Company: Australian Government Department of Education  Skills and Employment (DESE)
Title: Data Analysts (Multiple Positions)
Requirements: The Provider Analytics and Integrity Division is recruiting to fill vacancies across several Teams within the Division. The Division supports government outcomes by ensuring quality early childhood education and care provision through a fit for purpose sector. There are a range of exciting opportunities for Data Analysts in areas including: Data Analytics Information Analytics Modelling and Analytics Intelligence Analytics Data Warehouse/Datalake development The Data Analyst Manager (EL1) may: Develop and provision data  analysis  statistical reports and/or briefings to inform the public  research  financial modelling  program management  policy development and/or compliance  fraud and legal matters. Provide strategic policy leadership  data stewardship  and project management of the National Early Childhood Education and Care Collection (NECECC) and related data sets  Australian Early Development Census (AEDC) and National Workforce Census (NWC). Provide direction and identify opportunities to improve the development and provision of child care data  increase the sharing and integration of child care data  and gain deeper insights on the usage  quality  affordability  accessibility  and flexibility of the child care system. The Senior Data Analyst (APS6) may: Design  prototype and implement computer programs that navigate data warehouses and manipulate large administrative data sets with complex structures for use in reporting and analysis of child care payments and programs. Assist in the policy leadership  data stewardship  and project management of the National Early Childhood Education and Care Collection (NECECC) and related data sets  Australian Early Development Census (AEDC) and National Workforce Census (NWC). Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to identify opportunities to improve the development and provision of child care data  increase the sharing and integration of child care data  and gain deeper insights on the usage  quality  affordability  accessibility  and flexibility of the child care system. The Data Analyst (APS5) may: Build and use existing standard reports or write ad-hoc data queries to produce evidence and analysis for publication  research  program management  policy development and/or compliance  fraud and legal matters. Assist in the project management of data collections including procurement  contract management and state funding agreements as relevant. Support activities to improve data access  data integration and sharing  and data literacy. The Data Analyst (APS4) may: Assist in the development and provision of data  analysis  statistical reports and/or briefings for internal and external stakeholders to inform the public  research  program management and policy development. Provide administrative support regarding data systems and system related issues. Actively participate in a collaborative team environment based on supportiveness  development  knowledge sharing and effective communication. DESE offers a positive and inclusive workplace culture and excellent employment benefits and conditions. This includes attractive salaries and employer superannuation  a flexible workplace  generous leave and purchased leave options  salary packaging  a closedown period over Christmas  along with a range of other benefits. Staff are encouraged to actively participate in career development opportunities such as task forces and special projects. For a full list of responsibilities and capabilities please review the job information pack and position description for each role available here. Job Reference Number: Data Analyst Manager (EL1): 22/0422 EXT Senior Data Analyst (APS6): 22/0424 EXT Data Analyst (APS5): 22/0425 EXT Data Analyst (APS4): 22/0427 EXT

Title: Advanced Analytics Analyst
Requirements: Job Description  A new opportunity reporting into the Senior Manager  Data & Analytics has become available based out of our Melbourne office when not working remotely.  The Advanced Analytics Analyst has accountability for creating and delivering data-driven value across Health Services via the utilisation of data to discover insights and visualise results and patterns observed through the application of statistical analysis.  How will I help?  Key Accountabilities Include But Are Not Limited To Collaborate with internal customers to identify their business problem and work with them to provide meaningful  actionable insights Collate and manipulate data from multiple sources for the purpose of analysis and tactical reporting and feed this into our strategic data roadmap Prepare data for reporting. Complete any data mining needed to prepare new fields or measures and develop new reports and dashboards in Power BI Provide insights into customer behaviour  profitability and business performance and provide recommendations for optimisation of key business metrics and to improve customer experience Apply advanced analytics techniques and data mining etc. to develop algorithms and deliver intelligence Provide quality assurance  leading practice guidance and collaborate with Data Engineers and Analysts What’s in it for me?  As well as a competitive salary  a range of Bupa benefits and flexible working/ work from home arrangements  you’ll be challenged and encouraged to innovate. You will partner with colleagues who are dedicated to delivering exceptional experiences. We respect and consider everyone  knowing your difference will make the difference.  Perk Highlights Discount on our health insurance  travel  car  home  contents and pet insurance products as well as discounts when you attend a Bupa Dental clinic or purchase glasses from a Bupa Optical store. A dedicated internal wellbeing team provides you with a range of services  such as a global resilience program  regular training opportunities on a range of wellbeing topics and access to a variety of wellbeing discounts. An additional well-being day each year to treat yourself. What do I need? Previous experience in customer insights or marketing analytics with knowledge of these concepts applications in the health care industry would be ideal. Relevant postgraduate qualifications in data science  statistics  mathematics or similar discipline are desirable Commercial experience of building and improving advanced analytics solutions Excellent scripting and programming skills including Python  R and SQL Expertise in analysing data sets  quantitative analysis  data mining and creating data visualisations (ie. Tableau and Power BI) to tell stories and provide business insights Able to move  extract  manipulate and analyse data. Knowledge of ETL processes Ability to communicate complex information in a clear  succinct manner Demonstrated ability to work well within virtual and agile team environments Demonstrated experience consulting with stakeholders to design analytical products & solutions Strong communication and data-storytelling skills The ability to work with a high level of autonomy About Bupa  Bupa is an international healthcare group which has a purpose to deliver longer  healthier  happier lives and making a better world for more than 70 years. In Australia and New Zealand  Bupa assists more than 5 million customers through a broad range of health and care services including health insurance  aged care  rehabilitation  dental  optical  medical  hearing and medical visa services.  Our people reflect the diversity of our community. At Bupa  your wellbeing  identity and own story is respected and valued.  Time Type  Full time

Title: Data Analyst – Department of Developmental Disability  Neuropsychiatry
Requirements: This Job is based in Australia  Data Analyst – Department of Developmental Disability  Neuropsychiatry  Employment Type: Full-time (35 hour week)  Duration: 12 month Fixed Term role  Remuneration: $90K - $96K (plus 17% superannuation and leave loading)  Location: Kensington NSW (Hybrid)  UNSW isn’t like other places you’ve worked. Yes  we’re a large organisation with a diverse and talented community  a community doing great things. But what makes us different isn’t what we do  it’s how we do it. Together  we are driven to be thoughtful  practical  and purposeful in all we do.  Why your role matters  As a Data Analyst  you will be required to manage projects  conduct epidemiological and other data analysis on multiple research projects related to people with neuropsychiatric disorders and people with disability  health services evaluation and capacity building. In this position  you will be required to contribute to the development of new grant applications for submission by the Department. Key tasks will include development of statistical approaches  planning  execution and writing up of analyses  data cleaning  and data management processes.  The role of Data Analyst reports to the Senior Data Analyst and has no direct reports. Please see attached Position Description for full details.  Who You Are  To be successful you must have: A university degree in statistics  biostatistics  computer sciences  epidemiology  psychology  or an equivalent level of knowledge gained through any other combination of education  training and/or experience. A post-graduate qualification in a related discipline will be highly desirable. Demonstrated experience in research  data analysis  and data visualisation. Knowledge and understanding of health economics. Sound understanding and experience in statistical analysis of epidemiological and linked administrative datasets. Knowledge of statistical and/or database software  such as SAS  R  STATA or SQL. Excellent written and verbal communication skills for diverse audiences  including the ability to prepare high quality reports and papers for publication  and the ability to communicate with diverse research stakeholders. Excellent time management skills  with a demonstrated ability to respond to changing priorities  manage multiple tasks and meet competing deadlines by using judgement and initiative. Demonstrated ability to work collaboratively and productively within a team  but also to take initiative and work independently while managing competing demands. Experience with machine learning in a data science context would be highly regarded. Knowledge of research protocols  experimental design and planning as involved in developing research projects and reporting against milestones.  To Apply: Please submit your CV and cover letter online.  Please apply online - applications will not be accepted if sent to the contact listed.  Contact (For Job Related Queries Only)  Jamie Cutler: Talent Acquisition Consultant E: j.cutler@unsw.edu.au  Applications close: Wednesday 11th May at 11:55pm  Find out more about working at UNSW at https://med.unsw.edu.au/  UNSW aspires to be the exemplar Australian university and employer of choice for people from diverse backgrounds. UNSW aims to ensure equality in recruitment  development  retention and promotion of staff  and that no-one is disadvantaged on the basis of their gender  cultural background  disability  sexual orientation or identity. We encourage everyone who meets the selection criteria to apply.

Company: NSW Department of Planning and Environment
Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: Do you want your work to make a difference for NSW? Together  we create thriving environments  communities and economies. Data Analyst role Permanent full-time opportunity  Hybrid location based in Parramatta 5 days per fortnight Salary ranges from $99 431 to $110 064 + super  Our Land and Housing Corporation (LAHC) team is currently seeking to appoint a Contract Analyst to inspect  translate  clean  transform and model data from multiple system sources. Through this process  you will generate external contractor’s monthly performance reports against agreed key performance indicators (KPIs). You will use a range of data analysis techniques and tools in order to identify trends  issues  anomalies or fraud and verify compliance with the requirements of an asset maintenance outsourcing contract.  About You  To be successful in this role you will  Demonstrate high experience in computer packages such as Excel or a specialist software used for analysis (such as Qlik  Business Objects  SAS  Tableau or Alteryx). Demonstrate a sound understanding of data  analysis and reporting (particularly synthesis of large volumes of data into readily understood information). Demonstrate an ability to work in an environment of very tight decision-making and responding to demanding and competing requirements imposed by clients and stakeholders  where the tasks may involve commercially sensitive issues.  Experience in Contracts is not a requirement of the role – we’re looking for your data analyst skills. Commercial analyst or procurement experience is desirable.  Essential Requirements Tertiary qualifications in a related discipline and/or equivalent knowledge  skills and experience with demonstrated commitment to ongoing professional development. Highly experienced in MS Excel for data manipulation and synthesis.  For more information read the full Role Description: Contract Analyst  For further information hit Apply to visit the iworkfor.nsw.gov.au website.  About Us  The Department of Planning and Environment ’s (DPE) vision is to create thriving environments  communities and economies for the people of New South Wales. We strive to be a high-performing  world-class public service organisation that celebrates and reflects the full diversity of the community we serve and seeks to embed Aboriginal cultural awareness and knowledge throughout the department.  In our inclusive and accessible workplace  differences are embraced  contributions are valued  and everyone has a sense of connection and belonging. DPE supports various employee affinity groups  practice flexible working  offer job share and workplace adjustments. We are committed to the Premier’s Priorities and welcome applications from all.  To Apply  If excited by the information above  we look forward to receiving your application  including a copy of your resume and cover letter expressing your interest and suitability for the role.  It is an essential requirement of the role that successful candidates are fully vaccinated by receiving an acceptable course of COVID-19 vaccination as defined by the Australian Technical Advisory Group on Immunisation (ATAGI) as a condition of employment.  Applications close Sunday 8 May at 11:55PM.  Should you require further information about the role please contact Anup Aryal via anup.aryal@facs.nsw.gov.au or on 02 9354 1284.  A recruitment pool may be created for ongoing and temporary opportunities of the same role or role type that may become available over the next 18 months.  Looking for more information or assistance in applying?  Our Diversity team can assist to: provide alternative formats to apply make adjustments to the recruitment process offer information about workplace adjustments and support networks  We encourage people with disability to apply. If you have disability and require more information on adjustments and assistance to apply  contact the Diversity team on Diversity@DPIE.nsw.gov.au (please include reference number).  If you are an Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander check out Our Mob on Country https://www.dpie.nsw.gov.au/premiers-priorities/our-mob-on-country to see the work we do and get assistance in applying.  Find us on Facebook   Instagram   and LinkedIn .

Title: Data Analyst - Karitane
Requirements: We are seeking an experienced Data Analyst  who will provide professional data analytics support to  facilitate the management and maintenance of reliable  comprehensive and complex information systems  focusing on health care outcomes and service operations.  POSITION TITLE Data Analyst  DEPARTMENT Governance  OPERATIONAL BASE: Carramar  STATUS: Temporary part-time 32 hours p/w to 30 June 2024  VACCINATION CATEGORY: A (including full COVID-19 Vaccination)  RESPONSIBLE TO: Director  Governance & Corporate Services  INDUSTRIAL AWARD: Health Service Manager  Level 1  Purpose Of This Role  The role encompasses data design  collection  analysis and reporting and includes overall database management and administration across a range of platforms.  Reporting to the Director of Governance and Corporate Services  the role will be responsible for translating data into meaningful reports to support business decisions and quality improvement.  KEY SELECTION CRITERIA: (Each criteria below must be addressed in your application) Qualifications in Health Informatics  statistics  data design or equivalent work experience in a health setting. Demonstrated knowledge  skills and experience in the development and / or maintenance of multiple information systems to evaluate the effectiveness of health care programs Ability to manage competing priorities and project deadlines Ability to work both independently  and as part of a team Demonstrated highly developed verbal and written communication skills necessary for documenting research and writing briefs. Benefits of a Career at Karitane:- Dynamic team environment Innovative organisation Family-friendly workplace Professional development  support and mentoring Opportunity to salary package up to $16 050 tax free (as not-for-profit and registered charity) Accrued day off once a month where for full time roles Encouraged to achieve your full potential Respected and recognised Flexible work practices where applicable and appropriate Meaningful work – that makes a difference Conditions of Employment  Temporary part-time role in accordance with The Named NSW (Non-Declared) Affiliated Health Organisations’ Health Employees Agreement - Health Services Manager Level 1.  The majority of Karitane’s services close for two weeks over the Christmas/New Year period  during which time employees are required to take leave. Karitane services are provided at a number of sites across NSW. Occasional regional travel and site visits may be required from time to time.  Karitane supports a smoke free environment including grounds  buildings and vehicles. Applicants will have a commitment to EEO & WHS Policies  ethical practice and the principles of cultural diversity.  Relevant Criminal History  Working with Children’s Check  Apprehended Violence Orders and prior employment checks  including relevant disciplinary proceedings  will be conducted on recommended applicants. Karitane is a Child Safe organisation. All Karitane employees are required to complete a ‘Working with Children Check’ and comply with Karitane’s Child Safe Code of Conduct.  Please note: If you work in the NSW Public Health system and other Affiliated Health Organisations your accruals of leave and service can be transferred across to Karitane  A comprehensive position description is available on our website www.karitane.com.au  Enquiries And Applications Via Email Should Be Addressed To  Karen Edwards  Director Governance and Corporate Services  Tel. (02) 9794 2359 or Mobile. 0437 446 960  Email. Karen.Edwards3@health.nsw.gov.au  Close date: COB Monday 2nd May 2022  The culture of Karitane is founded on our values of: respect  innovation  collaboration and excellence.  Agency: Health

Title: Data Analyst - Financial Services - Data & Analytics
Requirements: At EY  you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are  with the global scale  support  inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better  too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself  and a better working world for all.  The opportunity  EY DnA is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific  with over 500 specialist employees working across multiple industry sectors. You will shape  change  and deliver a data management roadmap to improve and enhance the value and re-usability of data  through modern and evolving data management practices and frameworks.  As a Data Analyst  you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives  you will work with a diverse range of stakeholders and data teams to uplift the current data quality management capabilities of a number of different high profile client groups.  Responsibilities include but not limited to: Translating business questions to data and analysis requirements  carry out analysis  visualization and presentation. Performing ad-hoc analysis to solve business problems and support decisions. Design and build data products  such as Power BI dashboards  including defining the data models. Surfacing and sharing insights  typically from internal corporate data  using a dashboard. Run human centred design sessions with end-users. Communicating and influencing stakeholders. Coaching non-data experts how to use data.  To be successful in this role you will have experience in the following: Experience in a hands-on role interpreting and telling stories with data. Curious and business outcome focused with an ability to break down a complex problem and work out how to solve it. Evidence of numerical and technical aptitude strong collaboration skills having worked with business stakeholders at different levels of seniority. Comfortable working across a wide range of data sets and systems. Expertise in cleansing  combining and processing data. Have knowledge of SQL  with knowledge of Python an advantage. Familiarity with Power BI and ideally data manipulation tools (e.g. Alteryx and Daraiku). What We Offer  A tech career @ EY means working with 40 000 fellow technologists who are creating cutting edge applications in blockchain  AI  cloud  analytics  robotics and cyber  harnessing tech to power the human enterprise and build a more equitable  sustainable world. We offer world class training and a free Tech MBA to all our people.  Globally at EY  we are committed to offer: Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next. Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility  so you can make a meaningful impact  your way. Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights  coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs. Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.  The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.  The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third party provider. Regarding this role  the minimum salary is $90 000 including 10% superannuation.  EY | Building a better working world  EY exists to build a better working world  helping to create long-term value for clients  people and society and build trust in the capital markets.  Enabled by data and technology  diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow  transform and operate.  Working across assurance  consulting  law  strategy  tax and transactions  EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

About the opportunity In this role you will perform a range of processes and analytical tasks  including calculation of optimal stock levels  data-driven assessment of items catalogues  and working with BI dashboards. This is a Full Time Temporary (for a period up to 26 February 2023) position graded as a Health Manager Level 1 with an annual salary of $76 152.00 to $102 438.00 (Excl. 10% superannuation). Location: NSW Health Campus  St Leonards Why you'll enjoy working with us Flexible working arrangements Accrued Days Off A large portfolio and dedicated team Work in a growing organisation to genuinely better the lives of patients across the state Salary packaging and annual leave loading Corporate wellbeing programs  including the Fitness Passport Opportunities for learning and development  including in-house training with My Health Learning and the NSW Health RTO Professional growth and accelerated career progression Where you’ll be working HealthShare NSW provides a range of services to assist Local Health Districts and other Health Agencies. Our people perform important roles which free up health professionals to focus on what they do best! For more information regarding working for HealthShare NSW and the benefits we offer  click here. How to apply During the application process  you will be required to attach your resume and provide answers to the Targeted Questions below. You must ensure your answers make reference to all of the Essential Requirements listed in the Position Description prior to submitting your application. Describe a time when you showed commitment to ensuring a challenging analytical project or task was completed in time. In your example describe the situation  how you maintained your commitment despite the challenges you faced and the outcome. Provide an example of a time when you had to be conscious of your own communication style when dealing with a colleague or staff member? Describe the situation  what you did and the impact of your actions on the outcome. Provide an example of a time in your life where you have learned a new technological skill (application  language  etc.) Describe your learning process  and the outcome of learning the new skill on your work. You will be asked to complete a psychometric assessment (e.g. personality and cognitive abilities assessments) in the recruitment process for this position. Only candidates with current Australian work rights (Australian citizens  permanent residents  valid work visa) will be considered. Vaccination Requirements This is a NSW Health Category B position. All NSW Health workers are required to have completed a primary course of a COVID-19 vaccine which has been approved or recognised by the Therapeutics Goods Administration (TGA). New applicants must have completed the vaccination course prior to commencement with NSW Health  or provide an approved medical contraindication certificate certifying the worker cannot have any approved COVID-19 vaccines available in NSW. Acceptable proof of vaccination is the Australian Immunisation Register (AIR) Immunisation History Statement or AIR COVID-19 Digital Certificate. Booster doses are highly recommended for all health care workers who have completed the primary course of COVID-19 vaccinations. Please provide proof of vaccination if available. Need more information? For role related queries or questions contact Alex Graham via email at Alex.Graham@health.nsw.gov.au. HealthShare NSW are an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. If you require any assistance with your application or have any questions about this position  please follow the links below. Learn more about our Aboriginal Workforce team here Email our Access and Inclusion Team about how to apply with particular needs and accessing workplace adjustments at HSNSW-AccessAndInclusion@health.nsw.gov.au Talent Pool If the selection panel identifies a surplus of suitable candidates for the role  an eligibility list may be created where candidates may be offered casual  permanent  or temporary full-time or part-time positions within the next 6 to 12 months. Applications Close: 11.59pm Thursday 5 May 2022

Title: Business Services - Data & Analytics Analyst
Requirements: KPMG is one of the most trusted and respected global professional services firms. Through depth of expertise  clarity of insight and strength of purpose we help our clients solve complex challenges  steer change  strengthen  transition and grow. We are looking for talented people who share our purpose of inspiring confidence and empowering change for our clients  our people and our communities.  We are looking for a Mid-senior level Data Analyst to join our Data and Analytics team within IT Services. Our data analytics group focuses on assisting business to solve complex business issues that add value and/or reduce reputational  operational  financial risks. Supported by our ITS division  the analytics group brings together analytics specialists and subject matter expertise to provide a unique service that allows business to commission one-off pieces of analytics work across on-premise and cloud platforms  proofs of concept or ongoing data-oriented managed services. It represents a critical component to KPMG's analytics strategy.  Your new role  The successful candidate will perform a Data/Reporting Analyst role need to support or enhance or build current/new reporting use cases on MS BI Stack (SSIS  SSRS and SSAS). Also  would need to perform Systems Administration  which typically involves the set-up and management of data and platforms both on-premises and Cloud  using innovative techniques to provision or maintain data assets and platforms. Candidates will be expected to manage the technical components of the platform (installations  configurations  access control etc.) and work closely with the infrastructure provider and our internal security and network teams.  The work is highly varied  and the successful candidate will have the opportunity to enhance and take their skills to the next level by gaining strong technical and business experience whilst developing their ability to manage work streams  projects and analytics platforms.  You will be responsible for Support/Enhance existing reporting platform or build new reporting use cases using MS BI Stack. This includes data ingestion using SSIS and building/enhancing reports in Power BI and Reporting Services (SSRS). The installation and configuration of Business Intelligence/Analytics components across On-Prem and Cloud platforms (e.g.  Python  Qlik  Tableau  Power-BI  D3) Database management  primarily MS-SQL (e.g.  database creation  schema creation  performance tuning). Management of BI/Analytics platforms (e.g.  license  access control  network configurations  LDAP integration)  Pro-actively drive forward new and creative ideas and analytical solutions/platforms which benefit KPMG. Coordinate with the infrastructure provider and internal teams for network management  security  and identity management to support the BI/Analytics platforms. Develop internal networks and maintaining relationships with colleagues across other teams within KPMG.   You bring to the role A bachelor’s degree in computer science  or similar. Excellent communication skills with the ability to explain complex technical analysis to a non-technical audience A tenacious problem-solving attitude - particularly when trying to discover the root cause of backend technical issues. Knowledge and/or experience  in the following technical skillset Linux  MS SQL Server (SQL skills)  MS BI Suite (SSIS  SSRS and SSAS) Backend server knowledge of data visualisation tools necessary (e.g.  Tableau  Qlikview  PowerBI  D3) Knowledge of other ancillary components to the core platform  like network  security  user access  data encryption  backups  and data retention. Desirable to have knowledge of statistical techniques and analysis (such as regression  clustering  sampling  social network analysis)   What We Offer You  We offer rewarding careers for outstanding professionals  ongoing learning and development opportunities  a collaborative and inclusive culture  and flexible and agile work practices that focus on our people's wellbeing to drive innovation and entrepreneurship. We also believe that our business plays a distinct and vital role in helping solve important social and environmental issues  and use our unique skills and expertise to help create positive and lasting impacts for our communities.  We believe diversity of thought  background and experience strengthens relationships and delivers meaningful benefits to our people  our clients and communities. We are consistently recognised as an employer of choice for women  and our inclusive culture promotes the development of our people irrespective of gender  ethnicity  generation  flexible work status  family circumstances  sexual orientation or disability. This is an exciting opportunity to be a part of KPMG and its ongoing success. So if you want a career where you can use your deep expertise to deliver real results  talk to us first.  Please apply for this position by submitting your confidential application online.

Title: Reporting Insights Analyst

As an integral part of the team you will help our customers identify and solve their problems through the use of data and analytics. You are responsible for interpreting requirements to design and develop insightful analytics and reporting solutions as well as providing expertise and guidance to internal and external customers. This role requires a mix of creativity  attention to detail and a curiosity to find and communicate insights.  Your new role  Design  develop  and implement innovative and appealing user-friendly reports and dashboards in Power BI Contribute to the creation of data visualisation standards across the team  enhancing organisational capabilities in data visualisation and associated techniques  Executing against the Data and Analytics roadmap  including optimisation of the existing capability as well the introduction of new capabilities Identification and implementation of continuous improvement initiatives Determining business needs and drivers through stakeholder consultation and collaboration Execute complex analytical tasks that provide actionable results to business users.  What you'll need to succeed    Experience in building innovative stories in BI tools to identify and communicate business insights to support effective decision-making Advanced SQL skills Strong data analysis and data interpretation skills with experience extracting and working with raw data Experience in translating business requirements to technical/analytical specifications Expertise in analytics  data mining and creating data visualisations. Understanding of predictive/analytical modelling techniques  theories  principle and practices Understanding of Python or R Desirable Experience in Azure and Pega Desirable   What you'll get in return Be apart of a company that are inclusive and their people work collaboratively and where difference is valued. Work for a company that are encouraging  supporting and valuing the various talents and perspectives of the people and supporting flexible hybrid style of working. If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position  please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.  SA Licence number : LHS 297508

Title: VoC Insights Analyst
Requirements: Job description:  Will you actively create a healthier future for tomorrow?  At Medibank we’re encouraged to think big. We have a clear purpose to impact better health outcomes for our customers  patients and our community.  We celebrate diversity of thought because we want to make better decisions for our customers. As we work towards our goal of better health for better lives  we value the knowledge and contribution of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders. We are working hard to create an inclusive workplace and develop Indigenous careers.  ** This role can be based anywhere in Australia**  The Opportunity  Reporting into the VOC & CX Strategy Lead  you will be continuously improving Medibank’s VOC program to provide actionable insights and reporting to guide the future state of Customer Experience Design (CXD).  We are looking for an analyst who wants to take on a more strategic role to manage a VOC program to inform product development and prioritisation.  You will be hands-on in SQL or R and keen to expand your skillset to learn about NPS measurements  stitching commercial and operational data with survey data and transforming insights into story-telling.  As a strong team player  you will engage and empower CX Designers  crews  and squads with insights to help them improve customer experience  prioritise CX initiatives and understand the impact of initiatives after launch for continuous improvements.  Drawing upon previous experience in a similar role  you will impact by:  Generating actionable insights and bringing them to life to improve customer experience by partnering and working collaboratively with cross-functional teams to drive and support the prioritization of CX initiatives Working collaboratively with CX Designers to help guide the future state of customer experience by providing actionable insights Shaping  developing  and implementing the Future VOC program  this includes designing the program  designing and programming surveys  analyzing the data  creating and presenting insight reports  etc Supporting the VOC & CX Strategy Lead in identifying and sizing customer problems and influencing the business to address business objectives through a customer lens Raising stakeholders’ awareness and utilization of insights from the VOC program so they can make informed business decisions   About You:  You will have extensive experience managing generating insights preferably within VOC  CX or customer insights (i.e. on the client-side or agency side).  You’re results-driven and commit to high performance and getting things done. You have a growth mindset and are eager to pick up new skills. Comfortable wearing many hats  you have an adaptive and highly organised nature and thrive in ever-changing environments.  You are analytical and your problem-solving ability is one of your strengths  you use relevant data to provide insight and drive performance.  You have strong stakeholder engagement skills at all levels and a natural ability to influence outcomes.    Other requirements:  Strong analytic/quantitative research skills  hands-on experience in SQL  R Experience on the research consultancy/agency side in creating digital / CX / VOC insights and reporting is highly regarded Experience in co-designing solutions with others is a bonus e.g.  CX Designers  the digital team  and other stakeholders Experience in different research methodologies e.g.  best practice survey design  etc. Strong analytic/quantitative research skills (e.g.  able to conduct driver analysis) Experience in using Q is a bonus Experience managing a CX Platform and experience with Tableau highly advantageous   A career with us  At Medibank  we believe work is something we do  not somewhere we go. Our modes of working – Collaboration  Connection and Concentration – help inform how your day is structured and where you choose to work will vary  depending on your role and requirements.  The wellbeing of our employees is our priority. We encourage you to talk to us about any adjustments or additional support you may require during the recruitment process  as well as how this role can be flexible for you. Virtual interviews are always on offer and will not adversely impact your application.  All employees who may attend a worksite or any face-to-face work-related activity will be required to be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 as a condition of employment.  We offer a range of great benefits such as subsidised private health insurance  rewards and discounts  and health and wellbeing initiatives. To find out more  click here.  To start small and impact bigger.

Title: Data Analyst - Financial Services - Data & Analytics
Requirements: At EY  you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are  with the global scale  support  inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better  too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself  and a better working world for all.  The opportunity  EY DnA is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific  with over 500 specialist employees working across multiple industry sectors. You will shape  change  and deliver a data management roadmap to improve and enhance the value and re-usability of data  through modern and evolving data management practices and frameworks.  As a Data Analyst  you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives  you will work with a diverse range of stakeholders and data teams to uplift the current data quality management capabilities of a number of different high profile client groups.  Responsibilities include but not limited to: Translating business questions to data and analysis requirements  carry out analysis  visualization and presentation. Performing ad-hoc analysis to solve business problems and support decisions. Design and build data products  such as Power BI dashboards  including defining the data models. Surfacing and sharing insights  typically from internal corporate data  using a dashboard. Run human centred design sessions with end-users. Communicating and influencing stakeholders. Coaching non-data experts how to use data.  To be successful in this role you will have experience in the following: Experience in a hands-on role interpreting and telling stories with data. Curious and business outcome focused with an ability to break down a complex problem and work out how to solve it. Evidence of numerical and technical aptitude strong collaboration skills having worked with business stakeholders at different levels of seniority. Comfortable working across a wide range of data sets and systems. Expertise in cleansing  combining and processing data. Have knowledge of SQL  with knowledge of Python an advantage. Familiarity with Power BI and ideally data manipulation tools (e.g. Alteryx and Daraiku). What We Offer  A tech career @ EY means working with 40 000 fellow technologists who are creating cutting edge applications in blockchain  AI  cloud  analytics  robotics and cyber  harnessing tech to power the human enterprise and build a more equitable  sustainable world. We offer world class training and a free Tech MBA to all our people.  Globally at EY  we are committed to offer: Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next. Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility  so you can make a meaningful impact  your way. Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights  coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs. Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.  The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.  The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third party provider. Regarding this role  the minimum salary is $90 000 including 10% superannuation.  EY | Building a better working world  EY exists to build a better working world  helping to create long-term value for clients  people and society and build trust in the capital markets.  Enabled by data and technology  diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow  transform and operate.  Working across assurance  consulting  law  strategy  tax and transactions  EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Title: Senior Data Insights Analyst
Requirements: Your new opportunity  Randstad Technologies is partnering exclusively with Griffith University to appoint a Senior Data Insights Analyst within their BI and Analytics team.  Providing higher education services for over 40 years  Griffith University spans six campuses in South East Queensland and has become a comprehensive  research-intensive University  ranking in the top 2% of Universities worldwide.  With over 4 000 employees over their campuses  you will contribute to the development of knowledge and learning in an environment which values excellence  equity  diversity and ongoing improvement and innovation.  About The Opportunity  An exciting and rare opportunity is now available for an experienced Senior Data Insight Analyst  to join Griffith University in driving a range of exciting key initiatives in a fast moving  agile environment.  As the Senior Data Insights Analyst  you will be responsible for advancing  managing and safeguarding Griffith University’s systems  data and information integrity and security and ensuring compliance with legal  regulatory  and reporting requirements.  You will bring a strong attention to detail to conduct data validation and be highly analytical through cleaning raw data to find patterns  challenges  risks and opportunities and their impacts on Griffith University. With this  you will be business-savvy and collaborate with a wide range of stakeholders to play a pivotal role in contributing to the development of and presentation of key insights to enable strategic investment decision-making for Griffith University.  Specifically  you will be responsible for the provision of student government reporting for the University including the coordination of data reporting via the Tertiary Collection of Student Information (TCSI) system as required under the Higher Education Support Act (2003).  Key Responsibilities Will Include Advance  manage and protect Griffith University’s systems  data and information integrity and security and ensure compliance with legal  regulatory  and reporting requirements. Undertake projects  initiatives  and activities to identify  evaluate and prioritize trends  challenges  risks and opportunities and their impacts on Griffith University and contribute to the development of strategies and interventions to address them. As a senior analyst provide insightful advice to stakeholders on data and related principles  strategies  plans  policies  systems  and processes. Implement the data and analytics governance approach  processes  cadences  ensuring that projects  initiatives  services  and capability comply with relevant legislation  University policies and procedures and values. Develop Griffith University’s data and analytics capability and support customers to build their data acumen through coaching and mentoring. Analyse the internal and external operating environment through research  data  and information analysis and/or consultation to identify trends  challenges  risks  and opportunities. Listen to and communicate interactively with colleagues across the university and within the finance team to respond appropriately to queries  solve problems  anticipate needs/questions  develop easily understood written material  simplify complex information  proactively share information in a balanced and timely manner. Promote and demonstrate cultural behaviour in accordance with the Fraud and Corruption Control Framework and the University’s Integrity program. This includes acting with integrity in undertaking duties and implementing processes to effectively prevent  detect  and respond to fraud and corruption within the University. Ensure Griffith University meets its compliance obligations as required under the Higher Education Support Act (2003) with the provision of student reporting through TCSI including: Coordinating the correction of data validation errors across various areas of the University responsible for collecting and submitting student data  Assist areas of the University in resolving complex data validation issues  Co-design technical/function/operational solutions between the Department of Education  Skills and Employment (DESE)  other institutions (including those using PeopleSoft)  Oracle (Vendor) and departments within the University  and Manage future changes to DESE reporting requirements. Key Knowledge & Qualities Applicants should hold a Bachelor Degree in Mathematics  Computer Science  Business Intelligence or higher You will possess strong stakeholder engagement skills with the ability to consult  negotiate and influence others in developing Griffith University’s data and analytics capability. You will be experienced in implementing the insight generation approach  systems and processes to drive full value from the data value chain and support customers to build their data acumen. You will possess strong data mining skills  where you will analyze large blocks of information to glean meaningful patterns and trends. You will be proficient in data validation  with strong experience checking the accuracy and quality of source data before use. Strong knowledge with Tableau server or Power BI is highly desirable Employment in this role is subject to the successful candidate being fully vaccinated against COVID-19  subject to certain limitation exemptions described in Griffith University’s Mandatory COVID-19 Vaccination or Testing Policy. Workers in a setting covered by a Queensland Government Health Order or similar government direction  must be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 in accordance with the direction and must remain compliant with any such directions. The successful candidate will be required to supply supporting evidence of COVID-19 vaccination prior to commencing in this role.  Applicants must have unrestricted work rights in Australia.  Successful candidates may be subject to a criminal history check.  Further information  This is an urgent requirement and we are seeking to advance interested  suitable applicants immediately. For further information about this role  please contact Matthew Andrews on matt.andrews@randstad.com.au as soon as possible.  At Randstad  we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.

Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: Randstad Defence is looking for multiple passionate Data Scientists to work for one of the largest consultancies on their Defence engagements at various phases of the project lifecycle for either the CASG Joint  Land  Maritime  or Aerospace Systems Divisions. As a Data Scientist  you will analyse supply chain  maintenance  and configuration data  as well as electronic documentation. These positions include both permanent and contracting alternatives  as well as long-term engagement.  The salary/contract rate is variable and will be determined by your level of competence and skill set.  About You Experience using and analysing data from logistics and information systems such as MILIS  CMT-U  NAVALLOW  and/or AIMS. Language and tool proficiency in Python  SQL  PowerQuery  and PowerBI Capability to perform basic statistical analyses Previous expertise in logistics  maintenance  and asset data analysis is preferred. The candidate must be an Australian citizen and have a baseline or NV1 security clearance.  We have multiple roles available  so if you're as passionate about this position as we are  please do not hesitate to apply now or send an email to Lucas or Pinkey at lucas.fuhrmann@randstad.com.au or pinkey.paul@randstad.com.au to discuss these roles further in detail and in confidence.  Ref/ RANDEF  At Randstad  we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background./ RANDEF

Title: Data Governance Analyst
Requirements: Job Description  How will I help?  This senior analyst role supports the Business Data Manager (Business Engagement) functions for a subset of the Group’s data assets to ensure compliance with the Group’s information management policies.  What You Will Do Support Business Data Managers in delivering uplift in capability within business areas and data domains Maintain business definitions of critical data elements Proactively promote adherence to Group information management policies Support Business Data Managers in the monitoring and reporting of data quality Support the development of key metrics for data quality measurement  monitoring and reporting Review data quality reporting and provide input to commentary Assist business stakeholders to understand data quality reporting and to identify opportunities to make improvements to data quality Support the management of data issues Ensure data domain compliance with the Group’s information management policies  standards and alignment with both data and business strategies Provide input to half yearly self-assessments of data management obligations to measure progress in information management capabilities and practices for the divisions and domain(s) Support annual control assessment of compliance to Information Management Policy and Managing Data Risks (APRA guide CPG 235) as part of the Group’s prudential compliance obligations Utilise influencing and stakeholder management skills to promote strong information management practices and understanding across the organisation Maintain communication channels and relationships with senior business partners and their teams Engagement with divisional representatives  business SMEs  and the information management community to identify potential synergies across domains What’s in it for me?  Joining Westpac has many benefits besides building a long and stable career. You’ll be able to purchase leave to facilitate your dreams or obligations and you’ll be encouraged to participate in the community through paid volunteer leave and secondments. You’ll also be entitled to a suite of online learning  training modules and career planning tools to grow with us.  What do I need?  Knowledge: Understanding of information management capabilities including business terms  critical data elements  data quality rules  data lineage  data controls and reference data Understanding of APRA guide CPG 235 – Managing Data Risk End to end knowledge of the data lifecycle in a financial services business Advocate of enterprise information management best practices Service focus and driven to deliver excellent outcomes for our internal customers Excellent communication skills – written and verbal Self-leader who manages to high quality  on time delivery. Shows determination  resilience  resourcefulness and a sense of purpose Experience: 3+ years of demonstrable experience in Information Management  Data Risk or Operational Risk Strong experience in stakeholder management Demonstrated understanding of business performance  information analytic concepts and numerical proficiency End to end knowledge of the data lifecycle in a financial services business Advocate of enterprise data management best practices Education in Information Management  Risk  Analytics  Information Systems and / or Computer Science is an advantage What is it like to work in Westpac?  We aim to provide one big  supportive team to help us reach our vision to become one of the world’s great service companies. Working with us you'll discover new ways of working  and an exciting range of roles to showcase your skills. As an equal opportunity employer  we’re proud to have created a culture where people can be their best  in an environment that values diversity and flexibility. And one where everyone belongs.  How do I Apply?  Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.  As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace  this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages  people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply. The health and wellbeing of our employees is our top priority. We’ve developed clear standards to ensure our people are confident  safe and healthy whether they’re working from a Westpac Group site or working from home. These are based on expert medical advice and Safe Work Australia guidelines.  The Westpac Group has implemented an Entry to Workplace Policy that requires employees and others entering our workplaces to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by relevant dates set out in the policy (subject to applicable medical exemptions). Our employees are required to comply with the policy regardless of whether they are in customer-facing or non-customer-facing roles (as employees in non-customer-facing roles are required to attend the workplace under our Hybrid Working Strategy). Further  the Westpac Group is required to comply with State/Territory issued public health orders/directions which require relevant workers to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter workplaces.  By applying for this role  you acknowledge that you are aware of our Entry to Workplace Policy  and if you secure employment with us  you will be required to comply with the policy.
