Title: Digital Data Analyst
Requirements: About Us  Optus  a wholly owned subsidiary of Singapore Telecommunications (SingTel) is an Australian leader in integrated telecommunications  delivering cutting-edge communications  information technology and entertainment services. Optus’ vision is to be Australia’s most loved everyday brand with lasting customer relationships  and we’ll achieve this by creating Unique customer connections and by being Digital everywhere  delivered by our Amazing people.  About Living Networks  We are bringing you a whole new level of connectivity – it’s connectivity your way. The Optus Living Network adapts and transforms telecommunications from a set and forget service in the background into a real experience – YOUR experience – that comes alive when and how you want it to. At Optus  customers are the centre of our world – and we want to rock our customers’ worlds. So  we developed a plan to create a network that could bring people closer together  simplify life’s complexities or amp up more of what you love. The Optus Living Network sets the new bar for what telecommunications should be by putting you in command of your connectivity. We have already introduced some of the Optus Living Network’s early features- Donate your Data  a new way to do good with unused data  Unlimited Data Days  a way to access 24 hours’ of data ‘off the metre’  Game Path  a service that reduces lag and jitter for gamers  and Optus Pause  a unique way to simultaneously pause any or all devices in your household for some quality  tech-free time.  About The Role  The Digital Data Analyst within the Digital Hub is a critical role in the Digital Analytics Chapter within the Tribes within Consumer. The Digital Tribes have been established to allow the rapid development and launch of Optus Digital assets covering all aspects of Optus Digital interactions with customers. Responsibilities will include- Writing and developing tracking specifications for web and app tracking implementation Testing web and app tracking implementation against specification and business requirements Querying customer data  performing analyses  and presenting findings in a clear and understandable language Building data visualisation dashboards for product reporting and insights Performing data  statistical and commercial analysis to understand how customer behaviour  product changes and market dynamics impact the Consumer business Developing recommendations with a clearly articulated  structured argument Delivering findings back to stakeholders to drive well-informed decision-making Contributing to the overall chapter delivery of business insights and recommendations to delivery against the Digital Tribe objectives  About You  We are looking for the following skills  experience and attributes- Tertiary qualifications in a quantitative field (e.g. Mathematics  Computer Science  Finance  Engineering  Statistics) SQL &/or R Programming skills Data presentation skills using Tableau/Microsoft Power BI or other data visualisation tool Excellent communication and presentation skills Demonstrated analytical skills developed from experience in similar roles Must be a proactive self-starter  with the ability to use a high level of initiative

In this role  you will work very closely with transactional systems business analysts to build logical/physical data models for the department’s business processes and manage common data model that satisfies requirements.  You will be able to demonstrate the capacity to work within a multi-specialist team and deliver to tight timeframes and deadlines (and rapidly changing priorities).  Responsibilities Undertake data mapping against an ICT solution and identify the delivery of data sets to support Product delivery Understand business needs and processes to identify  analyse and document detailed data requirements Work with business representatives to determine priorities and validate and justify the requirements Participate in data extract  transformation and migration activities Work with development teams and other skilled analysts to validate functionality against the data requirements Provide timely  strategic and expert advice regarding data requirements  information requirements  business impacts  scope management  and project risks Manage the delivery of work to a schedule and assist in the setting and managing of expectations Use high level communication skills to negotiate  establish  and maintain networks and working relationships Apply standardised templates  methodologies and processes for data analysis activities and related project documentation Lead and work collaboratively with a wide range of staff at all levels Contribute to business integration  change management  and testing activities Actively manage a working environment supporting quality human resource management practices including employment equity  anti-discrimination  occupational health and safety  and ethical behaviour. Experience Required Demonstrated experience in data ingestion  cleansing  manipulation and modelling. Experience in eliciting  analysing  specifying  documenting and validating the business data needs of stakeholders. Data/reports development skills and experience relevant to the position Understanding and experience working with applications that utilise complex relational architecture Experience working within a large  complex multi-disciplinary organisation High level of written communication and documentation skills Proven effective communication and stakeholder engagement skills and experience Proven ability to manage a large workload whilst maintaining high levels of accuracy How To Apply  To find out more  please "Apply for this job" or contact Jenifer Mitchell on (07) 3221 3333 or jenifer.mitchell@talentinternational.com  For a list of all vacant positions  please see our website www.talentinternational.com

Title: Intelligence Analyst
Requirements: Exciting and challenging opportunity to work in a specialist law enforcement agency Sydney CBD location Full time ongoing position Flexible working conditions Commitment to a diverse workplace Salary: From $87 493 to $110 064 per annum  Grade 5-8  (excluding superannuation and leave loading)  Contact: NSWCrimeCommission@Hays.com.au  Closing Date: 11.59pm(EST)on Wednesday 4 th May 2022  It is an essential requirement of the role that successful applicants are an Australian Citizen  and will have received two doses of an approved COVID 19 vaccine.  About The NSW Crime Commission  The NSW Crime Commission is established to investigate and disrupt organised crime and other serious criminal activity and to pursue confiscation of the proceeds of crime. The Commission is structured into a number of Divisions consisting of operational divisions  support teams and specialist units.  The function of conducting criminal investigations is assigned to the Commission’s Criminal Investigations Division. Investigations are typically conducted pursuant to a Management Committee reference to investigate or approval to work in cooperation with a joint task force comprising one or more of the Commission’s partner agencies. The Criminal Investigations Division is also responsible for the Commission’s Strategic Intelligence capability  the provision of specialist investigative support services and the provision of advice and recommendations to Government in relation to minimising the impact of serious and organised crime on the NSW community.  About The Role  The Intelligence Analyst is responsible for undertaking concurrent criminal and financial investigations or intelligence projects in accordance with Commission references  policies and procedures by interrogating databases and other sources  grading and analysing available data / information  and presenting logical and succinct conclusions through written reports and verbal briefings. The role liaises extensively with internal and external stakeholders  and shares strategies  methodologies  techniques and learnings to contribute to effective investigative outcomes. Commission Intelligence Analysts support investigations and intelligence projects tactically  operationally and strategically.  In accordance with Commission policy  the Intelligence Analyst may be assigned to different teams from time to time.  Essential Requirements Degree qualifications and / or relevant experience in any discipline with a strong research component Excellent research  analytical  conceptual and problem-solving skills Excellent interpersonal  written/verbal communication  presentation and influencing skills Excellent organisational and time management skills  including a demonstrated ability to manage competing demands and priorities Ability to work independently and contribute effectively in a multi-disciplinary team environment Excellent computer skills  including an ability to use spreadsheet and database applications Aptitude for the interpretation of financial data Understanding of the role and functions of the Commission  including the capacity to deal with confidential and sensitive information with tact  discretion and judgement. Key Challenges In This Role Include Managing multiple investigations or projects with competing and occasionally urgent deadlines Making sense of complex data / information  identifying patterns  trends and probabilities  and presenting succinct and logical theories and/ or recommendations for action Balancing intuition  investigative precedent and risk/threats to deliver creative solutions and effective intelligence outcomes Liaising effectively with a broad range of internal and external stakeholders to influence investigation and/or strategic intelligence pathways Dealing with challenging  sensitive  and disturbing data/information  displaying resilience  managing own frustrations and staying calm in challenging situations Demonstrating a high level of tact and discretion at all times  sharing information appropriately in a team setting while maintaining confidentiality and secrecy of certain matters To learn more about the roles please review the role description.  Our commitment to flexible working  The NSW Crime Commission is committed to ensuring the sector reflects the whole NSW community it serves. We support an inclusive workplace where staff have access to opportunities and resources at all levels  enabling our people to drive commitment  innovation  productivity and delivery of high-quality services and capabilities. We support the NSW Government’s ‘If Not  Why Not’ policy to flexible working arrangements and encourage our people to explore new ways of working – including part-time  job-share or working from different locations. Everyone can ask about it.  Our commitment to Diversity  The NSW Crime Commission strives to be an inclusive workplace for all people within our diverse community and welcome and encourage applications from all ages and genders  Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples  culturally and linguistically diverse groups  the LGBTIQA+ community  veterans  refugees and people with disabilities.  The NSW Crime Commission is committed to Equal Employment Opportunity  Workforce Health and Safety  Ethical Practices and the principles of Cultural Diversity. We encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and people with disabilities to apply.  Job Status: Ongoing employment under the Government Sector Employment Act 2013.  Persons are eligible to apply for this role only if they are Australian citizens. This is a requirement of the Commonwealth Security Vetting process.  How To Apply  All applications must be forwarded to: NSWCrimeCommission@hays.com.au . Once your application has been received  you will be notified by email to advise receipt of your application.  Applications will not be accepted via ‘I work for NSW’  To Apply For This Position  Please Submit Your resume (maximum 5 pages) including your citizenship status  A brief covering letter (no longer than two pages). In the covering letter  demonstrate your competency with reference to the ‘Essential Requirements’ and 'Focus Capabilities' as specified in the role description  and A document no longer than two pages answering the two pre-screening questions below Question 1: Provide an example of how you planned  conducted and/ or influenced the direction of an investigation  inquiry or intelligence project. Describe your approach  key challenges and the outcome.  Question 2: Outline a time when you worked on a project collaboratively whilst also managing competing independent demands and priorities.  Applicants invited to interview will be required to complete additional assessments.  The recommended candidates must be willing to participate in and secure appropriate security clearances (including a Commonwealth security vetting clearance)  and provide details of financial interests and other relevant information about themselves and their associates. All appointments are subject to attaining appropriate security clearances.  Applicants are also advised to refer to the Commission's Guide for Job Applicants to obtain further information about applying for a role at the Commission.  To find out more about the NSW Crime Commission please visit: www.crimecommission.nsw.gov.au

Company: Scentre Group (Owner and Operator of Westfield in Aus and NZ)
Title: Data Governance Analyst (12 month contract)
Requirements: Our Story  Scentre Group is the owner and operator of 42 Westfield living centres in Australia and New Zealand  partnering with the world’s leading retail and luxury brands to create a unique shopping and leisure experience for our customers. A career with us fosters the chance to be a part of a company that is transforming the digital and physical retail space.  Every day  our people play a vital role in our purpose to ‘create extraordinary places  connecting and enriching communities’.  Your opportunity  Scentre group has an exciting opportunity for a privacy professional to join our Customer & Business Development (CBD) team.  In this newly created role as Data Governance Analyst (DGA) you will become a key member of Scentre Group’s (SCG) Customer Division. Within the Data Governance space  you will be responsible for deploying and applying key DG processes within various customer domains and at times across other enterprise areas with collaboration.  Day to day  your main responsibilities will include (but not be limited to) Work collaboratively with stakeholders to understand the current and future needs of the business and develop the appropriate structures and processes and controls to enable the business to maximise the utility of its data  whilst maintaining regulatory compliance and customer trust. Ensure that all data assets which are subject to governance processes within Customer division are addressed Support the DG lead in the development and maintenance of an end-to-end data lifecycle management approach Responsible for applying data governance framework including the management of data  operating model  data policies and across the division Ensure adherence and compliance of key data principles  polices and standards Conduct and participate in change management activities such as user education and training on key data concepts and technologies Consult and engage the business on Privacy risks and controls including conducting Privacy Impact Assessments and partnering with business working groups on new projects to ensure that Privacy requirements (including policies  laws and regulations) are met. Ensure DG forums are operational in nature and appropriate participation Assist the DG lead in executing data deletion and retention policies within Customer domain Maintain business glossary  technical lineage and data catalog in a centralised manner by engaging appropriate business stewards for accuracy  integrity and quality Provide assurance reports on CBD activities and key privacy controls to the Cyber  Privacy  Data Working Group and CCX Steerco You will also work closely with the Scentre Group Enterprise Data Governance lead for all management and day to day operational matters.  This role is being offered on a 12-month fixed-term contract base from Scentre Groups support office  conveniently located above Westfield Sydney.  What will set you apart from the rest?  We Are Also Looking For  You will be a confident and passionate self-motivated individual who enjoys working in a high performing culture. 5-6 years of experience in data and analytics domain Good working knowledge of Software Development LifeCycle (SDLC) Working knowledge of Information Management procedures and standards Operational knowledge of working with enterprise data governance platforms and tools like Collibra A Data Management certification or familiarity with DAMA DMBOK data management principles or similar data management training A good understanding of the progress of adoption of Data Lifecycle  performing audits with stakeholders to validate compliance Good understanding of information management and record keeping requirements for e.g. data retention  disposal  data classification A strong track record of partnering with the business and influencing positive business outcomes that balance compliance  risk  and reward A self-motivated person who values continuous improvement and who can establish and deliver their own program of work What sets us apart from the rest? A collaborative  inclusive culture Diverse career paths across our vertically integrated business Training Opportunities Ability to innovate in a company that not only encourages it but will facilitate it Competitive benefits including 18 weeks parental leave  volunteer days to work with our charity partners  health and wellbeing discounts and the ability to purchase extra annual leave Our diverse and inclusive workforce is not only something we’re proud of  but something we’re committed to. We encourage and support our people to bring their ‘whole selves’ to work each and every day because we believe our differences contribute to our success and ensures a workforce that reflects the customers we serve  in the communities in which we operate. This commitment is backed by executive and employee-led working groups including LGBTI  gender equity  mental health & wellbeing  working flexibility  disability and alongside other initiatives. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples are encouraged to apply.  If this sounds like you  apply today to make extraordinary happen! Should you have any questions  or want to discuss the role further  please reach out to Kylie Stephens  Talent Acquisition Business Partner  on 02 9028 8349.

Title: Senior Analyst  Data & Insights
Requirements: Posted by Christophe Hovette Talent Acquisition Partner at Mable Send InMail Founded in 2014  Mable has become one of Australia's largest and fastest growing healthtech marketplaces. Our platform is an online community of independent support workers who offer their services directly to people who are seeking aged care or disability support. Mable began when our co-founder Peter Scutt teamed up with his friend and colleague  Tony Charara  after struggling to find the right home care solution for his parents. That collaboration resulted in an entirely new concept in community care led by the people that matter  which we've been constantly refining and improving upon ever since.  With over 3 million hours of support being facilitated through its platform annually  Mable has been growing at a very fast pace and is now at 200+ employees strong. We’re thrilled to have been recognised within AFR’s Fast 100 list in 2021  Deloitte’s Fast 50 2020 Awards (#9 - 721% Growth and we won the Australian Growth & Australian Technology Growth Company of the Year Award 2020! This is an awesome opportunity to join a thriving scale up whose profit for purpose mission is transforming the aged care and disability support sectors.  Mission: We’re redefining support for disability and aged care in Australia by helping people who are ageing or living with disability to connect with independent support people in their community.  About the role: As a Senior Analyst  Data & Insights at Mable you will use data and analytical techniques to identify and understand our business and product challenges  communicate your insights to multiple business stakeholders  partner with cross-functional teams  and develop recommendations and prototypes to solve these challenges. You will be at the heart of a fast-paced  high growth environment where you will help drive real-world impact.  Your responsibilities: Structuring approaches to our business problems  and using data and analysis to understand and solve these problems Leading exploratory analysis to identify trends and insights  and verify hypotheses Identifying with data not only what is happening  but why it is happening and what it means Creating dashboards to track business metrics and performance Analysing the results of split (treatment / control) tests to determine which new product features or operational processes are effective Communicating your analysis  insights and recommendations to non-technical audiences  both verbally and in written form Partnering with a team of product managers  engineers  UX designers  and other business stakeholders Developing and testing rapid prototypes for data science services  and collaborating with Data Engineers to develop a final product Outlining the data implications for new product features Ensuring that all data analysis adheres to the Mable privacy and security policies  Experience you'll need: 3+ years of data analysis experience developing actionable insights Experience using Tableau or another data visualisation tool to create data visualisations and dashboards Ability to communicate your insights and technical concepts to a non-technical audience  both verbally and in written form Initiative and ownership to deliver work with autonomy Collaboration skills to partner effectively with multiple stakeholders A “solutions mindset” of natural curiosity and a strong motivation to solve problems  no matter how complicated or ambiguous they might be Comfort with ambiguity  a fast-paced environment  and rapid business growth Above all else  a “can-do” attitude is the most important qualification!  What else would make a difference? Experience analysing split (treatment / control) tests  including statistical analysis R  python or SQL skills Experience with machine learning   Benefits of Working at Mable Make an impact: Enjoy being part of a cohesive team with a collaborative culture that values decision-makers and action. Competitive salary packages everyone at Mable contributes to the bigger picture mission. We want you to feel rewarded with our packages & incentives. Birthday Leave Take your birthday off on us! Paid Parental Leave a gender neutral policy for primary and secondary carers We value wellbeing: We’re here to support you in times of need with our Employee Assistance Program (App + counseling) which is a four pillar holistic offering (LifeWorks) + daily Wellbeing Hours where you are encouraged to switch off and have a break. Diversity & Inclusion we are endorsed by Work180 as an accredited employer for women in tech. Team hybrid working arrangements balance collaboration with home and family commitments. Office Location Two minutes walk from Town Hall station  we’ve recently taken over an entire floor of the Hilton Hotel building (hello  #scaleup life) Celebrate Success we’re here for the good vibes and celebrating our wins  no matter how big or small. Accelerate your career: Be a part of one of Australia's fastest growing Marketplaces. We are a scale-up tech-co and our people are a huge part of this. We want all of our Mablers to feel supported in their careers and for Mable to be the place where they can grow to their full potential.  Our Values All About People - We put our customers at the center of everything we do Better Together - We are stronger  better and faster when we work together Challenge Openly - Speak up. Candid discussion helps us make better decisions. Do The Right Thing  Always - We hold ourselves to the highest standard. What we say and do matters. CrEate Impact - We are passionate about having an impact.  Role Location At Mable we believe that collaboration and team connection is key for success. This role can either be based in Sydney (mix of office / home) or fully remote within Australia. We're all about creating opportunities for people  regardless of where they live.  Additional Information Mable is an equal opportunity employer. We find excellence in diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. People with lived experience of disability or personal experience with the aged care system are strongly encouraged to apply. We’re endorsed by Work180 which showcases our commitment to our policies  flexible working and inclusion practices for women in tech. If this role has stood out to you but you don’t feel like you ‘’tick all the boxes’’  we strongly encourage you to apply nonetheless. We value diversity across experience and you might well just bring something to the Mablehood that we are looking for! "Believe you can and you're halfway there." - Theodore Roosevelt  Where to find us online: Glassdoor: https://bit.ly/3z0K328 Youtube: https://bit.ly/34L7DlP Instagram: https://bit.ly/3pgAOXk Facebook: https://bit.ly/3ic6LhQ LinkedIn: https://bit.ly/3ie6Q4U

Title: Business Analyst (Data and BI)

This organisation supports the community via regulatory measures to protect community members and uphold industry standards. What's On Offer  This is an exciting role that will give you the ability to join a high-performing and stable team! Title: Operations Data Analyst
Requirements: Brighter Futures Start here  As Australia’s biggest and most loved retailer  we’ve been brightening up everyday life for families for over 50 years. At our stores  distribution centres  and offices in Australia and New Zealand. All around the globe. Our diverse and inclusive 47 000 strong team come together for a common cause. Giving families easy access to our on-trend products and incredibly low prices – it’s the heart of everything we do.  As a leader in the retail market  we’re optimistic about our future and yours. We’re relentless in our pursuit for results  but changing at a rapid rate  giving you challenging work that you’ll be proud of. We celebrate your uniqueness and individuality. Because at Kmart it’s not just what you do  it’s who you are that makes every day living brighter.  What You’ll Be Doing  Our Kmart Stores New Format teams are currently delivering some exciting digital initiatives across the inventory management  fulfillment  payments  and mobile application streams. There is a serious focus on what the future of in-store technology looks like within Kmart – it is truly an exciting time to be working in this space! We are looking to bring on board an Operations Data Analyst to help deliver innovative projects such as robot integration for inventory management and AI. You will be working on greenfield projects where you will have the opportunity ensure accurate data between our systems and analyse information & results.  Our teams are building and creating ‘first of their kind’ technology in retail. You will be working on proof of concepts projects that will change the way Kmart technology is used in stores.  Reporting into the Analytics Lead for Digital Stores  the role of Operations Data Analyst is to help our tribe to leverage data for business decision making. This includes building insightful reports and dashboards  performing hypothesis testing and generating recommendations for optimising business operations.  Key responsibilities for this role include: End to end data validation and correction Systems testing Analyse data and provide statistical analysis to improves cost and customer experience Issue and bug identification Be the conduit between operations and data tech teams Maintain a data dictionary  definition and documentation Collaborate with the wider data science and data engineering teams to deliver value  About You  To meet the challenges of this role  you will ideally possess the following skills and experience: Technology or Mathematics related tertiary qualification preferred 2+ years’ experience in data analytics related roles Strong proficiency in SQL and Microsoft Excel required Exposure to business intelligence tools  such as Power BI is helpful Quantitative aptitude with exposure to mathematical modelling Ability to demonstrate thought leadership  initiative and operate in an autonomous manner Clear communicator with an ability to ensure consistent messaging in relation to measuring business performance Strong ability to manage multiple accountabilities and prioritise effectively Demonstrated ability to deliver results in a fast paced environment  Benefits we’ll offer you: A dynamic learning and support program Competitive remuneration Flexible working through our Flex Where  Flex When  Flex Well policy A discount card for Kmart  Target  Officeworks and Bunnings  plus other benefits An inclusive  fun recognition program A bonus program (where eligible) Development opportunities across Kmart Group (comprised of Kmart  Target and Catch) as well as the broader Wesfarmers Group. Wesfarmers Share Plan access (where eligible)  We’re here to make everyday living brighter  From humble beginnings in Burwood East  Victoria  in 1969  we’re now an essential part of 300 communities  and proud of it! From bedding to apparel to kitchenware and beyond. We’re designing and creating the products people reach for every day. In-store  online  or Click & Collect – getting the products we love into the hands of happy customers is what we aim to do best. From the remote outback to coastal towns and big cities  and everywhere in-between. We’re progressive in our pursuit to create seamless customer journeys for satisfied shoppers.  A place you can belong  At Kmart  we celebrate the rich diversity of the communities in which we operate and are committed to creating inclusive and safe environments where all our team members can contribute and succeed. We believe that all team members should feel valued  respected and safe irrespective of your gender  ethnicity  indigeneity  religious beliefs  education  age  disability  family responsibilities  sexual orientation and gender identity and we encourage applications from all candidates. Title: Customer Insights Analyst
Requirements: Can you bring data to life  are you curious about what customers want from organisations? Are you looking for a role where you get to enrich the quality of lives - everyday? Where you play a valued role in being the voice of our people  our customers and our communities to inform and drive continuous enhancement of the Urban Utilities experience.  Urban Utilities is one of the largest water distributor-retailers in Australia... but we're so much more than water. Our people ensure that a population of more than 1.4 million South East Queenslanders have access to world-class drinking water  recycled water and sewerage services. We love being part of our urban and regional communities and take great pride in our people  our work  and the opportunity to manage a network that provides access to one of the earth's most precious resources.  The role  Urban Utilities is undergoing an exciting business transformation and we would love for you to be part of it. The Customer Insights Analyst role is part of our newly created Voice of the Customer team. You will be responsible for unlocking valued insights from our research data and other key data sources to enable key stakeholders to deliver what matters most for our customers. You will also develop reporting that will be used across the enterprise to track customer experiences and report performance to ensure we’re showing up for the moments that matter and shaping the moments to come.  This is a key role within the Customer & Community Experience team who are a hyper-connected team who deliver on what matters most for our customers and communities. For our internal customers  we add value. For our external customers  we create impact and build trust.    We’re looking for someone who is:    Analytical: conducts analysis using primary data sources and prepares data and analytical reports. Innovative: applies innovative analytical techniques to identify actionable insights. A communicator: visualises insights and data to track performance  clearly articulating customer experiences  needs and expectations. Data obsessed: provides data solutions to enable analysis of human-centred design solutions. Focused on quality: continuously improving the quality and quantity of customer data by evaluating and addressing gaps. A collaborator: that builds strong relationships with key stakeholders to establish performance outcomes and measures for key customer metrics.   Important to your success:    Minimum 2 years’ experience working in a customer focused reporting and Analytical function Bachelor’s degree in research  analytics  business  IT or similar field is preferred Providing innovative analytical insights to drive improvements to customer experience Demonstrated experience analysing customer data to generate valued insights and intelligence using tools such as SQL and Excel Proven experience producing visual reports that tell customer stories using Power BI or other visualisation tools. Building strong relationships with key stakeholders to establish performance outcomes and measures for key customer metrics.   What’s on offer?   You'll have the opportunity to work as part of a dynamic and valued team that has a strong influence on shaping the moments to come.   The business is super collaborative  people listen and respect your point of view You'll be involved in projects end to end and have exposure to senior managers and stakeholders  putting you in contact with key decision makers within the business.   What matters to you matters to us too. Feel supported to have open  honest conversations about the flexibility you need so that you're able to take care of your personal life.    We offer genuine flexibility and remote working arrangements  generous leave provisions  a holistic well-being program and the opportunity to be part of a community  not just a company.  It's an exciting time to join the Experience team and make a lasting impact. We're passionate about building a culture where our people feel empowered to make a difference and are curious and excited about the work we do and where we are heading!  If this role sounds like the perfect role for you  we'd love for you to apply!

Title: Reporting Analyst  Analytics
Requirements: TCorp provides best-in-class investment management  financial management  solutions and advice to the New South Wales (NSW) public sector. With A$113 billion of assets under management  TCorp is a top 5 Australian investment manager and is the central borrowing authority of the state of NSW  with a balance sheet of A$132 billion. It is rated Aaa (Stable) by Moody’s and AA+ (Stable) by S&P.  TCorp champions and protects the financial interests of the state and delivers sustainable returns and financial efficiencies that allow its clients to achieve their broader business objectives.  TCorp delivers this through its expert team  ability to anticipate the future needs of the state and with a deep understanding of the unique needs of the NSW Government family. We work exclusively for the NSW Government and public sector entities.  The Operations division mission is to enable TCorp’s strategy through their functions: Enterprise Programme Management Office (EPMO)  Investment Operations (IO)  Financial Markets Operations (FMO)  Finance & Settlements (F&S)  Data & Analytics (D&A) and Board Secretariat.  The D&A team plays a strategic role in enabling best-in class investment implementation and reporting on behalf of TCorp’s clients. The team is responsible for the data life cycle of TCorp's investments data from acquisition to stewardship and distribution. In addition to portfolio reporting  the Analytics function is  in partnership with portfolio management and other stakeholders  responsible for analytical methodology development and deployment to enable decision making and accountability within TCorp's Investments function.  The Reporting Analyst Will Be Accountable For ensuring the timely and accurate reporting of portfolio analytics to external clients and internal stakeholders implementing the Reporting Governance Framework documenting processes of the Analytics reporting function contributing to improving current analytics and reporting capability liaising with TCorp’s custodian and other data providers to ensure quality of data inputs. Key Capabilities Required For Success Include  The Reporting Analyst will also be expected to liaise with key stakeholders internally including Analytics and Data Management to facilitate change management/transformation initiatives that impact the Analytics reporting function. Ability to work independently to meet client critical deadlines Strong attention to detail in all technical matters An understanding of scalable data and report validation concepts Familiarity with concepts relating to performance  performance attribution  ex-post risk  portfolio characteristics  exposures evaluation and other key metrics across all asset classes Familiarity with ex-ante risk models and contribution to risk concepts advantageous Written and verbal communication skills and the ability to prepare concise/succinct business reports In order to be considered for this role you will need to hold tertiary qualifications in mathematics or quantitative based disciplines (or demonstrated relevant experience) with a high level of Microsoft Excel capability and experience in stakeholder management within a complex environment. Demonstrated experience with Microsoft PowerBI and SSRS is advantageous  as is experience in the financial services industry  preferably within a fund manager or superannuation fund.  At TCorp we actively collaborate with our stakeholders to achieve the best outcomes for our clients and the state of NSW. We aim to build an inclusive culture so we can benefit from each employee’s unique perspective and contribution. We also understand the importance of flexible working and we support our people to balance their commitments and thrive both professionally and personally.  Please submit your application via our careers portal and include a cover letter setting out how your background and capabilities align to our selection criteria and how this role fits with your career goals. Please also note your salary expectations in the relevant section of the portal. No agency candidates please.  TCorp’s COVID-19 Vaccination Policy requires all new employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or have an approved medical exemption. You will need to provide evidence of vaccination prior to attending a face-to-face interview and proof of vaccination or medical exemption will be required prior to any offer of employment being made.

Title: Data Analyst

We are Australia’s largest locally owned media company – the home of Australia’s most trusted and loved brands spanning News  Sport  Lifestyle  and Entertainment  we pride ourselves on creating the best content  accessed by consumers when and how they want. Nine’s assets include the Nine Network  major mastheads such as The Sydney Morning Herald  The Age and The Australian Financial Review  radio stations 2GB  2UE  3AW  MAGIC  4BC  4BH and 6PR  digital properties such as nine.com.au  9Now  9Honey  Pedestrian.TV  subscription video platform Stan and majority investments in Domain Group and CarAdvice. Role Responsibilities Apply advanced analytics to generate business insights Translate business needs into analytics/reporting requirements Maintain a high level "cutting edge" knowledge and awareness of the key business drivers for your internal stakeholders Establish an effective working relationship with stakeholders Perform ad-hoc custom audience analysis and reporting Working collaboratively with team members to perform ETL tasks that are part of data warehouse build  model build and ongoing analysis using AWS cloud services such as Athena  Spectrum and Redshift Ability to present data analysis outcome and create visualisations of data Managing and debugging ETL Pipelines Create statistical models and ad-hoc analyses to support business need using R/Python or similar – not essential but will be advantageous  Qualifications 4+ years in BI and data analytics solution University Degree in related subject Strong data manipulation skills using SQL or similar Experience in building dashboard using Tableau Experience working in a big data environment AWS Cloud computing experience Analyse information using statistical/data analysis techniques Extensive knowledge and understanding of dimensional data warehouse design and implementation Demonstrated experience in analysis  design  development and deployment of reports  Desirable Experience & Skills Java – not essential but would be beneficial Ability to build and optimise predictive models using R/Python Text mining experience would be advantageous Working knowledge of ad serving platforms and their configuration SSIS skills are not essential  but would be beneficial  Additional Information  Nine embraces all aspects of diversity & inclusion and is committed to creating a workplace that reflects the diversity of customers  audiences and communities we serve. Company: Penguin Random House Australia & New Zealand
Title: Sales Data Analyst  Online and Digital Sales
Requirements: At Penguin Random House Australia  we strive to be the best home for our authors and people  the most service-oriented partner for our customers and to put readers at the centre of everything we do. An opportunity exists for an analytical  entrepreneurial and detail-driven Sales Data Analyst to join our team in the Melbourne office. In this role you will use sales data from internal and external sources to discover and maximise opportunities to improve sales performance with online retailers. You will work with digital and physical books  analysing pricing  in-stock performance  as well as conversion rates across large volumes of titles. You will work with internal teams across our sales  product and commercial teams  helping to run and interpret existing reporting  as well as looking for new opportunities to use retailer data to drive sales and market share growth. You'll undertake tasks including: Reporting on sales performance across eBooks  audio and physical books using internal and customer data sources Reporting on  and updating  pricing across digital products and measuring performance through pricing experimentation and promotional analysis Making sales-focused improvements by adding new reporting on sales trends by titles and subjects Combining retailer and internal reporting to view end-to-end sales performance including in-stock performance and conversion rates Reporting on customer search term data Attending team meetings Liaising with other teams on areas for improvement  including product teams and commercial / finance teams Liaising with customers on improvements and troubleshooting The ideal candidate will have excellent attention to detail and be able to work analytically with large volumes of data. You will be able to extrapolate insights with sales focused thinking  finding opportunities and making recommendations for actions and process improvements. You will also have strong communication skills. You will have previous experience in an analytical data role and advanced knowledge of Microsoft Office  particularly Excel. Previous experience with systems such as Business Objects  Business Intelligence  Tableau and Amazon Vendor central are desired but not essential. Experience or qualifications in accounting or data science are desired but not essential. If this sounds like you  we invite you to apply now. All applications must include a cover letter outlining your suitability for the role. Due to the high volume of applications only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

Title: Data Delivery Analyst
Requirements: Who is Equifax?  Equifax is a leading global data  analytic and technology company  supporting customers across 24 countries. We have been serving the Australian and New Zealand markets for over 60 years. Through continuously adapting to our environment  not only have we remained a market leader  we drive and challenge ourselves to do better to help our customers live their financial best.  Our people are what makes us great at what we do - we see every member of our team as an integral piece of a jigsaw. We celebrate differences and recognize that each person brings with them unique talents and perspectives. We provide our people the support and flexibility to manage their work-life balance. At Equifax we genuinely care about our people and our ability to come together as #OneEquifax.  The perks of being an Equifax employee within the Data & Analytics team?  There are lots of perks of being an Equifax employee – we offer additional leave days as we recognize the importance of taking time out  whether that’s to catch up on some rest  celebrate a birthday  or give back to our community by volunteering. We are committed to the wellbeing of our people and provide them with discounted health cover through BUPA  access to comprehensive hearing services and discounts  and offer 24/7 support through our employee assistance program. Our leadership team fosters a culture of ownership  they will lead  coach  mentor and listen. We support one another to feel confident to speak up and hold each other accountable to work with integrity.  Our success is our people  for we are truly united by our purpose and are encouraged and challenged every day to bring new ideas to help our customers make more informed decisions. Our outcomes focused culture encourages thought leadership and innovation to ensure our ongoing success.  We are supportive and revel in working together on exciting projects. We see ourselves making an impact by utilizing cutting edge/statistical modelling tools across hundreds of rich data assets and collaborating with some of the best data minds in Australia. Working within our diverse D&A team will provide you opportunities to gain exposure across all phases of the D&A lifecycle and work with some of our largest blue-chip customers.  Flexible location - Sydney/Melbourne  What you’ll do:  The Data Delivery Analyst (DDA) will be expected to use their advance Data Manipulation skills in the delivery of Client data tasks. DDAs are required to take the ownership of multiple and concurrent projects and the ability to work independently to deliver quality work. This role also enables the fine-tuning of technical and stakeholder management skills. DDAs are also expected to extract and manipulate information from internal databases in order to satisfy client requirements  delivering quality output in agreed time frame  write and understand SQL/SSIS/SAS/R queries to facilitate data extraction and manipulation. This role also requires to process and analyze large volumes of data generally in the fields of Marketing lists and campaign execution.  What are we looking for? At least 3+ years’ experience in a data operations / database marketing environment. Prior experience in standardization and automation of processes.  Success attributes of an Equifax employee  does this describe you? Accountable Brave Curious Collaborative Individualist Trustworthy Dedicated  At Equifax  there is no such thing as the 'perfect candidate'  Seeing responsibilities and competencies laid out on paper can be confronting. At this stage of the application process  sometimes imposter syndrome can creep in and mess with our confidence. Please know  we list these items to give you an opportunity to show us your potential and how you can grow and transform with us.  Your ability to demonstrate that you possess/have the real potential to develop the required capabilities  knowledge  experience and qualifications to perform in our roles is what we would like to hear from you. However you identify  and whatever background you bring with you  please apply if this is a role that would make you excited to come to work every day!

Permanent full-time position based at our Mascot Campus.  Qantas is synonymous with aviation  but we’ve evolved in ways that may surprise you. Title: Data Analyst | Data-centric & commercially-minded | Join the Cloudscene team
Requirements: Overview  Do you simply LOVE data analytics? Does showcasing useful info that will create and inspire positive change really butter your bread? Do you love deriving predictions and consumer behaviours from key pieces of data  and collaborating with an effective yet highly efficient team to put those insights to use? If that sounds like you then I invite you to read on because you’re going to love this role.  Cloudscene is a leading marketplace platform  enabling enterprises and service providers to connect in a fast  easy and data-driven way. This company is backed by a globally recognised tech founder who’s also responsible for companies that many of Brisbane’s tech folk are lining up to work for.  Like most of the world  our client has successfully transitioned to a remote-first model but they also have an office in Brisbane  so if you like working from home  but you also like popping into the office every now and again for a team lunch or Friday drinks  then look no further!  This Data Analyst role is imperative to drive the business through the scale-up phase as the person filling it will provide insights on market trends  and use those insights to advise which direction they should take. They’re looking for someone who can take that responsibility and give them the direction they need  so they can continue to grow sustainably and effectively.  But wait  before we talk more about the role! Who is Cloudscene?  Let’s Talk About Cloudscene …  Founded by Bevan Slattery  a renowned global tech entrepreneur  Cloudscene’ s goal is to become the #1 trading platform for network services worldwide.  You might recognise the name ‘Bevan Slattery’ – he is also the Founder of hugely successful companies including NEXTDC   SUB.CO   Superloop and Megaport . He also co-founded PIPE Networks and HyperOne . When it comes to building successful telco and infrastructure companies  Bevan’s resume is an impressive one.  Which brings us back to Cloudscene …  Cloudscene is on a mission to transform the way businesses source and sell network services  making the experience simpler  faster and more competitive.  Here’s three easy ways that users get the most out of the centralised Cloudscene platform: Source: Find  compare  and request quotes for the network services they need to power their businesses in just a few clicks. Sell: Connect with informed buyers actively searching for network services  manage leads  and quote requirements all in one place. Search: Explore the world’s most comprehensive platform for industry data across colocation  cloud  and connectivity. And with 8 000+ data centres  8 000+ service providers  200+ network fabrics  500+ cloud on-ramps and 3 500+ marketplace listings  Cloudscene is in a critical phase of growth and they need intelligent  driven  engaged and hard-working people  like you  to help drive this growth.  ‘What about the perks?’ we hear you ask:  Here are a few extra reasons why you’ll love working at Cloudscene: They focus on quality output whether you achieve this working from home or from their HQ in Brisbane’s Fortitude Valley – it’s your choice! They believe in flexibility and offering work-life balance with ‘downtime’ in addition to four weeks of annual leave and work-from-home flexibility On Friday afternoons  they chill out and reflect on the week (not sure about you but virtual Friday arvo drinks is something we can get behind!) They know that job satisfaction and happiness at work is super important so they conduct regular check-ins and give employees feedback opportunities throughout the year (just look at their team’s tenures and career growth – the proof is in the pudding) Their Founder has a long track record of building his startups into hugely successful multimillion-dollar companies  so you’ll get to be part of something big from the early stages! Are you hooked yet? Let us tell you about the role  Let’s tell you about the role… About You You’re both fluid in thought yet know and follow the proper procedure You have excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills You have an inextinguishable thirst for improvement You would love nothing better than joining a scale-up and help them thrive the best that they can You have excellent professional and commercial judgement The Role  This Includes The Following Responsibilities  The Data Analyst will be a gatekeeper for managing the company’s global database as a reliable and trusted information source. Build and maintain a global database with accurate and up-to-date information about colocation data centres  service providers  network fabrics and cloud on-ramps. Source data from global service providers and data centre operators. Update information on the platform on behalf of users or internal stakeholders as required. Ensure the ongoing accuracy of the data published. Ensure ongoing data integrity and data improvement  reporting any data inconsistencies appropriately. Where required  conduct testing in the staging environment before being released into production. Conduct analysis and quality verifications of the data input and data information received by users. Support Business Development opportunities from a data management  analysis and reporting perspective. Identify  prepare and interpret trends and patterns in data sets  reporting as required. Write/rewrite content reports based on business  country and market data. Support the company’s internal Global Content Marketing Manager with any data required for content. Provide a high standard of first level support for users via email and phone with regards to data queries. Provide regular reporting to internal stakeholders and produce external data reports and analysis for industry leaderboards  rankings and trends. Experience Qualified in Mathematics/Statistics  Computer Sciences  Information Management or a similar discipline. Analytical mind with a passion for working with data  stats and trends. Experience in a software and technology company or a start-up environment. Experience and understanding of database systems (both building and maintaining) Experience with ETL processes  Metabase (or any other BI tool)  Buildkite (or any other platforms that implement pipelines)  Excel and other spreadsheet tools Ability to communicate effectively with a wide range of stakeholders (including customers) and articulate methodologies and results to non-technical audiences Strong attention to detail. Ability to work with tight deadlines. Collaborative  whilst also able to work autonomously and independently with project prioritisation in mind. Brownie Points  These Aren’t Must-haves  But Will Be Highly-regarded SQL (MYSQL or PostgreSQL) and Python will be highly regarded. Salary:  $80k + super (commensurate with experience)  If you’re a date-driven  detail-orientated  commercially-minded person on the hunt for a challenging yet ever-rewarding opportunity that allows you to continually better yourself both professionally and personally  then this role was made for you.  Are you interested? You should be! Contact Emily ( emily@huntandco.io   0403 726 487)  Interested  but this role isn’t quite right for you? Get in touch! We have other current and upcoming opportunities we’d love to discuss with you.  At Hunt & Co.  we are fierce advocates for diversity  inclusion and equality in digital and believe that technology should be built by all people  for all people. You have probably seen the stats: women and other underrepresented people in tech tend to only apply for a role when they meet 100% of the criteria. Don’t take yourself out of the race! If you think you have what it takes  but don’t necessarily meet every single point on the job description  please still get in touch. We’d love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit.  While we’re looking at your application  and preparing to come back to you with an update  why not get to know us a little better and follow us on social media? We also regularly post job and industry updates on there too! Linkedin   Facebook   Instagram .

Title: Data Governance Analyst
Requirements: About Us  Endeavour Group was created in 2020 through the restructure and merger of the Woolworths Group drinks and hospitality businesses. With a strong track record of growth  combined these businesses form the leading customer franchise in drinks and hospitality in Australia.  United behind a common purpose of ‘Creating a more sociable future together’  we are a 28 000+ strong team with more than 1600 stores and 330 hotels nationally  including leading brands such as Dan Murphy’s  BWS and ALH Hotels.  Endeavour Group separated from Woolworths during calendar year 2021 and is well-positioned as an ASX Top 50 Company. Join the team at an exciting time in their evolution!  As a start-up business inside Australia's largest liquor retailer  EndeavourX aims to bring the best of Endeavour Drinks to our customers  powered by our team  technology and data. To achieve our customer 1st strategy  we have combined the Digital & eCommerce businesses for Dan Murphy’s and BWS to transform the customer experience under one brand - EndeavourX.  As part of the EndeavourX Data and Personalisation team  this role will play a critical part in implementing a robust data governance framework across Endeavour Drinks Group and Woolworths Group.  The Opportunity  Responsibilities Will Include  But Are Not Limited To  We are looking for an experienced Analyst with expertise in Data Governance to work across a range of projects. Support the delivery of data governance across Endeavour and work with the data governance & privacy team to develop a strategic road map to ensure our data is safe and trusted. Support the implementation of standards  processes and practices required to meet data privacy requirements and ensure they are cascaded within Endeavour. Contribute to the implementation of the group data risk management framework within Endeavour in close collaboration with the group data team. Support the implementation of a new data lineage  metadata & reference data management framework and technology solution in partnership with IT. Utilise this solution to identify  initiate and champion improvements in data quality  sustainability and security. Ensure Endeavour data assets are classified  certified and prioritised to enable our community of users to trust the data they use in their decision making processes. Collaborate with the data and personalisation team  work to uplift the group-wide Endeavour data culture and capabilities. Contribute to the management of a portfolio of data privacy & governance initiatives for Endeavour. This includes the development of concepts  business cases  project planning  and delivery. Skills & Qualifications 5+ years of experience in a data governance analyst and/or project management role in a data or risk related role within a large organisation or consulting firm. Experience in implementing frameworks  policies  processes  and transformational agendas in large organisations. Hands on experience using data governance tools including  Collibra or Ataccama is an added advantage. Demonstrated experience working in an Agile project delivery model environment. Eagerness to work in a fun  dynamic  and fast-paced environment. Exposure to data governance  data information security practices  and cloud databases. What's in it for you?  With an industry-leading technology team  backed by analytics  we’re resourceful and willing to experiment. Our agile teams are empowered to innovate and deliver an awesome experience for our customers - no matter whether they choose to shop in-store  or online. The EndeavourX Hub is a 5 minutes walk from Central station with spaces for different activities such as collaboration  brainstorming or just chilling out playing ping pong. At EndeavourX  we also believe in flexible working  and our teams also have the option to work from home. The opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest and best minds in Australia! Training and Education - We pride ourselves in helping you realise your potential and give you the opportunity to be innovative leveraging great partnerships we have with Google  Microsoft and others. An exciting career - As our business grows  so do the opportunities for our people! Innovative environment working with the latest and greatest tools and technology on the market. Grow with Endeavour Group  Endeavour Group comprises a diverse range of drinks and hospitality businesses including BWS  Dan Murphy’s  ALH Hotels and Pinnacle Drinks. We are focused on growing and transforming our businesses to meet the changing needs of customers and we’re driven by a culture that puts our customers and team first.  As an inclusive  team-first company  our people are at the core of everything we do. We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued  respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity  ethnicity  disability or sexual orientation. At Endeavour Group we value flexibility  and encourage our team members to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing.  We work hard to create a safe and inclusive environment for all  and most importantly  we're all about creating a more sociable future – for our customers and for each other.  We’d love to hear from You  If you meet a number of the requirements  but not all  we encourage you to submit your application.  You can learn more about working with us on LinkedIn or via www.wowcareers.com.au #LI #work180  Our Talent Acquisition Team and Hiring Leaders kindly request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from Recruitment Agencies. Endeavour Group is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - APAC Publishing Insights and Analytics
Requirements: Job Title  Senior Data Analyst - APAC Publishing Insights and Analytics  Requisition ID  R013549  Job Description  The Role  We are looking for a hard-working and experienced Data Analyst to develop an intimate knowledge on how consumers are purchasing  playing  and interacting with video games across Asia. A love for video games. Preferable – 1+ year experience in an analytical role within FMCG in a consumer-focused category  video game knowledge preferred. The job title may vary depending on the candidate’s experience and expertise.

Title: Lead Data Analyst - Creators Monetisation & Insights
Requirements: Canva’s Commitment and Mission  At Canva  we celebrate diversity. We deeply believe that bringing together diversity of thoughts  perspectives and expression is key to building the best product  team and company. We look for many different skills and abilities  as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. So  even if you don’t think you quite meet all of the skills listed or tick all the boxes  we’d still love to hear from you!  Our mission at Canva is to empower the world to design and since launching in 2013  we have grown exponentially  amassing over 75 million monthly active users across 190 different countries and a team of over 2 800 people… and the best bit is that we’ve only achieved 1% of what we know we’re capable of.  Join us and design your future.  Since Canva’s founding  our template library has been a critical and fundamental driver of our success. Fundamental to making design accessible to the world is giving people everywhere a springboard with which to create designs from. Templates are that springboard.  Templates provide inspiration to users  help them visualise what's possible and provide an approachable starting point for our users to get creative. In fact  templates are the way the majority of our users create designs so the templates teams are helping millions of people each week.  Historically  Canva’s templates have been designed by a talented team of internal graphic designers. But last year we launched Canva Creators  a platform that allows anyone to publish their templates and earn money every time they’re used. We believe Canva Creators has the potential to take Canva to the next level of scale  and we want you to be central to that growth.  In this role  you'll collaborate with our founders  Product  Finance  Strategy  Engineering and Researchers to shape the Creators Monetisation strategy.  Initially  this role will be a half of a 1-2 combination we are setting up between the Monetisation Product Manager and this role  the Data and monetisation insights Lead. Together  you will drive the strategy  modelling  shaping  testing and development of Canva Creator’s monetisation approach across templates and elements. This is an amazing opportunity to lead and grow the strategies around monetisation for Creators in an environment that rewards strategic thinking  initiative  creativity  and independence.  This role is about so much more than just “Money  money  money” - our Creators have shared stories about how becoming a Creator enabled them to gain their financial independence and make empowering decisions to put their health and happiness first  buy a new home for their family  leave a job where they were unhappy - see some of the comments below! We are building pathways to better lives for people all over the world and this role is a critical thought-leader and decision-maker as part of that.  Role Responsibilities Forecast and model product and monetization scenarios to test likely impact of changes Be the voice of data for the Creators team - input what data should and shouldn’t be shared and help to apply a strategic lens for how data is used across the product (including in communications outside of the product) Analyse the feedback on the current monetisation model for Creators Use quantitative data to inform team on who benefits from specific models and changes  and analyse how closely this aligns with Canva’s goals  and being the voice for those who are not benefiting or who are experiencing diminishing returns Test the model with creators  work with Product to define how this should be positioned internally and externally Present your recommendations to the team and leadership  taking ownership and recognition of your work Continue to regularly monitor our royalty system  including analyse movements and abnormalities  and ensuring that they align continue to with Canva’s strategic direction while working with Product and Finance to make adjustments Work with the team on researching the competitive landscape  including ensuring how we can present the most appealing opportunity for Canva Creators Improve the lives and livelihoods of thousands of Creators (and growing!) while creating business value for Canva  on our mission to empower the world to design.  Experience You'll Need Strong competency with SQL  experience with data warehouses such as Snowflake  Redshift  or BigQuery is a plus! Experience wrangling and analysing data using Python or R Extensive experience communicating with senior stakeholders A track-record of tackling complex problems and delivering simple  elegant solutions. You hold a high-bar for elegant  strategic and scalable financial solutions Experience with very large data sets is a huge plus  but not required Deep understanding of how to uncover user needs through research and user empathy Moderate execution experience so that you understand some of the intricacies of delivery A strong sense of ethics - understanding that the decisions we make at Canva impact millions of lives  everyday You enjoy a little flexibility in your work. Our growth means there are constantly new things to work on every day  as such it’s likely that you’ll often be working across the board on new and exciting projects.  Company Benefits Competitive salary  plus equity options Flexible working hours  we value work-life balance In-house chefs that cook delicious breakfast and lunch for us each day Free Yoga membership Generous parental leave policy Pet friendly offices including a garden  climbing wall  unisex toilets Sponsored social clubs and team events Fun and quirky celebrations Relocation budget provided for interstate or overseas candidates  One of our core values at Canva  “Being a force for good” means we are actively working towards a world that isn't just good for a small few  but one that’s good for everyone. We believe deeply that bringing together diversity of thoughts  perspectives and expression is key for building the best product for our equally diverse community. To achieve this  we need to constantly work towards making Canva the best place to work  for everyone.  If you're a passionate data analyst seeking a truly challenging opportunity with one of the world's premier technology companies  then apply now to start the discussion with us!  We will not accept or review any CVs from external recruitment agencies.  Working at Canva  Our culture is unlike anywhere else and we design your #CanvaLife experience to empower you to do the best work of your life.  Whether you’re in the office  working from home or choosing your own adventure  our benefits for permanent Canvanauts include: Equity packages for you to truly be a part of the Canva journey. Hybrid work model (in-office & from home) coming together for 8 days a year. Flexible leave so you can recharge  give back  support others or focus on your own professional development. Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents and carers throughout their parenting and caring journey. An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance. This is for you to spend on whatever will support your wellbeing and development.. because you know what you need to Vibe and Thrive  better than anyone. Virtual and in-office wellness benefits including Canva University  Employee Assistant Programs and Fitness & Meditation Classes. Canva For Good program matching your not-for-profit donations  Force for Good leave (3 paid volunteering days) and a range of sustainability and ethical initiatives to get involved in.  We make hiring decisions based on your experience  skills and passion. Please note that interviews are conducted virtually. When you apply  please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: Job description:  12-month Fixed Term Position Location: Clarence Correctional Centre (Grafton  NSW) Bring your problem-solving & analytical skills to this critical role   About you  You are a process driven and solution focused Data Analyst with exceptional attention to detail  sound judgement  and a flexible and agile approach. You are engaging and collaborative  whilst having a high degree of emotional intelligence and outstanding interpersonal and communication skills. You thrive in fast paced  complex and ever-changing environment  and can prioritise conflicting needs diplomatically whilst following through on actions and commitments. You’re a respectful and professional person who demonstrates exceptional values in everything you do.    About the role  The key purpose of this position is to support the Facilities Manager in the delivery of the Asset Management Plan. Specifically  the forecasting of and extension to  lifecycle replacement activity. Integral to the success of this position is the validation of asset data  including life expectancy and maintenance activities that will enhance the assets life expectancy.    To be successful in this role you will have:  The highest levels of personal integrity and ethical behaviour Degree level qualification or higher in Engineering or Commercial discipline Demonstrated experience working within a property or asset management environment ERP/ CAFM / CMS application configuration and user experience Knowledge of PAS 1192-3:2014. Sound knowledge of relevant legislative requirements according to contract obligations  and any other specific requirements for a Correctional Centre. Sound business acumen and a track record of delivering value-add impact in a fast-paced  dynamic environment Strong organisational and time management skills A highly motivated self-starter with demonstrated ability to drive outcomes This is a position of trust and responsibility and to support this we will conduct a thorough probity assessment as an essential section component for this role.      About Us  We have been operating correctional services in Australia for almost 15 years. As a prison operator  safety and security is always our first priority and the new Clarence Correctional Centre is no exception. Newly opened in mid-2020  this 1 700-bed state-of-the-art facility is the largest correctional centre in Australia.    At Serco  you’ll be part of a team of more than 50 000 people delivering essential services on behalf of governments and organisations around the world. We apply world's best practice  insights and technology across six key sectors: Citizen Services  Defence  Healthcare  Immigration  Justice and Transport. But no matter your role or where you’re based  we each share the same goal – to bring service to life to make a positive difference every day. To learn more please visit www.graftonserco.com.au    About NSW Mid-North Coast  Located on the beautiful NSW Mid-North Coast approx. 6 hours’ drive from Sydney and 4 hours from Brisbane our region offers rainforests  epic headlands  sand dunes and some of the best Australian beaches with a variety of multi-cultural cafes  restaurants and friendly community towns. Our region has something to offer everyone from trail walks in National Parks  ocean adventures  sporting  relaxation and a vibrant culture. With recent Pacific Highway upgrades and investment in infrastructure  and with affordable housing and access to good schools and recreation options  you can select the ideal community location for your next career move with your family. Our closest communities are Grafton set on the Clarence River or if you are looking for that beach lifestyle consider Yamba  Woolgoolga  or Coffs Harbour with additional smaller beach communities along the way that all offer something unique.    Join Us  If you are inspired to make a positive difference and would like to be considered for this opportunity  please apply now.    Serco values of Trust  Care  Innovation and Pride underpin everything we do. We are curious  creative and collaborative. Our people help in ways that matter.  By joining Serco you will have access to our Global Employee Networks – SercoInspire (Gender)  SercoEmbrace (Multicultural)  SercoUnlimited (Disability) and In@Serco (Networks) Serco Employee Networks  led by colleagues who are passionate about diversity  inclusion and belonging.  NOTE: Google Chrome is the preferred browser to access Serco careers website

manipulation (SQL  R  Python  Pandas  Scala) Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau or your weapon of choice Strong analytical and statistical analysis skills in order to extract insights and recommendations Fluent in English with strong communication skills (both written and verbal)  It’s Great If You Have  Knowledge of machine learning algorithms including classifiers  clustering algorithms  and anomaly detection is a plus #sanfrancisco #washdc #sydney #london #tokyo #amsterdam #munich #berlin #toronto #vancouver #moscow #dublin #seoul #hcmc #telaviv #taipei #IT #4
