Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: Posted by Linda Marlin Talent Acquisition Partner Send InMail About Us Kinesso brings together the best minds in data  technology and media activation to deliver seamless data-driven marketing solutions. Kinesso’s application framework spans audience  planning and activation  delivering insights and business outcomes for leading global brands.  Our data science team are highly skilled data science & analytics professionals offering a diverse and expanding range of data led offerings to our clients. You will be part of growing data practice with the opportunity to contribute to shaping the future of addressable services to our clients. We value innovation  new ideas and new ways to approach our client’s media and business challenges.  The Role The SPO Analyst role is a core technical role within the Data Science division working in tandem with Partnerships and Investment Strategy Division of Kinesso. The purpose of the role is to provide insight into our SPO performance over time and identify strategic optimisation learnings from SSPs’ log level data outputs.  This role is responsible in analysing log level data to create consistent reporting with the intent of measuring success of implemented SPO tactics and create a readable data output to enhance Matterkind optimisation’s intel and super charge advertisers’ reporting.  The opportunity also exists to learn and work alongside our leading data and partnerships specialists  supporting the partnerships team in demonstrating the success that curating private inventory has on advertisers’ KPIs and performance. As well as leveraging data science to identify suitable inventory choices based on specific advertisers’ main metrics.  About You To be successful in this role  it is expected that you have the following experience:  · 2+ years proven experience as a data analyst/scientist in a commercial environment. · Experience using statistical programming languages  libraries  or packages for analysing large datasets: R  Python  SPSS. · Experience with large data sets  specifically web traffic (clickstream) · Experience with data interrogation  manipulation and extraction using SQL/R/Python applied to large databases. · Experience with Media Analytics desirable. · Experience visualising  presenting data and building dashboards using Tableau  PowerBI · Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect  organise  analyse  and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. · Experience with data modelling techniques such as multiple linear regression  classification  segmentation etc. is a plus. · Experience with ML and AI is a plus. · Proactive  self-learning and confident. · Ability to project manage and prioritize against multiple deadlines. · Ability to work within a team environment is essential. · BS in Mathematics  Economics  Econometrics  Computer Science  Information Management  Data Science or Statistics.  What's in it for you? This is a unique opportunity to fast track your career and be mentored into a leadership role working closely with our Head of Data Science & Audience Analytics. In addition you will also:  · Build a network of strong relationships in market and connect with great minds in our industry · Contribute towards building solutions from the ground up  providing a unique opportunity to be at the forefront of industry first initiatives. · Work with one of the largest people based addressable data stacks in the country providing our clients with the most robust data led audience strategies in market. · Lots of work flexibility and a fantastic company culture.  In case your experience looks a little different from what we are looking for and you think you can perform the role  we would still love to hear back from you. Interested? – Click apply  tell us why you think you would succeed with Kinesso enclosing your CV.  Mediabrands is an equal opportunity employer and is committed to building a diverse and inclusive workplace. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples are encouraged to apply.

Title: Principal Data Analyst
Requirements: Based In Southport For Further Information On Our Health Service  Please Watch Our Corporate Video  The primary focus of this role is to lead the delivery of high quality data and analytics services  including design of data and information delivery solutions and ad hoc analysis.  The Role  An opportunity has become available for a Principal Data Analyst to join Gold Coast Health (GCH) where the focus of our 10 000-strong team is on providing world-class health care to people living in the Gold Coast  and northern New South Wales region of Australia.  You will Provide high quality analysis of complex health care data to support strategic and operational decision making Support day to day management of data and analytics platforms  providing end to end analysis and investigating variances Lead the development and design of data and analytics solutions that deliver the right information for the right purpose at the right time Maintain up to date knowledge of national and international developments About You  To be successful in this position you will require: While not mandatory  the following are highly regarded: Experience with Structured Query Language (SQL) Experience in the development of end to end business intelligence solutions using tools such as Qlik  Power Pivot  SSRS  Panorama Necto  Power BI and Crystal Reports Experience with clinical and patient administration systems  such as the Hospital Based Clinical Information System (HBCIS) and the integrated electronic medical record (ieMR) A relevant tertiary qualification Evidence of vaccination  and remain vaccinated against - COVID 19 Declaration of serious discipline history must be disclosed Benefits Flexible work options Career Development Salary Packaging Modern Facilities Diverse Work Culture Research Opportunities Up to 12.75% super 17.5% leave loading Salary Temporary full time (12 months) Base salary ranging from $122 108 - $131 044 per annum About Us  The Strategy  Transformation and Major Capital division has been established to define  design  enhance delivery and sustainability of our most significant service improvement  digital and digital transformation opportunities. As a division  we are responsible for the delivery of the transformation agenda  sustainability plan  digital transformation roadmap. Based at Southport.  About Gold Coast Health Nationally and internationally recognised location for innovative medical research and health care Annual operating budget exceeding $1.5 billion More than 1100 beds across three hospitals - Gold Coast University Hospital  Robina Hospital  Varsity Lakes Hospital and Robina and Southport Health Precincts Secondary and tertiary health services across more than 20 facilities Opportunity to combine professional advancement  job satisfaction and relaxation into one fulfilling lifestyle A workplace culture that encourages people to bring their whole selves to work so that they can perform at their best Committed to reflecting the diversity of the Gold Coast community and ensuring each staff member is included and feels like they belong How To Apply  Click APPLY to submit your application by Thursday  19 May 2022  Job Ad reference: GC416140  Please note: no third-party applications will be accepted.  Occupational group IT & Telecommunications

Title: SAS - Analyst
Requirements: Job Description  Key Skills  3+ Years’ experience in analytics  economics  insights or other quantitative analysis within a corporate  environment.  Experience in SAS programming language.  Experience with data visualization with Tableau or other tools would be advantageous.  Proven ability to undertake complex data and statistical analysis using relevant tools.  Uses analytical techniques to provide data-driven recommendations and reports results in a meaningful   logical and concise manner  Diagnose reporting and analytics problems to understand the root causes  including gathering and analyzing  data.  Design  develop and implement interventions to address the root causes  improving the governance   process  technology and people components in collaboration with SMEs.  Provide input into project management artefacts including schedule  risk and issue registers and status  reporting.  Key Responsibilities  Works on complex problems where analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of various  factors. Specifically formulates and defines business and operational data requirements through research  and fact-finding.  Works closely with internal stakeholders to identify and clarify basic to moderately complex business  requirements.  Succinctly converts business requirements into scope of work with clear timelines  roles and responsibilities  for delivery.  Interrogates the data warehouse and extracting relevant data for a range of adhoc and regular projects and  reports.  Provides value added analysis and insight to internal and external stakeholders.  Ensure health services data is leveraged to maximum commercial and operational advantage.

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Requirements: At Canva  our mission is to empower the world to design  and we’re looking for insightful data analysts who can help us make that happen.  We're looking for self-motivated individuals who are curious about our product and our users  and who are excited to seek out valuable insights. We don’t want you to just be a resource that answers questions - we want you to act as a genuine data partner with your team and the broader business. We have a LOT of data and need people who can use their skills to help us make the most of it!  You’ll be coming into a diverse data team of more than forty people  who really do enjoy finding answers to the problems that our users have. We’re looking forward to continuing to grow our team and gaining a range of new perspectives and ideas on how we can achieve our goals and help more people.  This role will rely on your particular strengths in building out data-driven decisions  communicating closely with stakeholders  and organising your fellow data team members such that the data attitude in this space is highly proactive.  Role Responsibilities Coach a team of data specialists  composed of BI Analysts  Data Analysts and sometimes Analytics Engineers. This role will act as a driver of data strategy in this group and will coordinate closely with the Product Growth Manager. It will require close coordination with several stakeholders and a real sense of drive and initiative to keep things moving. Nobody tells you what to do  you identify the opportunities where your team can make the largest impact and you see it through. Although you are a technical guru  you also have people skills and know how to coordinate a team  align with stakeholders  and organise a data strategy in your particular area. Find insights that help us understand both Canva and our customers - we want you to be creative and insightful  rather than just throwing the usual metrics at the wall to see what sticks Suggest and run interesting experiments that will actually move our metrics - when we push tests to 100% we want to actually see the bump in the relevant graph Build and maintain dashboards for your group’s initiatives  and make them look really good - you don’t need to be a designer or have any design talent  you just need to want to build cool things Own projects  data models  dashboards  and other artefacts and keep them up-to-date and high quality in a hypergrowth environment Use our giant databases to answer the sort of questions that sound really simple but turn out to be challenging (and fun!) Help us extend data literacy and curiosity throughout the whole company  Required Skills & Experience Experience leading data analysts. Experience working with subscription-based data sets. It would be desirable if you have experience with collaborative products as well. Strong competency with SQL  experience with data warehouses such as Snowflake  Redshift  or BigQuery is a plus! Experience wrangling and analysing data using Python or R Experience with optimising product funnels  running experiments  and building dashboards that effectively communicate results and outcomes A grounding in mathematics / statistics and a bachelor's degree in a STEM area is preferred  but not required Experience with very large data sets is a huge plus  but not required Strong communication skills - verbal and written - be able to break down complex topics into simple solutions and ideas. Stakeholder management skills are vital in this role.  Perks & Benifits: Competitive salary  plus stock options via our ESOP plan Flexible daily working hours  we value work-life balance Breakfast and lunch prepared by our wonderful Vibe team Onsite-Gym and Yoga Membership End-of-Trip Facilities: Bicycle parking and showers Generous parental (including secondary) leave policy Pet-friendly offices Internal Coaching and Employee Support Programs Sponsored social clubs  team events and celebrations Relocation budget for interstate and qualified overseas individuals (see below for visa information)  The Canva workspace is set up for you to do your best work and have a great time doing so  with breakout areas  little nooks  and quiet places to retreat.  If you're seeking professional growth and enjoy working on large  distributed  cloud-based applications that delight our millions of individual and business users alike - then apply now to be considered for the position!  If you require visa sponsorship  you must ensure you have at least two (2) years of post-University commercial experience as a Software Engineer and meet the mandatory sponsorship requirements laid out by the Department of Home Affairs.  We will not accept or review any CVs from external recruitment agencies.

Title: Lead Data Analyst
Requirements: Digital Health Technology team powers digital experiences and engagement to enhance the lives of millions of people every day through connected care. We build  deliver and manage a portfolio of data management platforms and mobile offerings in support of our core businesses. We thrive on simple and elegant architecture and agility. You’ll be immersed in a dynamic high-growth environment and empowered to excel  take informed risks  and drive ingenuity across the enterprise.  The role of a Lead Data Analyst is to identify and build analytics solutions that create business value. You'll be untangling and understanding business problems then applying a broad knowledge of best practice analytical methods and tools to deliver outcomes.  We’re looking for a candidate who balances skills  curiosity and a passion for using data to deliver impactful results. Success in this role is all about converting data opportunities into value in partnership with Product Owners and business stakeholders.  Let’s Talk About Responsibilities Provide technical leadership to other analytics team members Ability to link team specific business requirements to best practice BI  Analytics and Big Data solutions Advanced analytical skills demonstrated by the ability to research and develop solutions to complex technical problems Building strong partnerships with a broad range of business functions and identifying where analytics solutions can add value Conduct effective and efficient data preparation  transformation and visualisation Maintain an understanding of the data architecture and relationships between various sources of data Proactively engage with customers to understand  prioritise and communicate analytics needs that will lead to improved business outcomes Drive participation in data governance  architecture  integration and change management alongside business stakeholders and domain experts Present information effectively to all parts of ResMed up to Executive level Document all activities and generate appropriate reports for internal and external use Required  Let’s talk about Qualifications and Experience Bachelor’s degree in data science  business  information systems  computer science or equivalent and at least 8 years of experience working in a complex business environment Experience working on projects incorporating aspects of data governance  data transformation  data warehousing and data visualisation Experience working with a range of data preparation  analysis and visualisation tools (e.g. Tableau  Qlik Sense  R  Python  Alteryx  COGNOS analytics) and a demonstrated ability to apply expertise to new tools Fundamental SQL query and data management experience Understanding of Data Science principles and applications sufficient to work effectively on projects incorporating machine learning elements Experience in different phases of the data project lifecycle from strategy and advisory  scoping and planning  requirements gathering  design  development  testing  training and deployment Preferred Experience leading analytics projects or working independently to deliver analytics products Demonstrated ability to add value through mentoring or technical leadership Experience in a Quality Assured or Regulated environment Medical device experience  particularly with flow generator  oxygen or ventilator products Joining us is more than saying “yes” to making the world a healthier place. It’s discovering a career that’s challenging  supportive and inspiring. Where a culture driven by excellence helps you not only meet your goals  but also create new ones. We focus on creating a diverse and inclusive culture  encouraging individual expression in the workplace and thrive on the innovative ideas this generates. If this sounds like the workplace for you  apply now!

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Requirements: Posted by Jason Crooks Talent Acquisition Partner IT - Recruitment across Dynamics CRM / CE / F&O  Full Stack Development (.NET / React / Angular)  Azure  Project Management  Product Ownership  Agile & Scrum  Data  Cyber Send InMail At RAC we are focusing on Data and Analytics to help better serve our members  and have an exciting position for someone who is wanting to become a data analytics professional. You will be working with the team to deliver real value and enable a better  personalised member experience.  Reporting to the Analytics Manager  this position is a permanent  full-time opportunity.  What's in it for you?   Working in an environment that is embracing a continuous improvement culture using experimentation to support learning Time dedicated to your personal development time with access to training  development  and certification programs to ensure you can upskill Being part of empowered  cross-functional agile delivery teams that works with the business to build systems that solve problems Complete flexibility to choose between working from the home or office with flexible hours for a better work life balance Building digital systems that will shape the future for the RAC and a better WA Gain RAC Staff Benefits including free Roadside Assistance and 25% discount on your Insurances  Social Club and access Fitness Passport for cheaper gym memberships What will you be doing?   You will be using SQL to query and extract data from database  then manipulate and create reports in Power BI before presenting to stakeholders Ensuring accuracy  consistency and timeliness of data  to identify system improvement opportunities Performing adhoc analysis on data and information to identify patterns  trends and issues that could highlighted Helping coach or mentor junior data analysts within the team Lead engagements with stakeholders in the business to ensure decisions are backed by data What are we looking for?   You will ideally have experience with SQL  R  SAS  Excel  Business Intelligence reporting and visualisation tools You will be a keen problem solver with a passion for data and analytics to drive better services and improved performances for our members Tertiary qualifications in a quantitative field such as  Science  Statistics  or in Business  Commerce  or Marketing discipline are mandatory Please note: We encourage you to apply as soon as possible  as RAC reserves the right to close this vacancy without notice. For any questions about the role please contact Jason Crooks on 08 9436 4486.   To help ensure the health  safety and wellbeing of our people and members  RAC require employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Confirmation of your vaccination (and/or medical exemption) details will be required during the recruitment process.

Title: Business/Data Analyst
Requirements: At EY  you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are  with the global scale  support  inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better  too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself  and a better working world for all.  The opportunity  EY DnA is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific  with over 500 specialist employees working across multiple industry sectors.  As a Business/Data Analyst  you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives. Some of your responsibilities will include: Be a part of one of our successful delivery teams and get an opportunity to move into a more consultative role working across various data environments and helping our clients solve their business problems with data. Be responsible for creating requirement specifications  analysing requirements  creating visual models  facilitating elicitation sessions  and digging around in the data when needed. Designing and building reports – capture data requirements for the client and team. Creating requirements specifications  analysing requirements  creating visual models  facilitating workshop sessions  and using the necessary business analyst tools.  To qualify for the role  you must have Worked in a similar Business/Data Analyst position for at least 3-5 years with a focus on data management  data governance and data strategy Ability to understand and identify business rules and processes Conducted process mapping and requirements gathering workshops with non-technical stakeholders Working with SQL databases and database querying languages. Have knowledge and experience of all phases of software development including requirements analysis  design  coding  testing  defect management. Due to the nature of the client base  you MUST BE an Australian Citizen  Ideally  you’ll also have Experience in engaging with both technical and non-technical stakeholders Strong consulting experience and background  including engaging directly with clients Experience in a delivery role on Business Intelligence  Data Warehousing  Big Data or analytics projects Ability to problem-solve and think critically Technical reconciliation and reporting skills Some development experience would be advantageous but not essential  What We Offer Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility  so you can make a meaningful impact  your way. Continuous learning: personalised career development including coaching  experiences and formal learning so you’ll develop the mindset and skills you’ll need to thrive in the future. Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.  At EY  you’ll be rewarded and recognised based on your performance and our comprehensive benefits package can be tailored to your individual needs.  We hold a collective commitment to foster an environment where all differences are valued and respected  practices are equitable  and everyone experiences a sense of belonging. If you require any adjustments to the recruitment process in order to equitably participate  we encourage you to advise us at the time of application via contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or phone +61 3 8650 7788 (option 4).  We understand the importance of social distancing at this time so our recruitment and onboarding process may be managed virtually so we can continue to prioritise the safety and wellbeing of EY people  clients  guests and the broader public.  The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.  EY | Building a better working world  EY exists to build a better working world  helping to create long-term value for clients  people and society and build trust in the capital markets.  Enabled by data and technology  diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow  transform and operate.  Working across assurance  consulting  law  strategy  tax and transactions  EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: Are you a motivated Data Analyst looking to make your mark? This is your chance to join an international  high growth  tech start-up that has just been through a series B funding and is partnering with some of the most well respected organisations around the world!  Ideally looking for a strong Data Analyst who has the ability and communication skills to work closely with a wide variety of stakeholders  delivering data insights to boost company strategies.  What We Need From You Extensive experience using SQL and/or SQL Development Strong experience in BigQuery Data Visualisation using Tableau Stakeholder management experience What's in it for you? Fantastic remuneration packages Play an integral role in a very green field project and help build out the data functions Career growth and room for extension This is a great opportunity to take your career to the next level and make an impact within the business and industry! Apply now!

Title: Data Analyst (Energy Analyst)
Requirements: Posted by Chiara Amato Polito Talent Acquisition Specialist | HR | Human Resources Send InMail Our client is a leading Australian electricity retailer. They are transforming the way Australian businesses buy their electricity. They have set out to find new and better ways to bring their customers' energy costs down and put the power back into businesses' hands.  We are seeking a dynamic Data Analyst who will report to the Wholesale Markets & Pricing Lead.  Responsibilities of this role include  but are not limited to:  Managing of incoming analysis queries  Extracting data from different sources  Being in regular contact with BDM’s and Sales staff  Analysing and interpreting large datasets to identify key metrics and support customer Proposals  Supporting in providing the right solutions to the customers through analysis of their historical consumption patterns  Discussing wholesale market issues with both internal stakeholders and Clients when required  Being up to date with changes in the energy market including price movements  supply/demand fundamentals  regulations (ASX and AEMO)  Developing actionable insights  reports and proposals to communicate to stakeholders in a precise and compelling manner  Providing accurate data and liaising effectively with external or internal stakeholders (i.e. Business Development Managers  Sales staff  Operations team  Finance team) as required  Leveraging of information provided by internal stakeholders to develop new reports and tools  Working with the team on continuous improvement process and reporting outputs.  You are the perfect fit  if you have:  Experience in the energy sector  Background in energy consulting (not required  but desirable)  Previous experience with C & I energy users is preferable  Advanced Microsoft Excel Skills  SQL knowledge is highly regarded  Strong communication and liaison skills  Learning attitude  Collaborative approach and experience in working efficiently within a team  Strong problem-solving  analysing  planning and time management skills.  Benefits within the company:  Competitive salary  End of the month drinks and birthdays celebration  Employment assistance package.  If you are keen to join a growing business where you can really make a difference  learn  and progress  this role is for you. We are looking for individuals who are energetic and positive. Sounds like you are the perfect match? If you're interested  please hit “APPLY”  If this opportunity sounds of interest and matches your profile  we’d love to hear from you.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Requirements: MLC Life Insurance. We have been protecting Australians for over 130 years. We respect the role we play in providing peace of mind for our customers  and we never lose sight of it.  Our Purpose  MLC Life Insurance is one of Australia’s leading life insurance specialists and a member of the Nippon Life Insurance Group  one of the world’s leading insurers. We are guided by our simple purpose: ‘A Promise for Life’. We provide almost 1.2 million Australians with reassurance that they and their loved ones will be supported when they need it most. It’s a promise that provides peace of mind and helps them sleep at night.  Our purpose is supported by Our Values of Do What’s Right  Deliver Together  Make it Simple  Own it and Aim High. It’s how we work together and behave every day in every interaction with our customers  partners and each other that defines who we are.  Our Strategy  Our strategy puts our customers at the centre of our ambition to be Australia’s leading and most trusted life insurer. It is through the commitment  energy and talent of everyone at MLC Life Insurance  working together  that we make a positive contribution to the lives of our customers. To support all of us to be at their best every day  we offer a flexible work environment centred on development  wellbeing  recognition and contribution.  With more than 1500 people nationally  we believe our success is built on the unique contribution of our people. Diversity and Inclusion is core to what we believe in and who we are. We aspire for everyone at MLC Life Insurance to feel valued and respected for who they are.  The Role  Reporting to the Manager  Business Insights & Analytics  the Senior Data Analyst will work with internal business stakeholders to provide data driven insights through the delivery of reporting and analytics.  This role will see you working holistically across the life cycle of development  from understanding the business problem/opportunity  gathering requirements  analysis  design and delivery of self-service data sets  impactful data visualisations and analytics.  You will support colleagues within the Data & Analytics team by providing technical guidance and supporting business stakeholders with uplifting their data literacy and their adoption of solutions to enable them to make decisions to improve their business function.  Due to an ongoing significant transformation at MLCL  this role will see you in a transition period to strengthen our Data Capabilities and build our data platform target state. This transition requires the integration of different teams. Your skills to navigate the new environment  coordinate  plan  prioritise  and resolve contention are fundamental to team success.  About You  You are a seasoned Data Analyst with a minimum of 3 years’ experience in data visualisation and analytics.  You are highly proficient with Power BI  within an enterprise environment and possess significant experience in SQL. Experienced in tabular modelling using Power BI and/or SSAS  Experience with R and/or Python in Advanced Analytics would be an advantage.  Lastly  your strong understanding of working with Database Structures and Data Warehouses coupled with your demonstrated experience of working within a team responsible for designing  building and supporting Business Intelligent capabilities will see you succeed in this role.  Why Choose Us?  At MLC Life Insurance  you will have the opportunity to:  • work with a WGEA cited Employer of Choice for Gender Equality  • enjoy flexible work options and an inclusive environment where everyone is respected and valued for who they are and their unique contribution  • embrace a culture of customer centricity and an ambition to be Australia’s leading  most trusted Life Insurer  • access a range of benefits including competitive salary  lifestyle leave  two days volunteer leave every year  recognition of service milestones  and  • Wellness and lifestyle offerings including access to Uprise – our Digital Wellbeing Program  as well as discounts on a variety of lifestyle and entertainment products and services.  Should an applicant be the preferred candidate  background checks (including Federal Police Checks  Employment checks  ASIC banned and disqualified persons and Bankruptcy checks) will be completed prior to the candidate's employment being confirmed. The outcomes of the background checks do not automatically bar candidates  however they will be assessed against the inherent requirements of the position

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Requirements: Posted by Simona Flavio Global Talent Partner Send InMail What we do:  Kognitiv enables leading organizations to form collaborative commerce networks  unearth value for their consumers  and markedly improve returns.  Founded in 2008  Kognitiv enables collaborative commerce through its proprietary technology platform and performance model for leading global brands to build their own peer-to-peer trading networks. In June 2020  Kognitiv and Aimia’s Loyalty Solutions companies came together to create a technology-forward business  employing over 500 people across 20 countries worldwide. With 200+ clients and partners in more than 50 markets globally  Kognitiv brings to life a world where brands work together to create new opportunities for less  gain direct access to new audiences  and create network effects where everyone wins  all the time.  About the Opportunity  As the Senior Insights Analyst you are responsible for providing high-quality in-depth analysis and recommendations and data visualization  as well as presenting analytical insights to other team members and Kognitiv clients.  In this key role you are also responsible for building predictive models and customer segmentations  being a steward of data and analytics across the team and organization as well as mentoring and providing support to the more junior members of the team  Areas of key responsibilities:  Gather business requirements and then translate into analytics objectives and analysis plan that you and the team can begin working towards Analyze complex business issues and effectively communicate meaningful insights based on data trends / patterns found in data Build clean  concise and digestible visualizations and dashboards for the team and/or client to use and gain insight from Conduct in-depth analysis and post-campaign analysis to evaluate ESPs performance & ROI  and provide recommendations for improvement Deliver insights and recommendations via summary or presentations (slides)  to internal teams in a client-ready state Build machine learning models such as clustering for member segmentation and predictive models to uncover opportunities for maximizing customer wallet share (e.g. upsell/cross-sell/retention) Develop and implement new analytical methodologies and techniques for clients Continue to develop and build-out the best practices for analytics Contribute to the evolution and internal innovation of our Analytics and Data Science capabilities  toolsets and knowledge-base  Who are you  To be successful in this role you must be comfortable working with large amounts of data and be able to work with tight deadlines. You love a challenge and enjoy learning through experimentation. In addition  you possess the following:  Bachelor’s degree in Business  Analytics  Computer Science  Management Information Systems  Statistics or related field Fluency in SQL Experience with at least one core statistical programming language (e.g. R  Python) Comprehension of data visualization best practices Experience with data visualization tools (e.g. Tableau  PowerBI  Domo  Looker) Strong Microsoft Suite skills  especially with Excel and PowerPoint  Ideal experience  Ideally 3-5 years of relevant analytical experience Prior experience building predictive modelling and member segmentation models Experience and understanding of A/B and multivariate testing best practices and application Experience with AWS technology stack including Redshift Experience with version control and code hosting services (e.g. Bitbucket  Github) Comfortable synthesizing and presenting technical concepts and insights  We are a passionate  innovative organization with just over 500 team members globally and we are looking for exceptional people to come and join us. This is an exciting opportunity to work for an international business  in a high energy environment with a collaborative  smart and passionate team. If you like the sound of us and the role: get in touch!  Here at Kognitiv  we don’t just accept difference - we celebrate it! Greater diversity means greater variation in ways of thinking  perspectives and approach. And we thrive on it for the benefit of our employees and our clients. Kognitiv are committed to creating an inclusive environment and all employment is decided on the basis of qualifications  merit  fit and business need.  We always welcome international candidates to apply providing they are eligible to work and live in Australia.

Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: Bet Technology provides state of the art technology unrivalled in terms of speed and scalability for the betting industry in Australia and overseas. We are seeking a Data Analyst who will be working directly with our Research and Development Team to achieve key company objectives  as part of a small and quickly growing team. This is a multi-disciplinary role  best summarized as 50% data analytics & visualisation and 50% Dynamic 365 CRM specialist. You will be an ambitious and passionate individual who wants to develop within a role  while being accountable for key components of a fast growth business that continues to break ground in an exciting industry. You will be working closely with the Sales and Marketing department in creating dashboards  KPIs  automations and integrations.   The Candidate You should have a degree or similar higher education qualification in a relevant subject: Data Analysis  Data Science  Data Engineering  Information Systems  Economics  Maths or similar. You should have a natural ability and passion to work with data analyses – you should want to explore the meaning behind the numbers and how data can be used to understand and shape the development of populations. You have strong written and verbal communication skills. You are detail oriented and organized with the ability to develop new and improved processes.   Candidate Requirements At least three years of relevant experience. Strong SQL experience  including ability to develop complex queries. At least two years’ experience using PowerBI. Understanding of transfer and loading (ETL) processes is advantageous Experience with one or more programming languages such as C#  Python and R is advantageous. Experience of working with Dynamic 365 CRM is required. Competency in Microsoft Office applications. Experience with Marketing platforms such as Salesforce Marketing Cloud will be advantageous.   The role will require the following: Ability to present data models  methodology and insights to stakeholders in a professional format. Ability to process and analyse large datasets. Ability to explain analysis (sometimes that is advanced) in a simple and logical way. Ability to interpret numbers and proactively identify and explore new and relevant hypothesis for further testing. Ability to undertake adhoc analysis and scenario testing. Attention to detail and commitment to quality assurance. Strong desire to learn and thrive in a fast-moving dynamic environment.   The Perks Paid Parental Leave Birthday Leave Bonus scheme Premium Udemy licenses and Learning budget

Title: Graduate Quantitative Researcher – 2023
Requirements: Do you have a passion for modelling and/or data-driven statistical problem solving? Do you want to make a tangible impact right from the start?  Get ready to collaborate with world-class Traders and Software Engineers to improve financial markets in 50+ countries across the globe. This is your chance to demonstrate how valuable research and data is to the future of electronic trading.  Ready to test your limits? Join Optiver and accelerate your growth in a truly fascinating  high-performance environment.  Who We Are  Optiver is a tech-driven trading firm and leading global market maker. For over 35 years  Optiver has been improving financial markets around the world  making them more transparent and efficient for all participants. With a focus on cutting-edge engineering  data science and research  we actively trade on 50+ exchanges  where we’re trusted to always provide accurate buy and sell pricing – no matter the market conditions.  Optiver’s Sydney office is one of the primary players within Asian markets  trading a range of products. As an active participant on the Hong Kong  Korea  Singapore  Taiwan  and Japan exchanges  we act as Optiver’s APAC head office.  What You'll Do  As our Graduate Quantitative Researcher  you’ll be constantly applying your top-tier analytical abilities to your day-to-day  creating insights and proposals that drive impactful new trading strategies.  Over the first 8 weeks  you will be immersed in our highly interactive training course  alongside Traders and Software Developers  to learn the ins and outs of quantitative trading. Once you’ve got the basics covered  you’ll join one of our Research teams  where you’ll be able to put your knowledge into practice and be given the autonomy to make decisions that create an immediate impact.  Every day will present you with new and interesting challenges to solve. And it’s up to you and your team to drive our success by ensuring that our quantitative models remain at the cutting-edge of constantly evolving capital markets.  Who You Are  You’re an inquisitive  critical thinker who is creative in innovating new solutions. When you are told that something “just is”  you immediately start to take it apart to understand the “why”. You’re a strong believer in the power of collaborative problem solving. And you're excited to test yourself in one of the most competitive areas of the financial market. In addition  you:  Are pragmatic and focused on outcomes Can communicate technical concepts well Enjoy utilising technology  programming or maths in your daily life to solve problems Possess programming experience in any language (C  C++  Python  Basic  JAVA  etc.)  While our Researchers all share a passion for creative quantitative problem solving  they work in three main areas with different focuses. In the application  you can select the role that appeals to you the most  and through the recruitment process we will work together to ensure you find the area most suitable for you.  Performance and Strategy Researchers  Whether you join as a Graduate Strategy or Performance Researcher  you’ll be developing and testing hypotheses experimentally  under real-world conditions and constraints  to drive improvements in our trading systems.  As a Strategy Researcher  you’ll be leveraging our understanding of execution success and pricing to design and improve automated trading strategies. The scope of projects you’ll work on is broad  ranging from optimising strategy parameters  to examining market data and finding new hidden market opportunities  to developing new strategies that capture these opportunities.  As a Performance Researcher  you’ll be using data science  reverse engineering  and computing fundamentals to improve the success of our trading systems. You could be building tools to optimise our low-latency strategies  utilising custom built FPGA hardware  or analysing terabytes of systems and network capture data to process and discover hidden patterns.  D1 Research  As a D1 Researcher  you’ll collaborate with traders and developers on live trading strategies using cutting-edge statistical and machine learning algorithms. You’ll work on building trading signals from market or fundamental data  combine signals and optimise strategy parameters through our state-of-the-art back testing infrastructure. Whilst the research uses a mix of statistics  computer science and economics  there are no textbook solutions to what you aim to solve. Instead  you’ll move beyond the theory to search for the hidden signals in the noise that’ll help you create profitable strategies. And that’s what makes it deeply rewarding.  Options Pricing Research  As an Options Pricing Researcher  you’ll be responsible for the creation and improvement of our underlying pricing models  as well as increasing our statistical understanding of the underlying dynamics that impact the market. You’ll also work with Traders to create and improve volatility surfaces  yield curves  and other quantitative elements of our automated trading systems. You’ll find creative solutions to problems  test those solutions with historical parameters and market data  and then drive these changes in our trading system to improve our ability to make successful trades.  What You'll Get  Up to AUD $250 000 first year salary package The chance to work alongside diverse and intelligent peers in a rewarding environment Training  mentorship and personal development opportunities Gym membership plus weekly in-house chair massages Daily breakfast  lunch and an in-house barista Regular social events including an annual company trip Work-from-home allowance and support Guided relocation and a competitive relocation package where necessary.  As an intentionally flat organisation  we believe that great ideas and impact can come from everyone. We are passionate about empowering individuals and creating diverse teams that thrive. Every person at Optiver should feel included  valued and respected  because we believe our best work is done together.  Our commitment to diversity and inclusion is hardwired through every stage of our hiring process. We encourage applications from candidates from any and all backgrounds  and we welcome requests for reasonable adjustments during the process to ensure that you can best demonstrate your abilities.  ELIGIBILITY  A final-year/Honours/Masters/PhD student or a recent graduate (up to 4 years) Studying a highly quantitative or technically focused degree  such as Maths  Statistics  Physics  Elec / Mechatronic / Software Engineering  Computer Science  Applied/Quantitative Finance or Econometrics. An Australian or New Zealand Citizen  Australian Permanent Resident or able to secure full working rights after graduating.  Does this sound like the future you’re looking for? Take up the challenge and apply today!  If you have any questions regarding this opportunity  please contact us at

Title: Senior Data Analyst - APAC Publishing Insights and Analytics
Requirements: Job Title  Senior Data Analyst - APAC Publishing Insights and Analytics  Requisition ID  R013549  Job Description  The Role  We are looking for a hard-working and experienced Data Analyst to develop an intimate knowledge on how consumers are purchasing  playing  and interacting with video games across Asia. To do this you will be extracting  interpreting  and analysing internal and external data with the expectation of delivering insights to assist in the formulation of best in class strategies and executions.  Key Responsibilities  Form a deep understanding of the players Activision Blizzard already knows and the players Activision Blizzard is yet to meet to drive greater commercial outcomes by: Identifying  analysing  and interpreting trends within internal data sets covering sales and telemetry data to offer clarity on how to accelerate the acquisition  engagement and/or monetisation of players. Evaluate the Asia video games market landscape. Research and analyse market characteristics  competitive landscape  emerging issues  market trends and publishing models. Acquire data from primary or secondary data sources and publish reports that offer player  market and competitor insights that can leveraged for strategy formulation. Developing models that offer long range market size assumptions and forecasting  as well as determining the Lifetime Value (LTV) of players. Develop proficiency to assist publishing teams in articulating problems they are trying to address and presenting insights and analytic solutions to offer answers and recommendations. Measure the performance of campaigns and provide insight on efficiency. Locate and define new process improvement opportunities. The Ideal Candidate Will Have Extensive experience in analytics or closely related fields Expertise in SQL Proficiency with programming languages (R  SAS  Python) Proficiency with data analytics and data visualization tools  such as Tableau Understanding of cloud platforms  such as Azure  IBM  and Google A strong intuition for crafting raw data and analysis into well-written and persuasive content The ability to prioritise time wisely against multiple competing projects and requests Experience translating insights into decisions and actions that have a direct business impact Solid sense of accountability  self-drive  and the ability to function independently Strong communication skills  as well as written and verbal presentation skills. A love for video games. Preferable – 1+ year experience in an analytical role within FMCG in a consumer-focused category  video game knowledge preferred. The job title may vary depending on the candidate’s experience and expertise. R013549

Title: Data Analyst - Business Owners
Requirements: About The Role Help shape the future of how we use data to deliver powerful insights Collaborate with talented teams of data scientists  engineers and analysts Join a progressive organisation with the people and policies you want  At ANZ our purpose is to shape a world where people and communities thrive and to achieve this  we need a talented Data Analyst to join our Business Owners Engagement Tribe. The Business Owners Engagement Tribe mission is to deepen business owner engagement by designing propositions and campaigns to address key customer needs and drive momentum while positioning ANZ as the bank of choice for business owners. The Business Owners Engagement Tribe are looking for this Data Analyst for our Business Insights squad.  Our data analysts deeply understand the power of data to generate quality customer insights  manage information and identify trends to accelerate sound business decisions.  Your skillset will enable you to source and interrogate data  working with a focus on the future  with an active understanding of industry trends to ensure capability development is aligned. You will influence strategic direction by translating insights into practical business recommendations  communicating team objectives and presenting data in digestible  logical and compelling ways.  What Will Your Day Look Like Source data from a variety of sources Analyse  understand  manipulate and validate the data Clearly communicate and present updates to technical and non-technological stakeholders Assist with forensic reports and dashboards Actively participate in Daily Standups  Sprint Planning  Showcases and Retrospective ceremonies Conduct ad hoc data analysis as required by the squad Further develop your Data skills through guided training/growth plans  What will you bring?  We know not everyone will bring all of the skills and experience  and at ANZ we are focused on people bringing a growth mindset to their approach to work. Some of the skills we are looking for are below  but don’t worry if you don’t have all of these as learning on the job is the way we work.  But back to some of the skills – Excellent communication and presentation skills Visualise data using tools such as (e.g. Qliksense  Power BI  Tableau). Experience using SQL (Teradata  Oracle or SQL Server) and scripting languages preferable (Python  R  PySpark) Knowledge and experience in sourcing data  joining and deriving insights from disparate data sources. Knowledge on Big data and cloud platforms experiences (on Spark  Hive  Impala  BigQuery  etc.) are desirable. Demonstrable experience with modern data analysis tools like Jupyter Notebook  Data Science Workbench  Zeppelin etc. Demonstrable knowledge about Data Warehousing  DataMart and Data modelling techniques for BI. Curious and analytical mindset. Analytical and problem-solving skills to understand the complexity of our data Ability to effectively communicate to all stakeholders (technical and non-technical)  You’re not expected to have 100% of these skills. At ANZ a growth mindset is at the heart of our culture and we actively encourage people to try new things. So if this role interests you and you feel you have most of these things in your toolbox  we’d love to hear from you.  So  why join us?  We’re reinventing the way we do banking  and our community of collaborative  innovative thinkers who create human-centred solutions are helping us get there. We’re responding faster to changing customer requirements  focusing on the things that matter.  We’ll also offer you the opportunity to develop your career  working in a diverse and inclusive workplace where the different backgrounds  perspectives and life experiences of our people are celebrated and create a great place to grow  thrive and belong.  A happy workplace is a thriving one  and some of the perks you’ll get from being at ANZ are: Lifestyle leave - top up your annual leave with up to four weeks of additional purchased leave or take a longer period of unpaid time off Great discounts on our financial products  and an annual Superannuation top up payment of $500 for all female employees to address the Superannuation gender gap Competitive parental leave policies for both mums and dads  with a lump sum childcare contribution when you return to work  We work flexibly at ANZ and encourage you to talk to us about how this role can be flexible for you and any adjustments you may require to our recruitment process or the role itself. If you are a candidate with a disability  let us know how we can provide you with additional support.  Interested in joining us?  Click Apply Now  or visit www.anz.com/careers to find out more or view other opportunities.  This role is required to work from an ANZ workplace. Under the Victorian Government’s COVID-19 Mandatory Vaccination (Workers) Directions  the successful candidate will need to provide evidence that they have received two doses of an approved COVID-19 vaccine  or have a medical exemption evidenced by an authorised medical practitioner  in order to be appointed to the role. Please Note: After your initial application you may be asked to complete an online assessment  this invite will be sent to you via email from our assessment partner SHL. Please action this request as early as possible  this will enable us to manage your application and provide you with an update in a timely manner.  Job Posting End Date  27/04/2022

Title: Campaign Data Analyst - 12 months fixed term contract
Requirements: It’s a fun and exciting time to join ING. We have recently been named the ‘World’s Best Bank for 2021’ and due to continuous growth we are looking a number of Campaign Data Analysts to join our high performance team for a 12 months fixed term contract.  You’ll be responsible for campaign data management and campaign delivery  as well as executing customer campaign and campaign building skills  completing each campaign with a post analysis report to gauge the success of each campaign using your strong SQL skills.  In collaboration with key stakeholders  you’ll design  build  implement and manage data that delivers personalised customer communications across all channels  outbound and inbound. This is the perfect role for you if you enjoy working in a fast paced environment  are highly analytical  and are natural a lateral thinker who thrives using their problem solving and interpretive skills!  We are looking for someone who is self-motivated and curious  with a positive  can-do attitude and entrepreneurial spirit! If this is you  then apply today!  What are you going to do? You will be… Identifying any areas for improvement in campaign delivery such as quality  speed  response rates and automation Challenging the way we use or source data to ensure campaigns are designed to leverage suite of data assets (i.e. customer segmentation  propensity models) Consulting with key stakeholders on the best way to design and deliver campaign activity Building and implementing robust campaigns to agreed deadlines Carefully testing your own and peer’s work with strict adherence to agreed campaign quality processes Embedding robust test and learn methodologies into campaigns by leveraging data-driven insights and past learnings What are we looking for? Someone who has… Strong SQL skills and good understanding of relational database structure Experience in customer campaign execution  including campaign planning and sizing  list extraction  and campaign attribution reporting methodologies Experience with Unica Campaign Suite (not essential but desirable) or a similar campaign program would be highly advantageous Great communication skills and the ability to influence stakeholders to optimise outcomes The ability to understand and pick up technologies quickly and efficiently Efficient project planning skills and execution for deliverables About Us  At ING  we want to make life simpler and more worthwhile – for everyone who banks with us  for the people who work with us  and the community at large  too.  When you come to work at ING  you’re joining a team where individuality isn’t just accepted  it’s encouraged. We’ve built a culture that’s fun  friendly and supportive – it’s the kind of place where you can be yourself and make the most of whatever you have to offer.  We give people the freedom to take risks  think differently  take ownership of their work  and make great things happen. We’re here to help you get ahead. And with our global network  there’s plenty of scope to take your career in new directions  perhaps even ones you’ve never considered.  People of all ages  sexual orientations  cultures and backgrounds are welcome to apply – likewise if you’re an indigenous Australian  or you’re living with a disability  or you have family or caring responsibilities.  Sound like the kind of place you’d feel at home? We’d love to hear from you.  (One last thing  ING operates a direct talent sourcing model. So no agency introductions  please.)  For more information please contact Skye Griffiths on skye.griffiths@ing.com.au

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Requirements: Description  Abous us  Norton Rose Fulbright is a global law firm. We provide the world's pre-eminent corporations and financial institutions with a full business law service. We have more than 3 700 lawyers and other legal staff based in Europe  the United States  Canada  Latin America  Asia  Australia  the Middle East and Africa.  The role  Increased client demand for digital engagement with our people and services has created an opportunity for a Marketing Data Analyst to join the Digital  Communications & Experience (DCE) team. This is a unique opportunity to join a Marketing and Business Development (MBD) team with an ambitious MarTech strategy and existing investment in marketing automation (Oracle's Eloqua) and other systems  with significant development opportunities available.  The key responsibilities and requirements are:  Responsibilities Support the core functions of the DCE team  with an emphasis on CRM (InterAction)  other digital marketing platforms and channels  and data analytics  flows and management to optimise digital marketing activity and client experience. Focus on data management and data flows across systems  including supporting data maintenance  reporting and user training through day-to-day work in InterAction. Work on optimising integrations between the CRM and other systems  such as marketing automation platform Eloqua and leading webinar tools and events applications. Use Eloqua to help derive insights and reports on client engagement. Focus on Australia but working closely with the Global Digital team on CRM best practice. Requirements Knowledge of  and comfort using  CRM (InterAction or other systems  such as Salesforce)  marketing automation or e-marketing tools  and business intelligence and client feedback / surveying programs. Familiarity with Lexis Nexis' InterAction  Oracle's Eloqua  Qualtrics  Cvent  On24  Zoom and Microsoft Teams will be viewed favourably Experience with analytics tools (ranging from Excel  Qualtrics  system native reporting  SSRS and BBi) and building reports that track and measure client activity Excellent attention to detail and good project management skills Effective communication  facilitation and presentation skills to varied groups of stakeholders Strong understanding of service offerings and value propositions Ability to explain complicated technical solutions to non-technical audiences The successful candidate will need to be an energetic  driven and focussed individual . At Norton Rose Fulbright Australia  you will be rewarded with genuine career prospects and an excellent team environment renowned for its collaborative culture  passion for client service and professional development opportunities. Remuneration will becommensurate with relevant experience.  Norton Rose Fulbright values diversity and strives to create an inclusive environment where all employees can bring their whole selves to work. We embrace the opportunity to contribute to the communities in which we work which underpins our strong Corporate Social Responsibility (CSR) program. We provide a range of opportunities in which our people can make a difference to their local and global communities including through pro bono legal work  charitable giving  volunteering and support for the environment.  We are proud that Norton Rose Fulbright in Australia has been recognised as an Employer of Choice for Gender Equality by the Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) as well as a silver employer for LGBTI Inclusion through the Australian Workplace Equality Index.  We encourage Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander candidates to apply.  To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. It is the policy of NRFA Group to provide workplace adjustments for qualified persons with disabilities who are employees or applicants for employment. If you need assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application/interview process  please contact Eleanor Guy  Talent Engagement Advisor on (02) 9330 8267  If you are trans or gender diverse and would like a confidential discussion before applying  please contact Eleanor Guy  Talent Engagement Advisor on (02) 9330 8267.  Note to recruitment agencies:  Please note that we are not accepting applications submitted by recruitment agencies for this position.

Title: Senior Data Analyst  Remediation Analytics
Requirements: A career that gives you more  Your career at NAB is about more than money  it's about serving our customers well and helping our communities prosper. We currently have an opportunity for a Senior Data Analyst  Remediation Analytics.  You are passionate about working with data and have an ability to continually improve our customers experience and outcomes by uplifting our remediation delivery.  Demonstrate your expertise with the cross functional team and value chain to ensure customers are remediated fairly  accurately and in a timely manner  and develop best in class Machine Learning methods to proactively detect remediation scenarios. Achieving these will inspire confidence that NAB is focused on getting it right for customers every time.   Key responsibilities  Sourcing of applicable data from various legacy and cloud data environments and systems to be used for remediation analytics Highlighting potential technology process and system changes to obtain data Obtaining data to identify impacted customers and required compensation Developing cutting-edge Machine Learning and Artificial Intelligence models for proactive analytics Ensuring technical analytics resources have the data  tools and context to effectively analyse event data Develop and maintain important documentation that describes the remediation event and the systems Coordinate analytical output of the team to socialise with event owners and business SMEs  maintain a strong relationship with these stakeholders Contribute to management of remediation events inclusive of resource management  timelines  deliverables and project management for remediation analytics  What you will bring  Experience working in a similar position with knowledge of core data principles such as Data Science (model development and production pipelines)  Engineering and Analysis. Knowledge of typical data sourcing / ETL requirement gathering  planning  risks  issues  and the presentation  communication and treatment Highly collaborative approach to facilitate a productive squad dynamic Strong problem-solving skills and a continuous improvement mindset and willingness to learn and share Knowledge of Machine Learning methods  especially Anomaly Detection and NLP is highly regarded Experience with cloud environments (AWS) and tools is preferred Awareness across banking products  regulatory and industry landscape preferred  Your new team  Remediation Analytics is an integral part of NAB’s Centre for Customer Remediation  comprising a team of talented and collaborative data scientists  data engineers and data analysts that are focussed on building our analytical capabilities together. Each portfolio/project team also consists of a diverse range of disciplined and enthusiastic professionals who are dedicated to provide great customer experiences and putting things right fast.    Applications close Sunday 3 April 2022    To help keep our community safe  candidates are required to comply with vaccine requirements outlined in state based public health orders.    NAB  invested in you  We are committed to gender equality and are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and have a diverse and inclusive workforce. We have committed $70bn in financing to help address climate change and provide 2 days of paid leave each year through our employee volunteering program to support community organisations.  We support our colleagues to be their best by offering a wide range of educational  financial  lifestyle  health & wellbeing benefits. For more information please visit here.  Join NAB  If you think this role is the right fit for you  we invite you to apply. Let’s explore who you are and what drives you. We’d love to share our vision for the future of banking.  To be eligible to apply  you must have Australian or New Zealand citizenship or permanent residency status. Please note candidate screening and interviews may be conducted prior to the closing date of the job advert.  *Please note unsolicited CVs from agencies will not be accepted.

Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: Position Title: Data Analyst  Position Type: Regular - Full-Time  Position Location: Ballarat  Requisition ID: 15825  Dynamic individual who loves people  built to lead  has a curious mind and passion to help shape one of the world's leading FMCG businesses. To do this we will leverage your ability to define business requirement and design a data architecture to support these requirements.  Your experience with analytics will get you a ticket to be part of the newly formed APACSA Region a Data & Analytics Centre of Excellence (COE) to lead the Data and Analytics transformation within the ANZ business.  You will play a critical role in working with business stakeholders to gather  analyse  communicate  and validate analytics and data requirements for changes to and the implementation of analytics solutions on medium to high levels of complexity. Where required build prototypes & proof of concepts.  Naturally your ability to deliver is highly prized where you will leverage your courage to liaison between the Business & IT and drive change management accountabilities.  The ideal candidate is a Purple Person - “Business people  the actuaries  know what data they need and can define requirements  but typically don’t have the skill set to design a data architecture that gives them the data they need. Technology people typically don’t understand the business requirements  but they can design the data architectures. IT people speak blue  the business people speak red  but we need people who speak purple in order to create an appropriate solution.  About The Role  Business Partnering Develops and maintains relationships with a focus on Regional & Global Technology CoE’s and ANZ business partners including senior leaders. Identify and explore opportunities to realize value through data-based insights and related technology. Analytics – (POC) Responsible for Design of APACSA/ANZ data models  including enrichment through third party sources. Work with technology partners to design systems to support data model design and needed data pipelines to support analytics Work with colleagues in Global CoE and in APACSA business teams to understand business questions to solve with data  including: Prioritizing key dashboards and analysis that are essential to running the business today Building BI Proof of Concepts to validate the movement of data to insight to action. Expanding on data sources (including 1st party data opportunities and new 3rd party data sources) to uncover new ways of looking at the business and finding new opportunities Build a backlog of data sciences use cases / advanced analytics projects to work to drive value for business stakeholders Continue to modernize data reporting / dashboards to improve adoption and usage Identify data governance and/or data quality clean-up activities and connect Data Governance team to drive the activity. Service & Value Management Ensure the efficient delivery of Technology services to the businesses served within agreed SLAs and financial targets. About You  As you can see  we are hoping to find someone that has a nice blend of technical and stakeholder management experience. In addition  we’re also hoping that you may have some of the following skills and experience: Some experience working with BI and data visualization tools (e.g. Power BI  Microstrategy  Qlik  Tableau) Track record of working closely with stakeholders to understand their needs and deliver a solution that meets these needs Ideally experience in BA type work including developing business cases and some exposure to project management including familiarity with Waterfall and Agile methodologies Proven experience working with an Outsource partner would be a bonus Experience in advising key stakeholders on decisions made that had a measurable impact on the profitability or effectiveness of the organisation. This may include  but limited to  the use of data and analytics to reduce waste  increased business performance  improved work force utilisation or improved quality. Demonstrated experience in identification of opportunities and manage business change to realise opportunity. If you do not tick every box  that’s okay – we would love to hear from you even if you have some of the skills/experience we are seeking!  Talk to us about working flexibly – we are open to where and how you work  so please feel free to ask so we can discuss what flexibility looks like for you.  McCain Foods is an equal opportunity employer. We see value in ensuring we have a diverse  antiracist  inclusive  merit-based  and equitable workplace. As a global family-owned company we are proud to reflect the diverse communities around the world in which we live and work. We recognize that diversity drives our creativity  resilience  and success and makes our business stronger.  McCain is an accessible employer. If you require an accommodation throughout the recruitment process (including alternate formats of materials or accessible meeting rooms)  please let us know and we will work with you to meet your needs.  Your privacy is important to us. By submitting personal data or information to us  you agree this will be handled in accordance with the Global Privacy Policy  Job Family: Information Technology  Division: Global Technology  Department: IT ANZ  Location(s): AU - Australia : Victoria : Melbourne || AU - Australia : New South Wales : Gordon || AU - Australia : New South Wales : Lisarow || AU - Australia : New South Wales : Sidney || AU - Australia : Other : Reference job description || AU - Australia : Queensland : Brisbane || AU - Australia : Queensland : Morningside || AU - Australia : South Australia : Adelaide || AU - Australia : South Australia : Penola || AU - Australia : Tasmania : Hobart || AU - Australia : Tasmania : Smithton || AU - Australia : Victoria : Ballarat || AU - Australia : Western Australia : Perth  Company: McCain Foods (Aust) Pty.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Experimentation
Requirements: At Canva  our mission is to empower the world to design  and we’re looking for insightful data analysts who can help us make that happen.  Our product has grown enormously in the last few years. We now have 10s of millions of users generating enormous quantities of data every single day. To help us fuel our future growth  we need to better understand our data - this is where we need your help.  We're looking for self-motivated individuals who are curious about our product and our users  and who are excited to seek out valuable insights. We don’t want you to just be a resource that answers questions - we want you to act as a genuine data partner with your team and the broader business. We have a LOT of data and need people who can use their skills to help us make the most of it!  You’ll be coming into a diverse team of more than thirty people  who really do enjoy finding answers to the problems that our users have. We’re looking forward to continuing to grow our team and gaining a range of new perspectives and ideas on how we can achieve our goals and help more people.  The Team Canva’s experimentation team empowers everyone working at Canva to test their hypotheses and ideas via experimentation to make better  data-informed decisions. We are a central team who need to understand the data and decision challenges being faced by everyone across Canva  and democratise solutions to them in a way that helps everyone to be more impactful. Today we do this primarily through owning and improving Canva’s experimentation platform  it’s applications  and usage  at scale across all of Canva.  Role Responsibilities Work with the team to define success  metrics to measure it  and to set goals and priorities. Be the expert in causal inference  statistics  and research methods  helping to make sure the team is prioritising the right things and building them correctly. Champion experimentation and data-driven decision making  working to educate and upskill others outside your team on why and how to experiment. Find insights that help us understand how decisions are being made  how they’re affecting Canva’s customers  and drive initiatives to improve these at scale. Help to empower the entire team to better understand the problem space  leverage data  and move faster through education and self-service options such as dashboards Own projects  data models  and other artefacts  keeping them up-to-date and high quality in a hypergrowth environment  Required Skills & Experience Expertise in causal inference (statistics  research methods  etc). Background working on large-scale experimentation platforms is preferred. Strong competency with SQL  experience with data warehouses such as Snowflake  Redshift  or BigQuery is a plus! Experience wrangling and analysing data using Python or R Experience with optimising product funnels  running experiments  and building dashboards that effectively communicate results and outcomes PhD in a STEM area is preferred Experience working with large  distributed datasets is preferred. Strong communication skills - verbal and written - be able to break down complex topics into simple solutions and ideas  The Canva workspace is set up for you to do your best work and have a great time doing so  with breakout areas  little nooks  and quiet places to retreat.  If you're seeking professional growth and enjoy working on large  distributed  cloud-based applications that delight our millions of individual and business users alike - then apply now to be considered for the position!  If you require visa sponsorship  you must ensure you have at least two (2) years of post-University commercial experience as a Software Engineer and meet the mandatory sponsorship requirements laid out by the Department of Home Affairs.  We will not accept or review any CVs from external recruitment agencies.
