To help us fuel our future growth  we need to better understand our data - this is where we need your help.  We're looking for self-motivated individuals who are curious about our product and our users  and who are excited to seek out valuable insights. We don’t want you to just be a resource that answers questions - we want you to act as a genuine data partner with your team and the broader business. We have a LOT of data and need people who can use their skills to help us make the most of it!  You’ll be coming into a diverse team of more than thirty people  who really do enjoy finding answers to the problems that our users have. We’re looking forward to continuing to grow our team and gaining a range of new perspectives and ideas on how we can achieve our goals and help more people.  The Team Canva’s experimentation team empowers everyone working at Canva to test their hypotheses and ideas via experimentation to make better  data-informed decisions. We are a central team who need to understand the data and decision challenges being faced by everyone across Canva  and democratise solutions to them in a way that helps everyone to be more impactful. Today we do this primarily through owning and improving Canva’s experimentation platform  it’s applications  and usage  at scale across all of Canva.  Role Responsibilities Work with the team to define success  metrics to measure it  and to set goals and priorities. Be the expert in causal inference  statistics  and research methods  helping to make sure the team is prioritising the right things and building them correctly. Champion experimentation and data-driven decision making  working to educate and upskill others outside your team on why and how to experiment. Find insights that help us understand how decisions are being made  how they’re affecting Canva’s customers  and drive initiatives to improve these at scale. Help to empower the entire team to better understand the problem space  leverage data  and move faster through education and self-service options such as dashboards Own projects  data models  and other artefacts  keeping them up-to-date and high quality in a hypergrowth environment  Required Skills & Experience Expertise in causal inference (statistics  research methods  etc). Background working on large-scale experimentation platforms is preferred. Strong competency with SQL  experience with data warehouses such as Snowflake  Redshift  or BigQuery is a plus! Experience wrangling and analysing data using Python or R Experience with optimising product funnels  running experiments  and building dashboards that effectively communicate results and outcomes PhD in a STEM area is preferred Experience working with large  distributed datasets is preferred. Strong communication skills - verbal and written - be able to break down complex topics into simple solutions and ideas  The Canva workspace is set up for you to do your best work and have a great time doing so  with breakout areas  little nooks  and quiet places to retreat.  If you're seeking professional growth and enjoy working on large  distributed  cloud-based applications that delight our millions of individual and business users alike - then apply now to be considered for the position!  If you require visa sponsorship  you must ensure you have at least two (2) years of post-University commercial experience as a Software Engineer and meet the mandatory sponsorship requirements laid out by the Department of Home Affairs.  We will not accept or review any CVs from external recruitment agencies.

As a Business/Data Analyst  you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives. Be responsible for creating requirement specifications  analysing requirements  creating visual models  facilitating elicitation sessions  and digging around in the data when needed. Designing and building reports – capture data requirements for the client and team. Creating requirements specifications  analysing requirements  creating visual models  facilitating workshop sessions  and using the necessary business analyst tools.  To qualify for the role  you must have Worked in a similar Business/Data Analyst position for at least 3-5 years with a focus on data management  data governance and data strategy Ability to understand and identify business rules and processes Conducted process mapping and requirements gathering workshops with non-technical stakeholders Working with SQL databases and database querying languages. Have knowledge and experience of all phases of software development including requirements analysis  design  coding  testing  defect management. Due to the nature of the client base  you MUST BE an Australian Citizen  Ideally  you’ll also have Experience in engaging with both technical and non-technical stakeholders Strong consulting experience and background  including engaging directly with clients Experience in a delivery role on Business Intelligence  Data Warehousing  Big Data or analytics projects Ability to problem-solve and think critically Technical reconciliation and reporting skills Some development experience would be advantageous but not essential  What We Offer Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility  so you can make a meaningful impact  your way. Continuous learning: personalised career development including coaching  experiences and formal learning so you’ll develop the mindset and skills you’ll need to thrive in the future. Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.  At EY  you’ll be rewarded and recognised based on your performance and our comprehensive benefits package can be tailored to your individual needs.  We hold a collective commitment to foster an environment where all differences are valued and respected  practices are equitable  and everyone experiences a sense of belonging. If you require any adjustments to the recruitment process in order to equitably participate  we encourage you to advise us at the time of application via contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or phone +61 3 8650 7788 (option 4).  We understand the importance of social distancing at this time so our recruitment and onboarding process may be managed virtually so we can continue to prioritise the safety and wellbeing of EY people  clients  guests and the broader public.  The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.  EY | Building a better working world  EY exists to build a better working world  helping to create long-term value for clients  people and society and build trust in the capital markets.  Enabled by data and technology  diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow  transform and operate.  Working across assurance  consulting  law  strategy  tax and transactions  EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Title: Senior Analytics Specialist
Requirements: Job description:  About ahm Simple  easy and affordable. That’s our mission for health insurance.   We take a straightforward approach to creating positive experiences for our customers. So  our people are straightforward too. We are people who care about delivery  we like disruptive ideas and challenging what is considered ‘normal’. We work flexibly  and look after our health and wellbeing – it helps us be at our best. If you have passion for driving results  a strategic mindset  and a love of innovation  now is the time to join ahm.    The Opportunity  As a Senior Analytics specialist joining ahm  you will work within the Strategy and Analytics team and play a key role in driving performance outlook and insights.  Your previous analytical background will be called upon as you manage and coordinate analytics and insights activities  from sales through to retention to grow in-force book  across both PHI and diversified product portfolios.  This will be achieved through partnering with various teams to assist them in achieving business goals and initiatives.  Your impact?  Develop expertise and insights relating to ahm competitiveness across an array of dimensions which may impact ahm’s sales performance  growth and profitability Act as SME for ahm in applying advanced analytics techniques  systems and software (i.e. SAS  SQL  Python  R) to identify insights and develop fact-based and actionable recommendations Champion measurement and refinement of complex projects which require deep analytical rigour. Comfortably transition from insights to execution (where required) including implementation planning  knowledge transfer and outcome tracking Identify and assess critical performance issues and opportunities informed by robust qualitative and quantitative analyses Develop self-serve analytical capability through dashboards to measure key business performance metrics Support business stakeholders and multi-function project teams to transition from insights to execution (where required) Partner effectively with senior stakeholders in developing business cases and investment requests that align to Corporate Plan targets or long-term strategy realisation   Who are you?  Enough about us  let’s talk about you… you have an entrepreneurial spirit and aren’t afraid to roll your sleeves up when the time comes. You’re a little bit obsessive about understanding our customers and getting to know what makes them tick. You’re a self-starter and can manage competing stakeholders  time  and priorities effectively.  You have a proven track record in Analytics and are highly proficient in SAS  SQL  and Tableau / Power Bi. Exposure to Python and R desirable but not essential  You are analytical and your problem-solving ability is one of your strengths  you use relevant data to provide insight and drive performance.  You’re skilled at working collaboratively with others and actively contributing to the achievement of common work goals. You are innovative and you can effectively manage stakeholder relationships and influence at all levels.  You are a big picture thinker who can draw upon the market context to understand the impact on performance.  You have demonstrated oral and written communication skills which are evident in your ability to communicate technical information clearly.    Other skills?  Demonstrated expertise in using extremely large  complex data sets A strong self-starter that can work both autonomously and in a team environment  Degree qualified in Analytics  Data-Science  Engineering  Commerce  Econometrics/Economics  Information Management  Business Statistics or another business-related discipline

Requirements: This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more We currently have a requirement for a Data Analyst to assist in the migration of data from a legacy system to a new solution.  Amongst your responsibilities you will be required to: Deliver SQL analysis and SQL Server/Oracle skills and knowledge to support the Data Migration of the Legacy systems to the new Solution. Establish  maintain and manage Data Migration SQL Server/Oracle database schemas and environments utilising Visual Studio and build complex SQL  PL/SQL and Transact-SQL in order to support legacy data extraction and loading  data aggregation and dissemination. Create reports and presentations in order to support Data Profiling  Cleansing and Reconciliation. Support data migration reconciliation activities  issues and defect resolution  as well as data migration cutover  production verification testing and reconciliation activities To be successful in securing this role you will have: Degree in relevant discipline or equivalent skills  knowledge and experience. Demonstrated extensive knowledge and experience in data analysis  data profiling  data cleansing  data migration  data reconciliation  including development of the relevant rules. Demonstrated understanding of the data profiling and cleansing impacts on the Data Migration. Experience with Oracle and SQL Server and expert level with Pentaho  SQL and SQL Server SSIS  SQL Developer and other relevant tools. THE OPPORTUNITY Exciting opportunity at ASG Group for an ETL & SQL / Data Tester to join our Brisbane team. Unwavering focus on professional development Diverse & challenging project work Flexibility to juggle what’s important to you with work Committed health & wellbeing plan Competitive remuneration Corporate partnerships  DIVERSITY & INCLUSION We celebrate the diversity of people  and we pride ourselves on ensuring everyone belongs. Title: Data Analyst - Python
Requirements: Maven is looking for outstanding Data Analysts with the engineering and analytical skills to help drive our continuing success to the next level. You will work alongside the best traders and developers  using open-source and in-house tools to provide expertise and solve problems for our systematic trading business.  Previous experience in Python  pandas and related tools is a must  as are fluency in programming fundamentals and mathematical techniques. Experience in financial markets and securities is essential. Time series data is beneficial but not essential. This is a full-time  permanent role based in Sydney  with a competitive remuneration package comprising a base salary  benefits and bonus.  Skills And Experience You Have 3 years financial industry commercial experience minimum  Sound knowledge of financial markets & securities (particularly futures  options & equities)  Strong Python skills including experience with Numpy and Pandas  Business communication skills & ability to present information clearly and concisely  Enthusiasm to rapidly learn new technologies and skills  Efficient and diligent with a strong attention to detail  Bachelor degree with a minimum 2.1 grade or equivalent.  The stuff it would be great if you have already (but if not you will learn in this role): Experience working with large data sets  Time series data experience  Experience in C++  Containerisation (Docker  Kubernetes  serverless).  MAVEN DATA SERVICES TEAM  The Data Services team is responsible for the delivery of reliable  timely and accurate data and visualisations for the trading and research teams at Maven. Our data pipelines handle terabytes of exchange traffic  performing numerous transformations in real-time covering all the markets traded by Maven. We also provide perform analysis ranging from nanosecond-level investigations on low-latency trading systems to research on trading strategies covering entire markets.  We are a small team who sit on the trading floor and we partner with the trading desks and software development teams. Over the next year Data Services will be building out the Maven Data Lake. This will become the central repository for data loads and processing pipelines. The Data Lake will allow easy discovery of and access to different data sets  as well as the ability to create and maintain derived data sets as required by our users. Due to the volume and number of data sets we manage at Maven  this is a formidable challenge that will require innovative technical solutions.  Maven is a proprietary trading organisation formed in 2011. We employ the most talented traders  developers and engineers in the market  executing a diverse range of strategies across global equities and derivatives. We are the most active participant in many of the products we trade  contributing significant liquidity to markets around the world.  Maven has a culture that is relaxed and informal but highly rewarding of strong performance  there's no dress code  plenty of free food and regular social events.  We have offices in London  Hong Kong and New York and will be opening a new Chicago office in early 2020 as part of our plans to expand our coverage of derivatives markets.

Title: Data Analyst - Wealth
Requirements: Sydney  The role will see you getting involved in some truly great projects working on systems built on leading edge cloud technologies. We’re looking for a self-motivated individual to join our growing business banking and vehicle finance business.  About this Role: You will be working on analytical projects and delivering use cases to support our strategic initiatives. You will work collaboratively across a variety of working groups in an agile work environment. You will apply statistical methods using SQL  R and python to manipulate data and draw insights from large data sets. You will assist with driving automation and help deliver new solutions to business problems. To succeed in this role  you will ideally have: A degree and/or Masters in a quantitative subject - degree in statistics  mathematics  operations research  engineering (industrial  computer or electrical)  or related fields. Experience working in analytics teams or related functions. Experience wrangling data using SQL/Alteryx and Python/R  working with cloud platforms incl. AWS and GCP will be viewed favourably. Experience with Data visualisation tools e.g. Tableau/Power BI. Familiar with Agile principles and practices. Strong communication and presentation skills with all levels of stakeholders. Experience with productionising machine learning model is a plus. About Banking And Financial Services  Banking and Financial Services is Macquarie’s retail banking and financial services business  providing a diverse range of personal banking  wealth management  business banking and vehicle finance products and services to retail clients  advisers  brokers and business clients.  Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion  The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths  and in combination with our inclusive environment  it enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people  clients  shareholders and communities. From day one  you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us  please apply. With the right technology  support and resources  our people can work in a range of flexible ways.  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you  and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.  About Macquarie  A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills  explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition  helping sustain global food supplies  financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie  we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.  Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups  disciplines  sectors and borders. With 17 000+ employees and offices in 33 markets around the world  we’re a truly global organisation.  You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives  ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us  you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.  Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management  retail and business banking  wealth management  leasing and asset financing  market access  commodity trading  renewables development  specialist advisory  capital raising and principal investment.  Find out more at www.macquarie.com/careers  Job no: BFS-959906  Work type: Permanent - Full time  Location: Sydney  Category: Mid-level  Data & Analytics  Technology  Retail Banking  Group: Banking and Financial Services  Division: Product & Technology  Recruiter: Chelsea Hollins  Opening Date: 07/9/2021

Title: Lead Data Analyst - B2B
Requirements: At Canva  our mission is to empower the world to design  and we’re looking for insightful data analysts who can help us make that happen.  We're looking for self-motivated individuals who are curious about our product and our users  and who are excited to seek out valuable insights. We don’t want you to just be a resource that answers questions - we want you to act as a genuine data partner with your team and the broader business. We have a LOT of data and need people who can use their skills to help us make the most of it!  You’ll be coming into a diverse data team of more than forty people  who really do enjoy finding answers to the problems that our users have. We’re looking forward to continuing to grow our team and gaining a range of new perspectives and ideas on how we can achieve our goals and help more people.  This role will rely on your particular strengths in building out data-driven decisions  communicating closely with stakeholders  and organising your fellow data team members such that the data attitude in this space is highly proactive.  About the B2B Team The B2B Team is a new team at Canva and receiving a lot of attention! This team is unique at Canva in that it brings together Marketing  Product  Sales  and Data  and is therefore truly cross-functional. It will focus on 3 core motions to identify and capitalise on opportunities for larger paid teams using Canva: self-service  high-velocity (sales assisted)  and strategic sales. We’re all about bringing the right product to the right Canva user  at the right time. If that fit means going on an Enterprise product  we want to ensure it works for the customer  and they get the best education in how this can bring value to their business.  Role Responsibilities Coach a team of data specialists in the B2B teams. You will act as a driver of data strategy in this group and will coordinate closely with the Product Growth Manager. This role is all about bringing together key players from Sydney  Australia and Austin  Texas  together in an organised manner. It will require close coordination with several stakeholders and a real sense of drive and initiative to keep things moving. Find insights that help us understand both Canva and our customers - we want you to be creative and insightful  rather than just throwing the usual metrics at the wall to see what sticks Suggest and run interesting experiments that will actually move our metrics - when we push tests to 100% we want to actually see the bump in the relevant graph Build and maintain dashboards for our B2B initiatives  and make them look really good - you don’t need to be a designer or have any design talent  you just need to want to build cool things Own projects  data models  dashboards  and other artefacts and keep them up-to-date and high quality in a hypergrowth environment Use our giant databases to answer the sort of questions that sound really simple but turn out to be challenging (and fun!) Help us extend data literacy and curiosity throughout the whole company  Required Skills & Experience Experience working with subscription-based data sets. It would be desirable to have experience with collaborative products as well. Experience in the B2B world  specifically in identifying customers prime for an Enterprise product  based on their behaviour metrics in the product  as well as their company size and value. Previous experience working closely with a Sales team. Willingness to coordinate remotely with part of your team in the US  but normal hours will still apply. Strong competency with SQL  experience with data warehouses such as Snowflake  Redshift  or BigQuery is a plus! Experience wrangling and analysing data using Python or R Experience with optimising product funnels  running experiments  and building dashboards that effectively communicate results and outcomes A grounding in mathematics / statistics and a bachelor's degree in a STEM area is preferred  but not required Experience with very large data sets is a huge plus  but not required Strong communication skills - verbal and written - be able to break down complex topics into simple solutions and ideas. Stakeholder management skills are vital in this role.  Perks & Benifits: Competitive salary  plus stock options via our ESOP plan Flexible daily working hours  we value work-life balance Breakfast and lunch prepared by our wonderful Vibe team Onsite-Gym and Yoga Membership End-of-Trip Facilities: Bicycle parking and showers Generous parental (including secondary) leave policy Pet-friendly offices Internal Coaching and Employee Support Programs Sponsored social clubs  team events and celebrations Relocation budget for interstate and qualified overseas individuals (see below for visa information)  The Canva workspace is set up for you to do your best work and have a great time doing so  with breakout areas  little nooks  and quiet places to retreat.  If you're seeking professional growth and enjoy working on large  distributed  cloud-based applications that delight our millions of individual and business users alike - then apply now to be considered for the position!  If you require visa sponsorship  you must ensure you have at least two (2) years of post-University commercial experience as a Software Engineer and meet the mandatory sponsorship requirements laid out by the Department of Home Affairs.  We will not accept or review any CVs from external recruitment agencies.

Title: Data Quality Analyst - Sydney - PNT06526
Requirements: Sydney  Data Quality Analyst  Play a key role in uplifting the data quality of our banking product data for regulatory reporting  compliance  and customer service purposes.  As a Data Quality Analyst  you will work with a diverse range of stakeholders and data teams to uplift the current data quality management capabilities and leverage these across banking products in general  with a specific focus on home loans. You will learn detailed processes and be able to critically assess home loan application information to determine reporting attributes in line with regulatory reporting requirements. In addition  you will be able to flexibly update to new reporting guidance and adapt to undertaking reviews for other data quality remediations.  Your day to day activities will include: undertaking detailed data quality reviews for banking products  particularly home loans determining accurate reporting information with a high degree of attention to detail documenting supporting evidence for conclusions reached arranging source system updates for data quality remediation communicating progress against weekly volumes of data quality reviews escalating problems to management and governance teams where necessary For success in this role  you’ll need to bring: previous experience in credit approvals  data quality remediation or similar work the capacity to maintain high output levels over a sustained period proficiency with using data applications  particularly Excel an ability to consider multiple sources of information a high degree of attention to detail the ability to work flexibly and learn other detailed remediation activities If you are a driven individual who takes a proactive approach to your work  we want to hear from you. Apply online today.  About Banking And Financial Services  Banking and Financial Services is Macquarie’s retail banking and financial services business  providing a diverse range of personal banking  wealth management  business banking and vehicle finance products and services to retail clients  advisers  brokers and business clients.  Our commitment to Diversity  Equity and Inclusion  The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths. An inclusive and equitable environment enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people  clients  shareholders and communities. From day one  you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us  please apply. With the right technology  support and resources  our people can work in a range of flexible ways.  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity  equity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you  and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.  About Macquarie  A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills  explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition  helping sustain global food supplies  financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie  we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.  Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups  disciplines  sectors and borders. With 17 000+ employees and offices in 33 markets around the world  we’re a truly global organisation.  You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives  ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us  you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.  Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management  retail and business banking  wealth management  leasing and asset financing  market access  commodity trading  renewables development  specialist advisory  capital raising and principal investment.  Find out more at www.macquarie.com/careers  Job no: BFS-963491  Work type: Permanent - Full time  Location: Sydney  Category: Technology  Operations  Group: Banking and Financial Services  Division: Product & Technology  Recruiter: Patrick Lockington  Opening Date: 01/3/2022

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Requirements: About Us  We’re known for being the country’s most popular rewards program  making the everyday worth more for millions of Aussies.  All the things that make working at Flybuys different as usual – these aren't just values we talk about. They’re built into everything we do  every day.  Be part of a company that's always questioned the norm. A business that's well-established  but still expanding. With one eye on the horizon.  And together we can make every day different as usual.  The Opportunity  We've already built a pretty amazing team  but we're not looking for more of the same. Our day-to-day is made stronger when we surround ourselves with people who are different  like you.  We work really hard to build teams that support each other. It’s the kind of environment you’ll miss while you’re on holidays.  Your Role  Capability Development: Develop key customer insights and recommendations to inform analytics strategy and marketing investment. Build out and execute insights and recommendations for relevant campaign targeting . Promote the use of analytics by translating complex mathematical techniques into consumable and commercial concepts  with a focus on promoting the value of the flybuys program. Work with multiple large data sets  to conduct detailed Analysis for our internal teams  and partners. Showcase  benchmark and quantify the value and outcomes of analytics based decision making. Analytics Strategy And Planning Participate in the development of the vision for partner data / analytics architecture. Proactively investigate CRM and Analytics opportunities in order to create measurable change and deliver measurable value in the partner acquisition/retention/trade-driving space  as relevant . Responsible for implementing commercial partner analytical strategy . Understand market context  competitor capability and customer trends to support CRM / Analytics strategies . Apply analytics best practices and/or standards. Thought Leadership & Innovation Socialise analytics trends and best practices . Source  develop and apply new and existing analytical methods and techniques. Use of a variety of sources to keep abreast of industry practices. Ensure key stakeholders are updated  ensuring the commercial impact has been explored / communicated. Mentor and develop other members of the team to further their understanding and use of analytical techniques. Stakeholder Management Cultivate relationships across internal teams and with the partners  at all levels as required. Clearly articulate the customer opportunity  commercial benefit  analytical findings. Explain complex analysis to non-technical audience . Tell and sell the story to stakeholders  visualise and report data findings creatively in a variety of visual formats that provides insights. To Be Successful You Will Have Tertiary Qualified in Business  Mathematics or Science discipline. Analytics professional with a proven track record  ideally with consulting experience (minimum 7-10 years working experience) Great influencing and storytelling skills and the ability to navigate internal and external organisations to build and leverage relationships. Experience in clearly articulating commercial benefits of analytics. Naturally collaborative with a strong emphasis on building and leveraging relationships both internally and externally. Experience of large  complex data sets Naturally curious  able to positively challenge existing practices. Commercially savvy. Experience of analytical tools – data extraction  data exploration and analysis  data visualisation. Experience of working within large  complex  cross functional projects Technical skills including SQL and Power BI experience Experience with Snowflake would be advantageous. We value ways of working that work for everyone  and use our different strengths to make us stronger. We work hard to make sure everyone’s voice is heard and respected equally  regardless of identity  background  position  ability or lifestyle.  So whether you’re an earlybird list maker  a night owl coder  a brainstorm chaser or a PowerPoint proof-reader  we want you to Be You  With Us.  To ensure the safety and wellbeing of our employees and the community in which we operate  Flybuys (Loyalty Pacific) has introduced a Vaccination Policy which requires all persons entering a Flybuys (Loyalty Pacific) workplace  attending a Flybuys (Loyalty Pacific) work-related event  or entering other premises to undertake work on Flybuys (Loyalty Pacific)’s behalf to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or to hold a valid exemption (and to provide evidence of the same).  It is also a condition of employment that successful applicants provide evidence of compliance with Flybuys (Loyalty Pacific) Vaccination Policy and to undergo a National Police Check.

Title: Data and Insights Analyst
Requirements: Job Description  The opportunity  The key focus of this role is to generate customer  commercial and product insights to support the development of customer and go to market strategies for the Health Insurance business  through the application of data and analytics.  The role demands an experienced individual with strong problem solving  data analysis  data preparation and visualisation skills  and an ability to work across a matrix environment with business and technical stakeholders to understand customer and business problems  develop hypothesis and solve for them.  Responsibilities Develop insights and recommendations by undertaking data sourcing  data preparation  analysis design and visualisation to support product development  go-to-market plan and customer experience strategies Work closely with business stakeholders to understand their commercial imperatives and translate into data-driven approaches Be supportive and proactive in strengthening the technical capabilities of the analytics / performance function Deepen understanding of the Health Insurance industry and remain abreast of relevant industry  market  competitive and regulatory developments What’s in it for me?  As well as a competitive salary  a range of Bupa benefits and flexible working/ work from home arrangements  you’ll be challenged and encouraged to innovate. You will collaborate strongly with colleagues who are committed to delivering exceptional experiences. We trust  respect and consider everyone  knowing your difference will make the difference.  What do I need? Programming in SQL (required)  R  Python and/or SAS Visualisation tools such as Power BI and Tableau Experience with Data Bricks  Azure Synapse and Azure Data Lake will be highly regarded Comfortable using Microsoft PowerPoint and Word to craft presentations based on a defined narrative / storyline and key messages Possess strong quantitative  analytical and conceptual problem-solving skills 3+ years’ experience in a data and analytics related role Experience in Health Insurance will be highly regarded Tertiary qualification in analytics  science  business/economics computer science or related discipline Full working rights - Permanent resident or citizen of Australia What is it like to work there?  Be at the heart of helping people live longer  healthier  happier lives. At Bupa  we employ more than 80 000 people globally who are making this a reality. One thing stands out about Bupa people -our customers are our passion  they’re at the heart of our culture of care. If you've got the belief  the drive and the talent to help us in our ambition then we’d like to hear from you.  Time Type  Full time

Title: Intelligence Analyst - Systems Operator (No Experience Required)
Requirements: An entry requirement for employment with the Australian Defence Force (ADF) is that you must be an Australian citizen. If you do not meet the citizenship conditions for service in the ADF  we are unable to accept an application from you. You are welcome to apply once you have completed your citizenship journey.  Your role:  As an Intelligence Analyst – System Operator (known in the Navy as Cryptologic Systems Operators) your role supports classified Government intelligence programs by analysing signal transmissions  and informing tactical and military advantage both at sea and ashore.  This diverse and mentally stimulating role encompasses a range of specialist skills that support intelligence  surveillance and reconnaissance activities. You’ll use sophisticated  state-of-the-art search receivers and other complex equipment to intercept  record  analyse and disseminate the intelligence of signal transmissions.  Teamwork is an important part of the role. You’ll work in a close-knit team that really rely on each other. There are also many opportunities for career growth and travel  all while making a difference to the defence of Australia and her interests.  As an Intelligence Analyst – Systems Operator  you will receive training in the following areas:  - Analytical techniques and methodical problem-solving  - Communications theory and networks  - Methods for working with intelligence information  - Preparation and presentation of intelligence briefs  and  - Provide advice to Commanders and other audiences as required.  Prior experience isn’t needed. You’ll gain all the necessary skills and qualifications to become an Intelligence Analyst – Systems Operator as part of your training. Although  it is worth noting that successful Operators typically have a sound background in mathematics and are comfortable with the fundamentals of physics.  Life in the Navy:  A career in the Navy is challenging and highly rewarding  and comes with good work/life balance  competitive salary and skills for life. You can expect to feel a unique sense of accomplishment and pride from serving and protecting our country and helping to keep our vast coastlines safe.  Life in the Navy is anything but mundane. You’ll enjoy varied lifestyles  rewarding careers  opportunities to travel  and excellent social and fitness facilities  free medical and dental  all in a dynamic and fulfilling working environment.  Don’t worry  it’s not all life at sea—there’s more to the Navy than ships  submarines and helicopters. Some days  you might be exploring exciting new countries with your fellow crewmates. Other days  you could be stationed locally not too far from home.  Salary:  Upon completion of your initial military and initial employment training  you’ll enjoy a competitive starting salary package from $75 625 including service and uniform allowances. You will also receive a Maritime Allowance when serving on ships.  In addition to your salary  you will receive generous superannuation  housing subsidies and free medical and dental care.  Apply Now:  For this role  you must be over 17 at time of enlistment  an Australian Citizen and have passed Year 10 English  Maths and Science (physics is preferable).  Click the APPLY button if you think you have what it takes to become an Intelligence Analyst – Systems Operator and we’ll get in contact with you shortly.  You can also visit the link below to view the full position description and learn more about life in the Navy.  https://navy.defencejobs.gov.au/jobs/intelligence-analyst-systems-operator

Requirements: Job Description  At Boeing  we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. Location:  Brisbane  Category:  Engineering / Technical  Position Type:  Permanent  Job Reference:  BOE/1618694B  No File Attached  Share This:  The Opportunity  Boeing Defence Australia (BDA) is looking for talented data engineers and analysts to join our dynamic and growing digital engineering capability responsible for establishing and delivering data analytics and applied business intelligence strategy and solutions for Boeing Defence Australia and our customers.  Working as part of our Data Engineering and Applied Intelligence team  you will be responsible for leading  designing and developing a suite of data analytics solutions and services critical to the establishment of the BDA digital thread enabling our military and commercial customers to operate in an ever changing and accelerating digital world.  Responsibilities  Designing and developing efficient and effective end to end data engineering solutions Ingesting  transforming and integrating complex  large and disparate data sets  in a batch or streaming context Developing data governance initiatives across enterprise Supporting large scale migration efforts of multiple disparate engineering data sources Developing reporting solutions to inform program management on progress and KPIs Supporting deployed applications through consultation with users  defect identification/resolution and release management Working collaboratively with technical leads and architects  promoting new technologies and methods to support the efficiency and effectiveness of future analytics solutions  and contributing to the development of technical roadmaps. Boeing has implemented a new COVID-19 Vaccination Policy in Australia that requires all new Boeing Australia hires to show proof of being fully vaccinated from COVID-19  or have an approved medical exemption. At Boeing  we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. Title: Data Governance Analyst/ Analyste de la Gouvernance des Données
Requirements: Posted by Taniffa Louis Technical Recruiter at Alcoa Send InMail Just as aluminum is the element of possibility  so too  are our current and future employees. We relentlessly pursue outstanding and sustainable results and creatively transform ideas into value. At Alcoa you can quickly make your mark  impact your world and grow your career. Alcoa is a truly global company with many locations worldwide. The majority of our hiring takes place in Australia  Brazil  Canada  Iceland  Hungary  The Netherlands  Norway  Spain  and the United States. While some roles are based on-site  Alcoa also offers a flexible working model for certain positions. Come learn what’s possible for you!  About The Job  Alcoa is looking for a self-motivated  energetic  detail oriented and a great teammate to take on the role of Enterprise Data Management Analyst in the Data Hub organization! This professional will be accountable for delivering Data Governance within an Enterprise Data function. The scope is Alcoa wide and will interact with both the Enterprise & Operations Spokes that have the responsibility for delivery of Data Management & Analytics solutions to their respective enterprise and operations customers.  We are also seeking experience in Enterprise Data governance and tools that include the areas of master data management  metadata and cataloging  data quality and compliance and data governance including policy creation covering data access and retention. Are you ready to face this exciting challenge?  Major activities and key challenges Drive the data governance vision and implement data management strategies  standards  and processes to support all of Alcoa. Assist in developing and driving the execution of master data management strategies. Support in the development of data quality standards and find opportunities to ensure data meets the following characteristics  including but not limited to: accuracy  validity  reliability  timeliness  relevance  and completeness. Promote ongoing engagement of data stewards and data domain owners within the data governance structure. Develop and implement a roadmap for tools and processes to effectively manage critical data across the enterprise. Establish processes and governance that enable rapid data access that leads to value creation  without sacrificing appropriate access controls. Drive the capture of business definitions  taxonomies  and linkage to technical lineage within the metadata tool.  About you:  Our values – act with integrity  operate with excellence  care for people  and lead with courage – are at the foundation of everything we do. To be successful in this role and to play a part in our ongoing success we desire the following background: Bachelor’s degree in computer science  information systems or a related IT field. Location is flexible - home office options available. At least 5 years of performing enterprise data management activities  interpreting data policy  and conducting impact analysis for data related changes. Demonstrable experience in tools such as Informatica  Collibra or Semarchy and collaborating with business users and IT technical staff. Expertise with analytical and data visualization tools and techniques  recent skills in Microsoft Power BI  enterprise data in warehouses/marts  master data management  dimensional data models  and data quality. Ability to communicate clearly  in written and spoken word  with customers and team members. Experience with supporting data governance activities  designing and conducting data governance training programs. Experience with Microsoft Azure data management technologies such as data stores (SQL  Synapse or Data Lake)  Integrations (Functions  Data Factory or SSIS) and analytics (Databricks  ML).  To support our teams and their families beyond the workplace  Alcoa provides an outstanding benefits package effective day one of employment!  Alcoa encourages applications from women  a diverse group of backgrounds and those with different skills and life experiences. Alcoa is proud to be an equal opportunity workplace.  Description De L'emploi  Alcoa est à la recherche d'une personne motivée  énergique  soucieuse du détail et d'un excellent coéquipier pour assumer le rôle d'analyste en gestion des données d'entreprise au sein de l'organisation Data Hub ! Ce professionnel sera responsable de la gouvernance des données dans le cadre d'une fonction de données d'entreprise. Le champ d'application s'étend à l'ensemble d'Alcoa et ce dernier interagira avec les divisions Entreprise et Opérations qui ont la responsabilité de fournir des solutions de gestion et d'analyse des données à leurs clients respectifs.  Nous recherchons également quelqu’un avec de l'expérience en matière de gouvernance et d'outils de données d'entreprise  notamment dans les domaines de la gestion des données de base  des métadonnées et du catalogage  de la qualité et de la conformité des données et de la gouvernance des données  y compris la création de politiques couvrant l'accès et la conservation des données. Êtes-vous prêt à relever ce défi passionnant ?  Principales activités et principaux défis Diriger la vision de la gouvernance des données et mettre en œuvre des stratégies  des normes et des processus de gestion de données pour soutenir l'ensemble d'Alcoa. Contribuer à l'élaboration et à la mise en oeuvre de l'exécution des stratégies de gestion des données de base. Soutenir l'élaboration de normes de qualité des données et trouver des opportunités pour s'assurer que les données répondent aux caractéristiques suivantes  y compris  mais sans s'y limiter : exactitude  validité  fiabilité  actualité  pertinence et exhaustivité. Promouvoir l'engagement continu des intendants de données et des propriétaires de domaines de données au sein de la structure de gouvernance des données. Élaborer et mettre en œuvre une feuille de route pour les outils et les processus permettant de gérer efficacement les données critiques dans toute l'entreprise. Mettre en place des processus et une gouvernance qui permettent un accès rapide aux données qui mène à la création de valeur  sans sacrifier les contrôles d'accès appropriés. Diriger la saisie des définitions d'affaires  des taxonomies et des liens avec la lignée technique dans l'outil de métadonnées.  À propos de vous :  Nos valeurs — agir avec intégrité  travailler avec excellence  prendre soin des gens  & et diriger avec courage — sont à la base de tout ce que nous entreprenons. Pour réussir dans ce rôle et jouer un rôle dans notre succès continu  nous souhaitons avoir les antécédents suivants : Baccalauréat en informatique  en systèmes d'information ou dans un domaine connexe des TI. Emplacement flexible - politique de travail à domicile disponible. Au moins 5 ans d'expérience dans la gestion des données d'entreprise  l'interprétation de la politique en matière de données et l'analyse de l'impact des changements liés aux données. Expérience avérée de l'utilisation d'outils tels que Informatica  Collibra ou Semarchy et de la collaboration avec les utilisateurs professionnels et le personnel technique informatique. Expertise en matière d'outils et de techniques d'analyse et de visualisation des données  compétences récentes avec Microsoft Power BI  entrepôts ou magasins de données d'entreprise  gestion des données de base  modèles de données dimensionnelles et qualité des données. Capacité à communiquer clairement  à l'écrit et à l'oral  avec les clients et les membres de l'équipe. Expérience du soutien des activités de gouvernance des données  de la conception et de la réalisation de programmes de formation en matière de gouvernance de données. Expérience des technologies de gestion des données Microsoft Azure  telles que les magasins de données (SQL  Synapse ou Data Lake)  les intégrations (Functions  Data Factory ou SSIS) et les analyses (Databricks  ML).  Pour soutenir nos équipes et leurs familles au-delà du lieu de travail  Alcoa propose un ensemble d'avantages sociaux exceptionnels dès le premier jour d'embauche !  Alcoa encourage les candidatures de femmes  d'un groupe d'origines diverses et de personnes ayant des compétences et des expériences de vie différentes. Alcoa est fière d'être un lieu de travail offrant l'égalité des chances.

Title: Business/Data Analyst
Requirements: At EY  you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are  with the global scale  support  inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better  too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself  and a better working world for all.  The opportunity  EY DnA is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific  with over 500 specialist employees working across multiple industry sectors.  As a Business/Data Analyst  you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives. Some of your responsibilities will include: Be a part of one of our successful delivery teams and get an opportunity to move into a more consultative role working across various data environments and helping our clients solve their business problems with data. Be responsible for creating requirement specifications  analysing requirements  creating visual models  facilitating elicitation sessions  and digging around in the data when needed. Designing and building reports – capture data requirements for the client and team. Creating requirements specifications  analysing requirements  creating visual models  facilitating workshop sessions  and using the necessary business analyst tools.  To qualify for the role  you must have Worked in a similar Business/Data Analyst position for at least 3-5 years with a focus on data management  data governance and data strategy Ability to understand and identify business rules and processes Conducted process mapping and requirements gathering workshops with non-technical stakeholders Working with SQL databases and database querying languages. Due to the nature of the client base  you MUST BE an Australian Citizen  Ideally  you’ll also have Experience in engaging with both technical and non-technical stakeholders Strong consulting experience and background  including engaging directly with clients Experience in a delivery role on Business Intelligence  Data Warehousing  Big Data or analytics projects Ability to problem-solve and think critically Technical reconciliation and reporting skills Some development experience would be advantageous but not essential  What We Offer Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility  so you can make a meaningful impact  your way. Continuous learning: personalised career development including coaching  experiences and formal learning so you’ll develop the mindset and skills you’ll need to thrive in the future. Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.  At EY  you’ll be rewarded and recognised based on your performance and our comprehensive benefits package can be tailored to your individual needs.  We hold a collective commitment to foster an environment where all differences are valued and respected  practices are equitable  and everyone experiences a sense of belonging. If you require any adjustments to the recruitment process in order to equitably participate  we encourage you to advise us at the time of application via contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or phone +61 3 8650 7788 (option 4).  We understand the importance of social distancing at this time so our recruitment and onboarding process may be managed virtually so we can continue to prioritise the safety and wellbeing of EY people  clients  guests and the broader public.  The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.  EY | Building a better working world  EY exists to build a better working world  helping to create long-term value for clients  people and society and build trust in the capital markets.  Enabled by data and technology  diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow  transform and operate.  Working across assurance  consulting  law  strategy  tax and transactions  EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Title: Modelling and Analytics Senior Analyst
Requirements: You are motivated and solutions-oriented with a positive attitude and approach We are a values-driven high performing team that ensures that resources are optimised across our multiple functions  while providing management information and insight that supports drives performance and supports continuous improvement. Together we can deliver an exemplary experience for our stakeholders and the Group Do What Matters  Risk Management is responsible for developing the risk frameworks to allow the Group to take conscious exposures to credit  market  operational  compliance and insurance risks within a Board-approved appetite. Business Banking Risk Management (BB RM) forms part of the Group Risk Management division  and specifically  it provides the Business Banking (BB) team with specialist risk services and advice.  See Yourself In The Team  You will be part of a high performing Provisioning team  which is responsible for calculating the IFRS9 credit provisions  loan impairment expense and executive level reporting to the BB leadership team.  On a Day To Basis You Will Run monthly SAS programs / scripts for calculation of IFRS9 credit provisions Develop SAS programs / scripts that perform various analytics task. Identify and implement automation opportunities using disciplined software development processes. Produce high quality documentation and standards for all aspects of the automation delivery  including testing. Work with stakeholders and managers to prioritise work on a daily basis within an agile framework. Maintaining  executing and enhancing the IFRS9 SAS programs which are used in Loan Impairment Expense reporting. Prepare and review monthly internal management reporting for discussion at BB loan loss provision committee (LLPC) Prepare quarterly and half yearly Credit provision disclosures Perform ad-hoc investigation and insights to BB RM leadership team We are interested in hearing from you  if you have: Experience in programming language required (SAS software suite desirable otherwise SQL  Python  R knowledge but willing to learn SAS) Advanced Excel skills Knowledge of AASB9/ IFRS9 desirable Knowledge of Credit risk and/or credit provisioning desirable Intermediate verbal  written and numeracy skills We believe in working for a place that works for you. We have many flexible working options within our team so talk to us about which arrangements would work best for you.  If you like the sound of this role  we would love to hear from you. “Apply Now”  The health and safety of our people  customers and communities is our number one priority. This means that we require all of our employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Please speak to us if you have any questions about this based on your individual circumstances.  At CommBank  we advocate and facilitate a culture of inclusion and respect  celebrating all cultures  abilities  genders  expressions of gender and sexual orientation Read more about our commitment to inclusion and diversity .  We believe in working for a place that works for you. We have many flexible working options within our team so talk to us about which arrangements would work best for you.  If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest)  you'll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. We’re keen to support you with the next step in your career.  We're aware of some accessibility issues on this site  particularly for screen reader users. We want to make finding your dream job as easy as possible  so if you require additional support please contact HR Direct on 1800 989 696.  Advertising End Date: 22/04/2022

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Requirements: About Us  At Optus  we are striving to become Australia’s most loved everyday brand with lasting customer relationships and truly believe digital is one of the keys to unlocking our vision. The Analytics Team at Optus are leaders in driving value out of data. We enable stakeholders to make informed  data based decisions to build connections with our customers  deliver digitally engaging experiences  improve business processes and explore new innovation opportunities while maintaining the highest data privacy standards. It's our collaborative culture that’s focused on growth and development with an entrepreneurial spirit that makes us unique. We love helping data tell a story and unlocking the value of data to help make better decisions for our business and our customers. Every day presents a new opportunity to create rich insights  learn new skills and work across the organisation to do good things with data for our customers.  About The Role  The Senior Data Analyst is a critical within Analytics providing guidance  recommendations and insights to the business. Positioned within the Customer Value Analytics chapter this role using a proactive approach to demonstrate the value of analytics and how it can be applied to business decisions which improve customer outcomes  achieve targets and explore growth opportunities. You will be a strong proactive contributor to the analytics strategy  capability and delivery of insight and analytics programs of work required by the specific business unit/s and will work day to day within a cross-functional team to leverage their combined skills to deliver the best outcome.  Key Responsibilities Include- Proactively engage and collaborate with key Business Unit/s stakeholders to understand the key business problems to be solved Influence stakeholders through effective storytelling and relationship management to ensure data is a key enabler of decisions Translation of business challenges into analysis plans needed to address these across the areas of business analysis  customer insights and advanced analytics. Mentoring Data Analysts  in querying customer data  performing analyses  and presenting findings in a clear and understandable language  Performing complex data  statistical and commercial analysis to understand how customer behaviour  product changes and market dynamics impact the Consumer business Consolidating information and data from across the Insights team to present a holistic view of customer behaviour and market trends including Research  Data Scientists  Commercial  External Market Analysis and Marketing effectiveness Developing recommendations with a clearly articulated  structured argument and deliver findings and recommendation back to the senior stakeholders Contributing to the overall team delivery of business insights and recommendations and trading performance Contributing to the growth and development of the team’s operating procedures and capability Proactively innovate with the use of new untapped data and analytics to identify opportunities to growth and engage our customers Collaborate with the cross-functional team to deliver the best outcomes for business and customers Effectively and autonomously manage workload to deliver to business deadlines and priority  help others to do the same with the team  The effective interpretation of business trends  customer behaviours and market dynamics are critical to the success of the company.  About You  We are looking for the following skills  experience and attributes Exposure to a variety of Marketing  Sales and/or Commercial functions in large organisation People leadership Internal consulting experience as part of a centre of excellence Complex stakeholder management to achieve alignment around a common set of goals and influence business outcomes Advanced SQL coding skills a must  2nd language (Python/R preferred) Strong understanding of data warehouse structure and data extraction Working in Hybrid or Cloud environments Proven ability to work through complex issues to reach an outcome Demonstrated ability to interpret business relevant results from analysis and apply to impact outcomes Exposure to advanced analytics methods and application to business use Tertiary qualifications in a quantitative field (e.g. Mathematics  Computer Science  Finance  Engineering  Statistics) Telecommunications or Financial Services experience preferred  Does this sound like you ?  Self-starter  Able to work independently and multitask several different activities  An expert at managing critical deadlines in a high-pressure environment.  If the answers are YES we look forward to hearing from you !

Title: Junior Data Analyst: Operations - Global Meeting Services (Mandarin Speaking)
Requirements: Posted by Clarisse Leoncio APAC Corporate Recruiter at ISS | Institutional Shareholder Services Send InMail Position Overview The Global Meeting Services provides data support and services covering markets worldwide including  but not limited to  US  Canada  China  Taiwan  United Kingdom  South Africa  Australia  New Zealand and Asia Pacific. The team continuously monitors and obtains relevant information on all upcoming corporate action events specifically shareholders meetings where topics such as acquisitions  mergers and demergers  election of directors and auditors might be discussed. The relevant meeting results are also collected. The information collected is accurately inputted in the database and this will be generated for clients to see. Collected information is also used by other teams for further data collection and research for the ultimate issuance of ISS Vote Recommendations. Responsibilities Monitoring corporate action events such as shareholders meetings from various sources like EDGAR  SEDAR and Stock Exchanges of each market Procuring relevant shareholder meeting documents such as Annual Report  Notice of the Meeting  Information Circular  Proxy Form and other Corporate Governance documents Contacting the companies or issuers by email or phone for engagements Collecting meeting details such as the date  type  record date  location  time  voting instructions Ascertaining securities (ISIN  SEDOL  CUSIP and CINS) that have the relevant voting rights in a meeting Extracting the meeting agenda and encoding it to the database to make clients aware of the agenda /resolutions that will be voted at the meeting Inputting correct Voting Instructions such as the Valid Vote Options  Market Deadline Date and details of the Registrars Collecting results of the meetings and inputting it to the database Assisting in any other relevant projects that might be assigned from time to time Desired Experiences & Qualifications Bachelors’ Degree in Business  Finance  Economics or any equivalent/related course Strong oral and written communication skills  fluent in English and Mandarin (Traditional and Simplified) Knowledge and experience in using MS Office  Ability to work within a team-oriented environment Ability to work under tight deadlines Strong skills in problem solving Strong attention to detail Strong organizational skills and ability to prioritize multiple tasks Understanding of corporate governance issues  corporate transactions and capital markets is a plus Open to Fresh Graduates. This is an entry-level position. #ENTRYLEVEL #FINANCE #OTHERS #ANALYST

Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: Sydney  About The Role  You will join the Business Services Division  Central Team and provide data analyst skills to various departments to cover key transformation and digitalisation projects. The team provides data strategy  architecture  analysis  and data visualisation resources. You will play a key role in supporting our Product Owners  speaking to business customers  identify business problems and build innovative insights from data. You will operate across diverse data sets and business problems including workplaces and corporate real estate  procurement services  operational resilience  supplier risk and NetZero sustainability projects Work with business customers to define and capture questions  problems  and requirements Translate requirements to data engineers to source data and collate for analysis Build queries and models to look for insights to answer business questions Document and explain to non-data experts how to use and interpret data Design and create KPIs and visualisations in Power BI About You You will have a good understanding of data management principles and best practice Highly proficient in data modelling  warehousing  and analysis Able to translate complex logic to non-technical business users and tell stories with data Customer centric with a human centred design focus Have a good understanding of designing and developing visualisations and reports (preferably using Power BI) Curious and business outcome focused with an ability to break down a complex problem and work out how to solve it Evidence of numerical and technical aptitude Proactive and have great communication and stakeholder management skills A natural collaborator with a learning mindset  happy to share knowledge and learn from others. Our commitment to Diversity  Equity and Inclusion  The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you  and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive. At Macquarie  we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future. With 17 000+ employees and offices in 33 markets around the world  we’re a truly global organisation.  You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives  ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. Title: Customer Data Analyst
Requirements: This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more Faethm is scaling! We're looking for a Sydney-based Customer Data Analyst to join our team. We are at an exciting point in our trajectory where we’ve recently joined forces with Pearson Education. Operating as a scale-up within a larger company  Faethm will continue to evolve over the coming year as we leverage the resources and offerings of our new parent company.  Faethm's objective is to keep every worker  everywhere  employable. Founded in 2017 in Sydney  Faethm is an augmented analytics platform that provides scenario-driven predictive analytics on the impact of external trends on the workforce. Our SaaS AI-driven capability is the world’s data source for navigating external impacts like AI/ robotic technologies  the evolution of work  and COVID-19 on the workforce. Our capability helps clients evaluate the impact of these trends on any economy  industry  organisation  or job and suggests viable transition pathways for impacted employees into 'future proof' career pathways.  Faethm is building out its Customer Insights team to manage and support a growing pipeline of client activities across APAC. Core to your work at Faethm is an interest in process optimisation  system standardisation and creative analytics. We work with large workforce datasets  which are ingested into our AI engine to develop insights on the impact of external trends on a workforce or economy. This means that our?Data Analysts are critical stakeholders in successful onboarding  kick-off  and value creation for our clients through analytical insights.  As such  Faethm is seeking candidates with two core skill sets: People with a passion for unique visualisation and data interpretation and a willingness to experiment/create new content to generate value for our clients Scrappy 'get stuff done' individuals with a desire to improve systems  create standardised processes  and automate our own capabilities We are looking for a delivery-focused and self-starting Data Analyst to join our team and grow with us. Initial responsibilities are detailed below  but we expect this role will evolve over time  and as such  flexibility  collaboration  a passion for your work  an unquenchable thirst for knowledge  and a sense of humour will be essential.?  What You’ll Be Doing  Reporting directly to the APAC Customer Insights Lead  you will be responsible for the collection and analysis of client data  improvements to process flows  and analysis of key workforce data insights. Work closely with key internal stakeholders (Customer Insights – client delivery  Product team and Sales)  to understand their priorities and shifting needs. Utilise a client-driven mindset to ensure Faethm client accounts are set-up in a logical  intuitive manner with clean workforce data to enable impactful insights.? Engage in continuous process improvements to the client onboarding process  with a focus on working with the Customer Insights team and clients to enable a seamless onboarding experience to the Faethm platform. Periodically communicate with clients to discuss workforce data requirements  resolve errors  gaps  and limitations in submission files.? Collect and assimilate various workforce and emerging technology data. Apply your analytical skillset to understand  interpret  manipulate  and visualise data (e.g. via Tableau  Excel  etc.) Ensure client data requirements are delivered in conjunction with the Customer Insights team within timeframes agreed upon with clients. This includes flagging  mitigating  and resolving potential risks to delays in timelines. Run data quality tests and fix errors to ensure that a client’s workforce data passes checks prior to uploading to the Faethm platform for optimal insights. Act as trusted advisors to both the Customer Insights team and customers for the end-to-end data collection  management  and upload requirements for the onboarding phase to the Faethm platform. Required Skills & Experience Experience in processing  cleaning  organising and manipulating data. Experience Programming in scripting languages such as Python (preferred) or R. Familiarity with Tableau or other BI data viz tools desired. Development  enhancement and standardisation of process automation and process flow  including running and understanding scripts. Strong MS Excel proficiency including pivot tables  filtering  formulas  etc.? Ability to effectively communicate complex topics via Tableau  Excel or PowerPoint. Knowledge of AWS. Prior consulting or direct client experience with tact and professionalism in communication. Join our team in APAC with a rapid scale mandate and help us build our capability as we support clients across industry verticals!  Faethm is an equal opportunity employer. We find excellence in diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.

Title: Report and Data Analyst
Requirements: Position description  The Portfolio Report & Data Analyst will produce and maintain high quality performance reporting on IP Australia’s investment portfolio. You will also provide project teams and leaders with robust  practical and targeted advice on project and program delivery.  You will undertake complex work under limited direction and exercising both initiative and judgement in the application of sound P3M practices.  Position Duties  As the Portfolio Reporting and Data Analyst  you will:  gather and analyse project performance data from a wide range of internal stakeholders to develop highly consumable reports and briefings to support investment prioritisation and strategic planning activities support project and program teams to build robust performance metrics that demonstrate progress towards articulated benefits contribute to the continuous improvement of the PMO’s reports  tools  methods  templates and/or databases  To be successful in this role it is desirable to have:  investment portfolio management experience and will be able to demonstrate you:  have experience in P3M and Agile delivery methods have expertise in extracting  assessing and aggregating project and program data to create whole of portfolio performance reports have experience in conducting project health checks and/or stage gate assurance activities For additional information please click apply now

Title: APS5-6 Data Analyst and Presenter
Requirements: This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more Contract | Canberra  ACT Location | State Government Agency | Full time position Contract State Government Agency Marcus Clarke Street  Canberra  ACT  2601 Location About The Company  Karlka Recruiting Group has partnered with a State Government Agency to engage a APS5-6 Data Analyst and Presenter. This position is located in their busy Marcus Clarke Street office for an initial Contract  About The Position  The Meat Market Access Section provides technical input into maintaining existing or negotiating new or improved market access for Australia’s meat exports. The section develops Australian positions on international standard setting for trade in food and delivers content for the Manual of Importing Country Requirements (Micor). The section works closely with department operational export programs  Trade and Market Access International Division and overseas posts. Presently  this section is split into two teams based on regions/countries.  Duties Developing and implementing prioritisation systems using GovTeams (SharePoint) in conjunction with our key export industries. Contributing to the development and improvement of branch governance processes through innovating thinking and use of available IT Systems. Developing monitoring tools that support branch and divisional strategic objectives (i.e. certificate prioritisation  distressed consignments). Supporting development of reporting mechanisms to ensure easy and influential visualisation of progress and achievements. Liaising and effectively communicating with internal and external stakeholders  including Australian and overseas government agencies  senior executive and industry bodies. Providing secretariat and/or organisational support  including managing branch inboxes to respond to external and internal enquiries. Requirements/Skills  We are looking for a dynamic  positive individual someone who is customer focused and has a strong interest in improving internal processes and using data and analysis to support accurate reporting. This is a great opportunity for someone who wants to put their skills to the test and learn about Australian agricultural trade. Experience in using systems such as Microsoft Teams  SharePoint and PowerBI  and ability to analyse large data is desirable.  How To Apply  Apply now to be considered for submission to our client by 31/03/2022  Consultant: Shynata Kuresa  Email for questions: recruitment@karlkarecruiting.com.au Please apply through this portal. Any applications through email may be missed. Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for further discussion.  Applications received after the due date may be considered for similar roles.
