Title: Lead Data Analyst - Creators & Monetisation
Requirements: At Canva  our mission is to democratise design and empower creativity for anyone and everyone  on every platform. Inspired by a team of talented thinkers  an amazing culture and a remarkable growth trajectory – we’re out to change the world  one design at a time.  Since launch in August 2013  we have grown exponentially  amassing over 60 million monthly active users across 190 different countries who have created more than 6 Billion designs. We are one of the world’s fastest-growing technology companies and we have only achieved about 1% of what we want to do.  About the group Since Canva’s founding  our template library has been a critical and fundamental driver of our success. Fundamental to making design accessible to the world is giving people everywhere a springboard with which to create designs from. Templates are that springboard.  Templates provide inspiration to users  help them visualise what's possible and provide an approachable starting point for our users to get creative. In fact  templates are the way the majority of our users create designs so the templates teams are helping millions of people each week.  Historically  Canva’s templates have been designed by a talented team of internal graphic designers. But last year we launched Canva Creators  a platform that allows anyone to publish their templates and earn money every time they’re used. We believe Canva Creators has the potential to take Canva to the next level of scale  and we want you to be central to that growth.  About the role In this role  you'll collaborate with our founders  Product  Finance  Strategy  Engineering and Researchers to shape the Creators Monetisation strategy.  Initially  this role will be a half of a 1-2 combination we are setting up between the Monetisation Product Manager and this role  the Data and monetisation insights Lead. Together  you will drive the strategy  modelling  shaping  testing and development of Canva Creator’s monetisation approach across templates and elements. This is an amazing opportunity to lead and grow the strategies around monetisation for Creators in an environment that rewards strategic thinking  initiative  creativity  and independence.  This role is about so much more than just “Money  money  money” - our Creators have shared stories about how becoming a Creator enabled them to gain their financial independence and make empowering decisions to put their health and happiness first  buy a new home for their family  leave a job where they were unhappy - see some of the comments below! We are building pathways to better lives for people all over the world and this role is a critical thought-leader and decision-maker as part of that.  What you’ll do Forecast and model product and monetization scenarios to test likely impact of changes Be the voice of data for the Creators team - input what data should and shouldn’t be shared and help to apply a strategic lens for how data is used across the product (including in communications outside of the product) Analyse the feedback on the current monetisation model for Creators Use quantitative data to inform team on who benefits from specific models and changes  and analyse how closely this aligns with Canva’s goals  and being the voice for those who are not benefiting or who are experiencing diminishing returns Test the model with creators  work with Product to define how this should be positioned internally and externally Present your recommendations to the team and leadership  taking ownership and recognition of your work Continue to regularly monitor our royalty system  including analyse movements and abnormalities  and ensuring that they align continue to with Canva’s strategic direction while working with Product and Finance to make adjustments Work with the team on researching the competitive landscape  including ensuring how we can present the most appealing opportunity for Canva Creators Improve the lives and livelihoods of thousands of Creators (and growing!) while creating business value for Canva  on our mission to empower the world to design.  Experience you’ll need Strong competency with SQL  experience with data warehouses such as Snowflake  Redshift  or BigQuery is a plus! Experience wrangling and analysing data using Python or R Extensive experience communicating with senior stakeholders A track-record of tackling complex problems and delivering simple  elegant solutions. You hold a high-bar for elegant  strategic and scalable financial solutions Experience with very large data sets is a huge plus  but not required Deep understanding of how to uncover user needs through research and user empathy Moderate execution experience so that you understand some of the intricacies of delivery A strong sense of ethics - understanding that the decisions we make at Canva impact millions of lives  everyday  You enjoy a little flexibility in your work. Our growth means there are constantly new things to work on every day  as such it’s likely that you’ll often be working across the board on new and exciting projects.  The Canva workspace is set up for you to do your best work and have a great time doing so  with breakout areas  little nooks  and quiet places to retreat.  If you're seeking professional growth and enjoy working on large  distributed  cloud-based applications that delight our millions of individual and business users alike - then apply now to be considered for the position!  If you require visa sponsorship  you must ensure you have at least two (2) years of post-University commercial experience as a Software Engineer and meet the mandatory sponsorship requirements laid out by the Department of Home Affairs.  We will not accept or review any CVs from external recruitment agencies.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist

We do this through data automation  data governance and robust reporting primarily utilizing the Power platform. We provide advice and direction  translating business and user requirements  to help determine the best solution for their data needs.  In this role  with your innovative thinking and technical skills  you will develop and coordinate solutions to support a data-driven Growth team. You will identify opportunities for innovation and efficiency with a particular focus on Power BI reporting and analytics.  Responsibilities Will Include Develop Power BI reports to meet the needs of the Growth team  aligning data from multiple sources into high-value  informative reporting Proactively engage with business leaders/groups to understand their needs and foster data-centric thinking Inform business leaders of trends and insights by interpreting data into what this means for them Stay informed of latest Power BI software developments to leverage maximum value Collaborate with other business reporting functions to ensure consistency and streamline data processes and reporting Training and user support to promote self-service and understanding Identify opportunities for improvements and challenge the status quo and others to innovate and make a real difference. Contribute to a positive working environment where people are motivated to do their best to help the business achieve its objectives. Promote a curious mindset and facilitate the introduction of new concepts and technologies. About You Power BI experience is essential (Power Query Formula Language  Complex DAX functions  Data modelling principles  Report development) Experience in R  SQL  Excel desirable Excellent communication skills  able to engage with all levels of the business  including the leadership team Work with a broad range of stakeholders to frame and implement key initiatives to support data-driven insights Strong analytical skills  including data analysis  and understanding of statistics Support internal and external business reporting  ensuring high quality and attention to detail Able to interpret complex data into actionable insights Identify opportunities for innovation and efficiency within data gathering and reporting We offer a competitive remuneration & benefits package  a friendly  professional and dynamic working environment with the opportunity to develop your career prospects globally.  Worley recognises the value of equal employment opportunity and is committed to promoting fairness  equity and diversity in its workplace hence we encourage applications from people with a variety of experience and backgrounds. In addition  we recognise that everyone’s personal circumstances differ and thus understand the importance of offering flexibility in the working arrangements of our personnel.  You must have current unrestricted working rights for Australia to be eligible for consideration and only those candidates with appropriate qualifications and experience will be contacted directly. Title: Senior Data Analyst
Requirements: This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst with strong business instincts  creativity and analytics expertise. Reporting to the VP of Product and Data  you will apply these skills to build data  analytics and insights foundations that enable informed and objective product decisions that maximize the creation of customer and business value.  Key aspects of the role Drive a culture of measurement and analysis that enables us to understand the usage and performance of Honey products Support the product team with insights and data that enables experiments that move our metrics in line with core objectives Build and maintain dashboards that enable the product team and our partners across the business to understand overall performance Identify high impact opportunities for analysis and align analytics and data activities with the company strategy and product roadmap Own projects  data models  dashboards  and other artefacts and keep them up-to-date and of a high quality  in a hyper growth environment Collaborate with brilliant engineers in an agile environment  using modern tools and techniques to create the data infrastructure that underpins Honey Requirements 5+ years experience years of data analytics experience ideally in consumer products Proven experience applying your analytics skills to initiatives that have had a positive impact on company level business and product decisions Demonstrable track record working with Product Management  Product Design and Engineering teams applying an agile approach to your work Proficiency in working with data warehouse technologies and BI tools Expertise in data manipulation and statistical programming languages such as SQL  R and Python  as well as knowledge of cloud data environments Experience in using statistics as part of your role (e.g. regressions  A/B tests  forecasting) Strong ability to communicate  explaining complex concepts to broad audiences  and telling compelling stories that articulate data insights You are a positive person  a resourceful go-getter who can inspire through data analytics A degree in a quantitative field (e.g. statistics  mathematics  physics  or computer science) Benefits  At Honey  we like to do things a bit differently. You’ll notice this from the very first time you meet with one of our talented team  right through to your first day at Honey. We challenge expectations  are always looking to make a difference  questioning what we’re doing and asking if there’s a better way. We are exceptional at what we do and every single one of us brings a unique talent to Honey. We are incredibly resourceful and bring great energy and a can-do attitude to every conversation  where everyone has an equal voice and we know a good idea can come from anywhere.  We are proud that every one of our team has equity in Honey  that’s right from everyone in the call centre through to the team leading this business we all own a piece of the pie. That means we all have the same goals and aspirations for changing the current home insurance landscape. We all know there is a ‘better’ way of doing this insurance thing and we are all passionate about making this the ‘new’ way. The Honey way. Honey will be your proudest moment on your CV  it will be the job in ten years time you look back on and feel chest puffed out proud about  not only because of the success of the company but because of what we built. Together.  Are you in? If so  read on.  Why we’re different  Honey is Australia’s first smart home insurance for the modern-day homeowner  renter or landlord  on a mission to eliminate the majority of avoidable accidents that happen in the home. We do this through a re-imagined approach to home insurance that lets customers easily sign-up with the right level of cover by using satellite and third party data  and then provide customers with smart home technology to help protect their homes.  Honey took Australia by storm when it launched in June 2021 with the largest Seed funding round in Australian history of $15.5 million led by RACQ  AGL  Mirvac  Metricon and many other industry leading Australian companies. And we are growing fast.  We offer a hybrid working environment and fantastic benefits.

Title: Digital Insights Analyst
Requirements: Job Description  The opportunity  Reporting to the Digital Analytics & Insights Manager  one of your key responsibilities is to produce ongoing end-to-end customer journey analysis by integrating data from the online and offline platforms. With deep understanding of online/offline data and business context  you will work closely with the Digital team in providing actionable insights across the BUPA digital estate.  Insights will focus on Digital sales  service  and/or engagement and include (not limited to) recommendations towards optimisation & personalisation hypothesis  conversion improvement opportunities  reporting  dashboard development and ad hoc investigations. You should be able to synthesize the work of multiple team members into a cohesive result and can translate the complexity of online and offline data into clearly articulated communications.  We currently have 2 x Permanent Full-Time vacancies  and you can be based in Melbourne  Sydney  Brisbane  or Adelaide with work from home option available.  How will I help?  Key Accountabilities Include Integration of digital and enterprise data to perform end-to-end customer journey analysis Proactively assess website traffic and analyse online customer behaviour to provide insights and recommend actions for improvement in the user experience and website conversion. Contribute to support optimisation & personalisation activities through ideation  actionable insights from data  hypotheses generation. Create accessible self-service dashboards and actionable insights that are fact based  intuitive and re-usable. Support the Digital Insights lead in developing an efficient digital analytics ‘factory’ with appropriate balance of automation and deeper bespoke reporting. Actively contribute to the standardization of the digital data layer through solid understanding of key building blocks of data strategy  for example an understanding of the role of the data layer (re-use  standardisation) and how data is collected and stored What’s in it for me?  As well as a competitive salary  a range of Bupa benefits and flexible working/ work from home arrangements  you’ll be challenged and encouraged to innovate. You will partner with colleagues who are dedicated to delivering exceptional experiences. We respect and consider everyone  knowing your difference will make the difference.  Perk Highlights Discount on our health insurance  travel  car  home  contents and pet insurance products as well as discounts when you attend a Bupa Dental clinic or purchase glasses from a Bupa Optical store. A dedicated internal wellbeing team provides you with a range of services  such as a global resilience program  regular training opportunities on a range of wellbeing topics and access to a variety of wellbeing discounts. An additional well-being day each year to treat yourself. What do I need? Demonstrated experience in using web analytics tools and testing tools such as Adobe Analytics or Google Analytics  Adobe Target  Optimisely and a tag management system such as Tealium or Google Tag Manager is a mandatory pre-requisite. Experience in customer data platforms such as Tealium Audience Stream to contribute in the website personalisation activities is desirable Experience in SQL  SAS  R or Python as a scripting language is advantageous. Someone who can not only extract the data but can proactively provide insights and recommended actions for digital optimisation. In other words  you’re a great ‘story teller’. Use data to drive an optimisation program  supporting hypotheses put forward by stakeholders and successfully improving onsite conversion. About Bupa Asia Pacific  Bupa is an international healthcare group which has been committed to a purpose of helping people live longer  healthier  happier lives and making a better world for more than 70 years.  Bupa Asia Pacific operates in Australia  New Zealand and Hong Kong  supporting about 6.5 million customers through a broad range of health and care services including health insurance  aged care  dental  medical  optical and hearing services. Employing more than 20 000 people in the region  we believe that we can make a real difference to the lives of customers through our values  purpose and the way that we deliver personalised care.  Since 2002  we have reinvested approximately $6 billion in the region  with the Bupa Foundation investing more than $34 million to support 130+ health and care projects.  Our people reflect the diversity of our community. At Bupa  your wellbeing  identity and own story is respected and valued.  Time Type  Full time

Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: Company Description  Every person at Leidos plays an important and valued role bringing science  engineering and technology together to produce practical solutions for our customers’ most complex problems. It’s how we help to make the world safer  healthier and more efficient - work that matters and a mission  like those of our customers  we are passionate about. We’re open minded  ambitious and committed to enabling our people to do their best work  to be inspired by what they can achieve and the impact they can have.  Here in Australia  we’re agile and growing fast. Our 1 400 employees are busy building an enviable reputation for innovation and delivery. And  as part of a US-based organisation with 37 000 people and a 50 year history  we are able to draw upon world-leading technical expertise to help us provide the best solutions to our customers.  Job Description  Your New Role  As the Data Analyst  you will be supporting for critical information management capabilities for the Health Knowledge Management System. The successful candidate will play a vital role in analysing current system data  developing target state mappings  and assisting the execution data migration to the new solution. The successful candidate will also contribute to the establishment of Master Data Management and Data Quality Management functions.  Tasks Include Support data migration strategy and execution plan Liaise with Project Managers  Solution Architect/Engineers in the scoping and estimating for new initiatives Leading the establishment of DQM  MDM  and data synchronisation processes Developing and establishing best practice information management standards and guidelines Facilitate monitoring and rectification of identified data quality  governance  or security issues Identifying potential risks and issues  and mitigations to resolve them Investigating data quality issues/errors/flaws in the current setup and identify ways to improve systems performance and efficiency by suggesting best practices in line with the organisations’ processes and system deployment standards Complying with applicable standards  processes and governance Support Data Management team and work closely with development teams  other technical stakeholders and external vendors  Qualifications  About You and What You'll Bring  You Will Also Have  Coupled with your Information Management skills  education and program experience  you will demonstrate a pro-active approach with the ability to understand the business  identify issues and develop relationships to achieve the company’s objectives. Data Modelling Experience Working knowledge of SQL and experience producing quality reports using tools such as Microsoft PowerBI  Qlik  and Tableau Demonstrable experience supporting large complex data migrations Proven experience in the Information Management domain including reporting and analysis  information lifecycle management  and data governance (Desirable) Experience with MDM and DQM products from TIBCO  Talend  Informatica  or IBM Experience extracting  transforming  and analysing raw data and turning this into intelligence  ideally in a healthcare setting Excellent communication skills and a history of successful customers engagement Ability to consult directly with customers and offer strategic advice as well as consulting experience within agile environments Demonstrated ability to operate at a consistently high level in isolation and as a team player. Experience working with Agile products such as Jira and Confluence Understanding of the healthcare operational environment and experience with clinical software applications/ information systems is highly desirable. Experience with Health specific data interoperability standards such as HL7 and FHIR is desirable  This role requires the successful applicant to be an Australian Citizen and be able to hold an Australian security clearance.  This position can be based in Canberra or Scoresby VIC  What You’ll Love  Additional Information  At Leidos you’ll enjoy 12 weeks’ paid parental leave as a primary carer  flexible work practices  discounted health insurance  novated leasing and more. Foster your career through complete access to learning and development and mentoring opportunities  we have a strong track record of internal promotion and career transitions. Join a company who acknowledges “People First”.

Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: Your impact  As a Data Analyst  you will play a key role in working with customers to understand their business requirements  map these to their data capabilities  liaise with our internal Data Engineers to design and build elegant solutions  then partner with our customers to deploy those solutions in a way that allows them to turn data into insight. You will have 2-3 years’ experience working as a Data Analyst (or similar role) on data-related solutions  preferably using AWS  and will be comfortable working with business analysts  data visualisers  data engineers and data scientists  to enable customers to solve their data-related challenges.  You will relish the opportunity to innovate  evolve and challenge existing assumptions and to develop the data-related requirements that feed into the design of solutions that solve real-world problems for customers. Your experience with large-scale data challenges and ability to analyse them as input into reliable  scalable cloud-based solutions  will see you thriving in this role!  Expectations  Enjoy honing your data-related analysis skills and developing new ones  so you can make strong contributions to solution discussions. Regularly take part in further education and training to help you hone and extend your data analysis skills. Have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about solutions to business  product  and technical challenges. Possess an innate awareness of technology trends and how they impact the way businesses consume IT. Strong Analytics skills to collect  analyze and generate insight using data. Have a basic understanding of IT security and governance including security standards  access policies  and data classification schema. Love what you do and instinctively know how to make work fun. Be dynamic  creative  and willing to take on challenges that have the potential to make a big impact. Relish a ground floor opportunity to work in a small  agile  friendly startup environment. A Graduate degree (or Masters) in a data or technology-related discipline is preferred. An AWS Associate Solutions Architect certification is a bonus.     Qualifications  Technical Requirements:  2+ years of:  o Hands on  practical experience  in and around data-related solutions  o AWS experience  o A basic understanding of software development tools and methodologies  o Data analysis experience  o Experience producing quality documentation and written communications  · Familiarity with DevOps tools such as Bitbucket  Bamboo  Jenkins or Ansible  · Some experience with both writing and interpreting SQL queries.  · Experience building reports and dashboards using BI tools such as Tableau  PowerBI or Amazon QuickSight.  · A basic understanding of Infrastructure as Code  especially AWS Cloudformation.  · Some programming skills in one or more of the following languages: Python  Java  Node.js  .Net  PHP.  · A basic understanding of data ingestion and transformation pipelines.  · A basic understanding of fundamental data concepts including databases  data schema  data classification  data security  data governance  data analysis  data transformation  data engineering and data science.  · A basic understanding of fundamental networking concepts.    Additional Information  We’re passionate about the technical community we are a part of  and believe in contributing to open source and AWS initiatives We care about climate change and are always looking at ways to reduce our carbon footprint We support and contribute to a different cause each quarter We’re committed to developing your career with customised individual growth and development plans We’re committed to ensuring all our staff feel welcome  included and respected every day they work for The Data Foundry

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Requirements: At MMSG we help customers get more out of their money through salary packaging and Novated leasing. There’s now an opportunity to better understand our customers to help them on their journeys and show them ways where they could be saving more.  MMSG pioneered salary packaging and novated leasing in Australia. Whilst we’ve grown from a small  family-run business to a global  Top 200 ASX-listed company  that entrepreneurial spirit remains at the heart of everything we do.  About The Role  The i ncreasing demand for digital engagement has created an opportunity for a Marketing Data Analyst to join the Marketing and Digital Team.  The Data Analyst team enjoys significant freedom in project opportunities  and you will be set up for success with access to a suite of tools at your disposal. This role is perfectly suited for someone who is ready to show what they can do and make impactful business change. Whilst the core role is analytics  statistics  and data science modelling  success will come from someone who has strong business acumen and a deep understanding of marketing and sales processes.  Don't let the location deter you - we're open to talking to candidates across Australia.  Key Responsibilities Represent and champion the Marketing Data Science brand within the MMSG Group in a professional manner. Deliver comprehensive results to stakeholders through means such as presentations and information sessions  ensuring consistency of quality  and value to the business. Liaise with business stakeholders in requirements and information gathering. Developing analytical/insight project plans to ensure milestones and deadlines are achievable and met. Applying out-of-the-box thinking for solutions and options  challenging the status quo when necessary. Identifying and leveraging market knowledge/experience of consumer behaviour to guide analytical direction. Foster a wide business understanding to ensure the appropriateness of approach  output and identification of new opportunities. Develop standards  tools and best practices to enhance Marketing Data\Information Governance and Data Management. Be involved in all aspects of the project life-cycle  including Strategy  Road-Mapping  Architecture  Implementation and Development. What we are looking for? Strong experience in Marketing Analytics e.g. Sales & Conversion insights analysis Fluency in R and SQL  R  caret  ggplot  tidyverse Experience in delivering practical analysis in a business environment and end to end analytical projects An eagerness to solve complex problems in environments that are often ambiguous  technologically challenged and require creative and lateral thinking Strong written communication skills demonstrated by the ability to produce sound written reports and technical documentation and preset the same to varied groups of stakeholders H igh-level understanding of data modelling  ETL development  and data warehousing is desirable Experience building up and enhancing Information Governance and Data Management is desirable What We Can Offer You Our strong people-first culture Flexible/hybrid working to enhance your work/life balance Novated lease benefits and discounts 12 weeks Paid Parental leave and access to our Parents Portal Exempt Employee Share Plan Paid Income Protection Insurance under MMSG default Super plan Access to a broad range of learning and development programs Career break and volunteering leave Access to Employee Assistance Program and annual Flu vaccination Lifestyle Rewards program McMillan Shakespeare are an equal opportunity employer who are committed to creating a workplace where everyone is included  treated fairly and with respect. We appreciate the strength that diversity brings and welcome candidates from all backgrounds  Indigenous Australians and people with a disability to apply.  Please note all successful candidates will be required to undergo background checks.

Title: Data Analyst  M&C Saatchi - Precision
Requirements: Innovation and creativity only thrive in a truly inclusive culture. At M&C Saatchi Group  we celebrate people who embrace these values.  People with an innate curiosity – who appreciate different perspectives and respect others. People who hunger for the new  the brilliant  the unexpected.  M&C Saatchi Group / Precision  Precision is M&C Saatchi Groups Marketing Sciences Practice and we believe that creativity is the most influential force in marketing today.  Like any other positive force  the impact of creativity can be magnified through Precision. Which is why Precision sits at the heart of our group operating model  partnering with our creative businesses to create a unique and powerful union between art and science or as we prefer to say  creativity and quantification.  We’ve helped some of the country's most recognisable brands deliver Creativity with Precision to benefit their bottom line  including TAB  Big W  Lexus and BWS. Would you like to join us on our journey?  What’s in it for you?  Interested? Here are 8 reasons why we think you should seriously consider working at M&C Saatchi Precision. You have a voice : Your opinion and ideas matter  so if you want to have a meaningful impact on where you work  look no further! Work with purpose : Join our mission is to enable ‘Creativity with Precision’ and feel what it’s like to get out of bed everyday with a spring in your step. Contribute to business growth : Want to see where and how your work impacts the bottom line? Then you’ll love the full commercial transparency of our team. Diversity of work : We work with dozens of different clients  from household names like TAB to start-ups brands like 86 400. So don’t expect any two days to feel the same! Trust & responsibility : We offer real ownership of projects and products so you can stretch and grow in ways you didn’t think were possible. Learn how to problem solve : Problem solving is the #1 business skill everyone needs to learn. We solve significant problems for our clients every week meaning you’ll be an expert in no time. Job satisfaction : Nothing beats the feeling of a job well done and we you’ll be enjoying that feeling a lot! T-shaped development : Learn and explore every facet of Marketing Science so you can find your passion.  Key Responsibilities Contribute to the execution and delivery of M&C Saatchi's Marketing Sciences agenda. Own the delivery and ongoing development of M&C Saatchi's Business & Marketing Intelligence platform. Support the rapid production of proof of concept and test cases to support project scope. Collaborate on analytical projects that require a working knowledge of statistical and modelling techniques. Manage projects with agency and client engagement to ensure projects achieve their agreed goals and are delivered on time and on budget.  Key Strengths Strong knowledge and experience in BI systems such as Datorama  Power BI and Google Data Studio. Comfortable and capable with Analytics solutions such as Google Analytics. Working knowledge of digital media and its common platforms and data sets. Understanding of CRM solutions such as Oracle Eloqua  Hubspot or Salesforce Customer 360 would be beneficial. Strong and logical approach to problem solving and an investigative and inquisitive mind. Ability to communicate with clarity  completeness and specificity Wizard or mage level abilities in excel a plus!  Our Values  At M&C Saatchi  we’re bonded by an insatiable CURIOSITY for the changing world. We share a HUNGER for the win  the new  the brilliant  the unexpected. Others talk  we do. Without ACTION we are nothing.  We are a diverse and loyal family  we RESPECT each other’s talents  individuality and unite as one.  These values guide our people and our business.  Wait  there’s more!  A fun  inclusive and high performance culture  where you can bring your best and true self to work everyday.  Where mentoring  flexible and innovative ways of working and generous Parental Leave are just some of the benefits of working at M&C Saatchi Group.  With 9 diverse businesses across the Group  you’ll find a wealth of experience  talent and career paths.  And hopefully  a second family.  We are a 2022 Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.  To protect the health and safety of all our employees and clients  M&C Saatchi Group takes all reasonable and necessary measures to maintain a COVID-19 safe workplace. We are currently considering the way forward  however it may be a condition of this role that you are fully vaccinated against COVID-19. If you have any questions or concerns in relation to this  please let us know during your application process.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Requirements: Posted by Geraint Cooper 2nd Senior Principal Consultant at Salt Send InMail Salt is partnering with one of Australia’s leading Financial Services organisations in search of a Senior Data Analyst within Remediation Analytics.   This role will give you the opportunity to work in Data Analysis as well as Data Science  continually improving customers’ experience and outcomes by uplifting remediation delivery.   You will demonstrate your expertise within cross-functional teams and value chain to ensure customers are remediated fairly  accurately and in a timely manner  as well as develop best-in-class machine learning methods to proactively detect remediation scenarios.     About the role  Source applicable data from various legacy and cloud data environments and systems to be used for remediation analytics  Highlight potential technology processes and system changes to obtain data  Obtain data to identify impacted customers and required compensation  Develop cutting-edge Machine Learning and AI models for proactive analytics  Ensure technical analytics resources have the data  tools and context to effectively analyse event data  Develop and maintain important documentation that describes the remediation event and the systems  Coordinate analytical output of the team  Build and maintain strong relationships with stakeholders like event owners and business SMEs  Contribute to management of remediation events inclusive of resource management  timelines  deliverables  and project management for remediation analytics     About you  Proven typical data sourcing - ETL requirement gathering  planning  risks  issues  and the presentation  communication  and treatment  Experience working in a similar position with knowledge of core data principles such as Data Science (model development and production pipelines)  Engineering and Analysis.  Strong understanding of Machine Learning methods  especially Anomaly Detection and NLP  Experienced in working with Python and working knowledge in cloud environments (AWS) and tools  A collaborative approach to facilitate a productive squad dynamic  Strong problem-solving skills and a continuous improvement mindset and willingness to learn and share  Excellent communication and presentation skills  with the ability to relay technical jargon  Some previous experience working across banking products  regulatory and industry landscape is preferred  Highly collaborative approach to facilitate a productive  and dynamic squad of elite data experts

Thank you for your interest in working with us. Whilst we would love the chance to speak to every applicant unfortunately that's not always possible. Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: See yourself being part of a large  transformational change? This could be the role for you!  Who we are?  At Iress  we believe technology should help people perform better every day. Since our beginning in 1993  people across financial services have trusted us to take their performance to the next level. From the world’s most established financial brands to new and disruptive players  we help improve every aspect of our clients’ businesses so that they can work better  every day.  Iress is one of Australia’s largest technology companies and employs more than 2 250 people across Australia  United Kingdom  South Africa  Canada  New Zealand and Asia.  Role Purpose  Iress products are complex and we have a wide range of users and use cases across to support the needs of different markets.  In addition Iress stores large amounts of data about our clients and the nature of their relationship with Iress.  The purpose of this role is to unlock the value of what we know about our client base to better target the sales and service activities.  This includes identifying opportunities with new and existing clients as well as better supporting the current service model (e.g. operational efficiencies  bottlenecks)  Therefore this position requires someone who has great analytical and problem solving skills  high attention to detail  embodies our values and culture  and is passionate about delivering the best software to clients and end-users.  Accountabilities & Deliverables Formulate insights and provide recommendations to  improve sales activity  better focus (and streamline) sales and service activity  improve client experiences through an improved service models and shape the Iress’ market offer. Develop and deliver ongoing reporting solutions (e.g data inputs  reports  dashboards etc.) to support sales and account management activity. Deliver any reporting\dashboard in a manner that can be leveraged globally. Prepare inputs for ongoing management and board reporting. Build the capability across the client facing teams to continuously improve data insights. Deliver analysis and reporting to the global commercial team across the sales and service functions. Core Skills  Knowledge And Attributes Minimum 5 years’ experience in technology  ideally in financial advice or wealth management technology  including a minimum 2 years’ experience as a Data Analyst Experience using data analytics\business intelligence tools to build dashboards to support key business functions of sales and account management Strong commercial acumen and finance knowledge Tertiary qualifications in Business  Information Technology and/or Finance are highly desirable. Familiarity with Scrum and lean agile practices Outstanding written  verbal and presentation-style communication skills High proficiency in SQL Experience using data analytics\business intelligence tools to build dashboard (Quicksight  PowerBI  Tableau etc) Outstanding written  verbal and presentation-style communication skills Ability to influence stakeholders across the organisation to deliver outcomes Ability to understand complex business challenges  opportunities and risks  seek out the right data and translate it into actionable insights Proficiency in Python Experience in data warehousing and analytics  including using AWS technologies – S3  Glue  Athena  Quicksight etc. Why Iress? 6 paid days per year to extend your weekends State-of-the-art offices Equity grants for our top 25% performers Annual Profit Share when Iress meets its annual profit targets Access to learning and development programs through Udemy 3 days’ leave per year for charity initiatives Global 36-hour hackathon Starting school leave - 8.5 days of leave to assist your kids with the transition to school Discounted health insurance premiums Up to 26 weeks’ paid parental leave for primary carers (up to 4 weeks for secondary carers)  and the ability to work part-time when returning to work. Employment Type Employee Time Type Full time

Title: Data Analytics and Insights Analyst
Requirements: Sydney  Utilise your prior experience in identifying and communicating data-driven insights as a Data Analytics and Insights Analyst and join our Data Modelling and BI Centre of Excellence.  What impact will you have?  Supported by an established team of data engineers and solution architects  as a data modeler you will design  implement  and document data architecture and data modelling solutions. These solutions support enterprise information management  business intelligence  and other business interests. Key responsibilities will include: working with finance and business stakeholders  and application/solution teams to implement data strategies  build data flows  and develop conceptual and logical data models having regards to business and regulatory drivers. implementing business data requirements through new data strategies and designs across all data platforms (relational (e.g. MS SQL Server)  dimensional  and NoSQL (e.g. Cloudera) and data tools (reporting  visualization  and analytics) defining and governing data modelling and design standards  tools  best practices  risk management and related development for enterprise data models identifying architecture  infrastructure  and interfaces to data sources  tools supporting automated data loads  security concerns  analytic models  and data visualization building data and analytics capabilities by partnering with Finance  Business and Technology teams across all aspects of the Information Management life cycle developing and implementing robust report production processes and oversee handover to aligned operational teams developing an intimate understanding of the flow of data through the organisation. Interrogate and investigate the Data Warehouse to deliver an improved reporting & analysis toolkit  supporting strategic decision making across the broader organisation championing the use of enterprise data management and governance frameworks for data and analytics via Collibra What skills will you use?  You will bring with you three or more years hands on experience in data modelling  data analysis  management reporting or similar roles. You will also possess: an understanding of data modelling and data warehouse concepts  data architecture principles and the ability to extract and transform data from multiple sources proficient in using traditional data bases like MS SQL Server or Teradata and data processing confident user of work flow automation  analytics or visualisation applications such as Alteryx  Power BI or comparable products exposure to big data architecture and platform solutions tools Strong academic results and / or professional qualifications. Our team values diverse points of view  is action-oriented and energetic. We worked flexibly before Covid-19 and even more so now  and we are proud of our mix of locations  levels and backgrounds. We have a flexible approach to working underpinned by the commitment to deliver to a high standard for our Macquarie stakeholders.  If you value flexibility and diversity  have a passion for data with a proven track record of delivering outcomes  we would love to hear from you. Please reach out to Maddy Wilson if you would like to learn more at maddy.wilson@macquarie.com  About The Financial Management Group  The Financial Management Group provides financial  tax and treasury services to all areas of Macquarie. The group is focused on providing strategic analysis and advice to Macquarie's businesses and senior management  managing Macquarie's funding  liquidity and capital position  ensuring Macquarie continues to meet regulatory and compliance obligations and managing Macquarie's corporate affairs.  Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion  The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths  and in combination with our inclusive environment  it enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people  clients  shareholders and communities. From day one  you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us  please apply. With the right technology  support and resources  our people can work in a range of flexible ways.  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you  and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.  About Macquarie  A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills  explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition  helping sustain global food supplies  financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie  we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.  Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups  disciplines  sectors and borders. With 17 000+ employees and offices in 33 markets around the world  we’re a truly global organisation.  You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives  ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us  you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.  Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management  retail and business banking  wealth management  leasing and asset financing  market access  commodity trading  renewables development  specialist advisory  capital raising and principal investment.  Find out more at www.macquarie.com/careers  Job no: FMG-962179  Work type: Permanent - Full time  Location: Sydney  Category: Mid-level  Data & Analytics  Group: Financial Management Group  Division: FMG Central  Recruiter: Verity Morison  Opening Date: 19/1/2022

Title: Analytics Consultant
Requirements: Job Summary  Thanks to recent successes AECOM is seeking experienced Analytics Consultants at all levels.  As a member of the Australia New Zealand Analytics Team you will be a key part of our Digital Consulting offering to our biggest clients  particularly in the Transportation  Resources and Government sectors.  You will be part of a high performing  Australia-wide team responsible for descriptive  predictive and prescriptive analytics including simulation modelling of infrastructure and operations  machine learning  natural language processing and dashboarding.  You will support the preparation  modelling and analysis of client data and apply data science  operations research and AI techniques to solve real-world problems.  A self-motivated and inquisitive individual would best suit this role with a combination of on-the-job and self-paced training provided.  Minimum Requirements At least 2 years relevant experience  ideally in a consulting environment A strong sense of commitment  a willingness to learn  and a desire to work in a dynamic consulting environment The following experience would be highly desirable: Python or C# Power BI or Tableau Discrete event simulation Web development Knowledge of operations research techniques This role involves regular contact with clients so very good interpersonal skills with an ability to focus on client requirements is a must. Strong analytical and data manipulation skills  Preferred Qualifications Tertiary qualification in Mathematics  Data Science  Computer Science or Engineering or similar numerate discipline Certified Analytics Professional or similar accreditations desirable  What We Offer  We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office  remote location or at a client site  you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity  entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.  You will help us foster a culture of equity  diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace  where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents  backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.  We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on  the teams and committees you join and our business.  We offer competitive pay and benefits  well-being programs to support you and your family  and the development resources you need to advance your career.  When you join us  you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners  designers  engineers  scientists  consultants  program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.  As an Equal Opportunity Employer  we believe in each person’s potential  and we’ll help you reach yours.  Job Category Engineering - Transportation - Advisory  Business Line Transportation  Business Group Design and Consulting Services Group (DCS)  Country Australia  Position Status Full Time  Requisition/Vacancy No. 265056BR  Additional Locations AU - Brisbane  QLD  AU - Melbourne  VIC - Collins Square  AU - Sydney  NSW  Virtual: No  Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race  color  religion  sex  national origin  sexual orientation  gender identity  disability or protected veteran status.

Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: See yourself being part of a large  transformational change? This could be the role for you!  Who we are?  At Iress  we believe technology should help people perform better every day. Since our beginning in 1993  people across financial services have trusted us to take their performance to the next level. From the world’s most established financial brands to new and disruptive players  we help improve every aspect of our clients’ businesses so that they can work better  every day.  Iress is one of Australia’s largest technology companies and employs more than 2 250 people across Australia  United Kingdom  South Africa  Canada  New Zealand and Asia.  Role Purpose  Iress products are complex and we have a wide range of users and use cases across to support the needs of different markets.  In addition Iress stores large amounts of data about our clients and the nature of their relationship with Iress.  The purpose of this role is to unlock the value of what we know about our client base to better target the sales and service activities.  This includes identifying opportunities with new and existing clients as well as better supporting the current service model (e.g. operational efficiencies  bottlenecks)  Therefore this position requires someone who has great analytical and problem solving skills  high attention to detail  embodies our values and culture  and is passionate about delivering the best software to clients and end-users.  Accountabilities & Deliverables Formulate insights and provide recommendations to  improve sales activity  better focus (and streamline) sales and service activity  improve client experiences through an improved service models and shape the Iress’ market offer. Develop and deliver ongoing reporting solutions (e.g data inputs  reports  dashboards etc.) to support sales and account management activity. Deliver any reporting\dashboard in a manner that can be leveraged globally. Prepare inputs for ongoing management and board reporting. Build the capability across the client facing teams to continuously improve data insights. Deliver analysis and reporting to the global commercial team across the sales and service functions. Core Skills  Knowledge And Attributes Minimum 5 years’ experience in technology  ideally in financial advice or wealth management technology  including a minimum 2 years’ experience as a Data Analyst Experience using data analytics\business intelligence tools to build dashboards to support key business functions of sales and account management Strong commercial acumen and finance knowledge Tertiary qualifications in Business  Information Technology and/or Finance are highly desirable. Familiarity with Scrum and lean agile practices Outstanding written  verbal and presentation-style communication skills High proficiency in SQL Experience using data analytics\business intelligence tools to build dashboard (Quicksight  PowerBI  Tableau etc) Outstanding written  verbal and presentation-style communication skills Ability to influence stakeholders across the organisation to deliver outcomes Ability to understand complex business challenges  opportunities and risks  seek out the right data and translate it into actionable insights Proficiency in Python Experience in data warehousing and analytics  including using AWS technologies – S3  Glue  Athena  Quicksight etc. Why Iress? 6 paid days per year to extend your weekends State-of-the-art offices Equity grants for our top 25% performers Annual Profit Share when Iress meets its annual profit targets Access to learning and development programs through Udemy 3 days’ leave per year for charity initiatives Global 36-hour hackathon Starting school leave - 8.5 days of leave to assist your kids with the transition to school Discounted health insurance premiums Up to 26 weeks’ paid parental leave for primary carers (up to 4 weeks for secondary carers)  and the ability to work part-time when returning to work. Employment Type Employee Time Type Full time

Title: Analytics Consultant
Requirements: Nous is a great place to work... Nous Group (Nous) is a leading Australian owned management consulting and leadership development firm. We are a values based organisation that partners with clients to solve society’s most complex and demanding problems. Working in unique  cross-disciplinary teams we create innovative and enduring solutions that improve the lives of all Australians. We work with leading ASX companies  government and not for profit organisations in Australia and we are growing internationally.  Nous was recognised as ‘Best Management Consulting Firm  Australia’ in the 2017 Australian Financial Review Client Choice Awards  and was most recently recognised as Australia’s top workplace  ranking first in the 2021 Great Places to Work Awards.  As an Analytics Consultant  you will have the opportunity to blend your advanced analytics skills with traditional consulting.  At Nous you have the autonomy to focus on development  and we will provide the support to ensure that you reach your potential. As a consultant at Nous  you will build trusting and credible relationships with clients on projects  demonstrate a good understanding of Nous business offers/sector issues  and contribute valuable content to projects and proposals by articulating sound knowledge of Nous business offers  methodologies and digital tools aligned to client contexts.  You are: passionate and driven about doing work that matters and creates positive influence  in an environment that values diversity and thrives on creativity creative  you think about new ways of using data  new sources and combinations of data and analytical methods to generate insights a collaborator  You bring energy and enthusiasm for collaborating with others throughout the project design and delivery process intelligent and academically accomplished – a distinction average or above is essential self-directed  you enjoy working in a self-managed environment with lots of autonomy enthusiastic and interested in working across our service lines and a variety of sectors  And the practical experience: defining the analytical scope and method for projects experience using advanced analytics and modelling techniques to help solve complex business and policy problems applying best practices to the management and manipulation of data combining datasets to generate new insight experience with R  SQL and Tableau/Power BI (or demonstrated ability to learn new programming languages and technologies) strong analytical skills and the capacity to interpret qualitative and quantitative data the capability to think  articulate and write logically strong problem solving ability applied in a structured way ideally  work experience and education in areas related to our sectors and capability areas (look under Work at nousgroup.com to learn more)  Finally  the important details... Nous is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds  including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people. Nous is a flexible workplace that offers consulting opportunities on a full-time and part-time basis.  We seek people who demonstrate an ability to work effectively with individuals with diverse backgrounds. We are committed to diversity and inclusion.  If you have experience working on complex problems and want to be part of a dynamic team that puts people at the centre of everything  then we'd love to hear from you! Please click Apply below.  To apply for a role at Nous in Australia you must have Australian Permanent Residency or right to work in Australia.  Please note if you are successful in the recruitment process  you will be required to undertake background screening prior to your commencement at Nous.

Title: Campaign Analytics Analyst
Requirements: Let’s talk about the opportunity! Latitude is growing and changing at rapid rate and more then ever we need to ensure our marketing effectiveness across our products is making a real impact with our customers and is used to drive customer engagement and incremental volume to the business.  Positioned as part of Chief Data office  no day will ever be the same  which will allow you to flex your experience from managing the end-to-end delivery of customer communications and offers  including pre-analysis  execution  performance review and fulfilment  as well as the generation of customer and portfolio insights across Latitude Financial Services. This role will see you have touch points with stakeholders both internally and externally  so the ability to communicate recommendations on how to design test & learns that result in measurable outcomes will be important.  Reporting to the Analytics & Insights Manager you will be involved with:  Generate analytical insights from LFS customer base and product portfolios  to support business initiatives  solve business problems and drive incremental value to the business Campaign execution including both ad-hoc and BAU campaigns  for all the portfolios within LFS  keep campaign contact history up to date and complete the fulfilment process as required. Improve the ROI for Marketing Campaigns for both prospecting  cross-sell and lifecycle marketing  through the provision of pre-campaign targeting  campaign execution and post implementation reviews SME for executing / managing data driven campaigns as well as both digital and traditional campaign execution channels Managing campaign engine optimization and automation  Who you are? In addition to great comms and your impressive leadership qualities  you feel comfortable dealing with ambiguity and conflicting deadlines and priorities. You take great pride in your “can-do” approach to your work and find stakeholder engagement and influencing come naturally to you.  Several years’ experience in a analytics/insights role and be fluent in SQL  and be experienced in management of large datasets. Logical thinker  strong analytical and mathematical skills  with excellent attention to detail Experience with Marketing automation platforms such as Responsys  Salesforce  Marketo or similar Ability to share analytical findings using a visualisation tool Commercial acumen in the interpretation of data and development of data-based solutions   Sound like you? That's a good sign! In return for your energy and ideas  we offer a flexible working environment and great compensation. We always support a safe  healthy  engaging  and productive working environment for all employees and workers  whether that be in your home and office  or a combination of both.

Title: Lead Data Analyst - Infrastructure
Requirements: At Canva  our mission is to democratise design and empower creativity for anyone and everyone  on every platform. Inspired by a team of talented thinkers  an amazing culture and a remarkable growth trajectory – we’re out to change the world  one design at a time.  Since launch in August 2013  we have grown exponentially  amassing over 60 million monthly active users across 190 different countries who have created more than 6 Billion designs. We are one of the world’s fastest-growing technology companies and we have only achieved about 1% of what we want to do.  We're looking for self-motivated individuals who are curious about our product and our users  and who are excited to seek out valuable insights. We don’t want you to just be a resource that answers questions - we want you to act as a genuine data partner with your team and the broader business. We have a LOT of data and need people who can use their skills to help us make the most of it!  You’ll be coming into a diverse data team of more than forty people  who really do enjoy finding answers to the problems that our users have. We’re looking forward to continuing to grow our team and gaining a range of new perspectives and ideas on how we can achieve our goals and help more people.  This role will rely on your particular strengths in building out data-driven decisions  communicating closely with stakeholders  and organising your fellow data team members such that the data attitude in this space is highly proactive.  The Team Canva’s Infra organisation provides the necessary tooling and components across the entire software development lifecycle that allows engineers to build reliable  secure  compliant services to power the Canva app and its supporting platform capabilities. Canva’s infra is a large and rapidly growing organisation in the business  today comprising 25 teams of around 200 engineers. As Canva continues to hire and onboard engineers at a rapid rate  the capabilities provided by Infra are used by an increasing number of Canvanauts to advance their respective group and team strategies. The demand on Infra is increasing rapidly (e.g.  here estimating Infra by 2026 to support thousands of engineers  hundreds of merged PRs/day  733Pb of media  and more) and achieving this growth and scale requires us to work on the most important things to get us there as fast as possible. This is where you come in! Not having had dedicated analytical support  Infra is looking for a lead data analyst to establish themselves as part of the broader cross-functional leadership  build a team  and ensure that we’re using data to confidently understand how Infra is achieving its mission and what directions to take to get there faster.  Roles & Responsibilities You will build  grow  and lead a team of data specialists embedded in Canva’s Infra organisation who will support and provide insights and direction to key Infra partners. These may include Business Intelligence Analysts  Data Analysts  and Analytics Engineers. Support Infra in the review and redefinition of critical metrics to track the performance of Infra programs. Develop a strategy detailing the data enrichment opportunity across our Infra data in line with our data governance and ethics standards. Work with your Infra partners to establish a robust reporting framework that ties each key area of Infra to a unified view to help Infra leadership make decisions. Provide expert consultation to senior leaders  driving priorities based on a holistic view of Infra  providing the analytics insights that enable them to make informed decisions. Work with teams to ensure data quality is maintained and drive trust in the Infra ecosystem. Work with data leaders across the organisation contributing to Canva’s Insights and Metrics strategy and development of key data capabilities supporting both Infra and other areas. Be a thought leader in new trends in Infra metrics and measurement and for driving effectiveness and efficiency.  Required Skills & Experience 10+ years of relevant experience in analytics  consulting  or related quantitative role  3+ years of data analytics team building and management. Experience working in hyper-growth and large tech companies (Consumer and SaaS experience ideal). Experience leading and scaling an Analytics capability in a hyper-growth Infra team that is scaling rapidly in team size and capability ownership. Knowledge of and experience in applying data to assess and improve DevOps. For example  establishing DORA metrics to improve how Infra is driving product development velocity and quality across Canva. Highly numeric with strong communication skills and the ability to communicate complex information in clear and simple language. A grounding in mathematics / statistics (PhD in a STEM area is preferred but not required). Ability to take ambiguous problems and solve them in a structured  hypothesis-driven  data-supported way.  The Canva workspace is set up for you to do your best work and have a great time doing so  with breakout areas  little nooks  and quiet places to retreat.  If you're seeking professional growth and enjoy working on large  distributed  cloud-based applications that delight our millions of individual and business users alike - then apply now to be considered for the position!  If you require visa sponsorship  you must ensure you have at least two (2) years of post-University commercial experience as a Software Engineer and meet the mandatory sponsorship requirements laid out by the Department of Home Affairs.  We will not accept or review any CVs from external recruitment agencies.

Company: University Hospitals of Derby and Burton NHS Foundation Trust
Title: Senior Information Analyst
Requirements: How You'll Apply For This Job  We're updating the design of NHS Jobs and the way you apply.  This means you'll apply for this job through a new updated version of the website.  If you've already got an NHS Jobs account  You'll need to create a new NHS Jobs account and apply for this job through the new version.  You'll still have access to your current NHS Jobs account. For example  you can sign in and view your profile  your applications  and you can copy and paste any information from there into your new account  if you need to.  You'll have these 2 accounts while there's a 'current' and 'new' version of the website. Your new account will replace your current account when the website design is fully updated.  If you've not got an NHS Jobs account  You'll need to continue and create one to apply for this job.  If you want to access the website in Welsh  The new NHS Jobs website is also available in Welsh. Choose the Welsh (Cymraeg) option on the new NHS Jobs website to change the language from English to Welsh.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - People Group
Requirements: At Canva  we’re transforming the way the world designs  and we need you to help us transform the way we use data to achieve that goal. Our team has grown dramatically over the last few years. We’ve gone from a small start up to a large and diverse team across multiple offices around the world. In order to continue supporting Canva’s incredible growth as a product  we need to continue building up our amazing team  and that’s where you come in. We need you to join our analytics specialists  with a focus on understanding Canva’s operational people data.  Canva’s People Team has a big mission to build the most effective and engaged company in the world! Our success is finding  growing and empowering the best engineers  designers  product managers  growth marketers and operators to ship incredible products for our global design community. We’re looking for a data analyst to work closely with our People Team to define and produce key HR metrics  insights and workforce analyses  synthesize insights and partner on data driven people strategies across Canva. The person in this role should be highly data driven  technically astute  a solid communicator  intellectually curious  a fast learner  and able to move quickly while keeping focused on high impact projects with limited direction and supervision. >> Our Data folk  who are embedded across the business  manage huge volumes of data in order to help our friends across the business make Canva run  scale and grow. This role will be embedded in Canva’s People team  but will also form a part of our Data team where you will also be joining a diverse group of people who really enjoy finding answers for the business  as well as uncovering opportunities that we didn’t know existed. The Data team can often be found chatting about the latest trends in data and how we can apply them at Canva. We’re looking forward to growing both teams and gaining a range of new perspectives and ideas on how we can do things better.  Responsibilities: Help us understand our business - we want you to be creative and insightful  rather than just throwing the usual metrics at the wall to see what sticks Support your team to understand their performance by ensuring a connected and discoverable data ecosystem and building key reusable data assets Build and maintain dashboards that show meaningful business progress  make them look really good - you don’t need to be a designer or have any design talent  you just need to build visualisations that enable people to interpret the insights Use our giant databases to answer the sort of questions that sound really simple but turn out to be challenging (and fun!) Make complex data simple by building data models that make diverse data sources easy to work with Help us extend data literacy and curiosity throughout the whole company Work across all areas of the team to understand performance  identify and promote opportunities for our team to be even more effective at what they do You’ll pull together data from a number of tech platforms - recruitment  HRIS  payroll  finance  comp and workforce planning (among others) to provide strategic workforce insights and dashboards With your test & seek mindset you’ll play around with scenarios that relate to our workforce to pull out strategic opportunities across the business.  Required Skills: Experience working with large real world data sets Strong competency with SQL  experience with big data SQL Query Engines like Snowflake  BigQuery  or Redshift is a plus Experience building connected data ecosystems across multiple off the shelf and cloud Data platforms such as Snowflake or BigQuery Experience across both highly integrated (Workday & Netsuite) ERPs and stand-alone best-of-breed platforms (eg: Lever  Pave  Enboarder) Experience defining reports and dashboards inside off the shelf software  as well as BI tools such as Looker or Tableau Experience building dashboards that effectively communicate results and outcomes A grounding in mathematics / statistics and a bachelor's degree in a STEM area is preferred  but not required Strong communication skills - verbal and written - be able to break down complex topics into simple solutions and ideas Experience wrangling and analyzing data using Python or R is a nice to have  Perks & Benifits: Competitive salary  plus stock options via our ESOP plan Flexible daily working hours  we value work-life balance Breakfast and lunch prepared by our wonderful Vibe team Onsite-Gym and Yoga Membership End-of-Trip Facilities: Bicycle parking and showers Generous parental (including secondary) leave policy Pet-friendly offices Internal Coaching and Employee Support Programs Sponsored social clubs  team events and celebrations Relocation budget for interstate and qualified overseas individuals (see below for visa information)  The Canva workspace is set up for you to do your best work and have a great time doing so  with breakout areas  little nooks  and quiet places to retreat.  If you're seeking professional growth and enjoy working on large  distributed  cloud-based applications that delight our millions of individual and business users alike - then apply now to be considered for the position!  If you require visa sponsorship  you must ensure you have at least two (2) years of post-University commercial experience as a Software Engineer and meet the mandatory sponsorship requirements laid out by the Department of Home Affairs.  We will not accept or review any CVs from external recruitment agencies.

Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: Posted by Richard Hamstead Tech Recruitment Specialist Send InMail Showcase your ability with an influential player in IoT Flexible working arrangements including working from home Immediate start | Temporary role with strong change of permanent conversion  Leverage your PowerBI expertise to demonstrate the value of data-driven insights  increasing the accessibility to and consumption of reporting across the broader business.  You're a junior Data Analyst  looking for the next step in your career. You've got lots of ideas about how to use data  but you're not given the freedom you need to make them come to life.  Your new company has developed a new Data Analyst role. They have ample data which is related to their Supply Chain but they are a little unsure what to do with it. This is where you come in - you have both the ideas as well as some experience honing your skills to start developing key insights from this data.  Specialising in Microsoft PowerBI to embed a broader use of Business Intelligence throughout the business  your days will be largely independent and autonomous. You will be delivering recurring and ad-hoc reports and visualisations to various internal stakeholders across multiple business divisions and specialisations.  The Right Person  You've worked for at least a year as a Data Analyst  so you’ll be well-versed in data interpretation and visualisation. But you enter this position with plenty of room to grow.  With strong communication skills and an ability to create concise  accurate and straightforward reports  you will be able to articulate key insights to people of diverse professional backgrounds. You'll have an eye for detail  and be able to recognise reporting gaps and use available data to remedy these.  In addition  you:  Are highly proficient with Microsoft PowerBI Demonstrate experience with SQL queries and ETL/ELT process delivery Work with an understanding on various Project/Process Delivery frameworks  such as SDLC and Agile  The Company  Your new company is an established  high-profile Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) who understands the value of data in driving improvements to productivity  efficiency and safety. Nationally recognised for innovation in the mining and health sectors  you’ll join an organisation bursting with Newcastle’s premier technical talent.  This is a temporary position  with an expected initial engagement of 6 months. There is a strong possibility for the role to evolve into a permanent one at the end of the initial engagement once the value that the role delivers has been proven to the broader business.  Next Steps: The best way to be immediately considered for this position is by clicking "Apply" to submit your resume and any supporting documentation.  If you don't have an up top date resume  please feel free to either message me on LinkedIn or send me an email at rhamstead@rarekind.com.au.

Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: Permanent Full Time Position Sydney or Melbourne Location Hybrid working – 1-2 Days in the office  Insignia Financial is one of Australia’s leading Wealth Management organisations  undertaking a rapid and exciting transformation. We are a strong and resilient business and despite the current climate  are investing in supporting our people to onboard and connect them remotely. It is in this context that we are looking for a Data Analyst who can work closely with our business to understand business drivers and requirements and shape these into a data roadmap.  The Role  We are currently looking for a Data Analyst within our experienced Financial Wellbeing Team  this role is responsible for managing and analysing data  building reports and providing insights to our business.  This role will suit someone who loves manipulating data and is looking to move into an organisation which is going through a lot of change. You will have the opportunity to make a difference and get involved in some new and exciting changes.
