Title: Lead Data Analyst - Infrastructure
Requirements: At Canva  our mission is to democratise design and empower creativity for anyone and everyone  on every platform. Inspired by a team of talented thinkers  an amazing culture and a remarkable growth trajectory – we’re out to change the world  one design at a time.  Since launch in August 2013  we have grown exponentially  amassing over 60 million monthly active users across 190 different countries who have created more than 6 Billion designs. We are one of the world’s fastest-growing technology companies and we have only achieved about 1% of what we want to do.  We're looking for self-motivated individuals who are curious about our product and our users  and who are excited to seek out valuable insights. We don’t want you to just be a resource that answers questions - we want you to act as a genuine data partner with your team and the broader business. We have a LOT of data and need people who can use their skills to help us make the most of it!  You’ll be coming into a diverse data team of more than forty people  who really do enjoy finding answers to the problems that our users have. We’re looking forward to continuing to grow our team and gaining a range of new perspectives and ideas on how we can achieve our goals and help more people.  This role will rely on your particular strengths in building out data-driven decisions  communicating closely with stakeholders  and organising your fellow data team members such that the data attitude in this space is highly proactive.  The Team Canva’s Infra organisation provides the necessary tooling and components across the entire software development lifecycle that allows engineers to build reliable  secure  compliant services to power the Canva app and its supporting platform capabilities. Canva’s infra is a large and rapidly growing organisation in the business  today comprising 25 teams of around 200 engineers. As Canva continues to hire and onboard engineers at a rapid rate  the capabilities provided by Infra are used by an increasing number of Canvanauts to advance their respective group and team strategies. The demand on Infra is increasing rapidly (e.g.  here estimating Infra by 2026 to support thousands of engineers  hundreds of merged PRs/day  733Pb of media  and more) and achieving this growth and scale requires us to work on the most important things to get us there as fast as possible. This is where you come in! Not having had dedicated analytical support  Infra is looking for a lead data analyst to establish themselves as part of the broader cross-functional leadership  build a team  and ensure that we’re using data to confidently understand how Infra is achieving its mission and what directions to take to get there faster.  Roles & Responsibilities You will build  grow  and lead a team of data specialists embedded in Canva’s Infra organisation who will support and provide insights and direction to key Infra partners. These may include Business Intelligence Analysts  Data Analysts  and Analytics Engineers. Support Infra in the review and redefinition of critical metrics to track the performance of Infra programs. Develop a strategy detailing the data enrichment opportunity across our Infra data in line with our data governance and ethics standards. Work with your Infra partners to establish a robust reporting framework that ties each key area of Infra to a unified view to help Infra leadership make decisions. Provide expert consultation to senior leaders  driving priorities based on a holistic view of Infra  providing the analytics insights that enable them to make informed decisions. Work with teams to ensure data quality is maintained and drive trust in the Infra ecosystem. Work with data leaders across the organisation contributing to Canva’s Insights and Metrics strategy and development of key data capabilities supporting both Infra and other areas. Be a thought leader in new trends in Infra metrics and measurement and for driving effectiveness and efficiency.  Required Skills & Experience 10+ years of relevant experience in analytics  consulting  or related quantitative role  3+ years of data analytics team building and management. Experience working in hyper-growth and large tech companies (Consumer and SaaS experience ideal). Experience leading and scaling an Analytics capability in a hyper-growth Infra team that is scaling rapidly in team size and capability ownership. Knowledge of and experience in applying data to assess and improve DevOps. For example  establishing DORA metrics to improve how Infra is driving product development velocity and quality across Canva. Highly numeric with strong communication skills and the ability to communicate complex information in clear and simple language. A grounding in mathematics / statistics (PhD in a STEM area is preferred but not required). Ability to take ambiguous problems and solve them in a structured  hypothesis-driven  data-supported way.  The Canva workspace is set up for you to do your best work and have a great time doing so  with breakout areas  little nooks  and quiet places to retreat.  If you're seeking professional growth and enjoy working on large  distributed  cloud-based applications that delight our millions of individual and business users alike - then apply now to be considered for the position!  If you require visa sponsorship  you must ensure you have at least two (2) years of post-University commercial experience as a Software Engineer and meet the mandatory sponsorship requirements laid out by the Department of Home Affairs.  We will not accept or review any CVs from external recruitment agencies.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Requirements: Who Are You  As a Senior Data Analyst  your role is to deliver data projects utilizing advanced analytical and programming skills that allows the business to meet its objectives  including remediation projects.  What You Will Do  You will support the Data Lead by engaging with business stakeholders to understand risk drivers within their business  analyze data and develop key metrics  build and maintain reports and software applications that automate manual processes  providing assistance across the unit to optimize business and customer outcomes  including remediation activities  What We Need To See  You are a seasoned hands-on Senior Data Analyst and have:  Tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline such as Computer Science  Mathematics  Information Technology  Commerce Experience in .NET / T-SQL / SSIS programming role (ideally 5+ years) Certified Microsoft SQL 2016 Database Development Solid experience developing complex ETLs based on SSIS and customized coding in C# Strong SQL/T-SQL skills and SQL Server database design Strong mathematical skills and able to model complex calculation problems into functions and mathematical formulas Experience working with large  complex data sets Proven written communication skills and the ability to translate data analytics into business insights Strong stakeholder management skills and business acumen Demonstrated skill with building reports Experience with data visualization (preferred)  Who Are We  Our Wealth Management company relies on innovators like you to build and maintain the technology that helps us safely service the world's important corporations  governments and institutions. As a member of Core Transaction System team  you'll design and develop solutions that help the bank process all the payment transactions in markets spanning over multiple time zones.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Requirements: Posted by Elena Denza Senior Talent Acquisition & Diversity Manager at hipages Group Send InMail hi  we’re hipages Group.  We create effortless solutions that help tradies streamline and grow their businesses and delight their customers. Over 3 million Australians have used the hipages platform  where a home improvement job is posted every 20 seconds.  How you will make an impact:  Joining our Marketplace Growth team as a Senior Data Analyst  you will be responsible for generating data driven insights and identifying business opportunities. You will work closely with the Senior Leadership and Data teams to plan  prioritise  and deliver immense value to the business  by influencing product design and advancing our marketing effectiveness.  You will be influential in defining the direction of the hipages marketplace as we continue to evolve and apply your experience to find the best experience for our customers. But most importantly  you’ll be joining a top-notch data team!  How you will add value:  Advise on the required setup hypothesis-driven testing and direct test from conception to conclusion. Select  acquire and integrate structured data from disparate sources required to deliver actionable insights. Build econometric and statistical models for various business problems leaning on your toolbox of projections  classification  clustering  pattern analysis and data mining. Democratise data access and share insights across the team and department Assist in prioritisation of team initiatives by providing opportunity sizing Contribute to growing our user base by designing and delivering on segmentation strategies to build a customised consumer experience.  About You:  Requirements : Degree qualified in Computer Science  Statistics  Mathematics or a related qualification 5+ years experience applying statistical / modelling techniques to real world data to drive insights Experience in data analytics with a lense on SaaS Product Analysis/Development (A/B testing  causal impact analysis) Knowledge of  experience with and ability to use the tools  processes and practices for predicting business trends and providing forecasts that drive business decisions and business planning Knowledge of and ability to utilise tools  techniques and processes for gathering and reporting data in a particular department or division of a company. Prior experience as a Marketing Analyst or Product Analyst would be advantageous  Technical Experience: Proficient to query databases using advanced queries in SQL (Athena  Mysql) and advanced analytics using Python/R Experience with AWS technologies (Redshift  Athena  S3  Sagemaker)  Take a look inside our home:  A close-knit diverse family of bright  respectful  collaborative members who love to solve problems and jump on new opportunities  High-touch personalised investment in your continuous career development  Agile cross-functional teams who value teamwork - from Hackathon to team off-sites  to Product roadshows  you get to experience it all  Competitive salary and benefits  plus equity via our Employee Share Program  we’re all owners of hipages and other great perks such as 14 weeks paid parental leave  Daily bottomless continental breakfast  fresh fruit and snacks  Inspiring office and location - based in the heart of Sydney CBD  only a few steps from Town Hall Station  Remote work and flexible work (50/50) hybrid model  Social connection focus: Friday socials  company parties and teaming activities - the best in town!  Sounds like you're home? Apply Now!  Innovation & Collaboration: are two important core values at hipages which both cannot be achieved successfully without a diverse and inclusive team. We don't expect you to be an expert in all areas and we are more interested in learning about you as a person  a team member and a leader.  Research shows that while men apply for jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria  women and other minority groups tend to only apply when they check every box. So if you don't tick every single box above  but you think you would be a great fit for the role we encourage you to apply  we would LOVE to hear from you!

As a BDA employee  you will join other innovative  ethical people who have the critical skills required to develop and deliver world class capabilities and systems to protect Australia and its national interests. Joining us is a chance to make your mark  working with a diverse team that is united in pushing the boundaries of imagination and excellence.  At Boeing  we innovate and collaborate to make the world a better place. Title: Lead Data Analyst - Revenue Platform
Requirements: At Canva  our mission is to empower the world to design  and we’re looking for insightful data analysts who can help us make that happen.  We're looking for self-motivated individuals who are curious about our product and our users  and who are excited to seek out valuable insights. We don’t want you to just be a resource that answers questions - we want you to act as a genuine data partner with your team and the broader business. We have a LOT of data and need people who can use their skills to help us make the most of it!  You’ll be coming into a diverse data team of more than forty people  who really do enjoy finding answers to the problems that our users have. We’re looking forward to continuing to grow our team and gaining a range of new perspectives and ideas on how we can achieve our goals and help more people.  This role will rely on your particular strengths in building out data-driven decisions  communicating closely with stakeholders  and organising your fellow data team members such that the data attitude in this space is highly proactive.  About the Revenue Platform Group The Revenue Platform Group is deeply rooted within the Businesses and Education Super-Group. Owning the strategy and roadmap for enabling everyone  across the planet  to access the paid features of Canva  be this through a subscription or a one off transaction. No two countries are the same  it is our job to understand  evaluate and prioritise what works best and for who. We do everything from building out complex new payment integrations to enabling other Canva groups to achieve their goals and monetise their features.  Role Responsibilities Coach a team of data specialists in the Revenue and Payments teams. This role will act as a driver of data strategy in this group and will coordinate closely with Product Managers across the Group  to prioritise and assess impact of new initiatives (e.g. new payment methods offering  payment success rate optimisation strategy) Find insights that help us understand both Canva and our customers - we want you to be creative and insightful  rather than just throwing the usual metrics at the wall to see what sticks Suggest and run interesting experiments that will actually move our metrics - when we push tests to 100% we want to actually see the bump in the relevant graph Build and maintain dashboards for our Revenue Platform teams  and make them look really good - you don’t need to be a designer or have any design talent  you just need to want to build cool things Own projects  data models  dashboards  and other artefacts and keep them up-to-date and high quality in a hypergrowth environment Use our giant databases to answer the sort of questions that sound really simple but turn out to be challenging (and fun!) Help us extend data literacy and curiosity throughout the whole company  Required Skills & Experience Experience working in data teams at a global e-commerce/ fintech company or bank Experience working with subscription-based data sets  including revenue and invoice data Experience working with payment related metrics and an industry knowledge of payment processing and digital payments  with strong interest in the consumer payments landscape Experience tracking and analysing customer churn  and building models to explain and predict churn Strong competency with SQL  experience with data warehouses such as Snowflake  Redshift  or BigQuery is a plus! Experience wrangling and analysing data using Python or R Experience with optimising product funnels  running experiments  and building dashboards that effectively communicate results and outcomes A grounding in mathematics / statistics and a bachelor's degree in a STEM area is preferred  but not required Experience with very large data sets is a huge plus  but not required Strong communication skills - verbal and written - be able to break down complex topics into simple solutions and ideas. Stakeholder management skills are vital in this role.  Perks & Benifits: Competitive salary  plus stock options via our ESOP plan Flexible daily working hours  we value work-life balance Breakfast and lunch prepared by our wonderful Vibe team Onsite-Gym and Yoga Membership End-of-Trip Facilities: Bicycle parking and showers Generous parental (including secondary) leave policy Pet-friendly offices Internal Coaching and Employee Support Programs Sponsored social clubs  team events and celebrations Relocation budget for interstate and qualified overseas individuals (see below for visa information)  The Canva workspace is set up for you to do your best work and have a great time doing so  with breakout areas  little nooks  and quiet places to retreat.  If you're seeking professional growth and enjoy working on large  distributed  cloud-based applications that delight our millions of individual and business users alike - then apply now to be considered for the position!  If you require visa sponsorship  you must ensure you have at least two (2) years of post-University commercial experience as a Software Engineer and meet the mandatory sponsorship requirements laid out by the Department of Home Affairs. Title: Data & Insight Analyst
Requirements: As one of the world's largest toll-road operators  Transurban aims to bring people and places closer in a safer  smarter and faster way. We are customer obsessed - whether it's the technology that keeps drivers safe on our roads  our digital channels or our Customer Care team  we focus on creating frictionless experiences that keep people moving. We're always listening and relentlessly solving problems so we are continuously adding value for our Customers.  As a Data and Insight Analyst - Revenue Assurance and Reporting  your role will two-fold  you will deliver and manage revenue assurance analytics across a defined portfolio of assets  and you will provide real-time and cyclical reporting of your asset portfolio's operational performance across a range of metrics.  This is a 12 month fixed term contract  which can be done as a full time or part time.   The impact you'll have:  You'll be the custodian and developer of high level dashboard reporting  taking an asset-based view on various metrics and providing analysis  commentary and recommendations where required. You'll play a crucial role in supporting a reduction of revenue leakage  using your analysis and insights to drive P&L improvements  always looking for better ways to do things and searching for different angles to attack problems from. You'll assist in the preparation and delivery of results  engaging with asset managers and other key stakeholder groups to help them understand what makes our roads tick. You'll gain oversight of the end-to-end tolling system  identifying issues and drive improvements in both realised revenue trips and revenue leakage. First and foremost you'll be a data person  providing day to day support to our reporting and analytics environment through custodianship  administration and validation activities. The talents you'll bring:  You'll bring high level data manipulation  analysis and reporting capability  including defined success developing new and improved reporting practices. As a data specialist  you'll have advanced technical proficiency across SQL and a Data Visualisation tool (preferably Tableau/PowerBI). Knowledge or experience with Data transformation tool (such as Lavastorm  Alteryx or equivalent) and Data warehouse (SQL Oracle  AWS Redshift or Snowflake) are also advantageous. Analytical and incisive  you'll spot issues and use your own ingenuity - and that of your team - to solve problems collaboratively. Experience and understanding of working with large complex data sets  data structure and possess the ability to interrogate data in large volume transactional data is preferred. You'll possess high levels of attention to detail  with the accuracy of the information you compile and effective communication with stakeholders are keys to your success. You'll have a curious mind  enjoy investigating problems and solving their root causes  share a willingness to learn and won't be frightened by tight deadlines and a dynamic  high pressure environment. The rewards you'll earn:  We'll provide you with a workplace that is safe  respectful and inclusive  as our commitment to belonging and wellbeing is core to who we are. We are growing and want our people to grow with us. We will work with you to enable your career goals with access to learning opportunities and support to grow in your role and beyond. A competitive salary package with salary sacrifice options Generous leave options that you're eligible for from day 1. We'll help you be healthy with flu vaccinations  fresh fruit and mental health support. We'll invite you to plenty of social activities  including ones that give back to our communities. We'll offer flexible leave  public transport ticket purchasing programs  insurance and salary continuance.   About us  At Transurban we are driven by bringing people and places closer. Together  we're building a future that marries traditional infrastructure with emerging technology. We're making roads ready for driverless cars and predicting accidents before they happen. We're getting people where they're going. And we're doing it faster  smarter and safer.  We believe in equality. We treat everyone with fairness  consideration and respect  regardless of gender  cultural background  religious beliefs  sexuality or personal circumstances - whether they work for us or not. We want to ensure everyone feels comfortable to express themselves and their opinions.  We strongly encourage applications from candidates of diverse backgrounds  including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people.  If you meet a number of the requirements  but not all  we encourage you to submit your application.  Start changing the world around you. Apply now!     Desired Skills and Experience  Data Analytics Database Management Reporting Tableau SQL

Title: APS6 Data Analyst
Requirements: About The Company  As one of Australia's largest providers of human resources solutions  Chandler Macleod has a proven track record of unleashing potential in people and companies. For over 40 years Chandler Macleod's recruitment business has connected leading-edge projects and employers with outstanding business professionals. A great opportunity for an experienced Data Analyst to join a busy Federal Government team in a long term capacity.  About The Role You will be maintaining a complex dataset with interconnected parts You will be liaising with a team of researching and policy officers You will be solving data problems You will be understanding policy goals and different types of analysis You will be documenting code pipelines  workflows and project plans You will be exploring analytical approaches to achieve business outcomes You will be communicating information using data visualisation and data storytelling About You You will have strong experience of applying researching and analysis within an evidence based setting You will ideally have experience working in government  and working with frameworks and policies You will have intermediate to advanced Excel skills You will have experience writing and evaluating code (e.g. python  R  VBA  SQL) You will be a self-starter who is able to work with limited supervision Benefits ASAP start (pending Federal Police Clearance - Baseline) 12 month temporary assignment with potential for further extension Full time hours Monday - Friday 7.5 hours per day Brisbane CBD location $60 - $65 per hour + super Please note to be eligible for this role you must hold Australian Citizenship and be willing to undertake a Baseline clearance ***

Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: See yourself being part of a large  transformational change? This could be the role for you!  Who we are?  At Iress  we believe technology should help people perform better every day. Since our beginning in 1993  people across financial services have trusted us to take their performance to the next level. From the world’s most established financial brands to new and disruptive players  we help improve every aspect of our clients’ businesses so that they can work better  every day.  Iress is one of Australia’s largest technology companies and employs more than 2 250 people across Australia  United Kingdom  South Africa  Canada  New Zealand and Asia.  Role Purpose  Iress products are complex and we have a wide range of users and use cases across to support the needs of different markets.  In addition Iress stores large amounts of data about our clients and the nature of their relationship with Iress.  The purpose of this role is to unlock the value of what we know about our client base to better target the sales and service activities.  This includes identifying opportunities with new and existing clients as well as better supporting the current service model (e.g. operational efficiencies  bottlenecks)  Therefore this position requires someone who has great analytical and problem solving skills  high attention to detail  embodies our values and culture  and is passionate about delivering the best software to clients and end-users.  Accountabilities & Deliverables Formulate insights and provide recommendations to  improve sales activity  better focus (and streamline) sales and service activity  improve client experiences through an improved service models and shape the Iress’ market offer. Develop and deliver ongoing reporting solutions (e.g data inputs  reports  dashboards etc.) to support sales and account management activity. Deliver any reporting\dashboard in a manner that can be leveraged globally. Prepare inputs for ongoing management and board reporting. Build the capability across the client facing teams to continuously improve data insights. Deliver analysis and reporting to the global commercial team across the sales and service functions. Core Skills  Knowledge And Attributes Minimum 5 years’ experience in technology  ideally in financial advice or wealth management technology  including a minimum 2 years’ experience as a Data Analyst Experience using data analytics\business intelligence tools to build dashboards to support key business functions of sales and account management Strong commercial acumen and finance knowledge Tertiary qualifications in Business  Information Technology and/or Finance are highly desirable. Familiarity with Scrum and lean agile practices Outstanding written  verbal and presentation-style communication skills High proficiency in SQL Experience using data analytics\business intelligence tools to build dashboard (Quicksight  PowerBI  Tableau etc) Outstanding written  verbal and presentation-style communication skills Ability to influence stakeholders across the organisation to deliver outcomes Ability to understand complex business challenges  opportunities and risks  seek out the right data and translate it into actionable insights Proficiency in Python Experience in data warehousing and analytics  including using AWS technologies – S3  Glue  Athena  Quicksight etc. Why Iress? 6 paid days per year to extend your weekends State-of-the-art offices Equity grants for our top 25% performers Annual Profit Share when Iress meets its annual profit targets Access to learning and development programs through Udemy 3 days’ leave per year for charity initiatives Global 36-hour hackathon Starting school leave - 8.5 days of leave to assist your kids with the transition to school Discounted health insurance premiums Up to 26 weeks’ paid parental leave for primary carers (up to 4 weeks for secondary carers)  and the ability to work part-time when returning to work. Employment Type Employee Time Type Full time

Title: Lead Data Analyst - Revenue Platform
Requirements: At Canva  our mission is to empower the world to design  and we’re looking for insightful data analysts who can help us make that happen.  We're looking for self-motivated individuals who are curious about our product and our users  and who are excited to seek out valuable insights. We don’t want you to just be a resource that answers questions - we want you to act as a genuine data partner with your team and the broader business. We have a LOT of data and need people who can use their skills to help us make the most of it!  You’ll be coming into a diverse data team of more than forty people  who really do enjoy finding answers to the problems that our users have. We’re looking forward to continuing to grow our team and gaining a range of new perspectives and ideas on how we can achieve our goals and help more people.  This role will rely on your particular strengths in building out data-driven decisions  communicating closely with stakeholders  and organising your fellow data team members such that the data attitude in this space is highly proactive.  About the Revenue Platform Group The Revenue Platform Group is deeply rooted within the Businesses and Education Super-Group. Owning the strategy and roadmap for enabling everyone  across the planet  to access the paid features of Canva  be this through a subscription or a one off transaction. No two countries are the same  it is our job to understand  evaluate and prioritise what works best and for who. We do everything from building out complex new payment integrations to enabling other Canva groups to achieve their goals and monetise their features.  Role Responsibilities Coach a team of data specialists in the Revenue and Payments teams. This role will act as a driver of data strategy in this group and will coordinate closely with Product Managers across the Group  to prioritise and assess impact of new initiatives (e.g. new payment methods offering  payment success rate optimisation strategy) Find insights that help us understand both Canva and our customers - we want you to be creative and insightful  rather than just throwing the usual metrics at the wall to see what sticks Suggest and run interesting experiments that will actually move our metrics - when we push tests to 100% we want to actually see the bump in the relevant graph Build and maintain dashboards for our Revenue Platform teams  and make them look really good - you don’t need to be a designer or have any design talent  you just need to want to build cool things Own projects  data models  dashboards  and other artefacts and keep them up-to-date and high quality in a hypergrowth environment Use our giant databases to answer the sort of questions that sound really simple but turn out to be challenging (and fun!) Help us extend data literacy and curiosity throughout the whole company  Required Skills & Experience Experience working in data teams at a global e-commerce/ fintech company or bank Experience working with subscription-based data sets  including revenue and invoice data Experience working with payment related metrics and an industry knowledge of payment processing and digital payments  with strong interest in the consumer payments landscape Experience tracking and analysing customer churn  and building models to explain and predict churn Strong competency with SQL  experience with data warehouses such as Snowflake  Redshift  or BigQuery is a plus! Experience wrangling and analysing data using Python or R Experience with optimising product funnels  running experiments  and building dashboards that effectively communicate results and outcomes A grounding in mathematics / statistics and a bachelor's degree in a STEM area is preferred  but not required Experience with very large data sets is a huge plus  but not required Strong communication skills - verbal and written - be able to break down complex topics into simple solutions and ideas. Stakeholder management skills are vital in this role.  Perks & Benifits: Competitive salary  plus stock options via our ESOP plan Flexible daily working hours  we value work-life balance Breakfast and lunch prepared by our wonderful Vibe team Onsite-Gym and Yoga Membership End-of-Trip Facilities: Bicycle parking and showers Generous parental (including secondary) leave policy Pet-friendly offices Internal Coaching and Employee Support Programs Sponsored social clubs  team events and celebrations Relocation budget for interstate and qualified overseas individuals (see below for visa information)  The Canva workspace is set up for you to do your best work and have a great time doing so  with breakout areas  little nooks  and quiet places to retreat.  If you're seeking professional growth and enjoy working on large  distributed  cloud-based applications that delight our millions of individual and business users alike - then apply now to be considered for the position!  If you require visa sponsorship  you must ensure you have at least two (2) years of post-University commercial experience as a Software Engineer and meet the mandatory sponsorship requirements laid out by the Department of Home Affairs.  We will not accept or review any CVs from external recruitment agencies.

Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Requirements: We deliver the world’s most complex projects Melbourne or Sydney Location  Flexible work options Enjoy a varied & challenging role Worley currently have an exciting opportunity for a Business Intelligence Specialist to join the Data Solutions Team  a high functioning team enabling Growth  and the greater Worley business  to derive the insights needed to make informed business decisions and to win more work. We do this through data automation  data governance and robust reporting primarily utilizing the Power platform. We provide advice and direction  translating business and user requirements  to help determine the best solution for their data needs.  In this role  with your innovative thinking and technical skills  you will develop and coordinate solutions to support a data-driven Growth team. You will identify opportunities for innovation and efficiency with a particular focus on Power BI reporting and analytics.  Responsibilities Will Include Develop Power BI reports to meet the needs of the Growth team  aligning data from multiple sources into high-value  informative reporting Proactively engage with business leaders/groups to understand their needs and foster data-centric thinking Inform business leaders of trends and insights by interpreting data into what this means for them Stay informed of latest Power BI software developments to leverage maximum value Collaborate with other business reporting functions to ensure consistency and streamline data processes and reporting Training and user support to promote self-service and understanding Identify opportunities for improvements and challenge the status quo and others to innovate and make a real difference. Contribute to a positive working environment where people are motivated to do their best to help the business achieve its objectives. Promote a curious mindset and facilitate the introduction of new concepts and technologies. About You Power BI experience is essential (Power Query Formula Language  Complex DAX functions  Data modelling principles  Report development) Experience in R  SQL  Excel desirable Excellent communication skills  able to engage with all levels of the business  including the leadership team Work with a broad range of stakeholders to frame and implement key initiatives to support data-driven insights Strong analytical skills  including data analysis  and understanding of statistics Support internal and external business reporting  ensuring high quality and attention to detail Able to interpret complex data into actionable insights Identify opportunities for innovation and efficiency within data gathering and reporting We offer a competitive remuneration & benefits package  a friendly  professional and dynamic working environment with the opportunity to develop your career prospects globally.  Worley recognises the value of equal employment opportunity and is committed to promoting fairness  equity and diversity in its workplace hence we encourage applications from people with a variety of experience and backgrounds. In addition  we recognise that everyone’s personal circumstances differ and thus understand the importance of offering flexibility in the working arrangements of our personnel.  You must have current unrestricted working rights for Australia to be eligible for consideration and only those candidates with appropriate qualifications and experience will be contacted directly.  Please note: If you are being represented by a recruitment agency you will not be considered  to be considered you will need to apply directly to Worley.  Make a real difference - witness the results - be a part of the Worley journey today! Title: Commercial Data and Insights Senior Analyst
Requirements: Job Description  Bupa is a leading health insurance provider in Australia. Our customers include over 4.7 million Australian residents as well as international visitors who come to Australia as a tourist  worker or students.  Reporting to the Strategic Projects Manager  the role of the Commercial Data and Insights Analyst works closely with a multitude of Delivery Hub team members to resolve the most impactful customer and commercial  multi-variant problems.  With experience in Private Health Insurance  large change programs and agile ways of working  the role will be critical for scientifically determining the most salient drivers of customer and commercial performance to improve decision-making across our Health Insurance agile squads  planned delivery teams and Accelerated Performance and Delivery team.  What do I need? Tertiary qualification in data science  statistics  mathematics  computer science  machine learning  applied statistics or mathematics At least two years’ experience – as an analyst or data scientist – working on customer and commercial transformation programs Fluency in at least one of the following programming languages SAS  R  Python and Scala. Proficient in advanced analytics tools  including R  Excel and VBA  SAS  GA360  Big Query  Tableau and datasets such as Google Analytics and Adobe Analytics Experience with technologies like AWS EMR to support ETL processing on large data sources or with computationally intensive steps (SQL  parallelization  Hadoop  Spark  etc.) What is it like to work there?  Be at the heart of helping people live longer  healthier  happier lives. At Bupa  we employ more than 80 000 people globally who are making this a reality. One thing stands out about Bupa people -our customers are our passion  they’re at the heart of our culture of care. If you've got the belief  the drive and the talent to help us in our ambition then we’d like to hear from you.  Time Type  Full time  Job Posting End Date  27 May 2021

Company: Scentre Group (Owner and Operator of Westfield in Aus and NZ)
Title: Data Governance Analyst -12 month contract
Requirements: Posted by Kylie Stephens Talent Acquisition Business Partner Send InMail Our Story  Scentre Group is the owner and operator of 42 Westfield living centres in Australia and New Zealand  partnering with the world’s leading retail and luxury brands to create a unique shopping and leisure experience for our customers. A career with us fosters the chance to be a part of a company that is transforming the digital and physical retail space.  Every day  our people play a vital role in our purpose to ‘create extraordinary places  connecting and enriching communities’.  Your opportunity  Scentre group has an exciting opportunity for a privacy professional to join our Customer & Business Development (CBD) team.  In this newly created role as Data Governance Analyst (DGA) you will become a key member of Scentre Group’s (SCG) Customer Division. Within the Data Governance space  you will be responsible for deploying and applying key DG processes within various customer domains and at times across other enterprise areas with collaboration.  Day to day  your main responsibilities will include (but not be limited to)  Work collaboratively with stakeholders to understand the current and future needs of the business and develop the appropriate structures and processes and controls to enable the business to maximise the utility of its data  whilst maintaining regulatory compliance and customer trust. Ensure that all data assets which are subject to governance processes within Customer division are addressed Support the DG lead in the development and maintenance of an end-to-end data lifecycle management approach Responsible for applying data governance framework including the management of data  operating model  data policies and across the division Ensure adherence and compliance of key data principles  polices and standards Conduct and participate in change management activities such as user education and training on key data concepts and technologies Consult and engage the business on Privacy risks and controls including conducting Privacy Impact Assessments and partnering with business working groups on new projects to ensure that Privacy requirements (including policies  laws and regulations) are met. Ensure DG forums are operational in nature and appropriate participation Assist the DG lead in executing data deletion and retention policies within Customer domain Maintain business glossary  technical lineage and data catalog in a centralised manner by engaging appropriate business stewards for accuracy  integrity and quality Provide assurance reports on CBD activities and key privacy controls to the Cyber  Privacy  Data Working Group and CCX Steerco  You will also work closely with the Scentre Group Enterprise Data Governance lead for all management and day to day operational matters.  This role is being offered on a 12-month fixed-term contract base from Scentre Groups support office  conveniently located above Westfield Sydney.  What will set you apart from the rest?  You will be a confident and passionate self-motivated individual who enjoys working in a high performing culture. We are also looking for: 5-6 years of experience in data and analytics domain Good working knowledge of Software Development LifeCycle (SDLC) Working knowledge of Information Management procedures and standards Operational knowledge of working with enterprise data governance platforms and tools like Collibra A Data Management certification or familiarity with DAMA DMBOK data management principles or similar data management training A good understanding of the progress of adoption of Data Lifecycle  performing audits with stakeholders to validate compliance Good understanding of information management and record keeping requirements for e.g. data retention  disposal  data classification A strong track record of partnering with the business and influencing positive business outcomes that balance compliance  risk  and reward A self-motivated person who values continuous improvement and who can establish and deliver their own program of work  What sets us apart from the rest? A collaborative  inclusive culture Diverse career paths across our vertically integrated business Training Opportunities Ability to innovate in a company that not only encourages it but will facilitate it Competitive benefits including 18 weeks parental leave  volunteer days to work with our charity partners  health and wellbeing discounts and the ability to purchase extra annual leave  Our diverse and inclusive workforce is not only something we’re proud of  but something we’re committed to. We encourage and support our people to bring their ‘whole selves’ to work each and every day because we believe our differences contribute to our success and ensures a workforce that reflects the customers we serve  in the communities in which we operate. This commitment is backed by executive and employee-led working groups including LGBTI  gender equity  mental health & wellbeing  working flexibility  disability and alongside other initiatives. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples are encouraged to apply.  If this sounds like you  apply today to make extraordinary happen! Should you have any questions  or want to discuss the role further  please reach out to Kylie Stephens  Talent Acquisition Business Partner  on 02 9028 8349.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Requirements: Posted by Jason Crooks Talent Acquisition Partner IT - Recruitment across Dynamics CRM / CE / F&O  Full Stack Development (.NET / React / Angular)  Azure  Project Management  Product Ownership  Agile & Scrum  Data  Cyber Send InMail At RAC we are focusing on Data and Analytics to help better serve our members  and have an exciting position for someone who is wanting to become a data analytics professional. You will be working with the team to deliver real value and enable a better  personalised member experience.  Reporting to the Analytics Manager  this position is a permanent  full-time opportunity.  What's in it for you?  Working in an environment that is embracing a continuous improvement culture using experimentation to support learning Time dedicated to your personal development time with access to training  development  and certification programs to ensure you can upskill Being part of empowered  cross-functional agile delivery teams that works with the business to build systems that solve problems Complete flexibility to choose between working from the home or office with flexible hours for a better work life balance Building digital systems that will shape the future for the RAC and a better WA Gain RAC Staff Benefits including free Roadside Assistance and 25% discount on your Insurances  Social Club and access Fitness Passport for cheaper gym membership What will you be doing? Engaging with business SME's to understand the problem and using your suite of skills to deliver relevant solutions Working in the Azure stack to build sustainable and scaleable data pipelines Power BI administration and automation by utilising Power BI APIs Performing adhoc analysis on data and information to make insights available for the business Ensuring accuracy  consistency and timeliness of data  to identify system improvement opportunities Helping coach or mentor junior data analysts within the team Lead engagements with stakeholders in the business to ensure decisions are backed by data What are we looking for? You're a restless learner  having learned something new within the last 3 months. You have a passion for sharing your skills and building a community. You will have experience with SQL  R/Python  Excel (Power Query)  BI reporting and visualisation tools You will know what makes a good data model and can separate facts from dimensions You can explain with ease  concepts on database schemas  design and how to optimise for performance You will be a keen problem solver with a passion for data and analytics to drive better services and improved performances for our members Tertiary qualifications in a quantitative field such as  Science  Statistics  or in Business  Commerce  or Marketing discipline are mandatory What can we offer you?  A genuine opportunity for training and development in the data analytics field A competitive base salary plus Super Member benefits and opportunity to join a very active Social Club In-house Health and Wellness programs and Platinum WorkSafe Certification We are looking for someone enthusiastic who will thrive in a culture of continuous improvement. To be considered  please formally apply by completing an online application  Please note: We encourage you to apply as soon as possible  as RAC reserves the right to close this vacancy without notice.  Vaccination To help ensure the health  safety and wellbeing of our people and members  RAC require employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Confirmation of your vaccination (and/or medical exemption) details will be required during the recruitment process.

Title: Maritime Data Management and Analysis APS Level 6
Requirements: The Role The directorate of Maritime Data Management is seeking motivated  passionate and adaptable people to fill multiple data analysis and data quality positions at the APS6 level.   We are looking for people interested in pursuing a career in data analysis  data quality and data science fields. These roles will provide key skills to support initiatives that provide insights into our data with a strong emphasis on measuring quality and business intelligence. Each role will also be expected to provide team leadership of both APS and contract staff.   As data stewards  we have a strong emphasis on quality processes  maintaining data integrity and data curation within our organisation. The roles will support and deliver complex process improvement  be supported by data operations  data analysis  data quality and data dissemination professionals. The roles will have a willingness to work in  and be supportive of  a positive dynamic team culture.   Use your amazing data management  quality  analysis and interpersonal skills to make a positive difference to our organisation. In a supportive environment as a team leader of both APS and contract staff  you will inspire a team to manage maritime data  encourage innovation to explore efficiencies and deliver solution to help meet strategic outcomes.   If your experience looks a little different from what we’ve identified but you think you can fulfil this role  we’d love to learn more about you so please apply.  About our Team The Australian Hydrographic office (AHO) is Australia’s national hydrographic and charting authority and is responsible for producing nautical charts and products to support Australia’s maritime interests and Defence Operations.   The Maritime Data Management Directorate provides strategic  operational and governance expertise. The Maritime Data Operations Section is responsible for ensuring that data is managed in support of the National Hydrographic and Charting programs.   These functions deliver and sustain business processes associated with receipt  storage  archiving and dissemination of maritime source data. This includes working closely with IT staff contractors to maintain the organisation’s data management system  Mediaflux.   The team work closely with geospatial analysts  nautical cartographers and hydrographic surveyors by making data discoverable and accessible in support of quality assurance and assessment of navigational safety.     The data management team maintain a range of technical competencies in support of data curation and analysis. Collectively we recognise there can be more than one solution to a problem and encourage innovation through team collaboration  support for additional technical and managerial training opportunities and a friendly  professional work environment.  Our Ideal Candidate Our ideal candidate will have a comprehensive understanding of data management principles  experience with managing large volumes of complex data and adheres to quality management procedures.   As a data management professional working as part of a team  you will apply your knowledge and experience to manage data cataloguing processes  ensure data quality and perform data analysis in support of business objectives.   You will have excellent interpersonal  negotiation and communication skills. This is demonstrated by building and sustaining positive relationships through working collaboratively and operating as an effective team member.   As a proactive leader  you commit energy and drive to identify improvements and deliver results. To achieve this you will have strong time management skills and challenge issues constructively in support of decision making and strategic goals.   We are interested in skillsets in any of these spaces: data curation  records management  data ingest  data cataloguing  data discovery  stakeholder engagement  data preservation and archiving  information science  information management and data exploitation  data governance  data quality  data dissemination  data transformation  GIS  geospatial analyst  librarian and data integration.   Application closing date: Friday the 6th of May 2022  For further information please review the job information pack  Reference DIG/00856/22 on https://defencecareers.nga.net.au/?jati=784C4DF9-B26F-4CF3-9E31-C8639B4A2F51

Company: Department of Treasury and Finance  Victoria
Title: Senior Data Analyst
Requirements: Posted by Shakuntala M. Recruiter - Tech Send InMail About us The Department of Treasury and Finance provides economic  financial and resource management advice to help the Victorian Government deliver its policies. We strive for excellence in financial and economic management to improve the lives of all Victorians. Information and Technology Services (ITS) is part of the Corporate Delivery Services Group and supports DTF with its information technology needs  including support for telephony services  applications  ICT operations and IT development.   About the role The Data Analytics and Reporting team is a newly formed team comprises of some highly skilled data analysts  specialists  and BI developers. We provide a centralised data integration platform to support divisional analytics users  as well as manage data strategy and governance across DTF. The team has an exciting and ambitious plan to build a data warehouse and integration platform to enable the growth of data culture and use of data to support decision making.   Key Accountabilities - - Build data models  design  schedule and maintain automated reports and dashboards using Tableau and Oracle Analytics. - Work with Cloud based data warehouses and ETL/ELT platform (Azure/Oracle) and application databases. - Identify data sources and provide detailed technical plan to design  implement and document data mappings using ETL/ELT tools in Azure/Oracle Cloud. - Manage issues and incidents against Service Level Targets and communicate findings. - Act as an analytics platform administrator/subject matter expert and provide support for business users including but not limited to user onboarding  license allocation  user enablement and training  and incident management. - Monitor analytics platforms and tools performance to ensure scalability and sizing for current usage and future growth. - Work with the team and service providers to support DTF analytics platforms (Tableau Online  Azure Data Warehouse  and Oracle Analytics Cloud Services) and tool maintenance through updates  patching  testing and integration to ensure high availability.  About you You are passionate about data and are someone who can see the big picture  while having mastery of the details. You are a self-starter  an excellent communicator  enjoy learning  and thrive on taking the initiative and pioneering new and creative ideas. You are confident and comfortable working with ambiguity and uncertainty. In this technical role  you will have some experience and a general enthusiasm for our green field environment. You have excellent critical thinking and problem-solving skills  enjoy working in a diverse team.  To be considered for this role  you must be able to demonstrate the following Experience in Tableau  Azure Data Warehouse  Power BI  and SQL. Knowledge in Oracle reporting and analytics would be an added advantage. Experience in the public sector or demonstrated understanding of the public sector dynamics would be an added advantage. Relevant qualification (e.g. Information Technology  Information Systems  Data Management  Data Science  Applied Mathematics) or equivalent to provide a subject matter expert level of data modelling and analysis Relevant post graduate qualification in data science  data analytics  or other related technical field desirable.   About our culture We aim to be a model employer providing an inclusive workplace that is understanding and respectful of differences such as gender  identity  race  disability or age. In addition  we are committed to supporting Aboriginal pathways between education and employment. The Department strives to create an environment that supports a flexible and adaptive workforce. All requests for flexible working arrangements will be considered in line with operational requirements.   How to apply  For more information about the position and key selection criteria  please refer to the position description. If you have specific questions regarding the role  please contact Shakuntala on shakuntala.markandeya@dtf.vic.gov.au  To apply  select the ‘Apply Now' button and provide a copy of your resume and cover letter summarising your skills and relevant experience.  Applications close 19th April 2022   If you require a copy of this advertisement in an accessible format  please email careers@dtf.vic.gov.au.

Title: Digital Data Ninja (Analyst)
Requirements: About NOVA NOVA Entertainment is Australia’s fastest growing entertainment company with broad interests across the media industry including successful radio brands like Nova & Smooth. We have a mission to create Australia's leading digital audio destination for listeners and advertisers. However you’ll probably already know this as you’ve probably got one of our apps on your phone and secretly love some of our podcasts – if not it’s never too late to start.  Your Challenge Like any digital team you were to work in  there’ll be no shortage of things for you to get stuck into  work on and learn about. This means that each day you come to work you’ll get the opportunity to help shape the state of data throughout our business – a huge opportunity we know!  Day to day: You’ll need to integrate yourself into a very dynamic  forward thinking  and fun team where you’ll become part of the crew. Don’t worry we’ve got a crew of 500+. We’ve got lots of data that you’ll get to wrangle into gold  cool stories  insights  and some interesting metrics that we can measure digital business performance with. Partner with your manager Mark Hales (he knows our digital content and audience inside out)  he’ll bring the context and you bring the data wizardry Collaborate with Isa our Data Platform Manager  she know’s where all our data is and spends a lot of time working on how we get more data  better access to it and receive it faster Form a strong bond with Shri  our data engineer who will be able to take you analysis and build automation around it  then load it into powerful dashboard’s for the business Flexing your excel spreadsheet muscle  we love this and if you can ‘pivot’ the ‘tables’ with your eyes closed  then you could be a winner Fly the flag for how we speak about and use data within the business  everyone has a role in data and you’re going to be key in helping everyone understand the power it creates.  About You Media experience is not mandatory  nor is 5+ years of experience as this is a junior/mid-level role You’re an expert driver of excel  can pivot and graph like it’s going out of fashion When your brain clicks on for work you’re thinking about what you can do  not what you can’t Complex problems are your favourite Self-starter  goal oriented and ability to work well and at times autonomously in a fast-paced environment. Insatiable thirst for learning and tackling things differently You know how to communicate  and you love taking peoples feedback and making things even better If you’ve got some AQL in your back pocket or worked with visualization platforms this is a bonus You don’t take life too seriously and can have a laugh  even at yourself Open and self-aware  you believe in building to grow and like the opportunity to spread your wings  Nova Benefits Workplace flexibility (hybrid working model) to support a work-life balance Additional leave days: Anniversary & Loyalty leave  Give back Leave  Mental Wellbeing days Access to Learning and Development programs & internal opportunities Access to health and wellbeing initiatives (Nova’s Life+ & Employee Assistance Program  mental health training programs) Frequent staff lunches  survey celebrations & an in-house bar! Plus  a whole lot more! Hopefully what we’re throwing out sounds a little bit different  but we’re moving quickly so don’t miss an opportunity to secure a chat with us – from there it could all be history.

Title: Business Analyst (Data and Analytics)
Requirements: Posted by Maria Smyth 2nd Talent (Data) @ Mantel Group [Hiring Data Engineers  Data Scientists  Machine Learning Engineers & Data & Analytics Consultants for Mantel Group] Send InMail It's official! Eliiza has ranked as No 1 Best Workplace in Australia! (as part of Mantel Groups house of brands - named Best Medium sized workplace 2021!).  Eliiza is jam packed full of passionate data lovers! Our team consists of Data Consultant  Machine Learning Engineers  Data Engineers & Data Scientists all working together to deliver smart data science and analytics solutions for our clients.  Our team members are located all around Australia and New Zealand and we dont mind where you are located (within Australia & New Zealand). We've built a hybrid approach to working where you can access any (or all!) of our awesome hubs providing a space for collaboration across Melbourne  Sydney  Brisbane  Perth & Magnetic island (and more to come including Queenstown & Auckland!) meaning you can choose a work model (and location!) that works best for you and your individual needs!  We don't have a head office  instead have opted for a distributed and diverse leadership team that extends across Australia and New Zealand.  Our approach is simple  we hire smart people and get out of their way. We don’t do policies  performance reviews  hierarchies or bureaucracy! By focusing on our five principles and not getting caught up in red tape  we trust you to get the job done.  So you’re ready for something new?  The Data and Analytics practice is a brand new team at Eliiza. We will be setting out to help our clients solve a broader set of analytics problems  which will complement both our expertise in ML and AI in Eliiza and our broader Mantel Group solutions.  The Data and Analytics proposition sits across four key areas: Data Strategy  Machine Learning and Data Science Strategy  Data Governance and Data Storytelling. You will be instrumental in supporting the successful delivery of projects  helping build our reputation as one of the most impactful consultancies in the Data and Analytics space.  With our diverse range of clients and projects  no day will look the same - but here’s a little snapshot of how you could spend your day: be the conduit between business and technology  quickly understanding business requirements and translating them into technical specifications as the bridge between business and technology  you will play a key role in a cross-functional Eliiza team or working as part of an integrated team with our clients communicate and collaborate with stakeholders to investigate issues  analyse information and deliver into appropriate artefacts Work to quickly gain understanding of our clients’ data environment  through process mapping  data exploration and analysis support delivery by being across key deliverables  risks and dependencies within the team as well as cross teams articulate key activities involved in various data roles (e.g. data engineering  data science or data governance) and their business impacts and benefits to the clients  If you’re the right Business Analyst (Data & Analytics) for us  you’ll: come from a strong technical background  you will be comfortable being the conduit between technical and non-technical teams you will have breadth of experience across data projects including performing data exploration  data modelling and data analysis ideally you will have exposure to or experience working with data visualisation tools e.g. PowerBI  Tableau etc your interpersonal skills are key and you will enjoy building strong relationships with a range of business and technology stakeholders you thrive in a collaborative environment and have demonstrated ability to work in cross functional teams analytical mind  keen attention to detail and not afraid to ask “why?” self-starter who is hands on  knows how to find answers and can work with ambiguity  Our team is made up of a range of people  with different experience across a huge range of data driven skill sets. We value a diversity of skill-sets  and don’t necessarily require that you’re skilled with all of the above (we’re aware there’s a lot listed!). If you feel you don't fit all the experience/skills listed we still encourage you to apply or get in touch.  What's on offer/ Why Eliiza?  We make sure you’re always one step ahead by investing your learning and development  every year. We build our own training where it doesn’t exist yet - it’s in our best interest to teach you things you don’t already know. You and your family’s health are most important to us. We know everyone is walking their own path in life  so we offer Flexible Leave for those times in your life when you need extra support. We want each person to tailor their working conditions whether that be remotely every now and then  or on a permanent basis - we know how to actually do ‘flexibility’ not just talk about it. You’ll be joining a passionate and supportive team who’ll move mountains to help you achieve your objective. You’ll get all the tools you need - including the latest phone & laptop along with mobile & data allowance and a lot of swag!  But hold on  you mentioned a house of brands?  We certainly did! Mantel Group is an Australian-owned  'house of brands' company with seven technology businesses (Eliiza being one of them!) across Australia and New Zealand. We know you won’t have one job for life so we’re building a group of companies with open borders so we can support you to take on new skills and challenges without leaving an awesome team!  Being part of Mantel Group means it’s not just the Eliiza team you’ll work with  learn from and see at social events - there’s almost 500 of us across DigIO  Kasna  CMD Solutions  Pretzel lab  Azenix & Cuusoo!  Sounds like a good match for you? Click “Apply” to share your details with our talent team  and we’ll be in touch. In the meantime  check out ‘how we hire’ to find out what’s in store if you’re successful and get to know us better by visiting our website and following Eliiza on LinkedIn.

Title: Lead Data Analyst - Creators & Monetisation
Requirements: At Canva  our mission is to democratise design and empower creativity for anyone and everyone  on every platform. Inspired by a team of talented thinkers  an amazing culture and a remarkable growth trajectory – we’re out to change the world  one design at a time.  Since launch in August 2013  we have grown exponentially  amassing over 60 million monthly active users across 190 different countries who have created more than 6 Billion designs. We are one of the world’s fastest-growing technology companies and we have only achieved about 1% of what we want to do.  About the group Since Canva’s founding  our template library has been a critical and fundamental driver of our success. Fundamental to making design accessible to the world is giving people everywhere a springboard with which to create designs from. Templates are that springboard.  Templates provide inspiration to users  help them visualise what's possible and provide an approachable starting point for our users to get creative. In fact  templates are the way the majority of our users create designs so the templates teams are helping millions of people each week.  Historically  Canva’s templates have been designed by a talented team of internal graphic designers. But last year we launched Canva Creators  a platform that allows anyone to publish their templates and earn money every time they’re used. We believe Canva Creators has the potential to take Canva to the next level of scale  and we want you to be central to that growth.  About the role In this role  you'll collaborate with our founders  Product  Finance  Strategy  Engineering and Researchers to shape the Creators Monetisation strategy.  Initially  this role will be a half of a 1-2 combination we are setting up between the Monetisation Product Manager and this role  the Data and monetisation insights Lead. Together  you will drive the strategy  modelling  shaping  testing and development of Canva Creator’s monetisation approach across templates and elements. This is an amazing opportunity to lead and grow the strategies around monetisation for Creators in an environment that rewards strategic thinking  initiative  creativity  and independence.  This role is about so much more than just “Money  money  money” - our Creators have shared stories about how becoming a Creator enabled them to gain their financial independence and make empowering decisions to put their health and happiness first  buy a new home for their family  leave a job where they were unhappy - see some of the comments below! We are building pathways to better lives for people all over the world and this role is a critical thought-leader and decision-maker as part of that.  What you’ll do Forecast and model product and monetization scenarios to test likely impact of changes Be the voice of data for the Creators team - input what data should and shouldn’t be shared and help to apply a strategic lens for how data is used across the product (including in communications outside of the product) Analyse the feedback on the current monetisation model for Creators Use quantitative data to inform team on who benefits from specific models and changes  and analyse how closely this aligns with Canva’s goals  and being the voice for those who are not benefiting or who are experiencing diminishing returns Test the model with creators  work with Product to define how this should be positioned internally and externally Present your recommendations to the team and leadership  taking ownership and recognition of your work Continue to regularly monitor our royalty system  including analyse movements and abnormalities  and ensuring that they align continue to with Canva’s strategic direction while working with Product and Finance to make adjustments Work with the team on researching the competitive landscape  including ensuring how we can present the most appealing opportunity for Canva Creators Improve the lives and livelihoods of thousands of Creators (and growing!) while creating business value for Canva  on our mission to empower the world to design.  Experience you’ll need Strong competency with SQL  experience with data warehouses such as Snowflake  Redshift  or BigQuery is a plus! Experience wrangling and analysing data using Python or R Extensive experience communicating with senior stakeholders A track-record of tackling complex problems and delivering simple  elegant solutions. You hold a high-bar for elegant  strategic and scalable financial solutions Experience with very large data sets is a huge plus  but not required Deep understanding of how to uncover user needs through research and user empathy Moderate execution experience so that you understand some of the intricacies of delivery A strong sense of ethics - understanding that the decisions we make at Canva impact millions of lives  everyday  You enjoy a little flexibility in your work. Our growth means there are constantly new things to work on every day  as such it’s likely that you’ll often be working across the board on new and exciting projects.  The Canva workspace is set up for you to do your best work and have a great time doing so  with breakout areas  little nooks  and quiet places to retreat.  If you're seeking professional growth and enjoy working on large  distributed  cloud-based applications that delight our millions of individual and business users alike - then apply now to be considered for the position!  If you require visa sponsorship  you must ensure you have at least two (2) years of post-University commercial experience as a Software Engineer and meet the mandatory sponsorship requirements laid out by the Department of Home Affairs.  We will not accept or review any CVs from external recruitment agencies.

Title: Junior Insights Analyst
Requirements: Posted by Cassandra Sanchez-Lindgren Talent Acquisition Specialist at Are Media Pty Ltd Send InMail Junior Insights Analyst  Are Media is the home of Australian magazines. Our extensive portfolio includes some of the country’s longest-running and most-loved brands  and boasts magazines  websites  videos  social  review sites  podcasts and experiences. This includes Australian Women’s Weekly  New Idea  Marie Claire  Gourmet Traveller  House & Garden  Wheels and many more  About the role  This is a great opportunity to work within our Circulation department. This role will be working alongside our Circulation & Insights Manager and is responsible for allocation of magazines in the retail environment and providing sales reporting & analytics to support insights to the business.  Your main responsibilities will include determining how many magazine copies are printed  where in the country they’re going to  tracking sales and reporting back to the business and editors. You will also be looking back historically on other methods used and recommending other options to mitigate risks with print issues.  We are looking for a Circulation Analyst as they are a key supporting role which is responsible for assisting in implementation of the distribution and retail plan and provide sales analysis information to the wider business. Success in this role will be driven by a pro-active approach  willingness to learn and collaborate to enhance future business performance for Are Media.  Duties  Analysis on promotional activity and general analysis on distribution as needed across Are Media titles Reporting on weekly and monthly sales performance of magazines to internal stakeholders. Distribution of data & information across Are Media titles and platforms Regular liaising with our internal teams including editorial  finance  marketing and retail channels Communications lead between Are Media distribution partners and production teams Data & bundle mapping whilst also finding possible saving covers General admin queries for the Circulation department Skills and experience  Excellent written and verbal communication skills Competency in MS Outlook and MS office suite (Excel  Word  PowerPoint) Experience with excel and pivot tables highly desirable Strong numerical skills with high attention to detail Adaptable to changing deadlines and strong time management skills Proven problem solving abilities. Why Are Media?  Join a values based organisation built on respecting all  inspiring creativity and collaboration with others. Excellent Employee Benefits Package including  discounted gym & swimming pool rates at Park Street CBD  regular beauty perks  discounts at cafes  restaurants & retail stores  as well as access to Are Media’s Learning & Development Offerings. Are Media is committed to a diverse  respectful  collaborative & inclusive workplace. We know & value the success this brings for everyone and we welcome & encourage applications from diverse backgrounds  Please apply now and send your CV via the link.
