Title: Actuarial Data Analyst
Requirements: Summary of Responsibilities:  The Actuarial Data Analyst is responsible for supporting the Actuarial team to discover and disseminate data driven actuarial insights.   Principal Responsibilities:  Run valuation processes as directed. Assist in the building of statistical and predictive models to analyze the results and deliver the key insights to stakeholders. Updating models and data preparation. Working with the broader Actuarial team to support reporting requirements.   Knowledge/Skills/Competencies Required:  Possess strong analytical and mathematical ability with a desire to develop Strong proactive team player who works collaboratively Good communication skills  both written and oral Strong work ethic and curious by nature Have the potential to develop strong relationship skills and have a commitment to providing exceptional customer service. Demonstrate strong time management and organisation skills  with the ability to multi-task and prioritise your work You will learn how to use relevant programs on the job as required  knowledge of Microsoft Excel or any coding experience would be highly regarded   Qualification Required:  Degree in a Science discipline with a strong emphasis on mathematical skills e.g. Actuarial or Data Science  Mathematics  Engineering or Statistics.   What's in it for you?  · Great central location (when we return from WFH that is!)  · Fantastic employee benefits including - flexible work arrangements  health & wellbeing allowance  access to corporate discounts through Perks at Work  additional purchased annual leave  super matching and free weekly fresh fruit.  · Access to ongoing professional development  including study support and career progression within a leading global organisation.   To apply  please send your resume to aupeopleculture@metlife.com   Applications close Sunday 10th April 2022 MetLife is proud to be an equal opportunity/affirmative action employer. We are committed to attracting  retaining and maximizing the performance of a diverse and inclusive workforce. It is the policy of MetLife to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race  color  creed  religion  national origin  alienage or citizenship status  age  sex  sexual orientation  gender identity  or expression  marital or domestic/civil partnership status  disability  veteran status  genetic information or any other basis protected by law.

Title: Biostatistician Research Officer
Requirements: Posted by Brandon West (GAHRI) Recruitment Officer at Murdoch University Send InMail Fixed Term  Full Time HEW0708 | Competitive Remuneration Package to be offered to successful candidate 10% employer superannuation contributions Salary Packaging opportunities Ref: 3814A01/127708 The Centre for Computational & Systems Medicine (CCSM) is a leading research centre at Murdoch University  with strong national and international reputation for translational research. At Murdoch  we pride ourselves on our diverse and vibrant workplace. We are committed to the recruitment and development of skilled and passionate people  who want to make a difference to the world around them. With more than 23 000 students and 1 700 staff across three campuses in the Perth area as well as centres in Singapore and Dubai  Murdoch has an ambitious agenda both locally and internationally. The Role An exciting new opportunity has arisen for a Research Officer with experienced in Bioinformatics  Chemometrics or Biostatistics  to join the Centre for Computational & Systems Medicine (CCSM) at Murdoch University. This is part of the WA Premier’s Science Program specifically aims to apply metabolic phenotyping and data analytics with clinical application targeted at disease prevention. The position will drive research activities that focus on the development and application of high-fidelity computational and statistical modelling pipelines for modelling spectroscopic data generated by instruments such as nuclear magnetic resonance spectroscopy and mass spectrometers. The candidate will develop and apply univariate and multivariate statistical and pattern recognition techniques to interrogate the spectroscopic data. The candidate will also contribute to the rapidly expanding opportunities in precision health. What you’ll bring to this role MSc or PhD with experience in Chemometrics  Bioinformatics or related fields  with a strong focus on applied statistics Professional experience in data analysis  data modelling  statistical analysis  and results reporting Proficiency in programming languages such as R  Python  MATLAB and JavaScript A track record of applying mathematical analysis to interrogate spectroscopic day. Relevant techniques include  and not limited to  pattern recognition  multivariate regression  and machine learning Practical experience in analysing high dimensional data  especially data derived from MS and NMR spectroscopy  and visualisation of results It is also desirable for the preferred candidate to have: Experience in managing a project and delivering key research milestones on time Excellent time management skills and ability to work as part of a scientifically diverse team High quality track record of publications and presentations at national and international meetings/conferences or equivalent eminence within an industry context Experience in providing supervision to junior staff and/or PhD students Applicants should refer to the Position Description for further detail on the duties  skills and experience required for this role. Applicants must have valid work rights. What you’ll get in return You will be part of a vibrant and talented team  work in an innovative and lively university community and enjoy the benefits that come with working at Murdoch. Our people enjoy a lively  natural campus and world-class facilities  as well as a range of benefits including: Competitive remuneration Paid leave entitlements Flexible work arrangements Salary packaging options Employee Assistance Program On Campus Services and Facilities  including a Childcare Centre  Gym  Vet Hospital and Chiropractic Clinic To Apply Please apply  follow the link through to Seek and submit the documents below: A cover letter including a statement addressing the selection criteria (found in the Position Description) Your most recent resume (CV) Please visit the Current Vacancies page to view the position description for this role. Please see the Applicant Guide for more information. Applications sent by post or email will not be accepted. Please note visa sponsorship is not available for this position. Position contact: Dr. Ruey Leng Loo  WA Premier’s Mid-Career Fellow in Molecular Nutrition at rueyleng.loo@murdoch.edu.au Murdoch University values diversity  promotes inclusion  and strongly encourages Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander people  women  and people with disability to apply. Applicants who have support or access requirements  are encouraged to advise this at the time of their application  to ensure appropriate assistance is provided throughout the recruitment process. Closing date: 30 April 2022 (8:59pm AWST) The University reserves the right to withdraw this advertisement at any time.

This is an long term day rate contract with a view of being extended or becoming permanent for the right Candidate. Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: Award Winning Team | Permanent Job | Leading Tech Company  Your New Company  With a global client base but primarily based in Perth this organisation synonymous with online tech has 2 Data Analyst jobs. They are known as a SaaS platform for online marketing underpinned by secure cyber and data risk practices. To ensure the products that showcase their market leading presence stay at the forefront of the industry they are in need of multiple Data Analysts.  Your new role  You will work with an experienced team who know the SaaS solution well. Working in a high performance customer support team your contribution will ensure the customer is aware of the performance of their ads as data is analysed and presented using unique insights. As a Data Analyst in the team other responsibilities will include Display quality data in an understandable manner Assist in research for client presentations Analyse data around fraudulent activity and web traffic Build data dashboards Work with the team to implement plans to improve data quality What you'll need to succeed  Ideally a couple of years' experience in a similar role is required to be successful at interview as experience of working with customers and commercial knowledge is preferred. However  graduates who can demonstrate a high level of commercial acumen and some exposure working with high-profile customers in a work environment are also encouraged to apply.  Skills that are required to deliver this Data Analyst role successfully are: A good level of SQL query skills (query Dev't and tuning) Excellent Communication and team player skills Business Analysis Good BI application skills (PowerBI or Tableau for example) Data Visualisation Any exposure to Google Ads or mobile marketing platforms is highly regarded. What you'll get in return  The Data Team have won multiple awards so you will be learning from the best in the business. It's an awesome opportunity to work for a leading player in the online advertising world. The opportunity is available as a fully remote option if you aren't based in Perth as this position is critical to the next stage of the product development. There are various benefits on offer as well as flexible work  including share schemes  social events  upskilling opportunities and employee wellness plans. This is a permanent opportunity and a competitive salary is on offer for the right candidate.  What You Need To Do Now  If you're interested in this role  click 'apply now' to forward an up-to-date copy of your CV to Hannah Becker hannah.becker@hays.com.au  or call us now.  If this job isn't quite right for you but you are looking for a new position  please contact us for a confidential discussion on your career.  LHS 297508 #2626512

Title: Consultant - Data Analytics
Requirements: Posted by Chris Caiger-Watson Director at GeniusPeople Send InMail About The Firm A powerhouse Fortune 500 Company in the international consulting world  this business gets ranked in the top 100 employers brands globally as a team of pioneers who move with agility and best practice thinking to implement pragmatic solutions for complex business issues with data in Infrastructure. This is not your standard data science role and you should keep reading if you have a strong commercial background  an exceptional modelling CV and an entrepreneurial mindset. DA is the future.  About The Role An exciting opportunity is now available for an experienced analytics consultant. You will be a key part of our Digital Consulting offering to our biggest clients  particularly in the Transportation  Resources and Government sectors. Title: Analytics and AI Developer
Requirements: Overview Full-time  Fixed Term position until December 2022  in the first instance Salary Level HEW 8 + 17% Superannuation and Flexible Working Arrangements Based at the Melbourne CBD campus  but may be required to work and/or be based at other campuses of the University  About You  As the Analytics and AI Developer  you will support the delivery of research and development of the various analytics and AI projects across the College of Business & Law. You will be situated within the RMIT Enterprise AI and Data Analytics Hub  a newly established entity and research group that brings together researchers from across the College to address analytics and AI research from a business-first perspective. As such  you can expect to work closely with a diverse range of stakeholders and to participate in the design of analytics and AI solutions that require a combination of business-driven theories  frameworks  processes  and any other considerations as part of the solutions delivery.  To Be Successful In This Position  You’ll Have Degree in data science  business analytics  computer science  or a relevant discipline. Experience with data wrangling  including the use of tools such as SQL and ETL tools. Experience with development of visualisations  such as Tableau or PowerBI. Demonstrated proficiency with a programming language  such as R or Python  including an updated-to-date understanding of relevant packages and libraries in analytics  machine learning and AI. Experience with version control software  such as Github. Some experience of software development  e.g.  in web or application development  that uses AI and Analytics models will be highly desirable A strong analytical mindset and problem-solving skills. Ability to work effectively as part of a multi-disciplinary team  including the ability to interface with software developers to deliver outputs as part of a solution. Demonstrated attitude to continuous learning and upskilling. Please Note: Appointment to this position is subject to passing a Working with Children Check.  About The Hub  The Enterprise AI and Data Analytics Hub is a newly established research structure within the College of Business & Law. The mission of the Hub is to undertake research in Analytics and AI  ensuring effective translation of these technologies in various business problems  and to deliver a bespoke business-first training in Analytics and AI skills for the industry. The hub will bring together capabilities from across the College  giving businesses a one-stop shop for AI and Analytics capabilities that are grounded with business know-how  including areas such as accounting and finance  marketing  HRM  supply chain  and more. Collectively  our work will advance the communities we serve in achieving a thriving digital economy in the next decade.  As a staff of the Hub  you will have the opportunity to work collaboratively in a team setting with a range of stakeholders and problem areas  including opportunities to contribute to the College’s strategic plans and vision. Growing together with the hub  your role will have a voice in the directions and projects to pursue  giving you the satisfaction to take ownership of the Hub’s development.  To Apply  Please submit your CV and covering letter addressing your suitability for this position by clicking on the ‘Apply’ link below.  For further information about this position  please see Position Description below or contact Kok-Leong Ong (Head of Department  Information Systems) via email on kok-leong.ong2@rmit.edu.au  PD - Analytics and AI Developer (CoBL)  Vaccination Requirements  The COVID-19 Mandatory Vaccination (Workers) Directions  made under the Public Health and Wellbeing Act 2008 (Vic) and as amended and replaced from time to time (Directions)  affect all persons employed or engaged to perform work by RMIT.  As such  offers of employment from RMIT are conditional upon the applicant being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or medically exempt and providing satisfactory evidence of the same. You can access the Directions here: https://www.dhhs.vic.gov.au/victorias-restriction-levels-covid-19  Applications Close  27 Apr 2022 11.59 pm  RMIT is an equal opportunity employer committed to being a child safe organisation. We are dedicated to attracting  retaining and developing our people regardless of gender identity  ethnicity  sexual orientation  disability and age. Applications are encouraged from all sectors of the community and we strongly encourage applications from the Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander community.  RMIT is a Disability Confident Recruitment Team and we are happy to adjust the recruitment process for your accessibility requirements. Please contact us at TalentSupport@rmit.edu.au telling us your preferred type of communication and we will be in touch as soon as possible to discuss your requirements.  Please note that whilst we still accept applications from any persons interested in our roles  due to the impacts of COVID-19  we are currently prioritising applications from those with current working rights in Australia and who are not affected by travel restrictions. Please see the latest updates to Australia’s immigration and border arrangements during the COVID-19 (Coronavirus) outbreak here.  We are a Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.

Title: Analytics Consultant
Requirements: Job Summary  Thanks to recent successes AECOM is seeking experienced Analytics Consultants at all levels.  As a member of the Australia New Zealand Analytics Team you will be a key part of our Digital Consulting offering to our biggest clients  particularly in the Transportation  Resources and Government sectors.  You will be part of a high performing  Australia-wide team responsible for descriptive  predictive and prescriptive analytics including simulation modelling of infrastructure and operations  machine learning  natural language processing and dashboarding.  You will support the preparation  modelling and analysis of client data and apply data science  operations research and AI techniques to solve real-world problems.  A self-motivated and inquisitive individual would best suit this role with a combination of on-the-job and self-paced training provided.  Minimum Requirements At least 2 years relevant experience  ideally in a consulting environment A strong sense of commitment  a willingness to learn  and a desire to work in a dynamic consulting environment The following experience would be highly desirable: Python or C# Power BI or Tableau Discrete event simulation Web development Knowledge of operations research techniques This role involves regular contact with clients so very good interpersonal skills with an ability to focus on client requirements is a must. Strong analytical and data manipulation skills  Preferred Qualifications Tertiary qualification in Mathematics  Data Science  Computer Science or Engineering or similar numerate discipline Certified Analytics Professional or similar accreditations desirable  What We Offer  We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office  remote location or at a client site  you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity  entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.  You will help us foster a culture of equity  diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace  where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents  backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.  We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on  the teams and committees you join and our business.  We offer competitive pay and benefits  well-being programs to support you and your family  and the development resources you need to advance your career.  When you join us  you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners  designers  engineers  scientists  consultants  program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.  As an Equal Opportunity Employer  we believe in each person’s potential  and we’ll help you reach yours.  Job Category Engineering - Transportation - Advisory  Business Line Transportation  Business Group Design and Consulting Services Group (DCS)  Country Australia  Position Status Full Time  Requisition/Vacancy No. 265056BR  Additional Locations AU - Brisbane  QLD  AU - Melbourne  VIC - Collins Square  AU - Sydney  NSW  Virtual: No  Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race  color  religion  sex  national origin  sexual orientation  gender identity  disability or protected veteran status.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Requirements: Who is Equifax?  Equifax is a leading global data  analytic and technology company  supporting customers across 24 countries. We have been serving the Australian and New Zealand markets for over 60 years. Through continuously adapting to our environment  not only have we remained a market leader  we drive and challenge ourselves to do better to help our customers live their financial best.  Our people are what makes us great at what we do - we see every member of our team as an integral piece of a jigsaw. We celebrate differences and recognise that each person brings with them unique talents and perspectives. We provide our people the support and flexibility to manage their work-life balance. At Equifax we genuinely care about our people and our ability to come together as #OneEquifax.  The perks of being an Equifax employee within the Data & Analytics team?  There are lots of perks of being an Equifax employee – we offer additional leave days as we recognise the importance of taking time out  whether that’s to catch up on some rest  celebrate a birthday  or give back to our community by volunteering. We are committed to the wellbeing of our people and provide them with discounted health cover through BUPA  access to comprehensive hearing services and discounts  and offer 24/7 support through our employee assistance program. Our leadership team fosters a culture of ownership  they will lead  coach  mentor and listen. We support one another to feel confident to speak up and hold each other accountable to work with integrity.  Our success is our people  for we are truly united by our purpose and are encouraged and challenged every day to bring new ideas to help our customers make more informed decisions. Our outcomes focussed culture encourages thought leadership and innovation to ensure our ongoing success.  We are supportive and revel in working together on exciting projects. We see ourselves making an impact by utilising cutting edge/statistical modelling tools across hundreds of rich data assets and collaborating with some of the best data minds in Australia. Working within our diverse D&A team will provide you opportunities to gain exposure across all phases of the D&A lifecycle and work with some of our largest blue-chip customers.  What you’ll do:  This is an 18 month fixed term contract.  The Senior Technical Data Analyst is responsible for identifying data ingestion solutions for new and existing customers. This also includes the reparation of data for analytical use by building data pipeline to gather data from multiple sources and systems  integrating  consolidating  and cleansing data  and structuring data for use by our clients in our solutions. You will also perform design  creation  and interpretation of large and highly complex datasets  What are we looking for?  Tertiary qualification with Computer Science  Information Technology  Engineering or equivalent Experience in Agile Development environment Strong skills with SQL  Python and Data Visualisation Able to work independently  Extra points for any of the following:  Knowledge of Tableau Basic knowledge of Java Exposure to GCP  Success attributes of an Equifax employee  does this describe you?  Accountable Brave Curious Collaborative Individualist Trustworthy Dedicated  At Equifax  there is no such thing as the 'perfect candidate'  Seeing responsibilities and competencies laid out on paper can be confronting. At this stage of the application process  sometimes imposter syndrome can creep in and mess with our confidence. Please know  we list these items to give you an opportunity to show us your potential and how you can grow and transform with us.  Your ability to demonstrate that you possess/have the real potential to develop the required capabilities  knowledge  experience and qualifications to perform in our roles is what we would like to hear from you. Where possible  you should support your claims with specific examples of what you have done and how you did it.

Title: Data Analyst - Packaging
Requirements: About YFYJupiter YFYJupiter is an integrated brand packaging services company specializing in sustainable packaging  structural engineering  graphic design  photography  printing  package manufacturing  and JIT supply chain. Our clients include leading global retailers  forward brands companies  consumer electronics brands companies  and ODMs.  About the Role The role is individual-contributor and client-facing roles. As a member of the Packaging Professional Service team  you will be working directly with leading retailers to develop and implement sustainable packaging solutions throughout the client’s product lifecycle. You will face various projects that will require you to analyze complex problems using data and provide insight to our clients. You will work closely with various functional groups to identify process and system parameters  design and create methods to extract data  contribute to data quality management  and produce reports using appropriate methods. Utilize your experience in data analytics to solve our client’s needs. You will be exposure to work with various industry leaders and best practices and have the chance to create change and sustainable results for YFYJupiter and our clients. What You Will Do As an individual contributor  you will work as a member of the client-facing project team to deliver the assigned project (s) and project scope(s) Using tools to extract data from various databases  perform exploratory data analysis  cleanse  massage  and collect data from various sources as provided or instructed by clients and per project base. Design  develop  and execute quarries of databases using tools  develop additional databases as necessary. While you will be assigned project scope based on your experience level and specialization(s)  most projects require you to be broad in your approach and project delivery as defined in each project scope of work Assists with monthly  quarterly  and annual data verification Assists with tracking and verification of data flow from suppliers through the client’s value stream. Participate in effective communication with clients to define and build business cases utilizing data through visual displays of quantitative information  interpretations  and recommendations. Work with internal YFYJupiter teams to leverage appropriate resources for client-facing developments. Qualifications University degrees and formal educational background from a reputable institution in information systems  statistics  data science  computer science or other related degree is a must At least three (3) years of professional or commercial experiences reflecting a knowledgeable  mid-level data analyst. Experienced in start-up environment and able to perform with minimal supervision. Experience in querying and manipulating large data sets using data querying languages (e.g. SQL)  scripting languages (e.g. Python)  and utilizing statistical/mathematical software (e.g. Python  pandas  R) Experienced in using various data tools (e.g.  AWS  Tableau  Power BI  Shiny  Excel) as each client’s requirement may vary. Self-starter with the ability to work in a cross-functional  team-oriented environment Able to work in a flexible-hour environment  collaborating with teams in different international time-zones based on project assignment. Nice to have but not necessary - Proficient with one or more of the following: sustainable packaging  Extended Producer Responsibility (EPR)’s role influencing design  general recycling process  packaging recyclability Reporting to: Director of Professional Services

Title: Senior Reporting & Insights Analyst
Requirements: A new opportunity reporting into the Senior Manager  Data & Analytics has become available on a full time  permanent basis. Based out of our Melbourne  Sydney or Brisbane office locations when not working remotely.  The Senior Reporting Insights Analyst is responsible for leading the development of analytic products to facilitate data-driven business decision making within Bupa Australia Health Services.  How will I help?  Key accountabilities include:   Working with Health Services business units to execute operational  commercial  contractual and insights reporting. Leading conversations with internal stakeholders to understand their business needs  offer recommendations to improve outcomes and provide insights into customer behaviour  profitability  segmentation. Prepare data for reporting. Complete any data mining needed to prepare new fields or measures. Develop new reports  trouble-shoot technical problems and implement enhancements in PowerBI or other reporting tools (e.g. Excel  SAS) Develop predictive models and enhance data-driven business decision making and effectively lead a pipeline of analytics  reporting and data work. Implement the Health Services data strategy and roadmap by implementing new reporting  analytics or modelling  and/or supporting the improvement of data flows  data processing or data storage as directed by the Senior Manager  Data & Analytics. Contribute to a collaborative model of centralised analytics. Continually improve BAU processes through automation to drive efficiency and accuracy What's in it for me?  As well as a competitive salary  a range of Bupa benefits and flexible working/ work from home arrangements  you'll be challenged and encouraged to innovate. You will partner with colleagues who are dedicated to delivering exceptional experiences. We respect and consider everyone  knowing your difference will make the difference.  Perk highlights:   Discount on our health insurance  travel  car  home  contents and pet insurance products as well as discounts when you attend a Bupa Dental clinic or purchase glasses from a Bupa Optical store. A dedicated internal wellbeing team provides you with a range of services  such as a global resilience program  regular training opportunities on a range of wellbeing topics and access to a variety of wellbeing discounts. An additional well-being day each year to treat yourself. What do I need?   Tertiary qualifications in Data Science  Statistics  Mathematics  Economics  Computer Science  or a related quantitative field. 3+ years' experience using Microsoft Data Platforms & Data Analytics  Microsoft Power BI (including DAX coding) and SQL to extract and manipulate data for reporting and insights Strong interpersonal and communication skills with the ability to engage and influence stakeholders at all levels including data-story telling  facilitating meetings and presenting to large groups Expertise in analysing data sets  quantitative analysis  data mining and creating data visualisations to provide business insights Experience in Marketing Analytics including pre/post campaign analysis  segmentation  targeting and CRM Able to move  extract  manipulate and analyse data. Knowledge of ETL processes and comfortable working with relational databases and reporting cubes Strong work execution  proactive  passion for quality and attention to detail. Collaborative approach to work and would thrive in a connected  innovative team culture. Comfortable working with sensitive data and will vigilantly maintain the integrity of the customers' data. Previous experience in customer insights or marketing analytics is preferred. Knowledge of these concepts applications in the health care industry would be ideal. About Bupa  Bupa is an international healthcare group which has a purpose to deliver longer  healthier  happier lives and making a better world for more than 70 years. In Australia and New Zealand  Bupa assists more than 5 million customers through a broad range of health and care services including health insurance  aged care  rehabilitation  dental  optical  medical  hearing and medical visa services.  Our people reflect the diversity of our community. At Bupa  your wellbeing  identity and own story is respected and valued.

What's Involved  Sourcing  manipulating  and drawing meaningful insights from disparate datasets Identifying opportunities to drive business growth Developing a deep understanding of the business  working with and influencing key stakeholders Creative problem solving to define and deliver innovative solutions to business problems Supporting the delivery of benefits articulated in a business functions analytical roadmap Contributing to the design  development  Analytical implementation and ongoing support of Analytical Products for a business function Bringing to life the Data and Analytics teams’ aspiration to build the best retail data capability  Who We’re Looking For  You are an analytical  outcome driven problem solver who is flexible & adaptable in their approach. Title: Business Analyst (Data and Analytics)
Requirements: Posted by Maria Smyth 2nd Talent (Data) @ Mantel Group [Hiring Data Engineers  Data Scientists  Machine Learning Engineers & Data & Analytics Consultants for Mantel Group] Send InMail It's official! Eliiza has ranked as No 1 Best Workplace in Australia! (as part of Mantel Groups house of brands - named Best Medium sized workplace 2021!).  Eliiza is jam packed full of passionate data lovers! Our team consists of Data Consultant  Machine Learning Engineers  Data Engineers & Data Scientists all working together to deliver smart data science and analytics solutions for our clients.  Our team members are located all around Australia and New Zealand and we dont mind where you are located (within Australia & New Zealand). We've built a hybrid approach to working where you can access any (or all!) of our awesome hubs providing a space for collaboration across Melbourne  Sydney  Brisbane  Perth & Magnetic island (and more to come including Queenstown & Auckland!) meaning you can choose a work model (and location!) that works best for you and your individual needs!  We don't have a head office  instead have opted for a distributed and diverse leadership team that extends across Australia and New Zealand.  Our approach is simple  we hire smart people and get out of their way. We don’t do policies  performance reviews  hierarchies or bureaucracy! By focusing on our five principles and not getting caught up in red tape  we trust you to get the job done.  So you’re ready for something new?  The Data and Analytics practice is a brand new team at Eliiza. We will be setting out to help our clients solve a broader set of analytics problems  which will complement both our expertise in ML and AI in Eliiza and our broader Mantel Group solutions.  The Data and Analytics proposition sits across four key areas: Data Strategy  Machine Learning and Data Science Strategy  Data Governance and Data Storytelling. You will be instrumental in supporting the successful delivery of projects  helping build our reputation as one of the most impactful consultancies in the Data and Analytics space.  With our diverse range of clients and projects  no day will look the same - but here’s a little snapshot of how you could spend your day: be the conduit between business and technology  quickly understanding business requirements and translating them into technical specifications as the bridge between business and technology  you will play a key role in a cross-functional Eliiza team or working as part of an integrated team with our clients communicate and collaborate with stakeholders to investigate issues  analyse information and deliver into appropriate artefacts Work to quickly gain understanding of our clients’ data environment  through process mapping  data exploration and analysis support delivery by being across key deliverables  risks and dependencies within the team as well as cross teams articulate key activities involved in various data roles (e.g. data engineering  data science or data governance) and their business impacts and benefits to the clients  If you’re the right Business Analyst (Data & Analytics) for us  you’ll: come from a strong technical background  you will be comfortable being the conduit between technical and non-technical teams you will have breadth of experience across data projects including performing data exploration  data modelling and data analysis ideally you will have exposure to or experience working with data visualisation tools e.g. PowerBI  Tableau etc your interpersonal skills are key and you will enjoy building strong relationships with a range of business and technology stakeholders you thrive in a collaborative environment and have demonstrated ability to work in cross functional teams analytical mind  keen attention to detail and not afraid to ask “why?” self-starter who is hands on  knows how to find answers and can work with ambiguity  Our team is made up of a range of people  with different experience across a huge range of data driven skill sets. We value a diversity of skill-sets  and don’t necessarily require that you’re skilled with all of the above (we’re aware there’s a lot listed!). If you feel you don't fit all the experience/skills listed we still encourage you to apply or get in touch.  What's on offer/ Why Eliiza?  We make sure you’re always one step ahead by investing your learning and development  every year. We build our own training where it doesn’t exist yet - it’s in our best interest to teach you things you don’t already know. You and your family’s health are most important to us. We know everyone is walking their own path in life  so we offer Flexible Leave for those times in your life when you need extra support. We want each person to tailor their working conditions whether that be remotely every now and then  or on a permanent basis - we know how to actually do ‘flexibility’ not just talk about it. You’ll be joining a passionate and supportive team who’ll move mountains to help you achieve your objective. You’ll get all the tools you need - including the latest phone & laptop along with mobile & data allowance and a lot of swag!  But hold on  you mentioned a house of brands?  We certainly did! Mantel Group is an Australian-owned  'house of brands' company with seven technology businesses (Eliiza being one of them!) across Australia and New Zealand. We know you won’t have one job for life so we’re building a group of companies with open borders so we can support you to take on new skills and challenges without leaving an awesome team!  Being part of Mantel Group means it’s not just the Eliiza team you’ll work with  learn from and see at social events - there’s almost 500 of us across DigIO  Kasna  CMD Solutions  Pretzel lab  Azenix & Cuusoo!  Sounds like a good match for you? Click “Apply” to share your details with our talent team  and we’ll be in touch. In the meantime  check out ‘how we hire’ to find out what’s in store if you’re successful and get to know us better by visiting our website and following Eliiza on LinkedIn.

Title: Senior Information Analyst
Requirements: WA Health is committed to growing the Aboriginal workforce as a part of WA Health’s Aboriginal Workforce Policy. As a measure to achieve equality  Section 51 of the Equal Opportunity Act 1984 applies to this position. Aboriginal people are encouraged to apply.  Position Profile: North Metropolitan Mental Health Service is seeking suitable applications for a Senior Information Analyst to join the Clinical Research Centre at Graylands Hospital. The position develops  manages and reports on projects of a complex analytical nature related to the planning and implementation of clinical reforms necessary in clinical service delivery affecting performance  provision and service utilization. The incumbent designs  plans  and develops the technical methodologies and techniques to frame the data infrastructure in order to meet the strategic and operational planning and improvement of mental health services in the NMHS.  Eligibility to Apply: Australian citizenship or permanent residency is an essential requirement for applicants to be considered for permanent positions in the public sector.  All WA health system employees are required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including the booster vaccination when they are eligible) in order to access health care facilities  pursuant to the Health Worker (Restrictions on Access) Directions (HWD) (or its replacement)  COVID-19 Mandatory Vaccination and Vaccination Program Policy  and the Booster Vaccination (Restriction on Access) Directions (no 2) (or its replacement) (BVD)  unless the employee is exempt pursuant to the HWD and/or BVD.  Additionally  if an employee is working in a residential aged care facility  they must comply with the Residential Aged Care Facility Worker Access Directions No 4 (or its replacement). Title: Analytics Lead - Oracle Consulting
Requirements: The great thing (one of the many great things) about Accenture is that you can work from pretty much anywhere in the ANZ region – living in a small town not near one of our physical offices? That’s OK. Permanently residing at your beach house and wanting to venture into the office only once and a while? That’s Ok too. We are all connected through Technology and so this opens up our world and allows you to balance your life in ways that are important to you.  This role sits within our Oracle Analytics team and will see you deliver complex data analytics and applied intelligence solutions to large private and government organisations.  We’re looking for someone who is skilled in cloud architecture  large-scale analytics implementations and who is used to operating in a tech leadership capacity  leading architecture and design. Being Certified in Oracle Analytics Cloud underpins your credibility.  We’re looking for someone who lives and breathes Analytics and who has built their career specifically in Oracle  being familiar with ADW and/or ATP and  prior to Fusion  with EBS.  You will be pivotal to driving business outcomes for clients through analytics either as Embedded Analytics or Analytics as a Service.  leveraging analytics to drive next generation initiatives and innovation. This role supports the delivery leads  account management and operational excellence teams to deliver client value through analytics and industry best practices.  About Accenture  Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital  cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries  we offer Strategy and Consulting  Interactive  Technology and Operations services — all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 569 000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day  serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients  people  shareholders  partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.  Accenture has a culture of knowledge sharing and equipping its people with what they need to succeed. We offer flexibility and value diversity in all its forms  welcoming interest from people from all ethnicities  backgrounds  belief systems and worldviews  those looking for full-time or part-time working options as well as people with physical or mental disabilities. Please let us know if you require special assistance at any point in the recruitment process.  YOU matter!

Title: Experienced Data Analyst
Requirements: Welcome to Aginic  a consultancy where some of the country’s brightest data analysts  engineers  agile coaches  designers  and cloud architects blend their technical skills with a desire to deliver impactful insights that solve business problems  For more information about us visit https://aginic.com/our-people/  Welcome to Aginic  a consultancy where some of the country’s brightest data analysts  engineers  agile coaches  designers  and cloud architects blend their technical skills with a desire to deliver impactful insights that solve business problems  As a data analyst with Aginic  you can choose to be a business-focussed generalist or mix your skillset up with data science or data engineering.  Working as a key member/lead of a cross functional squad  you will deliver awesome outcomes for our clients. You will be primarily responsible for performing data analytics and visualisations on a variety of projects for a range of clients  from state government departments to not for profits and large commercial clients.  About The Role Ask the right questions to understand a new client's business and guide them to the right data solutions  to develop data pipelines  dashboards or reports to make data accessible to them in a timely and intuitive way Perform data analytics and visualisation for a range of clients  including state health departments  major retailers  banks  utilities  aged care and education Your day-to-day work will involve a range of different technologies. On one project you may perform data modelling in SQL  leverage a modern ELT data stack on the cloud and then develop dashboards for end users in Power BI or Qlik Sense. On another project you might build a predictive machine learning model  advise clients on the strategy to create and deploy dashboards or automate tasks and data flows using Power Automate and Power BI  What you offer A relevant degree in a numerical discipline You have the ability to lead an analytics project. You may have experience leading projects or have worked in a complex analytics environment You're smart  innovative and always learning new things You critically reflect on your own processes and challenge assumptions about how things should be done  exploring solutions that others might not consider You're approachable  dependable and genuine and you care about getting to know people You like the start-up vibe of a workplace and are excited by the prospect of working in an energetic and growing team  If you have any analytics experience or relevant projects  we'd love to see them.  At Aginic we value diversity in our people and the ideas they bring to our team. We look after our team and pride ourselves on our supportive and friendly culture. We’re looking for people who identify with our values whilst also bringing their own individual perspective on their work  choosing your own adventure in how you help us support our clients.  What we offer: Attractive remuneration and leave package Training and professional development opportunities Flexible working Social workplace with regular events and team activities including “Winter School” - 1 week residential professional development and team building trip. EAP and other wellbeing initiatives for all employees Start up culture that values ideas from all levels Coaching program  If this sounds like a good fit we'd love to hear from you.  We’re committed to promoting diversity in the workplace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply. Are you looking to join a high performing  smart and fun team? Apply now!

Title: Google Data Analyst
Requirements: ● Are you passionate about tech? ● Autonomous and challenging role ● Work with a fun and highly dynamic team ● Exciting opportunity for an analytical individual to join our team and work with our client Google!   As a Data Analyst  you will work with our client Google  to increase sales of Google Products within National Consumer Electronics and Telecommunications retailers. You will assist the team in analysing large volumes of data to identify  shape and drive initiatives to maximize return on investment of existing capabilities and shape and deliver new sales opportunities.  In the role you will effectively help manage  collect and interpret large volumes of data from multiple sources (in house reporting platform  customer sales data  etc) to provide insights  ROI and trending reports that accelerate retail excellence for our client.  Your insights and recommendations  together with your supporting rationale  will influence and drive critical strategic and sales/commercial decisions  both internally and with our client. As someone who is naturally inquisitive  great with numbers  commercially savvy and an effective communicator you will know how to turn data into impactful sales insights  and logically drive creative and innovative ideas to drive persistently increasing sales of Google products.  A competitive total salary package inclusive of superannuation ($90 000 - $100 000) is on offer for this 9-month contract  with option to extend.   What do you need?  ● Bachelor’s degree in a related field or equivalent working experience ● 3+ years’ experience in data/business analyst related role ● Understanding of the Consumer Electronics and Telecommunications Industry ● Proficiency in Excel and analysing data sets to drive data-based decisions ● Experience in SQL and Tableau is welcome  but not critical   What would your day look like?  ● Compiling large volumes of product sales and other forms of data to identify Key performance indicators  trends and opportunities ● Building and reconfiguring data capture and reporting tools to improve data management ● Communicating inquisitive insights in weekly/monthly and ad hoc reporting for internal and external stakeholders ● Managing data infrastructure to provide efficient insights and improve data driven decision making ● Coaching and support field and other teams within the Google program in analysing and understanding data trends   The qualities of a Google Data Analyst:  ● Excellent written  communication and presentation skills ● Superlative time management and prioritisation skills ● Diligent  hard-working  loyal and reliable  you take pride in delivering exceptional results ● Enthusiastic and energetic team player  who proactively shares knowledge and experience ● Ability to learn and use complex reporting platforms - Tableau experience welcome ● Solutions focused ● Proactively inquisitive and insatiably curious ● Able to simplify and explain complex concepts   About us  Creative Activation is the number 1 retail partner in Australia for merchandising  sales teams and mystery shopping. We work with leading brands and retailers to drive sales and brand experience through field marketing activations. We have a relentless pursuit to exceed expectations and achieve results we can be proud of.   Interested?  This is an ideal role to make your mark within an innovative  supportive and driven business that is regularly adapting to the changing retail environment. If this sounds like you then please apply with your resume and cover letter outlining why you would be the perfect fit for this opportunity. Applications close 29/04/2022.  Please note that only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

Title: Data Analyst - Store Design & Space Planning
Requirements: Data Analyst - Space Planning  Are you looking for an opportunity to combine your analytical skills with your ability to communicate a compelling story and build great relationships? If so  this is the ideal role for you! Be an advocate for the use of customer-focused data and insights in the business Work with a team that supports growth and career development Norwest based with WFH flexibility About The Role  As we continue to increase our customer focus and lead the food market within Australia we will continue to place a greater emphasis on strategic thinking and the ongoing development of a high-performing Commercial team.  You will have the opportunity to work on one of the biggest strategic initiatives within the Woolworths business - to deliver a differentiated offer for our customers  leveraging our data and insights to inform our space strategy and ranging decisions.  About The Role    The Macro Space Analyst is positioned within the Space and Insights team and is responsible for analysing space utilisation and performance within our stores. The individual will be responsible for deriving data-driven  fact-based recommendations to ensure store designs are customer-centric and maximise the shopping experience for our customers.  Key Responsibilities Include  However Not Limited To Partner with our Merchandising & Space Tribe in the delivery of tailored stores through data-driven space management As an analyst  you will assist with the delivery of customer-focused floor plans  optimising space allocation across departments and categories  while driving continuous improvement initiatives Deriving data-led insights  providing recommendations on space strategy and striving to maximise our Return on Space Identify store opportunities through structured analysis and problem solving across different areas  support the build and delivery of multi-store programs driving significant incr. sales and profit outcomes Incorporate strategic insights from qualitative and quantitative consumer and category research Consult and collaborate confidently with stakeholders across the business to achieve desired outcomes We Offer An exciting career - As our business grows  so do the opportunities for our team members Strong career progression and succession opportunities into more senior strategy positions or other business roles across Woolworths Group Paid parental leave  Headspace Days Strong mentorship and development  opportunity to collaborate with some of the brightest and best minds in Australia Flexible working arrangements  excellent employee benefits & unparalleled growth opportunities We value diversity and aim to create a vibrant and inclusive workforce that reflects the communities we serve. About You  You are an analytical thinker  with capability of breaking information into component parts  patterns  and relationships & with a passion to understand customer behaviour and its links to commercial outcomes. You will have strong experience in interpreting data and deriving actionable insights to make recommendations for commercial strategies. You are a critical thinker who is able to adapt to new situations  and know-how to maximise value  sometimes  with limited information and inputs.  You Will Have A minimum of 1-2 years experience in relevant roles e.g analyst  category executive  sales analyst  account executive - Required Confident communicator and storyteller  with strong visualisation  verbal  and written skills - Required Advanced Excel functions e.g. pivot tables  formulas  and conditional formatting  with basic SQL skills a plus Bachelor Degree in Business  Marketing  Finance or related subject or equal professional experience - Desirable Understands the FMCG industry and commercial processes of Woolworths and Suppliers - Desirable If you share our customer-first culture and enjoy influencing stakeholders  & meet a number of requirements (and not all)  we encourage you to submit your application #work180  Apply via www.wowcareers.com.au or alternatively connect with us on Linkedin for further information  Grow with the Group  As an inclusive  team-first company  our people are at the core of everything we do.  We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued  respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity  ethnicity  disability  sexual orientation or life stage and we are proud to be recognised as a Gold Tier Employer in the Australian Workplace Equality Index for LGBTI inclusion.  As our Group continues to evolve  innovate and support our communities  we encourage our team members to do the same with their own careers  by providing ongoing opportunities to grow and make a real difference.  We value flexibility  and encourage our team members to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing.  We work hard to create a safe and inclusive environment for all  and most importantly  we're all about creating better experiences – for our customers and for each other.  We’d love to hear from You  If you meet a number of the requirements  but not all  we encourage you to submit your application. You can follow us on LinkedIn or see more opportunities via www.wowcareers.com.au.

Title: Sales Data Analyst
Requirements: Is supporting a great leader what you love to do?  Do you get a kick out of providing great customer service to internal and external stakeholders? Your perfect job is here! Join our fast-paced team and help us deliver top notch service to our business one happy team member at a time.  What You Will Be Doing Day To Day  Reporting to the Sales Performance Manager  the Sales Data Analyst will be responsible for enabling data-driven decision-making across the Vocus Enterprise & Government Sales team and ensuring we have a clear understanding of key business levers to achieve our commercial and business goals. The role will include creating insights  month end reporting responsibilities and will also support on creating insights for key business initiatives. The role requires a high degree of problem solving  analytical thinking and attention to detail.  In particular  the Sales Data Analyst will:  Prepare reports  insights and analytics that support business growth drivers Assimilate  analyse and maintain data from various sources to a highly accurate standard Analyse and assess data accuracy Diagnose  resolve or escalate data errors Support the evaluation and execution of strategic and tactical programs including data preparation  analytics  SME on key programs of work Assist in the analysis and reporting requested of the Sales Enablement team from its customers in the Vocus Enterprise Sales Team Support the management and administration of internal and external commission payments where required    What we need from you:  Being awesome is a given  and so is getting stuck in and owning what you do. We’re also looking for someone who has:  Outstanding written and verbal communication skills High attention to detail and ability to translate data into meaningful business insights and recommendations A passion for data and improving data quality A commercial mind and ability to understand key business drivers Ability to present data and insights ready for end user consumption **NV1 clearance or be eligible for clearance** A passion and desire to continuously learn and build broad market and business knowledge A strong ability to think high (strategic)  deep (get into the details) and wide (think end to end) Strong influencing skills across a diverse range of stakeholders Ideally  Data Science or Data Analytics expertise Preferred experience in Salesforce and Business Intelligence platforms Desired but not essential business  statistics or related degree    It’s a seriously exciting time to join the Vocus Group and there’s even more to come. If you think you want to join us and be part of something great  do it and apply now!  The extra stuff we know you want to know  Our business is crazy about customers. We use disruptive thinking every day to deliver incredible experiences to our customers and teams. We empower our people to Do it. Own it. Love it and that’s why they choose to work for us.  Here  it’s never just a job – We care about what we do and the impact we have  and that’s what connects us. Whoever you are  you'll fit right into our team of 1 400 different personalities. We’ll support you to be ‘the best you’  at Vocus and at home.  We know how to celebrate our wins and we know not to sweat the small stuff. We are all about flexible working and  hand on heart  we practice work life balance. We work in a hybrid environment of 2 days in our Vocus offices and 3 days at home each week. We high five you on your work anniversary and give you a day off. We know time off is important for balance  so we have an option to buy more leave. We also offer amazing employee discounts on internet  mobile and energy services.  We embrace who you are and let you be a master of your own style with no dress code. This is just the tip of the iceberg  so jump on our careers site or LinkedIn to find out more!  Did I hear you say  “Who is Vocus?”  We are a challenger business in the Telco and Energy Industries. We listened to our customers and heard that they wanted more from a network  so that’s what we’ve given them:  We built the network thanks to our own team of highly skilled fibre engineers. We own our network  so we have easier  straightforward access We manage our network here in Australia out of our Melbourne offices.  We now have more than 30 000 km of fibre optic cable laid and operational throughout Australia  5000 on-net buildings connected to our network.  Have we got you excited?

Title: SAP Data Analyst
Requirements: About the Role:  This role reports directly to the ANJ Zone Analytics Lead. This position has the responsibility for supporting IT projects and the day to day analytics operations for the Australia New Zealand Japan (ANJ) Business unit in Kraft Heinz. The Data Analytics & Reporting Analyst supports the analytics team and business by driving delivery of technology solutions to both Leadership and functional team members. This person should be able to support data analysis and discuss it comfortably with the most team members at all levels of the organisation.  Key Components of the role  Business Analysis/Partnership This is the part of the job that will distinguish you from other applicants. Relationship skills are huge part of this role. Unlike specialised and technical analytics skills  being able to communicate effectively with end users is used every day and in every area of our partnership with the business.   Proactively act as a liaison with the user community in identifying end-to-end business processes and how analytics help tell the story and provide insights as a result. Possess the ability to communicate recommendations back to the business effectively and efficiently. Innovating and influencing how we leverage analytics in the organisation  identifying opportunities to transform the business through the application of analytics. Must be able to engage in business focused conversations about data analytics and any associated technology. Ability to adjust the conversation based on audience  is important. Customer focus  on every level and in any functional area  is vital!  Key position functions  You will be responsible for data analytics and reporting in the ANJ business unit with the following requirements:   Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect  organise  analyse and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. Support data analytics project delivery including initiation  planning  scope  budget and change request management  client management and customer satisfaction. Maintaining regular communications with active project teams and business stakeholders to ensure necessary and appropriate steps are taken to resolve issues and risks  perform appropriate testing and resolve conflicts. Strong knowledge of  and experience working with various ETL packages Provide support for existing analytics solutions in the ANJ business  including data warehousing  data models  database design  data mining and OLAP technology. Work together with both Zone and Global data analytics groups to ensure alignment of data analytic strategy with business priorities and maximise analytics value. Adept at queries  report writing and presenting findings. Locate and define new process improvement opportunities  Qualifications:  EDUCATION/SPECIFIC BUSINESS KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS   University Degree required  Information Systems  and Computer Science degrees highly suggested. Excellent written and oral communications. Experience with the full project lifecycle. Willingness to travel as required  and mobility is an advantage. Business acumen and ability to operate at strategic and operational planes while also being able to work with people covering all backgrounds and technical skill levels. Up-to-date knowledge of the Analytics market  with emphasis on latest technology trends and possible application to support business growth and analytics experience. Strong interpersonal skills  experience of a multicultural environment is a major bonus. Self-starter  positive attitude  and drive for results.  CORE AND DESIRED EXPERIENCES/ PREVIOUS ROLES   3+ years relevant commercial experience in analytics  preferably in a multinational industry Consulting and SQL Server experience is highly prized  knowledge and experience with Tableau  Snowflake and SAP S/4 HANA would be advantageous. Experience in supporting multiple aspects of Data & Analytics projects including planning  requirements gathering  development  testing and implementation. Experience working with multiple stakeholders from different functions and different organisational levels Experience in End User service delivery and user engagement an advantage  Benefits Program:  We empower our people to own their work- and it’s true our employees are our competitive advantage – so we take care of our Kraft Heinz family with our ‘Live Well’ benefits program:  Hybrid Working- flexibility around when and where you work Free Food - our kitchen is fully stocked with our products for you to enjoy! Gatherings - monthly drinks & nibbles- End of Year Celebration Wellbeing - annual health checks & flu shots- onsite wellbeing sessions & webinars Volunteering – volunteer days with Foodbank- meal packing events for our Global partner Rise Against Hunger Keeping Fit – join our Run Club and sign up for discounted gym memberships & classes Purchase Leave – purchase additional annual leave at the beginning of each calendar year Parental Leave - 12 weeks paid parental leave for primary caregivers  The Kraft Heinz Company Australia & New Zealand is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a working environment that embraces  promotes and values diversity and inclusion. Research shows that candidates from under represented backgrounds hesitate to apply for roles if they feel they don’t meet 100% of the criteria. So  if this opportunity excites you and you think you have skills and experience that can add value (even if not specified)  please don’t hesitate to apply! #LI-DNI

Liaising with the key contacts to actively pursue internal queries in finding appropriate outcomes / solutions. Qualifications: 4+ years of professional management reporting experience. Excellent skills in communication  presentation  influencing others across diverse  geographically dispersed teams. Ability to analyze large amounts of data Ensure timely and accurate delivery of key management reports Individual should be analytical  flexible  team-oriented  have good interpersonal  communication  and follow-up skills with strong attention to detail and ability to multi-task Proficient in Microsoft Office Suite (Word  Excel  PowerPoint  etc.) Finance / accounting knowledge or experience as a plus Experience and ease in interfacing with Senior Management as a plus Education:  Bachelor’s/University degree  -------------------------------------------------  Job Family Group:  Operations - Core  -------------------------------------------------  Job Family:  Business Planning & Analysis  ------------------------------------------------------  Time Type:  Full time  ------------------------------------------------------  Citi is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer.
