Title: Customer Insights (Analyst) Officer
Requirements: The position of Customer Insights (Analyst) Officer forms part of the Customer Experience team and Customer Experience (CX) and describes as how customers perceive their interactions with the employees  processes  products  and services of an organisation.  As the Customer Insights (Analyst) Officer (AO5) you will do this by: Experience in extracting data from multiple sources - CRMs  data warehouses  BI  GA  Oracle  Verint etc. Demonstrate a sound working knowledge of statistical methods and understanding of technical language e.g.  SQL. Coordinate and analyse a range of customer data sources across multiple service delivery channels (phone  online  email  SMS etc) to inform/support/deliver actionable insights to improve customer experience. Design and contribute to the development  delivery  and continuous improvement of high-quality reporting dashboards (e.g.  PowerBi & Google Analytics). Identify efficiencies and performance improvements/automation of existing reporting functionality across the CX team and wider organisation. Assist with the management and use of feedback and analytics tools to support business decisions e.g.  UX & CX activities  surveys  and AI. Self-manage workload and work collaboratively across the organisation to proactively plan  implement  and evaluate performance to meet team and operational targets. Establish strong relationships and open communication with the internal and external partners to ensure the CX activities are delivered. Demonstrate excellent interpersonal skills which foster trust  teamwork  and cooperation. Knowledge share to help coach and develop others. Applications to remain current for 12 months.  Job Ad Reference: QLD/415922/22  Closing Date: Wednesday 4 May 2022  Occupational group Administration

Title: Data Analyst - Wealth
Requirements: Sydney  Join the Banking and Financial Services data and analytics team to support our growing business banking and wealth management business. You will be leveraging our cutting-edge cloud data platform plus your analytics skills to drive growth and transformation.  In this role  you will be: Deliver analytical use cases to support our strategic business initiatives in an agile working environment. Using SQL/Alteryx  R/Python to transform data and draw insights from large data sets. Design metrics and interactive dashboards to facilitate business understanding and support automation. Apply statistical methods or machine learning models to solve business problems. To excel in this role  you will have: Tertiary qualifications preferably in a quantitative subject e.g. engineering  mathematics or finance. 2-3 years relevant industry experience in analytics team or related functions. Strong experience wrangling data using SQL  and familiar with either Python or R. Experience with visualisation tools like Tableau/Power BI will be viewed favourably. Working with Cloud Platforms e.g. AWS  GCP  Databricks will be viewed favourably. A curious mind with excellent problem-solving skills Good communication and presentation skills  with the ability to explain complex concepts to non-technical teams About Banking And Financial Services  Banking and Financial Services is Macquarie’s retail banking and financial services business  providing a diverse range of personal banking  wealth management  business banking and vehicle finance products and services to retail clients  advisers  brokers and business clients.  Our commitment to Diversity  Equity and Inclusion  The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths. An inclusive and equitable environment enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people  clients  shareholders and communities. From day one  you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us  please apply. With the right technology  support and resources  our people can work in a range of flexible ways.  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity  equity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you  and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.  About Macquarie  A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills  explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition  helping sustain global food supplies  financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie  we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.  Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups  disciplines  sectors and borders. With 17 000+ employees and offices in 33 markets around the world  we’re a truly global organisation.  You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives  ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us  you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.  Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management  retail and business banking  wealth management  leasing and asset financing  market access  commodity trading  renewables development  specialist advisory  capital raising and principal investment.  Find out more at www.macquarie.com/careers  Job no: BFS-962587  Work type: Permanent - Full time  Location: Sydney  Category: Mid-level  Junior  Data & Analytics  Group: Banking and Financial Services  Division: Product & Technology  Recruiter: Chelsea Hollins  Opening Date: 02/2/2022

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Requirements: Posted by Shahriar Harun Talent Acquisition Consultant Send InMail We're looking for an analytics professional with a passion for uncovering insights from data and producing meaningful analysis for our journalists.  This role is part of the Data & Analytics Team and supports editorial creators across the ACM portfolio. Reporting to the Director of Data  this role will be crucial in building data models that collect and analyse engagement behaviour associated with content production and then presenting insights to our editorial  audience engagement and product development teams.  This role will work across various content/editorial systems including our core CMS  audience analytics  newsroom planning tools.  This role is crucial in shaping content planning and optimisation and will work across all of ACM digital assets including web  mobile and social.  What You'll Do  Work with the Editorial teams to consolidate  build  deliver  and develop reporting insights that help track against key audience growth and content performance goals. Partner with the product and technology teams to develop new audience data sources and integrate with existing Google Analytics and Data Studio reporting suite. Support content strategists  editors  engagement managers and video creators to ensure all reporting and insights are clear  actionable  and support content and editorial strategies. Serve as a data guide and teacher  helping others make better data-driven decisions  read and understand reporting  and build their own bespoke reports. Share learnings with key stakeholders  create data visualizations  share findings in group presentations  and surface trends and opportunities within the media Ecosystem  Who You Are  3-5 years of experience in data analytics  background with a media-related business is a plus. Strong knowledge of Google Analytics  Data Studio  or other content analytics and BI tools. Experience with SQL and comfortable with sourcing  merging  and working with multiple data sets. Working across multiple disparate data sources  the ability to analyze  interpret and visualize data into clean  clear  and digestible dashboards and reports. Communicative and capable of building strong relationships with colleagues and breaking down complex topics into simple  influential terms. Organized  detail-oriented  and comfortable juggling multiple projects simultaneously. An inherently curious person that loves trying to connect the dots. A lover of media with an interest in its ongoing evolution. Knowledge of the state of the media/entertainment industry and competitive landscape as well as an informed perspective on the future of content creation and consumption.  About us  Australian Community Media (ACM) is Australia's largest and most diversified private media business. We have been bringing news to our rural and regional communities for more than 150 years. Our network of more than 142 leading news media brands includes The Canberra Times  Newcastle Herald  Illawarra Mercury  The Land  Queensland Country Life  and the Northern Daily Leader. More recently  ACM and Real Estate View formed a joint venture to build a market-leading  multi-faceted property media and data business.  This is an exciting time to join ACM.  Apply:  We embrace all aspects of diversity and inclusion and are committed to creating a workplace  which reflects the incredibly diverse customers  audiences and communities we serve.  If you are seeking the pride of being part of Australia's largest regional media company  please apply now!  Disclaimer:  Applications will only be considered from candidates with the right to work in Australia. We do not accept unsolicited agency resumes. We are not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Title: Data Analyst - Portfolio Intelligence
Requirements: Posted by Leni Rokosova Senior Talent Partner at AirTrunk Send InMail Want to be a part of Asia-Pacific’s (APAC) fastest growing data centre business? AirTrunk is an APAC technology company with a powerful purpose - to scale and sustain the relentless growth of the region’s digital future. We do this by continuously redefining and delivering data centres that meet the needs of our customers  the world’s most transformational companies. And we’re doing so sustainably  for today and tomorrow.  Having opened Australia’s first and largest hyperscale data centres in Western Sydney and Melbourne in 2017  we set our eyes on rapid expansion across APAC. Since then  we launched in Singapore  Hong Kong  Sydney North and Japan  and announced plans for our second Western Sydney data centre which will be the largest in APAC. With backing from our investors including Macquarie Group  this is just the beginning…  Join us at AirTrunk  where the cloud meets the ground.  A Snapshot As the Data Analyst - Portfolio Intelligence  reporting to the Head of Innovation and Intelligence  you will work closely with the rest of the Technology team  making your mark in a number of ways:  Build and own centralised reporting and analysis hub for the team and AirTrunk across APAC Lead pivotal initiatives that will help drive continued growth  efficiency and will bring high customer happiness Develop and implement tools and technologies to enable business units to have access to the appropriate data and metrics for their business decisions  Please note this role can be based either in Singapore or Australia-wide.  Your Day to Day  Manage different datasets and the delivery of standardised reports  dashboards  commentaries and analyses Develop reporting standards including critical metrics dashboards and executive reports Maintain and analyse historical and live datasets Understand the requirements for integrations between existing platforms and collaborate with ICT and other departments to ensure the overall data warehouse is updated to support team members’ needs  ensuring single source of data is achieved Understand and evaluate business requirements  working with team members to deliver accurate and effective dashboards and reports Design  build and maintain a reporting suite on key dimensions and metrics to support AirTrunk in a relevant and timely manner Be up to date on emerging trends  anomalies  risks and opportunities  and translate these to practical insights  commentaries  and presentations to aid decision making.  Requirements Bachelor’s degree in data or computer science  construction  accounting  finance  statistics or any related field 4+ years experience in business intelligence and analytics role in a dynamic environment. Real estate  construction and/or business operations experience preferred. Proven working knowledge of BI software tools (Power BI  Mixpanel etc.) and data warehousing Extensive knowledge in data analysis and business intelligence. Knowledge of data science would be added advantage. Highly analytical  strong abstract and numerical reasoning skills Data-driven  ability to analyse and interpret large amounts of data Excellent communication and presentation skills Ability to connect effectively with all professional levels within the organisation Facilitates and promotes a culture of continuous improvement with the ability to mentor and guide others  The AirTrunk Culture Working at AirTrunk is a once in a lifetime opportunity to fast-track your career and make a positive impact. At AirTrunk  we’ll help you Grow@Hyperscale.  The pace of our industry means you’ll feel an electric atmosphere at AirTrunk. We are a team of challengers and collaborative problem solvers who break new ground every day. We do this by living our values  going above and beyond  and being dynamic  transparent and responsive.  Every AirTrunker brings their own unique background and diverse perspective to find solutions to problems that matter. We’ve created a flexible and safe working environment where everyone feels welcome  heard  and equal regardless of age  disability  gender  gender expression  marital or parental status  race  colour  religion or belief  national origin  sexual orientation or veteran status.  With a range of exciting employee benefits for you to choose from  we’ll help you stay positively charged in both your work and life.   **To all recruitment agencies: AirTrunk does not accept agency resumes. Please do not forward resumes to our jobs alias  AirTrunk employees or any other organization location. AirTrunk is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.**

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Requirements: Endeavour Group - Our Story  Endeavour Group operates Australia’s largest retail drinks network through Dan Murphy’s and BWS  and the nation’s largest portfolio of licensed hospitality venues (ALH hotels)  with a market share of approximately 40% in retail liquor and approximately 9% in hotels. Endeavour Group also owns bottling facilities and wineries as part of its products and services capabilities.  United behind a common purpose of ‘Creating a more sociable future together’  we are a 28 000+ strong team with more than 1600 stores and 330 hotels nationally.  The Opportunity  We are expanding our Data and Analytics team to support the creation of a retail media services business within Endeavour  and ensure we can deliver analytics built on trusted  reliable data and meet our supplier obligations.  We have an exciting opportunity for a Senior Analyst who can deliver analytics that measure and optimise media investments by our suppliers. As part of the analytics team  you will also be able to leverage the capability that exists across the other team members. By developing strong relationships  shared ways of working and leveraging the skills of the team we aim to build a strong analytics capability and embed data and insight into the business.  A day In the life of a Senior Analyst  Media Analytics @ Endeavour… Provide leadership and best practice media measurement and reporting for suppliers Produce data  analytics and insights from various data sources across Endeavour drinks  including Adobe  GCP  Azure and other proprietary databases. Assist in the development of test and learn experiments to drive key organisational initiatives Provide ongoing and ad hoc reporting  analysis and insights in a timely manner Work within team norms  standards and procedures to provide consistency across the business Establish strong relationships with business stakeholders. Be proactive with ideas and recommendations and help drive the business outcomes Lead  coach and develop junior team members What You’ll Need To Succeed 5+ years experience in a digital  retail or marketing agency environment with experience in data  analytics or insights Demonstrated capability in developing analytics and insights and communicating findings to stakeholders to improve customer satisfaction and business outcomes. Experience working across at least 2 relevant areas: digital analytics  marketing analytics  analytics development  data development  CRO  reporting  data visualisation  insight delivery Experience in auditing and improving analytics setup Demonstrable ability to build collaborative relationships with a diverse range of stakeholders within analytics chapters and across cross functional squads Ability to prioritise multiple concurrent pieces of work and deliver to agreed milestones whilst communicating any changes in scope or timelines Demonstrable marketing  ecomm or sales analytics experience. Proven experience of continuously improving individual outputs and contributing to the aim of the team to do the same. Experience working in an agile organisation or with agile technology teams. Ability to translate business problems into actionable metrics Ability to translate complicated methods and results into plain language  both in speaking and writing The Perks Everyday Rewards+ Card which gives you access to exclusive employee discounts across Woolworths  BigW and Endeavour Group brands (BWS  Dan Murphy’s  etc) as well as 50% off at our ALH Venues. Access to our Endeavour Group Employee Share Scheme! Learn wine tasting with Cellarmaster’s: Bronze  Silver & Gold certifications. Paid training opportunities with our partners incl. Microsoft/Google. Headspace mornings - no meetings company-wide. Flexible working arrangements are encouraged and our norm! Grow with Endeavour Group  Endeavour Group comprises a diverse range of drinks and hospitality businesses including BWS  Dan Murphy’s  ALH Hotels and Pinnacle Drinks. We are focused on growing and transforming our businesses to meet the changing needs of customers and we’re driven by a culture that puts our customers and team first.  As an inclusive  team-first company  our people are at the core of everything we do. We care deeply about creating a workplace where our team members feel valued  respected and empowered. We are committed to providing equal opportunity regardless of gender identity  ethnicity  disability or sexual orientation. At Endeavour Group we value flexibility  and encourage our team members to work in ways that meet their work/life commitments and support their wellbeing.  We work hard to create a safe and inclusive environment for all  and most importantly  we're all about creating a more sociable future – for our customers and for each other.  We’d love to hear from You  If you meet a number of the requirements  but not all  we encourage you to submit your application.  You can learn more about working with us on LinkedIn or via www.wowcareers.com.au  Our Talent Acquisition Team and Hiring Leaders kindly request no unsolicited resumes or approaches from Recruitment Agencies. Endeavour Group is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Title: Data and Insights  Data Engineer - Industry Based Learning ("IBL") student
Requirements: Be the change. Join our team.  At Mercedes-Benz  we like to do things differently. We are a balance of passion  professionalism and approachability. Our Head Office  based in Mulgrave  supporting a dynamic network across Australia  New Zealand has an established culture of support  collaboration  ensuring our service is exceptional  and our customers’ expectations are exceeded.  We believe our people make the difference. We proudly offer generous employee benefits  such as discounted car leasing purchase options  volunteer leave and much more! Our passion for our people also extends to Employee Recognition and Reward programs  as well as  on-going investment and support in learning and development opportunities. We are proud to be recognised as a Workplace Gender Equality Employer of Choice and support a flexible and modern work culture. We empower  trust and respect our employees and support a diverse workplace with equal opportunities.  Our 2022 Industry Based Learning (“IBL”) Program:  Full-time  12 month paid role to kick-start your career with a prestigious global brand Commencing quarter 2  2022  with potential opportunities to stay on with the company following the conclusion of the program Enrichening professional work experience in a large corporate business Head Office  combined with development and training opportunities Real work experience that will give you a competitive advantage Work in a collaborative  supportive and agile work culture Join a tight knit community of other IBLs and form lasting relationships Opportunities to grow your network  be involved in exciting cross departmental meetings and projects and become part of a close-knit team.  The Data Engineering placement for our Data and Insights team at a glance:  An exciting opportunity is available for a motivated and enthusiastic student to join the Head Office Data and Insights team. Reporting to the Manager for Engineering and Technology  your key responsibilities will include: Assist with managing data sources  data ingestion and data processing including metadata management along with relevant stakeholders Participate in data requirements gathering and analysis meetings with team members  internal customers  and stakeholders all around the world Develop  maintain  test  and troubleshoot data solutions  including database development  ETL / data migration development  and big data development Drive own ideas and concepts that improve and help the Data and Insights team to solve complex and interesting challenges Design and implement CI/CD pipelines for the development of our data science models  data reports or software products  What we are looking for:  A self-motivated and pro-active student who is passionate about gaining work experience. Effective communicators who can build rapport  enjoy collaborating with others and have the confidence to step up and drive change and ideas. To be considered  students must be an undergraduate in their second year or have at least 1 year left of studies as of January 2022  in a math  computer science  data science  or a business-related degree. Following skills are highly recommended but not necessary:  Good programming skills and experience in one of the following programming languages: Python  R  Scala or Java Experience with Spark or Databricks Experience with SQL and ETL Knowledge in creating data engineering pipelines If this sounds like the right opportunity for you to kick start your career at Mercedes-Benz Australia’s Head Office  please apply by April 30th 2022. Please ensure your application includes your resume  cover letter and recent academic transcript (can be unofficial).  This is a local  contract role. You must have a valid working visa for Australia / New Zealand for the entire length of the contract  to be able to apply for this position.   At Mercedes-Benz Australia Pacific  we believe our people make the difference. We proudly offer generous employee benefits  such as discounted car leasing and purchase options  on-site parking  employee assistance programs and much more. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We are proud to be recognized as a Workplace Gender Equality Employer of Choice and we support a flexible and progressive work culture. We actively recognize our committed people through Employee Recognition and Reward programs. We also provide exciting learning and career development opportunities.

Title: Data Test Analyst
Requirements: This is an opportunity for a Senior Test Analyst to work with an Industry leader based in Brisbane.You'll validate data based solutions against the business requirements and ensure a high quality outcome is produced.  About This Role  You will be responsible for:  Analysing requirements to prepare test plans Create and execute test cases Report on defects and the testing status Creating test summary reports TL testing  data acquisition from files and streaming data on Azure and / or SQL server Perform different stages of testing (i.e System testing  Integration   Regression testing)Define the scope of testing within the context of each release and the project requirements Design and Implement configuration based Data Ingestion & Curation Test Pipelines  About You  You'll have experience on BI  Data Warehouse or Data Analytics projects Strong experience in writing complexed SQL queries Technically strong in ETL  BI and Data Warehouse Testing Automation and API testing experience is preferable  Our offer  Our client has ensured market rate for this opportunity.Brunel provide dedicated contractor support through the engagement and assignment life cycle. Additional consultation during and after your assignment for market opportunity within the Brunel network.  About Us  Brunel is a recruitment and flexible workforce solution provider which connects talented people with opportunities throughout Australasia and around the world.  We specialise in highly skilled roles across a variety of technical  professional  trades and craft disciplines  pairing candidates with industry-leading projects and organisations on a contract  permanent or secondment basis.  Operating in Australasia since 2001  Brunel has major bases of operation in Perth  Sydney  Brisbane and Port Moresby  which are further backed by the strength and reach of a truly global network spanning over 40 countries  120 offices and 45 years of successful operation.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Requirements: You will be working in a tight-knit analytics team in a startup environment experiencing explosive growth  you will be working on surfacing insight in our consumer healthcare businesses Pilot  Kin  Software and Normal.  The overarching goal of the Data Analytics team is to Ensure the efficient allocation of capital in every aspect of the business - this means surfacing the relevant information to the relevant people at the relevant time to increase the quality of decision making  As a Senior Data Analyst at Eucalyptus you should: Be interested in thinking about the data required to answer business questions from various stakeholders. Be resourceful in how you procure and transform that information. Have the ability to communicate the findings (if any). Be a key architectural voice in designing and building a scalable business processes for a multi-asset multi-brand platform. Be interested in formulating questions that tackle large problems and then break down those problems into their component parts (consulting skillset). Work closely with product and design  as well as marketing  content  and operations to develop the best information processes.  Experience required Need to have work rights in Australia and available for work in Sydney Recent experience in predictive analytics Recent and extensive experience in analysing and transforming data Excel  Python  R  PostgreSQL. Recent and extensive experience in visualizing and presenting findings Tableau  Data Studio  Metabase  Javascript Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Experience with building reusable components across multiple applications and code bases Ideally 3+ years experience in a similar role  Additional Information  Why join Eucalyptus? We’ve grown from 0 to 200 000 patients We’ve grown from 0 to 5 brands We’ve grown from 4 to 200 people All in just 3 years! We are building the future of accessible  patient-centric healthcare right here in Australia and we want you to be part of this generational story! We are backed by some of the best VCs in the world and Blackbird  who invested in us  put us among the fastest-growing companies they have ever funded.  What do we do  exactly? Our mission is to build the future of healthcare and help people live longer  healthier lives. We have built a bespoke technology platform to deliver healthcare to Australians with a level of care and depth that brings healthcare into the internet age and we are just getting started. We work with doctors  specialists  pharmacists  and medical professionals from all over the country  and our brands (Pilot  Kin  Software  Normal  and Juniper) speak to different people at different stages of their life and needs. For example  our most recent brand  Juniper  is changing the conversation around menopause.  How do we work? Things move quickly here. We like to set goals with the mindset that if we hit them all we haven’t challenged ourselves enough. You’ll be surrounded by a world-class team of thinkers  designers  engineers and leaders who are obsessed with three things: The health and wellbeing of the average person Creating personalised  engaging  convenient user-experiences Making healthcare fun and interesting (because it is) We are experienced business builders  our roots and talent run deep in the DTC and technology space. We believe too many chefs spoil the broth and people are given the freedom to make decisions (and mistakes)  and learn from the journey. Ultimately  we believe ideas are cheap and great execution is more important than anything.  Why you'll thrive here Here are the highlights: Come and experience the growth at one of the fastest growing startups (LinkedIn #5 fastest growing startups in Australia) while we are still small (~200 people). Push yourself with challenges that are world-first  unique and exhilarating. See the meaningful impact of your work on over tens of thousands of actual users (check out the customers that love us!) Learn from some of Australia’s best marketers  engineers  creatives  operations specialists  and medical professionals - joining a diverse team from Atlassian  Canva  Google  Koala  McKinsey  Bain  BuzzFeed  Optiver  Halter and many many more. A share in the company (equity)  so you are rewarded for your best work. And also it goes without saying: flexible location work arrangements  WFH allowances  parental leave  gym benefits  employee discounts  social clubs sponsorships  uncapped learning and development budgets for all of our staff. Life is too short to not be curious

Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: Posted by Tim Paris Cofounder / CEO at Dataro Send InMail Are you looking to use your data skills for social good? Do you thrive in a supportive team that values good work and is willing to challenge the status quo? Dataro is an ethically-minded ‘Data Science-as-a-Service’ startup that uses machine learning to help not-for-profits run more successful fundraising campaigns.  We are looking for somebody with a keen desire to understand patterns in data as well as human behaviour so we can better understand the real world outcomes of our technology and where improvements can be made.  In This Role  You'll Get To Run experiments  generate reports and analyse models that have a real-world impact on charity fundraising. Analyse millions of data points to understand how people give to charities. Work in a team of data scientists  engineers and analysts and see how machine learning is deployed and used in practice. On The First Day  We'll Expect You To Have At least 3 years experience in a data analyst (or similar) role Strong skills in either R or Python Excellent visualisation and reporting skills (e.g.  using Markdown or Shiny) Understanding of SQL A willingness to learn and a creative approach to tricky problems. It's Great  But Not Required  If You Have Experience With The fundraising and non-profit sector Start-ups R Shiny  R Markdown  Bash  AWS (EC2  Batch  Lambda  S3)  HTML/JS  We are based in Sydney and are currently operating remotely due to COVID. While we like being digital we do miss seeing each other and are sometimes in and out of the office  so if selected you will need to be able to commute to Sydney when required. We value a diverse workforce and offer flexible working hours.

Title: Experienced Data Analyst
Requirements: Welcome to Aginic  a consultancy where some of the country’s brightest data analysts  engineers  agile coaches  designers  and cloud architects blend their technical skills with a desire to deliver impactful insights that solve business problems  For more information about us visit https://aginic.com/our-people/  Welcome to Aginic  a consultancy where some of the country’s brightest data analysts  engineers  agile coaches  designers  and cloud architects blend their technical skills with a desire to deliver impactful insights that solve business problems  As a data analyst with Aginic  you can choose to be a business-focussed generalist or mix your skillset up with data science or data engineering.  Working as a key member/lead of a cross functional squad  you will deliver awesome outcomes for our clients. You will be primarily responsible for performing data analytics and visualisations on a variety of projects for a range of clients  from state government departments to not for profits and large commercial clients.  About The Role Ask the right questions to understand a new client's business and guide them to the right data solutions  to develop data pipelines  dashboards or reports to make data accessible to them in a timely and intuitive way Perform data analytics and visualisation for a range of clients  including state health departments  major retailers  banks  utilities  aged care and education Your day-to-day work will involve a range of different technologies. On one project you may perform data modelling in SQL  leverage a modern ELT data stack on the cloud and then develop dashboards for end users in Power BI or Qlik Sense. On another project you might build a predictive machine learning model  advise clients on the strategy to create and deploy dashboards or automate tasks and data flows using Power Automate and Power BI  What you offer A relevant degree in a numerical discipline You have the ability to lead an analytics project. You may have experience leading projects or have worked in a complex analytics environment You're smart  innovative and always learning new things You critically reflect on your own processes and challenge assumptions about how things should be done  exploring solutions that others might not consider You're approachable  dependable and genuine and you care about getting to know people You like the start-up vibe of a workplace and are excited by the prospect of working in an energetic and growing team  If you have any analytics experience or relevant projects  we'd love to see them. At Aginic we value diversity in our people and the ideas they bring to our team. We look after our team and pride ourselves on our supportive and friendly culture. We’re looking for people who identify with our values whilst also bringing their own individual perspective on their work  choosing your own adventure in how you help us support our clients.  What we offer Attractive remuneration and leave package Training and professional development opportunities Flexible working Social workplace with regular events and team activities including “Winter School” - 1 week residential professional development and team building trip. EAP and other wellbeing initiatives for all employees Start up culture that values ideas from all levels Coaching program  If this sounds like a good fit we'd love to hear from you!  We’re committed to promoting diversity in the workplace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply. Are you looking to join a high performing  smart and fun team? Apply now!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst – Mining
Requirements: Job Description  Hexagon is a global leader in sensor  software and autonomous solutions and has more than 20 000 employees across 50 countries and net sales of approximately 4.3bn USD. Hexagon’s Mining division is enabling an autonomous future through the delivery of an autonomous connected ecosystem in mines across the globe. We bring survey  geology  mine planning & design  fleet management  production optimization  collision avoidance and operator safety together in a life-of-mine solution that integrates people and processes. Our customers are safer and more productive through insight-driven decisions that sustainably captures more value from mining operations.  Enterprise Suite of Products  Hexagon’s Enterprise portfolio is a data analytics hub that nurtures collaboration. It helps mines access  see downstream effects  and make decisions from operational technology data. It provides data visualization  accessibility  data analytics and reporting by connecting and structuring data from Planning  Operations  Safety and Drill & Blast systems.  The Role  Role  If you answer yes to the following questions  this might be the role for you  The Mine Enterprise portfolio is currently seeking an experienced Application Engineer to join their Perth based team on a permanent full-time basis. Are passionate about data and unlocking its hidden value? Are you driven by successful customer adoption of technology to improve processes that generate a tangible return on investment? Have you had experience in creating business intelligence reporting that can be standardized across multiple customers? Desired Skills  Major Areas of Responsibility  Within the position of Application Engineer  you would be the global champion for the suite of Mine Enterprise products to drive successful customer adoption and obtain customer return-on-investment. You are the voice of the customer and internal support teams and you will provide clear feedback to the software development team to better the solution for all customers. This position is responsible for driving customer adoption for the suite of solutions that deliver on a vision to connect data across the life-of-mine value chain.  Skills And Experience Required  We are looking for an individual with the following skills and experience: Degree in Computer Science  Computer Engineering / Software Engineering  or related fields Proven experience within a similar position (software solution consulting) Good time management and ability to work with disparate teams Prior experience with technology in the mining industry (planning  operations  drill & blast  safety). Global experience desirable Experience with Microsoft Power BI  Tableau and Microsoft SQL Server or Postgres Experience in the testing and validation of technology products and the development of training courses to assist internal lead experts. As an individual who can consolidate findings of software usage in-the-field across different customers  it is essential that you have the technical aptitude to interpret and respond to customer requirements  in addition to the soft skills to explain the benefits to management and sales teams.  Customer Success Provide technical sales assistance to regional teams including trials and demos Provide guidance on best practice use of Hexagon Mining products Primarily provide 2nd tier support to escalated requests from the regional service & support teams Attend customer sites and regional offices for technical knowledge transfer Assist with building key reference sites for our BI system in each region Provide global guidance for all major commercial deals including RFI and RFP’s. What’s On Offer  Apart from a salary package that is commensurate with your skills and experience  you will also benefit from the following: Personalized training and upskilling opportunities for career development for both technical and soft skills Work with a diverse  talented  multi-disciplinary team across the globe  gaining valuable skills and knowledge servicing some of the biggest names in the industry International and domestic travel to a variety of locations for client services Modern  well-appointed office space with a casual and friendly atmosphere Work life balance support Social events  team building activities  morning teas  quiz nights and more. Travel  This position involves travel intrastate  interstate and overseas to support and deploy Hexagon Mining’s product in the field.  Language Fluent English (written and verbal) is a pre-requisite. Spanish or Portuguese or other second language would be very favorable. Job Family  Information Technology  City  Perth

Title: Sr Biostatistician
Requirements: Come discover what our 25 000+ employees already know: work here matters everywhere. We’re a growing and evolving biopharmaceutical industry leader  which means you’ll have endless opportunities to work with experts around the world and build the career you’ve dreamed of. As a part of the Syneos Health team  you’ll help us deliver results for a rewarding reason – we improve patients’ lives around the world. Because to us  a patient isn’t just a number  they’re our family  friends  and neighbors. Why Syneos Health 1. #SyneosHealthLife means we’re committed to our Total Self culture – where everyone can authentically be themselves. Our Total Self culture is what unites us globally  and we know every person’s unique contributions make a difference. 2. We believe our success is a direct result of the people who are driving it – you! We value your dedication to care for our customers and patients  so we want to focus on taking care of you. That’s why we offer a comprehensive benefits program encompassing your total health - physical  mental and financial. 3. We are continuously building the company we all want to work for and our customers want to work with. Why? Because when we bring together diversity of thoughts  backgrounds  cultures  and perspectives – we’re able to create a place where everyone feels like they belong. Senior Biostatistician Job responsibilities 0. Provides support across all assigned statistical tasks during the lifecycle of the project  from protocol to CSR. 1. Prepares Statistical Analysis Plans (SAPs)  including development of well-presented mock-up displays for tables  listings  and figures. Collaborate with the sponsor  if required. 2. May be responsible for the statistical aspects of the protocol  generation of randomization schedule  publications and input to the clinical study report. 3. Coordinates the activities of other biostatistics and statistical programming personnel on assigned projects to ensure timely completion of high quality work. Provides independent review of project work produced by other biostatisticians in the department. 4. Creates or reviews programming specifications for analysis datasets  tables  listings  and figures. 5. Reviews SAS annotated case report forms (CRFs)  database design  and other study documentation to ensure protocol criteria are met and all data is captured as required to support a high quality database and the planned analysis. 6. Conducts and participates in verification and quality control of project deliverables  ensuring that output meets expectations and is consistent with analysis described in SAP and specifications. 7. Implements company objectives  and create alternative solutions to address business and operational challenges. 8. Serves as biostatistics representative on project teams  interfacing as necessary with other departmental project team representatives. This would include preparing in advance for internal meetings  contributing ideas  and demonstrating respect for opinions of others. 9. Manages scheduling and time constraints across multiple projects  sets goals based on priorities from management  adapts to timeline or priority changes by reorganizing daily workload  and proactively communicates to biostatistics management any difficulties with meeting these timelines. 10. Monitors progress on study activities against agreed upon milestones and ensures the study timelines for project deliverables are met. Identifies out of scope tasks and escalate to management. 11. Provides statistical programming support as needed. 12. May participate in Data Safety Monitoring Board and/or Data Monitoring Committee activities  including charter development and serving as an independent non-voting biostatistician. 13. May lead projects involving integrated analyses  attend regulatory agency meetings or respond to questions  as needed  to support the statistical analysis results of clinical trials on behalf of the sponsor. 14. Follows applicable SOPs  WIs  and relevant regulatory guidelines (e.g. ICH). 15. Maintains well organized  complete  and up-to-date project documentation  and verification/quality control documents and programs  ensuring inspection readiness. 16. Displays willingness to work with others and assists with projects and initiatives as necessary to meet the needs of the business. 17. Supports business development activities by contributing to proposals  budgets  and attending sponsor bid defense meetings. 18. Coaches and mentors other Biostatistics staff. 19. Performs other work-related duties as assigned. 20. Minimal travel may be required. Desired Skills and Experience What we’re looking for 1. Graduate degree in biostatistics or related discipline. 2. Moderate experience in clinical trials or an equivalent combination of education and experience. 3. Proficiency in programming. 4. Ability to apply knowledge of statistical design  analysis  relevant regulatory guidelines  and programming techniques utilized in clinical research and to effectively communicate statistical concepts. 5. Experience across all statistical tasks required to support clinical trials during the lifecycle of the project  from protocol to CSR. 6. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. 7. Ability to read  write  speak  and understand English. Get to know Syneos Health We are the only full-service biopharmaceutical solutions company in the world. That means we bring together the best clinical and commercial minds to create a better  smarter  faster way to get medicines into the hands of patients who need it most. Learn more about Syneos Health. Additional Information: Tasks  duties  and responsibilities as listed in this job description are not exhaustive. The Company  at its sole discretion and with no prior notice  may assign other tasks  duties  and job responsibilities. Equivalent experience  skills  and/or education will also be considered so qualifications of incumbents may differ from those listed in the Job Description. The Company  at its sole discretion  will determine what constitutes as equivalent to the qualifications described above. Further  nothing contained herein should be construed to create an employment contract. Occasionally  required skills/experiences for jobs are expressed in brief terms. Any language contained herein is intended to fully comply with all obligations imposed by the legislation of each country in which it operates  including the implementation of the EU Equality Directive  in relation to the recruitment and employment of its employees. The Company is committed to compliance with the Americans with Disabilities Act  including the provision of reasonable accommodations  when appropriate  to assist employees or applicants to perform the essential functions of the job.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Requirements: Welcome to a place where you can chase real progress and drive real change  and that includes your own career. Being a part of the Suncorp Group means being switched on  endlessly curious and always adaptable. In return  you’ll be supported to bring your own ideas to the table and challenge conventions – with the aim of making life a little brighter  simpler  and better for our customers and each other.  The Role  Suncorp Group’s Risk Models team performs an important role within the Bank Capital and Risk Model team  specifically ensuring that from a first line of defence perspective  we have developed  maintained and applied sound models  including expected credit loss  stress testing  economic capital  risk-based-capital (including market and credit risk types)  and operational risk models.  As part of this team  the Quantitative Analyst will contribute to planning  modelling and implementation of new or enhanced models. Model development will be performed with a strong focus on understanding the business drivers for risk  integrity of modelling processes and outcomes  and focus on the end-use and -users of the model. All modelling to be performed within model governance  which includes a high standard of documentation.  What You’ll Do Contribute to the build  validation  documentation  implementation of the banking models (expected credit loss  stress testing  economic capital  risk based capital  operational risk) Conduct detailed analytical work with a high level of accuracy in order to deliver high level results to senior management Define and specify key data requirements to support modelling approaches Document model technical detail  modelling choices made  and model methodology considerations Assist the Bank meet capital management requirements by ensuring that the existing models are designed  documented  controlled  used  and meet APRA and internal model validation requirements Engage with the Business Owners of models  and Group Risk and Capital representatives to ensure that the model outputs are understood and meet their requirements Working with risk model development leadership to proactively engage with stakeholders to understand business context  add value  propose solutions  project manage pieces of work through to completion and balance prioritisation effectively between across a wide stakeholder group. Ensure time spent matches the importance of the work and manage situations / competing priorities so that the most beneficial program of work is achieved Working with the leaders of the Capital Strategy & Risk Models team to ensure models are effectively embedded into operational activities  the program of work for the department is documented and resourcing or delivery issues are well managed Prepare analysis papers and ensure that high quality analytical papers are written and delivered to appropriate senior management and committees Identifying inefficiencies and proposing operational process improvements to enable better outcomes Add value to deliverables with excellent problem solving  idea generation and strategic thinking. Work closely with the wider team  Banking  Group and other stakeholders What You’ll Bring Degree in Actuarial  Finance  Economics  Statistics / Mathematics  or Risk – mandatory Post graduate finance  economics or accounting qualifications requirement – desired Experience in a quantitative risk function Experience in managing projects and programs of work Background in Model Implementation to make the person credible when discussing system and process considerations Background in banking sufficient to make the person credible when discussing banking issues Proficiency in statistical software such as SAS  R  Python  Matlab or similar Technical experience with risk and capital estimates (Credit Risk  IRRBB  Operational Risk  Regulatory Capital  Economic Capital) Ability to convey complex data in a concise understandable manner and distil the key messages What We Can Offer You Excellent discounts on a range of retail favourite stores as well as banking and insurance products A range of flexible working and leave options  including 16 weeks paid parental leave and unlimited paid emergency response leave Invest in your brighter future with ongoing study support and career development programs Give back to our communities with payroll giving  donation matching and paid volunteer leave Prioritise your work/life balance with our robust employee assistance program and dedicated employee council Employee benefits | Suncorp Group  About Suncorp Group  We’re proud to be a part of the Suncorp Group family alongside some of Australia’s most trusted and diverse names in insurance. Together  we share a drive to make the complex simple and bring our customers peace of mind when it matters most – while helping to evolve and innovate the ways we can serve our community every day. That comes with all kinds of exciting opportunities for you to grow your own career. Whether you’re guiding people through life’s biggest moments or providing them with support in times they need it most  you’ll be driven forward by our shared customer obsession and supported at every step of the journey.  At Suncorp we build inclusion by providing an environment where everyone is able to be themselves and feel valued  involved and respected for their perspectives and contribution.  The health and safety of our people  customers and communities is our number one priority. This means that we require all of our new employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Please speak to us if you have any questions about this based on your individual circumstances.

Title: Senior Consultant  Pricing and Analytics
Requirements: Quantium combines the best of human and artificial intelligence to power possibilities for individuals  organisations and society.  Our insurance consulting team is focused upon being the industry’s preferred provider of data-driven solutions  through delivery of high impact  transformational initiatives for Australia’s leading insurers.  We are seeking actuaries and analytics professionals who are equipped to:  Apply a deep technical skillset to design and deliver high value pricing and analytics solutions Run highly skilled teams to deliver complex  transformational pricing and analytics projects for leading insurers Develop into pricing and analytics leaders within the industry  who are sought out to advise on best practice pricing functions and building analytics capability.  We offer you an environment that provides:  Opportunities for you to be exposed to best practice analytics through participation in Quantium’s Analytics Community and on the job mentoring from our experienced experts. Exposure to senior client stakeholders through project delivery. Access to a pipeline of the brightest junior actuarial and analytics talent in the country  providing you with the capacity to grow and expand your role and career.  Quantium is the market leader in technical insurance pricing approaches and our innovations have transformed how the private insurance market approaches premium rating for both personal and commercial insurance. We partner with Australia’s leading insurers on initiatives to evolve and enhance their existing approaches  creating new capabilities in pricing  as well as customer  marketing and claims analytics.  The opportunity  The Senior Consultant is a technical role with accountability for the delivery of multiple projects within the Insurance Industry vertical  including the management of the analytics quality on these projects  and guidance of junior staff. The Senior Consultant works with Lead Consultants and Executive Managers on projects to transform client opportunities and problems into analytical solutions  as well as helping to identify and realise new opportunities for our insurance clients.  Key responsibilities  Accountable for the analytics quality and delivery of insurance pricing and analytics projects Supporting Lead Consultants and Executive Managers to transform client questions and issues into analytical solutions Task management including overseeing and delegating technical tasks amongst analysts Support the technical and professional development of Associates and Consultants through mentoring  coaching and skills development Support Lead Consultants and Executive Managerswith the identification and realisation of new opportunities to add value for our insurance industry clients. Potential management and accountability for performance management for a small number of analysts  Do you have a bullet point checklist for me to check off my suitability?  5+ years’ experience in a highly technical analytics or insurance pricing team  carrying out data analytics  insurance pricing or data science work Experience in supervising the work of others as a senior team member  project manager or team leader Tertiary qualifications in actuarial studies  engineering  mathematics  statistics  physics  or a related discipline Advanced knowledge of technical analytics discipline  including data preparation  feature engineering and foundational analytics concepts  predictive model development and model training Coding and / or modelling experience in SAS / SQL / R / Python Experience with Emblem and Radar is an advantageGeneral Insurance pricing experience is an advantage Experience with successfully managing both internal and external stakeholders  delivering against projects  tasks and activities in a dynamic deadline driven environments Commercial acumen to understand business needs and be able to suggest the commercial impacts of different analytics solutions or approaches High attention to detail Drive for continuous improvement  Ok  the work sounds great  but what’s in it for me?  Quantium takes care of its biggest asset – our people. We believe there is more to a successful career than just hard work. To this end we provide a range of personal and professional benefits across six broad categories:  Career Our exceptional growth means new and exciting career opportunities at Quantium. New clients  new projects or new roles – our growth plans power bigger and better career possibilities for our people.  Learning and development Quantium believes the development of our people is critical in attracting and retaining top talent. Whether you’re new to Quantium and your career or you’re looking to grow your depth and breadth of knowledge in your chosen field  Quantium is committed to being there to support you in your journey.  Workplace We work hard but we don’t take ourselves too seriously – ask anyone who has been on one of our annual trips away! Our people have cited ‘Fun place to work’ as one of the top 5 attributes of working at Quantium. Our world-class offices are fitted out with office games and stocked with food and drink all year round.  Health and wellbeing Healthy body  healthy mind. Quantium believes in promoting ways for you to maintain and improve your health and personal wellbeing. Our team enjoys a range of activities  including group fitness sessions  yoga  health advice and various team sports.  Lifestyle We recognise the need to balance personal and family commitments with your work. At Quantium you have more control over how  when and where you work. We also recognise the importance of holidays and time to recharge so we always do our best to accommodate leave requests.  Family Quantium understands that family is important. We support the needs and career aspirations of our colleagues with families. From the arrival of a newborn to your child’s Christmas concert  we ensure you have the support to spend the time you need with your family.  More about Quantium  We are passionate about creating opportunities for ourselves and each other. You will have access to relevant  meaningful and actionable learning. We are growing our technical  professional and leadership capabilities through our robust internal learning curriculum  team knowledge-sharing sessions and our mentoring program.  Join our team of intelligent and fun people in an environment where colleagues quickly become friends. You might find our team working hard trying to solve tough  commercial problems for our clients or winding down with pizza and a drink in hand on a Friday afternoon. You'll enjoy plenty of social events  including annual company overnight trips  and our offices are fully stocked with snacks and drinks all year round.  We also believe there is more to a successful career than just hard work and recognise the need to balance personal and family commitments with flexible work options available and a companywide hybrid work model.  Quantium are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity. We are a multicultural team of various beliefs  sexual orientations and gender identities. We celebrate our diversity of race  religion  colour  national origin  gender  sexual orientation  age  marital status and disability status.  Please note  this role is not suitable for Graduates. If you are a graduate and you’d like information about our Graduate Academy  please visit https://au.gradconnection.com/employers/quantium/about-us/

Title: BI Analyst
Requirements: Sydney  Join our Commodities and Global Markets (“CGM”) team in Sydney as a BI Analyst in the Salesforce team.  In this exciting new role  you will support our sales teams  desk heads  and senior leadership team to execute CGM’s client strategy by supporting the Salesforce platform team within our Commodities and Global Markets business to build out its reporting and analytics capabilities.  In this role you will automate and transform processes  analyses  reports  and controls  and you will be responsible for documenting stakeholder reporting requirements then strategically plan and build to execute change and project deliverables. This role will also provide you with a significant exposure to Salesforce itself and will be a great opportunity to learn and develop your skills and knowledge of this platform  and you also will gain exposure to the full breadth of CGM’s businesses and people across all levels of the organisation.  Key duties and responsibilities: Scope  understand and gather business requirements and acceptance criteria. Identify gaps  opportunities and recommend solutions for business problems. Document and translate business requirements to technical requirements. Work with our IT department to leverage data use cases Run workshops  walk-throughs  and stakeholder meetings. Data modelling using a suite of BI and analytical tools Develop and test in Power BI Contribute to project prioritisation. Perform ad-hoc financial analysis and modelling to validate business requirements and prototype solutions. Implement new data analysis methodologies To be successful in this role  you will have a record of success in improving processes and eager to work in a dynamic environment  and in a diverse team amongst high performers who will encourage you to perform at your best. You will have strong communication skills and an ability to cultivate relationships  working with stakeholders from all levels of the organisation to identify  develop and innovate on existing business processes and surface data insights to users to drive effective and efficient decision making.  To be a successful applicant you’ll bring: 3+ years’ experience in a business intelligence and data analysis with various analytical tools such as Alteryx Ability to understand and find appropriate applications for data and analysis results An affinity for data modelling and developing business intelligence insights. Project and change management experience Strong communication and stakeholder management skills. An understanding of end-to-end delivery of data products and applications. Proven multi-tasking skills to manage conflicting priorities and deliver to deadlines. Policies and procedures for data collection and analysis If you are looking to further your career is a highly successful  fast paced environment then we would love to hear from you! Please apply via the link or contact Verity Morison at verity.morison@macquarie.com for a confidential discussion.  About Commodities And Global Markets  Commodities and Global Markets provides clients with an integrated  end-to-end offering across global markets including equities  fixed income  foreign exchange and commodities.  Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion  The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths  and in combination with our inclusive environment  it enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people  clients  shareholders and communities. From day one  you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us  please apply. With the right technology  support and resources  our people can work in a range of flexible ways.  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you  and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.  About Macquarie  A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills  explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition  helping sustain global food supplies  financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie  we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.  Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups  disciplines  sectors and borders. With 17 000+ employees and offices in 33 markets around the world  we’re a truly global organisation.  You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives  ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us  you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.  Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management  retail and business banking  wealth management  leasing and asset financing  market access  commodity trading  renewables development  specialist advisory  capital raising and principal investment.  Find out more at www.macquarie.com/careers  Job no: CGM-963474  Work type: Permanent - Full time  Location: Sydney  Category: Junior  Data & Analytics  Group: Commodities and Global Markets  Division: Central  Recruiter: Verity Morison  Opening Date: 24/2/2022

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Requirements: About Us  Endeavour Group was created in 2020 through the restructure and merger of the Woolworths Group drinks and hospitality businesses. United behind a common purpose of ‘Creating a more sociable future together’  we are a 28 000+ strong team with more than 1600 stores and 330 hotels nationally  including leading brands such as Dan Murphy’s  BWS and ALH Hotels.  Endeavour Group separated from Woolworths during calendar year 2021 and is well-positioned as an ASX Top 50 Company. Join the team at an exciting time in their evolution!  The Opportunity  As part of the analytics team  you will also be able to leverage the capability that exists across the other team members. By developing strong relationships  shared ways of working and leveraging the skills of the team we aim to build a strong analytics capability and embed data and insight into the business.  A day In the life of a Senior Data Analyst @ Endeavour… Produce data  analytics and insights from various data sources across Endeavour drinks  including Adobe  GCP  Azure and other proprietary databases. Assist in the development of test and learn experiments to drive key organisational initiatives Provide ongoing and ad hoc reporting  analysis and insights in a timely manner Work within team norms  standards and procedures to provide consistency across the business Establish strong relationships with business stakeholders. Be proactive with ideas and recommendations and help drive the business outcomes Lead  coach and develop junior team members What You’ll Need To Succeed 5+ years experience in retail environment with experience in data  analytics or insights Demonstrated capability in developing analytics and insights and communicating findings to stakeholders to improve customer satisfaction and business outcomes. Experience in auditing and improving analytics setup Demonstrable ability to build collaborative relationships with a diverse range of stakeholders within analytics chapters and across cross functional squads Ability to prioritise multiple concurrent pieces of work and deliver to agreed milestones whilst communicating any changes in scope or timelines Proven experience of continuously improving individual outputs and contributing to the aim of the team to do the same. Experience working in an agile organisation or with agile technology teams. Title: HIRING PROVINCIALLY - Investigator - Research & Analytics (REMOTE)
Requirements: Company  Xpera Risk Mitigation and Investigation LP  HIRING PROVINCIALLY - Investigator - Research & Analytics (REMOTE)  Reporting to the investigations manager  the Investigator  Research & Analytics will conduct a wide variety of detailed  quality and timely research and investigative assignments.  This position will work within the Open Source Intelligence team and collaborate with team members on a daily basis. Along with possessing an investigative mindset  advanced report writing  and research skills  a strong command of grammar and the English language are essential to success in this role. This role is available for remote work!  The ideal candidate has a demonstrated ability to manage multiple tasks within a fast-paced environment under the pressure of tight deadlines. Strong organizational  analytical  and decision-making skills are required. Must conduct all investigations in a professional manner and maintain strict confidentiality at all times.  Benefits and Remuneration: As part of the Xpera team  you will receive a comprehensive benefits package  including RRSP contributions. You will enjoy an industry leading remuneration package including the issuance of a laptop computer.  Competencies Required To Succeed Ability to collect  make use of  and disseminate publicly available information in a timely manner to an appropriate audience for the purpose of addressing a specific intelligence requirement. Possess patience and persistence ensuring quality services to our customers while managing conflicting demands from various divisions and managers  adjusts quickly to changing priorities and conditions. Provides accurate information and creative solutions for customers while taking ownership of decisions. Ability to determine data’s source and reliability  as well as provide meaningful analysis. Thorough  detail-oriented  organized  analytical  and systematic thinker. Ability to apply an investigative mindset and think outside the box. Creative problem-solving. Honor commitments and promises  maintain confidentiality and has high standards of integrity. Enthusiastic and positive  self-starter and quick learner. Works collaboratively with others to achieve goals but also works well independently. Ability to work under pressure to meet demanding timelines  ability to multi-task while maintaining focus on the task at hand  handling multiple and sometimes conflicting yet strict deadlines. Breaks down complex issues into manageable components. Prioritizes activities to sustain growth and profitability. Responsibilities Conduct detailed  in-depth background and asset investigations on individuals and corporate entities in response to client requests through the use of cyber research and databases Conduct intellectual property investigations via online research and site attendances Locate individuals throughout Canada through the use of database and Internet searches as well as inquiries Provide support to the Surveillance and Risk Management Divisions with open source research as needed Assist with confirming focal points and identifiers  in an effort to maximize surveillance resources Comfortably navigate through popular social networking sites  locating  analyzing and documenting relevant material found Document files accurately with file activity and all information gathered Ensure all client protocols and guidelines are followed Report your findings to our clients in accordance with Xpera standards and practices Abide by relevant privacy legislation and adhere to internal policies  guidelines and best practices that apply to open source intelligence Maintain current on industry standards  new and emergent sites and participate in staff meetings and trainings for information sharing purposes Attend court or legal proceedings as required Other related duties  as required Education  Knowledge And Experience Required Holds a valid Ontario Private Investigator License. Completion of 'Using the internet as an Investigative research Tool' training through Toddington International  or willingness to complete within two months of hire. Minimum of two (2) years of research and/or investigation experience. Proficiency working with Microsoft Word  Excel  Outlook. Ability to work autonomously. Prior experience working in a client focused environment. Advanced report writing and research abilities. Environment/Work conditions Primary work environment is in an office location  however  some field work may be required as file demands dictate therefore must be able to travel within assigned investigation territory. Flexible work schedule – some evening and weekend work may be required. Positive team dynamics. Fast paced environment. All prospective employees must be willing to undergo and pass a background check. If you are interested in this position  submit/upload your resume and cover letter (as one document).  SCM Insurance Services and affiliates welcome and encourage applications from people with disabilities. Accommodations are available on request for candidates throughout the recruitment and assessment process

Title: Applied Statistician/Econometrician
Requirements: About Us  Canberra Consulting focuses on delivering highly skilled and qualified professionals to our clients. Canberra Consulting has the experience and the capability to understand your specific requirements and match them to the right environment  ensuring professional satisfaction and ongoing development opportunities. Our focus is ensuring that both you and our client are a good match and that we give you every opportunity to succeed.  The Opportunity  Are you a talented Applied Statistician/Econometrician looking for an opportunity? Look no further  we have the role for YOU!  Our client is seeking someone just like you to join their team.  You will need adequate knowledge of R programming to deliver analytics with the biosecurity system modelling team.  You will be developing and implementing existing and emerging biosecurity systems and modelling approaches to contribute to the national evidence-based policymaking process  including the area of strategic resource allocation  alongside the Department’s research partner  fellow statisticians and data analysts  and policy/operational stakeholders.  This important role involves modelling conditional probabilities of the approach  entry  establishment and spread client-specific impacts.  Using Your Exceptional Skills  You Will Be Responsible For Improving existing biosecurity pathway models  resource allocation and expenditure models Integrating model uncertainty and embedding a geospatial dimension in Bayesian Network models Leading standalone projects on biosecurity-related statistical questions around experimental design  statistical power  and analysis approaches Assisting the team to determine best-practice data collection  quality control and documentation All candidates submitted for the advertised position must be an Australian Citizen and have the ability to obtain a Baseline Security Clearance.  Does this sound like a perfect role for you? Interested in hearing more?  Give Mica a call on 0434 599 635  for a confidential discussion. Desired Skills and Experience Applied Statistician/Econometrician
