We’re committed to promoting diversity in the workplace and encourage people from all backgrounds to apply. Are you looking to join a high performing  smart and fun team? Apply now!

Title: Senior Data Service Analyst
Requirements: Overall Job Purpose  The Data Service Analyst role sits within the Data as a Service Client Delivery team  and is responsible for support and delivery of Data as a Service.  The role performs day to day oversight of Data As a Service related reporting services that are produced by the offshore hub location in Chennai.  The Senior Data Service Analyst will interact directly with Australian based clients to ensure a high quality service delivery experience  by responding to client queries and resolving issues.  The Senior Data Service Analyst will work on service optimization and change management tasks for designated clients  and prepare and participate in service review meetings  workshops and system demonstrations.  The main objectives of the Data Service Client Delivery team are to: Receive daily investment data (Holdings  transactions  security attributes etc) from multiple external custodians  internal sources  and private equity data administrators via multiple feeds through the day. Management of cross domain data sets and services  including benchmark and security referential data from vendors Normalise  aggregate and validate this data  applying specific business rules to enhance the output. Feed the results via a series of daily data files to the client including their 3rd Party software solutions Support maintenance of client facing user interfaces allowing updating of account hierarchies  look through mapping  specific position updates and security referential overrides.  This role is in a recently created team to support the roll out of a new product for BNP Paribas  and thus there will be significant implementation and set up involved  including UAT testing  explaining and validating results with clients  and development of new processes and procedures.  Areas Of Responsibilities  Service Delivery Support the delivery of all data as a service products to BNP Paribas Australian clients. Develop and maintain relationships with clients to ensure provision of high level of service Oversight responsibilities for Data Service activity based in our global operations hub in Chennai  and/or in AU Technical contact point for clarification and resolution of reporting queries received from the hub location or the client  and main point of contract for resolution of issues with IT support teams. Ensure ongoing high level of client service Meet or liaise regularly with clients to ensure the service delivery is of a high standard  maintaining a strong focus on timeliness and accuracy as measured by service KPIs and KQIs  including production of monthly KPI packs. Interact regularly with key local (RM’s  CSM’s  as well as third party custodians and fund administrators) and international stake holders to ensure preferred outcomes Deliver demonstrations and presentations to clients (or prospective clients) as they relate to Data as a Service  Projects & Change Support client change control aimed at developing  extending  or improving the existing service received by the client Support new activity set up and onboarding activities Help define business specification documents  create test & implementation plans  support and maintain project governance documents Seek to optimise end to end production under oversight  working transversally across the business as required  Contributive responsibilities (how the role contributes to the success of business line / function) Deliver service to our clients accurately and on time  thus reinforcing and building client relationship  leading to new business opportunities Ensure operational risk is captured and addressed  securing our functional capabilities Ensure appropriate procedures and risk and control guidelines are adhered to within the team through processes and checking. Monitor adherence to the Risk and Control Matrix through undertaking Controlled Self-Assessment Support the growth of our commercial relationships with our clients  Technical Skills And Experience  Required: - Understanding of data system architecture and systems such as MapR  Hadoop and AB initio Strong practical understanding of Data Certification and the controls required to ensure accurate and complete data delivery Experience working within middle office  investment and performance analysis or fund accounting environment Strong practical understanding of ABOR and IBOR with multiple instrument types  including derivatives and how they should be treated within investment accounting and performance measurement Strong practical understanding of market data indices (S&P/ASX  MSCI  etc)  characteristics (duration  Greeks etc)  and classification schemes (GICS  BICS  etc.) Knowledge of private investments and their specifics around account and valuations Knowledge of performance  attribution  risk and other advanced investment reporting  and an understanding of the data required to support these calculations Proven client service skills Practical experience liaising with and explaining results to clients and internal stake holders Strong Microsoft excel skills  Excel VBA skills  Access database experience  SQL knowledge  Qualifications Tertiary qualification Industry specific qualifications such as CIPM  CFA  etc desirable.  Competencies Accountability – takes personal responsibility  delivers against personal and team goals Flexibility – positive and flexible approach to identify preferred solutions to issues and problems Results focused – understand the strategic objectives of the business as well as the team  work to ensure their achievement with a quality focus. Client focus – delivers consistently a high standard of client service   aiming to achieve all client deliverables within KPI  and operating in line with the departmental code of conduct Teamwork – work cohesively with a team of senior professionals to define and deliver against strategy  demonstrates sound intuition and political awareness Innovation – maintain a constant focus on process efficiency with the aim of increasing scalability and client experience Communication – effective verbal and written communication & effective interpersonal ability Maturity & Judgment - Demonstrates the ability to deal effectively with complex issues  learns from experience  assesses issues using relevant information and applying intuition. Time Management – Prioritise and manage client requests and the teams execution of key tasks  Primary Location  AU-NSW-Sydney  Job Type  Standard / Permanent  Job  DATA  Education Level  Bachelor Degree or equivalent (>= 3 years)  Experience Level  Not Indicated

Title: Data Analyst Manager (AO8) - Geological Survey of Queensland
Requirements: In the role of Data Analyst Manager within the Resources Planning and Intelligence Unit of the Geological Survey of Queensland (GSQ) you will provide a high level of professional leadership  as well as team and project management to support the Director of Resources Planning and Intelligence and the broader Georesources Division.  The Data Analyst Manager will lead the team in establishing robust data solutions and analysis to provide responsive and ongoing information  knowledge and insights  to support other business units within the Georesources Division of the Department of Resources and external stakeholders.  Key Skills and attributes  Manage the development and delivery of data management and data analytics to support GSQ’s industry intelligence function with a focus on customer needs  collaboration  efficiency and mutually beneficial outcomes. Provide strategic advice  intelligence and recommendations regarding attraction to  and investment in  Queensland’s mineral and energy resources sector  based on best use of data  information and systems. Guide  support and enhance the team’s capabilities by mentoring  coaching and demonstrating best practice in quantitative analysis  data visualisation  research  report writing and analysing data to provide insights. Oversee and undertake significant and complex research and analysis to identify risks  issues and opportunities relating to the development of the State’s mineral  petroleum  coal and extractive resources  including: continued improvement and development of existing tools  leading the development of new tools and processes  leading the delivery of research projects into emerging issues. Communicate complex issues in a clear and concise manner to provide high-level expert advice  information and support to senior management  the Minister’s office  and external clients as required in relation to policies  issues and trends affecting Queensland’s geological resources sector  and implications for Queensland. Organise  manage  and prioritise statistical data to produce meaningful and accurate reports for both internal and external clients. Develop and maintain positive working relationships with team members  customers and stakeholders to promote quality information exchange and collaboration.  Role requirements There are no mandatory requirements for this role  however the following would be highly regarded: data analytics experience and capability to apply modern approaches to data curation  data governance and data visualisation. experience with R  Python or SQL programming for data wrangling and analytics. experience in automating data workflows  and in preparing clear data visualisations through advanced use of Microsoft Power BI  Tableau or similar . excellent qualitative and quantitative research skills. superior writing skills with experience in writing ministerial briefs. knowledge of the Queensland’s resources sector  or capacity to acquire this knowledge to do the job at a high level of accomplishment.  Competencies As a Team Leader in the role of Data Analyst Manager  the following competencies from the Leadership competencies for Queensland are most relevant to this role: Vision Works with the team to organise work priorities so they deliver on broader organisational commitments (Leads strategically). Supports the team to generate actionable insights from data and empowers the use of technology to drive new efficiencies (Stimulates ideas and innovation).  Results Recognises the unique strengths  areas for development and aspirations of direct reports (Develops and mobilises talent). Initiates two-way collaborations by providing information and advice in a timely  proactive  and non-technical manner  supporting the team to do the same (Builds enduring relationships).  Accountability Promotes personal responsibility for the realisation of a healthy workplace through regular communication  feedback and sharing of observations and outcomes (Fosters healthy and inclusive workplaces). Acts as a role model for the team by actively seeking feedback and communicating openly about learnings (Pursues continuous growth).  It is a requirement for all current and prospective employees of the department  to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Acceptable evidence of vaccination must be provided If you have a recognised medical contraindication to COVID-19 vaccines  please speak with the panel chair to discuss your circumstances and available options.  How to apply  To apply for this role  please submit the following documents to recruitmenthr@resources.qld.gov.au. Your current resume detailing your previous work  voluntary or relevant experience including two referees who have personally observed you displaying the competencies required for this role. A brief letter (1-2 pages) telling us why you are interested in this role and how your skills and experience align with this role. This should not be a restatement of your resume. It is your opportunity to tell us about yourself  how you meet the required competencies  key duties and responsibilities  and any specific role requirements including what skills you’ll bring to the role.  Applications close 18 April 2022

Title: Escalation Engineer I (Health and Escalation Management) WFH Option in Australia
Requirements: Job Summary  DESCRIPTION  Amazon is now offering flexibility to choose between two working models  onsite and remote. Please  check below for further information: Onsite Employee: An employee who works either entirely in an Amazon building  or split between both an Amazon building and remote location. Employees will need to either live near or relocate to an already established Amazon building location. Remote Employee: An employee who works in a remote location for the entirety of the normally scheduled workweek  for a period of more than 90 days in a rolling 12 month period. These employees do not need to live near an Amazon office  but must live in Australia. About Us  Amazon has built a reputation for excellence with a mission to be the earth’s most customer-centric company  a company that customers from all over the globe will recognize  value  and trust for both our products and our service. Amazon Web Services (AWS) is carrying on that tradition while leading the world in cloud technologies.  The Escalation and Event Management (E2M) team is part of the broader AWS Support organisation and is dedicated to managing critical escalations  customer facing operational communications  and handling large-scale customer impacting events. E2M’s purpose is to drive operational excellence and improvements to the overall customer experience.  About You  E2M is looking for people who are detailed  analytical thinkers as well as creative problem solvers  with a strong bias for action. You are someone who is not constrained by the notion of “how things are usually done”  and you are equally comfortable operating in the minute detail  as well as with coordinating efforts at the forty thousand foot view. You confidently advocate for customers  maintaining composure in dynamic and high pressure situations. You are comfortable working on highly technical initiatives to consistently improve the AWS customer experience. You are someone who excels at working in a dynamic environment while collaborating with some of the smartest people in the industry  and you get excited about owning critical infrastructure services that serve global customers  every second of the day!  Finally  you are passionate about technology with a desire to learn more and do more with AWS.  About The Role  As members of E2M’s Health and Escalation Management team  we work to keep customers informed and moving forward when they are facing challenges using AWS’ products and services. We are responsible for driving critical customer problems to resolution  ensuring the right internal “Owners” are engaged to assist us and act as an advocate for the customer. We ensure customers are proactively informed of changes or impact to the AWS resources the customer is using in their operation  ensuring communications are clear and beneficial to the customer experience. Because of our unique role as Escalation Engineers  we have limitless exposure to all things AWS  including numerous leading edge technologies.  Every day will bring new and exciting challenges that include elements of: Drive critical  complex customer escalations in situations that are sometimes technically challenging in collaboration with Engineering Teams. Partner with AWS Service Teams to craft communications  helping to identify and remove technical ambiguity Deliver planned operational communications to customers in accordance with AWS communication tenets and style guides Provide clear  concise and timely communication on work items to relevant internal stakeholders Build a broad understanding of AWS services  service inter-dependencies and customer use cases to improve the customer experience and operational excellence Facilitating post mortems of operational failures  implementing corrective actions and identifying improvement opportunities for existing processes. Design  build  or collaborate on solutions using automation and self-repair rather than relying on human intervention Other duties as required by the organization **Please note for this position  the core coverage hours of our follow-the-sun model are from 9:00am-3:00pm AEST (or 10:00am-4:00pm AEDT during Daylight time). You can be located in any time zone within Australia but please only apply to this position if you are able to accommodate these core hours.**   Basic Qualifications Experience in Support Engineering  Customer Escalations  Technical Communications  or similar IT role 2+ years of experience in technical operations or support focused on cloud infrastructure Tertiary qualification/Bachelor’s Degree in Information Science / Information Technology  Computer Science  Engineering  Mathematics  Physics  or a related field (or 3+ years of relevant work experience)  Preferred Qualifications  Candidates that have been most successful after joining our team have demonstrated capabilities in one or more of these areas: Excellent written and oral English communication skills Industry specific accredited certification(s) such as the AWS Associate level certifications Familiarity with Cloud services with a focus on high availability and fault tolerant design Experience with data manipulation and/or automation using Python  JavaScript or shell scripting Knowledge of ITIL/Lean Processes Effective prioritization and time management skills Ability to work in ambiguous environments Demonstrated critical thinking and logical problem solving skills Amazon Web Services is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race  religion  color  national origin  gender  sexual orientation  age  marital status  veteran status  or disability status.   Company - AWS Australia Pty Ltd  Job ID: A2032876

As a responsible business  we are building a sustainable world and helping young people from underrepresented communities fulfil their potential. Title: Consultant - Data Analytics and Insights
Requirements: Our Insights  Communication and Creative team is growing  and we are seeking a Consultant or Senior Consultant to join our Data Analytics and Insights team in either Sydney or Brisbane.  You will be joining a diverse  supportive and tightly knit team of consultants  where you will develop an evidence base to support communication  consultation and community relations strategies on a mix of projects  large and small  for a range of government and private sector clients.  About The Job  The primary responsibilities of your position will be to run data discovery  data assessment  data analysis and develop effective data integration and data modelling strategies  to build evidence-based advice for RPS clients. The role will support the data analytics activities for management and delivery within integrated project teams across communications and engagement  strategy and investment  due diligence  and policy development and delivery.  You will also be passionate about shaping meaningful outcomes for the community and supporting clients to deliver innovative engagement and communication programs.  About You  Between five and ten years demonstrated experience in data analysis  data modelling and data visualisations  you will also possess: Tertiary qualification in Mathematics / Statistics / Computer Science (or other numerate discipline). Demonstrated experience querying databases using SQL including joining tables/views  and leveraging aggregate and window functions. A strong understanding of statistics with the experience to know when to apply specific statistical techniques or approaches and the ability to identify their strengths and weaknesses. Proficiency in data modelling and coding in R / Python. Experience using data visualisation tools and dashboarding using Power BI. Experience with cloud platforms (Azure) and leveraging APIs. Demonstrated experience working as part of a multi-disciplinary team and work co-operatively with people at all levels to achieve outcomes  including construction environments. The ability to self-manage including seeking out all necessary information about the wider context of their tasks  being responsible for meeting utilisation targets  adhering to budgets and managing competing priorities as well as ensuring work is delivered on time to the highest quality. Experience liaising with clients and maintain client relationships. Sound analytical and problem-solving skills including a strong attention to detail with an emphasis on accuracy and quality. High levels of initiative  self-motivated and able to work with limited supervision. Excellent teamwork and interpersonal skills. What's On Offer  We provide a diverse and inclusive work environment and offer many benefits to ensure your professional development & well-being: Flexible start and finish times  working from home  part time and job share options. State of the art  modern and contemporary offices. Paid Parental and Partner Leave. Well-being benefits e.g. vaccinations  health insurance discounts. Professional memberships. Study assistance. Professional and technical development opportunities. We encourage and value different ideas  perspectives  and styles of thinking. We need a mix of experiences and skills to develop the most innovative ideas. We respect one another and recognise the potential and contribution of everyone.  You’ll be joining a diverse community and a company that puts its people first and prioritises their wellbeing.  If this job sounds like you and you   APPLY today!  Our Approach  Our people live our purpose  deliver our promise  and demonstrate our behaviours every day. Our behaviours define who we are. Developed by our people  they underpin everything that we do. They create the memorable experiences we are known for and make RPS a great place to do great work. ‘Stronger Together’ is one of our five core behaviours and it is inherent in creating an inclusive workplace: ‘We are respectful  acknowledge diversity  and recognise the potential and contribution of everyone. We bring out the best in one another  always assuming best intent. People who learn and grow thrive in our business  sharing in our success.’  Recruitment Agencies  We have a Preferred Supplier List of trusted partners to assist us when required and do not acknowledge any speculative CVs or unsolicited candidate introductions from agencies not on this list. Please refer to the careers page on our website if you require any further information.

Title: Dashboard Developer
Requirements: A fantastic and high impact opportunity for a Dashboard Developer has become available within the Strategic Decision Support team (BI team) of ALDI stores  based in Minchinbury  NSW. This is a full time permanent position.  The purpose of a Dashboard Developer is to create high-value Tableau dashboard solutions which support specific business needs and objectives  creating actionable insights for the target audience to drive outcomes for the business. A Front End Developer embodies the values of ALDI and acts as an enabler of value-add dialogue  with a higher purpose to support the business in the delivery of high value outcomes.  As a Dashboard Developer  you will be responsible for partnering with senior stakeholders across Store and Warehouse Operations  Property  Procurement and Customer Interactions to deliver and develop a comprehensive suite of reporting and dashboards  assisting the business in providing actionable insights.  Experience in dashboard modelling and reporting development is essential for this role. The successful candidate will be able to demonstrate highly analytical  critical and holistic thinking across a variation of departments and reporting objectives.  What's in it for you? Market leading remuneration $124 900 - $142 500 (including super) 5 weeks annual leave Hybrid working model - 10 days a month working from home Be part of a high performing and high demand business unit Problem solving real business challenges in high impact areas Selection Criteria Minimum 3 years’ experience in a PowerBI or Tableau Developer role Tertiary education within Data  Analytics  Mathematics  Computer Science or related is highly regarded Demonstrated experience in transforming and improving business reporting Demonstrated experience in applying data management and analytics methodologies Current PowerBI  Tableau or Alteryx certification is highly regarded Excellent capabilities in communicating effectively to a variation of stakeholders  both technical and non-technical High attention to detail and accuracy Programming experience is a plus Role Responsibilities Creation of dashboard and reporting suites for a broad range of national departments Collate  extract and manage data from multiple sources to bring together insights and cleansing data as required to ensure the integrity of data Builds and maintains effective relationships with key stakeholders across functions and within the BI team Present Tableau dashboards and reports to stakeholders across all levels from within the Business and BI team Processing of demands that include touchpoints with the broader Business Intelligence team Ensuring development output is robust and reliable and adheres to agreed design guidelines and principles Drives the implementation of innovations and new functionalities in the reporting solution COVID-19 update  At ALDI we believe that our employees should expect to come to work every day with the comfort and confidence that they are in the safest possible environment. You will be required to adhere to all ALDI and State and Federal Government COVID-safe practices and regulations.  From March 1st 2022  a condition of ongoing employment with ALDI will be that employees are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless they have a valid medical exemption. This requirement will apply to all employees across stores  warehouse  transport and offices.

Title: Data Analyst Manager
Requirements: Sydney  With a busy and growing business to support  we are always looking for ways to optimise our client and employee experience and cultivate data driven decision making. We are seeking a strong problem solver  analytics translator with extensive hands-on experience performing analytical deep-dives and building models from complex data .  In this role you will: be responsible for owning and delivering analytical projects supporting the Personal Banking channel strategic initiatives. The Personal Banking channel in the Banking and Financial Services division provides typical retail banking products including home loans  online banking experiences  transaction and savings accounts  credit cards and car finance. consult with stakeholders to understand their business priorities and opportunities then proactively introduce innovative thinking and analytical solutions to those situations apply independent judgment in creating new statistical models  analysing  and connecting model results to business questions and hypotheses manage multiple projects  BAU and ad-hoc activities across the team to deliver high-quality outputs on time and in budget drive business impact by working collaboratively across a variety of working groups in an agile work environment to deliver outcomes in a timely manner mentor team members About you:  To be a success in this role  you’ll have extensive experience of consulting stakeholders to understand business needs and translating these to analytics use cases to deliver business outcomes  customer insights using advanced analytics methods  modelling and or statistical techniques.  You will have a passion for getting your hands dirty but also mentoring and guiding others to help support these projects. You’ll have experience working with tools including or similar to Alteryx  R  Python  Tableau  SQL  Hadoop  Hbase/NoSQL  Spark and Storm.  Banking industry experience is a plus.  Your degree and/or Masters will be in a quantitative subject - degree in statistics  mathematics  operations research  engineering (industrial  computer or electrical)  or related fields.  About Banking And Financial Services  Banking and Financial Services is Macquarie’s retail banking and financial services business  providing a diverse range of personal banking  wealth management  business banking and vehicle finance products and services to retail clients  advisers  brokers and business clients.  Our commitment to Diversity  Equity and Inclusion  The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths. An inclusive and equitable environment enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people  clients  shareholders and communities. From day one  you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us  please apply. With the right technology  support and resources  our people can work in a range of flexible ways.  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity  equity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you  and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.  About Macquarie  A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills  explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition  helping sustain global food supplies  financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie  we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.  Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups  disciplines  sectors and borders. With 17 000+ employees and offices in 33 markets around the world  we’re a truly global organisation.  You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives  ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us  you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.  Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management  retail and business banking  wealth management  leasing and asset financing  market access  commodity trading  renewables development  specialist advisory  capital raising and principal investment.  Find out more at www.macquarie.com/careers  Job no: BFS-963501  Work type: Permanent - Full time  Location: Sydney  Category: Mid-senior  Mid-level  Data & Analytics  Technology  Group: Banking and Financial Services  Division: Product & Technology  Recruiter: Chelsea Hollins  Opening Date: 03/3/2022

Title: Data Analysts and Data Visualisation Practitioners
Requirements: Do you have a passion for wrangling complex data into meaningful insight for senior decision makers?  Are you experienced in visual analytics platforms such as Tableau and Power BI and looking to expand your capability in a growing team?  Are you looking to take your strong analytics experience to the next level and make a difference?  Join us!  About Our Business Analytics Team  Our Business Analytics team is expanding rapidly as demand for our leading solutions grows. We work with a broad range of clients  delivering our world-class analytics  data visualisation and executive dashboarding solutions. We have an established  world class team of data professionals who work on interesting and challenging projects  in a culture that values and empowers the individual to realise success and entrepreneurship.  Role specific’s  As one of our Data analysts and data visualisation practitioners you will work deeply with data  to support the strategic objectives of our Government clients. Your work will help C-suite decision makers to deliver evidence-based outcomes through clear  data-driven solutions and support the team’s engagement and communication.  You will be responsible for:  Working with Australian Government clients to understand and document their information  analysis and decision-making needs using established user-experience and business analysis frameworks. Building  maintaining  improving and troubleshooting dashboards  reports  analytics tools and other data-driven solution products. Designing  building and delivering data frameworks including: queries  stored procedures and other mechanisms for extracting data from source systems  transforming it into reporting-friendly formats  and loading it into data warehouses and reporting databases.  You will bring a background that demonstrates:  Bachelor or postgrad qualifications in IT  data analytics  or another relevant field Skills and experience in data visualisation tools  especially PowerBI and/or Tableau Management Consulting experience. Ability to work with a high degree of autonomy and to high standards of quality. Ability to manage scope and timeline of multiple tasks without compromising on quality.  Our ideal candidate will be able to demonstrate one or more of the following:  Strong technical skills in data analysis tools  languages and techniques  such as SQL  ETL tools  and integration/middleware platforms Consulting and/or business development experience  possibly in data- or analytics- related fields. Experience working in an Australian Government environment  whether as an APS employee or consulting to Australian Government agencies You will have a positive attitude  excellent communication skills and be able to utilise your relationship building skills to work with other Synergites and clients in an authentic and personal way.  Security Clearance Requirements  Many of our engagements involve working with clients that have a need for security  privacy and confidentiality. You must therefore be an Australian citizen  you will hold an AGSVA baseline or NV1 clearance or have the ability to obtain one.  Why Synergy?  At Synergy we have a culture that is empowering  positive  open and abundant. We value building long lasting and trusted relationships with our Synergites  clients and community. Synergy is one of Canberra’s fastest growing  most dynamic consulting firms  serving federal and territory governments and commercial clients. Synergy’s culture values and empowers the individual to realise success through entrepreneurial opportunities.  We value diversity and inclusion and believe that no employment opportunity should be limited for any irrelevant reason. All employment decisions are made on the basis of qualifications  merit and business needs. We respect and empower each individual and seek to recruit  develop and retain the most talented people.  Please send your CV to our People Team at recruitment@synergygroup.net.au More information about Synergy is available at synergygroup.net.au and at our Synergy Group Australia page on LinkedIn.

Title: Senior Business Data Analyst
Requirements: Who we are: Maltem Australia is a niche data analytics & transformation consulting boutique composed of 50 consultants. Having said that  we are part of a larger consulting group  present in 5 regions and 11 countries  with different specialties such as cyber-security  technology  and agile transformation. In total  we are more than 1100 across the globe. Here in Australia  we have for mission to enable the organization to unleash the power of data & analytics to unlock value and deliver business benefits.  About the opportunity : Maltem Australia is working closely with one of its clients to uplift its data analytics journey. As part of our partnership  we are looking for a well-rounded Data BA who can closely with Supply Chain SMEs to identify data and information needs and assist in the translation to functional requirements. If you recognise the critical importance of data and have a passion for getting it right coupled with some excellent analytical skills  you will enjoy this role.  About the role : You would join an enterprise-wide data analytics transformation program at one of our key clients. You will be working with global supply chain team  along with sales & marketing business line to help them understand their data requirement  convert them into technical requirements and support the development and delivery of high value analytics solution.  Your responsibilities will be: • Liaise with global supply chain team as well as market & sales business functions • Define problem statements  and business requirements • Conduct business and data analysis • Partner with stakeholders to deliver solutions • Ensure data requirements are appropriately reviewed and signed-off • Analyse and document business requirements for development of solutions by the technical delivery team that will rectify the data challenges the business is experiencing • Execute wider source data analysis and systems analysis to ensure the successful delivery of the data analytics and insights program of work • Lead data discovery workshops to uncover fit-for-purpose business requirements for wider data and analytics projects Skills:  To be successful in the role you will need: • 2-3 years’ experience as a Technical / Data Business Analyst  preferably exposure to supply chain function • Experience working on a data related project  either data warehouse  analytics  or big data • Strong understanding of Business Intelligence/Visualisation tools like Power BI / Tableau. • Capability of working through high level requests and collaborating with relevant stakeholders to obtain clarity and detail on requirements. • Experience planning and conducting business requirements workshops with stakeholders  and documenting outcomes • Innovative mindset to provide creative solutions and business process improvement opportunities • Communicate business & design requirements to delivery team  assisting them through the development lifecycle • Ability to grasp new concepts quickly and be able to distil and communicate complex information • Experience in managing requirements through their lifecycle in agile environment Preferably : • Experience sketching and documenting PowerBI visualisation & dashboard wireframe designs with stakeholders • Understanding and exposure to relational databases  modern cloud-based databases such as AWS Redshift  So  are you ready to join us?

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Operations
Requirements: Posted by Kishan Modi Chief Product Officer at me&u Send InMail Founded in Australia  and catapulting into venues worldwide  me&u is the new way to order and pay  with our core focus being  improving the hospitality experience for the customer and operator alike. me&u is building a better future for hospitality  to inspire extraordinary memories for you and for me.  With rapid expansion across the UK & USA  and quickly becoming the leader in Australia’s at-table ordering category  our product has been acquired and utilized across all types of venues  from bars  pubs to restaurants big and small. Backed by Australia's leading hospitality operators  you will find me&u on over 40 000 tables across the country and exploding across tables in the UK & USA. Over 10 million customers have tapped onto me&u!  This is only just the beginning  and we are looking for like-minded team mates to join us on our journey!  With exponential growth in our team and partners over the last 2 years  we are excited to be expanding our Business Intelligence Team this year!  About the role  You will be part of the BI Team  working closely with our Ops team (Sales  Onboarding  Account Management).  You will work collaboratively with them to deliver actionable data-driven recommendations and identify opportunities for me&u  champion analysis relevant to the Ops team and help identify high impact of initiatives.  You’ll also be joining a top-notch data team  collaborating with BI Engineers and Data Scientists to provide the best outcomes for the Ops teams and drive the roadmap with the Head of BI.  A closer look at your responsibilities  Working closely with the Ops teams to assist them in executing their roadmap. Leverage large volume of data from multiple source systems Provide analytical solutions and actionable insights to drive performance and business improvements Work with the Ops teams to define key metrics and build dashboards and automated reporting when required to ensure accurate tracking Share and present insights to various stakeholders within me&u when needed Supporting and empowering the Ops team to broaden their usage of data in their day to day Work collaboratively with our BI Engineers and Data Scientists to provide the required outcomes Manage prioritization of the BI and data roadmap with the Head of BI Mentor and help more junior team members  What we hope you will bring to the table  Minimum 7 years of experience working with data and turning them into actionable insights Strong proficiency with SQL Proficiency with Tableau Capable of working with high volumes of data Analytical and problem-solving skills  with the ability to overlay commercial acumen to develop insights and recommendations Ability to communicate complex quantitative analysis in a clear  precise  and actionable manner to non-technical stakeholders Critical thinking and curiosity to learn more about me&u business Experience working closely and communicating effectively with internal and external stakeholders Strong capability of managing and prioritizing several competing tasks for different stakeholders  What we hope you will bring to the table  Experience with Python Experience with Snowflake Prior experience managing a small team  or coaching junior team members  Why us?  At me&u  you will have the unique opportunity to develop your career in an exciting and rewarding company. We pride ourselves on always improving our operations to ensure you are supported and guided towards success.  We are scaling quickly and embrace fresh minds that thrive in this environment. Our technological footprint on the hospitality industry is always evolving  and so will your role and the interesting challenges that you will face.  We give you the space to be accountable  to let you take responsibility and empower you to make the decisions you need to. We drive forward as a team towards our mission - our team is our strength.  Our values  We are change-makers who balance speed with purpose  we live our mission with curiosity and when things don't go the way we planned we are resilient and show up the next day. We unite to create a better future for hospitality. We take ownership over what we do and treat each other and all our customers with empathy  as we all play a role in the success of me&u  our name says it all  it's about you & me.  The extras  Competitive base salary as well the opportunity to take part of our Employee Share Plans. We pride ourselves in always providing ongoing support to our team and instilling clear career progression plans. We are a data-driven business  and we celebrate all wins.  At me&u  we are dedicated to empowering a diverse and inclusive community. We welcome applications from candidates from all backgrounds and perspectives.  If you feel excited and want to be part of disrupting hospitality for the better - reach out for a chat!

Title: Junior Data Engineer

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Investment Analytics
Requirements: Posted by James Eichhorn 2nd Senior Consultant at Talent Insights Group Send InMail Senior Data Analyst role working with investment data and analytics for a Melbourne based financial organisation. This position is part of a 5 person team growing to 8 working in customer investments.  You will work alongside Data Engineers  DataOps and Data Scientists on the Investments Data Platform to provide accurate reporting of overall assets  foreign currency and derivatives by classifying  modelling and aggregating current and future state data.  Note: Investments experience is not a must but very advantageous as is financial data experience    Tech Stack in use & required experience: SQL  either Python  .Net or Powershell for coding and automation Knowledge or commercial experience with statistical modelling  statistical packages for datasets using either R  Excel or SSAS Commercial experience with manipulating and analysing data in relational databases using SQL Cloud experience with ideally Azure but AWS experience is suitable. SSRS or BI tools such as PowerBI Bonus is CICD  automation  devops etc. API's experience is also advantageous. In addition investment systems such as Factset  Barraone  Ortec Pearl  Datastream  RIMES  Eikon or Bloomberg experience is very favourable.     About the team: Your immediate squad is a tightknit squad of 5 reporting into a Senior Manager. The team has Software/Data Engineering capability as well as Data Science. You will learn data science techniques in this position and engineering so there are some really great skills to learn in a sought after sector. The business itself is not purely investments so you will also learn other areas of the market but investments will be your primary focus.    About the manager and culture: You will have a great manager who excels in people leadership and stakeholder influence. Very strong knowledge of the investments sector and solid technical skills so if Investments is an area that interests you but you don't have the experience yet it really is a great opportunity to get your foot in the door.  The team includes diverse backgrounds and other passionate data professionals.  The company is big and has some normal 'big company issues' but these issues don't impact the investments division which is newer and free of the restraints in a big org.   Location: The office is in Melbourne CBD  but hybrid or potentially remote work in Victoria is fine.   Salary: $125K-$155K base + super  depending on your experience  I do have other Data Analyst and Data Science positions which leverage similar skill sets but are in different industries and focus though statistical modelling is a must for most. Please APPLY to this role or email james.eichhorn@talentinsights.com.au to learn more about this role or others.

Title: Project Analyst - Data

If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us  please apply. We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity  equity and inclusion. About Macquarie  A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills  explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition  helping sustain global food supplies  financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. With 17 000+ employees and offices in 33 markets around the world  we’re a truly global organisation.  You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives  ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us  you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.  Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management  retail and business banking  wealth management  leasing and asset financing  market access  commodity trading  renewables development  specialist advisory  capital raising and principal investment. Title: Data Engineer

As "Architects of Positive Futures"  Capgemini actively supports the community in 3 ways:  Diversity and Inclusion - we believe diversity of thought fuels excellence and innovation  which is why we positively encourage applications from suitably qualified candidates regardless of their gender identity  ethnicity  sexual orientation  religion  ability  intersex status or age. Title: Senior Data Analyst
Requirements: As a Senior Data Analyst  you will play a key role in working with customers to understand their business requirements  map these to their data capabilities  liaise with our internal Data Engineers to design and build elegant solutions  then partner with our customers to deploy those solutions in a way that allows them to turn data into insight. You will have 5-6 years’ experience working as a Data Analyst (or similar role) on data-related solutions  preferably using AWS  and will be comfortable working with business analysts  data visualisers  data engineers and data scientists  to enable customers to solve their data-related challenges.  You will relish the opportunity to innovate  evolve and challenge existing assumptions and to develop the data-related requirements that feed into the design of solutions that solve real-world problems for customers. Your experience with large-scale data challenges and ability to analyse them as input into reliable  scalable cloud-based solutions  will see you thriving in this role!  Expectations  Enjoy honing your data-related analysis skills and developing new ones  so you can make strong contributions to solution discussions. Regularly take part in further education and training to help you hone and extend your data analysis skills. Have a demonstrated ability to think strategically about solutions to business  product  and technical challenges. Possess an innate awareness of technology trends and how they impact the way businesses consume IT. Strong Analytics skills to collect  analyze and generate insight using data. Have a basic understanding of IT security and governance including security standards  access policies  and data classification schema. Love what you do and instinctively know how to make work fun. Be dynamic  creative  and willing to take on challenges that have the potential to make a big impact. Relish a ground floor opportunity to work in a small  agile  friendly startup environment. A Graduate degree (or Masters) in a data or technology-related discipline is preferred. An AWS Associate Solutions Architect certification is a bonus.     Qualifications  5+ years of:  o Hands on  practical experience  in and around data-related solutions  o AWS experience  o A basic understanding of software development tools and methodologies  o Data analysis experience  o Experience producing quality documentation and written communications  Familiarity with DevOps tools such as Bitbucket  Bamboo  Jenkins or Ansible Some experience with both writing and interpreting SQL queries. Experience building reports and dashboards using BI tools such as Tableau  PowerBI or Amazon QuickSight. A basic understanding of Infrastructure as Code  especially AWS Cloudformation. Some programming skills in one or more of the following languages: Python  Java  Node.js  .Net  PHP. A basic understanding of data ingestion and transformation pipelines. A basic understanding of fundamental data concepts including databases  data schema  data classification  data security  data governance  data analysis  data transformation  data engineering and data science. A basic understanding of fundamental networking concepts. Leadership Requirements:  5+ years of:  o Building and leading a small to medium-sized team of technology professionals  o Interfacing with the customer and handling customer objections  o Ability to provide leadership to Junior and mid-level data analysts  o Ability to present technical concepts to customers  o Comfortable with proactively representing TDF in external communities (meetups  user groups  technical forums etc)    Additional Information  We’re passionate about the technical community we are a part of  and believe in contributing to open source and AWS initiatives We care about climate change and are always looking at ways to reduce our carbon footprint We support and contribute to a different cause each quarter We’re committed to developing your career with customised individual growth and development plans We’re committed to ensuring all our staff feel welcome  included and respected every day they work for The Data Foundry

Title: Senior/Principal Biostatistician
Requirements: Job Description  Senior/Principal Biostatistician - Home based anywhere in Australia. $15 000 sign on bonus  PPD’s mission is to improve health. It starts as an idea to find a cure. It becomes a life saved. All in-between  it’s you! We know that meaningful results not only require the right approach  but also the right people. We invite you to re-imagine health promoting protocols with us  working alongside our talented  bright and energetic teams.  We are passionate about being data and technically agile and driving enhanced value for our clients and patients. Determined to improve patient health  we help PPD provide industry-leading statistical  programming and clinical pharmacology contributions through global delivery  consistent quality adherence and scientific insight.  In this role  you will serve as a subject matter expert and lead in providing statistical  process and regulatory knowledge to the department. Acts as the senior reviewer on simple or moderately complex projects  and with additional oversight as needed on complex or highly complex studies.  At PPD we hire the best  develop ourselves and each other  and recognize the power of being one team. We offer continued career advancement opportunities  award winning training and benefits focused on the health and wellbeing of our employees.  Summarized Purpose  Serves as a subject matter expert and lead in providing statistical  process and regulatory knowledge to the department. Acts as the senior reviewer on simple or moderately complex projects  and with additional oversight as needed on complex or highly complex studies. Acts as a project manager  overseeing the statistical and programming aspects of clinical trials from design  through analysis and reporting  acting as the lead statistician on multiple projects. Represents the department within the company and with interactions with client companies and regulatory agencies  on simple to complex study design matters  directly contributing to complex study proposals and bids  representing the department at bid defenses. Organizes teams and implements strategies to ensure process and programming efficiencies on complex studies.  Essential Functions:  Provides expert knowledge within the department on statistical and regulatory issues  mentors members of the department and provides project guidance and statistical advice. Provides expert knowledge and experience of complex trials design across different therapeutic areas.  Provides expertise in the development and delivery of training material  and the implementation of departmental procedures for the team. Contributes to process improvement and departmental initiatives.  Serves as senior reviewer on simple or moderately complex studies as assigned with minimal oversight  and on more complex studies as assigned with supervision as needed.  Serves as a lead statistician on multiple projects and leads project teams for multiple protocols. Conducts team meetings  maintains project timelines  assesses resource need  provides resources  and budget management. Ensures that SOPs are being followed and that appropriate project documentation is ongoing. Provides management with timely  accurate status and resourcing reports. Allocates and coordinates resources within the team to achieve timelines  time management of own and team's time spent on projects.  Interacts with the sponsor on statistical aspects of the project and present at meetings as required.  Produces sample size calculations. Provides input into study design and statistical considerations  during protocol development. Review protocols for completeness  appropriateness of clinical design and sound statistical analysis. Contributes to writing appropriate protocol sections.  Leads the development and review of statistical analysis plans  including table  listing and graph specifications. Organizes the production of statistical analyses and statistical appendices  with appropriate documentation. Ensures that appropriate validation for statistical analyses and statistical appendices is implemented.  Specifies the general structure of the analysis database  oversees its development  and ensures completeness for use in all programming.  Oversees the preparation and quality review of statistical reports  integrated summaries of safety  integrated summaries of efficacy and other documents  as required. Contributes statistical methods section for integrated clinical statistical reports.  Provides input to management as to hiring recommendations  department policies  and resourcing requirements.  Acts as the representative of the department to other divisions.  Assists in bidding and business development activities  as required.  Job Qualification  Education and Experience:  Previous experience that provides the knowledge  skills  and abilities to perform the job (comparable to 6+ years’). Master's degree in statistics  biostatistics  mathematics or related field  Extensive experience of statistics in a clinical trial environment. Evidence of providing expert statistical input in previous positions and presenting at statistical conferences would be an advantage.  In some cases an equivalency  consisting of a combination of appropriate education  training and/or directly related experience  will be considered sufficient for an individual to meet the requirements of the role.  Knowledge  Skills And Abilities  Excellent understanding of the statistical principles underlying clinical trials  Excellent statistical skills  Excellent understanding of the regulatory issues associated with the reporting of clinical data in the submission process  Great consultative skills  Outstanding SAS® programming skills and familiarity of other statistical packages (eg StatXact  Nquery) and understanding of database structures  Excellent organizational  time management  and planning skills to create and follow timelines  conduct long-range planning  adapt to changing priorities and handle multiple projects  Capable of adapting and adjusting to changing priorities  Excellent written and verbal communication skills  including proficiency in the English language  Capable of working in a multi-disciplinary team setting  Demonstrated initiative  motivation and problem-solving skills  Positive attitude and the ability to organise a team and work well with others  Good mentoring skills as shown by leadership of multiple projects and team members  Working Environment  PPD values the health and wellbeing of our employees. We support and encourage individuals to create a healthy and balanced environment where they can thrive. Below is listed the working environment/requirements for this role:  Able to communicate  receive  and understand information and ideas with diverse groups of people in a comprehensible and reasonable manner.  Able to work upright and stationary for typical working hours.  Ability to use and learn standard office equipment and technology with proficiency.  Able to perform successfully under pressure while prioritizing and handling multiple projects or activities.  May require travel. (Recruiter will provide more details.)  PPD Defining Principles  We have a strong will to win - We earn our customer’s trust - We are gamechangers - We do the right thing - We are one PPD -  If you resonate with our five principles above  and ultimately wish to accelerate the delivery of safe and effective therapeutics for some of the world’s most urgent health needs  then please submit your application – we’d love to hear from you!

Title: DATA ANALYST / ACCOUNTS RECEIVABLE
Requirements: With a fleet of 43 aircraft and growing  Chartair is one of Australia’s leading general aviation companies. We serve some of the most remote communities in the country and operate out of two main bases in Darwin and Alice Springs. This role potentially could be full time or part-time depending on the suitability of the individual. This position will be based in Darwin.  JOB TASKS AND RESPONSIBILITIES ABOUT THE PERSON The person needs to be a team player not only within finance but able to collaborate between departments within the company and externally. The person will be logical  technical and able to think laterally. Ideally have a broad accounting knowledge with a strong emphasis on Data Analysis and Cash Management. You'll have excellent communication skills  proficient and professional with a friendly approach to debtors to maintain a strong rapport.  CORE COMPETENCIES  Data Analytics – able to manipulate and extrapolate varying datasets. Comfortable using Marcos (Editing and creating will be mandatory). Invoicing – understanding and experience in producing invoices from various systems. Ability to import and export data using excel manipulation methodology. Previous experience with Sales contract processes is an advantage. Customer queries – This is where you will need your people skills. Ensuring all correspondence and issues in relation to customer requests are dealt with immediately and concisely. Good understanding of credit control parameters  and ability to refine and ensure credit terms are maintained. Meeting strict deadlines as part of month-end – Bank reconciliations  BAS  Provisions & other accounting deliverables. SKILLS & EXPERIENCE  Excellent attention to detail and not afraid to question the status quo Sound intermediate / advanced Excel experience MYOB experience Worked within the aviation sector will be a distinct advantage.  Salary will be negotiated based on experience. All applicants must be Australian Citizens and/or hold full working rights in Australia and be able to hold an ASIC. Interested applicants are encouraged to submit their application or interest along with their resume via the below website online form before 29/04/2022.

Title: Data Analyst - Marketing and Client Analytics
Requirements: Join a diverse and high performing team with flexible working arrangements Be part of a team and culture that values people Grow your career with a leading wealth management organisation  Insignia Financial is one of Australia’s leading Wealth Management organisations  undertaking a rapid and exciting transformation. We are a strong and resilient business and despite the current climate  are investing in supporting our people to onboard and connect them remotely. It is in this context that we are looking for a Client Analytics Consultant.  The Role  As a Client Analytics Consultant reporting to the Head of Client Analytics you will be responsible for detailed data analysis  responding to inquiries  and design and implementation of bespoke reporting.  Key Responsibilities Apply predicative analytics to predict client behaviour and outcomes Provide data driven insights and support strategic decision making across Marketing  Product and Distribution Conduct pre-campaign analytics to help shape business strategy and targeting opportunities Recommend appropriate courses of action and present analytical findings Develop improved analysis approaches and test and learn frameworks Clean and transform client data from registry and other source systems Build predictive and propensity  path analysis and attribution models Perform deep-dive analytics to improve understanding of our customers  To Be Successful In This Role You Will Possess Relevant tertiary and qualifications in a quantitative or comparable field Extensive experience in an analytics role with proven successes in the execution of data analytics initiatives Stakeholder management and ability to communicate the results of analyses and data visualisation Proactive and highly analytical and strategic approach to client management and business growth Highly proficient in SQL  R and/or Python languages Manage and process complex  large data for analysis (e.g.  hierarchies of datasets  inter-relationships  partitions  views  etc.) Experienced with statistical modelling and forecasting approaches and market analysis tools and techniques  Benefits In return  we offer development opportunities at an ASX top 200 company A professional  supportive  and friendly culture A range of corporate and lifestyle benefits  The Business  Insignia Financial is one of Australia’s leading wealth management organisations  undertaking a rapid and exciting transformation. The Insignia Financial group has been helping Australians secure their future since 1846. During that time  we have grown substantially to become a leading provider of quality financial services. We now manage and administer more than $200 billion of client monies and are listed on the Australian Securities Exchange in the ASX top 200 (ASX:IFL).  To Apply  Please submit your resume with a covering letter by clicking on “Apply Now.”  Applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in Australia  and at a minimum be required to undertake police and basic credit checks as a condition of employment.  Please note that applications from agencies will not be considered at this time.  Insignia Financial is an inclusive and equal opportunity employer. We encourage applications regardless of race  ethnicity  age  religion  gender  national origin  disability status  or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an adjustment during the application process because of a disability  it is available upon request.  Insignia Financial is conscious of our WHS obligations and is committed to providing a safe workplace for everyone. As such  we require all new employees to be able to comply with our National COVID-19 Vaccination Policy. We will gladly and openly discuss this with you during the recruitment process if you wish.  Please be aware that Insignia Financial is currently undergoing an Organisational Design process  which may impact future organisational structure.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Credit Risk
Requirements: It takes a dedicated team of specialists to accurately analyse and model the potential risks and opportunities in a business like ours. People with the passion and expertise to truly understand and explain how complex data will shape tomorrow’s business landscape for us. So if you’d like to take on a highly visible  varied and challenging role that’s key to our business success  join us in driving the future of financial services.  Our Credit Risk team is looking for a Senior Credit Risk Analyst who will be responsible for the development and monitoring of credit risk across Australia and New Zealand. Reporting to the Head of Credit Risk  this full-time permanent role is based in the Mulgrave office (south eastern suburbs).    What awaits you?  You will be responsible for risk analytics  including the development and maintenance of credit risk calculation models. You will produce monthly reporting of portfolio performance and present to senior management and executive committees to highlight key focus areas. You will be responsible for monitoring the effectiveness of retail credit scorecards in line with agreed risk tolerance levels. You will be responsible for ongoing enhancement of automated credit decisioning systems and strategies. You will risk manage internal projects  including legal and regulatory compliance changes. You will be responsible for implementation and compliance with BMW Group credit risk management guidelines  as well as local regulatory code. You will perform second line control reviews to ensure adherence to policy within the organisation.    Desired Skills and Experience Qualifications & Experience Bachelor’s Degree in Business / Accounting / Economics / Statistics or similar discipline Several years of experience in the financial services industry  preferably with experience in the area of Credit Risk and/or Data Analytics Knowledge of automotive finance industry and understanding of the National Consumer Credit Protection code highly regarded Strong analytical skills  proficiency in SAS  SQL or Tableau highly regarded Excellent communication skills – both written and verbal What do we offer? Attractive remuneration Flexible Work policy and practices Health & Wellbeing initiatives Lifelong learning & career development BMW & Mini promotions and product offers Annual spend on BMW & MINI merchandise Free onsite parking Onsite café Subsidised onsite gym  dry cleaning and car wash facilities A dynamic  inclusive and sustainable working environment BMW Group is an equal opportunities employer and takes great pride in fostering and promoting diversity in every aspect of our work life and culture. We highly regard the skills  knowledge  experience  ideas  perspective and energy our diverse workforce brings into the company. Employment at BMW Group Australia is conditional upon pre-employment checks undertaken by the candidate on request and clearances received. This includes qualifications and employment checks  relevant background checks and may include police check(s) and credit check(s). By submitting an application for a role at BMW Group Australia the candidate confirms: They have valid rights to work in Australia They agree to undertake integrity checks upon request should their candidacy progress to an offer of employment.

Title: Reporting / BI Consultant
Requirements: BI/Reporting Consultants  Rate: $600-850 per day including super/excluding GST  Duration: 6 months+  Start: ASAP - 2 weeks  Location: remote (ideally Sydney / Melbourne / Brisbane)  Role(s)  Our client is seeking strong and experienced Reporting/BI Consultants to help with delivery of a new project.  Responsibilities Part of a team  collect and validate report requirements for developing new reports and changing existing reports using an agile sprint based approach. Research and develop business rules in Microsoft SQL or DAX query languages to select  filter and organise reporting data. Develop queries of Microsoft SQL tabular databases and render data into Power BI dashboards and reports Required Experience MS SQL Power BI Skills Python Please submit your CV asap and I will get back to you with more details if suitable. PLEASE NOTE THAT TO BE CONSIDERED FOR THIS ROLE YOU MUST BE BASED IN AUSTRALIA**

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Requirements: At Canva  our mission is to empower the world to design  and we’re looking for insightful BI Analysts who can help us make that happen.  Our product has grown enormously in the last few years. We now have 10s of millions of users generating huge quantities of data every single day. To help us fuel our future growth  we need to better understand our data - this is where we need your help.  Your role will be to work with product/business managers  marketers  and data scientists  as well as data analysts and analytics engineers to build and own a suite of data models  reports  metrics  and dashboards for an area of the product/business. These artefacts are a critical part of Canva’s continued success and hyper-growth  so you’ll need to be organised and self-motivated. Succeeding at this role will require excellent written and verbal communication  as well as empathy and the ability to make complex things simple.  You’ll be coming into a diverse team of more than thirty people  who really do enjoy finding answers to the problems that the business and our users have. We’re looking forward to continuing to grow our team and gaining a range of new perspectives and ideas on how we can achieve our goals and empower the world to design.  Role Responsibilities Become an expert on your area of the business and develop the analytics  data models  dashboards  and reporting relating to it Work with stakeholders to ensure that they understand their part of the product and how it is performing Find insights that suggest future directions and improvements in the product Analyse A/B tests and other experiments to optimise the product and steer it in the right direction Work with Analytics Engineers to ensure that our data warehouse is up-to-date and error-free Extend data literacy and curiosity throughout the whole company through education projects  Required Skills & Experience Strong competency with SQL and experience with data warehouses such as Snowflake  Redshift  or BigQuery Strong communication skills - verbal and written - be able to break down complex topics into simple solutions and ideas Experience using Looker  Amplitude  Tableau  PowerBI or similar BI/data visualization tools Comfortable working with stakeholders to build up accurate reports on their areas of the business Experience with A/B testing and experiment analysis is a plus Experience with very large data sets is a plus Any prior experience with creative data visualisation or design is also valuable  Benefits Competitive salary  plus equity options Flexible working hours  we value work-life balance In-house chefs that cook delicious breakfast and lunch for us each day Gym and yoga facilities onsite Generous parental leave policy Pet friendly offices including a social are  unisex toilets Sponsored social clubs and team events Fun and quirky celebrations Relocation budget provided and visa application fees covered  One of our core values at Canva  “Being a force for good” means we are actively working towards a world that isn't just good for a small few  but one that’s good for everyone. We believe deeply that bringing together diversity of thoughts  perspectives and expression is key for building the best product for our equally diverse community. To achieve this  we need to constantly work towards making Canva the best place to work  for everyone.  We are looking for people who love technology and can bring creativity when solving challenging problems. We ensure that the Canva workspace is setup for you to do your best work and have a great time doing so. Do you know we have a chef  Song and Chris  that make fantastic lunches for the team? Follow them on Instagram here to see what has been whipped up today: https://www.instagram.com/canvalife/.
