Title: Mapping & Data Enterprise Analyst
Requirements: Posted by Arlene Taylor Recruitment Coordinator at Pilbara Ports Authority Send InMail Salary from $105 221 pa + 13% Superannuation Based in Perth Full and Part Time Hours Considered  The Role  This is a great opportunity to be part of the world’s largest bulk export port authority  where you will be responsible for providing specialist data management  spatial analysis and cartographic services across PPA in support of the management of enterprise GIS systems.  Where an applicant is seeking part-time hours or greater flexibility  a job share arrangement may be considered.  About You  This role will suit you if you enjoy diversity and connect with PPA's values of Excellence  Respect  Integrity  Care and Courage. Your understanding of data management and governance principles as well as your previous experience working with enterprise GIS systems and your ability to create mapping products and capture spatial information for the improvement of data management will contribute to your success in the role. You will be the type of person who is willing to develop and learn new systems and technologies and enjoys working as part of a team to build productive relationships across the organisation.  The Benefits  If successful you will be rewarded with a range of benefits which include: 13% superannuation 4 weeks annual leave Access to training and development opportunities Corporate uniform Access to wellbeing benefits and more  If this position appeals to you  please upload your resume along with a letter that tells us why you are the right person for the role.  You can find a full job description on our webpage.  For further information please contact Leila Ammar on 08 6217 7141.  PPA is committed to providing an environment of diversity and inclusion and is a strong supporter of training and professional development.  Applications close on 25 April 2022.

Title: Cloud Engineer - Data Insight Analytics
Requirements: Job Summary  DESCRIPTION  Amazon Web Services is the market leader and technology forerunner in the Cloud business. As a member of the AWS Support team you will be at the forefront of this transformational technology  assisting a global list of companies and developers that are taking advantage of a growing set of services and features to run their mission-critical applications. As a Cloud Support Engineer  you will act as the ‘Cloud Ambassador’ across all the cloud products  arming our customers with required tools & tactics to get the most out of their Product and Support investment.  Would you like to use the latest cloud computing technologies? Do you have an interest in helping customers understand application architectures and integration approaches? Are you familiar with best practices for applications  servers and networks? Do you want to be part of a customer facing technology team helping to ensure the success of Amazon Web Services (AWS) as a leading technology organization?  If you fit the description  you might be the person we are looking for! We are a group of smart people  passionate about cloud computing  and believe that world class support is critical to customer success.  WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT FROM A LIFE AT AWS?  Every day will bring new and exciting challenges on the job while you: Learn and use groundbreaking technologies. Apply advanced troubleshooting techniques to provide unique solutions to our customers' individual needs. Interact with leading engineers around the world. Partner with Amazon Web Services teams to help reproduce and resolve customer issues. Leverage your extensive customer support experience to provide feedback to internal AWS teams on how to improve our services. Drive customer communication during critical events. Drive projects that improve support-related processes and our customers’ technical support experience. Write tutorials  how-to videos  and other technical articles for the developer community. Work on critical  highly complex customer problems that may span multiple AWS services. WHY AWS SUPPORT? First and foremost this is a customer support role – in The Cloud. On a typical day  a Support Engineer will be primarily responsible for solving customer’s cases through a variety of customer contact channels which include telephone  email  and web/live chat. You will apply advanced troubleshooting techniques to provide tailored solutions for our customers and drive customer interactions by thoughtfully working with customers to dive deep into the root cause of an issue. Apart from working on a broad spectrum of technical issues  an AWS Support Engineer may also coach/mentor new hires  develop & present training  partner with development teams on complex issues or contact deflection initiatives  participate in new hiring  write tools/script to help the team  or work with leadership on process improvement and strategic initiatives. Career development: We promote advancement opportunities across the organization to help you meet your career goals. Training: We have training programs to help you develop the skills required to be successful in your role. We hire smart people who are keen to build a career with AWS  so we are more interested in the areas that you do know instead of those you haven’t been exposed to yet. Support engineers interested in travel have presented training or participated in focused summits across our sites or at specific AWS events. As we operate on follow-the-sun model  you may be required to work a staggered week  either Sun-Thu or Tue-Sat (no on-call). https://youtu.be/GC3bWcFFZTo   Basic Qualifications  This Analytics role supports our services that focus on Analytics technologies that allow customers to extract insights from their data such as Redshift  QuickSight and Neptune. Exposure to Database Fundamentals and General Troubleshooting (tuning and optimization  deadlocks  keys  normalization) in any Relational Database Engines (MySQL  PostgreSQL  Oracle  SQLServer) Familiar with data warehousing and ETL process Experience in Business Analytics application  support  and troubleshooting concepts Experience with System Administration and troubleshooting with Linux (Ubuntu  CentOS  RedHat) and/or Microsoft Windows Server and associated technologies (Active Directory) Experience with Networking and troubleshooting (TCP/IP  DNS  OSI model  routing  switching  firewalls  LAN/WAN  traceroute  iperf  dig  cURL or related) Bachelor’s degree in Information Science / Information Technology  Data Science  Computer Science  Engineering  Mathematics  Physics  or a related field OR equivalent experience in a technical position Preferred Qualifications Experience in a customer support environment Experience analyzing  troubleshooting  and providing solutions to technical issues Understanding of Cloud Computing concepts Experience scripting or developing in at least one of the following languages : Python  R  Ruby  GO  Java  .NET (C#)  JavaScript  Company - AWS Australia Pty Ltd  Job ID: A1859216

Title: Graduate Quantitative Researcher
Requirements: What you'll do as a Graduate Quantitative Researcher at Akuna:  Our Quantitative Team are a mixture of mathematicians  statisticians and technologists that find solutions to problems. We create trading models and strategies scientifically by combining our quantitative expertise with an understanding of derivatives and financial markets. We are seeking graduates to join the team to apply their quantitative skills to exciting problem. You don't need a background in finance or trading  instead we look for maths and coding skills.  Our Quantitative Researchers work closely with our developers and traders to analyse and predict all facets of derivative pricing and develop trading strategies using statistical and machine learning algorithms. They create  conduct  and analyse experiments to develop a deep understanding of derivatives and financial markets  test solutions using historical parameters and market data  and perform extensive data analysis to directly improve our trading strategies  design and implement optimisation algorithms for portfolio construction  and advances existing initiatives to explore opportunities for new research topics.  If this sounds interesting to you  apply now! We are looking for people who have innovative ideas  think analytically  and have an entrepreneurial mindset and want to make an immediate impact in our growing company and contribute to Akuna's strategy portfolio.  Start dates: February 2022- Mid 2023  Training: We always have new projects and look to bring on our juniors all throughout the year. As a junior  you will be paired with a mentor to work together on your first project  and we offer extensive training opportunities to learn about market making  our systems  and financial theories such as Options Greeks and Black Scholes methods.  Requirements for this role: Australian or NZ citizen or Australian Permanent residences only University Degree: graduated anytime in the last 3 years or finished your studies by Dec 2022 An understanding of statistics and machine learning Basic programming skills in Python or C++ Strong maths skills: able to apply concepts of probability  calculus and linear algebra Strong verbal and written communication skills Ability to run a project in a fast paced  team environment Financial experience or studies are NOT a requirement  Qualities that make great candidates: Bachelor  Honours  Masters or PhDs in Statistics  Mathematics  Physics  Computer Science  Engineering  or related degrees Distinction Average & proven strong academics Awards  prizes  medals  competitions  & scholarships Experience in research within an academic or professional environment Achievements outside of studies through your hobbies & interests  About Akuna:  Akuna Capital is an innovative trading firm with a strong focus on collaboration  cutting-edge technology  data driven solutions and automation. We specialise in providing liquidity as an options market maker – meaning we are committed to providing competitive quotes that we are willing to both buy and sell. To do this successfully we design and implement our own low latency technologies  trading strategies and mathematical models. At Akuna we have a flat structure  where the best idea wins.  Our Founding Partners  including our CEO Andrew Killion  first conceptualised Akuna in their hometown of Sydney. They opened our first office in 2011 in Chicago  the heart of the derivatives & options industry. Akuna then expanded to Sydney in 2018 to be the centre of our Asian trading operations. We are currently trading HK  Korea  cryptocurrencies and US night markets and are excited for expansions into all the major Asian exchanges. We also have offices in Shanghai and Boston.  At Akuna  we believe that the people are the centre of everything we do. Our Sydney office has a start-up feel with around 200 people  which means you really get to know the team! We run social poker competitions  office happy hours  have a fully stacked breakfast and snack room  host social events  go on company trips  have social clubs  and offer great training with our Akuna University. We are expanding rapidly and looking for the best talent to join us on this journey. If you enjoy being part of smart  driven teams with real challenges to solve- this could be the place for you!

Title: Data Transfer and Support Analyst level 2 (TSPV)
Requirements: Job title : Data Transfer and Support Analyst level 2 (TSPV) Contract type : Location : Canberra Sectors :  Salary : Competitive Start date : 2022-01-20 Duration : 24.0 MONTH Job Reference : V-40646 Contact name : Kate Kornsasi Contact email : Job published : 3 months ago  The Data Transfer and Support Analyst is required to provide ICT Customer Support and manual data transfers between ICT systems and clients. The Data Transfer and Support Analyst will attend to service requests and fault reports received from customers via telephone  email  in-person  or through the service request catalogue.  Regular engagement with customers is required to prioritise and deliver requests  and provide status updates.  Skills And Knowledge Demonstrated experience in Customer Service Delivery and Service Desk Operations with strong customer service focus. A good understanding of ICT systems  services  processes and associated policies. Completed the ITIL Foundation certificate or have a working knowledge of the service management principles and practices. Major Responsibilities Undertake client data transfer requests and process them within agreed timeframes. Report any issues identified during the processing of data transfers to the First Level Support Duty Analyst and the customers in a timely and efficient manner. Manage data transfer records by registering the media in the Records Management System and updating the records when disposing of the media. Work collaboratively with other analysts to coordinate the transfer of data and ensure the timely completion of requests. Location and Contract Term: The role is based in Canberra. Contract terms: between 12 and 24 months will be considered.  SFIA security level required: The Specified Person will be expected to demonstrate attributes of SFIA Level of Responsibility 2.  Security Requirements: Current Top-Secret Positive Vetting (TSPV) security clearance is strongly preferred  however candidates who have held a TSPV in the previous 12-month period (which has since been downgraded) may be considered.  How To Apply  Please upload your resume to apply. Please note you will need to complete selection criteria to complete this application process. We will be in touch with instructions for suitably skilled candidates.  Applications open until 09 February 2022 or until position is filled.  Call Kate 0480 002 456 for any further information.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Requirements: You will be working in a tight-knit analytics team in a startup environment experiencing explosive growth  you will be working on surfacing insight in our consumer healthcare businesses Pilot  Kin  Software and Normal.  The overarching goal of the Data Analytics team is to  Ensure the efficient allocation of capital in every aspect of the business - this means surfacing the relevant information to the relevant people at the relevant time to increase the quality of decision making As a Senior Data Analyst at Eucalyptus you should:  Be interested in thinking about the data required to answer business questions from various stakeholders. Be resourceful in how you procure and transform that information. Have the ability to communicate the findings (if any). Be a key architectural voice in designing and building a scalable business processes for a multi-asset multi-brand platform. Be interested in formulating questions that tackle large problems and then break down those problems into their component parts (consulting skillset). Work closely with product and design  as well as marketing  content  and operations to develop the best information processes. Experience required  Need to have work rights in Australia and available for work in Sydney Recent experience in predictive analytics Recent and extensive experience in analysing and transforming data Excel  Python  R  PostgreSQL. Recent and extensive experience in visualizing and presenting findings Tableau  Data Studio  Metabase  Javascript Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Experience with building reusable components across multiple applications and code bases Ideally 3+ years experience in a similar role  Additional Information  Why join Eucalyptus?  We’ve grown from 0 to 200 000 patients We’ve grown from 0 to 5 brands We’ve grown from 4 to 200 people  All in just 3 years!  We are building the future of accessible  patient-centric healthcare right here in Australia and we want you to be part of this generational story!  We are backed by some of the best VCs in the world and Blackbird  who invested in us  put us among the fastest-growing companies they have ever funded.  What do we do  exactly?  Our mission is to build the future of healthcare and help people live longer  healthier lives.  We have built a bespoke technology platform to deliver healthcare to Australians with a level of care and depth that brings healthcare into the internet age and we are just getting started.  We work with doctors  specialists  pharmacists  and medical professionals from all over the country  and our brands (Pilot  Kin  Software  Normal  and Juniper) speak to different people at different stages of their life and needs. For example  our most recent brand  Juniper  is changing the conversation around menopause.  How do we work?  Things move quickly here.  We like to set goals with the mindset that if we hit them all we haven’t challenged ourselves enough. You’ll be surrounded by a world-class team of thinkers  designers  engineers and leaders who are obsessed with three things:  The health and wellbeing of the average person  Creating personalised  engaging  convenient user-experiences  Making healthcare fun and interesting (because it is)  We are experienced business builders  our roots and talent run deep in the DTC and technology space. We believe too many chefs spoil the broth and people are given the freedom to make decisions (and mistakes)  and learn from the journey. Ultimately  we believe ideas are cheap and great execution is more important than anything.  Why you'll thrive here  Here are the highlights:  Come and experience the growth at one of the fastest growing startups (LinkedIn #5 fastest growing startups in Australia) while we are still small (~200 people).  Push yourself with challenges that are world-first  unique and exhilarating.  See the meaningful impact of your work on over tens of thousands of actual users (check out the customers that love us!)  Learn from some of Australia’s best marketers  engineers  creatives  operations specialists  and medical professionals - joining a diverse team from Atlassian  Canva  Google  Koala  McKinsey  Bain  BuzzFeed  Optiver  Halter and many many more.  A share in the company (equity)  so you are rewarded for your best work.  And also it goes without saying: flexible location work arrangements  WFH allowances  parental leave  gym benefits  employee discounts  social clubs sponsorships  uncapped learning and development budgets for all of our staff.  Life is too short to not be curious

Title: Data Business Analyst
Requirements: This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more Job Type: Full-time  Salary: $70 000.00 to $120 000.00 /year  Location: Office location will be determined dependant on the right applicant  as we have offices based in Sydney  Melbourne  Adelaide  Perth and Brisbane.  About The Role  We are looking for a BA who has demonstrated experience in business and data analysis alongside project delivery. You’ll be confident working across functional teams and will be able to join our team on a Full-time basis within one of our agencies.  As a Business Analyst  you are responsible for leading the written recommendations and documentation required throughout the project lifecycle working closely with Clients and our Project Management Office  Technical Development  Design and User Experience teams.  Who are we looking for? 2 years agency experience High attention to detail Confidence in presenting to wide range of Stakeholders. Title: Business Intelligence Specialist
Requirements: Posted by Jessica Harwood Talent Director @ Overdose. APAC Send InMail Our Story Overdose is a NZ born  global success story. Over the past 5 years we have grown from 2 consultants to a team of 450+ and counting  with offices across New Zealand  Australia  Ukraine  Singapore  Europe and the US. Our services cover the entire commerce lifecycle  from Strategy  Business Design  Creative and UX  through to Platform Architecture  Technical Execution  Performance Marketing  Data Insights and Automation.  We take a firm "no BS" approach to business  and pride ourselves on delivering fit-for-purpose solutions  with positive RoI for our clients  and a belief structure based around creating mutual value. We refer to ourselves as "digital business accelerators"  and operate primarily as partners  rather than suppliers.  We are currently partnered with premier retail clients the likes of Blundstone  Patagonia  Beacon Lighting  Goodyear  Tupperware  WelleCo  French Connection  Wilson  Globe Brands  KeepCup and much more... to which you will be exposed and grow alongside!  Position Summary The Business Intelligence (BI) Specialist at Overdose (OD) is responsible for helping clients uncover invaluable insight through use of data. This position requires you to be experienced with ETL processes  data pipelines  data-warehouse environments and visualisation tools. Like every role at Overdose  this is a hands-on role involving planning as well as execution. This is a rare opportunity to work with an exceptional team and influence some of the biggest brands globally.  Roles & Responsibilities As BI Specialist you will : Deliver economic value to OD’s clients through meaningful and growth focussed data initiatives. Understand client’s pain points  business questions and ideate how they can be answered through data. Plan and deliver solutions spanning from ETL / ELT approach  integrations  monitoring  alerting  visualisation and client handovers. Proactively recommend new opportunities  ideas and directions that can fuel growth through data & insight. Be actively involved in the evaluation and piloting of new tools that evolve the data offering at Overdose. Contribute to client proposals as and when necessary & support internal teams (Client Success  Marketing  SEO  Design teams) on ongoing data issues and questions. Establish strong client and internal relationships built on trust.  Essential Skills Experience working with SQL based implementations and comfort operating in data-warehouse environments such as Google BigQuery or similar. Experience leveraging the various components of Google Cloud Platform (Such as Cloud storage  Cloud Functions  App Engine  etc.) to build scalable and sustainable data solutions. Ability to write functions in Python as required. (or similar) Ability to work with APIs to extract data from sources where ready connectors may not exist. Ability to convey insights effectively through visualisations in BI tools (Google Data Studio  Power BI  Tableau etc.) Experience using data pipeline tools such as Stitch  Supermetrics  Hevo  Stitch  Funnel or similar. Basic understanding of Google Analytics and data from marketing platforms such as Facebook / Instagram Ads  Google Ads  Google Search Console Basic understanding of Javascript  HTML and CSS. Exceptional analytical and problem solving skills. Ability to work autonomously and as part of a team. Ability to manage multiple tasks  and adhere to time pressures and deadlines.  Perks and Benefits Annual 13th-month performance bonus Flexible working arrangements and hours Annual training allowance Two additional mental health days off per year The chance learn from some of the best digital leaders all around the world Free day off to celebrate your birthday month Ability to continue your learning and development though globally recognised courses Supported Global Work Secondments & Transfers Great humans to work alongside everyday  Please Note Only candidates with the legal right to live and work in Australia or NZ (and currently residing in Australia or NZ) will be considered. This role is open to candidates located in Australia or New Zealand with hybrid or remote working arrangements available. No recruitment agencies  please.

Title: Business & Data Analyst  Clerk Grade 7/8
Requirements: This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more Business and Data Analyst  Department of Communities & Justice  Corrective Services NSW Clerk Grade 7/8 Temporary Full-time role until 30 June 2023 Be a part of Corrective Services NSW  (Corrections Strategy & Policy Unit) Location: Sydney CBD and work from home flexibility with scope for regional location About Us  The Department of Communities and Justice (DCJ) works to support access to justice  to help families  and to promote early intervention and inclusion  in order to provide benefits for the whole community.  Corrective Services NSW (CSNSW) delivers professional correctional services and programs to reduce the risk of re-offending and enhance public safety. It serves a key function of the NSW Communities and Justice Sector by providing effective  safe and humane management of offenders both in custody and in the community CSNSW also works in partnership with other government and community agencies to ensure that offenders and their families are supported.  About The Role  This role will work within the Reducing Reoffending Program Management Office  specifically on projects relating to enhancing technology capabilities within correctional centres to transform prisoner rehabilitation. The role will focus on analysis of CSNSW current business process and identification of opportunities for innovation  efficiency  and improved outcomes to support the achievement of the Premier’s Priority on Reducing Adult Reoffending.  About You  To be successful in this role  you will have: You will be able to assess current business processes and provide recommendations on updates and changes to align with enhancing digital technology You will be able to develop project documentation and workflows that clearly outline milestones  risks  issues and key stakeholders You will be able to engage stakeholders including Offender Digital Services to ascertain technical requirements and assess these against CSNSW business needs You will be able assist in the establishment of working groups and provide secretariat support You will be able to assist in development of test plans or identification of testing requirements for projects that require testing on the Offender Digital Services platform You will be able to work within the values of the NSW public service  have flexibility and the ability to work as a positive and effective team member  and Have an understanding or experience in project management techniques and tools Understand the role of Government and machinery of government processes For Additional Information  Please Refer The Role Description  Applying for the role  To apply for this role you need to click ‘apply’ to complete the application form.  When Applying You Will Need To Attach Resume (maximum 3 pages and including 2 Referees – one must be a current supervisor) Cover letter (maximum 2 pages) outlining how you meet the requirements and capabilities of this role as specified in the role description (please refer to the Role Description so that you can address the highlighted capabilities). For application enquiries or technical issues  please contact the Talent Acquisition team via:  Email: mayur.kaushik@justice.nsw.gov.au  For more specific information about the role please contact Glen Barlow at: glen.barlow@justice.nsw.gov.au  Closing Date: 19 April 2022  A talent pool may be created for future ongoing and temporary roles and is valid for a period of up to 18 months.  If a vacancy arises in your preferred location during this time  you may be contacted and asked to attend the location to meet the manager. From there a final decision will be made regarding whether to activate the talent pool. Offers are based on location preference  capabilities  knowledge and experience.  To ensure recruitment at the Department of Communities and Justice continues without interruption during the COVID-19 pandemic  some interviews and assessments may be performed using alternative methods. This may include video interviewing  telephone interviewing and online assessments. If you are successful following review of your application  you may need to perform assessments and/or interviews via online platforms using a PC  laptop or smart phone. By doing so  we will be adhering to the strict social distancing advice currently in place.  Inclusion and Diversity lies at the heart of how we recruit  We continue to hire great people with a wide variety of skills  experience and backgrounds. This includes people with disability  Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people  women  people identifying as LGBTIQ+  culturally and linguistically diverse people  carers and other diversity groups.  If you require an adjustment within the recruitment process  please contact on and advise us of your preferred method of communication.  If you are looking for more information about workplace adjustments at DCJ  please visit our Careers site.

Title: Biostatistician | Senior Biostatistician - Sydney
Requirements: Biostatistician | AU  Novotech is the Asia-Pacific CRO designed for biotech  accelerating clinical development via cutting-edge technology to improve patient lives.  Working in a fast-paced and adaptable environment  we strive to set the benchmark for both business and clinical trial performance across all clinical trial phases and therapeutic areas.  Our people are critical in meeting organizational  and client objectives and we place a strong emphasis on creating a collaborative  transparent  and inclusive work environment where everyone is supported to achieve.  The Biostatistician will primarily implement and execute methodological and statistical aspects of clinical studies  Responsibilities Design  analysis  review and interpretation of clinical trial data Review available literature and implement appropriate statistical methods Ensure compliance with applicable regulatory agency guidelines in study design and protocol development Participate and review and/or preparation of statistical sections of study synopses  protocols and study reports Prepare sample size estimations  and prepare sample size justifications Review of case report forms and data management plans to ensure efficient and accurate collection of data Prepare randomisation specifications and schedules  and liaise with EDC vendors  or third parties  to set up IWRS/IVRS randomisation where applicable Prepare and write statistical analysis plans Write  document  validate and execute statistical programs using SAP or other software as required Interact with project managers  data managers and clients from start up through to close out Provide methodological advice to team and client SAS programming of derived datasets  tables  listings and figures according to the SAP and mock templates Quality Control of SAP output Ensure quality of statistical data and reports generated Present findings to internal/external clients as required Assist business development on forecasting statistic resource needs for ne study bids Experience And Qualifications Masters or PhD with a major in statistics or biostatistics or related field with 2-5 years of pharmaceutical industry  CRO or related experience Proficiency with Microsoft Office tools ( eg Word and Excel) and standard statistical packages (SAS) is expected Novotech is proud to offer a great workplace. We are committed to being an employer of choice for gender equality and providing an inclusive work environment where everyone is treated fairly and with respect.  Our team members are passionate about what we do  but we understand work is only of the things that is important to them. We support our team members with flexible working options  paid parental leave for both parents  flexible leave entitlements  wellness programs and ongoing development programs.  We are looking for people who are passionate about working clinical research and biotech  including people who identify as LGBTIQ+  have a disability or have caring responsibilities.  We are a Circle Back Initiative Employer and commit to respond to every application. We look forward to contacting you regarding your application.

Title: Trading Data Analyst  Quant Trading - Global Fintech Startup
Requirements: About Crypto.com Crypto.com was founded in 2016 on a simple belief: it's a basic human right for everyone to control their money  data and identity. With over 10+ million users on its platform today  Crypto.com provides a powerful alternative to traditional financial services  turning its vision of "cryptocurrency in every wallet" into reality  one customer at a time. Crypto.com is built on a solid foundation of security  privacy and compliance and is the first cryptocurrency company in the world to have ISO27001:2013 and PCI:DSS 3.2.1  Level compliance. Crypto.com is headquartered in Singapore with a 3000+ strong team. For more information  please visit www.crypto.com.  About the role: We are looking for a Trading Data Analyst with different seniority level to join our trading team  working together with traders  quants  trading ops and developers in different types of market and trading data analytics and engineering. You will contribute the daily data analytics  operations and engineering for flow trading  market making and proprietary crypto-trading business by using our research and analytic data warehouse.  Responsibilities: Conceptualizing and generating infrastructure that allows big data to be easily accessed and analyzed Build automatic pipeline to acquire  clean  transform and store data into data warehouse Ensure both market and derived data are accurate and fully validated Ensure all development and analytics work are clear and with detailed logic and fundamentals to support Identify ways to improve data reliability  efficiency and quality Understand different types of crypto related data from the market and bring into team for any trading activities Able to work as RAD to deliver tactical and long-term solutions to cover trading requirement needs Fully hands-on in programming and data analytics  Requirements: Minimum of Bachelor’s degree required in a quantitative subject (Computer Science  Engineering  Mathematics  Physics  Finance  Statistics  Big Data Analytics and Engineering). Master’s degree is preferred but not a must 3+ years of proven experience with data  preferably financial data – spot  swap  option  volatility and algo trading etc. Strong mathematical thinking and numerical analysis skills  a desire to make sense of data Strong coding skills  preferably Python  including experience developing large scale data project with SQL/NoSQL Time series database and vector-based coding are big plus  and experience in handing financial raw data Database architecture and management system knowledge will be greatly appreciated Familiar with automation tools like Jenkins  Ansible or any continuous integration tools Excellent organizational and interpersonal skills. Confidence to speak to people from different background to understand their needs and deliver technical solutions to cover all scenario Capacity to successfully manage a pipeline of duties with minimal supervision Passion for digital assets  the markets and new technologies Comfortable with trading floor environment  Benefits: We offer an attractive compensation package working in a cutting-edge field of Fintech. Huge responsibilities from Day 1. Be the owner of your own learning curve. The possibilities are limitless and depend on you You get to work in a very dynamic environment and be part of an international team You will get to have involvement in developing brand new products from scratch using latest technologies alongside with a passionate and talented team

Proactively communicate and collaborate with stakeholders  product specialists and data architects to capture functional and non-functional requirements Develop Functional data ingestion Interface designs Created business requirement documents and functional requirements document  Skills /Competencies: Essential: Data Warehousing experience at least 48 months PAAS Platform experience of at least 12 months Understanding of data ingestion and worked as a solution designer for at least 24 months Azure Fundamentals (AZ900) Python Data Governance and Data quality SQL DWH experience Spark Azure Data Bricks Azure Data Factory Synapse  Preferred: Azure Data Engineer certified (DP 201) Sparks ADF  ADLS Data cataloguing  Additional Skills: Excellent customer interfacing skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong attention to detail and outstanding analytical and Problem-solving skills. Title: Technical Business Analyst (Data)
Requirements: Sydney  As a member of our central Data Architecture team reporting to the Lead Enterprise Data Architect  you will play a pivotal role in investigations into enterprise data challenges  uncover the root causes  and help provide effective solutions to those problems. Your expertise as a data analyst combined ideally with data development background will require you to do explore new concepts via small PoC(s) to help develop pragmatic and effective data architecture strategy components across the enterprise. You will have the opportunity of turning high level conceptual ideas into tangible outcomes.  As a Technical Business Analyst in Data  you will work closely with the business and technical teams in analysis of non-standard and unique business problems to deliver actionable outcomes. For the right candidate this is will be great exposure to learn more about strategic data architecture as well as opportunity to build exposure in high demand skill of Data governance and how to build data strategy. This is an ideal opportunity for analyst / BA looking to pursue Data Architecture as a career going forward.  To be successful in this role you will have the following skills and experience: 5+ years of extensive data & business analytics experience. 5+ years of end-to-end data project experience spanning across requirements gathering  analysis  design to development. Be comfortable with ambiguous requirements and changing priorities. Strong expertise on using data queries and query tools - including Big Data tools like Hive  Impala  Presto along. Strong excel and Power BI based analytical skills to identify patterns / outliers on a given data set or to confirm hypothesis. Must be good at data forensics  creating & studying data lineages and condensing existing documentation in easy to consume summary for Data Architects. Good exposure or development experience with Big Data ecosystem is highly desirable: experience in design and implementing data pipelines in Spark using Java/Scala for Data Lakes and Data Warehouse. good understanding of data architecture principles including data modelling. Specific skills that would be highly beneficial but not mandatory: Experienced with handling and developing data pipelines within Financial Services Industry Experience in working with data discovery tools such as Alteryx About The Corporate Operations Group  The Corporate Operations Group brings together specialist support services in Digital Transformation & Data  Technology  Operations  Human Resources  Business Services  Business Improvement & Strategy  and the Macquarie Group Foundation.  Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion  The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths  and in combination with our inclusive environment  it enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people  clients  shareholders and communities. From day one  you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate & provide all support. With the right technology  support and resources  our people can work in a range of flexible ways.  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces & values diversity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you  and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.  About Macquarie  A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills  explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition  helping sustain global food supplies  financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie  we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.  Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups  disciplines  sectors and borders. With 17 000+ employees and offices in 33 markets around the world  we’re a truly global organisation.  You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives  ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us  you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.  Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management  retail and business banking  wealth management  leasing and asset financing  market access  commodity trading  renewables development  specialist advisory  capital raising and principal investment.  Find out more at www.macquarie.com/careers  Job no: COG-957598  Work type: Agency Worker  Location: Sydney  Category: Mid-level  Data & Analytics  Technology  Group: Corporate Operations Group  Division: Technology  Recruiter: Patrick Lockington  Opening Date: 10/4/2022

Title: Senior Analytics Consultant
Requirements: Job Summary  Thanks to recent successes AECOM is seeking experienced Analytics Consultants at all levels.  As a member of the Australia New Zealand Analytics Team you will be a key part of our Digital Consulting offering to our biggest clients  particularly in the Transportation  Resources and Government sectors.  You will be part of a high performing  Australia-wide team responsible for descriptive  predictive and prescriptive analytics including simulation modelling of infrastructure and operations  machine learning  natural language processing and dashboarding.  You will support the preparation  modelling and analysis of client data and apply data science  operations research and AI techniques to solve real-world problems.  A self-motivated and inquisitive individual would best suit this role with a combination of on-the-job and self-paced training provided.  Minimum Requirements At least 2 years relevant experience  ideally in a consulting environment A strong sense of commitment  a willingness to learn  and a desire to work in a dynamic consulting environment The following experience would be highly desirable: Python or C# Power BI or Tableau Discrete event simulation Web development Knowledge of operations research techniques This role involves regular contact with clients so very good interpersonal skills with an ability to focus on client requirements is a must. Strong analytical and data manipulation skills  Preferred Qualifications Tertiary qualification in Mathematics  Data Science  Computer Science or Engineering or similar numerate discipline Certified Analytics Professional or similar accreditations desirable  What We Offer  We will give you the flexibility you need to do your best work with hybrid work options. Whether you’re working from an AECOM office  remote location or at a client site  you will be working in a dynamic environment where your integrity  entrepreneurial spirit and pioneering mindset are championed.  You will help us foster a culture of equity  diversity and inclusion – a safe and respectful workplace  where we invite everyone to bring their whole selves to work using their unique talents  backgrounds and expertise to create transformational outcomes for our clients.  We will encourage you to grow and develop your career with us through our technical and professional development programs and diverse career opportunities. We believe in leadership at all levels. No matter where you sit in the organization you can make a lasting impact on the projects you work on  the teams and committees you join and our business.  We offer competitive pay and benefits  well-being programs to support you and your family  and the development resources you need to advance your career.  When you join us  you will connect and collaborate with a global network of experts – planners  designers  engineers  scientists  consultants  program and construction managers – leading the change toward a more sustainable and equitable future. Join us and let’s get started.  As an Equal Opportunity Employer  we believe in each person’s potential  and we’ll help you reach yours.  Job Category Engineering - Systems  Business Line Transportation  Business Group Design and Consulting Services Group (DCS)  Country Australia  Position Status Full Time  Requisition/Vacancy No. 264297BR  Additional Locations AU - Brisbane  QLD  AU - Perth  WA  AU - Sydney  NSW  Virtual: No  Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race  color  religion  sex  national origin  sexual orientation  gender identity  disability or protected veteran status.

Title: Business Intelligence (BI) Specialist
Requirements: Posted by Nathan Fregona Talent Acquisition Specialist | We’re hiring and developing! at RedEye.co Send InMail About RedEye!  We provide the first fully cloud-based and purpose-built engineering data management solution for asset owners and their service providers globally. We work with critical infrastructure organisations across industries such as water  energy  mining  infrastructure  healthcare  government (national parks and wildlife)  and defence to improve the safety and productivity of their critical assets  in real time.  What began as an ambitious start-up in Brisbane in 2012 as a way for engineers to manage their engineering information has today evolved into a recognised leader in assets data management delivery  helping our clients manage over $250bn of assets. This is our RedEye story...so far.  Headquartered in Brisbane  we currently have a team of 89 across ANZ  the Philippines and North America.  We are a customer focused organisation  with a commitment to growth and continuous improvement. We are proud of the values we live by every day that shape the success of our team and the experience of our customers:  “I've got your back” “I get sh*t done” “We're making a difference”  About The Opportunity  As RedEye’s Business Intelligence (BI) Specialist  you will be responsible for the analysis  design  creation and support of business insights and reporting that helps drive product development  uncovers business opportunities and provides data insight products that will be used by our customers through our apps.  This is not just another BI reporting role – this role is a key enabler of leveraging our data for the benefit of our customers and the business.  Some of your key responsibilities are listed below.  Insights and Modelling:  Using all available data sources  including our Data Lake  to transform data into useable insights that have a clear line of sight to generating customer value Telling stories about the business and customers using attractively-presented visualisations  insights packages and dashboards Using the company’s suite of BI tools and workbench to model and present insights Where required  creating data models that accurately represent business concepts and uncover drivers and predictors of customer value Creating and maintaining periodic reports and dashboards Creating and maintaining accurate and updated documentation for the above Administering our chosen BI Workbench  BI Program and Advocacy:  Acting as a key driver in supporting our Product and Customer Success teams  offering internal consultancy Actively fostering a data-driven culture Recommending improvements to source system data repositories for behavioural data capture Assisting in building our internal data community of practice Helping drive engagement with our customer data community Working with the Head of Data Science  Data Engineer and the Infrastructure Team to fully leverage the Data Lake in a cloud environment Helping to develop and maintain a data dictionary / glossary in the Lake that allows users to make sense of the ingested data for business use  About You  As our BI Specialist  you will work collaboratively as an internal consultant with business stakeholders at all levels to understand how our data reflects customer behaviour and convert business problems into data-driven solutions. Within the position  you'll ideally be comfortable leading the ongoing administration of our BI Workbench.  Given the importance and value-added nature of this role across RedEye  you will ideally possess:  Experience generating valuable business insights with demonstrable customer value. Experience interfacing with cloud-based Data Lakes and sources would be an advantage Extensive experience in data storytelling and visualisation Demonstrated experience in data modelling techniques Bachelors degree in any discipline. Business Intelligence certifications would be desirable. Core languages: SQL  experience with DAX and PowerQuery would be an advantage. Working knowledge of R or Python highly desirable. Experience with any of the major BI tools i.e. Tableau  Power BI. Ability to administer any of these tools would be highly regarded. Ability to quickly understand how RedEye products work and how underlying data flows and structures impact user experience  Why RedEye?  On top of being a leader in the delivery of engineering assets data management  with a diverse team of talented and supportive professionals  led by our cofounder and Queensland’s Chief Entrepreneur  Wayne Gerard  you will also have:  An opportunity to join a newly formed Analytics & Data Science team here at RedEye. As the team grows  so too will your seniority! A direct line of sight into creating real customer value across our engineering asset-data driven applications! A platform to be able create something entirely new  as a significant contributor to our competitive advantage as an engineering asset-data driven organisation! The chance to create significant  customer visible dollar value through great data engineering and architecture A genuine opportunity to take advantage of flexible working arrangements so you can be at your best both at work and in your personal time (work from home flexibility is the norm here) A promise to not hold you back with red tape and excessive procedures that are counterproductive (strong emphasis on “I get sh*t done” here) A commitment to your health and wellbeing  with discounted gym memberships and 2 annual RedEye Recharge Days  so you can take the time you need  just for yourself   Help us empower organisations that empower the world - Apply Now!

Title: Cloud Engineer - Data Insight Analytics
Requirements: Description  Amazon Web Services is the market leader and technology forerunner in the Cloud business. As a member of the AWS Support team you will be at the forefront of this transformational technology  assisting a global list of companies and developers that are taking advantage of a growing set of services and features to run their mission-critical applications. As a Cloud Support Engineer  you will act as the ‘Cloud Ambassador’ across all the cloud products  arming our customers with required tools & tactics to get the most out of their Product and Support investment.  Would you like to use the latest cloud computing technologies? Do you have an interest in helping customers understand application architectures and integration approaches? Are you familiar with best practices for applications  servers and networks? Do you want to be part of a customer facing technology team helping to ensure the success of Amazon Web Services (AWS) as a leading technology organization?  If you fit the description  you might be the person we are looking for! We are a group of smart people  passionate about cloud computing  and believe that world class support is critical to customer success.  WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT FROM A LIFE AT AWS?  Every day will bring new and exciting challenges on the job while you: Learn and use groundbreaking technologies. Apply advanced troubleshooting techniques to provide unique solutions to our customers' individual needs. Interact with leading engineers around the world. Partner with Amazon Web Services teams to help reproduce and resolve customer issues. Leverage your extensive customer support experience to provide feedback to internal AWS teams on how to improve our services. Drive customer communication during critical events. Drive projects that improve support-related processes and our customers’ technical support experience. Write tutorials  how-to videos  and other technical articles for the developer community. Work on critical  highly complex customer problems that may span multiple AWS services. WHY AWS SUPPORT? First and foremost this is a customer support role – in The Cloud. On a typical day  a Support Engineer will be primarily responsible for solving customer’s cases through a variety of customer contact channels which include telephone  email  and web/live chat. You will apply advanced troubleshooting techniques to provide tailored solutions for our customers and drive customer interactions by thoughtfully working with customers to dive deep into the root cause of an issue. Apart from working on a broad spectrum of technical issues  an AWS Support Engineer may also coach/mentor new hires  develop & present training  partner with development teams on complex issues or contact deflection initiatives  participate in new hiring  write tools/script to help the team  or work with leadership on process improvement and strategic initiatives. Career development: We promote advancement opportunities across the organization to help you meet your career goals. Training: We have training programs to help you develop the skills required to be successful in your role. We hire smart people who are keen to build a career with AWS  so we are more interested in the areas that you do know instead of those you haven’t been exposed to yet. Support engineers interested in travel have presented training or participated in focused summits across our sites or at specific AWS events. As we operate on follow-the-sun model  you may be required to work a staggered week  either Sun-Thu or Tue-Sat (no on-call). https://youtu.be/GC3bWcFFZTo   Basic Qualifications  This Analytics role supports our services that focus on Analytics technologies that allow customers to extract insights from their data such as Redshift  QuickSight and Neptune. Exposure to Database Fundamentals and General Troubleshooting (tuning and optimization  deadlocks  keys  normalization) in any Relational Database Engines (MySQL  PostgreSQL  Oracle  SQLServer) Familiar with data warehousing and ETL process Experience in Business Analytics application  support  and troubleshooting concepts Experience with System Administration and troubleshooting with Linux (Ubuntu  CentOS  RedHat) and/or Microsoft Windows Server and associated technologies (Active Directory) Experience with Networking and troubleshooting (TCP/IP  DNS  OSI model  routing  switching  firewalls  LAN/WAN  traceroute  iperf  dig  cURL or related) Bachelor’s degree in Information Science / Information Technology  Data Science  Computer Science  Engineering  Mathematics  Physics  or a related field OR equivalent experience in a technical position Preferred Qualifications Experience in a customer support environment Experience analyzing  troubleshooting  and providing solutions to technical issues Understanding of Cloud Computing concepts Experience scripting or developing in at least one of the following languages : Python  R  Ruby  GO  Java  .NET (C#)  JavaScript  Company - AWS Australia Pty Ltd  Job ID: A1859049

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst  Australia Retail BI & Analytics Program Team
Requirements: Job Summary  DESCRIPTION  Amazon’s Australia Retail team  located in Sydney  is looking for a motivated  self-driven BI Analyst to join our team.  You will be working with large volumes of complex data to produce insights that can improve business performance. You will be exploring datasets  writing complex SQL queries  building data pipelines and data visualization solutions with Tableau or AWS Quicksight. You will be also building new Machine Learning models to predict future outcomes of some of the key deliverables.  This role requires customer focus  strong analytical skills and business acumen in order to support leadership in influencing critical business decisions.  As a BI Analyst in the Australia Retail team  you will help identify stakeholder requirements and develop insightful dashboards and reports to support business decisions and provide customer insight. You will work with your counterparts in other Amazon locales to identify and adopt best practices and work with local teams to solve complex problems in a data- driven manner. You will put customer experience at the forefront of your thinking and the scope of your role will be diverse -from ad-hoc pieces of analysis  to ensuring timely regular reporting  enhancing existing reporting pipelines  and working on long-term strategic projects to enhance the BI & Analytics capability in Australia.  It is a pivotal role that will operate across the Retail business and will contribute to the evolution and success of Amazon Australia. If you’re an expert in Business Intelligence / Analytics  inspired by a new challenge and excited about driving the growth of a fast-paced technology business  then this is the position for you.  In the spirit of reconciliation Amazon acknowledges the Traditional Custodians of country throughout Australia and their connections to land  sea and community. We pay our respect to their elders past and present and extend that respect to all Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples today.  Amazon is committed to a diverse and inclusive workplace. Amazon is an equal opportunity employer  and does not discriminate on the basis of race  national origin  gender  gender identity  sexual orientation  disability  age  or other legally protected attributes.   Basic Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science  Engineering  Econometrics  Finance or comparable field 3+ years of relevant in Business Intelligence / Analytics  preferably in a retail or operations environment Expert in SQL and ETL platforms and hands-on data warehouse experience (ideally AWS Redshift)  as well as the ability to analyze Big Data and solving complex deep dive questions. Experience in data visualization with Tableau or equivalent. Experience in building data pipelines Experience leading projects of varying size  scope and timelines Extremely strong communication skills and the ability to influence High attention to detail and proven ability to manage multiple  competing priorities simultaneously Superior analytical skills including advanced Excel  but also strong bias for action Preferred Qualifications Experience in Python to build predictive ML models using regressions and other machine learning techniques. Familiarity with AWS services such as S3  Quicksight High threshold for working and thriving in an ambiguous  fast paced environment – figuring it out and adapting as you go Ability to operate simultaneously and effectively in both tactical and strategic modes  Company - Amzn Commercial Srvcs Pty Ltd  Job ID: A1982306

Title: Data and Business Analyst - Early Career Opportunities
Requirements: Sydney  Elevate yourself as a Data and Business Analyst and build the career that’s right for you.  Are you new to Data and Business Analyst or looking for more from your tech career? Joining our Tech Select Program puts you in the driver’s seat of your career  giving you the chance to experience new areas of technology  while building on your data and business analytics and professional skills.  Data and Business Analytics at Macquarie  There has never been a more exciting time to embark on a career in Data at Macquarie. We’re investing in our people  systems  and tools to help us manage and use data effectively and drive a data-centric culture.  Joining one of our data teams  could see you involved in Macquarie’s data and regulatory reporting strategy  delivering digital transformation and innovation  or helping teams gain valuable insight from data.  You’ll get to partner with stakeholders across the organisation to advance our data journey  while helping to solve/address some of the most complex problems faced by our industry.  Our Data team members work across the full breadth of our business groups  giving you the chance to diversify and drive the data career you want.  How Tech Select Works  Tech Select is purpose built for technologists in the early stages of their career. You’ll join a cohort of professionals who are passionate about accelerating the digital enterprise.  You’ll embark on a 12-month development and mentoring program across your choice of technology disciplines. Whatever you’re looking for  Tech Select is customised for you  by you.  You’ll have the choice of the following tech fields to rotate through: Software Engineering Cloud and Platform Engineering Cyber Security Data and Business Analytics UX/UI – Experience Design Customer/Tech Support At the conclusion of Tech Select  your journey with Macquarie is only just beginning. As a permanent employee  you’ll continue shaping a technology career that’s unique to you.  So  who are you?  You’re a Data or Business Analyst  or looking to become one  in the early stages of your career  ideally with some professional experience and a relevant Technology qualification.  We are an ever-growing global team who is accelerating the digital enterprise and delivering technology solutions that empower people to innovate and invest for a better future. If you want to join us and be part of our journey  while elevating your career  then this is the opportunity for you!  To learn more about Tech Select visit https://www.macquarie.com/au/en/careers/early-technology-careers/tech-select-program.html  About The Corporate Operations Group  The Corporate Operations Group brings together specialist support services in Digital Transformation & Data  Technology  Operations  Human Resources  Business Services  Business Improvement & Strategy  and the Macquarie Group Foundation. We deliver service excellence to ensure Macquarie is open for business  deliver on transformational change  invest in our people and have deep relationships with our customers.  Our commitment to Diversity  Equity and Inclusion  The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths. An inclusive and equitable environment enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people  clients  shareholders and communities. From day one  you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us  please apply. With the right technology  support and resources  our people can work in a range of flexible ways.  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity  equity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you  and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.  About Macquarie  A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills  explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition  helping sustain global food supplies  financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie  we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.  Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups  disciplines  sectors and borders. With 17 000+ employees and offices in 33 markets around the world  we’re a truly global organisation.  You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives  ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us  you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.  Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management  retail and business banking  wealth management  leasing and asset financing  market access  commodity trading  renewables development  specialist advisory  capital raising and principal investment. Title: Insights Analyst
Requirements: Posted by Hannah Timcke Head of HR Send InMail Who are we? We are Australia’s biggest broking family - Loan Market Group. We are one of the largest and fastest-growing retail mortgage brokerages and loan aggregators in Australasia  advocating for over 7 000 brokers  and their clients  across Australia  New Zealand and Indonesia. Proudly family-owned and led  we were founded in 1994 by Sam White and are part of the White Family Group of companies comprising Loan Market  PLAN Australia  Choice Aggregation Services  FAST  Home Now and Ray White.  About the role: The Insights Analyst is engaged in all facets of Loan Market Group corporate insights activities and plays an integral role in report development and uses proficient SQL writing skills to facilitate meaningful and actionable insights for the entire corporate group. This is a collaborative position responsible for carrying out corporate reporting using the Google Cloud Platform (e.g. BigQuery  Google Data Studio  Looker) with respect to data analytics  maintaining existing reports  and innovating new reports as required by the business.  Key responsibilities: Engage with Loan Market Group corporate users to understand their insights needs and create innovative reporting and analytics solutions. Technically skilled in SQL writing and proficient with Google Cloud Platform (BigQuery  Google Data Studio  Looker)  or other data visualisation tools (Power BI  Tableau  Qlik) Contribute to analytics engineering development work (Dataform and GitHub) in the Google Data Warehouse as well as Looker data models. Develop and maintain a suite of accurate high-quality data visualization dashboards and reports based on agreed business requirements. Provide business insights to support the decision-making of stakeholders. Contribute and provide support on ad hoc insights requests as required. Provide support for other insights and data projects as required. Identify  analyze  and interpret trends or patterns relating to key performance. Understand data governance framework including data architecture  data quality  data security  data transformation principles.  About you: Bachelor’s degree or equivalent industry experience with emphasis in IT  statistics  accounting  and financial analysis  or a related area. Experience in writing SQL queries. Github or other similar data repository experience and/or other command-line code experience is highly desirable. Innovative and solution-focused analytical approach to problem-solving. Well-developed interpersonal and communication skills  including the demonstrated ability to influence stakeholders at all levels  and be able to effectively present information to those stakeholders through various channels (written and verbal). A demonstrated commitment to the delivery of outcomes through being a team player who is also self-motivated  positive  and enthusiastic in achieving team goals.  What is in it for you? Flexible work environment – We support flexible working arrangements to suit your needs. Rewarding perks – Gain access to our Reward Gateway program that offers a wide range of discounts at hundreds of major stores and retailers  access to discounted Bupa and HCF Private Health Insurance  and access to our Employee Assistance Program for yourself and eligible family members. Paid parental leave – We offer 3 months paid parental leave (primary carer) for employees who are growing their families. Awesome culture and team – Grow your career in a supportive  collaborative and respectful team that celebrates every win together!  If you think this sounds like your ideal next opportunity  we'd love to hear from you!

Title: Data Engineer in Business Intelligence Team (Bangkok based  relocation provided)
Requirements: About Agoda  Agoda is an online travel booking platform for accommodations  flights  and more. We build and deploy cutting-edge technology that connects travelers with more than 2.5 million accommodations globally. Based in Asia and part of Booking Holdings  our 4 000+ employees representing 90+ nationalities foster a work environment rich in diversity  creativity  and collaboration. We innovate through a culture of experimentation and ownership  enhancing the ability for our customers to experience the world.  Get to Know Our Team  The Data department oversees all of Agoda’s data-related requirements. Our ultimate goal is to enable and increase the use of data in the company through creative approaches and the implementation of powerful resources such as operational and analytical databases  queue systems  BI tools  and data science technology. We hire the brightest minds from around the world to take on this challenge and equip them with the knowledge and tools that contribute to their personal growth and success while supporting our company’s culture of diversity and experimentation. The role the Data team plays at Agoda is critical as business users  product managers  engineers  and many others rely on us to empower their decision making. We are equally dedicated to our customers by improving their search experience with faster results and protecting them from any fraudulent activities. Data is interesting only when you have enough of it  and we have plenty. This is what drives up the challenge as part of the Data department  but also the reward.  The Opportunity  As a Data Engineer in Business Intelligence Team  you will work closely with product managers and BI team to interpret business questions into data needed. You make a design  development  until support and maintain the data pipeline. You will work with variety of data sources  data technology and data tools both in-house and enterprise licenses to build data pipeline and generating data reports.  In This Role  You’ll Get to  Works professionally to understand data needed for finance data analytics and be able to design proper data pipeline solution which is measurable and scalable Develop data pipeline on Bigdata platform by the following technology stack: Scala  Golang  Python3  scripting (Bash/Python)  Hadoop  etc Ensure delivered data achieve team’s standard quality checklist and always have visibility on it Be responsive to work within a deadline Keep catching up on data technology and have up to date data insight with the team  What You’ll Need To Succeed  Bachelor’s or advance degree in IT/Statistic related field More than 3 years of experience in data technology Fluent in English and Interpersonal skills Experience in ETL tools or data pipeline language such as Python  Scala Knowledgeable in using Databases and writing SQL queries Good time management and multitasking skills Self-motivation and ability to work well independently as part of the scrum team  It’s Great If You Have  Experience on data warehouse design Experience with ‘Big Data’ technologies / tools Ex. Tensorflow) Experience with third-party libraries and APIs Experience with automate operation tasks with Shell Script  Python Knowledge in business analysis or data modeling Hungry to learn new tools  languages and technologies  #sydney #kyiv #melbourne #london #tokyo #dhaka #edinburgh #amsterdam #munich #moscow #dublin #seoul #hcmc #telaviv #moscow #taipei #manila  Equal Opportunity Employer  At Agoda  we pride ourselves on being a company represented by people of all different backgrounds and orientations. We prioritize attracting diverse talent and cultivating an inclusive environment that encourages collaboration and innovation. Employment at Agoda is based solely on a person’s merit and qualifications. We are committed to providing equal employment opportunity regardless of sex  age  race  color  national origin  religion  marital status  pregnancy  sexual orientation  gender identity  disability  citizenship  veteran or military status  and other legally protected characteristics.
