For more details please read our privacy policy .  To all recruitment agencies: Agoda does not accept third party resumes. Please do not send resumes to our jobs alias  Agoda employees or any other organization location. Agoda is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Title: Analytics Consultant
Requirements: Your Team responsibilities -  MSCI analytics consultants are responsible for maintaining and growing existing client relationships for all Analytics products. Consultants are assigned clients within a given coverage territory  and work hand in glove with the sales team to achieve common commercial and client relationship/servicing objectives.  The consultant pro-actively manages the client relationship and ensures a high level of client experience and satisfaction. The objective is to ensure the client fully benefits from their subscription  which is achieved by developing a high-level understanding of the client needs and creating value as a Trusted Advisor. The consultant ensures the client maximizes the value of the products they have subscribed to and identify additional products that could further benefit the client in their investment and risk management process.  This role is a highly visible one  with involvement in all aspects of an account including senior level relationship management  product demonstrations  users training and education  and client experience enhancing activities such as presenting at client workshops  seminars  and webinars. In this role  individuals will work very closely with sales  global client service  marketing  research and product management.  What we will offer you: Depending on your location of your role  you can expect …  Competitive fixed and variable compensation  holiday/vacation allowance and retirement savings plans/pensions A wide range of benefits including - healthcare  dental plans  risk insurances and (location dependent) - cycle-to-work schemes  gym benefits  retail discounts A hybrid work environment  for the vast majority of employees  offering a more progressive way of working to give you the flexibility  accountability  and responsibility to empower you to perform at your very best. At the center of this way of working is a culture which is built on a strong foundation of trust. We trust our people and they trust our organization’s leaders to support them. An inclusive and performance driven culture where you are empowered to maximize your potential in an environment where all individuals are respected and encouraged to bring their authentic selves to work A purposeful approach to Wellbeing to provide you with all the resources you need to be your best at work and in your personal life. Our Here For You Employee Assistance Program provides confidential emotional support with local experts  financial and legal advice in a wide range of issues as well as access to online information  resources and tools. All the services are available for our employees free of charge.  Total Relationship Management Involving  Your key responsibilities -  Improving the year on year retention rate by ensuring a high level of client experience and satisfaction Support the sales business with product demonstrations. Detailed account planning  including engagement with all levels of client organization Responsible for delivering client education and product training Be a subject matter expert on all aspects of our products and methodologies  and be able to answer detailed client inquiries Become a Trusted Advisor by applying both product and client expertise to pro-actively identify solutions/product usage that create value for the client - hence contributing directly to up-selling and cross-selling opportunities Provide thought-leadership by sharing best practices within the client community  and leading workshops and seminars Keeping abreast of latest industry trends  client needs  and product development roadmap. Working with other teams (Marketing  Sales  Research  and Product Development) to ensure company is delivering relevant products Regular travel to client sites within coverage region  Your skills and experience that will help you excel -  Strong team skills and emotional maturity  with proven ability for independent work and self-teaching Fluency in English Superior communication and time management skills with the ability to handle multiple projects Strong analytic and quantitative skills Understanding of / experience dealing with major international institutions including Asset Managers  Hedge Funds  Broker / Dealers  Banks Ideally worked in client firm (Asset Manager  Hedge Fund  Bank) in a risk management (market / counterparty risk)  model validation  quantitative research or portfolio management role. Strong understanding of the global equity and fixed income markets  including over-the-counter securities and derivatives and exotic securities Thorough understanding of the Investment Management Process Significant relationship management experience with a proven record of accomplishment and experience in the financial service industry Someone who enjoys intellectual and analytical challenges Bachelor’s Degree required ideally from engineering/mathematical background. Ideally MBA  or Masters Degree in a quantitative science  i.e. Finance and/or Phd Professional qualifications ideally CFA charter holder  FRM (Financial Risk Manager) Experience with RiskMetrics Riskmanager preferred but not essential  How We’ll Support You  Coaching  support and encouragement from experts in your team Access to a wide range of learning opportunities to support your growth and development Customizable learning journeys to help you navigate your professional development Transparent performance-based compensation schemes Employee Resource Groups such as MSCI Pride  Black Leadership Network  Women’s Leadership Forum  Women in Tech  Asian Support Network  All Abilities and Climate Action Groups.  About MSCI And Our Teams  MSCI is a leading provider of critical decision support tools and services for the global investment community. With over 50 years of expertise in research  data and technology  we power better investment decisions by enabling clients to understand and analyze key drivers of risk and return and confidently build more effective portfolios. We create industry-leading research-enhanced solutions that clients use to gain insight into and improve transparency across the investment process.  Our values define the working environment we strive to create. We are inclusive  we champion bold ideas  we always pursue excellence  and always act with integrity. Personal accountability and responsibility are key to success  and we always work as a team to remain client centric.  At MSCI diversity is at our core and inclusion defines our culture. Our people are empowered to maximize their potential in an environment where all individuals are respected and encouraged to bring their authentic selves to work. We work  learn and grow together and we are committed to hiring and promoting qualified women  ethnic minorities and members of the LGBT+ community candidates  who have historically been underrepresented in financial services.  To learn more about life at MSCI please visit https://careers.msci.com or follow us on LinkedIn  Twitter  Glassdoor.  To all recruitment agencies : MSCI does not accept unsolicited CVs/Resumes. Please do not forward CVs/Resumes to any MSCI employee  location or website. MSCI is not responsible for any fees related to unsolicited CVs/Resumes.  MSCI Inc. is an equal opportunity employer committed to diversifying its workforce. It is the policy of the Firm to ensure equal employment opportunity without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race  color  religion  creed  age  sex  gender  gender identity  sexual orientation  national origin  citizenship  disability  marital and civil partnership/union status  pregnancy (including unlawful discrimination on the basis of a legally protected pregnancy/maternity leave)  veteran status  or any other characteristic protected by law. Title: Geological and Mining Data Analyst (Australia)
Requirements: In response to the increased demand for our geometallurgical and business improvement services (Operational Excellence and Strategy Optimization)  AMC Consultants is looking for a Geological and Mining Data Analyst based in any of our Australian offices (Adelaide  Brisbane  Melbourne  or Perth) to work with an Australian-based geometallurgical group within the larger Advisory team. By combining data science with expert knowledge in geology  metallurgy and mine optimization  AMC is delivering new insights and unlocking real value for our clients. You will use your strong analytical abilities and communications skills to help drive significant improvements in the operation and profitability of mining projects. You will enjoy solving data science problems through analysis of multivariate data sets  collaborate within AMC teams to develop optimized solutions through value creation by combining machine learning  process analysis and statistics. You will contribute to geometallurgical projects  feasibility studies  business improvement studies  and a variety of corporate Advisory projects. You will maintain understanding of emerging technologies and continue to develop your professional network within the industry. Specialist skills required: · Broad understanding of the mining and minerals industry  mine development and mine operating practices. · Basic understanding of any of geology  mineralogy  processing  and deposit types. · Fundamental understanding of statistical principles. · Advanced skills in R. · Good exposure to Python. · Understanding of CRISP-DM framework. · Demonstrated experience in data wrangling  decorrelation  dimension reduction  regression analysis and modelling  machine learning  digital twin development. · Competency in multivariate data analysis. · Hypothesis testing and machine learning (regression and classification). · Conduct data analysis and machine learning to build geometallurgical models. · Excellent communication skills. The ability to capture and clearly convey critical observations  analysis  modelling outcomes  results and recommendations verbally  visually and in writing to a wide range of stakeholders. · The ability to collaborate effectively within multidisciplinary teams. · Excellent time management skills and the ability to work efficiently in a dynamic consulting environment. Qualifications required: · University degree in geology  metallurgy  mining engineering  physics  chemistry  mathematics  engineering  or similar technical field. Post graduate qualifications  particularly in data science  will be considered favourably. · Minimum of 5 years industry experience in operational and/or consulting roles with a strong focus on data analysis. · Membership of an industry recognized professional organisation preferred. · English speaker. Additional language skills attractive. Desired skills and experience: · Exposure to cloud computing · Exposure to geostatistics and mineral resource estimation. · Exposure to a range of different mineral commodities and geological deposit types favourable · Exposure to a range of mineral processing technologies favourable. · Detailed oriented with an ability to think critically and abstractly. Salary The salary package offered for this position will be commensurate with the skills and experience of the successful candidate.

Title: Data Engineer - Expression of Interest

We encourage you to apply to this Expression of Interest and to join our growing Talent Community  to be considered for current and future roles in the Chief Data & Analytics Office!  Which is why we’re the perfect fit for you. Here  you’ll be part of a team of engineers going above and beyond to improve the standard of digital banking. Using the latest tech to solve our customers’ most complex data-centric problems.  To us  data is everything. It is what powers our cutting-edge features and it’s the reason we can provide seamless experiences for millions of customers from app to branch.  We’re responsible for CommBank’s key analytics capabilities and work to create world-leading capabilities for analytics  information management and decisioning. We work across the Teradata Group Data Warehouse  Hadoop Big Data Platform  Analytics Workbench for Machine Learning  Pega Decisioning  SAS  R  Tableau  Oracle BI  Ab Initio.  We Are Seeking People Who Are Passionate about building industry leading group data products from scratch Excited by the design and construction of large-scale automated machine learning and data mining practices Ready to execute state-of-the-art coding practices  driving high quality outcomes to solve core business objectives and minimise risks Capable to create both technology blueprints and engineering roadmaps  for a multi- year data transformational journey Can lead and drive a culture where quality  excellence and openness are championed Constantly thinking outside the box and breaking boundaries to solve complex data problems We Are Also Interested In Hearing From People Who Are willing to built their careers in Data Engineering Are experienced in design and development of Big Data  ML  Decisioning  Visualisation and Data warehouse applications Are confident in building group data products from scratch  by integrating large sets of data derived from hundreds of internal and external sources Have a natural drive to educate  communicate and positively influence a large stakeholder group Tech Skills  We use a broad range of tools  languages  and frameworks. Scala  ANSI/ISO SQL  or AbInitio graph along with backend coding expertise in Java and Python Hadoop / Teradata platform  using Spark   TCF and various ETL frameworks Machine Learning libraries ad model development   Jupyeter notebook Working With Us  Our people bring their diverse backgrounds and unique perspectives to build a respectful  inclusive  and flexible workplace with an ultimate flexibility to work from any of our engineering hubs within Australia. Here  you’ll thrive. You’ll be supported when faced with challenges and empowered to tackle new opportunities. You’ll be empowered to do your best work and be given the choice on when and where that work happens. We really love working here  and we think you will too.  The health and safety of our people  customers and communities is our number one priority. This means that we require all of our employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Please speak to us if you have any questions about this based on your individual circumstances. wearengineering datawareengineering If you're already part of the Commonwealth Bank Group (including Bankwest)  you'll need to apply through Sidekick to submit a valid application. Title: Data Transformation Analyst
Requirements: Sydney  As a Data Transformation Analyst you will form part of the data governance team and be responsible for creating data flows with visual tools or code within the ETL platform Dataiku. You will partner with other business divisions to create and advise on ETL data flows as required for various projects.  With experience in a similar role  you will have an agile mindset and an delivery track record across a range of complex and diverse projects. Your expertise in ETL workflows and stakeholder/relationship management skills will be key to driving the right business outcomes.  You will work alongside an agile team of engineers  data scientists  business  and technology stakeholders and other technical teams with a key focus to provide ETL support to relevant projects  create visualisation dashboards or associated datasets and document best practices for self-service ETL and visualisation.  Daily tasks will include: Responding to business user queries around Dataiku usage and best practice. Creation of Dataiku ETL flows for specific projects using visual recipes  python and SQL. Documentation of Dataiku data management best practices in Confluence. Creation of data visualisation dashboards using PowerBI and other software as required. To be successful in this role you will have: 3+ years of experience in a tech-related role Management of an ETL platform such as Alteryx  Talend StitchData Management of BI dashboard platforms such as PowerBI  Tableau  QlikSense/View Familiarity with the coding languages python  SQL  command line Familiarity with software development concepts such as git versioning + environments  data lakes + warehouses Familiarity with agile working practices and Atlassian products such as Jira and Confluence. Usage of a public cloud service such as AWS  Azure  Google Cloud Platform About The Corporate Operations Group  The Corporate Operations Group brings together specialist support services in Digital Transformation & Data  Technology  Operations  Human Resources  Business Services  Business Improvement & Strategy  and the Macquarie Group Foundation. We deliver service excellence to ensure Macquarie is open for business  deliver on transformational change  invest in our people and have deep relationships with our customers.  Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion  The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths  and in combination with our inclusive environment  it enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people  clients  shareholders and communities. From day one  you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us  please apply. With the right technology  support and resources  our people can work in a range of flexible ways.  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you  and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.  About Macquarie  A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills  explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition  helping sustain global food supplies  financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie  we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.  Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups  disciplines  sectors and borders. With 17 000+ employees and offices in 33 markets around the world  we’re a truly global organisation.  You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives  ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us  you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.  Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management  retail and business banking  wealth management  leasing and asset financing  market access  commodity trading  renewables development  specialist advisory  capital raising and principal investment.  Find out more at www.macquarie.com/careers  Job no: COG-960650  Work type: Agency Worker  Location: Sydney  Category: Technology  Group: Corporate Operations Group  Division: Technology  Recruiter: Ian Bullimore  Opening Date: 09/12/2021

Title: Graduate Quantitative Researcher/Analyst (PHD) - Start Dec 2022
Requirements: Overview  Are you passionate about research and solving the unsolvable?  Interested in how you can have a research career in industry?  SIGSydney is on the lookout for passionate PhD researchers who are interested in the world around them to join our Graduate PhD Quantitative Research Program. The program’s start dates are ongoing.  SIG is one of the world’s largest market makers  with a unique approach to trading  technology  and research. While this background puts us at the top of our game  what really makes us successful is our quantitative approach to decision making and the collaboration between our employees.  SIG’s Graduate PhD Quantitative Research Program  We teach our Graduate Quantitative Researchers to use their problem-solving skills and mathematical creativity to find solutions in competitive and constantly changing financial markets. Working along other researchers  traders  and technologists  you’ll use an academic research approach to transform our quantitative modeling into trading opportunities. You can expect to be working alongside a trading team and be part of the day-to-day collaboration that makes us successful. From the moment you join SIG  you’re be able to see the application and high impact of your work on the success of our trading strategies.  You’ll Learn Option theory and option modeling in the classroom Cutting edge techniques in machine learning and advanced statistics Applications of optimisation and game theory to trading algorithms What We're Looking For Graduating PhD’s or Postdoc’s with a passion for research and problem solving Research interests in quantitative fields such as Mathematics  Physics  Statistics  Electrical Engineering  Computer Science  or Economics Exceptional mathematical problem solving skills Strong programming skills  with emphasis on using computers to reliably and efficiently perform tasks Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment as part of a team Well-developed communication skills Finance experience is a plus  but not required Our Edge Academically rigorous research with real-world application Competitive salary Fully-stocked kitchen  including breakfast and daily catered lunch Casual dress code On-site gym for SIG employees with 24hr access Authentic social community (basketball team  gaming) 360-degree view of Sydney’s Harbors (it really is Sydney’s best office view) Sustainable & environmentally friendly office Interview Process  Apply -> Maths Assessment -> Recruiter Interview -> Quant Interviews -> Final On-site Interview -> Offer  We don’t post salary ranges externally so any salary estimate you see listed here was not provided by SIG and may not be accurate.  SIG is not accepting unsolicited resumes from search firms. All resumes submitted by search firms to any employee at SIG via-email  the Internet or directly without a valid written search agreement will be deemed the sole property of SIG  and no fee will be paid in the event the candidate is hired by SIG.  #efc-multi

Title: Data Test Analyst
Requirements: BE PART OF OUR EVOLUTION  Welcome to Ampion a Wipro company. Ampion is a technology services provider delivering a new level of specialization at scale. As an independent subsidiary of Wipro  we deliver scalability and breadth of capabilities  combined with the depth of global experience.  Ampion’s three areas of specialization provide an engineering focus and strategic approach across software assurance (Assure)  technology security (Secure)  and digital transformation (Transform). We belong to a 2 000+ strong Australian workforce  as a part of Wipro Limited  a leader in global technology  and business consulting services.  THE ROLE  We have multiple opportunities for experienced Data Test Analysts to join our growing Testing Practice! We have an immediate need to grow our division to meet client demand - we are keen to speak with experienced Data Test Analysts with a passion for delivering excellent work.  KEY REQUIREMENTS Hands on experience with Data warehouse/ETL testing Strong technical skills and abilities including databases and SQL Ability to create  execute & present UAT test plans  business focused test cases and scripts. Experience in writing test plans and test cases in the database and data analytics spaces. Experience working in Agile / Scrum teams Excellent oral and written communication skills Knowledge of Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC)  WHAT CAN AMPION OFFER YOU?  Ampion offers rewarding careers in a collaborative and supportive culture where everyone gets a voice. We offer a mature working environment  flexible working arrangements  a competitive remuneration package and above else the opportunity to grow and develop your career further with a defined career path and training schedule.  Ampion is an equal opportunity employer and we value diversity. We believe in leveraging individual talents  to empower and support you to be the best version of you. We create teams that people want to be a part of and a culture that we are proud of.  WHAT’S NEXT?  Ready to join our evolution? Submit your interest by applying now or contact our nicola.reece@ampion.com.au for more information on a career with Ampion.

Title: Support Analyst - Data Centre Operations
Requirements: Computer Systems Officer Level 4 Ongoing Full-Time Parramatta About Us  The NSW Police Force (NSWPF) is one of the largest police forces in the western world  with more than 20 000 employees  including more than 4 000 administrative employees who support the sworn officers that provide a range of law and order services 24 hours a day  seven days a week to the socially  geographically and culturally diverse community of NSW.  About The Role  At a senior level the Support Analyst mentors and supports the Operational team as they maintain all the NSW Police Data Centres  mainframes and open system environments.  For more information on this role (e.g. essential requirements  key accountabilities and capabilities required for the role)  click here to view the role description.  To Be Successful In This Role  You Will Have Extensive experience in mainframe Operations in a ZOS environment Ability to plan and prioritise high volumes of work with conflicting and critical deadlines Ability to make decisions in relation to the prioritisation of work tasks Strong foundation with Incident  Problem and Change Management What We Can Offer You  At NSWPF our people have access to a range of benefits that help balance life at work and at home. Some of the benefits available when you join the NSWPF include: competitive salary  flexible work options  opportunity to purchase leave  annual leave loading  corporate wellbeing programs including seminars and the Fitness Passport  free annual influenza vaccination  salary packaging options via superannuation contributions or a novated vehicle lease  convenient location for public transport and to shops etc  and in-house gym facilities. How To Apply  Applications can only be submitted electronically via the I Work for NSW website.  To be considered for this role  attach a cover letter (2 pages maximum) and an up-to-date resume that clearly details your skills & experience as relevant to this role.  Please do not attach copies of qualifications  certificates or documentation (other than what has been requested) - you can bring these if called for interview.  Please address each of the following Target Questions (300 word limit per question) in the text boxes provided in the online application or attach as a separate document.  Target Question 1  Outline your knowledge and experience in mainframe Operations  support and administration of ZOS. In your response please ensure you provide details on the following: ZOS system software including JES2  VTAM  Tivoli Workload Scheduler (TWS)  System Automation (CNMS) and Netview Practical experience in any similar mainframe environments Target Question 2  Provide your background experience relating to your ability to perform multiple tasks concurrently  respond to technical emergency situations effectively while dealing with day to day operational issues. In your response please ensure you address the focus capabilities of the role namely: Technology Think and Solving Problems Commitment to Customer Service Managing oneself and Communications Your application must stand on its own merits  and the completeness and relevance of your application will determine if you proceed through to the selection process.  If you require any further information about this opportunity  please contact the hiring manager David Hartigan via (02) 8835 9486.  To be eligible to apply for this role  you must meet one of the following statuses: an Australian Citizen  a permanent resident of Australia  or a New Zealand citizen. All NSW Police Force employees are required to be fully vaccinated with a COVID-19 vaccine or have a valid medical contraindication certificate that can be accommodated in the workplace. You are required to provide a record of your COVID-19 vaccination status (including medical contraindication) as part of your application for consideration by NSWPF.  Prior to commencement  the successful candidate will be required to undergo a rigorous National Police (criminal history) Check and obtain and maintain a Security Clearance as determined by the NSW Police Force.  Our Commitment To Diversity  The NSW Police Force is a proud employer of a diverse range of people. We are committed to reflecting the diverse community we serve and creating an inclusive and respectful workplace for all employees. Differences are embraced  contributions are valued  and everyone has a sense of connection and belonging.  We welcome people with diverse skills  experiences  perspectives and backgrounds and encourage applications from Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander peoples  and individuals who may identify as LGBTIQ  with disability  a culturally and linguistically diverse background  and people of all ages.  If you identify as a person with disability and require further information on the role or you require specific arrangements to participate in the recruitment process  please contact the HR Diversity Team on 0429 275 709 or by email at HRDiversity@police.nsw.gov.au .  If you identify as Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander and would like assistance with your application  please contact the NSWPF Aboriginal Employment & Engagement team at hraboriginal@police.nsw.gov.au .  This recruitment may be used to create a Talent Pool for similar future roles (ongoing or temporary) that may arise over the next 18 months.  For more information on applying for roles with the NSW Police Force click here  Thank you for your interest in this role. We look forward to receiving your application.

Title: Expressions of Interest - Data Engineer | Data & Analytics
Requirements: At EY  you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are  with the global scale  support  inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better  too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself  and a better working world for all.  The opportunity  EY DnA is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific  with over 500 specialist employees working across multiple industry sectors.  As a Data Engineer  you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives. Some of your responsibilities will include: Work with diverse stakeholders to identify their challenges with data that can be addressed using various Analysis techniques. Be a part of a culture that focuses on delivering excellence for our clients and work with an awesome team of people to work with and access to cutting edge technologies. Flexibility to work in the way that brings out the best in you and encourages you to do what you love  in an environment that supports you. Be involved in all aspects of the Project life-cycle  including Strategy  Road-Mapping  Architecture  Implementation and Development in order to gain maximum exposure to set you up for a successful consulting career.  To qualify for the role you must have Ability to define and develop data integration patterns and pipelines Ability to assess complexity of data (volume  structure  relationship etc.) Hands on technical expertise in Spark  Python  SQL  Java  Scala  Kafka etc Hands on experience working with different data bases (RDBMS  NoSQL  Blob storage etc) Hands on experience working technologies/platform e.g. Dockers  Containers  Openstack  AWS  Azure  GCP Experience building data profiling and data cleansing frameworks  Ideally  you’ll also have Experience in engaging with both technical and non-technical stakeholders Strong consulting experience preferable from a Big 4 background  including engaging directly with clients Experience in a delivery role on Business Intelligence  Data Warehousing  Big Data or analytics projects  What We Offer  A tech career @ EY means working with 40 000 fellow technologists who are creating cutting edge applications in blockchain  AI  cloud  analytics  robotics and cyber  harnessing tech to power the human enterprise and build a more equitable  sustainable world. We offer world class training and a free Tech MBA to all our people.  Globally at EY  we are committed to offer Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next. Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility  so you can make a meaningful impact  your way. Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights  coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs. Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.  We hold a collective commitment to foster an environment where all differences are valued and respected  practices are equitable  and everyone experiences a sense of belonging. If you require any adjustments to the recruitment process in order to equitably participate  we encourage you to advise us at the time of application via contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or phone +61 3 8650 7788 (option 4).  The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.  The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third party provider. Regarding this role  the minimum salary is $90 000 including 10% superannuation.  EY | Building a better working world  EY exists to build a better working world  helping to create long-term value for clients  people and society and build trust in the capital markets.  Enabled by data and technology  diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow  transform and operate.  Working across assurance  consulting  law  strategy  tax and transactions  EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.  The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third party provider.

Title: Data Analyst - Marketing and Client Analytics
Requirements: Join a diverse and high performing team with flexible working arrangements Be part of a team and culture that values people Grow your career with a leading wealth management organisation  Insignia Financial is one of Australia’s leading Wealth Management organisations  undertaking a rapid and exciting transformation. We are a strong and resilient business and despite the current climate  are investing in supporting our people to onboard and connect them remotely. It is in this context that we are looking for a Client Analytics Consultant.  The Role  As a Client Analytics Consultant reporting to the Head of Client Analytics you will be responsible for detailed data analysis  responding to inquiries  and design and implementation of bespoke reporting.  Key Responsibilities Apply predicative analytics to predict client behaviour and outcomes Provide data driven insights and support strategic decision making across Marketing  Product and Distribution Conduct pre-campaign analytics to help shape business strategy and targeting opportunities Recommend appropriate courses of action and present analytical findings Develop improved analysis approaches and test and learn frameworks Clean and transform client data from registry and other source systems Build predictive and propensity  path analysis and attribution models Perform deep-dive analytics to improve understanding of our customers  To Be Successful In This Role You Will Possess Relevant tertiary and qualifications in a quantitative or comparable field Extensive experience in an analytics role with proven successes in the execution of data analytics initiatives Stakeholder management and ability to communicate the results of analyses and data visualisation Proactive and highly analytical and strategic approach to client management and business growth Highly proficient in SQL  R and/or Python languages Manage and process complex  large data for analysis (e.g.  hierarchies of datasets  inter-relationships  partitions  views  etc.) Experienced with statistical modelling and forecasting approaches and market analysis tools and techniques  Benefits In return  we offer development opportunities at an ASX top 200 company A professional  supportive  and friendly culture A range of corporate and lifestyle benefits  The Business  Insignia Financial is one of Australia’s leading wealth management organisations  undertaking a rapid and exciting transformation. The Insignia Financial group has been helping Australians secure their future since 1846. During that time  we have grown substantially to become a leading provider of quality financial services. We now manage and administer more than $200 billion of client monies and are listed on the Australian Securities Exchange in the ASX top 200 (ASX:IFL).  To Apply  Please submit your resume with a covering letter by clicking on “Apply Now.”  Applicants will be required to provide evidence of their eligibility to work in Australia  and at a minimum be required to undertake police and basic credit checks as a condition of employment.  Please note that applications from agencies will not be considered at this time.  Insignia Financial is an inclusive and equal opportunity employer. We encourage applications regardless of race  ethnicity  age  religion  gender  national origin  disability status  or any other characteristic protected by law. If you need assistance or an adjustment during the application process because of a disability  it is available upon request.  Insignia Financial is conscious of our WHS obligations and is committed to providing a safe workplace for everyone. As such  we require all new employees to be able to comply with our National COVID-19 Vaccination Policy. We will gladly and openly discuss this with you during the recruitment process if you wish.  Please be aware that Insignia Financial is currently undergoing an Organisational Design process  which may impact future organisational structure.

Title: Business Analyst - Data and BI
Requirements: 6 Month Contract CBD location / Working from Home Government Agency This government agency is seeking a Business Analyst specialising in Data and Business Intelligence to be responsible for driving continued system and process enhancement activities supporting the Salesforce platform  Your Responsibilities Will Include Engage with business users and customers to elicit business requirements for Business Intelligence and Analytic reporting. Help to manage the technical development of BI dashboards and reporting solutions for customers Testing of BI dashboards to ensure that technical solutions are effective and easy to use. Translate business needs into technical requirements Lead project meetings  facilitate workshops and present to senior stakeholders Provide technical guidance and advice to stakeholders You Will Have Min 6 years of experience in Business Analyst roles with the handling of data  and their relationships to business impacts. Previous experience of Business Intelligence / Reporting systems such as Power BI Experience in producing artefacts and documents Experience working with data / datamart / data warehouse / data lake Strong experience with data analysis environments and incorporation of varying data sources and Business Intelligence tools What’s In It For You 6 Month Contract + potential for extensions Government Agency CBD Location - Working from Home Please apply today to secure an interview or call Xavier Cusack on 9236 7752 for a further discussion.

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Reporting / Business Intelligence
Requirements: About The Role  RPMGlobal is currently seeking a Senior Data Architect to develop a common reporting and business intelligence capability based on industry standards across the RPM product suite.  The successful candidate will have proven development skills in SQL  SSRS  Power BI  data manipulation  and enterprise reporting tools with a strong background in data analysis. The role will be responsible for delivering new reporting and analysis solutions to our customers to support statutory reporting  operational reporting  performance reports and user drive analysis tools to drive key business and commercial decisions.  This is a permanent  full-time role  based in RPM's head office in the Brisbane CBD. Our Technology team work in a flexible  hybrid environment  and you may be able to work a portion of time remotely as part of this role. You will be required to be in the greater Brisbane area and can attend team events and meetings in our Brisbane office as required.  Key Responsibilities Work collaboratively with the team to define and own the product strategy and roadmap. Translate business requirements into reporting and analysis specifications. Maintain regular and open communication with key stakeholders and other Product Managers. Present formal analysis  insights and strategic decisions to the management team. Articulate and communicate the product vision  strategy and roadmap to stakeholders Design and develop reporting standards and templates to be used across RPMGlobal solutions. Present complex data in a usable visual interface to drive decision making and performance Provide Technical sales and pre-sales support (customer presentations  tender responses and proposals) Ensure governance  data quality  completeness and accuracy of metadata  are integral to everything developed on the platform About You Experienced in product design and requirements documentation Ability to work within a team and provide direction to other team members Proven understanding of ‘cloud’ technologies and engineering products A confident analytical problem solver who is detail orientated A background in data architecture and analysis. Minimum of 3+ years’ experience in a similar role with a background in data analytics. Tertiary qualifications in ICT or a related discipline such as statistics or maths. Strong working knowledge of SQL  SSRS and Power BI  data manipulation  and reporting tools and processes. Experience in designing analytics solutions. Knowledge of statistical tools. Exposure to marketing environment and commercial experience a plus. Good written and spoken English. Legally entitled to work in Australia. About RPMGlobal  RPMGlobal is the mining industry’s leading advisory and consulting  enterprise technology and training provider and has been at the forefront of change and innovation in the mining industry for over 50 years.  We advance the mining industry towards a safer  more efficient  and more sustainable future through the delivery of innovative software solutions and deep domain mining expertise. Guided by our underlying principles of mining expertise  innovation  and sustainability  we strive to create safer and more efficient operations for our mining customers.  Our focus on providing advanced mining advisory and consulting  enterprise technology and training across the mining lifecycle  enables us to guide customers through the current and emerging challenges the industry faces worldwide. This includes helping them meet the shift in social norms and consumer and investor ESG related expectations.  Please  no agencies or recruiters.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Requirements: James Cook University (JCU) is committed to creating a brighter future for life in the Tropics worldwide through graduates and discoveries that make a difference. We now have an exciting opportunity for a Business Intelligence Analyst to join our team in the Planning  Performance and Analytics Directorate. The position is full time  continuing and based at the Townsville Bebegu Yumba campus  Douglas. Remuneration is $97 118 - $111 524 per annum plus superannuation.  WHAT YOU CAN ACCOMPLISH IN THE ROLE JCU’s Business Intelligence Project supports and enlightens staff with business information and analytics to enhance decision making capabilities. Responsible for the design  development  resilience  data integrity and support of the University’s business analytics environment  you will work closely with Cognos users across the University to define and deliver new information assets and deliver value on existing information assets to the organisation. Working within an agile development team  you will be involved in end to end processes through gathering business requirements  assisting with sourcing data  testing  modelling  and building and delivering the final Cognos report or dashboard solution.  WHAT YOU WILL BRING TO THE ROLE You’ll be an established professional progressing towards a postgraduate degree  with experience in the use and/or administration of Business Intelligence and Analytical Software programs including Dimensional Design/Modelling and OLAP technologies  Structured Query Language and JavaScript. Confident working within agile projects  you’ll have high level analytical and problem-solving skills with capacity for innovation in dealing with complex business requirements and processes. Strong interpersonal communication  knowledge sharing  training and presentation skills will see you communicating effectively with stakeholders across all levels  whilst you work autonomously under broad direction  manage priorities and deadlines efficiently and collaborate with the team to achieve collective results and successful outcomes.  WHY JCU? JCU offers a culturally diverse working environment with opportunities for professional and personal growth.  We support our people through the provision of  • A generous superannuation scheme with up to 17% employer contributions to UniSuper • Five weeks annual recreation leave • Attractive options for salary packaging • Fitness Passport • Employee Assistance Program • Online media subscriptions • Corporate discount on health insurance • Ongoing career and professional development support • Well-equipped campus facilities including an on-campus medical centre  cafes  gym and childcare.  HOW TO APPLY If you are interested in contributing to this valuable area of our University  please visit the Careers at JCU website for further information. Vacancy reference 17899. Applications close on the 27th of April 2022 at 11:59 PM.

Title: Master Data & Reporting Analyst
Requirements: Posted by Jess Walker Talent Acquisition Specialist | We're Hiring!| 7-Eleven Send InMail Why 7-Eleven?  We're an agile  human centred organisation and our people are at the core of everything we do. This is a true place to learn and grow whilst developing your career. We work hard to embrace diversity and inclusion and encourage everyone at 7-Eleven to bring their authentic selves to work every day.  Open office layout (in a great location – Richmond) which promotes collaboration  conversation and teamwork to drive results A flexible  remote-friendly work environment where people can enjoy a mix of WFH and in-office collaboration 2 days paid volunteer leave per year Free 7Eleven coffee and snacks in the office Social Committee club with regular events A strong focus on your development including unlimited access to Linkedin Learning  The role Create data standards and data management processes ensuring a high level of data quality Work with business teams to develop a data quality mindset Create data quality dashboards and monitor data quality Identify opportunities for continuous improvement Implement processes to measure the adherence to master data standards Identify and implement areas of data quality improvements Provide support to resolve any data issues identified Gatekeeper for promotion and material master data management and maintenance Develop and deliver timely planning reports and KPIs  What’s in your toolkit Relevant experience in a similar data role Experience in working with large and complex sets of data Experience in solving capacity issues working with internal and external stakeholders Experience in developing reports SAP experience Interpersonal skills which turn data into insight/action Good business acumen and an understanding of the inter-relationships between functions High level of attention to detail  thorough analytical skills  Want to work at 7-Eleven? - Good Call!

Title: Data Engineer
Requirements: Description: Mentoring programs – receive support and coaching to progress your career Health & Well-being – Gym discounts  Fitness First  Xtend Barre  HealthPass… the list goes on! Technology discounts – from Apple  HP  Lenovo  Windows… the list goes on! Our diverse Data & AI team comprises over 500 specialist practitioners across Australia  each of whom are constantly curious and excited about combining their business acumen and technological expertise to create data-centric solutions that help solve complex problems and transform  or reinvent our client’s business.  Our Data & AI teamwork with public and private sector clients helping them to design and implement world leading solutions and capabilities. From solving air and ground transport network issues through our industry-first Optimal Reality digital twin solution  bringing automation capabilities to vaccine rollout programs  to helping our clients move to a sustainable world  we are the partner of choice for our clients and our alliance vendors.  Our relationships with market leading vendors such as AWS  Microsoft  Google  Apple  Snowflake  Salesforce  and Informatica enable our practitioners to be at the forefront of new and emerging capabilities and to deliver our suite of services at scale. We are consistently recognised as leaders in Cloud  Data  Analytics and AI  including in the latest analyst reports.  About The Role  Our Data & AI practice brings the full suite of services that focus on applying intelligence across the entire data  analytics automation  and AI Value chain. This means bringing together expertise across Business analysis data engineering data management & services ML/AI data science  data architecture  modelling  reporting & visualisation.  In order to do this  we are looking to build cutting edge AI solutions to solve our clients’ hardest problems. And to do that we need a team of dedicated specialists who have the desire to build great products and go “in the field” to where our clients need those AI solutions to become a reality. This role will start off in product development  and eventually transition to being a full-time professional services consultant working on deploying AI & Data solutions directly to our clients.  Enough About Us  Let’s Talk About You  As a Consultant or Senior Consultant  you will use your technology consulting skills to work with clients to deeply understand their challenges and build next generation  cloud-based solutions using leading data & AI tools. And be granted the opportunity to learn from leading experts in both business acumen & technical domains.  You are someone with: 2+ years of experience in Data Analytics delivery preferably in either professional services or software engineering teams Software development and coding experience (e.g. Python) a plus Data engineering and data visualisation skills building robust analytical models and solutions to deliver actionable insights & outcomes for business users using enterprise tools such as Tableau  Power BI etc Experience in building and implementing Data and Analytics solutions using industry best practice tools  technologies  and methods Working in large scale cloud data solutions using cloud platforms such as AWS  GCP  Snowflake or Microsoft Azure Experience with Data Warehousing techniques and technologies  with advanced SQL skills Experience with data migration  data integration and data management tools (e.g.  Talend  Informatica  Collibra) Next Steps  Sound exactly like the sort of role for you? Apply now!  By applying to this job  you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte employee experience globally.  At Deloitte  we know we’re at our best when we look out for one another  prioritise respect  fairness  development  and wellbeing  foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of their background  experience  identity  ability or thinking style  and if you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process for accessibility reasons this is available upon request. The preferred candidate will be subject to background screening by Deloitte or by their external third-party provider.

Title: Data Security Analyst
Requirements: At Canva  we create tools that empower the world to design. Our mission is to democratise design and empower creativity for anyone and everyone  on every platform! Inspired by a team of talented thinkers  an amazing culture and remarkable growth trajectory – we’re out to change the world  one design at a time.  Since launch in August 2013 we have grown exponentially  amassing over 65 million active users across 190 different countries who have created more than 7 Billion designs. We are one of the world’s fastest-growing technology companies and we have only achieved about 1% of what we are capable of! About Security Data Analysts At Canva  we’re all constantly striving towards our Crazy Big Goals! As the features and services of our product suite evolve  we’re setting some large and ambitious goals. We need to be able to earn the trust of the Canva Community by delivering secure and stable services without sacrificing speed and scale of delivery  which is where our Security Data Analysts come in.  As a Security Data Analyst  it is your mission to analyse and interpret our security data to support Security Group decision making. You will analyse security vulnerability  configuration  log  and incident data to generate insights  quantify inputs to information security risk frameworks  and to measure the impact of changes to security controls. This work will directly influence how the Security Group prioritises its roadmap. You will also support security engineers with data analysis during security incidents and as part of threat detection engineering. About the Security Group The Security Group is responsible for protecting Canva systems and data from information security threats. Our teams work together  and with other groups  to deliver preventive and detective controls and processes that reduce security risk. The group runs programs across Identity and Access Management  Application Security  Risk Management  and Threat Detection and Response domains.  What you’ll be doing Help us understand how effective our security controls and programs are – we want you to be creative and insightful  leading the group’s thinking on how to measure our services Analyse and interpret our security data  so that we can identify and adjust to new trends Build and maintain dashboards for our security teams that tell a visual story  and make them look really good – you don’t need to be a designer or have any design talent  you just need to want to build things that look cool Produce data-driven projections for security  financial  and operational metrics  and refine those projections over time to improve accuracy Work with product managers  engineers  and others  to figure out what data we should collect  and how we should collect it Ensure that our data is robust and faithfully represents what we intended to measure Mentor and train future analysts as they join the team at Canva Use our mathematical  analytical  and statistical methods with our giant databases to answer the sort of questions that sound really simple but turn out to be extremely challenging (and fun!)  Required Experience Strong competency with SQL  experience with data warehouses such as Snowflake  Redshift  or AWS Athena/Glue/S3 Experience with large  real-world data sets Experience wrangling and analysing data using Python or R Basic working knowledge of information security concepts and data sets such as vulnerability data  security incident data  system configuration data  and security event logs Experience defining reports and dashboards inside off the shelf software  as well as BI tools such as Looker or Tableau Experience building dashboards that effectively communicate results and outcomes Strong communication skills - verbal and written - be able to break down complex topics into simple solutions and ideas. Stakeholder management skills are vital in this role. Beneficial Experience (not required  but helpful) A grounding in mathematics / statistics and/or a bachelor's degree in a STEM area Experience with very large data sets  The Canva workspace is set up for you to do your best work and have a great time doing so  with breakout areas  little nooks  and quiet places to retreat.  If you're seeking professional growth and enjoy working on large  distributed  cloud-based applications that delight our millions of individual and business users alike - then apply now to be considered for the position!  If you require visa sponsorship  you must ensure you have at least two (2) years of post-University commercial experience as a Software Engineer and meet the mandatory sponsorship requirements laid out by the Department of Home Affairs.  We will not accept or review any CVs from external recruitment agencies.

Title: GIS & Spatial Data Analyst
Requirements: Posted by Nadene Barretto - Eight Recruitment Director at Eight Recruitment - 8% Fees for Permanent Recruitment Send InMail Join a team of 3 in the GIS & Spatial Data team where there is a lot of autonomy on offer with lots of room for innovation whilst being mentored and working alongside some of the best  · Large multidisciplinary consultancy projects + the nimbleness of a boutique firm · Open to Part-Time  Full-Time and WFH options · One of only a few consultancies based in NSW that can demonstrate experience working on large scale executable mine closure plans  YOUR NEW EMPLOYER Starting out 3 years ago in their garage  this team has grown to 24  but not just any 24 – the best of the best 24! Based in the Hunter Valley and with offices in Canberra and Wollongong  your new employer. works for both private sector and government clients within the Mining  Quarries  Port  Infrastructure and Agriculture sectors. Specialising in delivering end-to-end life of facility environmental management and advisory consulting services  they work closely with their clients to integrate and achieve positive environmental  business and community outcomes.  Their "why" is to be a firm of a results-driven group of people who like to have fun whilst working with their clients to deliver great projects that are good for both the business  the environment & the communities in which they operate. They are able to offer you all the benefits that come from working in a much larger consultancy  including a competitive salary  ongoing professional support  career development and a great opportunity plus the chance to work on key projects that are leading edge in mine site rehabilitation and closure.   YOUR NEW ROLE Providing drafting (GIS) spatial data management  analysis  and technical knowledge for reports and calculations  your new employer is one of only a small group of consultancies in NSW that can demonstrate delivery of executable mine closure plans. Your new role will have you working with their established project teams to deliver on existing projects across the mining  port  extractives and rail sectors. In addition  you will be providing support and input into some of our key innovation initiatives that they are working on in their mine closure and rehabilitation projects   ABOUT YOU Qualification in GIS  Geospatial Science  Geodetics  computer science  or equivalent. Minimum 2 years' experience working in a multidisciplinary technical or business consulting environment Detailed ESRI product suite experience including ArcGIS Pro  ArcGIS Enterprise / Online Experience with EIS  Management Plan and Environmental drafting Basic knowledge of CAD and file conversions Data Management   .

Title: Data Analyst and System Administrator - Prince of Wales Hospital Foundation
Requirements: Posted by Malcolm Duncan Owner at The Insight Group Send InMail Full Time or Part time option Based in Randwick  offering the flexibility of home/office work $110K plus remuneration package  The Prince of Wales Hospital Foundation is an established health promotion charity  which works to build community and private partnerships to raise vital funds and awareness for the continued development of health promotion  research  education  equipment  facilities  and special projects. We are offering a permanent position with the option of full-time or part-time  working in a flexible environment. You will have the opportunity to develop your skills by working across several engaging and challenging projects  whilst supporting an impactful cause that supports meaningful change across the healthcare sector. The Foundation is paving the way for advancements in healthcare through innovation and technology for generations to come. Do you want to be part of our journey to create real  scalable change that could impact you and your family’s future? If so  we’d love to meet you! What we are looking for A senior CRM and Data Administrator with experience in the non-profit space who is familiar with Salesforce or is looking to retrain to Salesforce and apply their high-level experience and knowledge. Ideally  you are a creative and analytical self-starter who can demonstrate a problem-solving mindset and show a curiosity to constantly improve processes to create better efficiencies and data insights.  Reporting to the Director of Fundraising  you would be responsible for the development and support of all aspects of the Prince of Wales Hospital Foundation suite of business systems and associated applications built on the Salesforce platform. With scope across these platforms you will need to demonstrate flexible thinking and adaptability across the evolving landscape of campaigns and operational requirements. A team player with an investigative and solution-driven mindset would suit this position.  Your responsibilities include  · Ensuring that processes  automations and integrations operate as designed and analyse  troubleshoot and resolve (often complex) issues · Escalating product-related issues to external vendors and working collaboratively to find a resolution · Developing or enhancing solutions in associated tools for new processes or user requirements · System administration including user and license management  configuring security and permissions  system access · Supporting the fundraising team in managing the movement and manipulation of data  including running reports  prepare segmented data  import and export data from external vendors · Develop end-user documentation and guides  including business rules  step-by-step guides  process maps  videos and training material  Skills and experience we’d like you to have: · Minimum 3 years’ experience supporting  administrating  and developing solutions in the non-profit space. · Experience with Salesforce desired but we are open to consider the right candidate with extensive experience with other CRM systems in the non-profit space · Business Analysis skills including process mapping and process design · Experience in producing end-user documentation including step-by-step guides  process maps  videos and training materials · Experience in training or coaching team members in complex processes · Demonstrated stakeholder engagement skills in establishing requirements  estimating work effort and communicating delivery schedule · Ability to adapt to changing demands as part of a collaborative team   What we can offer you · An environment and culture built on the importance of teamwork  collaboration and shared purpose · Sector leading salary packaging and a competitive salary commensurate with the NFP sector · A balance of working in the office and from home as staff wellbeing and organisational culture is important to our values · A positive and values-driven work culture which celebrates our achievements and recognises our teams’ collective and individual efforts   How to apply  To apply for this great opportunity please submit your CV and a Cover Letter  outlining your experience and highlighting your strength to The Insight Group at search9@insgroup.com.au

Title: Analyst - Azure Data Engineer
Requirements: Job Description  Digital disruption is opening more opportunities for businesses to connect with their customers and accelerate the realization of business value.  Avanade – The World’s Premier Microsoft Consultancy  Avanade is the world’s leading Microsoft consultancy and is the ultimate destination for consultants who specialize in Microsoft technology. Our vision is to be the leading digital innovator through the power of people and the Microsoft ecosystem. We are 50 000 consultants strong and growing. Diversity and inclusion are baked into our DNA  as is flexibility. We empower our people to deliver awesome solutions for our clients  and our unsurpassed experience in the Microsoft space enables us to place our people on the most challenging  rewarding engagements. Career progression opportunities at Avanade are world-leading  as are our benefits. If you’re a modern Microsoft professional  this is where you need to be.  As a Analyst - Azure Data Engineer at Avanade  you will use comprehensive modern data engineer techniques and methods with Advanced Analytics to support business decisions for Avanade clients. You’re a data designer who knows how to find  store  and present a range of information from different sources so that everyone can access what they need quickly and simply  and use it effectively.  Key Role Responsibilities:  You design and set up projects that bring together information from a variety of sources  to enable analysis and decision-making. You make sure that data is accessible and easy to use  so that it can be used for routine and ad-hoc analysis. Be able to analyse current business practices  processes  and procedures as well as identifying future business opportunities for leveraging Microsoft Azure Data & Analytics PaaS Services. Support the planning and implementation of data design services  providing sizing and configuration assistance  and performing needs assessments. Delivery of architectures for transformations and modernizations of enterprise data solutions using Azure cloud data technologies. Design and Build Modern Data Pipelines and Data Streams. Design and Build Data Service APIs. Develop and maintain data warehouse schematics  layouts  architectures  and relational/non-relational databases for data access and Advanced Analytics. Expose data to end-users using PowerBI  Azure API Apps  or any other modern visualization platform or experience. Implement effective metrics and monitoring processes. Travel as needed  Key Role Skill & Capability Requirements:  Strong experience as an Azure Data Engineer Demonstrated experience of turning business use cases and requirements into technical solutions. Understanding on Azure Data Factory  Azure Data Lake  Azure SQL DW  and Azure SQL  Azure App Service is required. Experience in business processing mapping of data and analytics solutions. Ability to conduct data profiling  cataloguing  and mapping for technical design and construction of technical data flows. The ability to apply such methods to solve business problems using one or more Azure Data and Analytics services in combination with building data pipelines  data streams  and system integration. Experience preparing data for use in Azure Machine Learning and/or Azure Databricks is a plus. Big Data components such as Kafka  Spark SQL  Data frames  HIVE DB etc. and their implementation using Azure Data Bricks Experience in migration from on-premises Spark environment to Azure using Azure Data bricks PowerShell scripting Experience in structured problem solving. You don’t hesitate to roll up your sleeves to solve code related issues.  Preferred Education Background:  You likely possess MS/ Ph.D. in a quantitative field such as computer science  applied mathematics  statistics  or machine learning. An equivalent combination of education and experience will also suffice.  What We Offer You  Come for the distinctive experiences you have helping forward-thinking corporations  non-profits  and governments push the boundaries of digital innovation. Stay for the limitless learning opportunities that encourage you to master Microsoft and pursue big ideas. Enjoy ambitious growth for yourself as part of Avanade’s people-first culture with benefits like employee share purchasing  flexible work arrangements  a commitment to diversity and inclusion  and competitive pay.  Benefits Of Being An Avanade Employee  Additional 5 days personal Leave + Opportunity to purchase extra annual leave Wellbeing & Gadget Allowance Flexible working arrangements Generous parental leave Corporate private health insurance discounts Up to 80 hours of training per year  This role requires direct contact with Avanade clients as well as attendance in person at Avanade workplaces and other company-sponsored meetings and events. In order to comply with our client requirements and Avanade’s own health and safety obligations  this role requires the Applicant to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19. Proof of vaccination will be required during the application process. Applicants who have appropriate written proof of a medical or religious reason for not being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 may provide such documentation.  About Avanade  Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital  cloud and advisory services  industry solutions and design-led experiences across the Microsoft ecosystem. Every day  our 56 000 professionals in 26 countries make a genuine human impact for our clients  their employees and their customers.  We have been recognized as Microsoft’s Global SI Partner of the Year more than any other company. With the most Microsoft certifications (60 000+) and 18 (out of 18) Gold-level Microsoft competencies  we are uniquely positioned to help businesses grow and solve their toughest challenges.  We are a people first company  committed to providing an inclusive workplace where employees feel comfortable being their authentic selves. As a responsible business  we are building a sustainable world and helping young people from underrepresented communities fulfil their potential.  Majority owned by Accenture  Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com .

Title: Senior Business Insights & Reporting Analyst
Requirements: What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating many opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.  At Cognizant  together with your colleagues from all around the world  you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible  more innovative and successful. Moreover  this is your chance to be part of the success story.  Position Summary  Job Description Senior Business Insights & Reporting Analyst will be leading the agile data platform team  which will have the responsibility for supporting and enhancing project development. Expert level analytical and technical skills in data warehouse techniques for achieving business intelligence solutions Have strong experience of working in Insurance domain and expertise on the way Insurance business works. In-depth understanding of current Australian insurance products e.g. Term and trauma products  income protection products. Should lead the data warehousing track and should be able to translate business requirements into mapping documents and handle the technical transformation. Analytical mind set and capable of breaking complex problems into parts and identify the impact of changes on other businesses and systems. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Includes ability to explore alternatives to reach outcomes that are supported by multiple parties. Expert in implementing ITIL framework and capable of working in Agile methodology. Mandatory Skills Must have 7+ years of work experience in Qliksense  Alteryx and Cognos platforms. Must have AZURE certified Azure Data Engineer Associate. Must have 4+ years of hands on experience in Qliksense administration and able to perform installation and upgrades. 2+ Years of experience in providing data analysis and reporting using SQL and PowerBI Must have expert level work experience in Alteryx server administration and able to develop and configure workflow  schedule jobs and user administration. Must have expert level work experience in creating and producing NPRINTING reports. Should have experience in ServiceNow tool. Have expert level skills and hands on experience in UNIX and complex Shell scripting. Should have working experience in BIG data techniques using Horton works architecture. Must have worked in AGILE environment using JIRA and working in sprints. Have strong experience of working with schedulers like CRONTAB  Control M  Autosys. Expert level hands on knowledge in DB2 and SQL server scripting  Stored Procedures etc. Should have hands on experience in SSIS reporting frameworks. Good knowledge in other BI Tools like Informatica  Tableau and Spotfire. Leading the different cycles (requirements  development  and testing) of the BI solutions. Using data warehouse concepts to create data marts for better reporting capability. Proficient in software development life cycle and methodologies. Skilled in cultivating positive relationships with client and colleagues. Duties And Responsibilities Develop insights and identify trends  opportunities  and continuous improvement initiatives from modeling and trend analysis Work closely with the Project Analyst to support the team with data interpretation and technology needs Execute data analysis activities  including data validation  data discovery  data issue investigations. Contribute to business growth and planning initiatives as well as opportunity identification Establish core understanding of new data sets and aid stakeholders technical and non-technical in understanding these. Discussing and communicating with client to clearly understand the requirements. Should be responsible for understanding business requirements  creating logical mapping documents out of them  preparing the data model and translating that into data warehouse solutions using Qlik Sense  Cognos and Alteryx. Should be very prompt and analytical to find out BI shortcomings and work towards achieving the same. Should take care of ServiceNow tickets like Incident and Change. Should take care of fixing DataStage production issues. Must be responsible for production deployment activities. Should work as a data analyst for translating the business requirements to valid mapping sheets and technical descriptions. Leading the different cycles (requirements  development and testing) of the BI solutions. Maintaining the tools used (DataStage  Cognos  Qlik Sense  DB2  IIDR  Unix) and monitoring the daily usage and schedules of the data loads. Analyze the data from the policy administration databases and the workflow system to create data dictionaries. Collaborate with technical architects  cross functional BAs  and team members to design BI solutions Analyze and estimate incoming business requirements. Responsible for production deployment activities. Energetic  motivated and adaptable to changes. Fosters a collaborative culture with team members. Excellent prioritization and time management skills. Able to work independently and in a team. Qualifications & Certifications Master of computer applications 2006 Azure Data certification: Azure Data Engineer Associate Azure Data Fundamentals Azure Fundamentals Salary: >$100 000 Next steps  If you feel this opportunity suits you  or Cognizant is the type of organization you would like to join  we want to have a conversation with you! Please apply directly with us.  For a complete list of open opportunities with Cognizant  visit http://www.cognizant.com/careers  Cognizant is committed to providing Equal Employment Opportunities. Successful candidates will be required to undergo a background check.
