Title: Taxonomy Data Engineer - Australian Citizens Only
Requirements: KPMG Australia is part of a global network providing extensive services across a wide range of industries and sectors. Our people collaborate  share their expertise and create innovation as we partner with clients to solve complex challenges  empower change  drive disruption and growth. We look for talented people with the potential to make an extraordinary difference for our clients  our firm and our communities.  KPMG Data & Cloud is a team with a passion for helping our clients solve their business challenges. We achieve this through technology-based solutions that unlock insights and value from data and leverage innovative cloud-based solutions. Leveraging the “One KPMG” approach  our team works collaboratively with the wider KPMG service lines to provide our clients with industry-specific  tailored proposals that result in highly differentiated business transformation outcomes.  We re-imagine and re-invent organizations to become world class enterprises using advanced technologies  data and human insights. We help organizations to embrace Data Strategy  Artificial Intelligence (AI) & Cognitive  the Internet of Things (IoT)  Data  Analytics & Modelling and more.  Your new role  The Taxonomy Data Engineer is the designer  of the information or data structures and management pipelines  defining  designing and modelling data and data structures for analytical or operational use  or technical development. The Taxonomy Data Engineer will work with Data Engineers to document the design  construction  use of data and data pipelines to pull together information from different source systems that integrate  consolidate  cleanse  and monitor the data. They will ensure the stability and scalability of clients’ systems and data platforms.  You will work proactively to Drive a technical roadmap for the team  covering non-functional requirements such as scalability  reliability  and observability Assess new and existing data sources on their applicability to address the business issue and translate the outcomes of the analytical solutions we design in the context of business impacts and benefits. Collaborate with taxonomy operations to investigate enterprise data requirements where there is some complexity and ambiguity. Provide advice and guidance to Data Engineers and Data Scientists using the data structures and associated components. Define  model  and catalogue data structures and data pipelines using industry standard methods  notation and toolsets Understand  explain and evangelize buzz words such as serverless  cloud-native  and PaaS and how they impact the design of Data Pipelines Be comfortable with code or tool-based data pipelines and understand the pro and cons of each. Design  develop and implement the automated approach for productionising model scoring and the closed-loop feedback paths required to support test and learn. Select and configure analytics toolsets considering the clients’ business issues and analytic maturity.   In addition to your focus on client engagements  you will contribute to the definition and enhancement of data engineering and DataOps disciplines within the practice.  You bring to the role A proven ability to undertake the responsibilities and requirements of the role  as listed above. Degree in Data Science  Computer Science  Information Technology  Engineering or equivalent. Experience with and knowledge of DCAM  DAMA  CPG 235  and other similar industry frameworks and regulations is preferred. Knowledge of data structures  data modeling and database schema. A sound understanding of data technologies  data governance  data management  analytics and insights  and business process-based solutions and the application of such solutions to deliver new business capabilities. Excellent interpersonal  oral and written communication skills  with a knack for distilling complex and/or technical problems in environments that are often ambiguous. A proven ability to develop and manage enduring client relationships  engendering a sense of trust and respect. Demonstrable industry knowledge  understanding the way your primary industry functions and how data can be collected  analyzed and utilized. Experience with a range of technical skills that could include Knowledge of architecting and engineering cloud-based data solutions with the following products Cloud platforms with a focus on Paas or Serverless AWS Redshift/RDS  S3  EC2  step  EMR  Glue  DynamoDB  Athena  Kinesis  Cloudwatch  SQS  SNS  fargate OR Azure Blob storage  Synapse  Data Factory  Functions  log analytics  Event hub  Azure Kubernetes Service Big Data technologies such as Hadoop  Hudi  Storm  NiFi  HBase  Hive  Zepplin  Kafka  Ranger  Ambari. Programming languages such as Java  Node  C#  Go  Python  Scala  SAS  R. Oracle ETL tool experience is desirable Experience with DevOps principles and tools  including Agile enterprise development environments  CICD implementation  continuous testing  Cloud resource management (CloudFormation  terraform  ARM templates  pulumi etc..)  automation of environment deployment. Continuous Integration/Delivery tools such as AWS code  Azure DevOps or other similar industry tools Version control and development processes for data  low-level hardware and software configurations  and the code and configuration specific to each tool in the chain. A proven ability to Build resilient  tested  data pipelines with statistical data quality monitoring embedded (DataOps) Work with an existing lifecycle management framework to collect metadata  follow coding standards  use version control  complete documentation and write and execute unit tests. Appropriately communicate discovered information to consumers  clearly using visual variables shape  colour  hue  orientation  etc. Experience with SQL-based technologies (e.g. PostgreSQL and MySQL) and NoSQL technologies (e.g. Cassandra and MongoDB) Experience of Data lake and Data warehousing solutions and architectures and low-level design principles Data modelling tools (e.g. ERWin  Enterprise Architect and Visio) High-level understanding of statistical analysis and modelling  predictive analytics  text analytics and other machine learning applications and how to extract insight from data. A sound understanding of digital and cognitive technologies and analytics  information management and business process-based solutions. A disciplined approach to problem solving and an ability to critically assess a range of information to differentiate true business needs as opposed to user requests. An ability to work within a multidisciplinary team to seek and provide requirements to team members responsible for different pipeline areas. Must be an Australian citizen to meet clearance request guidelines. Department of Defence or similar Federal Government department experience is desirable NV1 security clearance or higher   Mandatory Requirement Australian Citizens Only  What can we offer you?  As you join our high-growth part of the business  we offer you a unique chance work in a social and dynamic team environment  work with high-profile clients  and provide active coaching and mentoring on engagements! As a leading global professional services firm  we are also dedicated to providing our employees with A culture focused on harmony  trust and collaboration Opportunities to work on larger  diverse and more complex projects. Putting your skills and experience to the test! Encouragement and support of ongoing learning and career development across the business. Because how you grow matters! Opportunities to collaborate and link across borders and globally with sector and technical experts in all parts of our business Be involved in KPMG's support of numerous organisations in the areas of education  social inclusion and health including our Reconciliation Action Plan and Global Green Initiative. Participation in the performance-based variable pay (bonus) scheme. Enjoy employee benefits including salary packaging options  employee discounts  reward schemes  and more!   The KPMG Difference  At KPMG  we’re passionate about creating an inclusive workplace that promotes and values diversity. We believe that everyone’s unique experiences enable us to deliver meaningful benefits for our people  our clients and communities. We welcome and encourage applications from people of all backgrounds  ages  religions  including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples  LGBTIQ+ people  those with a disability  women and people with a cultural or linguistically diverse background.  We embrace flexibility as a key principle to allow our people to manage the changing demands of work  personal and family life.  KPMG has a decade-long  proud commitment to Indigenous Australia  as demonstrated by the achievement of an Elevate level Reconciliation Action Plan. KPMG is a foundation member and Principal Partner of Pride in Diversity started in Australia by ACON and the Diversity Council of Australia  and is recognised in the Australian Workplace Equality Index (AWEI) which evaluates LGBTIQ+ inclusiveness in the workplace. KPMG Australia has been consistently recognised as an Employer of Choice in the Australian Government’s Workplace Gender Equality Agency(WGEA) annual index.  Make KPMG the clear choice for your career and be Extraordinary!  How you grow matters | Environmental  sustainability  governance | KPMG Australia - YouTube

Title: Senior Analytics and Insights Analyst
Requirements: Two of Australia’s leading telecommunication companies  Vodafone Hutchison Australia and TPG  have come together to form TPG Telecom Limited. TPG Telecom has a powerhouse of brands which include Vodafone  TPG  iiNet  Internode  Lebara  AAPT and felix. As the second largest telecommunications company listed on the ASX  TPG Telecom has a strong challenger spirit and a commitment to delivering the best services and products to our customers. We are driving competition and choice for businesses and consumers across Australia.  This role will support the delivery of TPG Telecom Limited’s commercial strategy through the effective management of the Vodafone customer base. You will be part of a highly motivated team and a customer transformation program working on interesting and difficult problems. As an integral member of the team  you will be responsible for the delivery of our next best action campaign analysis and customer insights with commercial outcomes.  What you work on will have a direct impact on shaping the future of Vodafone customers  and will help shape key business decisions and activities. You will have a strong quantitative or technical background with experience working with large datasets and solving tough problems. You will be a highly intelligent self-starter  with a bias towards action and attention to detail  able to turn information into actionable insights  Key Responsibilities And Tasks  Analysing large  complex datasets to reveal underlying patterns  correlations  and trends. Examine customer behaviour using internal & external datasets to design and develop analytical models and their optimisation. Drive analytics & business cases to come up with new ideas for promotions and campaigns to change the current behaviour by ensuring usage uplift and upgrading packages. Investigating performance of current products and translate insights into specific improvement suggestions & new feature proposals. Provide Insights and analysis on customer behaviours across the different customer lifecycle stages  report on campaign effectiveness and its impact to overall revenues and subscribers. Leveraging quantitative techniques to answer complex ad-hoc business problems. Drive and support financial/commercial modelling to inform business decisions. Business case development  financial modelling  and commercial analysis in relation to key projects and growth initiatives. Regularly update stakeholders on findings and insights to provide business strategy. Support the team with budgeting and forecasting. Representing CLM in external forums. Responsible for stakeholder management across TPG Telecom’s functions on the visibility of customer insights & campaign performance that drive growth in the customer base.  What We Need  Bachelor's Degree in a STEM subject or equivalent and 3-4+ years of relevant experience in solving large analytical problems using statistical  predictive analytical models or other quantitative methods.  including CRM related work. Exceptional analytical skills: in data manipulation (inc. SQL)  development of financial models  commercial analysis. Phyton or R a plus Demonstrated experience working with large datasets  understanding data structures  testing for data quality is essential  ideally via SQL database interrogation and distributed computing  Data visualizations tools like Qlik  Tableau would be a plus. Ability to translate high level business problems into objective  concise and logical requirements and present them to influence the business. Highly flexible  ability to handle changing directions/priorities and roles as business needs evolve Proven problem-solving skills  systematic  analytical thinker with strong communication skills Good team working attitude with the ability to work proactively under own initiative in a fast-paced environment. Commercial mindset and keen interest in telecommunications industry with a strong sense of ownership and gets things done  proactive attitude. Strong stakeholder management skills including the ability to advise and manage your projects autonomously. Good understanding of both the commercial and the tech side  which will enable you to proactively identify business use-cases  and to understand and work around tech constraints. A passion for data and analytics & high attention to detail. Effective presentation skills.  Benefits And Perks  Flexible hybrid way of working (from home and office) ‘Stay Connected Mobile’ – Access to a free mobile plan ‘Stay Connected NBN’ – Access to a free NBN 100 plan ‘Your Leave’ - an additional 4 days of leave to be used whenever you like - every year Access to TPG Learning Hub platform Access to Corporate Partner Discounts We are committed to attracting  developing and retaining the best people by offering a flexible  diverse and inclusive workplace where hard work is truly rewarded. You will have access to fantastic benefits  including generous leave policies  leadership development programs and opportunities to grow your career. You’ll be faced with loads of variety where no two days are ever the same in a collaborative workspace that helps drive innovation.  Interested? We are excited to hear from you!  To be considered for this role  you must be an AU/NZ Citizen or Permanent Resident.  At TPG Telecom we take all reasonably practicable steps to protect the health and safety of our people. The successful candidate is required to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19  due to the increased risk of infection and nature of the work. Please let our team know if there is anything you need to discuss about your individual circumstances.

Title: Data Ingestion Business Analyst
Requirements: Who is Equifax?  Equifax is a leading global data  analytic and technology company  supporting customers across 24 countries. There are lots of perks of being an Equifax employee – we offer additional leave days as we recognize the importance of taking time out  whether that’s to catch up on some rest  celebrate a birthday  or give back to our community by volunteering. Our outcomes focused culture encourages thought leadership and innovation to ensure our ongoing success.  We are supportive and revel in working together on exciting projects. Working within our diverse D&A team will provide you opportunities to gain exposure across all phases of the D&A lifecycle and work with some of our largest blue-chip customers. What are we looking for? In-depth knowledge and experience needed to operate independently with limited guidance and oversight. 5+ years’ experience in technical business analysis with advanced knowledge of SQL and system integration solutions/database analysis/data management 5+ years’ experience in leading projects / initiatives independently and in client support or customer service areas Technical competence and business acumen with high attention to details Ability to design and maintain efficient customer portal support and feedback channels. Excellent written and verbal communication skills  ability to present complex information simply and directly  Extra points for any of the following: Google Cloud experience Data Transformation experience Software Development experience Big Data Analysis experience Client facing skills  Success attributes of an Equifax employee  does this describe you? Accountable Brave Curious Collaborative Individualist Trustworthy Dedicated  At Equifax  there is no such thing as the 'perfect candidate'  Seeing responsibilities and competencies laid out on paper can be confronting. At this stage of the application process  sometimes imposter syndrome can creep in and mess with our confidence. Where possible  you should support your claims with specific examples of what you have done and how you did it.  However you identify  and whatever background you bring with you  please apply if this is a role that would make you excited to come to work every day!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Requirements: Convert data into information and information into insights & solutions with your skills in data discovery  business intelligence and analysis.    Join a trusted bank with a great culture and strong community focus Become part of a high performing team of skilled SMEs Full time with flexible work options 12 month fixed term contract starting June 2022   About the role  As a Business Intelligence Analyst in our Products & Analysis team you will support Bendigo and Adelaide Bank to achieve our vision of being Australia’s Bank of choice through identifying  executing and tracking outcomes of opportunities that will improve the financial performance of the Bank and provide better outcomes/experience for our Customers.  In this role you will design and develop dashboards and visualisations for internal stakeholders. You will leverage data and information from internal and external sources  applying analytical and data mining techniques to uncover actionable insights and answer business questions around the changing trends and future needs of our customers.  Join a high performing team of skilled SMEs who embrace collaboration and work in-step using Agile practices. While geographically dispersed  the team are virtually connected and therefore we’re open to people working remotely and will consider applicants based anywhere in Australia. This is a full time position with flexible work options  available as a 12 month maximum term contract starting June 2022.    Your knowledge & experience  We are looking for someone with the following technical experience:  Demonstrated experience in developing dashboards and visualisation solutions using tools such as Power BI. Database query experience such as SQL Server and Oracle. Experience with Python or R and with AWS/Amazon products will be highly regarded. Underneath your techy armour  there will be a creative problem solver with a passion about data and its ability to improve business performance. You can understand people’s problems  dive deep into the data  and persevere to deliver practical solutions which you can communicate in a meaningful and influential way to your stakeholders.    About Bendigo and Adelaide Bank  With more than 160 years of history  we are proud of our position in the community with more satisfied customers than any other Australian bank. Every day  we work hard to bring our company purpose to life  feeding into the success of our customers and communities and not off it.  We're more than just a bank with banking products. We change the lives of customers and communities. Commercial actions with heart!  Our time is now. We are challenging the status quo and we're excited about our future!      Why us?  There's so much more to a career with Bendigo and Adelaide Bank than just banking. Get real benefits  work life balance and flexibility. You bring your brilliant mind and we’ll help you take your learning to the next level with on the job training and external development opportunities - we want you to shine. After all  YOU are the difference that makes us the better big bank.  At Bendigo and Adelaide Bank we believe a diverse workforce supported by an inclusive culture is central to our success and we actively encourage applications from those who bring diversity of thought to our business. We support candidate requests for adjustment to accommodate an illness  injury or disability to equitably participate in the selection process.    Advertising closes 2nd May 2022.    It is a condition of employment with the Bank that you are fully vaccinated against COVID-19  unless you have a medical contraindication or acute illness which prevents you from receiving the vaccine and you provide satisfactory evidence of this to the Bank.

Title: Analyst - Customer Insights
Requirements: Hawaiian is a leading Western Australian property company with an extensive portfolio which includes shopping centres  office buildings and hospitality assets  employing a team of over 80 people.  With an innovative approach to business and strong company values  Hawaiian proudly services and supports the WA community. Through our many programs and partnerships  we aim to make a meaningful difference in the lives of people in our communities.  Our values at Hawaiian are clear. We are: Accountable  Collaborative  Passionate and Considerate. Hawaiian is proud to be a leading WA employer and we invite you to consider Hawaiian in your career journey.  An exciting opportunity has arisen to undertake the role of Analyst - Customer Insights on 12 month maternity contract  with the possibility of extension.  Working under the direction of the General Manager  Marketing  you will be responsible for providing sales  traffic and research insights to the Hawaiian retail team to assist with leasing  marketing and operational decisions.  Essential Duties Analyse the Sales and Traffic data generated from retail assets  overlaying it with other data sources to identify trends  shifts and opportunities that will have a strategic impact on the management of the assets. Weekly monitoring and reporting of Centre traffic patterns and in-Centre movements. Tactical projects including campaigns reviews and irregular research required by the retail teams. Review impact of marketing initiatives on Centre sales and traffic. Prepare portfolio and individual centre analysis on sales & traffic and provide commentary on market conditions for Quarterly Reports. Report on retail trends and impact on Hawaiian business. Manage primary (qualitative and quantitative) research  ensuring it is strategically appropriate for internal teams. This includes any intercept  phone  face-to-face or focus group research work that will be commissioned to external research experts. Customer Satisfaction Surveys and customer insight surveys. Preparing briefs for each external research project  including objectives  structure  timing  methodology and budget  liaising directly with the approved supplier. Analyse secondary (qualitative and quantitative) research  ensuring it is strategically appropriate for internal teams. This includes ABS  Census Urbis and Quantium to provide data to impact decisions around key strategic activities. Assist with the determination of the leasing strategy and marketing through the analysis and presentation of Quantium data. This includes development of leasing collateral  and insights to determine best possible leasing mix for the centre. Manage the company use of Survey Monkey for online research to Hawaiians digital communities  as requested by the retail teams. Qualification Requirements Bachelor’s Degree in a Business or Marketing discipline preferred. Required Skills And Attributes Practical experience in research including providing analysis across multiple reports to develop recommendations for changes to strategy and tactical execution. Intermediate to advanced experience in MS Excel. 2-5 Year experience in a similar role. Preferred Skills And Attributes Knowledge of and experience in retail marketing. Knowledge of and experience in managing research projects. Strong written and oral communication skills. High level of interpersonal and time management skills. High attention to detail. Take this opportunity to advance your career with a highly successful company that believes its best investment will always be its people.  If the above describes you and you are looking for a rewarding role within a great company then please submit a cover letter and your CV by clicking 'Apply Now'

We help public and private sector clients to design and implement world leading solutions and capabilities. From automated logistics problem-solving  to smarter defence systems with the Australian Defence Force  to better support for low cost housing - we are the partner of choice for our clients and alliance members.  Our relationships with market leading vendors such as AWS  Microsoft  Google  Apple  Snowflake  Salesforce  and Informatica enable our practitioners to be at the forefront of new and emerging capabilities and to deliver our suite of services at scale. We are consistently recognised as leaders in Cloud  Data  Analytics and AI  including in the latest analyst reports.  About The Role Help clients drive significant business outcomes and ROI by leveraging Intelligent system capabilities and insights uncovered through visualisation and statistical analysis Drive business process analysis and assessments for engagement opportunities  understand their challenges  and prepare documentation of solutions and implementation Understand the importance of operational security and the impact of good cyber practices in commercially and legislatively sensitive engagements Analyse  understand and document the business processes in detail where required and communicate effectively with business counterparts and stakeholders Extract  transform and load data from source systems to various data analytics tools Design solutions in accordance with Deloitte  client and vendor specific standards Configure new processes and technical objects using core architecture principles that are efficient  well structured  maintainable  and easy to understand Delivery and support of intelligent and analytics solutions by following best practices and delivery/support lifecycles Communicating with software vendor support team for technical issues and participating with other user community Working within project planning constraints  communicating any identified project risks and issues to the delivery/project manager accordingly and providing inputs to the change control process Guiding and supporting junior team members as required Knowledge And Experience Required At least 3 years of working experience in AI/ML and/or Analytics spaces. Experience in delivering technical solutions  including but not limited to Natural Language Processing  Computer Vision  Cognitive agents  and data visualisations. Experience working in environments with high operational security standards. Good understanding of data modelling  and ETL tools. Experience in Python  SQL  C++  SQL scripting  REST APIs or equivalent. Strong analytical and organisational skills and the ability to handle multiple high-priority projects that meet schedules on time. Ability to acquire and maintain an Australian Government Security Vetting Clearance of Baseline or NV1. Candidates who already cleared are encouraged to apply. In addition  the following experiences will be considered favourably Experience in consulting environment across diverse domains. Experience in Defence  Security of Justice sectors. Experience of software development projects  particularly analytics/data-science platforms or tools. Why Deloitte?  At Deloitte  we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders. We value difference  and embrace people with diverse backgrounds  experiences  gender identities  abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways  we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.  We’re committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace  where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural  disability  LGBTI+  Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality  we’re leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive.  We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress – check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space.  Next Steps  Sound exactly like the sort of role for you? Apply now  By applying to this job  you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte employee experience globally.  At Deloitte  we know we’re at our best when we look out for one another  prioritise respect  fairness  development and wellbeing  foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of their background  experience  identity  ability or thinking style  and if you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process for accessibility reasons this is available upon request.  The preferred candidate will be subject to background screening by Deloitte or by their external third-party provider.

Title: Analyst - Azure Data Engineer - Australian Citizenship Required
Requirements: Job Description  Digital disruption is opening more opportunities for businesses to connect with their customers and accelerate the realization of business value.  Avanade – The World’s Premier Microsoft Consultancy  Avanade is the world’s leading Microsoft consultancy and is the ultimate destination for consultants who specialize in Microsoft technology. Our vision is to be the leading digital innovator through the power of people and the Microsoft ecosystem. We are 50 000 consultants strong and growing. Diversity and inclusion are baked into our DNA  as is flexibility. We empower our people to deliver awesome solutions for our clients  and our unsurpassed experience in the Microsoft space enables us to place our people on the most challenging  rewarding engagements. Career progression opportunities at Avanade are world-leading  as are our benefits. If you’re a modern Microsoft professional  this is where you need to be.  As a Analyst / Sr. Analyst Azure Data Engineer at Avanade  you will use comprehensive modern data engineer techniques and methods with Advanced Analytics to support business decisions for Avanade clients. You’re a data designer who knows how to find  store  and present a range of information from different sources so that everyone can access what they need quickly and simply  and use it effectively.  Key Role Responsibilities:  Design and Build Modern Data Pipelines and Data Streams. Design and Build Data Service APIs. Develop and maintain data warehouse schematics  layouts  architectures  and relational/non-relational databases for data access and Advanced Analytics. Expose data to end-users using PowerBI  Azure API Apps  or any other modern visualization platform or experience. Implement effective metrics and monitoring processes. Travel as needed  Key Role Skill & Capability Requirements:  Minimum 3 years of experience as a Azure Data Engineer Demonstrated experience of turning business use cases and requirements into technical solutions. Good understanding on Azure Data Factory  Azure Data Lake  Azure SQL DW  and Azure SQL  Azure App Service is required. Experience in business processing mapping of data and analytics solutions. Ability to conduct data profiling  cataloguing  and mapping for technical design and construction of technical data flows. The ability to apply such methods to solve business problems using one or more Azure Data and Analytics services in combination with building data pipelines  data streams  and system integration. Knowledge of Python is a plus. Experience preparing data for Data Science and Machine Learning. Experience preparing data for use in Azure Machine Learning and/or Azure Databricks is a plus. Demonstrated experience preparing data and building data pipelines for AI Use Cases (text  voice  image  etc). Big Data components such as Kafka  Spark SQL  Data frames  HIVE DB etc. and their implementation using Azure Data Bricks Experience in migration from on-premises Spark environment to Azure using Azure Data bricks Read and write data in Azure Data bricks (preferred) Coding complex U-SQL  Spark (Scala or Python). T-SQL Good Understanding of Modern Data Warehouse/Lambda Architecture  Data warehousing concepts PowerShell scripting Experience in structured problem solving. You don’t hesitate to roll up your sleeves to solve code related issues.  Preferred Education Background:  You likely possess MS/ Ph.D. in a quantitative field such as computer science  applied mathematics  statistics  or machine learning. An equivalent combination of education and experience will also suffice.  Benefits of being an Avanade Employee  Additional 5 days personal Leave + Opportunity to purchase extra annual leave Wellbeing & Gadget Allowance Flexible working arrangements Generous parental leave Corporate private health insurance discounts Up to 80 hours of training per year  What We Offer You  Come for the distinctive experiences you have helping forward-thinking corporations  non-profits  and governments push the boundaries of digital innovation. Stay for the limitless learning opportunities that encourage you to master Microsoft and pursue big ideas. Enjoy ambitious growth for yourself as part of Avanade’s people-first culture with benefits like employee share purchasing  flexible work arrangements  a commitment to diversity and inclusion  and competitive pay.  This role requires direct contact with Avanade clients as well as attendance in person at Avanade workplaces and other company-sponsored meetings and events. In order to comply with our client requirements and Avanade’s own health and safety obligations  this role requires the Applicant to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19. Proof of vaccination will be required during the application process. Applicants who have appropriate written proof of a medical or religious reason for not being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 may provide such documentation.  About Avanade  Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital  cloud and advisory services  industry solutions and design-led experiences across the Microsoft ecosystem. Every day  our 56 000 professionals in 26 countries make a genuine human impact for our clients  their employees and their customers.  We have been recognized as Microsoft’s Global SI Partner of the Year more than any other company. With the most Microsoft certifications (60 000+) and 18 (out of 18) Gold-level Microsoft competencies  we are uniquely positioned to help businesses grow and solve their toughest challenges.  We are a people first company  committed to providing an inclusive workplace where employees feel comfortable being their authentic selves. As a responsible business  we are building a sustainable world and helping young people from underrepresented communities fulfil their potential.  Majority owned by Accenture  Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com .

Title: Data Analytics/ Data Governance - Expression of Interest
Requirements: Sydney  Are you passionate about data? Looking to make your first move to industry from Consulting? Or maybe you’re already a data professional wanting to fast track your career?  Data at Macquarie  There has never been a more exciting time to embark on a career in Data at Macquarie. We’re investing heavily in our people  systems  and tools to help us manage and utilise data effectively and drive a data-centric culture.  As we continue to grow our teams  we’re welcoming expressions of interests from for individuals keen to evolve a career in the following areas: Data Analytics  Business Intelligence  Data Governance or Data Quality.  Our data professionals work across the full breadth of our business groups  giving you the chance to diversify and drive the data career you want.  What impact will you have?  Joining one of our data teams  could see you involved in Macquarie’s data and regulatory reporting strategy  delivering digital transformation and innovation  or helping teams gain valuable insight from data.  You will partner with stakeholders across the organisation to advance our data journey  whilst helping to solve some of the most complex problems faced by our industry.  What skills do you need?  You’re an experienced Data Analyst  or Data Governance/ Quality specialist  or a highly numerate individual with a passionate for developing a career in this space. Our teams are curious  generous & bold in their approach – and having a keen interest in solving interesting problems and sharing in this ethos is the key requirement for your success!  Other skills and attributes that you possess may include: a relevant Bachelors’ Degree in Accounting  Finance  Commerce or IT 2-4 years’ experience in a Finance or Data role. Relevant experience may include: Data Analysis Data Management Business Intelligence Financial Reporting & Insights a keen interest to learn! If you’re passionate about data  enjoy challenging work and are excited by solving complex problems  submit your expression of interest today!  Our commitment to Diversity  Equity and Inclusion  The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths. An inclusive and equitable environment enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people  clients  shareholders and communities. From day one  you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us  please apply. With the right technology  support and resources  our people can work in a range of flexible ways.  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity  equity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you  and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.  About Macquarie  A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills  explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition  helping sustain global food supplies  financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie  we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.  Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups  disciplines  sectors and borders. With 17 000+ employees and offices in 33 markets around the world  we’re a truly global organisation.  You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives  ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us  you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.  Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management  retail and business banking  wealth management  leasing and asset financing  market access  commodity trading  renewables development  specialist advisory  capital raising and principal investment.  Find out more at www.macquarie.com/careers  Job no: 964155  Work type: Permanent - Full time  Location: Sydney  Category: Mid-level  Junior  Accounting & Finance  Data & Analytics  Technology  Recruiter: Mark Francisco  Opening Date: 30/3/2022

Title: Snr Data & Analytics Specialist
Requirements: Full-time Contract until June 2023 WFH/Australian Hearing Hub at Macquarie University Competitive base salary plus 15.4% superannuation Hearing Australia is the country’s largest hearing services provider  with an international reputation for excellence. We are currently undergoing an exciting transformational journey  repositioning our brand and workplace culture  to ensure our customers are at the heart of everything we do. When you change lives  it’s more than just a job.  As the Senior Data & Analytics Specialist  you will coordinate the development and maintenance of reports/insights to meet business requirements and to enable efficient utilisation of enterprise data system capabilities for Hearing Australia.  The scope is technical  functional and process driven  relating to the Production Environment systems and information. Scope of Production Environment is applications  databases and middleware  What We Have To Offer 15.4% Super Flexible work arrangement opportunities to support work  personal and family commitments Free on-site Parking  Great facilities Employee recognition awards program Hearing aid discounts for employees and family members Attractive employee benefits (salary sacrifice superannuation  HCF private health cover discount  well-being programs  salary packaging a new motor vehicle  discounts across an exciting range of retailers) About The Role Develop requirements  functional specifications  test cases  test plans for analytical and reporting activities on assigned projects. Develop test cases  test plans and managing the testing results and consolidation for reporting Design and advise on process to collect  manipulate  clean and explore data Understand Internal Stakeholder business needs  offer recommendations to improve outcomes and provide insights into customer behaviour  profitability  segmentation. Prepare data for reporting and creation of interactive dashboards. Develop new reports  trouble-shoot technical problems and implement enhancements in PowerBI or other reporting tools (e.g. Excel  Microsoft Dynamics CRM) Develop predictive models and enhance data-driven business decision making and effectively lead a pipeline of analytics  reporting and data work. Implement new reporting  analytics or modelling  and/or supporting the improvement of data flows  data processing or data storage About You 3+ years' experience using Microsoft Data Platforms (Microsoft Dynamics CRM) & Data Analytics  Microsoft Power BI (including DAX coding) and SQL to extract and manipulate data for reporting and insights Strong interpersonal and communication skills at all levels  including data-story telling  facilitating meetings and presenting to large groups Expertise in analysing data sets  quantitative analysis  data mining and creating data visualisations to provide business insights Experience in Marketing Analytics including pre/post campaign analysis  segmentation  targeting and CRM. (Desirable) Able to move  extract  manipulate and analyse data. Knowledge of ETL processes and comfortable working with relational databases and reporting cubes. (Desirable) Previous experience in customer insights or marketing analytics. (Desirable) Knowledge of these concepts applications in the health care industry would be ideal We will require the successful candidate to be willing to have a Police Check conducted (we pay) and must have rights to work in Australia  Why work for Hearing Australia?  At Hearing Australia  our mission is “to provide world leading research and hearing services for the wellbeing of all Australians” .  A career with us is rewarding because you are helping to positively impact people’s lives and improve Australia’s hearing health. Do what’s right: we put our clients first while also finding new ways to achieve better outcomes for them and their families. Make their day: we are thoughtful and actively listening to our clients and to each other. Work as one: we collaborate and support our clients  our teammates  and each other. Visit to discover more!  Hearing Australia is an Equal Opportunity Employer operating under Department of Human Services. Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander peoples are encouraged to apply.

Title: Media Insights Analyst - $155 000 - Melbourne
Requirements: Posted by Stephen Murfitt Principal Consultant at Talent Insights Group Send InMail Talent Insights are working with a company who are recognised as being at the forefront of the latest Data revolution. With an enviable culture  and working environment  we are looking for a Senior Insights Analyst - Media role. to help with their continued growth. This is an opportunity to grow your Insight's career and to join one of Melbourne's best employers - offering tailored career progression  a true focus on work/life balance and a great technology stack.  We are looking for someone who can: Provide thought leadership on industry best practice regarding measurement and optimisation of marketing initiatives through instore and digital media channels Lead a growing team of highly capable analysts and senior analysts Build the capability of the team through leadership  coaching  development and performance management Leverage knowledge of statistical principles to ensure analytical outputs are accurate and reliable Identify current and future capability needs and works with the Marketing Analytics Practice Lead to develop a capability roadmap to meet future needs Set team norms  standards and procedures and ensures these are understood and followed by chapter members Ensure team members knowledge and expertise remains current and is in line with industry best practice Leverage knowledge to identify current and future trends and ensure innovation and continuous improvement within the team Work as part of a broad function to facilitate business outcomes in a fast-changing environment Establish credible relationships with business stakeholders  including marketing and ecomm teams Works with the Marketing Analytics Practice Lead and the wider D&A community to remove impediments for the team Ensure that the team members are working on items that the business has prioritised Enable an empowered environment for close cooperation across all roles and functions within the team Grow the capability of the team through ongoing development and recruiting talent into the team. Act as a mentor and develop agile practices and mindsets within D&A  along with agile ways of working. Skills needed:  7 to 10 years experience developing measurement and optimisation of media in commercial environments  preferably exposure to Retail and eCommerce Analytical thinker  problem solver  self motivated Experience in leading teams to drive class-leading commercial outcomes. Proven commercial experience in media analytics  with experience in measurement and optimisation Thorough understanding of statistical principles to ensure analytics outputs are accurate and reliable Advanced working knowledge of Tableau and other visualisation tools Experience with SQL essential  exposure to Azure or GCP preferred. Experience in working in complex  multi-stakeholder environments. Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect  organise  analyse and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy. Tertiary qualified in relevant disciplines (Statistics  Data Science  Mathematics  Computer Science). Prior experience in a commercial/business support or data/insights analyst role coupled with relevant tertiary qualifications. Email me in the first instance on stephen@talentinsights.com.au

Title: Data Migration Analyst
Requirements: This is a large-scale transformation  which has change implications across the entire business. The data migration analyst participates in data migration mapping and migration activities between the legacy SAP ERP  Great Plains  JBOS and SIS systems to Workday. This role crafts ETL solutions between source and target systems  working with subject matter experts and solution architects to map and transform the data as needed. This work is undertaken in compliance with data and security standards  and participates in appropriate data quality reconciliation activities.  Key Responsibilities Consult with various stakeholders including subject matter experts  solution architects and external Workday consultants to understand the source and target data models Develop a detailed understanding of data mapping from legacy systems to other ERP system Design and execute data extraction  cleansing and loading from legacy systems to Workday Participate in data migration rehearsal activities Ensure all data handling is in compliance with security standards Participate in data quality and reconciliation activities Deliver quality outcomes and engineering discipline Qualifications  Skills And Experience Experience with analysing data models in both source and target system landscapes and defining appropriate mappings and transformations necessary to successfully migrate the relevant data Experience working on large scale data migration projects Hands on experience with migration tools Experience with developing solutions to extract and transform data from at least one of the key source systems (eg. SAP  MSGP) Experience with testing  reconciliation and troubleshooting data lineage issues Expert knowledge and experience in executing data projects and various data migration techniques and approaches Experience and understanding of cloud services and applications (specifically AWS) is highly desirable Experience in maintaining and developing relevant documentation Demonstrated experience working in an Agile software development environment Demonstrated experience liaising with subject matter experts  understanding of business processes and developing source and target reconciliation reports to enable the business to reconcile migrated data Experience in working closely with business representatives and business analysts to seek clarity on requirements and define test scenarios Excellent judgement and decision making skills. Exhibit strong emotional intelligence skills. Ability to challenge the status quo. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Ability to quickly breakdown problems and find innovative solutions. An ability to meet deadlines in a fast paced environment. If you have the necessary technical skills and this role sounds interesting  please apply and we will contact you for a confidential discussion asap!

Title: Category Insights Analyst
Requirements: Posted by Anna Mckinnon Connecting top talent with great opportunities Send InMail • Permanent role working with an experienced team of category experts • Would suit an Analyst with experience in PowerBi and Nielsen/IRi data • Access to Hybrid working across home and the office in Warriewood or Surry Hills  At Blackmores  we are an ASX 200 publicly listed Australian company leading the wellness revolution by championing innovative natural health solutions.  We have a great role for a Category Insights Analyst to join the Blackmores’s Category team based in Sydney. In this highly analytical role  you will support the field sales and Category teams in providing actionable insights for them to identify growth opportunities.  You will feel comfortable in the detail of mining data from a variety of sources  yet be able to provide internal and external market insights taking a broader Category lens  which will enable key stakeholders to make sound business decisions.  Responsibilities include: • Provide analytic support to diagnose issues and quantify opportunities to maximise the commercial return • Manage supplier relationships (such as Nielsen  IQVIA  IRi  Quantium and Catalytics) ensuring integrity of database content and timings/deliverables • Support Category Managers in category and range reviews (efficient assortment analysis for customers  insights supporting the category story/recommendation) • Provide various category reporting on an ad-hoc basis and training to onboard or upskill sales PowerBI users  Who are you? • Demonstrated experience in an analyst role  FMCG/Healthcare/Pharma or agency advantageous • Excellent quantitative  critical thinking and problem-solving skills • Highly analytical  loves working with data and can adeptly gain insights from the data • Keen aptitude for systems  with experience in PowerBI  and Nielsen or IRi data systems • Intermediate to advanced Excel knowledge  This is a great role for a real numbers guru to work their magic with lots of data to provide tangible insights to the Category team and cross functional stakeholders. You will be energised by working in a dynamic  fast paced environment where your insights will be used to influence and drive different business decisions and drive change across Blackmores.  Blackmores supports workplace flexibility in line with our Flexfit policy. We are open to discussing how we can accommodate you  both in terms of location and work pattern.  The Blackmores Group  founded by visionary naturopath Maurice Blackmore in 1932  has a vision to connect every person on earth to the healing power of nature by combining our knowledge of nature and science to deliver quality health solutions to people and their pets everywhere  every day. Recognising that you can’t have healthy people without a healthy planet  we’re strongly committed to embedding sustainability across our business and giving back to the communities in which we operate. As a purpose-led  performance-driven organisation  the Blackmores Group strives to create remarkable employee experiences through supporting a diverse and inclusive culture  creating leadership that inspires high performance  and providing everyone with opportunities to achieve their professional  personal and wellbeing goals supported by our flexible work practices and family friendly policies.  Agencies note: this recruitment assignment is being managed directly by Blackmores Talent Acquisition team. We will reach out to our preferred agency partners if required. Your respect for this process is appreciated.

Title: Data Scientist - Digital Delta
Requirements: Do you love solving complex problems  designing sophisticated solutions and building innovative technology? Are you passionate about Digital Transformation? Do you believe in creating powerful actionable insights from Data and Analytics? Immerse yourself in our inclusive  diverse and supportive culture   KPMG is one of the most trusted and respected global professional services firms. Through depth of expertise  clarity of insight and strength of purpose we help our clients solve complex challenges  steer change  strengthen  transition and grow.  KPMG’s Digital Delta  We re-imagine and re-invent organisations to become world class digital enterprises using advanced technologies  data and human insights. We help organisations to embrace Digital Strategy  Artificial Intelligence (AI) & Cognitive  the Internet of Things (IoT)  Data  Analytics & Modelling  Mobile App & Web  and User Experience (UX) & User Interface (UI) and more.  We work with clients to Formulate strategies that re-imagine organisations Harness innovation from the 4th industrial revolution Actioning insights from trusted data to consistently and quickly make clear decisions Build adaptive organisations Thrive as a connected enterprise – front  middle and back office   Our Digital Delta team in Canberra work across multiple Government Departments and Agencies. Our engagements range from working with Services Australia and the Department of Health to deliver outcomes that benefit citizens of Australia through to working with Defence and National Security protecting Australia.  Government Departments have some of the most interesting and complex datasets along with some of the largest computing systems in Australia. Just like private industry Government is starting to use this data for analytics  legacy systems are being replaced with new cloud based technologies and paper forms and manual processed are being digitised – these are just some of the areas where our Digital Delta team has assisted our clients to solve problems that directly impact Australians.  This Is How You’ll Contribute  We are looking for ambitious Data Scientists who are passionate about helping clients define bold ambitions and deliver on them. Joining our team will take you on a journey of personal and technical growth and provide the opportunity to inspire confidence and empower change.  As a Data Scientist you will design  develop and implement flexible and extensible analytic solutions that typically involve a combination of analytical  process and business transformation outcomes and focus on areas of our client’s business such as customer  product and supply chain  just to name a few. You will work with business stakeholders on factual problem formation  data identification and deriving answers that can be operationalized to solve business issues.  Please note you should also be an Australian Citizen or have the ability to obtain a government security clearance.  The KPMG Difference  Our people are focused on creating a diverse and dynamic environment that embraces and values differences. We value the variety of unique experiences  qualities and characteristics our people possess and we share and learn from each other.  We are proud to be consistently recognised as an employer of choice for women  and for our achievements in LGBT+ workplace inclusion.  Our commitment to ‘Flexibility’ allows our people to manage the changing demands of work  personal or family life. Explore the links below to hear our people share their experience @ KPMG  Flexibility empowers wellbeing  Flexibility enables contribution to the community  Flexibility inspires technology & innovation  Flexibility supports family  Make KPMG the clear choice for your career and be Extraordinary!

Title: Data Business Analyst
Requirements: Sydney  Are you a Business Analyst with a background in data management  and experience across financial services within a risk function  who is seeking your next opportunity?  This is an exciting new opportunity on the Data stream for the Net Zero  Climate Risk and Energy Transition “Program”  established to drive Macquarie’s Net Zero commitments and build out Macquarie’s Climate Risk management and reporting capabilities.  You will be: Engaging with business stakeholders to understand their risk management objectives that require data and analytics support  in addition to understanding the impacts of identified Data Quality Issues and process gaps Documenting and translating risk management objectives into functional requirements specifications Assisting in designing solutions to meet requirements Defining and implementing robust data governance processes and controls for critical data used in non-financial risk data solutions Working closely with the Data Governance team and data owners to define Critical Data Elements in line with Macquarie’s EDM framework In this role you will have the opportunity to work across Macquarie’s Business and Support Groups with a high-profile mandate. You will be involved in delivering a high impact initiative that will contribute to Macquarie’s pathway to Net Zero.  About You  To be successful in this role  you will possess experience in working with data management teams within financial services  ideally as a Business Analyst within a risk-based function. You will be passionate about the identification and management of data risk and hold an inquisitive mindset with a genuine desire to understand and solve problems.  STEM experience would be preferred. Previous experience in Climate Risk / Environmental & Social Risk will be highly advantageous for this role.  If you are interested in this exciting new opportunity  please apply directly or contact Verity Morison at verity.morison@macquarie.com.  About The Risk Management Group  The Risk Management Group (RMG) is an independent  centralised unit responsible for ensuring all risk across Macquarie are appropriately assessed and managed. Its divisions include Behavioural Risk  Compliance  Credit  Financial Crime Risk  Internal Audit  Market Risk  Operational Risk  Regulatory Affairs and Aggregate Risk  and RMG Enterprise Support.  Our commitment to Diversity and Inclusion  The diversity of our people is one of our greatest strengths  and in combination with our inclusive environment  it enables us to deliver innovative and sustainable outcomes for our people  clients  shareholders and communities. From day one  you'll be encouraged to be yourself and supported to perform at your best. If our purpose of ‘empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future’ is as inspiring to you as it is to us  please apply. With the right technology  support and resources  our people can work in a range of flexible ways.  We are committed to providing a working environment that embraces and values diversity and inclusion. We encourage candidates to speak with a member of our recruitment team if you require adjustments to our recruitment process to support you  and the type of working arrangements that would help you thrive.  About Macquarie  A career at Macquarie means you’ll have the opportunity to develop and utilise new skills  explore interesting fields and do challenging work that will impact the lives of people around the world—whether it’s accelerating the green energy transition  helping sustain global food supplies  financing social housing projects or investing in essential infrastructure. At Macquarie  we’re empowering people to innovate and invest for a better future.  Our size and international presence means your work can take you anywhere—across business groups  disciplines  sectors and borders. With 17 000+ employees and offices in 33 markets around the world  we’re a truly global organisation.  You’ll be supported by a diverse team where the unique perspectives  ideas and experiences that all of our people bring are valued. You’ll be empowered to address unmet needs in our communities whilst advising and investing alongside our clients and partners. Working with us  you’ll have the opportunity to make a difference.  Macquarie is a global financial group providing clients with asset management  retail and business banking  wealth management  leasing and asset financing  market access  commodity trading  renewables development  specialist advisory  capital raising and principal investment.  Find out more at www.macquarie.com/careers  Job no: RMG-962204  Work type: Permanent - Full time  Location: Sydney  Category: Mid-level  Junior  Data & Analytics  Risk Management  Group: Risk Management Group  Division: RMG Enterprise Support  Recruiter: Verity Morison  Opening Date: 23/12/2021

Title: Senior Insights Analyst
Requirements: Posted by Louise Hardie Talent and Human Resources Professional Send InMail What’s On Offer An opportunity to join the organisation at the heart of Australia’s financial markets  and contribute to the growth and prosperity of the Australian economy. You’ll be part of a Customer Data Analytics & Insights team (CDAI) of which you will be focused on formulating customer insights/profiles  supporting the Voice of Customer/Research program and creating  collating & reviewing customer board paper material. Key responsibilities include: · Shape and support the development of the future Voice of Customer and research program  this includes input into the design of the program including: road map  customer segmentation  assessing capability  tools and more · Identify and present actionable periodic customer insights/profiles and recommendations to stakeholders in a way that can be easily understood · Deliver ad-hoc and periodic quantitative/qualitative VOC surveys · Assist in the management and use of the CX enterprise survey tool · Create  collate and review board paper material covering the Customer divisions teams · Review and promote the customer segmentation model · Promote a data culture and drive data driven decision making within the Customer division by effective communication across key stakeholders · Support the Customer engagement strategy • Support the Customer engagement strategy.  What you’ve done: · At least 3 years of experience in customer experience and market research · Tertiary qualification in a technical discipline and industry experience analysing real world data · Ability to story tell and translate complex data and insights into a simple narrative · Generating actionable insights and bringing it to life to improve customer experience by partnering and working collaboratively with cross-functional teams to drive and support the prioritisation of CX initiatives. · Raising stakeholders' awareness and utilisation of insights from the VOC/Research program so they can make informed business decisions. · Supporting the CX strategy in identifying and sizing customer problems and influencing the business to address business objectives through a customer lens · Working collaboratively with CX Designers to help guide the future state of customer experience by providing actionable insights. · Exposure using CX survey tools (i.e Qualtrics)  And if you’ve got some of this  even better: · Understanding of ASX business  operational and technical processes · Understanding of different financial products · Exposure using Salesforce and Tableau CRM or equivalent visualisation tool · Experience with analytics techniques such as Customer Profiling  classification analyses  A/B testing  etc. · Experience in interaction at Executive management level of businesses · Exposure dealing with external research agencies What you need to enjoy and be good at for this role: · You’ll have a passion for customer insights  have a quantitative background in statistics  mathematics or similar and proven track record working with customer data · Curiosity and growth mindset · Working in ‘cross functional’/matrix style teams · Attention to detail · Ability to build rapport with and influence stakeholders · High level interpersonal  leadership  collaboration  facilitation and negotiation skills · Method driven approach to execution · ‘Big picture’ thinker - ability to assess all potential issues and alternatives · Superior presentation and communications skills (written and verbal) · Drive for continuous improvement

Title: Data Engineer

Title: Data Engineer
Requirements: At EY  you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are  with the global scale  support  inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better  too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself  and a better working world for all.  EY is the only professional services firm with a separate business unit (“FSO”) that is dedicated to the financial services marketplace. Our FSO teams have been at the forefront of every event that has reshaped and redefined the financial services industry. If you have a passion for rallying together to solve the most complex challenges in the financial services industry  come join our dynamic FSO team!  The opportunity  We are growing our dynamic Data & Analytics team in FSO and now is an exciting time to join us on this journey. We are looking for people to join our diverse team who are passionate about technology & data with financial services experience. If you are a consultant through to manager looking for your next role across the whole breadth and depth of Data & Analytics from Design and Analysis to Data Governance  we would love to talk you. We are looking for team members to join us who are interested in Data Engineering roles with an initial focus on big-data enabled Financial Crime solutions.  You could be Working with cutting edge technology to help protect our clients and communities from Financial Crime Working on a team to help our clients to find solutions to their most complex business challenges Use critical thinking and problem-solving skills to design and develop cutting edge Data & Analytics solutions Collaborating with your team and clients to develop the data & analytics strategy of tomorrow  today Helping us grow a DnA FSO that is inclusive and diverse and that builds a better working world for our people Using your energy  enthusiasm and story telling skills to convey the big idea to our client and our leadership while not forgetting the important details  Skills And Attributes For Success Proven big data experience from an implementation or a data science perspective Expertise in big data technologies such as Spark  Hadoop  or Elasticsearch Strong engineering background in either Java  Python or Scala Experience in working in an Agile environment  Preferred Skills And Qualifications Banking or Financial Services experience Exposure to ETL tools such as Ab Initio  Informatica  etc Quantexa Data Engineer accreditation  We would love to talk to you if you want to hear more about a career in consulting or are considering a move back after taking a break from consulting or your career.  What We Offer Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility  so you can make a meaningful impact  your way. Continuous learning: personalised career development including coaching  experiences and formal learning so you’ll develop the mindset and skills you’ll need to thrive in the future. Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.  At EY  you’ll be rewarded and recognised based on your performance and our comprehensive benefits package can be tailored to your individual needs.  We hold a collective commitment to foster an environment where all differences are valued and respected  practices are equitable and everyone experiences a sense of belonging. If you require any adjustments to the recruitment process in order to equitably participate  we encourage you to advise us at the time of application via contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or phone +61 3 8650 7788 (option 4).  We understand the importance of social distancing at this time so our recruitment and onboarding process may be managed virtually so we can continue to prioritise the safety and wellbeing of EY people  clients  guests and the broader public.  The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.  The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third-party provider. Regarding this role  the minimum salary for Consultant is $90 000 including 9.5% superannuation.  EY | Building a better working world  EY exists to build a better working world  helping to create long-term value for clients  people and society and build trust in the capital markets.  Enabled by data and technology  diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow  transform and operate.  Working across assurance  consulting  law  strategy  tax and transactions  EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Title: Data engineer
Requirements: About Capgemini:  Capgemini is a global leader in partnering with companies to transform and manage their business by harnessing the power of technology. The Group is guided everyday by its purpose of unleashing human energy through technology for an inclusive and sustainable future. It is a responsible and diverse organization of 270 000 team members in nearly 50 countries. With its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry expertise  Capgemini is trusted by its clients to address the entire breadth of their business needs  from strategy and design to operations  fueled by the fast evolving and innovative world of cloud  data  AI  connectivity  software  digital engineering  and platforms. The Group reported in 2020 global revenues of €16 billion.  Let's talk about the team:  Our Insights and Data team helps our clients make better business decisions by transforming an ocean of data into streams of insight. Our clients are among Australia's top performing companies  and they choose to partner with Capgemini for a very good reason - our exceptional people. Due to continued growth within Capgemini's Insights & Data practice we intend to recruit a Data Engineer with relevant consulting and communication skills. If you are already working in a consultancy role  or have excellent client-facing skills gained within large organizations  we would like to discuss our consultant opportunities with you. This role can be positioned to work from anywhere in Australia (Sydney  Melbourne  Adelaide  Brisbane  or Perth).  Role Description: Design  build and test solutions created on the basis of requirements gathered from numerous active discussions with the client Leading complex business reengineering development projects and to solve organisational problems through IT solutions. Let's Talk About The Role And Responsibilities Design  develop and implement solutions to customers organisational problems Provide high quality service delivery on engagements Actively manage client relationships Ensures opportunities are properly qualified to minimise risk Seen by client as an “adviser” who can contribute to a broad range of strategic  operational and budget decisions central to the client's strategy and priorities Guarantees engagement economics are maintained across the deal portfolio Development and direction of appropriate solutions and personnel associated with Pursuits and Delivery of Capgemini services Let's talk about your capability and experience: 8+ years of experience as a technology expert in designing and developing data solutions with more than 3+ years specializing in big data architecture or data analytics. In-depth experience in data modelling and experience with business intelligence systems (dimensional modelling  data mining  predictive analytics). Knowledge and experience with Big Data technologies such as Hadoop  NoSQL etc. Broad based architecture acumen: Database architecture  ETL  SOA  Cloud  etc. Data Platform knowledge (Hortonworks/Cloudera/MapR). Hands-On Technical Competencies Core Java Mandatory Good experience in NoSQL (HBase / Impala / Cassandara) Good experience in hive scripts  handling incremental data (Upserts) Good experience in SPARK  Spark Streaming  Kafka / Flume for extracting near real-time data & event messaging. Good experience in offloading/loading data in RDBMS & HDFS Experience working with Cloud Storage solutions in AWS  Azure etc. is a plus Let's talk about what's in it for you!  Passionate people are Capgemini's Ace of Spades - join us to discover a career that will challenge  support and inspire you. Working at Capgemini you'll find the rewards are more than just financial. You will work alongside some very smart and inspiring people on exciting projects and you will also enjoy incredible benefits. We offer flexible work practices and 40 hours of self-development every year with a huge selection of learning opportunities to choose from. Capgemini constantly aims for excellence in its operations and the employee experience it provides. In line with our Purpose  Flexible Working aims to improve the overall people experience by providing an optimal work-life balance  more autonomy and freedom in when  where and how we work.  As "Architects of Positive Futures"  Capgemini actively supports the community in 3 ways:  Diversity and Inclusion - we believe diversity of thought fuels excellence and innovation  which is why we positively encourage applications from suitably qualified candidates regardless of their gender identity  ethnicity  sexual orientation  religion  ability  intersex status or age. To support our commitment to diversity and inclusion  we celebrate or recognise special events and days of significance that are important to our employees such as Diwali  Bastille Day  Pride  IDAHOBIT  IWD and International day of people with Disabilities. Our Employee Resource Groups Women@Capgemini  OutFront  Indigenous  Parents and Carers and Sustainability Community of Practice support the grassroots passion of employees to drive our diversity agenda and effect change.  Digital inclusion - at Capgemini we are using our skills to drive social impact initiatives focusing on helping society address the impact of the digital and automation revolution. We also provide employees with opportunities to give back to the community through charity projects and volunteer days.  Environmental Sustainability - Capgemini joined the CDP's (Carbon Disclosure Project) prestigious "A list" for its commitment to the Net-Zero economy. As well as focusing on helping our clients transform towards more sustainable business models  Capgemini recently announced its commitment to becoming a netzero busines by 2030.  Recognised by Ethisphere as one of the World's Most Ethical Companies for the last 9 years in a row  ethics and values are at the heart of Capgemini's corporate culture and business. Embedded in our DNA  our seven values - Honesty  Boldness  Trust  Team Spirit  Freedom  Fun and Modesty - have remained the same since company inception in 1967. To see how we bring these values to life  visit www.capgemini.com/au-en/careers/ and listen to some of our employee's stories.  #GetTheFutureYouWant - Come join us  bring your whole self to work  create new possibilities for you  your customers and your community and help us to be Architects of Positive Futures.
