Company: RMIT Enterprise AI and Data Analytics Hub
Title: Analytics and AI Application Developer
Requirements: Posted by Kok-Leong Ong Head of Department  Information Systems & Business Analytics at RMIT University Send InMail About You As the Analytics and AI Developer  you will support the delivery of research and development of the various analytics and AI projects across the College of Business & Law. You will be situated within the RMIT Enterprise AI and Data Analytics Hub  a newly established entity and research group that brings together researchers from across the College to address analytics and AI research from a business-first perspective. As such  you can expect to work closely with a diverse range of stakeholders and to participate in the design of analytics and AI solutions that require a combination of business-driven theories  frameworks  processes  and any other considerations as part of the solutions delivery. To be successful in this position  you’ll have:  Degree in data science  business analytics  computer science  or a relevant discipline. Experience with data wrangling  including the use of tools such as SQL and ETL tools. Experience with development of visualisations  such as Tableau or PowerBI. Demonstrated proficiency with a programming language  such as R or Python  including an updated-to-date understanding of relevant packages and libraries in analytics  machine learning and AI. Experience with version control software  such as Github. Some experience of software development  e.g.  in web or application development  that uses AI and Analytics models will be highly desirable A strong analytical mindset and problem-solving skills. Ability to work effectively as part of a multi-disciplinary team  including the ability to interface with software developers to deliver outputs as part of a solution. Demonstrated attitude to continuous learning and upskilling.  Please Note: Appointment to this position is subject to passing a Working with Children Check.  About the Hub The Enterprise AI and Data Analytics Hub is a newly established research structure within the College of Business & Law. The mission of the Hub is to undertake research in Analytics and AI  ensuring effective translation of these technologies in various business problems  and to deliver a bespoke business-first training in Analytics and AI skills for the industry. The hub will bring together capabilities from across the College  giving businesses a one-stop shop for AI and Analytics capabilities that are grounded with business know-how  including areas such as accounting and finance  marketing  HRM  supply chain  and more. Collectively  our work will advance the communities we serve in achieving a thriving digital economy in the next decade.  As a staff of the Hub  you will have the opportunity to work collaboratively in a team setting with a range of stakeholders and problem areas  including opportunities to contribute to the College’s strategic plans and vision. Growing together with the hub  your role will have a voice in the directions and projects to pursue  giving you the satisfaction to take ownership of the Hub’s development.  To Apply Please submit your CV and covering letter addressing your suitability for this position by clicking on the ‘Apply’ link below. For further information about this position  please see Position Description below or contact Kok-Leong Ong (Head of Department  Information Systems) via email on kok-leong.ong2@rmit.edu.au  Vaccination Requirements The COVID-19 Mandatory Vaccination (Workers) Directions  made under the Public Health and Wellbeing Act 2008 (Vic) and as amended and replaced from time to time (Directions)  affect all persons employed or engaged to perform work by RMIT. As such  offers of employment from RMIT are conditional upon the applicant being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or medically exempt and providing satisfactory evidence of the same. You can access the Directions here: https://www.dhhs.vic.gov.au/victorias-restriction-levels-covid-19  Applications Close: 27 Apr 2022 11.59 pm  RMIT is an equal opportunity employer committed to being a child safe organisation. We are dedicated to attracting  retaining and developing our people regardless of gender identity  ethnicity  sexual orientation  disability and age. Applications are encouraged from all sectors of the community and we strongly encourage applications from the Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander community.  RMIT is a Disability Confident Recruitment Team and we are happy to adjust the recruitment process for your accessibility requirements. Please contact us at  TalentSupport@rmit.edu.au telling us your preferred type of communication and we will be in touch as soon as possible to discuss your requirements. Please note that whilst we still accept applications from any persons interested in our roles  due to the impacts of COVID-19  we are currently prioritising applications from those with current working rights in Australia and who are not affected by travel restrictions. Please see the latest updates to Australia’s immigration and border arrangements during the COVID-19 (Coronavirus) outbreak here.  We are a Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.

Title: Data Engineer
Requirements: DXC Technology (NYSE:DXC) - where brilliant people embrace change and seize opportunities to advance their careers and amplify customer success. We use the power of technology to deliver mission critical IT services that move the world. DXC.com  DXC Analytics provides customers with access to industry leading analytics technologies and people. DXC Analytics has an opening for a Data Engineer.  As a virtual-first organisation  this role can be based in Sydney  Melbourne  Adelaide  or Canberra.  The Role  As Data Engineer you will be developing solutions to solve complex financial crime problems  automatically identifying and matching customer data as well as creating pipelines that enable dynamic entity resolution using next-gen analytics technologies for our Tier 1 clients. You will support our customers in connecting the dots using advanced network analytics to create context and unlocking the hidden value in their data.  You will work as a member of a large data engineering team and be responsible for managing  transforming and cleansing high volume data  providing advice and technical consulting to our customers in the adoption of big data analytics technologies.  What You Will Bring To The Role 1 years of experience in big data technologies & developing data-processing pipelines Some knowledge of Spark or similar big data product (e.g. Hadoop or Elasticsearch) Understanding of functional programming languages would be highly desirable (e.g. Scala) Experience working with a common programming language used in analytics (e.g. Python  Java  R) Experience with public cloud platforms highly regarded Sound analytical skills and attention to detail Positive attitude with a passion for supporting your team and clients  and offering creative solutions and insights Australian citizenship or Permanent Resident Status for Australia Our Culture And Benefits  DXC is committed to building better futures for our customers  colleagues  environment  and communities. We take care of each other and foster a culture of inclusion  belonging and corporate citizenship. We put this to action developing and implementing societal initiatives within our Social Impact Practice. #WeAreDXC  Our “people first” philosophy means we offer competitive remuneration  benefits  training and career opportunities that reflect our commitment to improving the lives of our employees  and the communities in which we live and work.  We are an Equal Opportunity Employer  DXC is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we welcome submissions from people from all walks of life. We celebrate our diversity and recognize it is the unique contributions of our people that give us our edge. We stand by the ‘bring your whole-self to work’ philosophy. It is our inclusive culture that powers our results  and our company grows only if our people grow.  For more information  visit http://www.dxc.technology/analytics/offerings/139783-services_solutions

Title: Data Engineer
Requirements: About The Job  Toptal developers work with speed and efficiency to deliver the highest quality of work. We are looking for someone who is passionate about their client’s business  and ready to work on exciting projects with Fortune 500 companies and Silicon Valley startups  with great rates and zero hassles. If you are looking for a place to advance your career  enhance your skill set  and build connections around the globe  Toptal is right for you.  About Toptal  Toptal is an exclusive network of top freelancers from around the world. Fortune 500 companies and Silicon Valley startups hire Toptal for their most important projects. Toptal is one of the fastest-growing fully remote networks and empowers freelance software developers  designers  finance experts  product managers  and project managers worldwide to grow and excel in their freelance careers.  Toptal clients vary in sizes and industries  from enterprise organizations and big tech companies to Silicon Valley startups and renowned universities. Once you enter the network  our matchers will contact you with project opportunities that fit your expertise and preferences. We have experts in over 120 countries who get to work remotely on projects that meet their career ambitions.  About The Role  As a Data Engineer  your main goal is to be one step ahead of data scientists and analysts. You will support them by providing infrastructure and tools they can use to deliver end-to-end solutions to business problems that can be developed rapidly and maintained easily. This is more than building and maintaining ETL pipelines. We need innovation  creativity  and solutions that will have a significant impact on the client’s velocity.  Requirements 3+ years of professional experience in software development Working experience with Python and Pandas. Familiarity with the basic principles of distributed computing and data modeling. Extensive experience with object-oriented design and coding and testing patterns  including experience with engineering software platforms and data infrastructures. Working experience with Airflow and Luigi is a big plus. Working experience with Scala is a plus. Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (e.g. GCS and BigQuery) is a plus. Working experience with Dimensional Modeling and Rails is a plus. Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills. Full-time availability is a strong advantage If you’re interested in pursuing an engaging career working on full-time freelance jobs for exclusive clients  take the next step by clicking apply and filling out the short form to get started.  #RemoteJobDataEngineering

Title: HR Systems Analyst
Requirements: Posted by Georgia Flint HR Professional | Project Management | HR Tech Send InMail At Bunnings  you'll make an impact on the business and beyond.  At Bunnings  there's so much going on behind the scenes that may come as a surprise. With millions of customer interactions occurring across our stores and online platforms  we've got so many opportunities to shape our trademark Bunnings experiences for our customers.  At Bunnings  you'll make an impact on the business and beyond.  At Bunnings  there's so much going on behind the scenes that may come as a surprise. With millions of customer interactions occurring across our stores and online platforms  we've got so many opportunities to shape our trademark Bunnings experiences for our customers.  About The Role  With multiple applications all needing to talk to each other  it's essential that data shared between our HCM  Payroll & Rostering systems remain accurate and in sync.  The HR Systems Analyst will be responsible for monitoring all integrations and ensuring the integrity of our data. They will work closely with other functional and technical specialists and be an integral part of a passionate team.  What's involved  Monitor inbound integrations into ichris (Payroll) from external sources (HCM & Rostering)  Monitor outbound integrations into external sources (HCM  Rostering  Financials)  Review all integration logs  check for errors & triage  Perform data reconciliations between all integrated applications  Perform root cause analysis and assist in prevention of issues re-occurring  Build & run ad-hoc reports (HCM & Payroll)  Review impact of new integration changes and assist with quality assurance  Support upgrades and regression testing  What you'll need:  Solid Excel skills  Sound understanding of Payroll processes  Ability to prioritize workload and provide timely follow-up and resolution  Ability to work collaboratively with multiple cross-functional teams  Technical proficiency in Python  XML  XSLT  PowerQuery  Oracle (desirable not essential)  Understanding of GTR files and how they interrelate with each other (desirable not essential)  Workday experience (desirable not essential)  Experience in Agile working methodologies (desirable not essential)  Experience with Atlassian suite of tools (Jira  Confluence) (desirable not essential)  You'll be part of a workplace where you'll feel like you belong.  There's so much on offer when you're part of the team. Our flexible and informal work environment helps bring balance between work and home. Then there's the fun stuff like team discount at Bunnings and other Wesfarmers brands  incentives  discounts from corporate partners (such as private health insurance) and cost price food and drinks at the Bunnings café. We also offer 12 weeks paid parental leave  regardless of gender  and you will have the opportunity to create a real difference in your community and environment. Join us and experience Bunnings from the other side of the counter.  Please note that if your application progresses to the reference check stage  you may be required to submit a police check. If your search returns a criminal record  Bunnings will assess whether the record impacts your ability to perform the key requirements of the role. Title: Senior Analyst  APS6  Specialist Advice & Services Division  Data & Intelligence Branch  All Locations
Requirements: Data and Intelligence Branch  Strategic Data Analysis Unit  The Data and Intelligence Branch supports the ACCC and AER to make informed decisions based on data analysis  effective information handling and intelligence methodology. The Branch consists of four teams: the Strategic Data Analysis Unit  the Infocentre  Legal Technology Services and the Intelligence team.  The Branch has several collaborative functions that support the agency in meeting its strategic objectives  including informing strategic decisions  providing specialist advice  improving data governance and evidence handling  developing tools and sources  driving innovation  collecting and triaging information and optimising the discovery and use of data and information.  The Data and Intelligence Branch sits within the Specialist Advice and Services Division  the ACCC/AER’s centralised in-house provider of legal  economic  international  information and data services.  The Strategic Data Analysis Unit (SDAU) is the ACCC’s specialist data and advanced analytics team  whose remit also includes leading the agency’s data governance program. The SDAU contributes by helping teams across the ACCC work with data to extract insights that inform strategic  operational and tactical decision-making.  Role and Duties  We seek highly motivated and innovative data and analytics professionals who will use their technical expertise for the benefit of Australian consumers  small businesses and the wider economy. In a data and algorithm driven economy  it is critical that the ACCC has the ability both to use advanced data and analytics techniques  and also the ability to analyse and understand how companies are using these techniques to run their businesses and make decisions.  This role sits in the SDAU. SDAU analysts will work directly with teams across the whole agency  contributing to complex and often high profile investigations and inquiries. We work with a range of data (both structured and unstructured) relating to industries across the Australian economy  and we apply a range of analytical techniques. Our toolkit includes R  Python and Power BI. The role suits analysts who enjoy continuous learning and innovation  every project we work on is a new challenge.  Successful candidates will be capable of working independently and have extensive experience in a data-related discipline – such as data analytics  data science  and/or data engineering. Senior Analysts must be able to communicate complex and technical issues simply  clearly and effectively in different forums to a range of stakeholders.  Duties are to be performed under limited direction and in accordance with the APS Code of Conduct and APS Values to achieve results in line with the corporate mission of the ACCC. Duties may include:  · Providing accurate specialist advice and guidance on data and analytics  including scoping analysis that will assist in the understanding of key issues relevant to the investigation or project · Developing objectives for short-term tasks and contributing to strategic planning for longer-term initiatives. · Conducting complex data analysis to reach conclusions and inform decision making · Preparing written reports and presentations detailing the findings of analysis  including evaluation and interpretation of any results · Managing relationships with stakeholders to achieve unit and agency goals  and anticipating and responding to stakeholder needs and expectations. · Building team capability by providing training to increase data literacy and analytical skills in the agency · Providing guidance  mentoring  and leading junior staff For more information about the role including the selection criteria  please see the attached Candidate Kit. How to apply  When applying you will be asked to upload your resume and submit a statement of claims that is no more than 800 words.  When preparing your statement of claims  please take into consideration the role and duties  and detail instances from your past that demonstrate how you meet the selection criteria.  Salary: $89 541 - $100 359 per annum (plus 15.4% superannuation) Contact Officer: John Dickson 08 9325 0678 This role is available on a full time  part time or job share basis.

Title: Data engineer
Requirements: The speed of change is throwing traditional business methods into question and disrupting the relevance of entire industries. Capgemini  a global leader in consulting  digital transformation  technology and engineering services  is at the forefront of innovation and well placed to address opportunities for our clients in the evolving world of cloud  digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise  Capgemini enables organisations to realise their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today  it is a multicultural company with over 270 000 team members in almost 50 countries. With Altran  the Group reported 2020 combined revenues of EUR 15.8 billion. Learn more about us at www.capgemini.com.  Let's talk about the team: Reports to the Feature Lead/Project Manager on the program or the lead solution designer or architect. Will take direction from the CG or client project manager for work and technical design from the solution designer or architect. The role of Data Engineer involves leading complex business reengineering development projects and to solve organizational problems through IT solutions using Big Data concepts  Platform tools and software engineering languages as required. Designing  developing and implementing solutions to customers organisational problems. Providing high quality service delivery on engagements. Designing and developing data reconciliation & metadata driven data processing frameworks. Let's Talk About The Role And Responsibilities Prior experience as a data engineer Hands-on experience in Cloud Computing - AWS preferably Experience in programming and shell scripting eg. Core/Python/Scala/Java Experience in Hadoop Stack e.g. Hive  Spark (Core and Streaming)  Kafka  Flink  NIFI. Experience with Github and Jenkins. Experience working on stream transform using Spark Streaming or Flink. Experience working on change data capture in a big data ecosystem. Experience in building real time or batch ingestion and transformation pipelines. Title: Google Data Engineer
Requirements: Do you have your head in the Cloud?  Reimagine what’s possible. Fast-track your future.  Work and learn from the best people every day  Be yourself at work  Do you have your head in the Cloud? Good. At Accenture Cloud First  we’re looking for people who live and breathe Cloud. People who don’t want to even think about settling for an ordinary Cloud career. People who want to fast-track their future and work on amazing projects with global impact.  We are the Accenture Google Business Group  combining the best of Google human-centric design and innovation with Accenture intelligence.  The Accenture Google Business Group is part of our rapidly growing Cloud First team. Working together with Google  we help clients unlock the value of data  use advanced analytics to better connect with their customers and become more efficient  and modernize the way they do business to become more agile  natively digital and drive value creation.  As a member of the Google Business Group  you’ll be part of a team of professionals who deliver more than just technology. You’ll help clients solve real business problems  benefit society  and make good on the promise of technology  data and artificial intelligence.  As a Google Cloud Data Engineer in our team  you can expect to work on a variety of client engagements and Accenture & Google offerings including:  Large scale data platforms  Innovative analytics and AI solutions  Customer Call Centre AI (using Google Dialogflow)  Our team members enjoy an extensive range of training and certifications and we provide a whole-of-career growth opportunity along technical  consulting  commercial and leadership aspects.  Key Responsibilities  As a Google Cloud Data Engineer in our team  you will be responsible for building and delivering data and AI solutions that center around Google-specific cloud technologies and will collaborate with other team members to create end-to-end solutions. These responsibilities include some or all of the following:  Collect and analyze data requirements in support of analytics and other use cases  Creating data models according to technical and business requirements  Designing and implementing batch and streaming data pipelines to collect data from various sources and transform it according to technical and business requirements  Design and implement data remediation  migration and integration strategies and techniques  Design and build large scale data platforms using BigQuery  Cloud Dataflow  Cloud Storage and other Google Cloud technologies  Explore and implement AI/ML techniques using Google cloud technologies  Depending on your level of experience you will also:  Lead teams of consultants and clients to achieve high-quality delivery goals on time and within budget  Participate in sales and pre-sales activities  Contribute to building the practice  Skills And Qualifications  Data modeling  Batch and stream data ingestion and transformation patterns  Google BigQuery  Cloud Storage  CloudSQL or similar technologies on AWS/Azure  Apache Beam  Google Cloud Dataflow or similar data processing technologies (e.g. Spark)  Strong relational database and SQL experience (DML and DDL)  Preferred – Jupyter/R basic skills  Preferred - experience leveraging AI/ML techniques and technologies such as:  BigQueryML  Tensorflow  Regression models  Classification models  Clustering  Neural networks  We are looking for candidates across a wide range of experience and will refine the responsibilities of successful applicants on an individual basis accordingly as part of the recruitment process.  As part of your onboarding  you may be expected to acquire Google Cloud certifications and will be fully supported by Accenture to do so with training  time and cost of certifications.  All of our consulting professionals receive comprehensive training covering business acumen  technical and professional skills development. You’ll also have opportunities to hone your functional skills and expertise in an area of specialisation. We offer a variety of formal and informal training programs at every level to help you acquire and build specialised skills faster. Learning takes place both on the job and through formal training conducted online  in the classroom  or in collaboration with teammates. The sheer variety of work we do  and the experience it offers  provide an unbeatable platform from which to build a career.  Applicants for employment in Australia must have work authorisation that does not now or in the future require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorisation in Australia and with Accenture  About Accenture  Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital  cloud and security. Combining unmatched experience and specialized skills across more than 40 industries  we offer Strategy and Consulting  Interactive  Technology and Operations services—all powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centres. Our 514 000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day  serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients  people  shareholders  partners  and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com.  At Accenture  our philosophy is anchored in recognising that our people are multi-dimensional. We take an intersectional human approach to create a work environment where all people feel like they can bring their authentic selves to work  every day.  We believe that equality drives innovation. Our commitment to accelerating equality starts at the top with our board and CEO and extends across every part of the company. This comes to life when our people own the equality agenda  making it part of their jobs – every decision  every day – and feel free to speak up and to act.  We do not tolerate discrimination because of differences  such as age  ability  ethnicity  gender  gender identity or expression  religion  or sexual orientation. We want a workplace that is inclusive and diverse to that end we are setting bold goals and taking comprehensive action. To achieve these goals  we collect information that allows us to track the effectiveness of our Inclusion and Diversity programs.  Learn how Accenture protects your personal data and know your rights in relation to your personal data. Read more about our Privacy Statement.  Priyanka Uchil is the Recruiter managing this role. Title: Senior Material Master Data Migration Analyst
Requirements: Overview  Bio-rad is looking for an SAP MDM (Master Data Management) Materials Master Senior Business Systems Analyst for the company’s Asia offices (Mandarin/English required). As part of the Master Data Management (MDM) Global ERP team  the Data Analyst will be responsible for the discovery  classification  assessment  and alignment of business data for SAP Materials Master and Master Data Governance (MDG). The ideal candidate will be more business-focused in this position and work with subject matter experts  Business Systems Analysts  Data Architects  System Integrators  and others across functional boundaries to develop data migration plans  data quality plans  data migration test cases  and data validation plans. The Data Analyst will also be responsible for developing and documenting the business rules for purification  staging  migration and data integrity.  Responsibilities  Responsible for data migration from legacy systems to SAP ECC or SAP HANA  along with SAP implementation and/or process transformation. Design IT solutions for global MDM business processes in alignment with the company’s strategic initiatives related to SAP Material Master  Vendor Master  Customer Master  Interfaces etc. Create functional specification documents that require development of WRICEF (Workflow Reports Interfaces Conversion Enhancement and Form) objects. Design  test and QA all MDM business processes. Document system configurations  SOPs and other operational workbooks in SAP Solution Manager. Support SAP integration with downstream consuming systems and support data conversion efforts from legacy systems to SAP. Assess impacts of scope changes and work closely with Change Management to prepare for implementation. Operate in close partnership with the IT and business communities  subject matter experts  external consultants  cross functional teams etc. Prepare for and support operational readiness and production cutover efforts. Gather business requirements for production and geographical enhancements. Document business requirements and analyze fit/gaps in the current global template. Configure the system for MDM business processes in SAP (globally). Provide HyperCare support.  Qualifications  Bachelor's/Master’s degree in Information Technology  Business  or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Five (5)+ years of systems/data analysis experience in a large international manufacturing company having participated in 1-2+ full cycle global SAP implementations. In-depth knowledge of SAP MDM business processes with cross functional integration knowledge and previous dedicated experience in SAP Material Management (SAP MM). Data Migration experience (ETL) from legacy systems to SAP ECC or SAP HANA  along with SAP implementation and/or process transformation. Experience with data mapping  data construction  de-duplication and fit gap analysis. Ability to perform FUT/UAT and support ITC and validation testing. Experience in creating/reviewing functional specifications for custom enhancements  basic programming experience to write queries and formulas also highly desirable (not required). Previous experience on project teams with a proven ability to work under time constraints while meeting critical milestones. Proven ability to solve problems in a methodical manner and to track and measure expected results Can process and disposition a high volume of requests in an organized and efficient manner Solid analytical skills  and a strong customer focus  attention to detail a necessity  willingness to learn. Proven expertise in data analysis  data modeling  and data management techniques Strong oral and written communication skills. Be an ambitious self-starter and work well in pressure and ambiguous situations.  Vaccination Requirement:  Due to the higher threat of more infectious and deadly COVID-19 variant strains emerging  Bio-Rad has a mandatory vaccination policy requiring its US employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 as a condition of employment. New hires will be asked to upload their vaccination card into our electronic database hosted by ClearPass  who specializes in securing electronic medical information  within 3 days of their start date. With this policy  Bio-Rad joins a growing list of companies that are prioritizing sound science and available facts to best ensure the ongoing safety of its employees and the community.  About Bio-Rad:  Bio-Rad is a global leader providing a broad array of clinical diagnostics and life science research products. With a team of more than 8 000 employees and a global network of operations serving our customers  we help people live longer  healthier lives.  Bio-Rad was founded over six decades ago and has continued to provide the healthcare industry with innovative and useful products that help life science researchers accelerate the discovery process and medical diagnostic labs obtain faster  better results.  EEO/AA Employer/Veterans/Disabled/Race/Ethnicity/Gender/Age  Agency Non-Solicitation:  Bio-Rad does not accept agency resumes  unless the agency has been authorized by a Bio-Rad Recruiting Representative. Please do not submit resumes unless authorized to do so. Bio-Rad will not pay for any fees related to unsolicited resumes.

Title: Data Engineer

We are looking for someone who is passionate about their client’s business  and ready to work on exciting projects with Fortune 500 companies and Silicon Valley startups  with great rates and zero hassles. If you are looking for a place to advance your career  enhance your skill set  and build connections around the globe  Toptal is right for you. Toptal is one of the fastest-growing fully remote networks and empowers freelance software developers  designers  finance experts  product managers  and project managers worldwide to grow and excel in their freelance careers. Once you enter the network  our matchers will contact you with project opportunities that fit your expertise and preferences. You will support them by providing infrastructure and tools they can use to deliver end-to-end solutions to business problems that can be developed rapidly and maintained easily. Working experience with Dimensional Modeling and Rails is a plus. Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills. Full-time availability is a strong advantage If you’re interested in pursuing an engaging career working on full-time freelance jobs for exclusive clients  take the next step by clicking apply and filling out the short form to get started.  #RemoteJobDataEngineering

Title: Senior Analyst  Analytics
Requirements: TCorp provides best-in-class investment management  financial management  solutions and advice to the New South Wales (NSW) public sector. With A$113 billion of assets under management  TCorp is a top 5 Australian investment manager and is the central borrowing authority of the state of NSW  with a balance sheet of A$132 billion. It is rated Aaa (Stable) by Moody’s and AA+ (Stable) by S&P.  TCorp champions and protects the financial interests of the state and delivers sustainable returns and financial efficiencies that allow its clients to achieve their broader business objectives.  TCorp delivers this through its expert team  ability to anticipate the future needs of the state and with a deep understanding of the unique needs of the NSW Government family. We work exclusively for the NSW Government and public sector entities.  The Operations division’s mission is to enable TCorp’s strategy through their functions: Enterprise Programme Management Office (EPMO)  Investment Operations (IO)  Financial Markets Operations (FMO)  Finance & Settlements (F&S)  Data & Analytics (D&A) and Board Secretariat.  The D&A team plays a strategic role in enabling best-in class investment implementation and reporting on behalf of TCorp’s clients. The team is responsible for the data life cycle of TCorp's investments data from acquisition to stewardship and distribution. In addition to portfolio reporting  the Analytics function is  in partnership with portfolio management and other stakeholders  responsible for analytical methodology development and deployment to enable decision making and accountability within TCorp's Investments function.  Role  The role manages associated analytical systems  service provider relationships and contributes to the Analytics reporting function  with responsibility for  The Senior Analyst  Analytics is a hands-on role accountable for supporting the Senior Manager  Analytics. The primary purpose of the role is to deliver the highest quality analytics services to TCorp which enable business decision making and enhance accountability. Business liaison  technical prototyping and contribution to production deployment of new analytical capability. Investigation  reconciliation  remediation and business communication of issues. Development of relevant data verification processes in partnership with the Data Management team. Partnership with Analytics and other reporting staff to validate and enhance report content. Effective contribution to investment  operational and systems related development projects. In addition  the role will be expected to contribute to core team deliverables and activities including: Quality of analytical content of regular and ad-hoc client reports and dashboards. Maintenance of primary analytical data sets including static data attributes in supporting systems. Communication with vendors e.g.  custodian  analytical systems. Participation in stakeholder discussions regarding reporting deliverables with a view to build confidence in the Analytics function. Effective support to professional staff working in other teams to meet or exceed client needs (e.g. Investments  Client Services  Client Advisory and Finance teams). Ongoing proactive contribution to the continuous refinement effort for compliance  governance and risk management processes. Work closely with investment  IT and operational staff to upgrade and develop analytics  data and systems areas to a best in class standard. Core capabilities expected of the Senior Analyst include strong quantitative problem solving skills  highly developed Investment performance methodology knowledge  advanced spreadsheet skills and process improvement capability with the tenacity  persistence and ability to drive solutions development. Experience with a programming language (SQL  Python  VBA) and familiarity with the use of vendor performance and/or risk solutions (Aladdin  MSCI-BARRA  FactSet) is advantageous.  The successful candidate will have relevant tertiary qualifications and a solid academic record (quantitative discipline preferred) and a minimum of five years’ demonstrated experience using using Investment performance risk systems within a consultant  investment manager  custodian or superannuation fund. Experience customising analysis or reporting for non-standard client requirements and demonstrated understanding of multi-asset class portfolios and requisite analytics metrics is essential.  At TCorp we actively collaborate with our stakeholders to achieve the best outcomes for our clients and the state of NSW. We aim to build an inclusive culture so we can benefit from each employee’s unique perspective and contribution. We also understand the importance of flexible working and we support our people to balance their commitments and thrive both professionally and personally.  Please submit your application via our careers portal and include a cover letter setting out how your background and capabilities align to our selection criteria and how this role fits with your career goals. Please also note your salary expectations in the relevant section of the portal. No agency candidates please.  TCorp’s COVID-19 Vaccination Policy requires all new employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or have an approved medical exemption. You will need to provide evidence of vaccination prior to attending a face-to-face interview and proof of vaccination or medical exemption will be required prior to any offer of employment being made.

Title: Escalation Engineer I (Health and Escalation Management) Sydney  AWS Support
Requirements: Job Summary  DESCRIPTION  Amazon is now offering flexibility to choose between two working models  onsite and remote. Please  check below for further information: Onsite Employee: An employee who works either entirely in an Amazon building  or split between both an Amazon building and remote location. Employees will need to either live near or relocate to an already established Amazon building location. Remote Employee: An employee who works in a remote location for the entirety of the normally scheduled workweek  for a period of more than 90 days in a rolling 12 month period. These employees do not need to live near an Amazon office  but must live in Australia. About Us  Amazon has built a reputation for excellence with a mission to be the earth’s most customer-centric company  a company that customers from all over the globe will recognize  value  and trust for both our products and our service. Amazon Web Services (AWS) is carrying on that tradition while leading the world in cloud technologies.  The Escalation and Event Management (E2M) team is part of the broader AWS Support organisation and is dedicated to managing critical escalations  customer facing operational communications  and handling large-scale customer impacting events. E2M’s purpose is to drive operational excellence and improvements to the overall customer experience.  About You  E2M is looking for people who are detailed  analytical thinkers as well as creative problem solvers  with a strong bias for action. You are someone who is not constrained by the notion of “how things are usually done”  and you are equally comfortable operating in the minute detail  as well as with coordinating efforts at the forty thousand foot view. You confidently advocate for customers  maintaining composure in dynamic and high pressure situations. You are comfortable working on highly technical initiatives to consistently improve the AWS customer experience. You are someone who excels at working in a dynamic environment while collaborating with some of the smartest people in the industry  and you get excited about owning critical infrastructure services that serve global customers  every second of the day!  Finally  you are passionate about technology with a desire to learn more and do more with AWS.  About The Role  As members of E2M’s Health and Escalation Management team  we work to keep customers informed and moving forward when they are facing challenges using AWS’ products and services. We are responsible for driving critical customer problems to resolution  ensuring the right internal “Owners” are engaged to assist us and act as an advocate for the customer. We ensure customers are proactively informed of changes or impact to the AWS resources the customer is using in their operation  ensuring communications are clear and beneficial to the customer experience. Because of our unique role as Escalation Engineers  we have limitless exposure to all things AWS  including numerous leading edge technologies.  Every day will bring new and exciting challenges that include elements of: Drive critical  complex customer escalations in situations that are sometimes technically challenging in collaboration with Engineering Teams. Partner with AWS Service Teams to craft communications  helping to identify and remove technical ambiguity Deliver planned operational communications to customers in accordance with AWS communication tenets and style guides Provide clear  concise and timely communication on work items to relevant internal stakeholders Build a broad understanding of AWS services  service inter-dependencies and customer use cases to improve the customer experience and operational excellence Facilitating post mortems of operational failures  implementing corrective actions and identifying improvement opportunities for existing processes. Design  build  or collaborate on solutions using automation and self-repair rather than relying on human intervention Other duties as required by the organization  Basic Qualifications Experience in Support Engineering  Customer Escalations  Technical Communications  or similar IT role 2+ years of experience in technical operations or support focused on cloud infrastructure Tertiary qualification/Bachelor’s Degree in Information Science / Information Technology  Computer Science  Engineering  Mathematics  Physics  or a related field (or 3+ years of relevant work experience)  Preferred Qualifications  Candidates that have been most successful after joining our team have demonstrated capabilities in one or more of these areas: Excellent written and oral English communication skills Industry specific accredited certification(s) such as the AWS Associate level certifications Familiarity with Cloud services with a focus on high availability and fault tolerant design Experience with data manipulation and/or automation using Python  JavaScript or shell scripting Knowledge of ITIL/Lean Processes Effective prioritization and time management skills Ability to work in ambiguous environments Demonstrated critical thinking and logical problem solving skills Amazon Web Services is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race  religion  color  national origin  gender  sexual orientation  age  marital status  veteran status  or disability status.   Company - AWS Australia Pty Ltd  Job ID: A1913254

Title: Data engineer
Requirements: The speed of change is throwing traditional business methods into question and disrupting the relevance of entire industries. Capgemini  a global leader in consulting  digital transformation  technology and engineering services  is at the forefront of innovation and well placed to address opportunities for our clients in the evolving world of cloud  digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise  Capgemini enables organisations to realise their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today  it is a multicultural company with over 270 000 team members in almost 50 countries. With Altran  the Group reported 2020 combined revenues of EUR 15.8 billion. Learn more about us at www.capgemini.com.  Let's talk about the team:  Our Insights and Data team helps our clients make better business decisions by transforming an ocean of data into streams of insight. Our clients are among Australia's top performing companies  and they choose to partner with Capgemini for a very good reason - our exceptional people. Due to continued growth within Capgemini's Insights & Data practice we intend to recruit a Data Engineer with relevant consulting and communication skills. If you are already working in a consultancy role  or have excellent client-facing skills gained within large organizations  we would like to discuss our consultant opportunities with you. This role can be positioned to work from anywhere in Australia (Sydney  Melbourne  Adelaide  Brisbane  or Perth).  Let's talk about the role and responsibilities:  Reports to the Feature Lead/Project Manager on the program or the lead solution designer or architect. Will take direction from the CG or client project manager for work and technical design from the solution designer or architect.  The role of Data Engineer involves leading complex business reengineering development projects and to solve organizational problems through IT solutions using Big Data concepts  Platform tools and software engineering languages as required.  Key Responsibilities include: Designing  developing and implementing solutions to customers organisational problems  Providing high quality service delivery on engagements  Designing and developing data reconciliation & metadata driven data processing frameworks  Prior experience as a data engineer Hands-on experience in Cloud Computing - AWS preferably Experience in programming and shell scripting eg. Core/Python/Scala/Java Experience in Hadoop Stack eg. Hive  Spark (Core and Streaming)  Kafka  Flink  NIFI  Experience with Github and Jenkins  Experience working on stream transform using Spark Streaming or Flink  Experience working on change data capture in a big data ecosystem  Experience in building real time or batch ingestion and transformation pipelines  Additional skills/responsibilities of this role: Experience supporting a production service in a DevOps friendly environment  Experience working in Agile/Scrum teams  Hands on experience in API and cloud-native architecture  Experience with ‘container' technology (e.g. Docker  Kubernetes)  Experience wrangling data using library such as Pandas  Scikit-learn or Numpy  Experience using notebook such as Jupyter or Polyglot  Experience with test-driven development  test automation & continuous delivery  Experience in Java build automation technologies such as Gradle  Maven  Integration with Sonarqube etc.  Qualifications  The following qualifications would be advantageous: Education level - Degree in Computer Science  Information Systems or related field AWS certification would be advantageous Understanding of Financial Services Industry could be advantageous Let's talk about what's in it for you!  Passionate people are Capgemini's Ace of Spades - join us to discover a career that will challenge  support and inspire you. Working at Capgemini you'll find the rewards are more than just financial. You will work alongside some very smart and inspiring people on exciting projects and you will also enjoy incredible benefits. We offer flexible work practices and 40 hours of self-development every year with a huge selection of learning opportunities to choose from. Capgemini constantly aims for excellence in its operations and the employee experience it provides. In line with our Purpose  Flexible Working aims to improve the overall people experience by providing an optimal work-life balance  more autonomy and freedom in when  where and how we work.  As "Architects of Positive Futures"  Capgemini actively supports the community in 3 ways:  Diversity and Inclusion - we believe diversity of thought fuels excellence and innovation  which is why we positively encourage applications from suitably qualified candidates regardless of their gender identity  ethnicity  sexual orientation  religion  ability  intersex status or age. To support our commitment to diversity and inclusion  we celebrate or recognise special events and days of significance that are important to our employees such as Diwali  Bastille Day  Pride  IDAHOBIT  IWD and International day of people with Disabilities. Our Employee Resource Groups Women@Capgemini  OutFront  Indigenous  Parents and Carers and Sustainability Community of Practice support the grassroots passion of employees to drive our diversity agenda and effect change.  Digital inclusion - at Capgemini we are using our skills to drive social impact initiatives focusing on helping society address the impact of the digital and automation revolution. We also provide employees with opportunities to give back to the community through charity projects and volunteer days.  Environmental Sustainability - Capgemini joined the CDP's (Carbon Disclosure Project) prestigious "A list" for its commitment to the Net-Zero economy. As well as focusing on helping our clients transform towards more sustainable business models  Capgemini recently announced its commitment to becoming a netzero busines by 2030.  Recognised by Ethisphere as one of the World's Most Ethical Companies for the last 9 years in a row  ethics and values are at the heart of Capgemini's corporate culture and business. Embedded in our DNA  our seven values - Honesty  Boldness  Trust  Team Spirit  Freedom  Fun and Modesty - have remained the same since company inception in 1967. To see how we bring these values to life  visit www.capgemini.com/au-en/careers/ and listen to some of our employee's stories.  #GetTheFutureYouWant - Come join us  bring your whole self to work  create new possibilities for you  your customers and your community and help us to be Architects of Positive Futures.  Please note unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or other third parties will not be considered.

Title: PowerBI Developer
Requirements: As one of Australia’s largest listed companies  we’re proud of our longstanding contribution to Australians. Wesfarmers achievements are deeply rooted in the desire to continually reinvent ourselves for the brands we stand behind  destinations that many Aussies call home. Think retailers like Bunnings  Kmart  Target  Catch and Officeworks. Our work doesn’t stop there  we operate in the industrials sector which supplies the nation with chemicals  energy and fertilisers  and industrial and safety products.  Join the team of industry leaders in our Advanced Analytics Centre  With plans to transform the Australian retail and industrial landscape  comes a big responsibility. We see a future where we are leaders in the data and digital space. It’s why we’ve been working hard to accelerate the development of data  digital and analytics capabilities across our businesses. We’re building a shared data asset for strategic use cases  at our Advanced Analytics Centre – an environment designed for the best and brightest as they shape our data and digital journey.  We’re focused on harnessing the power of data and transforming it into meaningful insights that enhance our customer experience  strengthen our businesses  and help them pursue new growth opportunities. That’s where you come in.  Our talented and agile team of data scientists  engineers  developers and analytics leads co-create and solve complex problems. It’s innovation  to create better experiences for our customers. It’s adding real value  that supports decision making across the Wesfarmers Group  and its transformational work  that’ll change the industries we operate in.  What You’ll Be Doing  This is a permanent position which oversees developing  deploying  and maintaining BI solutions to enable the management and development of robust  scalable  accurate and insightful reporting and analysis. In this role you will work alongside other AAC team members and business end users to translate business requirements into BI solutions. This involves understanding requirements  translating data into solution designs and the systematic sourcing  curation and management of data and reports within the Power BI reporting environment. A combination of advising divisions and the AAC on best practices in Business Intelligence reporting and visualisation.  What You’ll Need Solid Power BI Development experience – including data models  reporting  visualisation design and BI solutions experience Demonstrated ‘hands-on’ experience with cloud applications and technologies with a focus on data warehousing  application integration components and reporting Have a strong customer focus and ability to develop true stakeholder partnerships while being a team player. Intermediate level experience with SQL & DAX Experience with descriptive analytics. Strong analytical and problem-solving capabilities  including the ability to consider commercial dynamics in the development and interpretation of reporting etc. Nice to have’s Experience/exposure with: M code  Power platform  Snowflake  Redshift  SQL Server  Teradata etc. Experience in consulting. Experience in the retail industry. Relevant Certifications. Experience with the Cloud  point it out if you do. Why we think you’ll love working here  More than a job  this is an opportunity to make a strategic impact and accelerate your personal growth with an organisation committed to offering you a great place to work.  The way we work  Our culture  We’re results focused  but we’re a business that cares. Here we are less about titles and more about everyone playing a valuable role. We provide autonomy and space with freedom to operate  quickly learning from mistakes because we know they are part of the way forward. We’re curious  open minded  and collaborative. And although we’re thought leaders  we’re humble  and willing to share knowledge and learn from one another.  We know that diversity fosters greater innovation and better customer connection  so we strive to create an inclusive and diverse work environment. This means promoting the development of our people and fostering a sense of belonging irrespective of gender  ethnicity  generation  flexible work status  family circumstances  sexual orientation or disability.  Our ways of working  This multi-faceted role gives you a unique opportunity to combine thought leadership with the ability to see and own the outcomes of your achievements. Whether you’re spending time guiding Group-wide strategic data and digital initiatives  helping the team explore the next-wave of data and analytics  or offering expert advice to advance our data maturity  you’ll have the opportunity to rotate through a wide variety of projects. This gives you hands-on and varied experience that will deliver tangible results. With genuine support for flexible ways of working  you’re in control of shaping your week and finding balance between time in the office to collaborate with colleagues  and time at home to make things work for you.  Next steps  If this sounds like your next career move  then combine your cover letter and resume into one document and click on the ‘Apply’ button now. For brief enquiries please contact our Data and Digital talent Acquisition Partner at iramphul@wesfarmers.com.au  We’re hiring the best and the brightest talent in Australia. Let’s start to explore the possibilities of achieving great things together.  For more information  visit our website at https://www.wesfarmers.com.au/util/careers/data-and-digital-careers

Title: Data Engineer Senior Associate | 7 months contract
Requirements: Line of Service Internal Firm Services  Industry/Sector Not Applicable  Specialism IFS - Information Technology (IT)  Management Level Senior Associate  Job Description & Summary    With PwC  you’ll ignite a meaningful career while being supported by a flexible working culture  innovative learning and development opportunities and progressive policies and benefits  such as 18 weeks paid parental leave for mums  dads and foster carers (no minimum service!)   What will you create?   You’ll help Australian businesses  not-for-profits and governments create value and improve the way they work. From digitising healthcare  to creating smarter cities and igniting our start-up industry  together we build trust in society and solve important problems.   The Digital Technology Services (DigiTech) business unit proactively engage with our business as a partner and service provider for the firm. Our mission is to embed a digital mindset to drive how we manage and deliver technology across the firm  and use information to transform  disrupt and grow our business.   The Data Analytics capability in DigiTech enables the timely delivery of differentiating analytics and intelligent platforms and solutions to our market facing teams and the firm through efficiently organising and providing relevant technology  knowledge  processes and insights.   As a Senior Consultant in the Data Analytics capability you will work closely with the client service and internal teams on designing  developing and maintaining analytical data models  data integration and visualisation solutions.   Roles & Responsibilities: Design and build data analytics solutions based on requirements and industry best practices. Deliver robust  innovative and performant data integration  including batch processing and real-time streaming scenarios. Advise and develop data models  including data warehouse  analytical and semantic layers. Design and create dashboards and reports to present information in a clear and efficient way through the right visualisation format and structure. Provide consulting to client facing and technical delivery teams and assist the implementation and adoption of new data platforms and products from an initial design to proof-of-concept and production phases.   About you   You have at least 3 years of strong understanding of data models  data integration architectures and visualisation tools. You will have working experience with databases  and their modelling  querying and integration options  including relational (SQL)  multi-dimensional (MDX) and tabular (DAX)  Alteryx. With familiarity with analytics and big data related applications and cloud services  their roles  features  configuration and integration options and strong working experience with analytical and BI tools such as Power BI  Tableau. You will work with stakeholders including executive  product  data and design teams to assist with data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs. You are self-motivated with ability to work with minimal supervision  and to learn new technologies and processes.   Passionate about being at the forefront of change  you’re ready to help our Business Support team enable all areas of our firm to deliver meaningful value to clients.   You’re collaborative and enjoy working in an innovative environment. You’re a problem solver by nature and want to join a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and stakeholders. Most importantly  you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with.   Life at PwC   Our culture and benefits are something we’re proud of  and also why we’re consistently named as one of Australia’s best workplaces. With PwC  you’ll belong to an inclusive community where differences are both embraced and the underlying driver in everything we create together.   We empower you with the technology  coaching  flexibility and trust needed to make a meaningful difference  while supporting you in bringing your whole self to work each day. We’re committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce because we know it’s only by working together that we can realise the potential of our people  clients and society around us.   We’re living this commitment through initiatives including our Reconciliation Action Plan to increase Indigenous employment and employee-led diversity networks promoting cultural  disability  LGBTI and gender equality. At our core we’re a people business  which means you’ll be supported not just in your professional development but your personal growth as well.   "PwC is committed to the health  safety and wellbeing of our people  as well as visitors to our offices and events.   PwC has introduced a COVID-19 Vaccination policy that requires all staff  contractors  clients and visitors to be fully vaccinated before they can access our offices  attend client sites  undertake work-related travel  or attend work-related events  subject to limited exemptions. For more information: https://www.pwc.com.au/about-us/notices/coronavirus.html'   Rio Ogot is the Recruitment Manager for the role. As the team experiences high volumes of applications  we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all. Title: Analytics Engineer (Open to Remote across ANZ)

We deeply believe that bringing together diversity of thoughts  perspectives and expression is key to building the best product  team and company. We look for many different skills and abilities  as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. So  even if you don’t think you quite meet all of the skills listed or tick all the boxes  we’d still love to hear from you!  Our mission at Canva is to empower the world to design and since launching in 2013  we have grown exponentially  amassing over 75 million monthly active users across 190 different countries and a team of over 2 800 people… and the best bit is that we’ve only achieved 1% of what we know we’re capable of.  Join us and design your future.  Responsibilities Hands-on development  tuning  and overall management of our Data Warehousing platforms Responsibility for the continued development of new features  functionality  and optimisation from raw data ingestion  to the access and modelling layer  through to maintaining the visualization layer Providing functional and technical subject matter expertise with respect to data management  business intelligence  and reporting to internal stakeholders across Canva's global footprint Responsibility for managing planning and delivery of data projects and initiatives across the wider business  in conjunction with product teams across all offices.  Required Skills & Experience Advanced SQL scripting skills as well as reasonable proficiency in Python A demonstrated grounding in the Data Warehousing domain - experience building and managing large data warehouse and data mart environments in the cloud (AWS  Google Cloud  etc) Experience developing dashboards and reporting systems Familiarity with a wide set of Data Warehouse architectures and methodologies  schemas  and performance / optimization principles Excellent written & and verbal communication and collaborative skills  Want to experience Canva for yourself? If you're seeking professional growth and enjoy working on large  distributed  cloud-based applications that delight our millions of individual and business users alike - then apply now to be considered for the position!  If you require visa sponsorship  you must ensure you have at least two (2) years of post-University commercial experience as a Software Engineer  be mindful of Labour Market Testing  and meet the mandatory sponsorship requirements laid out by the Department of Home Affairs.  We will not accept or review any CVs from external recruitment agencies.  Working at Canva  Our culture is unlike anywhere else and we design your #CanvaLife experience to empower you to do the best work of your life.  Whether you’re in the office  working from home or choosing your own adventure  our benefits for permanent Canvanauts include: Equity packages for you to truly be a part of the Canva journey. Hybrid work model (in-office & from home) coming together for 8 days a year. Flexible leave so you can recharge  give back  support others or focus on your own professional development. Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents and carers throughout their parenting and caring journey. An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance. This is for you to spend on whatever will support your wellbeing and development.. because you know what you need to Vibe and Thrive  better than anyone. Virtual and in-office wellness benefits including Canva University  Employee Assistant Programs and Fitness & Meditation Classes. Canva For Good program matching your not-for-profit donations  Force for Good leave (3 paid volunteering days) and a range of sustainability and ethical initiatives to get involved in.  We make hiring decisions based on your experience  skills and passion. Please note that interviews are conducted virtually. Title: ArcGIS Developer

For more information  please visit www.wipro.com  With over 2 700 employees in Australia  we are committed to increasing localization. Good hands on experience in Desktop and Web solution development Programming Language: Python  C#.NET  VB.NET and PL/SQL Database: SQL Server Web Technologies: ASP.NET  ASP.NET MVC 3  AJAX  HTML  JQuery  JavaScript  XML  CSS  JSON and Geo-JSON. GIS Technologies: ESRI Suite (ArcGIS Pro  ArcGIS Desktop 10x  ArcGIS Enterprise 10x  ArcSDE)  MapInfo Having experience on implementing Linear referencing within ArcGIS will be an added advantage. So  if you have the curiosity to learn and the willingness to teach what you know  we'd love to hear from you.  Bonus Points If You Have Experience With Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science  Engineering or relevant IT fields. About 8 years of experience in Enterprise Geospatial Solution implementations. Adept in Geographical Information Systems  GIS Administration GIS Applicaton Development & data modelling. Expertise in development of technology based solutions by breaking down business requirements to simplify and map them to systems/technical requirements to ensure that they are in line with the enterprise architectural plan We pride ourselves on creating an inclusive workplace that provides equal opportunities to all persons regardless of their age  cultural background  sexual orientation  gender identity and expression  disability  veteran status  or anything else.  Benefits @ Wipro Flexible/remote working culture - location is not a limitation of success at Wipro. Global Travel & Relocation opportunities - COVID permitting. Paid Parental Leave. Excellent Remuneration Package. Quarterly bonus/variable pay. Quarterly Career Progression Reviews - we do not limited our employees to the usual once per year reviews! Novated Lease & Salary Sacrifice. Reduced Corporate Healthcare Rates. Fringe  Concession + Membership & Subscription Tax Benefits. Financial Advisory & Banking Benefits. Free Ongoing training and development to help you reach your full potential. Collaborative team - positive and empathetic people who love to laugh either through social distancing in the office or virtually from home! Team building  fun activities and social events - COVID permitting. Join us in many countries  see full career opportunities here.

Title: Data Engineer
Requirements: About The Job  Toptal developers work with speed and efficiency to deliver the highest quality of work. We are looking for someone who is passionate about their client’s business  and ready to work on exciting projects with Fortune 500 companies and Silicon Valley startups  with great rates and zero hassles. If you are looking for a place to advance your career  enhance your skill set  and build connections around the globe  Toptal is right for you.  About Toptal  Toptal is an exclusive network of top freelancers from around the world. Fortune 500 companies and Silicon Valley startups hire Toptal for their most important projects. Toptal is one of the fastest-growing fully remote networks and empowers freelance software developers  designers  finance experts  product managers  and project managers worldwide to grow and excel in their freelance careers.  Toptal clients vary in sizes and industries  from enterprise organizations and big tech companies to Silicon Valley startups and renowned universities. Once you enter the network  our matchers will contact you with project opportunities that fit your expertise and preferences. We have experts in over 120 countries who get to work remotely on projects that meet their career ambitions.  About The Role  As a Data Engineer  your main goal is to be one step ahead of data scientists and analysts. You will support them by providing infrastructure and tools they can use to deliver end-to-end solutions to business problems that can be developed rapidly and maintained easily. This is more than building and maintaining ETL pipelines. We need innovation  creativity  and solutions that will have a significant impact on the client’s velocity.  Requirements 3+ years of professional experience in software development Working experience with Python and Pandas. Familiarity with the basic principles of distributed computing and data modeling. Extensive experience with object-oriented design and coding and testing patterns  including experience with engineering software platforms and data infrastructures. Working experience with Airflow and Luigi is a big plus. Working experience with Scala is a plus. Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (e.g. GCS and BigQuery) is a plus. Working experience with Dimensional Modeling and Rails is a plus. Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills. Full-time availability is a strong advantage If you’re interested in pursuing an engaging career working on full-time freelance jobs for exclusive clients  take the next step by clicking apply and filling out the short form to get started.  #RemoteJobDataEngineering

Title: Business Intelligence Operations Specialist
Requirements: About Us  Over the next 40 years  Sydney’s population is projected to swell to over 12 million residents and regional NSW will accommodate an extra 700 000 people. Transport for NSW is delivering an unprecedented $72.2b investment into a truly game changing Future Transport strategy which will bring together several modes and cutting-edge technologies to deliver satisfaction and safety for our customers while supporting a rapidly growing economy.  The Division  We are a trusted partner to our clients  within Customer Strategy and Technology  developing and delivering smart  integrated  and sustainable data and analytics solutions which enable evidence-driven decisions to benefit our customers and communities  and leading an uplift in data literacy of use of data insights across the cluster.  The opportunity  Right now  we have an exciting opening for a Business Intelligence Operations Specialist (Front end) to join our Advanced Analytics and Insights team. This position is a permanent full time role based at Macquarie Park with flexible work options available.  You will be responsible to manage the Business Intelligence (BI) user environment for Advanced Analytics and Insights (AAI)  including site management  enhanced user experience and optimisation of production dashboards whilst also ensuring optimal customer outcomes through managing procedures  practices  and operations to ensure the efficient release  usage (including uptake) and maintenance of dashboards and self-service tools.  What you will be involved in: Manage and optimise the Tableau and Power BI sites to collaborate with platform teams to ensure appropriate user access and efficiency are maintained. Design and develop user-friendly navigation within the BI sites and between other communication platforms so that users can easier discover the insights they need to self-serve. Actively contribute to and guide innovation in Data Ops practices and delivery approaches and technologies that assist with developing and delivering dashboards and self-serve tools  including pipeline management of pre-prod to prod to minimise user access to pre-prod environments. Define  develop and communicate the practices and processes necessary for effective problem management to minimise the impact of service outages. Develop and maintain a database of known issues  causes and resolutions to guide the development and support teams in minimising the impact of incidents  working with the DevOps team to provide minor change enhancements and fixes for these know dashboard issues. Manage the response  investigation  resolution and post-incident analysis of major incidents to ensure deficiencies are identified  learnings are documented  and changes implemented to limit risk of future recurrence. Please click here to view a copy of the role description.  About you: Demonstrated experience in BI and emerging technologies. Strong design abilities of dashboard or UX/UI products/services. Demonstrated experience in creating engaging user experience through visual designs/design frameworks to engage users. Track record of designing a portal for a hub where people come and engage with products Experience using design software and analytics tools. Experience in wire framing and prototyping will be highly regarded. Experience in setting up Enterprise BI framework or Enterprise dashboards capability will be highly regarded  Salary And Benefits  The salary for this position is Transport Grade 9 ($138 670 - $ 155 309) plus 10% superannuation and annual leave loading.  For more information on employee benefits please click here to view a copy employee benefits pack.  How To Apply  To apply for this position  please answer all questions within the online application process and submit a resume.  Applications Close: Monday 25th April 2022 @ 11:59PM.  We are the community we serve  We are committed to being an inclusive  diverse and flexible workplace where differences are valued. We welcome people of all backgrounds  experience and abilities.  We enable our people to work in ways that work for them and their teams. Working virtually and from different locations including regional locations  staggering work hours and job sharing are just some of the ways our people can work flexibly.  Please contact the Talent Specialist below if you require any adjustments to be made to how you interact with us throughout the recruitment process or would like to discuss flexible work options.  For any enquiries  please email Jags Sethuraman at jagadeesh.sethuraman@transport.nsw.gov.au  Apply today to register your interest!  Find out more about working with Transport for NSW at https://jobs.transport.nsw.gov.au/  All Transport workers are required to have:  At least one dose of a TGA approved COVID-19 vaccine by 6 December 2021 and two doses by 7 February 2022  or an approved medical contraindication.  You will be required to show proof of your COVID-19 vaccination status or apply for a medical exemption prior to securing this role.
