Title: Data Operations Engineer
Requirements: About The Role  An exciting opportunity to join BOQ as a Data Operations Engineer during our transformation journey. By joining the digital bank of the future you will be able to make a difference with integrity and empathy  contributing to the successful and effective maintenance of the data warehousing capability  adding significant value to our organisation.  Reporting to the Senior Manager of Data Engineering  you will be responsible for maintaining day-to-day operations and stability of data platforms  including taking ownership of technical problem analysis and resolution at platform level.  You will have the opportunity to get exposure to cutting edge technology and a migration to the cloud  with additional training provided.  Key Responsibilities Technical problem analysis and resolution at platform level. Provide updates to the code  further escalating and assigning faults  issues or incidents to appropriate teams. Communicate and solve customers’ problems relating to data platforms via phone  email  live chat and face to face meetings. Be involved in deployment activity to production environment  delivering accurate and timely reports to incident management.  About You  As a data engineering analyst  you will be an eager professional who has the ability to work under pressure in deadline driven atmospheres putting your prioritisation skills into action. You will have experience in supporting enterprise scale data warehouse environments with strong analytical  troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.  Having a strong desire to succeed and keep up to date with industry trends on a national and global scale  you will have the ability to demonstrate a level of accountability in keeping the data and analytics platform(s) running and operational for internal users and customers of BOQ. You will also have proven experience of using SQL.  About Us  BOQ is one of Australia’s leading regional banks and provides a genuine alternative for Australian financial services customers and employees. Our purpose is to create prosperity for our customers  shareholders and people through empathy  integrity and by making a difference. Our ambition is to be known as the bold challenger bank  with multi-brands that are digitally enabled with a personal touch.  BOQ is passionate about providing opportunities for you to develop your career as we continuously adapt and deliver in a transformational and collaborative environment with a strong focus on community.  BOQ’s Inclusion vision is to foster a workspace that values and leverages difference and creates new possibilities  a place where our people feel confident to bring their best selves to work every day. We embrace difference and believe that our workforce should reflect the customers and communities that we serve.  In 2021 BOQ Group was awarded a Workplace Gender Equality Agency (WGEA) Employer of Choice for Gender Equality citation.  Our Benefits Flexible working arrangements Discounted financial products Salary sacrificing options Paid parental leave with no minimum Paid volunteer days Purchase annual leave BUPA Corporate Plan Employee Assistance Program (EAP) A ‘zero tolerance’ to Domestic and Family Violence (DFV) with active support for employees experiencing DFV Accessible work support through various practices  systems  office adjustments Gym  shopping  technology and travel offers 5 employee diversity network groups focusing on  First Nations Reconciliation Council  EPIC (LGBTIQA+)  Multicultural  Gender and Early Career.  How To Apply  To apply for this role please follow the links or apply via our Careers Page.  The Bank of Queensland is committed to diversity and an inclusive workforce. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People are encouraged to apply.  If you are successful for a role with the Bank of Queensland  it is a condition of employment that background screening is completed to ensure that the Bank complies with its obligations under the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter Terrorism Financing Act. These checks may include  but are not limited to: identity  verification  reference checks  criminal background checks  immigration checks  verification of academic qualifications  bankruptcy checks.

Title: Senior Analyst  APS6  Specialist Advice & Services Division  Data & Intelligence Branch  All Locations
Requirements: Data and Intelligence Branch  Strategic Data Analysis Unit  The Data and Intelligence Branch supports the ACCC and AER to make informed decisions based on data analysis  effective information handling and intelligence methodology. The Branch consists of four teams: the Strategic Data Analysis Unit  the Infocentre  Legal Technology Services and the Intelligence team.  The Branch has several collaborative functions that support the agency in meeting its strategic objectives  including informing strategic decisions  providing specialist advice  improving data governance and evidence handling  developing tools and sources  driving innovation  collecting and triaging information and optimising the discovery and use of data and information.  The Data and Intelligence Branch sits within the Specialist Advice and Services Division  the ACCC/AER’s centralised in-house provider of legal  economic  international  information and data services.  The Strategic Data Analysis Unit (SDAU) is the ACCC’s specialist data and advanced analytics team  whose remit also includes leading the agency’s data governance program. The SDAU contributes by helping teams across the ACCC work with data to extract insights that inform strategic  operational and tactical decision-making.  Role and Duties  We seek highly motivated and innovative data and analytics professionals who will use their technical expertise for the benefit of Australian consumers  small businesses and the wider economy. In a data and algorithm driven economy  it is critical that the ACCC has the ability both to use advanced data and analytics techniques  and also the ability to analyse and understand how companies are using these techniques to run their businesses and make decisions.  This role sits in the SDAU. SDAU analysts will work directly with teams across the whole agency  contributing to complex and often high profile investigations and inquiries. We work with a range of data (both structured and unstructured) relating to industries across the Australian economy  and we apply a range of analytical techniques. Our toolkit includes R  Python and Power BI. The role suits analysts who enjoy continuous learning and innovation  every project we work on is a new challenge.  Successful candidates will be capable of working independently and have extensive experience in a data-related discipline – such as data analytics  data science  and/or data engineering. Senior Analysts must be able to communicate complex and technical issues simply  clearly and effectively in different forums to a range of stakeholders.  Duties are to be performed under limited direction and in accordance with the APS Code of Conduct and APS Values to achieve results in line with the corporate mission of the ACCC. Duties may include:  · Providing accurate specialist advice and guidance on data and analytics  including scoping analysis that will assist in the understanding of key issues relevant to the investigation or project · Developing objectives for short-term tasks and contributing to strategic planning for longer-term initiatives. · Conducting complex data analysis to reach conclusions and inform decision making · Preparing written reports and presentations detailing the findings of analysis  including evaluation and interpretation of any results · Managing relationships with stakeholders to achieve unit and agency goals  and anticipating and responding to stakeholder needs and expectations. · Building team capability by providing training to increase data literacy and analytical skills in the agency · Providing guidance  mentoring  and leading junior staff For more information about the role including the selection criteria  please see the attached Candidate Kit. How to apply  When applying you will be asked to upload your resume and submit a statement of claims that is no more than 800 words.  When preparing your statement of claims  please take into consideration the role and duties  and detail instances from your past that demonstrate how you meet the selection criteria.  Salary: $89 541 - $100 359 per annum (plus 15.4% superannuation) Contact Officer: John Dickson 08 9325 0678 This role is available on a full time  part time or job share basis.

Title: Lead/Senior Data Analyst - Supply Chain
Requirements: Posted by Lynn Chua (She/Her) APAC Talent Acquisition Manager at ResMed Send InMail The Operations team partners closely with ResMed’s five business leaders to understand their needs then providing a variety of products and services to help them meet those needs including Customer and Technical Services  Global Quality Assurance and Regulatory Affairs  Supply Chain  manufacturing  logistics and distribution. Focused on enabling new product introduction and operating excellence  our team strives to improve time to market for new products and services  improve efficiencies in our cross-functional processes  and improve our supply chain through digitization and automation to increase value add to our customers.  You will be part of the Global Supplier Alliance (GSA) team to support the supply management strategies to achieve ResMed’s business strategy and financial goals. GSA team partners with ResMed business leaders  creating partnerships with suppliers who have the capability to support ResMed’s production planning  NPI roadmaps  know how/expertise  innovation and a source of Intellectual Property.  As a Lead/Senior Data Analyst - Supply Chain at ResMed  you will provide business and market intelligence information that allows Procurement and Category teams to function efficiently so that they can knowledgeably and competitively provide value to ResMed. This role is responsible for developing techniques and metrics to analyze data from our systems and other data sources.  You will do this by demonstrating a mastery of various data management skills used to interpret and diagnose data for root cause analysis  trends/ projections and providing insights. Using your experience in industrial analytics  you’ll apply predictive techniques to identify supply risks  support robust decision making and business modelling. You will also advance the analytics capability within the GSA team and evolve understanding of how data analytics can add value to the group.  Let's Talk About Responsibilities Collaborate with Procurement  Category Management and other supplier management functions in the discovery  interpretation  analysis and communication of meaningful patterns in data. Analysis of category  supplier  market  financial and other business data  through the use of mathematics  statistics  and computer software to identify category insights that result in total cost of ownership improvements and contribute to business strategies and goals. Support the development of category plans by performing data mining  benchmarking  collecting market intelligence  factoring economic influences  potential M&A and supplier/customer profiles. Identify  utilize and communicate external data sources including supplier and financial market reports and tools to enable tracking of supplier market indices to generate a view of supplier health and use predictive techniques to pre-empt risks to supply. Business modelling and scenario planning to enable faster and more robust business decisions working closely with Procurement and Category Managers. Support the broader GSA team  assisting with on-going and ad-hoc requests for information and insights  evolving the team’s understanding of how data analytics can add value to the group. Promote and drive adoption of corporate data governance practices within the GSA domain such as setting data policies  developing data processes  improving data quality  cataloguing data and fostering a data driven culture. Work closely with other analysts and data scientists to develop business data and analytics capabilities  particularly in adoption of modern analytics solutions and AI/ML for exception based decision making  process automation and predictive analytics. Perform various functions that arise from the normal course of business in a fast-paced work environment. Let's Talk About Qualifications And Experience Minimum Bachelor’s degree in data science  business  information systems  computer science or equivalent and at least 7 years’ experience working in a complex business environment Python and/or R experience Exposure to data principles  data transformation  data warehousing and data visualisation tools Fundamental SQL query and data management experience High-level understanding of procurement and supplier management processes. Previous experience in a regulated industry with complex and diverse supply chains such as medical device or automotive. Position Specific Skills and Challenges Advanced skills working with data analysis and visualisation tools such as Tableau  Qlik Sense  Power BI. Advanced working ability in MS Excel  PowerPoint  and SharePoint. Outstanding communication  presentation and interpersonal skills  must be able to translate complex information into understandable and compelling insights and present to audiences at all levels. Strong negotiating and influencing skills. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced and changing environment. Ability to build and maintain strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders. Joining us is more than saying “yes” to making the world a healthier place. It’s discovering a career that’s challenging  supportive and inspiring. Where a culture driven by excellence helps you not only meet your goals  but also create new ones. We focus on creating a diverse and inclusive culture  encouraging individual expression in the workplace and thrive on the innovative ideas this generates. If this sounds like the workplace for you  apply now!

Title: Data Engineer Senior Associate | 7 months contract
Requirements: Line of Service Internal Firm Services  Industry/Sector Not Applicable  Specialism IFS - Information Technology (IT)  Management Level Senior Associate  Job Description & Summary    With PwC  you’ll ignite a meaningful career while being supported by a flexible working culture  innovative learning and development opportunities and progressive policies and benefits  such as 18 weeks paid parental leave for mums  dads and foster carers (no minimum service!)   What will you create?   You’ll help Australian businesses  not-for-profits and governments create value and improve the way they work. Deliver robust  innovative and performant data integration  including batch processing and real-time streaming scenarios. Advise and develop data models  including data warehouse  analytical and semantic layers. Design and create dashboards and reports to present information in a clear and efficient way through the right visualisation format and structure. Provide consulting to client facing and technical delivery teams and assist the implementation and adoption of new data platforms and products from an initial design to proof-of-concept and production phases.   About you   You have at least 3 years of strong understanding of data models  data integration architectures and visualisation tools. You’re a problem solver by nature and want to join a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and stakeholders. We’re committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce because we know it’s only by working together that we can realise the potential of our people  clients and society around us.   We’re living this commitment through initiatives including our Reconciliation Action Plan to increase Indigenous employment and employee-led diversity networks promoting cultural  disability  LGBTI and gender equality. At our core we’re a people business  which means you’ll be supported not just in your professional development but your personal growth as well.   "PwC is committed to the health  safety and wellbeing of our people  as well as visitors to our offices and events.   PwC has introduced a COVID-19 Vaccination policy that requires all staff  contractors  clients and visitors to be fully vaccinated before they can access our offices  attend client sites  undertake work-related travel  or attend work-related events  subject to limited exemptions. For more information: https://www.pwc.com.au/about-us/notices/coronavirus.html'   Rio Ogot is the Recruitment Manager for the role. Title: Quantitative Researcher (Analyst/ Associate/ VP) - Global Fintech startup
Requirements: About Crypto.com Crypto.com was founded in 2016 on a simple belief: it's a basic human right for everyone to control their money  data and identity. With over 10+ million users on its platform today  Crypto.com provides a powerful alternative to traditional financial services  turning its vision of "cryptocurrency in every wallet" into reality  one customer at a time. Crypto.com is built on a solid foundation of security  privacy and compliance and is the first cryptocurrency company in the world to have ISO27001:2013 and PCI:DSS 3.2.1  Level compliance. Crypto.com is headquartered in Singapore with a 3000+ strong team. For more information  please visit www.crypto.com.  Responsibilities research/implement / debug strategies based on tick-level / alternative data High/Mid/Low frequencies delta1 and volatility Monitor live strategy performance/debug issues (i.e. specific to crypto exchanges data) Contribute and maintain python crypto delta1 and options analytics/trading pricing/backtesting/optimisation library and webapp tools (flask javascript) Applies machine learning techniques such as feature selection /transformations/normalisation to explore alpha strategies Perform data cleaning and identifying outliers Implement/back-test cutting-edge ideas and models derived from research papers  Requirements Previous experience in trading firm/hedge fund/investment bank/exchange (2y+) Fresh master/PHD graduates are welcomed Solid cryptocurrency trading experience Masters/PhD in Physics/Maths/Applied Maths/Statistics from top schools Excellent python Very good math/probability background Excellent command of written and spoken English Technical must-haves: Predictive machine learning implementations ( tensorflow / xgboost/ sklearn) Backtesting framework (e.g. backtrader) Scientific   high performance python (3y+) Experience in working with Pandas dataframes of several Gb (2y+) Unix scripting  Automation scripts Git Technical good-to-haves : Flask   Javascript  HTML  crypto exchanges connectivity /data download   SQL  Xgboost  Tensorflow  Scikit learn  Seaborn  Benefits We offer an attractive compensation package working in a cutting-edge field of Fintech. Huge responsibilities from Day 1. Be the owner of your own learning curve. The possibilities are limitless and depend on you You get to work in a very dynamic environment and be part of an international team You will get to have involvement in developing brand new products from scratch using latest technologies alongside with a passionate and talented team

Title: MDM developer
Requirements: Job Description  About Infosys:  Infosys is a global leader in next-generation digital services and consulting. We enable clients in more than 50 countries to navigate their digital transformation. With over four decades of experience in managing the systems and workings of global enterprises  we expertly steer our clients through their digital journey. We do it by enabling the enterprise with an AI-powered core that helps prioritize the execution of change. We also empower the business with agile digital at scale to deliver unprecedented levels of performance and customer delight. Our always-on learning agenda drives their continuous improvement through building and transferring digital skills  expertise  and ideas from our innovation ecosystem.  Visit to see how Infosys (NYSE: INFY) can help your enterprise navigate your next.  Short Description Developing functional solution designs and interface documents Lead the delivery of data ingestion use cases identified by internal consumers Drive the discussion with stakeholders Stakeholder management Roles And Responsibilities 10+ years of experience in data disciplines with experience on any of the following areas: Data Warehouse solution design Data ingestion solution design & implementation Impact analysis around source and target ingestion Solution Architecture Blueprint Having in depth understanding of different data ingestion patterns Project planning and leading data ingestion delivery Data Modelling Strong analytical  quantitative and problem-solving skills Good communication  articulation and interpersonal skills to effectively interface with various functional groups within the client organization Ability to explore  research and create POVs. Provide inputs in creating functional test cases  unit test plans based on data ingestion use case Elicit customer requirements using key tools such as stakeholder interviews  document analysis  POC  requirement workshops  use cases elaboration workshops  scenario building workshops  business and technology analysis. Confer with customer to capture user requirements  conduct user reviews and run stakeholder agreement meetings Understand and translate customer use case requirements and needs into business and technology solutions Conduct Impact assessment for new data ingestion use cases. Proactively communicate and collaborate with stakeholders  product specialists and data architects to capture functional and non-functional requirements Develop Functional data ingestion Interface designs Created business requirement documents and functional requirements document Essential  Skills /Competencies: Data Warehousing experience at least 48 months PAAS Platform experience of at least 12 months Understanding of data ingestion and worked as a solution designer for at least 24 months Azure Fundamentals (AZ900) Python Data Governance and Data quality SQL DWH experience Spark Azure Data Bricks Azure Data Factory Synapse Preferred Azure Data Engineer certified (DP 201) Sparks ADF  ADLS Data cataloguing Additional Skills Excellent customer interfacing skills. Excellent written and verbal communication skills. Strong attention to detail and outstanding analytical and Problem-solving skills. All aspects of employment at Infosys are based on merit  competence and performance. We are committed to embracing diversity and creating an inclusive environment for all employees. Infosys is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.  At Infosys  we recognize that everyone has individual requirements. If you are a person with disability  illness or injury and require adjustments to the recruitment and selection process  please contact our Recruitment team for adjustment only on Infosys_ta@infosys.com or include your preferred method of communication in email and someone will be in touch.  Please note in order to protect the interest of all parties involved in the recruitment process  Infosys does not accept any unsolicited resumes from third party vendors. In the absence of a signed agreement any submission will be deemed as non-binding and Infosys explicitly reserves the right to pursue and hire the submitted profile. All recruitment activity must be coordinated through the Talent Acquisition department.  EOE/Minority/Female/Veteran/Disabled/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity.

Title: Data Engineer - Permanent - Sydney
Requirements: Urgent requirement of Data Engineer - Permanent - Sydney  Requirements Should analyze and organize raw data and build data systems and pipelines Need to evaluate business needs and objectives and interpret trends and patterns Should conduct complex data analysis and report on results Prepare data for prescriptive and predictive modelling Build algorithms and prototypes and combine raw information from different sources Explore ways to enhance data quality and reliability and identify opportunities for data acquisition Should develop analytical tools and programs and collaborate with data scientists and architects on several projects Previous experience as a data engineer or in a similar role and technical expertise with data models  data mining  and segmentation techniques Knowledge of programming languages (e.g. Java and Python) Hands-on experience with SQL database design Very Good Communication Skills Eligibility: Australian/NZ Citizens/PR Holders only  Email: jobs@hasthasolutions.com

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Requirements: Posted by Danya Maguire Senior Talent Acquisition Partner  ANZ @ The Trade Desk 📍 AdTech 📍 Technology Recruitment 📍 Programmatic 📍 GTM Recruitment 📍 WE'RE HIRING↩ #fortunefuture50company Send InMail The Trade Desk is a global technology company with a mission to create a better  more open Internet for everyone through principled  intelligent advertising.  Handling over 600 billion queries per day (more than 100X the query volume of search globally)  our platform operates at unprecedented scale. We have also built something even stronger and more valuable: an award-winning culture based on trust  empathy  collaboration  and ownership. By working together across typical dividing lines  we are better as a team than any of us could be apart.  Do you have a passion for solving hard problems at scale? Are you eager to join a trust-based  globally-connected team  where your contributions will make a meaningful difference?  Come and see why Fortune Magazine consistently ranks The Trade Desk among best small-medium sized workplaces globally.  The Global BI team works closely with a broad range of teams including Client Services / Product / Engineering / Finance / Marketing to provide business intelligence reporting  address complex questions and help identify key metrics to drive data-driven decision making. We’re looking for someone who is enthusiastic about new technology  has not only the existing technical skills to be successful but also the acumen to learn even more  you’ll never run out of things to learn here! You’re comfortable being the conduit between business and technology teams  helping both reach solutions on high-priority technical issues. There is plenty of room for advancement in this role!  The Business Intelligence Analyst will report to the Business Intelligence Regional Lead and own BI service delivery and special projects from start to completion. Ultimately  your technical expertise and understanding of operating KPIs will help our Senior Management team identify key growth opportunities.  WHAT YOU’LL DO:  You will manage and resolve ad hoc Business Intelligence requests  developing new tools to automate repetitive tasks You will use predictive modeling techniques to drive business growth and generate accurate revenue forecasts You will support the business with time-critical data analysis and improve business operations by using cutting edge operational research and modelling methods You will maintain the integrity of company data and put checks in place to ensure accuracy You will apply a broad range of analytical techniques to identify business critical trends and insights by exploiting big data You will create dashboards and reports to allow teams to easily explore data pertinent to their ongoing operations You will serve as a subject matter expert for data analysis methods and tools  as well as data visualization best practices  WHO YOU ARE:  Essential Skills  You love data and this comes from a foundation from a Bachelor' degree in either Statistics  Economics  Computer Science etc. or similar relevant qualification. 2+ years professional experience in Business Intelligence  Business / Data Analyst roles. You have pivoted your career and looking to move back into a BI analyst role. You’re a SQL pro and have a deep hands-on expertise with relational databases and data warehouse methodologies You have strong problem-solving skills as well as the ability to drive actionable insights from massive data sets You are comfortable collaborating in a fast-paced environment with teams spread across the globe You have experience in a customer / client facing role working directly with business stakeholders You have excellent written  verbal and presentation skills You can prioritise and meet deadlines  Preferred Skills (Advantageous But Not Essential)  You have experience with big data technologies (Qubole  Spark  HIVE  Hadoop etc.) You have experience with multiple programming languages (Python  R etc.) You can design clean and intuitive dashboards in Tableau or a similar BI tool and have outstanding Excel skills  WHAT WE OFFER:  There are a ton of reasons why TTD is a phenomenal company to work for  but here are the top 6 that we think you'll find most interesting:  We are a globally collaborative environment. You will have the opportunity to work with brilliant & diverse teams from all over the world We celebrate continuous learning at TTD – here you will have opportunities to be sponsored for further education  certifications and we also have an in-house learning platform to support your further development Our culture - We have a wonderful team of brilliant high achievers built on a culture of empathy  grit  collaboration  & ownership. We are an award-winning company – we have won ‘Great Place to Work’ awards across Australia  US  UK  Europe and Asia! We offer an attractive compensation package  flex work environment  beautiful offices with all the perks that you're used to (snacks  catered lunches  wine  beer)  competitive equity  and an employee stock purchasing plan. We IPO'ed 5 yrs ago  with our stock price growing by 1000% in such a short time. We promote an environment of reward and recognition – At TTD  you will be recognised for your efforts and for each anniversary at TTD  we will celebrate you  and reward you for your contribution! The ad-tech industry represents a unique growth opportunity – it's currently only making up for about 2% of the overall $600B advertising industry. As we like to say here  "We're only 2% done!" Join us and help us tackle the other 98%! We promote an inclusive and diverse environment – we have many events and activities  which is why we have been awarded the ‘Great Place to Work’ for 2021 across Australia  US  UK and Asia and we promote inclusivity and diversity across our organisation.  The Trade Desk does not accept unsolicited resumes from search firm recruiters. Fees will not be paid in the event a candidate submitted by a recruiter without an agreement in place is hired  such resumes will be deemed the sole property of The Trade Desk. The Trade Desk is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment will be based on merit  competence  performance  and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race  color  religion  marital status  age  national origin  ancestry  physical or mental disability  medical condition  pregnancy  genetic information  gender  sexual orientation  gender identity or expression  veteran status  or any other status protected under federal  state  or local law.  REQ-1918

Title: SAS Developer
Requirements: What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating many opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.  At Cognizant  together with your colleagues from all around the world  you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible  more innovative  and successful. Moreover  this is your chance to be part of the success story.  Skill And Experience Requirements 5+ years of SAS/SQL experience particularly in data manipulation and cleansing. 5+ years' experience within projects and/or delivery of business and technology solutions  involving engineering of complex data processes. 3+ years of experience in data quality analysis and remediation. 3+ years of Business Analysis and Functional & Non-Functional Analysis experience. Hands on use of the Atlassian toolset of JIRA  Confluence and BitBucket Experience in data analysis and modelling. Expertise in Credit Risk Data with a strong focus on business knowledge and quantitative modelling Strong understanding of business performance and analytics concepts and applications Excellent business analysis skills to work through data issues and credit risk data elements Ability to work collaboratively within an Agile delivery framework Responsibilities Development of analytical data routines for extraction  alignment  transformation  and preparation for analytical consumption using SAS and SQL Toolsets Developing and executing unit  system  and integration testing plans Development of data definitions  including business rules  physical level data rules  field types  formats  profiling  data sourcing and end usage of the data. Data Investigation - Analyze data for issues to help determine the root cause of the issue and where required  the development of business rules that need to be applied. Analyze source system data and identify any derived measures that are used by business The creation and management of automation to schedule data processes and publish analytics Provide thought leadership and subject matter expertise on analytical ready data to the analytics  projects  systems and business teams. Main Duties Responsible to design  develop and test code using SAS toolsets for the applications Maintain and enhance analytical data knowledge through the publication of information into the analytics knowledge management solution Source data identification  involving identifying the optimal source of the required data variables (e.g.  those required for modelling  calculation  and reporting) Support project internal processes by focusing on data aggregation  data quality and testing Work with business units to understand credit risk related data elements  including identification of relevant reference data  metadata and data lineage Interaction with business and technology stakeholders to understand the business requirements Manage changes to the Business Managed domain of the Analytics Data Layer including the addition  subtraction  and update of data. Salary range: >$100 000  Next steps  If you feel this opportunity suits you  or Cognizant is the type of organization you would like to join  we want to have a conversation with you! Please apply directly with us.  For a complete list of open opportunities with Cognizant  visit http://www.cognizant.com/careers  Cognizant is committed to providing Equal Employment Opportunities. Successful candidates will be required to undergo a background check.  About Cognizant  Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies  transforming clients' business  operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based  consultative approach helps clients envision  build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the US  Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant.  Employee Status : Full Time Employee  Shift : Day Job  Job Posting : Jan 21 2022  About Cognizant  Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies  transforming clients' business  operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based  consultative approach helps clients envision  build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Title: Associate Data Engineer
Requirements: Entry level role for a Data Engineer to join our PropTrack team Do not let location deter you! We are open to applicants across Australia Support for your physical and mental wellbeing through our “You Matter” program  The safety and wellbeing of our employees and potential employees are important to us. Our external candidates will interview via Zoom. Not only do we wish to protect the health and safety of our people  we want to assure candidates that there is no expectation from REA to meet face-to-face. A virtual interview will not adversely impact your application. If you have any questions or concerns  this can be discussed through the screening process.  We're REA  An Australian start-up success story we're quietly proud of.  From a garage in Melbourne to the global stage is an achievement we're humbled by. Our idea to put pictures of houses on the internet has blossomed since 1995  and we now have businesses across Australia  Asia  India and North America.  Our purpose is to change the way the world experiences property. No matter where you're at on your property journey  we're here to help on every step - whether that's buying  selling  renting or renovating.  Some of our brands include realestate.com.au  realcommercial.com.au  spacely.com.au  Flatmates.com.au  Smartline.com.au and Proptrack.com.  We’re proud to have been named one of Australia’s Best Workplaces for 2021. This recognition is a great proof point of our unique and special culture. A culture that is driven by our people  our values  and our commitment to making a difference in the community.  What We’re Doing  With us  you’ll experience Belonging. You’ll be part of our Market Insights team within the PropTrack line of business.  PropTrack is REA’s property data solutions business. The acquisition of Hometrack (now ‘PropTrack’) by the REA Group in 2018 is part of a strategy to create a ‘property data powerhouse’. The capabilities required will underpin REA’s market leading position into the future  protect against new market entrants and networks as well as provide a new strategic growth plank for REA Group across Data Solutions  Products  Platforms  Insights and Analytics.  We are the engine room of REA. Our mission is to: Improve the quality  access and usage of our property data for consumers  and customers. Build reusable data products and patterns that unlock value stored in our data Create unique insights based on user  listings  property and customer data Invest in the reliability  quality and security of systems and data  What The Role Is All About  As an Associate Data Engineer you will support the Market Insights team in the following ways: Pairing with Data Engineer on day-to-day tasks Designing  coding  testing  and deploying new data pipelines and APIs using Python/Scala  as well as data platforms as such as BigQuery Airflow  Kafka and Flink Manage support requests from stakeholders and identify  track  and remediate data quality issues as well as perform exception handling across a broad variety of data sets Support data processes by providing the team with ad-hoc analysis and self-service reporting tools so that everyone gets a good sense of the state our data Analyse and produce data coverage and quality statistics across internal and external data sets to provide a high level of awareness across multiple teams Adhering to quality software delivery from inception and design to build and deployment  in collaboration with our Lead Developer and Tech Lead Sharing responsibility for all operational aspects of the software that we build  in support of our “you build it  you run it” philosophy where dev-ops is a part of everyday life.  Who We’re Looking For  Our ideal candidate will have skills in the following areas: A bit of experience for extracting and transform data using SQL Has a passion for learning programming skills - Our systems are primarily written in Python/Scala so experience in either is a plus  but if you’re experienced in another language  we’re happy for you to learn on the job Has some experience with Devops tools and techniques  particularly AWS  GCP and Docker Exposure to Agile software engineering practices with a passion for continuous improvement Has an ongoing commitment to their own learning and/or career change pathway (hackathons  short courses  and other self-learning) Good communication skills and experience collaborating with other team members  But we don’t just look for someone based on their skills and expertise. It’s our connection  acceptance and genuine care for each other that makes REA a great place to work. That means you also need to be: Savvy minded and have curiosity to think a little left of field / outside the box A strong and creative communicator Friendly  approachable and have good relationship management skills An avid contributor to our inclusive culture - we celebrate different perspectives and all play an active role in creating a sense of belonging  The REA experience  The physical  mental  emotional and financial health of our people is something we’ll never stop caring about. This is a place to learn and grow. We’re committed to your development – both professionally and personally. Your experience with us is something we take seriously.  We Offer A flexible working environment  meaning we strike the balance of what you need and what works for the business (and yes  our leaders fully understand the benefits of working flexibly) A hybrid approach to the future of work - https://www.rea-group.com/blog/the-way-we-work-at-rea-a-hybrid-approach/ Generous and flexible parental leave offering for primary and secondary carers Summer Fridays – time back to focus on your wellness every Friday afternoon from December through to March Support for your mental and physical health and wellbeing via our ‘You Matter’ Program Because We Care program which includes volunteer leave and community grants  to ensure you have the opportunity to give back to your community Hack Days for you to bring so you can bring your big ideas to life in a supportive learning environment An additional day of leave just for your birthday  Oh  And By The Way  At REA we value diversity and inclusion in all forms. Gender  religion  ethnicity  LBTGIQ+  neurodiversity and so much more. Research shows that while men apply to jobs when they meet an average of 60% of the criteria  women and other marginalized folks tend to only apply when they check every box. So if you've got the must-haves  dedication and enthusiasm to learn but don't necessarily meet every single point on the job description  please still get in touch. We'd love to have a chat and see if you could be a great fit.  If you like the sound of us  then we think you should apply today. We're proud to be Circle Back Initiative Employer and we commit to respond to every applicant. While we're looking at your application  and preparing to come back to you with an update  why not get to know us a bit more through our various social channels?

Title: Power Platform Developer
Requirements: At ALDI  our people are they key to our success.  Exciting opportunities are now available for IT Specialists within our National IT Customer Interactions team at ALDI Stores  based in Minchinbury. These opportunities include 12-month fixed term contracts and permanent full-time positions.  As a NIT Specialist  you will be responsible for enhancing existing and developing high quality solutions to the ALDI business using the Microsoft 365 platform  mainly within the Power Platform and SharePoint Online. In this role you will support the end-users  facilitate application testing and be part of enhancement and transformation projects which have a national impact.  What We Are Looking For  The successful candidate will be able to work in a fast paced  highly dynamic environment and possess strong technical and communication skills. The successful candidate will have prior technical experience within the Microsoft 365 platform  particularly around the Power Platform  but also SharePoint Online  Office 365 and Dynamics 365. You will be an outcome driven individual who is passionate to make a difference  with a keen eye for detail and an ability to meet competing deadlines.  What's in it for you? Market leading remuneration - $103 000 - $122 700* (including super) Be a part of a leading international retailer Comprehensive on-the-job training and development program provided 5 weeks annual leave Work up to 10 days from home per month Work in a team of collaborative  friendly and supportive colleagues High level of autonomy and responsibility Role Responsibilities Provide level 2 support for suite applications using Service NOW ticketing system Coordinate and actively partake in release management activities including UAT testing Perform root cause analysis and resolve application support issues Support business users with technical maintenance and troubleshooting of SharePoint and Power Platform applications as required Capitalise on your existing knowledge of the Microsoft Power Platform and SharePoint (including Power Apps  Power Automate  Model App Solutions  Canvas Apps and Dataverse) to assist in reaching productivity goals Partner with ALDI’s business users to gather requirements Collaborate with international counterparts to deliver solutions Provide advice on technical aspects of solution development and integration and ensure that relevant technical strategies  policies  standards and practices are applied correctly Assist and coordinate various projects to deliver an enhanced user experience Selection Criteria Demonstrated technical configuration and development experience with the Power Platform (including Power Apps  Power Automate  Model App Solutions  Canvas Apps and Dataverse). Demonstrated prior experience with SharePoint Online  Office 365 and/or Microsoft Dynamics 365 applications including migrations to the Cloud Previous experience in project management and/or project coordination Exceptional organisational skills with the ability to adapt particularly in high stress situations Strong communication skills  both verbal and written High level of professionalism and dedication Ability to take on responsibility and work autonomously This role reports to the Executive Manager - IT COVID-19 update  At ALDI we believe that our employees should expect to come to work every day with the comfort and confidence that they are in the safest possible environment. You will be required to adhere to all ALDI and State and Federal Government COVID-safe practices and regulations.  From March 1st 2022  a condition of ongoing employment with ALDI will be that employees are fully vaccinated against COVID-19 unless they have a valid medical exemption. This requirement will apply to all employees across stores  warehouse  transport and offices.

Title: Principal Data Engineer/Analyst
Requirements: Posted by Waqas Kidwai Principal Consultant  FutureYou | Technology | Recruitment Send InMail Position Title: Principal Data Engineer/Analyst (Big Data)  Position Type: Permanent Full-time  Location: Sydney  Melbourne or Brisbane (Hybrid working)  As a Principal Data Engineer  you are one of the most critical members of the team. You are coaching  developing  inspiring and working with your peers and leading the new starters in the chapter to take on the challenge of ingesting  transforming and presenting data from different sources in real-time. You are always in demand and praised by various teams such as Data Science  Data Analytics  Product  Marketing  Sales  Etc  The role is responsible for leading:  Architecture  Design and implement data pipelines in Bigdata platform Understand business requirement and develop solution design to address business requirements Fine-tuning of new and existing data pipelines Schedule and maintain data pipelines Drive optimization  testing and tooling to improve data quality & data governance Assemble large  complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements Identify  design  and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes  optimizing data delivery  etc Architect  design & Build robust and scalable data infrastructure (both batch processing and realtime) to support needs from internal and external users Troubleshoot Big Data platforms and software  including performance-tunes of BI applications Budgeting  tracking and forecasting capital & operational expenditure Interface with product vendors to keep abreast of new technologies  pricing and customer applicability. Participate in vendor evaluations Work with business stakeholders to develop and analyze big data & BI needs Experience Requirements:  10 -15 years’ experience working in Data Engineering and Data Warehousing. Experienced in working on PoCs for testing the efficiency and feasibility of new technologies  design patterns and products. Experience in migration of data assets and pipelines from On-premises to Cloud. Performance tuning on Cloud platform to reduce the daily run cost. Experience in requirements engineering  solution architecture  design  and development / deployment Experience in building fully automated end to end data pipelines using on-premise or cloud-based data platforms Hands on delivery of solutions for Reporting and Analytics use cases. Hands On with advanced SQL on Data Warehouse  Big Data and Native cloud technologies Hands On in data profiling  source-target mappings  ETL development  SQL optimisation  testing and implementation Hands On in working on relational databases like Teradata and Cloud DWs. Hands On in Big Data tools like Spark (python/scala)  Hive  Impala  Hue and storage (e.g. HDFS  HBase) Hands On in CICD processes – BitBucket/GitHub  Jenkins  Nexus etc. Knowledgeable managing structured and unstructured data types Track record of implementing databases and data access middleware and high-volume batch and (near) real-time processing Experience in building Microservices  Rest APIs  Data as a Service architectures. Experience in streaming frameworks (Kafka/Spark Streaming) is preferred 4+ years of hands-on experience in Big Data tools (not limited to) a. Spark b. Python c. Informatica BDM d. Scala e. StreamSets / Apache Nifi f. Cloudera and /or Hortonworks toolset g. Kafka h. Associated supporting technologies such as Unix Scripting i. Hive/Impala/HBASE j. Good knowledge of SQL If you have the required skills and experience  please apply to the job or reach out to our consultant Waqas Kidwai

Title: Senior Report Developer
Requirements: At EY  you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are  with the global scale  support  inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better  too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself  and a better working world for all.  The opportunity  EY DnA is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific  with over 500 specialist employees working across multiple industry sectors.  We are looking for a Report Developer with experience designing reporting systems using Power BI or IBM Cognos technologies to work within the Technology Consulting – Data and Analytics team to join our office in Canberra  Melbourne  Sydney  Perth  Brisbane or Adelaide.  As a Senior Report Developer  you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives. Some of your responsibilities will include: Working closely with delivery and technical leads  data engineers  report developers  testers and end-users ensuring seamless solution delivery outcomes. Applying best practices to the design of visualizations. Applying experience in Power BI or IBM Cognos to effectively communicate business meaning and simplify report development for technical and business users. Applying quality assurance best practices to verify reports function optimally and ensuring the feature changes do not break functionality. Thus includes  providing guidance to testing teams with "what to test" and "how to test". Keeping stakeholders (internal and external) up to date on progress  problems and associated solutions.  To qualify for the role  you must have Hands-on experience with design  build and system testing of data visualisation reports using Power BI or Cognos. Experience working on Business Intelligence  Data Warehousing or analytics projects Knowledge of data reporting systems  practices and standards. SQL skills  including database and report optimisation analysis. Knowledge and experience in either traditional SDLC or agile delivery methodologies (or hybrid approaches). Australian Citizenship and the ability to obtain security clearance – due to the nature of this role  this is essential.  Ideally  you’ll also have Additional experience or exposure to other database or BI tools (e.g. Tableau  SAS VA) Advanced analytics experience including predictive analytics. Analytical mind set / someone that challenges assumptions. Strong problem solver  someone comfortable to challenge the status quo Exceptional communication  documentation and presentation skills Responsibilities  Qualifications  Certifications - External  What We Offer  A tech career @ EY means working with 40 000 fellow technologists who are creating cutting edge applications in blockchain  AI  cloud  analytics  robotics and cyber  harnessing tech to power the human enterprise and build a more equitable  sustainable world. We offer world class training and a free Tech MBA to all our people.  Globally at EY  we are committed to offer Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next. Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility  so you can make a meaningful impact  your way. Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights  coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs. Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.  We hold a collective commitment to foster an environment where all differences are valued and respected  practices are equitable  and everyone experiences a sense of belonging. If you require any adjustments to the recruitment process in order to equitably participate  we encourage you to advise us at the time of application via contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or phone +61 3 8650 7788 (option 4).  The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.  EY | Building a better working world  EY exists to build a better working world  helping to create long-term value for clients  people and society and build trust in the capital markets.  Enabled by data and technology  diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow  transform and operate.  Working across assurance  consulting  law  strategy  tax and transactions  EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Title: Analytics Engineer
Requirements: Canva’s Commitment and Mission At Canva  we celebrate diversity. We deeply believe that bringing together diversity of thoughts  perspectives and expression is key to building the best product  team and company. We look for many different skills and abilities  as well as how you can enhance Canva and our culture. So  even if you don’t think you quite meet all of the skills listed or tick all the boxes  we’d still love to hear from you!  Our mission at Canva is to empower the world to design and since launching in 2013  we have grown exponentially  amassing over 75 million monthly active users across 190 different countries and a team of over 2 800 people… and the best bit is that we’ve only achieved 1% of what we know we’re capable of.  Join us and design your future.  About the team The Analytics Engineer empowers Canvanauts to discover insights from our data. Like a librarian  the analytics engineer curates the catalog so that the researchers can do their work more effectively. Our Analytics Engineers maintain and operate the data platform to deliver well-defined  transformed  tested  documented  and code-reviewed data sets.  We handle Billions of rows and Petabytes of data from hundreds of different sources - including events  databases  and third-party systems. We work in collaboration with multiple teams and stakeholders to support their decision making process. We work everyday to make Canva one of the most valuable companies in the world and to do the most good along the way. We are looking to grow our team and multiply our impact.  Responsibilities You will be applying software engineering practices to provide clean data sets from the data warehouse to end users. You will work primarily with SQL and Python to automate and optimize data loading and transformation systems. You will maintain  operate  and tune data infrastructure (Fivetran  Snowflake  Redshift  dbt  Looker  Mode Analytics  Census) at scale. You will develop infrastructure  tools and scalable data ingestion  access and modeling frameworks to support Canva's use of the data warehouse. You will design and build out analytic data models that support answering questions from our product teams and company leaders. You will ensure that our users’ data is protected throughout the data lifecycle and that it’s used with their consent to provide them with an amazing product experience.  Required Skills & Experience Proven experience building and managing large data platform environments in the cloud  AWS preferred. Experience with modern MPP cloud-based data warehouse solutions such as Snowflake  Redshift  or BigQuery. Advanced SQL and data modeling skills as well as reasonable proficiency in Python. Experience working with event-oriented data sets of large size and diverse schemas. Experience developing dashboards and reporting systems. Familiarity with a wide set of data warehousing principles  including architecture  methodologies  schemas  performance/optimization principles  and best practices. Strong competency following the ELT approach to the data integration process. Curiosity and self-drive to continuously learn new techniques and tools to extract value from data. Experience owning  tracking  and delivering goals  working both independently and in teams.  Working at Canva Our culture is unlike anywhere else and we design your #CanvaLife experience to empower you to do the best work of your life.  Whether you’re in the office  working from home or choosing your own adventure  our benefits for permanent Canvanauts include:  • Equity packages for you to truly be a part of the Canva journey. Hybrid work model (in-office & from home) coming together for 8 days a year. • Flexible leave so you can recharge  give back  support others or focus on your own professional development. • Inclusive parental leave policy that supports all parents and carers throughout their parenting and caring journey. • An annual Vibe & Thrive allowance. This is for you to spend on whatever will support your wellbeing and development.. because you know what you need to Vibe and Thrive  better than anyone. • Virtual and in-office wellness benefits including Canva University  Employee Assistant Programs and Fitness & Meditation Classes. • Canva For Good program matching your not-for-profit donations  Force for Good leave (3 paid volunteering days) and a range of sustainability and ethical initiatives to get involved in.  We make hiring decisions based on your experience  skills and passion. Please note that interviews are conducted virtually. When you apply  please tell us the pronouns you use and any reasonable adjustments you may need during the interview process.

Title: Data Engineer
Requirements: What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating many opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.  At Cognizant  together with your colleagues from all around the world  you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible  more innovative  and successful. Moreover  this is your chance to be part of the success story.  Job Description Hands on experience working in data engineering or data architecture role Experience with at least two of the following technologies Python  Scala  SQL  Java Experienced in multiple database technologies such as Distributed Processing (Spark  Hadoop  EMR)  Traditional RDBMS (MS SQL Server  Oracle  MySQL  PostgreSQL)  MPP (AWS Redshift  Teradata). NoSQL (MongoDB  DynamoDB  Cassandra  Neo4J  Titan) Experience and interest in Cloud platforms such as AWS  Azure  Goole Platform or Databrick Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban  Luigi  Airflow  etc. Experience with AWS cloud services: S3  EC2  EMR  RDS  Redshift and Kinesis Experienced in traditional data warehousing / ETL tools (Informatica  Talend  Pentaho  DataStage) Big Data Development experience using Hive  Impala  Spark  and/or Kafka Knowledge of Data Governance and string understanding of data lineage and data quality Experience in designing and building streaming data ingestion  analysis and processing pipelines using Kafka  Kafka Streams  Spark Streaming and similar cloud native technologies. Experience in software engineering best practices such as code reviews  testing frameworks  maintainability  and readability Experience deploying applications into production environments e.g. code packaging  integration testing  monitoring  release management Experience working on a collaborative Agile product team Excellent communication  listening  and influencing skills Experience working in DevOps  Agile  Scrum  Continuous Delivery and/or Rapid Application Development environments Hands-on experience building mock and proof-of-concepts across different capabilities/toolsets Experience mentoring and training other developers with best practices and design patterns  potentially including code reviews of other developers is a must. This includes quality assessment and technical knowledge of data source capabilities (i.e.  data capture frequency  known issues  etc) Contribute in the design and development of data integration and data pipelines. Will have a strong focus on delivering data engineering solutions in line with BHP’s Data Strategy Ability to coach members of the teams on achieving goals and developing necessary skills to get results Ability to provide leadership in product quality  technical excellence and engineering practices Responsible for establishing and enforcing standards and practices with the software development team. We’re looking for a Customer Insights Analyst to help drive our digital channels and contact centre forward as we continue to be Australia’s most recommended bank.  We're looking for a Senior Customer Insights Analyst  Customer Interactions Tribe to join our high performing team.  Our Customer Insights team improve service and product offerings by understanding our Customers enquiries  actions and behaviour’s to deliver high impact and tangible financial results. That’s where you step in! Working closely with senior stakeholders and SMEs  you’ll transform business challenges and questions into analytical approaches to discover and deliver insights. Your insights will assist the business to identify opportunities for value-add  operational efficiency and continuous improvement  helping us to realise our business strategy. You’ll be shaping the way our customers bank  helping them to do their thing. This is an excellent career opportunity for an insights analyst on a data-science path.  Are you ready to make a real impact on our business and our customers lives?  What are you going to do? You will be… Helping develop new data and analytics capabilities to improve Customer Experience across our customer facing channels. Democratise the use of data across the Customer Experience  Service and Distribution Teams Developing analytics to understand customer behaviours through various channels that will improve quality and accuracy of reporting as well as providing insights to support Business Cases Improving analytical capability by creating streamlined reporting using our BI reporting platforms Enhancing data capture across the Contact Centre  Broker/Direct Mortgages channels and Adviser Wealth team by liaising with the wider team in CI and the respective areas What are we looking for? Someone who has… Advanced SQL or similar query language (recommended Base SAS + Enterprise Guide) Tableau Desktop  Prep and Server are preferred Business Objects would be highly desirable Experience working with GCP  BigQuery and DataLab would be an advantage Advanced skills in Excel and PowerPoint and the ability to effectively communicate a story through data (visualization's  story-telling) Statistical and Mathematical Methods Experience working with big data platforms / data preferred A growth mindset  constantly looking at ways to improve processes and systems If you meet a number of the requirements  but not all  we encourage you to submit your application.  About Us  At ING  we want to make life simpler and more worthwhile – for everyone who banks with us  for the people who work with us  and the community at large  too.  When you come to work at ING  you’re joining a team where individuality isn’t just accepted  it’s encouraged. We’ve built a culture that’s fun  friendly and supportive – it’s the kind of place where you can be yourself and make the most of whatever you have to offer.  We give people the freedom to take risks  think differently  take ownership of their work  and make great things happen. We’re here to help you get ahead. And with our global network  there’s plenty of scope to take your career in new directions  perhaps even ones you’ve never considered.  People of all ages  sexual orientations  cultures and backgrounds are welcome to apply – likewise if you’re an indigenous Australian  or you’re living with a disability  or you have family or caring responsibilities.  Sound like the kind of place you’d feel at home? We’d love to hear from you.  (One last thing  ING operates a direct talent sourcing model. So no agency introductions  please.)  For more information contact Skye Griffiths on skye.griffiths@ing.com.au
