Title: SAS Data Engineer
Requirements: What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating many opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.  At Cognizant  together with your colleagues from all around the world  you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible  more innovative and successful. Moreover  this is your chance to be part of the success story.  Position Summary  Job Description 6+ years of IT experience in Banking and Finance  more than 4 years as Test Analyst and 2+ years as Data Analyst in ETL  Data Warehousing  Data Migration  BI Reporting  Test Data Management  Data Masking Projects  Data Governance and Data Testing projects. Experience in Implementation and testing of Cloud technology solutions (AWS) and Google Cloud technology. Worked as a Data Analyst for a data migrating project from legacy systems to cloud based CRM AWS  Google Cloud platform. Worked as Test Analyst /Data Analyst for Data warehousing projects. Experience in Software Development Lifecycle (SDLC)  QA methodologies  Software Testing Lifecycle (STLC). Experience in Data Profiling  Data Creation  Data Cleansing  and synthetic data generation. Expertise in Analysis & develop policies  procedures standards  as per guidelines. Expertise In supporting the Data Management team with the use of data management artefacts  tools  processes  and practices. ETL solution implementation and testing involving Oracle  SQL Server  Redshift  PostgreSQL  SAS and DB2 using SAS Studio  DataStage  SSIS  Informatica PowerCenter  Control M  SSRS Translate functional and non-functional requirements into accurate user stories and process flows. Experience in Analysing client’s business requirements and processes through document analysis  interviews  workshops  and workflow analysis. Experienced in advanced excel functionalities  MS Access  PowerPoint Skills. Have extensively worked in both WATERFALL and AGILE projects. Experience in using TEAMS  JIRA  VSTS  RALLY for project tracking and Test management tool (ALM/QC/QTest) for defect tracking  test planning  test execution and Requirement Traceability Matrix. Hands on experience in PROC SQL  Data Steps  Structured Query Language (SQL)  Procedural Language/Structured Query language (PL/SQL)  SQL Developer  Unix Shell Scripting  PYTHON  Visual Studio Code. Hands on experience in Databases viz Oracle SQL Developer  SQL Server  DB Visualiser  Teradata  Snowflake  Bigdata  Bigquery  Proc SQL  Data Steps Hands on experience in BI reporting - Business Objects  MicroStrategy  Power BI  SSRS Good at Stakeholder management and co-ordination with team. Mandatory Skills Data Analysis  SAS Analytics  ETL  Data Warehousing  Data Migration  BI Reporting  Test Data Management  Data Masking  Data Governance  Data Testing  Data Engineering Duties And Responsibilities Analysing user requirements  software analysis  code analysis  and requirements analysis  and software review  identification of code metrics  system risk analysis and software reliability analysis. Developing SAS Code to create data models in Database Configuration of business rules in SAS Enterprise Guide. Creating Source Data required for Credit Risk Program Implementation. Scheduling batch jobs to load the data into Database in cycle. Creation and execution of tests for subsystems and components. Creation of user stories in JIRA. Participates in client status meeting jointly with team  prepares daily status report to manager  and updates work progress in project tracker  project tracking and monitoring. Prepares scripts to create test data  populates test data to ensure test environment setup. Scenario Identification and Test Case Scripting in JIRA and get it reviewed from Business Analyst and Business stakeholders. Responsible for communication with Release Management and Technical Architecture teams during deployments. Automation and Performance Tuning on demand. Executing the test cases in HP ALM and identifying the defects and following up till closure. Communicate with Business  Architect  Design Team for clarification during coding to meet the Business requirements. Qualification  Qualifications & Certifications:  Bachelor’s in technology or Computer Engineering  Salary: >$100 000  Certification  Next steps  If you feel this opportunity suits you  or Cognizant is the type of organization you would like to join  we want to have a conversation with you! Please apply directly with us.  For a complete list of open opportunities with Cognizant  visit http://www.cognizant.com/careers  Cognizant is committed to providing Equal Employment Opportunities. Title: SAP Senior MDM (Master Data Management) Data Analyst
Requirements: Overview  Bio-Rad is looking for an SAP Senior MDM (Master Data Management) Data Analyst to support our global organization and projects in our Asia-Pacific offices. As part of the Master Data Management (MDM) Global ERP team  the Data Analyst will be responsible for the discovery  classification  assessment  and alignment of business data for SAP Customer and Vendor Master Data and Master Data Governance (MDG). The ideal candidate will be more business-focused on this position and work with subject matter experts  other Business Systems Analysts  Data Architects  System Integrators  and others across functional boundaries to develop data migration plans  data quality plans  data migration test cases  and data validation plans. The Data Analyst will also be responsible for developing and documenting the business rules for data cleansing  data staging  data migration and data referential integrity.  Responsibilities  Responsible for data migration from legacy systems to SAP ECC or SAP HANA  along with SAP implementation and/or process transformation. Configure the system for MDM business processes in SAP (globally) with a Vendor and Customer focus. Design IT solutions for global MDM business processes in alignment with the company’s strategic initiatives related to SAP Vendor Master  Customer Master  Interfaces etc. Create functional specification documents that require development of WRICEF (Workflow Reports Interfaces Conversion Enhancement and Form) objects. Document business requirements and analyze fit/gaps in the current global template. Design  test and QA all MDM business processes. Document system configurations  SOPs and other operational workbooks in SAP Solution Manager. Support SAP integration with downstream consuming systems and support data conversion efforts from legacy systems to SAP. Assess impacts of scope changes and work closely with Change Management to prepare for implementation. Operate in close partnership with the IT and business communities  subject matter experts  external consultants  cross functional teams etc. Prepare for and support operational readiness and production cutover efforts. Provide HyperCare support.  Qualifications  Bachelor's/Master’s degree in Information Technology  Business  or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Seven (7)+ years of systems/ data analysis/ configuration experience in a large international manufacturing company having participated in 3+ full cycle global SAP implementations. Experience with MDG configuration/implementation. In-depth knowledge of SAP MDM business processes with cross functional integration knowledge and previous experience in SAP Customer and Vendor and MDG. Ability to perform FUT/UAT and support ITC and validation testing Data Migration experience from legacy systems to SAP ECC or SAP HANA  along with SAP implementation and/or process transformation. Experience with data mapping  data construction  de-duplication and fit gap analysis. Proven expertise in data analysis  data modeling  and data management techniques. Experience in creating/reviewing functional specifications for custom enhancements  basic programming experience to write queries and formulas also highly desirable. Previous experience on project teams with a proven ability to work under time constraints while meeting critical milestones. Be an ambitious self-starter and work well in pressure and ambiguous situations. Proven ability to solve problems in a methodical manner and to track and measure expected results. Can process and disposition a high volume of requests in an organized and efficient manner Solid analytical skills  and a strong customer focus  attention to detail a necessity  willingness to learn. Strong oral and written communication skills. Experience with international business processes and relationships a strong plus.

Title: Data Engineer
Requirements: In the time it takes you to read this job ad  around 100 new accounts will have signed up to Linktree. We’re growing  fast! Since 2020  Linktree has 🚀 from 4M to over 20M accounts  scaling from 20 team members to over 200. To learn more about how we work (and get the 101 on our $6K flexible benefits package)  keep reading.  P.S. If you don’t tick every box in this ad  please don’t rule yourself out just yet. We’ve seen the research that women and other people in underrepresented groups tend to only apply when the checklist is all ticks. We prioritise hiring incredible human beings over ticking boxes – so if this role resonates with you  hit that apply button!  This role sits in Linktree's Data Platform team  which provides the structure and backbone of Data for the rest of the organisation. We are looking to fill 2 roles  one at a Senior level and the other a mid-level engineer.  As well as the Cloud Data Engineer skills and experience you bring (Python  SQL and Snowflake) we are looking for people with a high level of curiosity and enthusiasm to solving complex data problems. If you have a tendency to investigate problems and continually look for better ways of doing things  we could be a match.  As a Data Engineer at Linktree  you will be contribute to building data pipelines and reusable data products and patterns that make up Linktree's data platform.  Being in the Platform team  Cloud-first thinking and experience is also a key requirement and focus of this role.  This role reports to Shane Williams and working alongside amazing people like Stephanie & Hamza  there's a great team to share learnings with.  In this role you will:  Be extremely hands-on to deliver outcomes alongside fellow data engineers Work in close collaboration with our stakeholders and technical teams to architect  design  implement  test and manage leading data and analytics solutions Ensure all solutions conform to Linktree’s existing design patterns  architecture & data governance practices Drive and contribute to technical design discussions  deliver high quality data products  and serve as an escalation point for failures. Mentor and educate team members on Data Engineering Concepts (Senior Engineers will mentor but all aim to educate each other)  What we are looking for:  2 years + experience as Data Engineer on Cloud Data Platforms (remember we are looking for Mid & Senior level engineers) Expertise in DBT  Snowflake  Python  SQL  Airflow Familiarity with CICD tooling and implementation Knowledge and experience in big data architecture and engineering Tackled challenges of persisting  working with  and exposing metadata from data engineering processes using tools such as Amundsen Strong communication skills – verbal and written – to be able to break down complex topics into simple solutions and ideas Curiosity and enthusiasm A continual learning mindset  Where & How We Work  We are a global  diverse group across age  gender  and race and offer a truly flexible and family friendly work environment. Kids  pets  and the occasional delivery person are all actively encouraged to appear on our Zoom screens. All of us at Linktree work either fully remote or a hybrid "remote  but in-office sometimes" approach and that will continue even when COVID is behind us.  We currently have offices in Melbourne  Sydney and LA is coming next  but our team is spread across Australia  United States  and New Zealand. Growing from 20 people in early 2020  to 50 in 2021 and over 200 in 2022  Linktree is still growing rapidly!  Being globally distributed doesn't mean working to one timezone and we offer autonomy and flexibility in how you structure your days and weeks. There will be the need for some collaboration outside of a "normal" 9-5 being a global company  but we aim to work asynchronously where possible.  Our Culture & Benefits  Linktree's company culture and values are based around collaboration  diversity  inclusion  and flexibility. Those are all nice words but to give you some more specific examples:  We recognise that each person is unique and have designed our benefits with this in mind. Each person has $6000 AUD to spend across Wellness  Growth  Lifestyle  and Impact pillars. This could be spent on things like (but not limited to): fitness memberships  development courses  books  childcare  pet insurance  mental health support  bike equipment  travel  or green energy initiatives. Employee Stock Option Program - we want each and every employee to share in the company’s success as we go further together. We have a paid 18-week parental leave program that is inclusive of birth and non-birthing parents and supports the whole parenting lifecycle. We also offer 4 weeks of paid leave for early pregnancy loss and the full parental leave for later pregnancy loss  in addition to a support program. We are proud to offer all regular full-time and part-time employees 20 hours paid volunteering leave per calendar year. Flexibility is at the core of Linktree  so whether you prefer fully remote  the office  or a bit of both  the choice is up to you. We trust you to get the work done. We have several diversity and inclusion initiatives underway  including a D&I council  training for all staff on neurodiversity  unconscious bias  and the incorporation of a transpositive inclusion policy. We prioritise our team's mental health  with all employees having free access to Headspace and Uprise  including 1:1 coaching sessions from qualified psychologists or counsellors. All Linktree staff receive $1000 AUD towards setting up their work from home space.  The Linktree Story  The average number of social media accounts is close to 9 per person these days. Chances are you’re also using more than 3-4 social media platforms - but where should someone who wants to discover more about you achieve that? In a highly fragmented digital world  the concept of presenting your whole self feels overwhelming to most - and that’s where Linktree comes in.  Creating this category 5 years ago  we launched a simple tool that allowed anyone to manage their corner of the online world. Want to link all your social media accounts under one link? Thinking of turning your passion into your income? Want to share your ideas  beliefs  or even just a playlist you like? Linktree has the platform to help you get it done.  It sounds good  we hear you say  but how do I know if it works? Fair question - why don’t you take it up with Facebook  TikTok  Redbull  HBO  Metallica  Alicia Keys  Selena Gomez  or Michelle Obama? They’re all using Linktree!  With close to 40 000 signups per day (with no signs of stopping)  plus our latest funding round of $152M AUD valuing Linktree at $1.7 billion  we’re on our way to making a real impact on the digital universe - and we’d love for you to join us for this ride.  At Linktree  we celebrate and support everyone’s perspective and background  and we’re proud to be an equal opportunity workplace. We aim to foster a diverse and inclusive environment where all team members have a sense of belonging  because we believe in going further together. Linktree welcomes all people regardless of sex  gender identity  race  ethnicity  disability  pregnancy  age  or other lived experience.

Title: Digital Data Specialist
Requirements: Job Description  Opportunity snapshot  We are looking for talent in Digital Analytics with a range of skills. Multiple opportunities available in the team to support the growth in the customer agenda at Bupa. We would love to hear from a range of high-quality candidates  so encourage you to put your application in  if the role sounds like you.  An exciting opportunity reporting into the Digital Analytics Manager has become available at Bupa. You will be based in Melbourne or work remotely as a Digital Data Specialist as part of the Digital Insights team to implement the digital data layer of Bupa digital estate as per standards. You will be required to maintain and extend the digital data layer  ensuring that digital data capture is consistent over time to enable digital metrics tracking and trending. You will also be required to provide technical support and advice in Conversion Rate Optimisation (CRO) & Personalisation program and Insights Driven Optimisation for website.  With some background in digital data tagging and implementing marketing tags  you will have a ‘can-do’ attitude with an ability to think outside the box  comfortable with ambiguity and adapt well to change. This is a fantastic role to bring in your digital and analytical skills to help derive customer insights and see these turn into action that improve outcomes for Bupa’s customers.  You will have the opportunity to gain a deeper industry knowledge  make your mark and be part of Bupa’s customer revolution journey to become the world’s most-customer centric healthcare company.  There are 2 full-time  Permanent vacancies available in the team.  How will I help?  Key Accountabilities Include  But Not Limited To Working within a team of analytic professionals in coming up with solutions that best suits the business need. Contributing to decisions on digital metrics. Thinking creatively  out of the box outcome  thriving on challenges  requiring innovative solutions. Provide work estimates and contribute to evaluating work backlog across a diverse portfolio of requirements. Work as a member of an efficient Digital Analytics "factory" with appropriate balance of automation  bespoke reporting and data validation exercise. Collaborate with other reporting and insights teams across Bupa to share information and leading best practices. What’s in it for me?  As well as a competitive salary  a range of Bupa benefits and flexible working/work from home arrangements  you’ll be encouraged to innovate. You will be collaborating with various teams and will have the opportunity to learn and develop your career in a supportive environment. We trust  respect and consider everyone  knowing your difference will make the difference.  Perk Highlights Discount on our health insurance  travel  car  home  contents and pet insurance products as well as discounts when you attend a Bupa Dental clinic or purchase glasses from a Bupa Optical store. A dedicated internal wellbeing team provides you with a range of services  such as a global resilience program  regular training opportunities on a range of wellbeing topics and access to a plethora of wellbeing discounts. You will feel happier & healthier  working at Bupa! An additional well-being day each year to enjoy a day off. What do I need? Tertiary qualifications in Business or Marketing or other relevant qualification. (desirable) Excellent analytical skills with an ability to solve problems creatively. Demonstrated experience in a similar role with experience in Marketing Tag implementation and running multivariate test for insight-based optimisation (desirable). Demonstrated experience setting up tags using Enterprise Tag Management Solutions such as Tealium  Google Tag Manager or Ensighten (desirable). Good understanding of tag management data layer. Working knowledge with JavaScript will be beneficial. Experience working directly with developers in implementing analytic solutions. Experience within an optimisation program aimed at improving onsite conversion. Experience in online marketing campaigns  across channels including SEO  SEM  Display and Social. Adobe Analytics and Target Premium extensive experience. (desirable) Demonstrated experience in working collaboratively and engaging and managing stakeholders. Effective planning  organising and prioritising skills to be able to meet deadlines and milestones. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills with a desire to learn  develop and advance your career within Digital Analytics /Insights team. Digital Tools - Tealium  Adobe Analytics  Adobe Target or other tag management and analytic solutions  Microsoft Office (Advanced Excel)  Sitecore  Tealium audience manager and Tealium data access (desirable). About Bupa  Bupa is an international healthcare group which has been committed to a purpose of longer  healthier  happier lives and making a better world for more than 70 years. In Australia and New Zealand  Bupa supports more than 5 million customers through a broad range of health and care services including health insurance  aged care  rehabilitation  dental  optical  medical  hearing and medical visa services.  Our people reflect the diversity of our community. At Bupa  your wellbeing  identity and own story is respected and valued.  Time Type  Full time

Spark ML or R) Experience with real-time integration (using Kafka  Spark streaming or other technologies) Experience with Flink  Beam Experience with various messaging systems  such as Kafka  RabbitMQ  Solace A critical understanding of Lambda Architecture Experience and knowledge of major Hadoop distribution such as Cloudera  MapR  Hortonworks HDP Good experience with build tools like Maven  Gradle  Ant Working knowledge of API-based integration for modern system  What We Offer  A tech career @ EY means working with 40 000 fellow technologists who are creating cutting edge applications in blockchain  AI  cloud  analytics  robotics and cyber  harnessing tech to power the human enterprise and build a more equitable  sustainable world. We offer world class training and a free Tech MBA to all our people.  Globally at EY  we are committed to offer: Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next. Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility  so you can make a meaningful impact  your way. Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights  coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs. Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.  The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.  The preferred applicant will be subject to employment screening by EY or by their external third party provider. Regarding this role  the minimum salary is $90 000 including 10% superannuation.  EY | Building a better working world  EY exists to build a better working world  helping to create long-term value for clients  people and society and build trust in the capital markets.  Enabled by data and technology  diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow  transform and operate.  Working across assurance  consulting  law  strategy  tax and transactions  EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Title: Data Technical Business Analyst
Requirements: What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating many opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.  At Cognizant  together with your colleagues from all around the world  you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible  more innovative  and successful. Moreover  this is your chance to be part of the success story.  Required Ed Skills Significant IT Technical Business Analyst experience in enterprise / Big Data projects with a combination of technical and functional business focus. Must have experience in designing data mapping from source to target systems with knowledge on business rules  data transformations and reporting requirements. Must have knowledge on traditional databases and modelling concepts like referential integrity  entity-relationship  etc. Ability to gather  organize and synthesize large amounts of information from various sources and liaise with business for any requirement changes/clarifications. Work with the business teams developing complex code-based ETL/ELT data pipelines. Initiate & conduct collaborative working group sessions with business and technical SMEs to firm up requirements and solution view. Proficient in SQL to query and analyse data from various sources and modelling concepts like referential integrity  entity-relationship  etc. Knowledge in data modelling methodologies and data engineering. Understand Big data application architecture. Strong experience in Agile environments Exceptional communication skills You thrive in a constantly changing and dynamic work environments Excellent people and stakeholder management skills A proactive approach with client and a drive to exceed expectations A flexible and adaptable attitude Capabilities Feature creation across functional domains  maintain a healthy product backlog. Backlog prioritization in consultation with product owners. Initiate & conduct collaboration workgroup sessions with business and technical SMEs to firm up requirements and solution view. Active participation in Product Increment (PI) planning workshops Collaboration with cross team BAs to create a unified view of feature backlog  present sprint-wise delivery plan to business owners. Liaise with Feature Team Lead (FTL)  Scrum Master to organize feature walkthroughs  provide inputs on story point estimation (T-shirt sizing). Articulate & escalate discovery risks  as appropriate. Understand usage of project & program management tools like ESA and its processes Big data experience or Open Source full stack (Java and related technology) technical skills is required Ensure consistent billability for self and the team in consulting engagements (direct or indirect revenue streams). Manage travel readiness of the team. Facilitate understanding of operational issues. Manage financial and operational activities Enterprise Competencies Review use-cases for enhancements related to various customer episodes (e.g. Order tracking  Moving home  Hardware add-ons)  firm up test scenarios. Engage with upstream & downstream systems to coordinate functional flows and release schedules. Facilitate communication between functional and implementation teams to firm up remediation approach and implementation path for key defects / gap areas. Assist in defining problem or opportunity and work towards realizing product and project vision. Develop product strategy and document business benefits  rationale for change in terms of business outcomes. Employee Status : Full Time Employee  Shift : Day Job  Job Posting : Mar 23 2022  About Cognizant  Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies  transforming clients' business  operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based  consultative approach helps clients envision  build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S.  Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant.

Title: Data Engineer
Requirements: Job description:  Develop & manage data pipeline & data analytics platform (Azure + Agile) Permanent full-time opportunity Melbourne Processing Centre  Melbourne  with WFH flex   This is your opportunity to find a life-giving purpose  As an organisation  our purpose is simple: to give life. It’s at the centre of everything we do. As part of the Lifeblood team  you’ll have the opportunity to contribute to this life-giving purpose and grow your career. We’re committed to ensuring you have the ability to innovate  learn new skills  and embrace new challenges – all while making a difference in the lives of countless others.    Lifeblood has an inspiring opportunity for you  As a Data Engineer at Lifeblood  your primary focus will be to manage & develop data pipelines feeding the enterprise data analytics platform that support reporting and analytics solutions. You will profile and model data from multiple sources and design data models using Star Schema and Data Vault 2 for consumption in the enterprise data analytics platform.  You will apply automation techniques and explore & propose appropriate data ingestion approaches whilst proactively monitoring and maintaining the enterprise data analytics platform environments  including defining optimisation approaches to improve performance or cost.  You will define best practices for Azure data cloud design  governance  quality  lifecycle  security  and privacy outcomes within the scope of the Data Analytics platform and implement appropriate data management and data quality processes and tools to ensure the integrity  timeliness of reporting systems. Finally you will actively contribute to the review  selection and implementation of tools in conjunction with the team to provide appropriate subject matter expertise for stakeholders Sound interesting? Here’s what we’re looking for     Experience as a Data Engineer on the Microsoft Azure platform  Practical experience in developing data engineering solutions and Azure-based solutions using Data Factory  Synapse  SQL Server  Data Lake  and DevOps  Expertise in Microsoft Azure tools such as Data Factory  Data Lake Storage  Azure SQL  Blob Containers  Synapse  Azure SQL Server  Pipelines  Visual Studio  Azure DevOps Repos  CI/CD tools and branching methods  Data Modelling experience (Star Schema and Data Vault 2)  Solid understanding and application of data engineering best practices and refactoring methods  Worked in an Agile delivery team   Experience with Terraform (Beneficial)  Experience with Python / XML (Beneficial)   Permanent full time role reporting into our Data Warehouse Team Lead. The role will be based out of our processing centre in West Melbourne (5-10 minute walk from Southern Cross/Flagstaff) but will have the opportunity to work from home for large portions of the week.    Thrive in a diverse culture that cares for your wellbeing  At Lifeblood  we welcome different perspectives and backgrounds and we’re proud to foster an environment where people can come together to achieve their very best. That’s why we don’t believe in one-size-fits-all – especially when it comes to your wellbeing. Every employee is unique and we’ve developed a range of initiatives to look after the varying needs of all our people.    As part of the Lifeblood team you’ll have access to a generous salary packaging program  plus a great range of rewards like discounts on insurance  groceries  food & beverage  department stores  travel  and more.    Excited to join us? Apply now and discover a career filled with life-giving possibilities.    Next steps  When it comes to recruitment we like to move fast  this means we progress suitable candidates through the hiring process as soon as we can. You’ll hear from us with an outcome after your application has been reviewed and assessed.    If your application is suitable but the role is filled prior to the advertising close date  you can rest assured that we will keep in touch and consider you for the next similar opportunity.    If selected  you’ll be required to complete a number of background checks — don’t worry  we’ll help you through this process.    For further details on this position please contact Emiliano Sordo on esordo@redcrossblood.org.au    Our facilities are Covid-19 safe places  Click here to learn how we're protecting donors  volunteers  patients and our people.  We encourage all of our employees to be vaccinated against Covid-19 and a number of states have mandated that Lifeblood employees must be vaccinated to perform work for us. Please make sure that you are able to comply with these government requirements  or have the appropriate medical exemption information available.    While we appreciate all interest in our business  we won’t engage with or accept candidates from agencies or consulting firms on this occasion.

Title: Data Engineer
Requirements: About The Job  Toptal developers work with speed and efficiency to deliver the highest quality of work. We are looking for someone who is passionate about their client’s business  and ready to work on exciting projects with Fortune 500 companies and Silicon Valley startups  with great rates and zero hassles. If you are looking for a place to advance your career  enhance your skill set  and build connections around the globe  Toptal is right for you.  About Toptal  Toptal is an exclusive network of top freelancers from around the world. Fortune 500 companies and Silicon Valley startups hire Toptal for their most important projects. Toptal is one of the fastest-growing fully remote networks and empowers freelance software developers  designers  finance experts  product managers  and project managers worldwide to grow and excel in their freelance careers.  Toptal clients vary in sizes and industries  from enterprise organizations and big tech companies to Silicon Valley startups and renowned universities. Once you enter the network  our matchers will contact you with project opportunities that fit your expertise and preferences. We have experts in over 120 countries who get to work remotely on projects that meet their career ambitions.  About The Role  As a Data Engineer  your main goal is to be one step ahead of data scientists and analysts. You will support them by providing infrastructure and tools they can use to deliver end-to-end solutions to business problems that can be developed rapidly and maintained easily. This is more than building and maintaining ETL pipelines. We need innovation  creativity  and solutions that will have a significant impact on the client’s velocity.  Requirements 3+ years of professional experience in software development Working experience with Python and Pandas. Familiarity with the basic principles of distributed computing and data modeling. Extensive experience with object-oriented design and coding and testing patterns  including experience with engineering software platforms and data infrastructures. Working experience with Airflow and Luigi is a big plus. Working experience with Scala is a plus. Familiarity with Google Cloud Platform (e.g. GCS and BigQuery) is a plus. Working experience with Dimensional Modeling and Rails is a plus. Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills. Full-time availability is a strong advantage If you’re interested in pursuing an engaging career working on full-time freelance jobs for exclusive clients  take the next step by clicking apply and filling out the short form to get started.  #RemoteJobDataEngineering

Title: Consultant - Analytics & AI
Requirements: Description: Flexible work arrangements - work in a way that suits you best World-class learning and leadership programs Employee excellence awards/Employee appreciation month Our Analytics & Artificial Intelligence (A&AI) practice within Deloitte Consulting is leveraging established and emerging technologies to maximise our clients’ productivity and freedom to innovate. As an A&AI Consultant you will be empowered to identify opportunities for  and implement  machine learning capabilities  reporting platforms and enterprise data technologies. We are now looking for knowledgeable and passionate people to help accelerate an expansion of our Data & AI capability in the industries of Defence  Security and Justice (DS&J).  The Data & AI team at Deloitte  under which A&AI resides  comprises over 450 specialist practitioners across Australia  each of whom are constantly curious and excited about combining their business acumen and technological expertise to create data-centric solutions that help solve complex problems to help transform our clients’ businesses.  In the Canberra A&AI team  you will be working with practitioners with experience in the Government sector  Australian Defence and intelligence communities and private sectors clients from the industries of mining  energy  finance and more. We help public and private sector clients to design and implement world leading solutions and capabilities. From automated logistics problem-solving  to smarter defence systems with the Australian Defence Force  to better support for low cost housing - we are the partner of choice for our clients and alliance members.  Our relationships with market leading vendors such as AWS  Microsoft  Google  Apple  Snowflake  Salesforce  and Informatica enable our practitioners to be at the forefront of new and emerging capabilities and to deliver our suite of services at scale. We are consistently recognised as leaders in Cloud  Data  Analytics and AI  including in the latest analyst reports.  About The Role Help clients drive significant business outcomes and ROI by leveraging Intelligent system capabilities and insights uncovered through visualisation and statistical analysis Drive business process analysis and assessments for engagement opportunities  understand their challenges  and prepare documentation of solutions and implementation Understand the importance of operational security and the impact of good cyber practices in commercially and legislatively sensitive engagements Analyse  understand and document the business processes in detail where required and communicate effectively with business counterparts and stakeholders Extract  transform and load data from source systems to various data analytics tools Design solutions in accordance with Deloitte  client and vendor specific standards Configure new processes and technical objects using core architecture principles that are efficient  well structured  maintainable  and easy to understand Delivery and support of intelligent and analytics solutions by following best practices and delivery/support lifecycles Communicating with software vendor support team for technical issues and participating with other user community Working within project planning constraints  communicating any identified project risks and issues to the delivery/project manager accordingly and providing inputs to the change control process Guiding and supporting junior team members as required Knowledge And Experience Required At least 1 years of working experience in AI/ML and/or Analytics spaces. Experience in delivering technical solutions  including but not limited to Natural Language Processing  Computer Vision  Cognitive agents  and data visualisations. Experience working in environments with high operational security standards. Good understanding of data modelling  and ETL tools. Experience in Python  SQL  C++  SQL scripting  REST APIs or equivalent. Strong analytical and organisational skills and the ability to handle multiple high-priority projects that meet schedules on time. Ability to acquire and maintain an Australian Government Security Vetting Clearance of Baseline or NV1. Candidates who already cleared are encouraged to apply. In addition  the following experiences will be considered favourably Experience in consulting environment across diverse domains. Experience in Defence  Security of Justice sectors. Experience of software development projects  particularly analytics/data-science platforms or tools. Why Deloitte?  At Deloitte  we create positively differentiated work experiences that enable our people to feel valued and achieve their full potential. Deloitte Australia opens the door to a career that can cross borders virtually and physically across Asia Pacific to gain experience and access projects beyond Australia’s borders. We value difference  and embrace people with diverse backgrounds  experiences  gender identities  abilities and thinking styles. Knowing that people work best in a variety of ways  we are happy to discuss alternative arrangements if the working pattern you are looking for is not specifically indicated.  We’re committed to continually building a safe and respectful workplace  where all our people feel appreciated and accepted. Through the creation of endorsed employee-led diversity networks which promote cultural  disability  LGBTI+  Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and gender equality  we’re leading the way to shape an environment where everybody can thrive.  We are proud to have been recognised for our efforts in inspiring change and accelerating progress – check out our careers site for recent recognition in this space.  Next Steps  Sound exactly like the sort of role for you? Apply now  By applying to this job  you will be assessed against the Deloitte Global Talent Standards. We’ve designed these standards to provide our clients with a consistent and exceptional Deloitte employee experience globally.  At Deloitte  we know we’re at our best when we look out for one another  prioritise respect  fairness  development and wellbeing  foster an inclusive culture and embrace diversity in all forms. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment regardless of their background  experience  identity  ability or thinking style  and if you need assistance or an accommodation during the application process for accessibility reasons this is available upon request.  The preferred candidate will be subject to background screening by Deloitte or by their external third-party provider.

Title: Developer
Requirements: Digital Product Engineer  Grade: Clerk Grade 7/8 ($99 431 - $110 064 + Superannuation + Leave Loading)  Duration: Ongoing (Permanent role)  Location: Gosford (negotiable) Flexible/ Hybrid working arrangements available  Close date: Extended toWednesday  27 April 2022 (9:59AM)  DCS is transforming the way NSW Government agencies interact with customers and are passionate about putting the customer at the centre of everything we do. We adopt state of the art technologies to make government work better.  Better Regulation Division (BRD) works across a broad portfolio of functions and projects to deliver better regulation in NSW. These regulators are responsible for protecting the community  they are modern  innovative  and collaborative. They are responsible for protecting the community and give people confidence to engage in economic and social activities. NSW government strives to be the worlds’ most customer centric government.  About The Team  The Application and Digital Development Team contributes to the planning  design  and creation of new digital solutions. Our team creates new  and works on the amendment  verification and testing of new software. We also improve multimedia applications  web parts  and amend integration issues.  Our team is acknowledged for its completion of urgent ministerial initiatives. We are known to work at a rapid pace to deliver within very short timeframes. We also transform solutions to meet legislative reforms and leverage technology to improve business efficiencies.  We have a great team culture where we are always open and honest and willing to assist each other regardless the role or grade and where poor performance and behaviours are called out.  We work collaboratively with many teams across BRD and DCS to deliver our work. We were responsible for the successful delivery of the Residential Support for tenants affected by COVID and for the Same Day Delivery of Alcohol legislative reforms. We are currently working on reforms for Retirement Villages and are investigating improvements to Small Business Rebates. If you’d like to be part of a modern – very fast paced - team  creating tools and products that result in actual and positive change within the business and the community  then read on.  Key Responsibilities  You will use and leverage technology to improve business efficiencies in line with NSW Government standards and procedures whilst ensuring you protect and manage personal information and cyber security. You will prepare specialised  quality code that complies with specifications and standards as per business requirements and will align product design to enable on time application development. You will contribute to all aspects of the creation of new and ground-breaking digital development  including design  planning  creation  amendment  verification  testing and documentation. You will be working on several initiatives concurrently and need to manage your time and priorities well.  Key Challenges Provide high quality development services in a rapid paced environment Respond to requests for information and advice while balancing competing demands to ensure project objectives are achieved Providing  concise advice and determinations in a dynamic and complex working environment where user needs may conflict with their desires and customers need to be at the centre of what you do To Be Successful In This Role You Need Proven experience in rapid development using Low Code/No Code tools Extensive experience in O365 products including Power Apps  Power BI and Microsoft Flow/Power Automate Demonstrated programming skills in Web based languages and tools Experience in Data Structure and Algorithms A “Can Do” attitude and the ability to document your work and pitch in to help others Testing expertise on multiple browsers and platforms Experience in or knowledge of in Source Controls like Git and Github A good knowledge of Microsoft SQL Server  Computer Networks and Networking Basics To be a team player with a willingness to share information and collaborate to benefit your colleagues and show a high level of initiative If you can demonstrate these capabilities  then we want to hear from you.  For enquiries regarding this position please contact Brett Turner on 0436 819767.  How To Apply  Please submit your CV (max. 3 pages) for review  and a cover letter (max. 2 pages) highlighting what you bring to the role and demonstrating how you meet the above criteria.  Please note: This process involves submitting your application for review  an interview  workplace assessments and/or online assessment and reference checks.  Take a look at the Department of Customer Service website at https://www.linkedin.com/company/nswcustomerservice/about to learn more about us.  About This Role  Salary Grade 7/8  with the base salary for this role starting at $99 431 base plus superannuation  Click Here to access the Role Description . For enquiries relating to recruitment please contact Bethany Jones via Bethany.Jones@customerservice.nsw.gov.au.  Based on our current Work  Health and Safety (WHS) requirements  and in line with our Mandatory Vaccination Policy  it is a condition of engagement for a role within Service NSW/Department of Customer Service that staff be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Successful applicants will be required to provide proof of their COVID-19 vaccination status or have an approved medical contraindication certificate. Any relevant medical circumstances impacting on the ability to obtain a COVID-19 vaccination will be considered. These requirements apply to both internal and external preferred candidates and must be completed prior to commencing in the position. If you have a medical contraindication which may prevent you from complying with this requirement  please contact Bethany.Jones@customerservice.nsw.gov.au to discuss your circumstances.  Closing Date: Extended to Wednesday  27 April 2022 (9:59AM)  Working at Department of Customer Service  The Department of Customer Service (DCS) is a great place to work! Our values of accountability  trust  service  and integrity drive our initiatives and culture. We support innovative programs in areas as broad as digital government  consumer protection and major public works. We are an inclusive organisation that celebrates diversity and flexible work practices and believe our people are our greatest asset.  Visit our Careers site to find out what it means to work for us.  Our Commitment to Diversity  Inclusion & Flexibility  We are committed to diversity  inclusion  and new ways of working.  The Department of Customer Service serves all the people of NSW and we want to reflect that diversity in our people. We welcome and encourage applications from people with disability  Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples  culturally and linguistically diverse groups  the LGBTIQA+ community  veterans  carers  refugees  people in regional NSW and people of all ages. We strive to be an inclusive workplace where all our people can bring their authentic selves to work without judgement.  We understand that there are different ways of getting the job done and offer flexible working arrangements where and when possible.  If you do require an adjustment during the recruitment process  please notify us on your application form or contact the recruiter via Bethany.Jones@customerservice.nsw.gov.au or .

Title: Cloud Engineer - Database
Requirements: About Us  DESCRIPTION  Amazon Web Services is the market leader and technology forerunner in the Cloud business. As a member of the AWS Support team you will be at the forefront of this transformational technology  assisting a global list of companies and developers that are taking advantage of a growing set of services and features to run their mission-critical applications. As a Cloud Support Engineer  you will act as the ‘Cloud Ambassador’ across all the cloud products  arming our customers with required tools & tactics to get the most out of their Product and Support investment.  Would you like to use the latest cloud computing technologies? Do you have an interest in helping customers understand application architectures and integration approaches? Are you familiar with best practices for applications  servers and networks? Do you want to be part of a customer facing technology team helping to ensure the success of Amazon Web Services (AWS) as a leading technology organization?  If you fit the description  you might be the person we are looking for! We are a group of smart people  passionate about cloud computing  and believe that world class support is critical to customer success.  WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT FROM A LIFE AT AWS?  Every day will bring new and exciting challenges on the job while you: Learn and use groundbreaking technologies. Apply advanced troubleshooting techniques to provide unique solutions to our customers' individual needs. Interact with leading engineers around the world. Partner with Amazon Web Services teams to help reproduce and resolve customer issues. Leverage your extensive customer support experience to provide feedback to internal AWS teams on how to improve our services. Drive customer communication during critical events. Drive projects that improve support-related processes and our customers’ technical support experience. Write tutorials  how-to videos  and other technical articles for the developer community. Work on critical  highly complex customer problems that may span multiple AWS services. WHY AWS SUPPORT? First and foremost this is a customer support role – in The Cloud. On a typical day  a Support Engineer will be primarily responsible for solving customer’s cases through a variety of customer contact channels which include telephone  email  and web/live chat. You will apply advanced troubleshooting techniques to provide tailored solutions for our customers and drive customer interactions by thoughtfully working with customers to dive deep into the root cause of an issue. Apart from working on a broad spectrum of technical issues  an AWS Support Engineer may also coach/mentor new hires  develop & present training  partner with development teams on complex issues or contact deflection initiatives  participate in new hiring  write tools/script to help the team  or work with leadership on process improvement and strategic initiatives. Career development: We promote advancement opportunities across the organization to help you meet your career goals. Training: We have training programs to help you develop the skills required to be successful in your role.We hire smart people who are keen to build a career with AWS  so we are more interested in the areas that you do know instead of those you haven’t been exposed to yet. Support engineers interested in travel have presented training or participated in focused summits across our sites or at specific AWS events. As we operate on a follow-the-sun model  with Premium Support sites located globally  there is no after hours on-call or mandated overtime in this role. https://youtu.be/GC3bWcFFZTo   Basic Qualifications The Database role supports our services that focus on Databases technologies  including Amazon Aurora  DynamoDB  Redshift  Athena  as well as AWS Database Migration Service  Data Pipeline  Glue and more. Advanced administration experience with (1) of the following Database engines: MySQL / Oracle / PostgreSQL / MariaDB / SQL Server / Amazon Aurora Advanced experience with System Administration with Linux (Ubuntu  CentOS  RedHat) and/or Microsoft Windows Server and associated technologies (Active Directory  Exchange) Advanced experience with Networking and troubleshooting (TCP/IP  DNS  routing  switching  firewalls  LAN/WAN  traceroute  iperf  dig  cURL or related) Bachelor’s degree in Information Science / Information Technology  Data Science  Computer Science  Engineering  Mathematics  Physics  or a related field OR equivalent experience in a technical position Preferred Qualifications Strong analysis and troubleshooting skills and experience Database troubleshooting and performance tuning Experienced setting up monitoring / alarming for production DB environments Database migration and ETL experience Experience with NoSQL technologies like DynamoDB  Redis  MongoDB  Cassandra or Riak Experienced with Linux system monitoring and analysis Good understanding of distributed computing environments Experience with query analyzers and query tuning / slow query optimization etc. Exposure to Virtualization (VMware  Xen  Hypervisor) Prior working experience with AWS - any or all of EC2  S3  EBS  ELB  RDS  Dynamo DB  EMR Exposure to security concepts / best practices Expertise with Load Balancing  Iperf  MTR  netcat  and other network monitoring / troubleshooting tools Experience Troubleshooting the full application stacks from the OS up through custom applications Amazon Web Services is an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race  religion  color  national origin  gender  sexual orientation  age  marital status  veteran status  or disability status.   Company - AWS Australia Pty Ltd  Job ID: A1387770

Title: EDW Business Intelligence Developer  Analyst
Requirements: BI Developer – Analyst position  Health Manager Level 3  to work with Northern Sydney Local Health District Business Intelligence Unit with end-to-end development of reports and data using Power BI and Qlik.  Employment Type: Temporary Full Time until 30 June 2023  Position Classification: Health Manager Level 3  Remuneration: $2 230.86 - $2 543.19 per week  Hours Per Week: 38  Requisition ID: REQ295301  Where you'll be working  Royal North Shore Hospital Campus in St. Leonards  NSW  What You'll Be Doing  This position is vital in enhancing the Northern Sydney Local Health District Business Intelligence journey. The position will be involved in the end-to-end development of insights and analytics using tools such as Qlik and Power BI to support Northern Sydney Local Health District decision making to improve the monitoring and quality of care provided to our patients. Additionally  you will provide training for stakeholders on how to utilise BI tools and dashboards in their decision making and gain additional insights.  People of Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander background are encouraged to apply.  Candidates will need to meet the following criteria Consistently demonstrates behaviours that reinforce the CORE Values of our organisation  Collaboration  Openness  Respect and Empowerment. Demonstrates these behaviours with all stakeholders  colleagues  direct reports  as well as our patients and consumers  and those that care for them. Tertiary qualification in Computer Science  Information Management or Health Administration and/or extensive experience in performance reporting and Business Intelligence tool development within a large organisation. Experience with analysing and using health datasets. Experience with Cerner eMR and NSW Health EDWARD data warehouse is essential Significant experience as a BI developer with strong all round skills in design and development of interactive analytic tools. Experience in Power BI and Qlik Sense is essential. High level skills and experience using MS SQL  including creating complex views and stored procedures. Demonstrated experience in the development of Business Intelligence tools within a project framework involving scoping  design  user acceptance testing  business continuity planning  access and maintenance planning and post-implementation evaluation High-level communication and interpersonal skills with demonstrated ability to consult  negotiate and carry out presentations and engagement sessions with key stakeholders at all levels Ability to work under pressure to meet deadlines and to work independently as well as part of a team and to understand and adhere strictly to principles of confidentiality and to ensure the integrity  reliability  accuracy of data and data systems. Title: Senior Report Developer
Requirements: At EY  you’ll have the chance to build a career as unique as you are  with the global scale  support  inclusive culture and technology to become the best version of you. And we’re counting on your unique voice and perspective to help EY become even better  too. Join us and build an exceptional experience for yourself  and a better working world for all.  The opportunity  EY DnA is the data and advanced analytics capability within EY Asia-Pacific  with over 500 specialist employees working across multiple industry sectors.  We are looking for a Report Developer with experience designing reporting systems using Power BI or IBM Cognos technologies to work within the Technology Consulting – Data and Analytics team to join our office in Canberra  Melbourne  Sydney  Perth  Brisbane or Adelaide.  As a Senior Report Developer  you will support our clients in defining and implementing a data journey aligned with their strategic objectives. Some of your responsibilities will include: Working closely with delivery and technical leads  data engineers  report developers  testers and end-users ensuring seamless solution delivery outcomes. Applying best practices to the design of visualizations. Applying experience in Power BI or IBM Cognos to effectively communicate business meaning and simplify report development for technical and business users. Applying quality assurance best practices to verify reports function optimally and ensuring the feature changes do not break functionality. Thus includes  providing guidance to testing teams with "what to test" and "how to test". Keeping stakeholders (internal and external) up to date on progress  problems and associated solutions.  To qualify for the role  you must have Hands-on experience with design  build and system testing of data visualisation reports using Power BI or Cognos. Experience working on Business Intelligence  Data Warehousing or analytics projects Knowledge of data reporting systems  practices and standards. SQL skills  including database and report optimisation analysis. Knowledge and experience in either traditional SDLC or agile delivery methodologies (or hybrid approaches). Australian Citizenship and the ability to obtain security clearance – due to the nature of this role  this is essential.  Ideally  you’ll also have Additional experience or exposure to other database or BI tools (e.g. Tableau  SAS VA) Advanced analytics experience including predictive analytics. Analytical mind set / someone that challenges assumptions. Strong problem solver  someone comfortable to challenge the status quo Exceptional communication  documentation and presentation skills Responsibilities  Qualifications  Certifications - External  What We Offer  A tech career @ EY means working with 40 000 fellow technologists who are creating cutting edge applications in blockchain  AI  cloud  analytics  robotics and cyber  harnessing tech to power the human enterprise and build a more equitable  sustainable world. We offer world class training and a free Tech MBA to all our people.  Globally at EY  we are committed to offer Continuous learning: You’ll develop the mindset and skills to navigate whatever comes next. Success as defined by you: We’ll provide the tools and flexibility  so you can make a meaningful impact  your way. Transformative leadership: We’ll give you the insights  coaching and confidence to be the leader the world needs. Diverse and inclusive culture: You’ll be embraced for who you are and empowered to use your voice to help others find theirs.  We hold a collective commitment to foster an environment where all differences are valued and respected  practices are equitable  and everyone experiences a sense of belonging. If you require any adjustments to the recruitment process in order to equitably participate  we encourage you to advise us at the time of application via contactrecruitment@au.ey.com or phone +61 3 8650 7788 (option 4).  The Exceptional EY Experience. It’s Yours To Build.  EY | Building a better working world  EY exists to build a better working world  helping to create long-term value for clients  people and society and build trust in the capital markets.  Enabled by data and technology  diverse EY teams in over 150 countries provide trust through assurance and help clients grow  transform and operate.  Working across assurance  consulting  law  strategy  tax and transactions  EY teams ask better questions to find new answers for the complex issues facing our world today.

Title: Data Engineer
Requirements: Our client is investing heavily in its Product and Technology data team to continue to make data a competitive advantage. This means there are recruiting for several new Data Engineering roles over the coming months  with many starting now. As a mid-level Data Engineer you will work with key stakeholders to build great data products and reduce the complexity in our data systems. You will partner with stakeholders to enable the use of data to create innovative solutions for Thier business.  A day in the life of my clients Data Engineers - Build and manage significant data infrastructure in the cloud. Craft solutions that directly enable reporting specialists  analysts and super-users by exposing consumer focused data models and data pipelines. Work across the Data Engineering teams to contribute to the continuous improvement of data products  processes and systems. Provide data on industry trends  emerging technologies  and new toolsets - we aren't afraid to experiment To be considered for this role you will have - Experience with data analytics and reporting tools Knowledge and application of SQL and Python Experienced working in agile development & delivery processes A commitment to quality in your work Solid understanding of database structures  theories  principles & practices A strong commercial and customer focus  with a commitment to delivering outcomes for both. If you would like to join to work with the latest and greatest in DATA  please get in touch today!

Title: Data Scientists
Requirements: Role/Level: Consultant / Senior Consultant / Manager  Do you have a passion for wrangling complex data into meaningful insight for senior decision makers?  Are you experienced in visual analytics platforms such as Tableau and Power BI and looking to expand your capability in a growing team?  Are you looking to take your strong analytics experience to the next level and make a difference?  Join us!  About Our Business Analytics Team  Our Business Analytics team is expanding rapidly as demand for our leading solutions grows. We work with a broad range of clients  delivering our world-class analytics  data visualisation and executive dashboarding solutions. We have an established  world class team of data professionals who work on interesting and challenging projects  in a culture that values and empowers the individual to realise success and entrepreneurship.  Role specific’s  As one of our data scientists you will work deeply with data  to support the strategic objectives of our Government clients. Your work will help C-suite decision makers to deliver evidence-based outcomes through clear  data-driven solutions and support the team’s engagement and communication.  You will be responsible for:  Working with Australian Government clients to understand and document their information  analysis and decision-making needs using established user-experience and business analysis frameworks. Talking to clients about how data science techniques can help solve their business problems Building  maintaining  improving and formulating strategies from data Actioning and analysing insights from data to make clear and accurate decisions Produce complex data visualisation and reporting dashboards Designing  building and delivering data frameworks including: queries  stored procedures and other mechanisms for extracting data from source systems  transforming it into reporting-friendly formats  and loading it into data warehouses and reporting databases.  You will bring a background that demonstrates:  Bachelor or postgrad qualifications in IT  data analytics  or another relevant field Skills and experience in data visualisation tools  especially PowerBI and/or Tableau Management Consulting experience. Ability to work with a high degree of autonomy and to high standards of quality. Ability to manage scope and timeline of multiple tasks without compromising on quality.  Our ideal candidate will be able to demonstrate one or more of the following:  Strong technical skills in data analysis tools  languages and techniques  such as SQL  ETL tools  and integration/middleware platforms Consulting and/or business development experience  possibly in data- or analytics- related fields. Experience working in an Australian Government environment  whether as an APS employee or consulting to Australian Government agencies You will have a positive attitude  excellent communication skills and be able to utilise your relationship building skills to work with other Synergites and clients in an authentic and personal way.  Security Clearance Requirements  Many of our engagements involve working with clients that have a need for security  privacy and confidentiality. You must therefore be an Australian citizen  you will hold an AGSVA baseline or NV1 clearance or have the ability to obtain one.  Why Synergy?  At Synergy we have a culture that is empowering  positive  open and abundant. We value building long lasting and trusted relationships with our Synergites  clients and community. Synergy is one of Canberra’s fastest growing  most dynamic consulting firms  serving federal and territory governments and commercial clients. Synergy’s culture values and empowers the individual to realise success through entrepreneurial opportunities.  We value diversity and inclusion and believe that no employment opportunity should be limited for any irrelevant reason. All employment decisions are made on the basis of qualifications  merit and business needs. We respect and empower each individual and seek to recruit  develop and retain the most talented people.  Please send your CV to our People Team at recruitment@synergygroup.net.au . More information about Synergy is available at synergygroup.net.au and at our Synergy Group Australia page on LinkedIn.

Title: Senior Analyst  APS6  Specialist Advice & Services Division  Data & Intelligence Branch  All Locations
Requirements: Data and Intelligence Branch  Strategic Data Analysis Unit  The Data and Intelligence Branch supports the ACCC and AER to make informed decisions based on data analysis  effective information handling and intelligence methodology. The Branch consists of four teams: the Strategic Data Analysis Unit  the Infocentre  Legal Technology Services and the Intelligence team.  The Branch has several collaborative functions that support the agency in meeting its strategic objectives  including informing strategic decisions  providing specialist advice  improving data governance and evidence handling  developing tools and sources  driving innovation  collecting and triaging information and optimising the discovery and use of data and information.  The Data and Intelligence Branch sits within the Specialist Advice and Services Division  the ACCC/AER’s centralised in-house provider of legal  economic  international  information and data services.  The Strategic Data Analysis Unit (SDAU) is the ACCC’s specialist data and advanced analytics team  whose remit also includes leading the agency’s data governance program. The SDAU contributes by helping teams across the ACCC work with data to extract insights that inform strategic  operational and tactical decision-making.  Role and Duties  We seek highly motivated and innovative data and analytics professionals who will use their technical expertise for the benefit of Australian consumers  small businesses and the wider economy. In a data and algorithm driven economy  it is critical that the ACCC has the ability both to use advanced data and analytics techniques  and also the ability to analyse and understand how companies are using these techniques to run their businesses and make decisions.  This role sits in the SDAU. SDAU analysts will work directly with teams across the whole agency  contributing to complex and often high profile investigations and inquiries. We work with a range of data (both structured and unstructured) relating to industries across the Australian economy  and we apply a range of analytical techniques. Our toolkit includes R  Python and Power BI. The role suits analysts who enjoy continuous learning and innovation  every project we work on is a new challenge.  Successful candidates will be capable of working independently and have extensive experience in a data-related discipline – such as data analytics  data science  and/or data engineering. Senior Analysts must be able to communicate complex and technical issues simply  clearly and effectively in different forums to a range of stakeholders.  Duties are to be performed under limited direction and in accordance with the APS Code of Conduct and APS Values to achieve results in line with the corporate mission of the ACCC. Duties may include:  · Providing accurate specialist advice and guidance on data and analytics  including scoping analysis that will assist in the understanding of key issues relevant to the investigation or project · Developing objectives for short-term tasks and contributing to strategic planning for longer-term initiatives. · Conducting complex data analysis to reach conclusions and inform decision making · Preparing written reports and presentations detailing the findings of analysis  including evaluation and interpretation of any results · Managing relationships with stakeholders to achieve unit and agency goals  and anticipating and responding to stakeholder needs and expectations. · Building team capability by providing training to increase data literacy and analytical skills in the agency · Providing guidance  mentoring  and leading junior staff For more information about the role including the selection criteria  please see the attached Candidate Kit. How to apply  When applying you will be asked to upload your resume and submit a statement of claims that is no more than 800 words.  When preparing your statement of claims  please take into consideration the role and duties  and detail instances from your past that demonstrate how you meet the selection criteria.  Salary: $89 541 - $100 359 per annum (plus 15.4% superannuation) Contact Officer: John Dickson 08 9325 0678 This role is available on a full time  part time or job share basis.

Title: Data Modelling Engineer
Requirements: What makes Cognizant a unique place to work? The combination of rapid growth and an international and innovative environment! This is creating many opportunities for people like YOU — people with an entrepreneurial spirit who want to make a difference in this world.  At Cognizant  together with your colleagues from all around the world  you will collaborate on creating solutions for the world's leading companies and help them become more flexible  more innovative  and successful. Moreover  this is your chance to be part of the success story.  Job Summary  The Data Modelling Engineer is critical in ensuring that data provided to the Assets and used by all Digital Factory Teams - both on premise and cloud-based - is continually improving in quality  and the all data issues are identified  understood and addressed in order to achieve the high quality accurate data and make it available for key stakeholders thus enabling data driven decision making across the organization.  Key Responsibilities Understanding business problems and the Digital Factory product roadmap Working with product teams to identify required data / information for their solutions and the existing sources of said data. This includes quality assessment and technical knowledge of data source capabilities (i.e.  data capture frequency  known issues  etc.) Working with Product Teams and the Data Integration Engineer to ensure that new data sources deployed for DF products meet data quality requirements Monitors and manages metadata and ensures usefulness of metadata in improving effectiveness and quality of data Work with the Data Domain Owners to understand the Data Domain  Data entities  Data Standard definitions  Data Classification rules and drive Data Quality framework to support enterprise level data architecture. Implements processes and systems to monitor data quality  ensuring production data is always accurate  complete and consistent and available for key stakeholders and downstream business processes. Define and govern data modelling and design standards  tools  best practices  and related development methodologies for the Data Catalog Organization Create logical and physical data models using best practices to ensure high data quality and reduced redundancy Develop and maintain data lineage and source to target mappings to support data platform architecture Ability to coach members of the teams on achieving goals and developing necessary skills to get results Ability to provide leadership in product quality  technical excellence and engineering practices Responsible for establishing and enforcing standards and practices with the software development team. Essential Skills Experience working with large data sets  simulation/ optimization and distributed computing tools Demonstrated expertise in data environment development and improvement across a multitude of on premise and cloud-based data sources Demonstrable experience in developing  validating  publishing and maintaining Logical/physical data models Experience using data modelling tools - e.g.  ErWin Exposure to building data governance and quality frameworks including (data profiling  data catalog  data dictionary  business glossary and data lineage) Experience building and optimizing big data pipelines  architectures and data sets. Experience in working with large datasets  relational databases (SQL)  and distributed systems (Hadoop  Spark  Hive) and stream-processing systems (Spark-Streaming) Experience with object-oriented/object function scripting languages: Python  Scala  etc. Experience with data pipeline and workflow management tools: Azkaban  Luigi  Airflow  etc. Experience with AWS cloud services: S3  EC2  EMR  RDS  Redshift and Kinesis Salary : >$100 000 Next steps  If you feel this opportunity suits you  or Cognizant is the type of organization you would like to join  we want to have a conversation with you! Please apply directly with us.  For a complete list of open opportunities with Cognizant  visit http://www.cognizant.com/careers  Cognizant is committed to providing Equal Employment Opportunities. Successful candidates will be required to undergo a background check.  About Cognizant  Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies  transforming clients' business  operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based  consultative approach helps clients envision  build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the US  Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant.  Employee Status : Full Time Employee  Shift : Day Job  Travel : No  Job Posting : Mar 25 2022  About Cognizant  Cognizant (Nasdaq-100: CTSH) is one of the world's leading professional services companies  transforming clients' business  operating and technology models for the digital era. Our unique industry-based  consultative approach helps clients envision  build and run more innovative and efficient businesses. Headquartered in the U.S.  Cognizant is ranked 185 on the Fortune 500 and is consistently listed among the most admired companies in the world. Learn how Cognizant helps clients lead with digital at www.cognizant.com or follow us @Cognizant.

Title: Data Engineer
Requirements: Posted by Carl McDonald Team Lead | Business Intelligence and Data Specialist at SustainAbility Send InMail We are looking for a passionate Data Engineer to work closely with the Head of Analytics to further enhance the function support of the entire business through their next stage of growth.  Key Responsibilities Develop  test  and maintain data infrastructure to align the architecture with the business requirements using - GCP  Python & Postgres Manage cloud-based data integration process to be used successfully by the analytics team Evaluate and assess new products and services for integration with existing data infrastructure Lead the data implementation & integration of new products and services into existing data infrastructure   Skills And Experience 3+ years Data Engineering experience Strong Python and PSQ0 (Postgres) skillsets - ideally on GCP (Google Cloud) Some experience with visualisations tools such as Power BI or Tableau Excellent communication skills and ability to work autonomously This is a really exciting opportunity to grow with a market disruptor. The opportunity won't be around for long. Don't hesitate to apply.
