Title: Instructor - Part Time Data Analytics
Requirements: In this 10-week (or 6-day accelerated) course  students learn and practice turning messy real-world datasets into actionable  data-driven insights they can communicate  using Excel  SQL and Tableau as the primary tools for analysis.  We are looking for an experienced data analyst to lead this transformative experience as instructor for General Assembly's part-time Data Analytics course.  Skills And Qualifications You are eager to shape the skills  minds  and trajectories of the newest generation of data analysts. You are the person that your colleagues naturally gravitate to when they are trying to figure something out. You have at least 5 years of industry experience with data analytics. You have fluency with Excel  SQL and Tableau  and in your role you’ve been responsible for cleaning messy data  analyzing the data and presenting your data based insights. Essential Responsibilities And Duties Teach 2 hours per evening  2 days a week  for 10 weeks  or 8 hours per day from Monday to Saturday for a week  in a remote classroom environment. Prepare lessons and materials  leveraging existing GA curriculum content for several hours per week. Work alongside GA staff and teaching team to best meet the needs and learning styles of your students Guide students through development of a stellar final project that will showcase their abilities to hiring managers. Facilitate a dynamic and collaborative classroom community. Inspire students to persevere through the challenges of learning a new suite of skills Who are we?  Since 2011  General Assembly has transformed tens of thousands of careers through pioneering  experiential education in today’s most in-demand skills. As featured in The Economist  Wired  and The New York Times  GA offers training in web development  data  design  business  and more  both online and at campuses around the world. More than 21 000 employees at elite companies worldwide have honed their digital fluency with our corporate training programs. Requirements: Posted by Gemma Lewis Joint Managing Director at Resources Group Send InMail Join a Global Business Intelligence Agency.  The world’s biggest brands make their decisions based on sound research and intelligence.  As an Analyst in the research team  you will produce the data  insights and content that goes into strategic reports and presentations.  Dive into truly fascinating contemporary consumer trends across a variety of industries such as: Food & Nutrition  Drinks & Tobacco  Cannabis (medical and retail)  Beauty and fashion  Services  Travel & Tourism  Consumer Finance  Home Technology etc.  Skills you’ll build: Primary research  desk research and secondary analytics Synthesising data and information from multiple sources Excellent writing and reporting skills A commercial outlook as to why the trends are important Experience in conducting trade interviews to qualify information with senior industry leaders Industry expertise in your topics Strong attention to detail  The cool things about working here:  A great time to join the team who are just relocating into newly fitted CBD offices. Everything is new! People who work here  tell me they have the best boss who is supportive  flexible  fair and makes sure you’re appreciated and developing your skills. Not to mention all the lovely global agency benefits like: Summer Fridays – finish early! Flexible working – split between the office hub and home Private health insurance A rewards platform Working from anywhere for 15 days per week 23 days annual leave Global secondment opportunities  Desirable Experience:  A relevant bachelor’s degree qualification Experience of conducting desk research  being able to work with information databases  compiling & cross-referencing information Analytically minded able to see data patterns and present numbers in an accessible way Excellent writing skills to pull information together and write quality  concise reports The type of person who enjoys seeing the bigger picture whilst losing yourself in the detail. A passion for consumer trends and knowledge of the Australian brand landscape Full working rights. Unfortunately  this business can’t currently sponsor.  Interested? I’d love to have a chat on 0452417265 or send your CV to Gemma Lewis at glewis@resourcesgroup.com. Title: Data and Reporting Analyst  Critical Communications
Requirements: INNOVATION thrives here  WHY BAI COMMUNICATIONS It’s an exciting time to be part of BAI Communications. As a leading communications infrastructure provider  our technical excellence is sought after around the world. Building on our ground-breaking achievements  we continue to expand our operations  helping connect people  support communities and advance economies.  At BAI Communications  we keep Australians  from the cities to the outback  connected  and the significance of what we do is felt by everyone. Our critical communications team actively protect our sites and keep services on air. We work alongside authorities  to operate the NSW Government Radio Network and provide life-line communications to NSW Telco Authority emergency service providers who manage public safety. We are incredibly proud by the commitment  hard work and leadership our people show every day. Our trusted Field Service teams ensure continuity of our network. Our highly skilled Operators keep the public informed during times of crisis and react quickly to changing operational requirements of a demanding complex network. Our deep engineering  delivery and operational capability make us the partner of choice for the government and industry stakeholders alike.  During times of crisis  such as bushfire or cyclone season  our people travel from around the country to support this critical work. We care for our People. Volunteers for local Fire Service or State Emergency Services are provided with additional time off work at full pay for their volunteering activities. Hiring contractors fill gaps in our usual work and we are therefore always interested in hearing from people looking for permanent or casual work. We continue to develop world-class solutions for new and emerging technologies. This includes planning for future network improvements which allow our customers to take advantage of technology innovation.  ABOUT THE ROLE Reporting Analytics plays a key role within the Critical Comms team  sourcing  analysing and reporting on key information and data to help drive critical business decisions. The Data & Reporting Analyst will be responsible for initially building contractual reporting and on an ongoing basis working collaboratively within Critical Communications (business and technology stakeholders) to elicit  analyse  translate  and document business requirements into specifications that will allow for the development of BI reporting.  Primary Responsibilities • Defining and Developing reporting requirements to meet contractual deliverables  building and agreeing the reports with key Stakeholders internally as well as with the Customer • Converting requirements into logic to build and develop reports with clear traceability to initial requirement. • Collecting  collating and interpreting information for the creation of reports to enable sound business and strategic decision making • Drive the analysis and delivery of new or modified product features through collaboration with business SME’s  architects  suppliers  and technology specialists • Disseminating intelligence obtained from this information • Providing recommendations to stakeholders based on this intelligence • Provide statistical information when required • Liaise with the Operations  Engineering and Customer Teams to understand and translate data requirements into valuable reports • Supporting Operational cadence reporting – weekly  monthly  quarterly and annually • Work with stakeholders to develop and maintain a roadmap of enhancements and contribute to the CSIP • Document procedures and provide training for the management of business intelligence information • Maintain and develop working relationships across BAI • Utilising intelligence applications and information systems  ABOUT YOU • This is a great next step for someone who loves data and has worked within transition • Experience in developing Service Now reports is essential • Do you have a gift of translating Geek Speak? • Create  Develop and run reports in Power BI/Tableau (Microsoft SSRS and analytics (reporting  predictive  prescriptive) experience is required • Relevant experience and understanding of user needs of information and communication technologies and systems • Experience in conducting workshops to extract information and provide training • Experience and skills in presenting and pitching solutions • Technical qualifications in SQL  Power BI/Tableau  Microsoft SSRS and analytics (reporting  predictive  prescriptive ideal • Tableau knowledge/experience will be advantageous • Experience in Telecommunications and/or Critical Communications will be well regarded • Due to Baseline vetting requirements  you MUST be an Australian Citizen to be considered for this role.  WHY WORK WITH US? Large enough to deliver and maintain large-scale operations  we remain nimble to make things happen. Be part of an inclusive culture where diverse ideas are embraced and people feel connected and cared for. Enjoy the opportunity to learn and grow alongside talented colleagues who thrive on solving complex problems. Be trusted and empowered to deliver your best and make a positive impact on customers and communities.  Ready to learn  grow and make a difference? Join us at BAI Communications.   BAI Communications welcomes applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people  people from diverse cultural backgrounds  people with disability and members of the LGBTQIA+ community. Please specify in your application if you require any adjustments during the recruitment process.  Under the BAI Communications Australia COVID-19 Vaccination Policy  all Australian-based new employees must be fully vaccinated with proof of vaccination required. There are different compliance dates for different workgroups under the policy  you will be provided with the relevant information during the recruitment process.

Working experience with Dimensional Modeling and Rails is a plus. Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills. Full-time availability is a strong advantage If you’re interested in pursuing an engaging career working on full-time freelance jobs for exclusive clients  take the next step by clicking apply and filling out the short form to get started.  #RemoteJobDataEngineering

Title: MDM Developer
Requirements: The speed of change is throwing traditional business methods into question and disrupting the relevance of entire industries. Capgemini  a global leader in consulting  digital transformation  technology and engineering services  is at the forefront of innovation and well placed to address opportunities for our clients in the evolving world of cloud  digital and platforms. Building on its strong 50-year heritage and deep industry-specific expertise  Capgemini enables organisations to realise their business ambitions through an array of services from strategy to operations. Capgemini is driven by the conviction that the business value of technology comes from and through people. Today  it is a multicultural company with over 270 000 team members in almost 50 countries. With Altran  the Group reported 2020 combined revenues of EUR 15.8 billion. Learn more about us at www.capgemini.com.  Let's talk about the team:  Our Insights and Data team helps our clients make better business decisions by transforming an ocean of data into streams of insight. Our clients are among Australia's top performing companies and they choose to partner with Capgemini for a very good reason - our exceptional people.  Let's Talk About The Role And Responsibilities Perform Informatica MDM design  configuration and implementation Drive MDM architecture and design discussion Create Hierarchies using Informatica MDM Hierarchy manager / provisioning tool Create business entities using provisioning tool Creating Custom UI-s using Informatica Data Director (IDD)/ Entity 360 Design the Cleanse functions & Match rules for various business entities Design Informatica MDM User Exits  Match rules etc. Design and configure workflows in BPM and provisioning tools Architect for integration with various sources and downstream consumers of data in batch  near real time and real time mode Guide projects using the Informatica Velocity Methodology to ensure customer success and a high return on Informatica software investment Develop Rest APIs or web-services consuming clients for data push/pull for both upstream and downstream applications. Let's talk about your capability and experience: Bachelor's Degree with minimum 5 years of relevant experience 5+ years in Informatica MDM Informatica (9.X and above) with at least 2 full cycle implementations. Excellent knowledge and Hands-on with Informatica MDM  IDD  HM  Match / Merge Process Excellent knowledge and Hands-on on at least one ETL Tool Experience in creating Data Quality rules and data profiling (preferably using IDQ) Working knowledge of Oracle with strong SQL skills Excellent knowledge and Hands-on on at least one ETL Tool Use of bit bucket in release management Working knowledge of Informatica Data Governance (DG) and tech products - EDC  Axon is highly desirable Experience in establishing Guidelines  frameworks and best practices Knowledge of Custom domain implementation Ability to work in a fast-paced environment Experience with agile development methodologies and source control repositories Excellent verbal and written communication skills Let's talk about what's in it for you!  Passionate people are Capgemini's Ace of Spades - join us to discover a career that will challenge  support and inspire you. Working at Capgemini you'll find the rewards are more than just financial. You will work alongside some very smart and inspiring people on exciting projects and you will also enjoy incredible benefits. We offer flexible work practices and 40 hours of self-development every year with a huge selection of learning opportunities to choose from. Capgemini constantly aims for excellence in its operations and the employee experience it provides. In line with our Purpose  Flexible Working aims to improve the overall people experience by providing an optimal work-life balance  more autonomy and freedom in when  where and how we work.  As "Architects of Positive Futures"  Capgemini actively supports the community in 3 ways:  Diversity and Inclusion - we believe diversity of thought fuels excellence and innovation  which is why we positively encourage applications from suitably qualified candidates regardless of their gender identity  ethnicity  sexual orientation  religion  ability  intersex status or age. To support our commitment to diversity and inclusion  we celebrate or recognise special events and days of significance that are important to our employees such as Diwali  Bastille Day  Pride  IDAHOBIT  IWD and International day of people with Disabilities. Our Employee Resource Groups Women@Capgemini  OutFront  Indigenous  Parents and Carers and Sustainability Community of Practice support the grassroots passion of employees to drive our diversity agenda and effect change.  Digital inclusion - at Capgemini we are using our skills to drive social impact initiatives focusing on helping society address the impact of the digital and automation revolution. We also provide employees with opportunities to give back to the community through charity projects and volunteer days.  Environmental Sustainability - Capgemini joined the CDP's (Carbon Disclosure Project) prestigious "A list" for its commitment to the Net-Zero economy. As well as focusing on helping our clients transform towards more sustainable business models  Capgemini recently announced its commitment to becoming a netzero busines by 2030.  Recognised by Ethisphere as one of the World's Most Ethical Companies for the last 9 years in a row  ethics and values are at the heart of Capgemini's corporate culture and business. Embedded in our DNA  our seven values - Honesty  Boldness  Trust  Team Spirit  Freedom  Fun and Modesty - have remained the same since company inception in 1967. To see how we bring these values to life  visit www.capgemini.com/au-en/careers/ and listen to some of our employee's stories.  #GetTheFutureYouWant - Come join us  bring your whole self to work  create new possibilities for you  your customers and your community and help us to be Architects of Positive Futures.  Please note unsolicited resumes from employment agencies or other third parties will not be considered.

Enterprise applications are no more confined to the business  these are forced to communicate with social communities  and consumers based applications. Title: PowerApps Developer
Requirements: Job Description  Role Overview - As a PowerApps Developer  you utilise your in-depth technical knowledge of the Power Platform to solve complex business problems. You will be primarily focused on leveraging your experience to design and implement Power Platform solutions on complex projects in medium to large enterprises.  Key Role Responsibilities:  Day-to-day you will:  Contribute across all phases of Avanade projects (e.g. Plan  Analyse  Design  Build and Test) Leverage technical expertise to Design and Implement Power Platform based solutions Liaise effectively between customers  IT staff  and business partners to ensure high quality and timely resolution of customer issues Research customer issues that may be non-standard in order to offer solutions Technical design and solution development Partner with cross-functional technology and design teams to ensure consistent  positive client interaction and solution delivery Assist in sales activities and planning as required Work under general guidance and direction  but fully independent in own work with latitude for autonomous decision-making related to work process Travel as needed. You will be required to travel based on Project requirements.  Key Role Skill & Capability Requirements:  You are excited about working with a global technology leader to solve business-critical problems for some of the top companies in the world. You are a fast learner  self-starter  and creative thinker. You are passionate about software and its potential to move organisations forward through innovation.  Your technical skills include:  Experience in Power Platform (PowerApps Portal  Canvas and Model Driven Apps  Power Automate) and Common Data Service. Experience with CSS  JavaScript  Web API  WebServices  SQL. Azure DevOps. A good understanding of UI/UX concepts. Experience in a Software as a Service (SaaS) environment. Experience with cross-platform mobile application development is desirable. A solid understanding of relational database concepts. Experience working in both Agile and Waterfall delivery models.  Your non-technical skills include:  Client management skills and the ability to work with customers to develop and manage an action plan. Consulting experience working with external clients. Experience working with global/offshore teams on CRM technology implementation and maintenance projects. Excellent interpersonal  presentation and communication skills SFIA Level 3 and above  Preferred Education Background : Bachelor’s degree in business systems or related field  Certifications:  PL-900 - Power platform fundamentals MB-901: Microsoft Certified: Dynamics 365 Fundamentals  Any of the following certifications are highly desirable.  MB-230: Dynamics 365 Customer Service Functional Consultant Associate AZ-900: Microsoft Azure Fundamentals PL-100: Microsoft Power Platform App Make  Preferred Years of Work Experience: 1 to 2 years of experience in Power Platform. 5+ years of experience in Dynamics CRM or Office 365 implementations or .Net development.  Benefits We Offer  Opportunity to work for Microsoft’s Global Alliance Partner of the Year (17 of the last 20 years!) Exceptional development and training with a minimum 80 hours/year of training and paid certifications Avanade University – real-time access to technical and skilled resources globally 18 weeks paid Parental Leave benefit - available for both parents regardless of gender and fully applicable to same-sex families – and can be taken in a range of flexible ways to suit each family’s MyDays - 5 days of leave each year - this benefit supports Avanade's commitment to promoting a healthy balance between work and home life and it can also be taken to honour employees cultural beliefs. Gadget and Wellbeing allowance paid annually  Please Note:  This role requires direct contact with Avanade clients as well as attendance in person at Avanade workplaces and other company sponsored meetings and events. In order to comply with our client requirements and Avanade’s own health and safety obligations this role requires the Applicant to be fully vaccinated against Covid-19. Proof of vaccination will be required during the application process. Applicants who have appropriate written proof of a medical or religious reason for not being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 may provide such documentation.  About Avanade  Avanade is the leading provider of innovative digital  cloud and advisory services  industry solutions and design-led experiences across the Microsoft ecosystem. Every day  our 56 000 professionals in 26 countries make a genuine human impact for our clients  their employees and their customers.  We have been recognized as Microsoft’s Global SI Partner of the Year more than any other company. With the most Microsoft certifications (60 000+) and 18 (out of 18) Gold-level Microsoft competencies  we are uniquely positioned to help businesses grow and solve their toughest challenges.  We are a people first company  committed to providing an inclusive workplace where employees feel comfortable being their authentic selves. As a responsible business  we are building a sustainable world and helping young people from underrepresented communities fulfil their potential.  Majority owned by Accenture  Avanade was founded in 2000 by Accenture LLP and Microsoft Corporation. Learn more at www.avanade.com .

Title: Senior Analyst  APS6  Specialist Advice & Services Division  Data & Intelligence Branch  All Locations
Requirements: Data and Intelligence Branch  Strategic Data Analysis Unit  The Data and Intelligence Branch supports the ACCC and AER to make informed decisions based on data analysis  effective information handling and intelligence methodology. The Branch consists of four teams: the Strategic Data Analysis Unit  the Infocentre  Legal Technology Services and the Intelligence team.  The Branch has several collaborative functions that support the agency in meeting its strategic objectives  including informing strategic decisions  providing specialist advice  improving data governance and evidence handling  developing tools and sources  driving innovation  collecting and triaging information and optimising the discovery and use of data and information.  The Data and Intelligence Branch sits within the Specialist Advice and Services Division  the ACCC/AER’s centralised in-house provider of legal  economic  international  information and data services.  The Strategic Data Analysis Unit (SDAU) is the ACCC’s specialist data and advanced analytics team  whose remit also includes leading the agency’s data governance program. The SDAU contributes by helping teams across the ACCC work with data to extract insights that inform strategic  operational and tactical decision-making.  Role and Duties  We seek highly motivated and innovative data and analytics professionals who will use their technical expertise for the benefit of Australian consumers  small businesses and the wider economy. In a data and algorithm driven economy  it is critical that the ACCC has the ability both to use advanced data and analytics techniques  and also the ability to analyse and understand how companies are using these techniques to run their businesses and make decisions.  This role sits in the SDAU. SDAU analysts will work directly with teams across the whole agency  contributing to complex and often high profile investigations and inquiries. We work with a range of data (both structured and unstructured) relating to industries across the Australian economy  and we apply a range of analytical techniques. Our toolkit includes R  Python and Power BI. The role suits analysts who enjoy continuous learning and innovation  every project we work on is a new challenge.  Successful candidates will be capable of working independently and have extensive experience in a data-related discipline – such as data analytics  data science  and/or data engineering. Senior Analysts must be able to communicate complex and technical issues simply  clearly and effectively in different forums to a range of stakeholders.  Duties are to be performed under limited direction and in accordance with the APS Code of Conduct and APS Values to achieve results in line with the corporate mission of the ACCC. Duties may include:  · Providing accurate specialist advice and guidance on data and analytics  including scoping analysis that will assist in the understanding of key issues relevant to the investigation or project · Developing objectives for short-term tasks and contributing to strategic planning for longer-term initiatives. · Conducting complex data analysis to reach conclusions and inform decision making · Preparing written reports and presentations detailing the findings of analysis  including evaluation and interpretation of any results · Managing relationships with stakeholders to achieve unit and agency goals  and anticipating and responding to stakeholder needs and expectations. · Building team capability by providing training to increase data literacy and analytical skills in the agency · Providing guidance  mentoring  and leading junior staff For more information about the role including the selection criteria  please see the attached Candidate Kit. How to apply  When applying you will be asked to upload your resume and submit a statement of claims that is no more than 800 words.  When preparing your statement of claims  please take into consideration the role and duties  and detail instances from your past that demonstrate how you meet the selection criteria.  Salary: $89 541 - $100 359 per annum (plus 15.4% superannuation) Contact Officer: John Dickson 08 9325 0678 This role is available on a full time  part time or job share basis.

Title: Data Engineer (Python)
Requirements: Posted by Annaliza (Anna) Galit Seasoned IT Recruitment Consultant within B&F clients Send InMail Role on behalf of DXC Luxoft UK Limited Australia Branch  Project Description  To effectively support the Client  the Data Engineer will assist in the uplift and ongoing development of data management and analytics capabilities. With a primary focus on data integration  the development of data consumption interfaces  and addressing data-related technical debt  this role will work closely with Investment  Operations & Technology teams  as the Client continues to target materially upgrading our investment data  systems  and analytics capabilities.  Key to the success of this role is the ability to design  prototype  and implement solutions alongside other technology experts  with the goal of empowering development teams and end-users to consume high-quality data in a highly repeatable way.  Skills Significant experience in the Python and SQL Significant IT experience  predominantly in software engineering  workflow and automation and data & analytics roles In-depth knowledge of software delivery lifecycle including demonstrated experience across coding and code management  peer review  unit testing  integration testing  user acceptance testing production release and support  preferably within an agile and continuous delivery environment  Experience delivering solutions in financial services  with a demonstrated understanding of core investment concepts Experience in a range of development technologies beneficial such as C#  Git  HTML 5  PowerShell  JavaScript  Spark  Excel Experience in self-discovery and visualisation technologies is desirable for example Power BI  Tableau and Qlik

Title: Data Engineer
Requirements: Do you want to be part of a growing global business? Would you like to solve real problems for some of the world's leading retail brands (including Walmart  Woolworths  Diageo and Danone) and be part of a supportive team of like-minded people? We're on a huge journey and we want you on onboard.  At Retail Insight our mission is to reinvent retail operations through advanced analytics  growing sales and profitability across the globe. To continue to do this and be the best we need more talented individuals to join our team.  A Bit About The Role  As a data engineer you will be working as part of the data engineering team supporting and developing innovative data processing pipelines. We don't expect our data engineers to become experts in all these technologies but just the willingness to learn and understand the strengths and weaknesses of each. We want all our data engineers to have a voice in how we do engineering  and to challenge the mantra "we've always done it that way".  Here are some examples of what you might be doing: Delivering the next iteration of our data pipelines  e.g. how we capture our client's data reliably and enable our analysis to use it easily  how we get insights from our client's data  how we make sure that we put security at the core of how we work in data. Collaborate with the Data Analyst and Decision Scientist team Automate to accelerate  eliminate redundant and manual steps to get things done  so that every person in the team can focus on the things that humans do best. Deep collaboration and exchange of ideas  providing guidance to technical and non-technical team members. Building and supporting cloud native technologies to build and run scalable  manageable and resilient applications. Communicate regularly with internal and external stakeholders  provide regular information on updates  delivery and fixes. Develop tools and applications that produce clean and maintainable code. Proactively identify issues and opportunities and tackle them without being told to do so. Assessing and implementing new technologies that can reduce time to market  improve security and democratize data access for our clients. About You  You love to collaborate and exchange ideas. You are a strong verbal and written communicator with the ability to collaborate with all departments.  About Your Previous Experience Excellent problem solving  troubleshooting and communication skills. Experience working with data. Ability to write understandable and maintainable code. Experience in SQL is essential Experience in automation  however we're flexible with your scripting language Experience or knowledge of Python or Scala or C#Powershell or Bash Benefits And Perks  RI is a fun and collaborative place to be  to support you at work and play we offer a number of things: flexible working options  an extra day of paid leave on your birthday  team lunches  an audible subscription  options to support your development and growth.  More About RI  At Retail Insight  we have built a suite of innovative retail execution analytics products trusted by some of the world's leading retail and consumer goods companies including Walmart  Woolworths  Diageo and Danone.  We provide head office  stores and suppliers with data-driven insights that direct action and capture value. We specialise in-store and are at the cutting edge of retail analytics technology  helping identify drivers  and alerting to close  lost sales and lost profits from out-of-stocks  poor in-store execution  waste  markdown  and total loss.  If this sounds like you  we'd love to hear from you.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Requirements: Company Description  Global Express moves the businesses that move Australasia  offering our customers unrivalled access to an extensive transport network across Australia and New Zealand. Our services are designed around our customers with road  air  sea and rail freight options to securely deliver everything from documents through to critical spare parts and medical supplies.  Job Description  Due to growth we currently have exciting opportunities for a full time Business Intelligence Analyst to join our business. Based in Melbourne you will be responsible for defining and developing new data processes and supporting our BI & data platforms. You will work closely with project teams and technical support teams to develop and maintain data visibility and drive continuous improvement in performance measurement and reporting.  As The BI Analyst  You Will  Responsibilities: Design and develop data processes to be used in business reporting and analytical processes Contribute to the implementation of the Common Data Platform  including documenting requirements for data ingestion pipelines and end-to-end orchestration processes Continuously review data quality and support initiatives to improve consistent and standardisation of business data Supporting our BI & data platforms including system administration  maintenance and monitoring of servers and process to ensure ongoing service continuity Actively engage with IT business partners and relevant IT teams to protect the health of the data warehouse  set up and other necessary technical matters  Qualifications  To be successful in this role  you will need: Demonstrated experience in business intelligence or data engineering (minimum of 5 years’ experience in similar role) Experience using SAS for data integration and supporting analytical data processes Working knowledge of SQL  data extraction techniques  data profiling and MS SQL Server Strong verbal and written communication Bachelor’s or master’s degree in computer science  information systems  analytics  or a related discipline Experience with AWS data services and/or Snowflake will be highly regarded  You are a strong communicator dealing with stakeholders easily  having high level influencing skills and collaborative approach. In addition  your strong Statistical analysis methodologies  including forecasting  machine learning and predictive analytics techniques will be essential to the success of this position.  Additional Information  Be Connected  Recently acquired by Allegro Funds  a successful Australian private equity company  Global Express has an exciting future ahead and will benefit from a transformation program  underpinned by $500 million in funding to support and grow the business. It’s never been a more exciting time to join our team as we take the next step in our journey.  Toll embraces and celebrates a variety of cultures. We continue to build a business that reflects the values of equality  built on the knowledge and understanding that everyone is welcome including the First Nations Peoples and those of all ages  genders and abilities.  To find out more about us visit www.tollgroup.com/careers  To be considered  you must be entitled to work in the specified country and be prepared to undertake pre-employment checks including a criminal history check and medical assessment.

Title: Data Engineer - Permanent
Requirements: Posted by Etienne Schneider 2nd Consultant Data & Analytics Send InMail Data Engineer - Permanent The Company Provides water solutions in a unique IT company. Well known brand that is internationally recognised. Join a brand-new team to work on a huge Greenfield project. The role Join the water industry new team to provide data engineering support. Your responsibilities include:  Data collection through different client business units. Interpreting data and analysing results to report back to the relevant members of the business. Identifying quality  patterns and trends in data sets. To work alongside teams within the management team or the client business to establish business needs. Defining analysis processes and new data.  What we're looking for  Minimum 3 years' experience in data & analytics Strong knowledge of domain-based design  data modelling and data structures. Advanced SQL skills. Technical depth to deliver data and analytical services including data ingestion  transformation  storage  and reporting. Title: Analyst  Data Management
Requirements: Analyst  Data Management – 9 Month Maximum Term contract Opportunity for an Analyst to join a growing Data & Analytics team focusing on investment performance Use your SQL skills to work in an engaging  autonomous problem solving role while being part of a team Role would also suit a solutions developer from within Financial Services looking to move into Data Management TCorp provides best-in-class investment management  financial management  solutions and advice to the New South Wales (NSW) public sector. With A$113 billion of assets under management  TCorp is a top 5 Australian investment manager and is the central borrowing authority of the state of NSW  with a balance sheet of A$132 billion. It is rated Aaa (Stable) by Moody’s and AA+ (Stable) by S&P.  TCorp champions and protects the financial interests of the state and delivers sustainable returns and financial efficiencies that allow its clients to achieve their broader business objectives. TCorp delivers this through its expert team  ability to anticipate the future needs of the state and with a deep understanding of the unique needs of the NSW Government family. We work exclusively for the NSW Government and public sector entities.  The mission of the Operations division is to enable TCorp’s strategy. Our functions include the Enterprise Programme Management Office (EPMO)  Investment Operations (IO)  Financial Markets Operations (FMO)  Finance & Settlements (F&S)  Data & Analytics (D&A) and Board Secretariat.  The D&A team plays a strategic role in enabling best-in class investment implementation and reporting on behalf of TCorp’s clients. The team is responsible for the data life cycle of TCorp's investments data from acquisition to stewardship and distribution. In addition to portfolio reporting  the Analytics function is  in partnership with portfolio management and other stakeholders  responsible for analytical methodology development and deployment to enable decision making and accountability within TCorp's Investments function.  As a member of the D&A team  the primary purpose of this role is to ensure the day to day functioning of the TCorp Data Operating Model. The Analyst will focus on the operations pertaining to the Matrix Operational Data Store and the TCorp Enterprise Datastore. This role will best suit an independent curious mind who enjoys problem solving with the resources available to them but also have the ability to work as part of a team to drive outcomes.  The Analyst  Data Management  Will Be Accountable For Maintenance and verification of fund static data. Monitoring and escalating issues pertaining to daily processes (Azure Data Factory  Visual Cron). Data Quality management – creation of new check rules  testing and verification of SQL functions. Data Model configuration – onboarding and loading of new datasets (SQL). System Regression testing. Contributing to improvement of current data management capability and processes. Stakeholder communication to facilitate deployment of robust and repeatable data solutions. Contributing to measurable data quality improvement within relevant data domains. Escalating and documenting automation and efficiency opportunities to drive process improvement. Other operational data management functions as required. An ability to work independently while also recognising when to escalate  strong attention to detail in technical matters  demonstrated understanding of scalable data validation concepts and good communication skills are essential.  To succeed in this role  you should have tertiary qualifications in mathematics or quantitative based disciplines (and / or demonstrated relevant experience gained within the financial services industry) with strong SQL programming skills combined with Microsoft Excel capability. Demonstrated experience in stakeholder management and the ability to work with stakeholders within a complex environment will be viewed favourably.  At TCorp we actively collaborate with our stakeholders to achieve the best outcomes for our clients and the state of NSW. We aim to build an inclusive culture so we can benefit from each employee’s unique perspective and contribution. We also understand the importance of flexible working and we support our people to balance their commitments and thrive both professionally and personally.  Please submit your application via our careers portal and include a cover letter setting out how your background and capabilities align to our selection criteria and how this role fits with your career goals. Please also note your salary expectations in the relevant section of the portal. No agency candidates please.  TCorp’s COVID-19 Vaccination Policy requires all new employees to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or have an approved medical exemption. You will need to provide evidence of vaccination prior to attending a face-to-face interview and proof of vaccination or medical exemption will be required prior to any offer of employment being made.

Experience delivering in an agile environment   Experience of implementing and delivering data solutions and pipelines on Azure / AWS or GCP cloud platforms  Experience across one or more across data lifecycle – platform build  pipeline  migration / testing  An understanding of data modelling  data structures  databases  and ETL processes  An in-depth understanding of large-scale data sets  including both structured and unstructured data  Strong SQL and/or Python knowledge  Experience with related/complementary open source software platforms and languages (e.g. Java  Linux  Apache  Perl/Python/PHP  Chef)  Knowledge and experience of delivering CI/CD and DevOps capabilities in a data environment  Apply now to register your interest and have a confidential chat about your current situation and career goals.  Join Us  Experience: All levels  Start date: Staggered start dates apply  Location: ANZ  Salary: Remuneration is negotiable based upon experience to date  Job Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science  Engineering or an Associate degree and / or relevant work experience. Enjoy problem-solving in the different domains and industries.  Adept with Python and other common programming languages.  Practiced with APIs.  Skilled with scripting and frameworks  Capable of working with a range of operating systems. Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: Posted by Stephanie Tymms People and Culture Manager at Carlton Football Club Send InMail Carlton Football Club is one of Australia's oldest and most prominent sporting institutions. With 16 Premierships  we are the equal most successful club in the AFL.  We are a proud foundation Club of the AFLW and a Grand Finalist for the 2019 AFLW season.  Our future is being shaped by a strong vision and underpinned by our core values. We believe that a united football club  relentless in the pursuit of excellence who hold ourselves and each other accountable can achieve anything. This is the Carlton Way.  About the position Carlton Football Club is seeking to appoint an experienced Data Analyst to leverage data and deliver insights across the administration department at the Carlton Football Club. The Data Analyst will assist the Financial Insights and Business Services Manager with the implementation of the business intelligence strategy across the various departments of the Club.  The Data Analyst will be responsible for developing interactive dashboards and reports and driving their uptake within the business. They will also champion principles of good data governance and educate colleagues on how best to collect usable data.  The incumbent will assist in auditing data quality and cleaning data sets where required. They will also be involved in specific data analysis projects that are designed to answer key business problems across the Club.  The successful candidate will have demonstrated experience in completing data analysis projects to solve business problems  strong communication and partnering skills with the ability to clearly explain concepts to colleagues from different fields  strong attention to detail and be proactive. The successful candidate will also demonstrate commitment to Carlton Football Club’s values of The Carlton Way.  Key responsibilities  The key responsibilities for this role include  but are not limited to: Club wide Assist in the execution of various data analysis  problem solving  and investigations as developed with the Financial Insights and Business Services Manager and senior stakeholders as they arise. Champion standards of data governance across the Club  ensuring that all applications and sources have unique and developed protocols. Educate internal departments with regards to Data acquisition  management  and analysis. Proactively scan and promote data projects to improve efficiencies  security  insights  and decision making across the Club. Implement and promote predictive analytics across various areas of the business to aid in the achievement of operational and strategic plan objectives. Consumer Business Centric Assist with the uptake and development of the AFL fan data service product through the development of new dashboards and ensuring the integrity of data available in the system. Assist the membership team to create profiles and generate consumer behaviour insights that lead to informed retention and acquisition strategies being established. Commercial  Marketing  Digital and Communications Centric Assist in the collation  storage  interpretation  and presentation of data collected from first party sources. Support the development and utilization of the CRM system  ensuring that data is collected in a systematic manner and available for further analysis. Driving report generation and analysis of information contained within the CRM system. Champion and drive the implementation of customer view and centralised Club data solution. Key Selection Criteria Essential Undergraduate degree in finance  economics  statistics  mathematics  or related field. Demonstrated experience in completing data analysis projects to solve business problems. Experience in at least one of the following programming languages: R  Python or SQL. Strong communication skills with the ability to explain concepts to colleagues from different fields. Thorough attention to detail and effective time management skills. Highly self-motivated and proactive  able to work autonomously and collaborate as part of a team. Highly ethical with experience maintaining sensitive and confidential data. Desirable Previous experience working in a professional sporting organisation or related field. Proficiency with data visualization tools (Tableau  PowerBI). Demonstrated knowledge of fundamental statistical methods. Understanding of the principles of data management and governance. How to apply Applications are now open and will be accepted until Sunday 29 May 2022. Applications consisting of a CV and cover letter outlining how you meet the key selection criteria will be accepted via ‘Apply’. Given the high volume of interest  candidates who do not address the criteria above will not progress through to the next stage Applications and shortlisting to commence immediately.  Child Safety Standards  The Carlton Football Club is committed to providing a welcoming environment where the safety and wellbeing of all children and young people involved in our programs  services  activities  events  and the broader community  will always be our first priority.  All safety and legislative checks such as working with children  criminal background and personal reference checks are completed prior to commencing employment.  Therefore  all staff must hold (or be willing to obtain) a current Victorian Working with Children Check any additional checks as part of their employment with the Club and will be notified of this as part of the recruitment process.

Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: Job Description  Who are we?  Diageo Australia has one simple  but focused mission – to Celebrate Life  Every Day  Everywhere. In order to do this  we are supported by our incredible portfolio of market leading brands  some of which are in your home now. As the largest spirits manufacturer in the world  with brands including Johnnie Walker®  Smirnoff®  Gordon’s®  Baileys®  Captain Morgan® and our homegrown heroes Bundaberg Rum® and UDL®  we are focused on bringing consumers together  giving them opportunities to celebrate life  every day  everywhere.  About The Role  Please note this is a 12-month contract role.  Our organisation is globally transforming into one characterised by speed of thought  decision making and bias for action in order to emerge the clear leader of the industry.  We have established a new team within the organisation whose ambition is to transform how we utilise performance related data to run our business. We are now over a year into the journey and the immediate priority is to review our current processes with a view of simplifying  automating or offshoring activities.  In This Role  You Will Be responsible for maintaining a set of reports or data processes within the team ranging from market share reporting or sales team incentive reporting to pricing maintenance or customer master data maintenance  Be part of a team of data analysts where the tasks are rotated every 3-4 months across the team to improve  simplify and document the process providing you with an opportunity to learn  Participate in continuous improvement initiatives both from a systems and business process perspective  Support the business in the transition of its data into an enterprise data warehouse  Ensure our data and reports are accurate and well adopted by the Sales  Marketing and Finance teams  Provide the business with insight by merging disparate data sets  and Drive accountability with the sales & marketing teams to ensure accurate inputs and process adherence. What You'll Bring To The Table Strong Power BI Skills (essential) – data modelling  DAX and visualisation  Commercial drive and commercial curiosity  Problem-solving  planning and organising  highly detail conscious  Experience improving procedures and challenging the existing processes  Quick learner who exhibits resiliency and tenacity in the face of challenges  Can build powerful relationships and work collaboratively within a team and with a variety of stakeholders across Sales  Marketing  Finance & IT teams  both on and offshore  Understanding of drivers of performance within FMCG or Retail – Volume  Price  Mix and Distribution and Rate of Sale (preferred but not essential)  and Participated in a technology project implementation (preferred but not essential). What is the culture like?  Are you prepared to take risks in the pursuit of greatness? Do you hold yourself to the highest standards with real accountability for results? Would you treat the business as if it is truly your own – because you want your legacy to be worthy of that of our founders? Then  let’s talk!  We are an organisation that creates products that are part of celebrations  and our culture reflects this. We work in a flexible way to ensure that you can fit work around your life commitments – this may be a different location and/or flexible hours. We are a future focused organisation  that is constantly wanting to perform better and to continue our growth.  Our Commitment To Inclusion And Diversity  Diageo is committed to building a workplace culture that values inclusion and diversity. We actively promote the employment of people with disability  Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders  LGBTI and other diversity groups.  Diageo encourages applications from people with disability and will provide reasonable adjustments in our recruitment processes and in the workplace. If you need an adjustment in the recruitment process  please let us know when submitting your application and we will tailor our process where practical.  At Diageo  we pride ourselves on our fast paced  bold and agile culture. In order to ensure we’re supporting the performance ambitions of our team  applications for this role will close 5pm 18 April 2022.  Worker Type  Fixed Term Contract (Fixed Term)  Primary Location:  McMahons Point  Additional Locations :  Job Posting Start Date  2022-03-28-07:00

Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: Overview Full-time  Continuing position Salary Level HEW 7 + 17% Superannuation and Flexible Working Arrangements Based at the Melbourne CBD campus – Hybrid Working Model  About You  You will operate within a multi-disciplinary team  working closely with data scientists and data engineers to develop and deliver data and analytics solutions to stakeholders across the organisation. This includes performing analyses of key data sets to draw out insights to help inform decision making. You will contribute to the development of best practice approaches aligned to the data governance framework of the university.  To Be Successful In This Position  You’ll Have Experience and understanding of basic statistical tests  distributions  and a range of analysis techniques Experience in data visualisation techniques to communicate key concepts and insights Evidence of intermediate to advanced skills in data and visualisation tools such as SQL  Python  R studio  PowerBI and Domo Good problem solving skills with the ability to create  innovate and iterate solutions A self starter with a willingness to work independently and with minimum guidance About the Office of the Chief Data and Analytics Officer  This Involves Being Accountable And Responsible For  Office of the Chief Data & Analytics Officer supports and enables RMIT’s business strategy by leading and driving the data and analytics agenda for the enterprise. Developing and implementing RMIT’s data and analytics strategy and ensuring ongoing alignment with university Defining requirements and standards for data and analytics technologies to be delivered by Information Technology Coordinating and governing data management activities for analytics and reporting Developing and coordinating advanced analytics capabilities to resolve key university challenges To Apply  Please submit your CV and covering letter addressing your suitability for this position by clicking on the ‘Apply’ link below. Data Analyst.pdf  Vaccination Requirements  The COVID-19 Mandatory Vaccination (Workers) Directions  made under the Public Health and Wellbeing Act 2008 (Vic) and as amended and replaced from time to time (Directions)  affect all persons employed or engaged to perform work by RMIT.  As such  offers of employment from RMIT are conditional upon the applicant being fully vaccinated against COVID-19 or medically exempt and providing satisfactory evidence of the same. You can access the Directions here: https://www.dhhs.vic.gov.au/victorias-restriction-levels-covid-19  Applications Close  22 May 2022 11.59 pm  RMIT is an equal opportunity employer committed to being a child safe organisation. We are dedicated to attracting  retaining and developing our people regardless of gender identity  ethnicity  sexual orientation  disability and age. Applications are encouraged from all sectors of the community and we strongly encourage applications from the Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander community.  RMIT is a Disability Confident Recruitment Team and we are happy to adjust the recruitment process for your accessibility requirements. Please contact us at TalentSupport@rmit.edu.au telling us your preferred type of communication and we will be in touch as soon as possible to discuss your requirements.  Please note that whilst we still accept applications from any persons interested in our roles  due to the impacts of COVID-19  we are currently prioritising applications from those with current working rights in Australia and who are not affected by travel restrictions. Please see the latest updates to Australia’s immigration and border arrangements during the COVID-19 (Coronavirus) outbreak here.  We are a Circle Back Initiative Employer – we commit to respond to every applicant.

Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: Note: This role is for a 3-year fixed term contract with HP Inc  To be successful in this role you should have superior communication  presentation  and organizational skills. Work autonomously taking control and responsibility for achieving the objectives of the role. This role provides opportunities to develop original ideas  approaches  and solutions in a competitive and ever-changing business climate.  The ideal candidate relishes working with large volumes of data  enjoys the challenge of highly complex technical contexts  and  above all else  is passionate about data and analytics. She/he is an expert with data modelling  design and business intelligence tools. She/he is a self-starter  pays careful attention to detail  and enjoys working in a fast-paced team that continuously learns and evolves on a day-to-day basis  About The Role We are looking for a hands-on  detail oriented and highly motivated data analyst to help create data backed insights. Must have practical knowledge of Power BI and Python and should have 2-4 years of work experience Should also have advanced excel knowledge Good to have Web Development and statistical modelling knowledge The candidate should be comfortable interfacing with technology systems and be able to analyze data and gather actionable conclusions. Needs to be adept at dealing with ambiguous  new and challenging situations Should also have an excellent understanding of SQL and query development  good business acumen and the ability to work with quantitative and business teams. Role And Responsibilities Own the design  development  and maintenance of ongoing metrics  reports  analyses  dashboards  etc. to drive key business decisions Understand HP’s products and services and track/report business performance and problem areas using appropriate metrics Partner with cross functional teams Help identify process improvement opportunities to build streamlined and scalable solutions About HP  You’re out to reimagine and reinvent what’s possible—in your career as well as the world around you.  So are we. We love taking on tough challenges  disrupting the status quo  and creating what’s next. We’re in search of talented people who are inspired by big challenges  driven to learn and grow  and dedicated to making a meaningful difference.  HP is a technology company that operates in more than 170 countries around the world united in creating technology that makes life better for everyone  everywhere.  Our history: HP’s commitment to diversity  equity and inclusion - it's just who we are.  From the boardroom to factory floor  we create a culture where everyone is respected and where people can be themselves  while being a part of something bigger than themselves. We celebrate the notion that you can belong at HP and bring your authentic self to work each and every day. When you do that  you’re more innovative and that helps grow our bottom line. Come to HP and thrive!

Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: Line of Service Assurance  Industry/Sector Not Applicable  Specialism Risk  Management Level Senior Associate  Job Description & Summary    With PwC  you’ll ignite a meaningful career while being supported by a flexible working culture  innovative learning and development opportunities and progressive policies and benefits  such as 18 weeks paid parental leave for mums  dads and foster carers (no minimum service!)   What will you create?    You’ll help Australian businesses  not-for-profits and governments create value and improve the way they work. From digitising healthcare  to creating smarter cities and igniting our start-up industry  together we build trust in society and solve important problems.   Trust and Risk bring this to life by helping clients to protect and strengthen every aspect of their business  from people to performance  systems to strategy and business plans to business resilience.   As a Senior Associate in our Data Assurance team your impact will be seen by: Building risk and compliance data analytics outputs using tools such as Alteryx  ACL  R  Python  Qlik Sense  Power BI  SQL Server. Applying risk and compliance analytics to drive decision making for our clients  helping them to better manage risks  optimise processes and build trust with their stakeholders. Working across multiple client projects  with a broad range of tasks across the data analytics life cycle including ETL  data wrangling and cleansing  reporting and dashboarding. Lead and mentor junior staff in delivering risk and compliance data analytics engagements targeted on risk and compliance analytics. Exceptional communication between junior staff and senior management  providing that conduit across the team. Compelling data driven storytelling to communicate and help clients minimise risk and improve their processes and control framework..    About you    You have a background in data analytics and are skilled in data visualisation  data cleansing and manipulation and hold an understanding of business and risk application. Previous experience in internal audit analytics will be highly regarded.   Passionate about being at the forefront of change  you’re ready to help our Trust and Risk team transform how risk is perceived and capitalised on.   You’re collaborative and enjoy working in an innovative environment. You’re a problem solver by nature and want to join a firm that values the kind of people who reimagine the possible for their clients and stakeholders. Most importantly  you act with integrity and show care for the people you work with.   Life at PwC  Our culture and benefits are something we’re proud of  and also the reason we’ve been named LinkedIn’s #1 Australian workplace. With PwC  you’ll belong to an inclusive community where differences are both embraced and the underlying driver in everything we create together.   We empower you with the technology  coaching  flexibility and trust needed to make a meaningful difference  while supporting you in bringing your whole self to work each day. We’re committed to building and maintaining a diverse workforce because we know it’s only by working together that we can realise the potential of our people  clients and society around us.   We’re living this commitment through initiatives including our Reconciliation Action Plan to increase Indigenous employment and employee-led diversity networks promoting cultural  disability  LGBTI and gender equality. At our core we’re a people business  which means you’ll be supported not just in your professional development but your personal growth as well.   Wiona Court is the Recruitment Manager for the role. As the team experiences high volumes of applications  we appreciate your patience to allow for a timely and fair process for all.   We welcome the opportunity to speak to candidates about our value proposition and recognition and reward approach. The minimum full time salary for this role is $88 425.50 including 10% Superannuation  however will be determined based on the skills and experience that the candidate brings.   PwC is committed to the health  safety and wellbeing of our people  as well as visitors to our offices and events.  PwC has introduced a COVID-19 Vaccination policy that requires all staff  contractors  clients and visitors to be fully vaccinated before they can access our offices  attend client sites  undertake work-related travel  or attend work-related events  subject to limited exemptions. Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: Job Description  How will I help?  As the Credit Restructuring Operations Data Analyst  you will be responsible for developing  reporting and consolidating existing reports into a monthly automated reporting suite. You will assist drafting a data and reporting strategy for Credit Restructuring and produce superior reporting and analysis of portfolio trends that assists in managing the portfolio.  You will act as a key support to the Credit Restructuring leadership team in reporting on the portfolio of weak and defaulted customer exposures across multiple brands and develop and aggregate existing reporting into a suite of reports to manage the portfolio and share with appropriate stakeholders.  Your responsibilities will include  but aren’t limited to: Being a key part of the Credit Restructuring Operations team. Developing reports  researching  conducting analysis of significant portfolio trends. Maintaining effective partnerships with business stakeholders by providing timely reporting and support for the effective operation of credit restructuring’s control environment. Contributing to development  implementation and monitoring of product and system-based issues that may impact the business. Participate in business development initiatives and risk related projects. Development  implementation and monitoring of portfolio data to ensure compliance and reporting for relevant internal policies and external regulatory requirements. What is in it for me?  You’ll play an important and significant part in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years and be instrumental in achieving our purpose of helping Australians succeed. So  we’ll back you in the development of your career  with internal career prospects and flexible working. You’ll also be backed by a fantastic team of people in a can-do  supportive structure.  You will benefit from exposure to a global business constantly adapting to regulatory change and emerging risks  providing a very exciting and dynamic work environment.  What do I need?  The ideal candidate will have a minimum of 2 years’ data extraction and reporting experience within a financial institution. Knowledge of credit risk and the Banking environment is desirable.  You will be proficient with data extraction  manipulation and analysis and have s trong SQL  Python  and tableau experience  coupled with tertiary qualifications or equivalent risk analytics  analytical and problem-solving skills. Experience with SAS is a strong desirable skill.  Practical experience in business lending and recovery and collections is desirable.  This role will enable you to have a huge impact in improving efficiencies and services within the business.  What is it like to work there?  As well as good pay and a great culture  joining the Westpac family means you will get some of the best banking  wealth  and insurance benefits in the market. We back our employees by helping them work towards industry-recognised qualifications  using online learning  training modules and career planning tools for you to grow with us. We will even pay you to do volunteer or community work. As an equal opportunity employer  we are proud to have created a culture and work environment that values diversity and flexibility – and champions inclusion.  How do I Apply?  Start here. Just click on the APPLY button.  As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace  this role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages  people with a disability and Indigenous Australians to apply.  Our people are our highest priority  and we are committed to placing our redeployees in available roles before we review other applicants.  The Westpac Group has implemented an Entry to Workplace Policy that requires employees and others entering our workplaces to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 by relevant dates set out in the policy (subject to applicable medical exemptions). Our employees are required to comply with the policy regardless of whether they are in customer-facing or non-customer-facing roles (as employees in non-customer-facing roles are required to attend the workplace under our Hybrid Working Strategy). Further  the Westpac Group is required to comply with State/Territory issued public health orders/directions which require relevant workers to be vaccinated against COVID-19 to enter workplaces.  By applying for this role  you acknowledge that you are aware of our Entry to Workplace Policy   and if you secure employment with us  you will be required to comply with the policy.

Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: This job is sourced from a job board. Learn more AES are an exciting growing business looking for a new motivated data driven individual to join our energetic data team.  We are looking for a new member of our team who is eager to learn and to help us drive the business forward by unlocking the power of our data  using analysis and insights to allow faster smarter decisions  streamline our business processes and deliver improved efficiency.  About The Role  Based atourEnfield offices  the role focuses onworkingonbehalfof severalenergysuppliersin theUK  whereAESare responsible for managingclientportfolios andindustrydatarequirements.  Themainresponsibilities For This Role Will Be  Creating and managingbothinternal and external reports using a number of platforms.  Devising new reporting strategies to incorporate into companysystems  Assisting in maintaining company databases  Managing any externaldataentering companysystemsand exception handling  Assisting withindustrydatarequirements  Working in collaboration withourclient's technical teams and senior stakeholders.  About You  Knowledge ofbothSQL and Microsoft Excel Knowledge in data management software and business intelligence Driven and enthusiastic and want to launch a dynamic career based aroundData  passionate about problem solving and a naturally creative thinker  Ability to work collaboratively with excellent communication skills  Analytical mindset  Passion and drive to succeed in a commercial business environment  Educated to degree level (IT related)  Ideally some knowledge of theEnergyandmeteringindustries. Title: Data Analyst
Requirements: Posted by Bridget McDiarmid P & C Manager at HealthShare | I am passionate about creating amazing people centric teams and strong company cultures within tech startups. Send InMail HealthShare is a fast-growing Australian health tech company.  Our mission is to connect and engage all health stakeholders to deliver optimal patient health outcomes. Our digital solutions help millions of health professionals and patients each year around Australia.  Founded in 2010  we have been recognised by Westpac (Top 20 Businesses of Tomorrow Award  2017) and Deloitte (Fast 50 and Fast 500  2014-2018) for our innovation and business growth.  We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our Data and Analytics team to help us continue our growth through supporting the company with valuable data & insights.  The Role: The Data Analyst is responsible for creating and automating processes to extract  load and transform data for the Better Consult Product & affiliated business units. The role spans across the creation/documentation of data requirements as well as the timely delivery of work against these requirements to ensure client expectations and project timelines are met. Working closely with both internal (data  product  engineering and sales) and external teams  you'll act as the go-to for everything data related for their assigned projects.  Key Responsibilities Working closely with various stakeholders  both internal and external  to ensure smooth implementation and maintenance of product and service delivery related to data and reporting Developing and maintaining ELT processes to deliver against project data requirements Performing/automating analysis on the health of various ETL processes and (where necessary) creating reports to communicate this information to clients Ensuring high data privacy standards are maintained and best practices followed across the business operations Creating and maintaining documentation to ensure requirements and processes are clearly defined Providing input to inform estimates and project timelines  Experience: 2-3 years professional experience in a similar role Proficiency with SQL & analysing and manipulating data using a programming language (e.g. python  SAS  R)  git & cloud data warehouses (AWS  Azure  GCP etc) Experience developing and/or maintaining ETL/ELT processes  Skills: Clear ability to effectively communicate technical/complex concepts to non-technical audiences High level of attention to detail and accuracy of work The ability to work autonomously with a focus on project requirements & delivery Passion for and comfort with a range of data and programming technologies  Our Benefits and Perks: Regular social events & competitions Birthday Holiday Paid parental & partner leave Access to our Employee Assistance Program for your mental health and wellbeing Rewards for referring like-minded  talented individuals Discounts on gym membership  Apple  JB HiFi  and many more Working with a fun bunch of individuals in a culturally diverse and inclusive company  Learn about us: https://www.healthsharedigital.com https://au.betterconsult.com https://www.linkedin.com/company/healthshare  Applications: To apply  please send a cover letter and CV to careers@healthshare.com or apply via the link. You must have the right to work full-time in Australia.  We are committed and passionate about creating an inclusive culture that fosters diversity in an environment where all people are respected  appreciated and able to contribute their ideas. We encourage applications from diverse backgrounds including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and are always on the lookout for talented  passionate and supportive individuals who align with our values.

Title: Business Data Analyst
Requirements: Mercer is seeking candidates for the following position based in either the Wollongong  Sydney or Melbourne office:  Business Data Analyst  What can you expect?  We have a great opportunity available for a proactive and technically strong Business Data Analyst to join our Data Insights and Serving team within Global Metrics team. Our team support the Pacific O&T region by having a deeper understanding of the data platforms  building an interactive dashboard and reports for both internal and external stakeholders within the Superannuation industry.  Utilising your excellent technical skills  and ability to produce high quality written documentation  you will be responsible for the ongoing development and maintenance of these platforms including business analytics  documenting data requirements and implementation.  In return  you will enjoy a flexible work environment within a hybrid-working model between the home and office  and exposure to working as part of a truly global metrics team.  What is in it for you?  At Mercer  we recognize that our most important asset is our people. We offer benefits and programs that support career development such as professional development support  exam and study assistance and global rotation opportunities  which will support and nurture you with every opportunity to reach your full potential. We also recognise the value of healthy  happy colleagues and promote a culture of care and wellbeing  offering benefits such as flexible working and much more!   Leading training and development program Professional environment where your career path really matters and is supported in our global organization Great team environment with energetic and supportive colleagues Genuine work life balance.  We will count on you to:   Engage with stakeholders to identify and gather business requirements Analyze and interpret business needs and processes for both a business and technical audience Implement business and client led initiatives into business insights tools Communicate technical findings  models  and insights to different technical and non-technical audiences within the firm Understand  explore and document data controls  data sourcing and explore critical gaps analysis including understanding/defining data flows and sources Design and build robust analytical models and solutions to deliver actionable insight for business users.  What you need to have:   3+ years’ experience working with the analysis of data from complex data sets and systems Experience with advanced analytics  business modelling  and optimisation  simulation modelling and statistical techniques Hands on experience with a number of data manipulation tools and languages (e.g. SQL  Python  R) Experience gathering documenting  analysing data requirements and producing technical specification Strong SQL skills Front end Business Insights (Qlik  Tableau  SSRS ) delivery skills a must  What makes you stand out?   IT  Analytics  Computer Science or Mathematics qualification preferred but not essential Superannuation or Financial Services industry experience would be well regarded.  Mercer believes in building brighter futures by redefining the world of work  reshaping retirement and investment outcomes  and unlocking real health and well-being. If this role excites you please send your resume to: jobs@geosnapshot.com  =====================================================  Growth Data Analyst  Reports to: CEO / Senior Management Team Direct reports: N/A Working with: Sales  Product and Senior Management Team  Purpose of Role GEOSNAPSHOT (GSS) provides a unique photography platform that enables anyone to upload and sell photos. GSS is a growing global community of over 7 000 photographers from 76 counties who have uploaded over 13 million photos. Organisers of events  referred to as "Event Organisers " who host events ranging from large world-class sporting events and over 1 300 Schools who use GSS at school events.  GeoSnapShot works with a growing group of social photographers and partner companies in order to scale the user base. GeoSnapShot began as a front room start-up 8 years ago. Having successfully established and refined the product  the company is actively scaling in the USA and now looking to roll out to more customers globally. The role of the Growth Data Analyst will be crucial to the ongoing success of the business. Reporting to the CEO  the initial purpose of the role is to lead the company's analysis of strategies to grow and scale the business globally.   Job Description GSS is looking for a Data Analyst for its Growth team. The business is a modern  highly flexible company  constantly adapting it’s service offering and always searching for people that are going to add value  who thrive working in a close-knit supportive team  and who enjoy seeing their work having an instant impact on the business.
